SESSION 199 第199节 珍的两个梦 信封15


OCTOBER 18, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年10月18日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(In the 198th session of last Wednesday, October 13, Seth stated that financial matters and our kitchen problem would be settled by Saturday, October 16. Jane did hear from the secretary of her publisher on Saturday; she does not regard the situation settled however since the publisher is out of town and could not reply personally.(在10月13日上星期三的第198节课里，赛斯有说过，关于财务和我们厨房的问题将会在10月16日星期六前得到解决。珍确实在星期六接到出版社秘书的来电，不过因为出版商出城了无法回应这个问题，珍认为事情还没有得到解决。
(The carpenter was to see our landlord last week, and let us know about our kitchen enlargement by last Saturday. We have received no word about their meeting, although it is possible a decision was made Saturday.(木工师傅上周见过了我们的房东，他会在上周六让我们知道关于我们厨房扩建的问题，我们虽然还没听到关于他们会面的任何讯息，不过有可能这事已经在周六时决定了。
(It will be recalled that in the 166th session, of June 30,1965, Seth told the witness, John Bradley, that “there is one other company in particular with which you could become involved to your advantage. It is situated in the Midwest, perhaps in Minneapolis... presently a small firm comparatively speaking, but it will expand drastically within a short time... you will become involved with this company I believe irregardless, either as a competitor or as a member of the organization.”(回想起1965年6月30日第166节课上，赛斯曾对其中一位参与的学员约翰·布莱德利提到：“有另一家公司可能会特别有利于你。它位于中西部，也许在明尼亚波利斯这个地方……它现在相对来讲还是个小公司，但它会在很短时间内迅速扩张……我相信你会与这家公司有关联，不管是成为这个机构或是它竞争者的一员。”
(John at present is a salesman for Searle Drug. He lives in Williamsport, PA, but has witnessed several sessions. At the date of the 166th session he knew of no drug or pharmaceutical firms in Minneapolis. Visiting us this noon while making his rounds, John told us he had checked up on Seth. He gave us the names and addresses of two drug houses that he learned about in Minneapolis. He had not heard of them, and they are both small companies.(约翰现在是塞尔制药公司的业务员。他住在宾夕法尼亚州威廉波特，并见证了几节课。在上第166节课那时，他并不知道在明尼亚波利斯这地方有任何这样的药店或制药公司。约翰今天中午顺道来拜访我们，他告诉我们他想跟赛斯核对一下。他给了我们他查出来的，位于明尼亚波利斯两家药店的名字和地址。他之前从来没有听过它们的名字，而且这两家目前都是小公司。
(They are the Fuller Pharmaceutical Co., 3108 W. Lake Street, and the Ulmer Pharmacal Co., 1400 Harmon Place, both in Minneapolis. Needless to say, John plans to watch these companies with much interest.(它们是富尔制药厂，湖畔路西3108号[Fuller Pharmaceutical Co., 3108 W. Lake Street]，和艾默药厂，哈门区1400号[Ulmer Pharmacal Co., 1400 Harmon Place]，都位于明尼亚波利斯。不用说，约翰正打算好好关注这两家公司的发展。)
(For the envelope test object I used the appointment card for Janes visit to the dentist last May 5,1963. This is the appointment that Jane kept while in a trance state, and thus had her teeth cleaned without discomfort. For an account of this episode see the 152nd session. See also my tracing on page 1. The card is on white stock, printed in black ink, with the handwriting in black pencil. I enclosed the card between two pieces of Bristol, then inserted the whole into the usual double envelopes.(信封测试里的物件，我用的是珍在1965年5月5日那天去看牙时的预约单，珍在那次看牙的时候进入出离状态，以避免洗牙的时候会感到不舒服。关于这次事件的来龙去脉，请参考第150节，也可以参考上面的描绘图。单子上是白底黑字，上面有黑色铅笔的笔迹。我把单子夹在两张纸板中间，然后把它们放进普通的双层信封袋里。
(This evenings session will see the first of three scheduled attempts for Seth to clairvoyantly tune in on our friends, Bill and Peggy Gallagher, who arrived in Puerto Rico on vacation yesterday, Sunday. We hope that at 9:30 this evening, on Wednesday October 20, and Monday October 25, Seth will be able to pick up something of the activities and/or surroundings of Bill and Peg. They plan to make their own notes at these same times for later comparison.(今晚的课，赛斯打算用千里眼接收我们的朋友比尔和蓓·加拉格的讯息，是三次尝试计划中的第一次，他们在昨天星期天的时候到波多黎各度假。我们希望在今晚9点半、10月20日星期三，和10月25日星期一这三天，赛斯能接收到关于比尔和蓓周遭的环境或他们正在从事的活动。他们也打算同时做笔记以便事后对照比较。
(Jane said at 8 PM this evening that she did not mind if we had an envelope test. I remarked that it was going to be a busy session, what with the material on the Gallaghers and Dr. Instream, a possible envelope test, and the chance that Seth might discuss two very long, vivid, and complicated dreams Jane had while taking a short nap last Friday morning. See Jane's account in Volume 4, on pages 336. 38. She believes that at least one of these dreams is a therapeutic dream, resulting from suggestions she gave herself following Seth's material on therapeutic dreams in the last session.(珍在今晚上8点时表示，她不介意我们是否会有信封测试。我谈到这将会是忙碌的一节课，有加拉格夫妇和殷斯翠姆博士的资料，有可能做信封测试，有机会的话，赛斯也可能谈谈珍在上星期五早上小睡时做的两个非常长、逼真而且难懂的梦，详情请看珍在第四册第198节的描述。她相信其中至少有一个梦是疗愈梦，因为她在上节赛斯谈到疗愈梦之后给自己下了暗示。
(A development that may be of interest is that I had a strong sneezing spell just before this evenings session. It came upon me abruptly at about 8:45, while Jane was reading to me her account of the two dreams in question. For some reason the sneezing made me quite angry and impatient, briefly, and I asked Jane to hold up in her reading. For reasons I was not aware of, I nevertheless felt the sneezing was related to the dreams.(有一个蛮有趣的情况是，今晚上课前我忽然猛打喷嚏。这是在8:45分的时候突然发生的，当时珍正描述这两个梦给我听。不知道为什么，这阵喷嚏让我觉得很生气而且不耐烦，短暂的，我还要求珍暂停她的描述。然而当时我并不知道原因，我不觉得这阵喷嚏和这些梦有关。
(The session was held in our back room. Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her pace was a little slow in the beginning but soon picked up speed. Her voice was average.)(这节课在我们后面的房间举行。珍坐下，闭起眼睛开始说话。她开始的速度有点慢但不久就恢复正常。她的声音适中。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth. ")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
My fine sniffler. I do not know which matter to discuss first. Our Ruburt’s dreams, or your recent reaction to them, Joseph .我的最佳发言人。我不知道该先从哪件事开始讨论起。是鲁柏的梦，还是约瑟，你最近对这些梦的反应。
The second dream is an excellent example of a therapeutic dream that results from self-suggestion. Ruburt requested a therapeutic dream from his inner self, and he received one.第二个梦源自于自我暗示，它是疗愈梦的绝佳例子。鲁柏向他的内我要求了一个疗愈梦而他收到了。
I am happy to see that Ruburt tried out the material that I gave on the matter, and that he put it to the test. We will go rather deeply into this dream. However first we shall speak about the first dream, for they are indeed connected.我很高兴看到鲁柏试着把我给他的资料拿来做实验，我们会更深入的谈谈这个梦。不过首先我们应该先谈谈第一个梦，因为它们确实是互相关联的。
Indeed, Ruburt is correct in one respect at least, for the first dream, concerning the voices, was meant to be a therapeutic dream. However his own doubts changed the action within the dream, and he reacted to his doubts and ignored the earlier portion of the dream entirely.关于第一个，鲁柏至少有一点是正确的，这些声音的本意原该是一个疗愈梦。但是他自己的怀疑改变了这个梦的作用，他对他的怀疑起了反应而完全忽视了这个梦更早的一部分。
The basic action of the first dream involved his reception, his clear perception, of several voices within his head. The voices, though he does not consciously recall their message, the voices spoke words of encouragement. They presented excellent evidence of his own abilities, for they were crystal clear and distinct, and without distortions.对第一个梦的基本反应和他的领受度有关，他对脑海里几种声音的清晰感知度。这些声音传达着鼓励的话，虽然他已经无法有意识的想起内容来了。它们对他自己的能力提供了极佳的证明，因为它们是清楚明白且无扭曲的。
There were four voices, all male. Three of these were the voices of personalities who no longer exist within the physical system, but which were closely allied with Ruburt in past lives. The fourth voice was my own. This was an attempt to build his confidence, and to show him how clearly reception can be if his abilities are fully utilized.总共有4个声音，都是男性。有三个声音属于已经不存在于这个物质系统的人格，但是他们都曾在过去世和鲁柏有着紧密的连结。第四个声音是我自己。我们意图提振鲁柏的自信心，而且显示给他看如果他的能力能够充分使用的话，他的领受力会是如何的清晰。
(Jane has had other experiences, both in dreams and in psychological time, in which she heard Seth’s voice but did not recognize it. For an account of an instance occurring during psy-time, involving John Bradley, see the unscheduled 190th session. As it happened John witnessed this session also.)(珍也有其他的经验，是发生在梦中和在心理时间的时候，那时她听到赛斯的声音，但认不出来。关于发生在心理时间的一个例子，请参照临时课第190节的描述，这和约翰·布莱德利有关，当时约翰也参与了整个过程。)
Here however there is a drastic change, for the above portions of the experience were indeed no dream, but real experience, occurring while he was in a dissociated state.不过，这里有一个很大的不同，上面描述的经验实际上并不是一个梦，而是一个发生在他出离状态的一个真实经验。
The experience however shocked him, hence the shock later on when he turns this into a dream. The experience was to have been remembered however as a dream. He was not to have recalled its true nature, and it was hoped that he would elaborate the experience into a dream which would be composed of the constructive elements which the experience had given him.他被这个经验吓到了，惊吓后来把这个经验转成梦，以至于这个经验是以梦的方式被想起来的。他不用想起这个经验真正的本质，但希望他能以这个经验带给他建设性的元素来阐述这个经验。
Instead the experience frightened him, although only momentarily, for upon immediately awakening his mood was one of joy, and the earlier fear was forgotten. When he heard the voices, rather than becoming confident, he began to rise up to more shallow layers, and the ego ruled the dream sequence that followed.这个经验虽然吓到了他，但曾有一度短暂，立即唤起他一种愉悦的心情，而刚开始时的害怕被遗忘了。当他听到这些声音的时候，并没有变得比较有自信，反而升到比较浅层的睡眠导致自我开始接管梦的后续发展。
He would not accept the responsibility that he felt such ability would put upon him, and so he looked for an outside source of the voices, and dreamed the sequence in which the voices came from a radio, and not his head. In the dream he switches the radio off, hoping to still the voices. They continue because he knows that he is picking them up from a channel that is not physical.他不想接受这个责任，因为他感觉这样的能力是被扔在他身上的，所以他向外寻找声音的来源，而梦的后续发展是这些声音源自于一台收音机，而不是他的脑海。在梦里他想关掉收音机，希望能停止这些声音。但是声音仍然持续着，因为他知道，他并不是从物质界的频道接收到这些声音的。
But he tries again, and in the dream he discovers another radio on your bookcase, Joseph , where our material is kept. The connection is obvious, for he knows that the Seth material comes from the same system as the voices. Here he reaches out to turn the radio off, and is stopped by a severe and sudden shock. The shock is his knowledge that our material would cease were he to shut off his abilities in such a manner. So the shock, which is one of realization, prevents him.但是他还是再试了一次，在梦里，约瑟，他发现在你摆放我们资料的书架上有另一台收音机。这个关联是明显的，因为他知道这些声音和赛斯资料是来自于同一个系统。当他伸出手想把收音机关掉的时候，一阵突如其来的剧烈震惊让他停住了。他突然明白，如果他以同样的方式关掉他的能力，那我们的资料也会中止。所以这个震惊，也是这个领悟避免了他做这件事。
The connection with yourself is also obvious, since this happens in your room in the dream, for were he to shut off his abilities, you see, as one can turn off a radio, then you would be deprived as well as himself.这其中和你的关联也是明显的，因为在梦中，这发生在你的房间，你了解吗，如果他像关掉收音机一样的关掉了你的能力，那你和他都会听不见。
(Here, Jane reached out in front of her as though turning off an invisible radio. Her eyes were closed. Her pace however was now quite fast, her voice stronger, and she was quite restless. She changed her position, to lean forward with her elbows on her knees, her head down.)(这里，珍向前伸出手，仿佛要关掉一台看不见的收音机。她的眼睛是闭着的。她说话的速度较快，声音更大，有点坐立不安。她改变了坐姿，向前倾，把手肘放在膝盖上，她的头低着。)
In the dream he then goes into his own room, and this is the part of the dream that he has consciously forgotten, and covers it in his notes merely by saying “unclear here,” and a vague reference to an electric storm.在梦中他走进了自己的房间，这部分的梦他有意识的忘了，因此他只在笔记上写着“这里不清楚”，好像和电磁性的风暴有模糊的关联。
In the dream itself, he goes into his room and discovers that his ability is as much a part of him as his breath, and that he cannot turn it off and on at will, or turn it off as one would a radio. He stands in the room, and there is an electric storm in the dream, and the room is touched by vibrating currents. He is afraid. Nevertheless he realizes that he is part of the storm, and the storm is part of himself, and it is not destructive but creative; and most of all, a simple elemental part of reality as it is.在梦中，他走进自己的房间，发现他的能力和他的呼吸一样同为他的一部分，他不能随意地像开关收音机一样地把它关掉。他站在房间，有梦里有一个电磁性的风暴，房间里充满了跳动的电磁波。他很害怕。不过他了解他是这个风暴的一部分，这个风暴也是他自己的一部分，这不是破坏性而是创造性的；最重要的，这是一个实相简单基本的部分。
This realization made the following dream, the second dream, possible. But the following dream would not have been possible without the first. The second dream is a dream of expansion. We will discuss it from two levels. The most meaningful level was one in which the many rooms represented psychic areas of development, endless possibilities that continually opened; but possibilities which were based on previous life experiences, and there are many aspects of reincarnational data in this dream, all reinforcing the healthy aspects of Ruburt's personality.这样的了解让后续的梦。也就是第二个梦变得可能。如果没有第一个梦，接下来的梦也不可能发生。第二个梦是一个扩展的梦。我们将会从两个层面来讨论它。最有意义的层面是，很多的房间代表了很多心理领域的发展，无限的可能性持续的打开；但可能性奠基于之前的人生经验，在这个梦里有很多转世方面的资料，所有这些都强化了鲁柏人格上关于健康的一面。
I suggest a short break. And I will by all means mention your own reaction, which was based on a wrong assumption.我建议一个短暂的休息。然后我会谈到你的反应，那是建立在一个错误的假设上。
(Break at 9:30. Jane had been dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed. Her voice had strengthened a bit during the delivery, and her pace had become so fast that my hand was already cramped. Jane said she felt that no more than ten minutes had passed.(9:30分休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着。她的声音在口述时大声了一点，她的速度变得如此快以至于我的手抽筋了。珍说她感觉过了不到10分钟。
(We were now due for the material on the Gallaghers in Puerto Rico. During break I jokingly began to speak aloud my own impressions of what Peg and Bill were doing at the moment. I rattled off a string of impressions about them sitting in a long narrow restaurant, and described their surroundings in some detail, including such things as wall lamps, etc. The odd part about this is that I seemed to see pictures of what I was describing, while my eyes were open.(我们现在期待着关于波多黎各的加拉格夫妇资料。在休息的时候，我开玩笑的大声说起我自己对蓓和比尔现在正在做什么的印象。我不停地说了一串有关他们坐在一间很长而且狭窄的餐厅里，并且详细描述了他们周遭的环境，包括一些东西像壁灯等等。奇怪的是，当我描述的时候好像真的看到了这些影像，当时我的眼睛是张开的。
(Jane laughed with me at first, then asked me to stop, saying that my data might confuse her. At the same time I felt touches of my familiar thrilling sensation that I have often felt during psy-time, or when I see a vision; this gave me the feeling that I might be half right about what I had said; Seth however said nothing about it. Perhaps he will mention it next session.(珍刚开始跟着我笑，后来出声制止我，她说我的资料有可能会混淆她。在同时我突然有一股熟悉的兴奋感，这种感觉常会在心理时间或当我有视觉影像时发生；这给我一种感觉，我说的可能有一半是对的；不过赛斯没有说任何东西，也许下一节他就会提到。
(Jane's pace now slowed a great deal. As when giving the material for Dr. Instream, she sat with her eyes closed and her head down, usually with her hands to her eyes. Her voice was quiet. She used many pauses, a few of which are indicated. I will also indicate where I used a phonetic version of Jane's utterances, on two occasions. Resume at 9:40.)(珍的速度慢了下来。当说到殷斯翠姆博士资料的时候，她坐着，眼睛闭上，头低着，她的手通常会放在眼睛上。她的音量很轻，停顿了好几次，有几次我有注明。我也会标注在哪里我用拼音的方式来表达珍所说的，有两个这样的地方。9:40分继续口述。)
If you will give us a moment, we will see what we can do with your Jesuit and the cat lover this evening. (Pause.)如果你等我们一下，我看看我们今晚能得到关于耶稣会信徒和爱猫人士的什么讯息。(停顿)
These are impressions. A large white, or pale pastel building, they had something to do with today. Flowers here. Iron grillwork. Hacienda... Lucinda (phonetically; I asked Jane to repeat the word). They passed here. Bars at the windows of iron, not in jail.印象是这样。一栋白色或浅色的大型建筑物，这和他们今天要做的事情有关。有花在这儿。铁制的花格图样。哈希达……路希达(拼音，我请珍重复这个字)。他们经过这里。窗户上有铁栏杆，但不是监狱。
Newspapers sold in front, outside. Later at another end of this same city, they pass shacks. (Pause.) This at the northwest portion. A street. Saint Severin (phonetically.) A rather high pile of dark dirt. (Long pause at 9:45.)外面前面有卖报纸。等会在同一个城市的另一端，他们穿过棚屋。(稍停)在西北部。一条街。圣塞弗林(Saint Severin根据发音)一堆很高的、深色的土。(9:45分较长的停顿)
They stay at a pink stucco building, with porch enclosures that are round. (Jane paused and gestured with her hands.) The base is not round. The portion between the... (gesture; groping for words) what would be the porch railing and the roof is round.他们停留在一栋粉红色粉刷的建筑里，前面围绕的门廊是圆形的。(珍停了一下用手比划)基座不是圆的。在中间的部分……(比着手势，搜寻着字眼)在阳台栏杆和屋顶部分是圆的。
They bicycled. Perhaps in their room there is a rather elaborate lamp on a table that depicts a scene, that glows when it is lit.他们之前骑过车。在他们房间的桌子上也许有一盏相当精巧的桌灯，桌灯上有画，当点亮的时候就会显现出来。
Give us a moment again, and we will try to pick them up now. (Pause at 9:50. Jane, her eyes still closed, wagged a finger at me.) Ruburt was correct, Joseph. You should not have given your impressions.等一下，我们现在正试着收集讯息。(9:50分停顿。珍仍然闭着眼睛，对我摇了摇手指。)鲁柏是对的,约瑟。你不该说出你的印象。
Outdoors, on a verandah, nearby suitcases open. A low-scooped blouse, and pale skirt. I believe the owner of the place where they stay is 50 or thereabouts. Name beginning with an M, and ending with an A, and a connection with a dog. They think of an island that sounds like Sumatra, but is not.在外面，靠近阳台处皮箱开着，一件低领上衣和浅色的裙子。我相信他们待的地方屋主年龄大约50岁左右。名字开头的字母是M，结束的字母是A，而且与一只狗有关联。他们想到一座岛，听起来像苏门答腊，但并不是。
It is two words. (Pause.) More like San Mutro (phonetically), though I do not believe that is exact. An avenue beginning with a B, or San B, period, where they ate lunch. San Beninno (phonetically), or similar. (Long pause at 9:56.)有两个字。(停顿)更像萨恩•穆特罗(San Mutro)(发音)，虽然我不认为这很准确。一条街以B开头，或者萨恩•B(San B)，句号。他们在那里吃午饭。萨恩•贝尼诺(San Beninno)(发音)，或相似的音。(9:56长时间停顿)
A striped awning, a dinner at 375. I believe this is the cost. A blue blanket on the bed where they sleep? A purchase of an item that is like a small sculpture. (Pause.) I get a bear shape. Some rain.一个条纹遮阳篷，一顿375的晚餐。我相信这是指价格。他们睡的床上有一条蓝色的毯子?他们买了一个像小雕塑的东西。(停顿)我猜是一只熊的形状。下了一些雨。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:00. Jane was well dissociated, she said—much more so than usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet. Again, she had the impression that time had passed quickly.(10:00休息。珍在很好的出离状态，她说——比平常更好。她的眼睛仍闭着，声音停了下来。再次的，她感觉时间过得很快。
(While giving the above data Jane had no visual material to accompany it, and said she was just as glad. She took this lack of imagery to mean that her own feelings and ideas were bypassed; she felt free of concern about the accuracy of the material, and thought it might be better for this.(在给上述的资料时，珍并没有伴随着视觉资料，她说她很高兴这样。她认为缺少这些视觉资料，代表她自己的感觉和想法不涉其中；她不特别在意这些资料正确与否，也认为这样应该比较好。
(When she began speaking again, Jane's pace was slow, her voice quiet. As before, she sat with her eyes closed, her head down and her hands to her eyes. Resume at 10:09.)(当她再次说话时，速度慢，音量轻。一如往常，她坐着闭上她的眼，头低着，手放在眼睛上。10:09分重新开始。)
Now, from Puerto Rico to Oswego (site of a NY State University).现在，从波多黎各到奥斯威戈(一纽约州立大学所在地)。
Again, give us a moment. And please be very quiet.再次，等我们一下，请非常安静。
(I had made a noise turning a page in the notebook. Jane took a long pause at 10:10. Because it was a warm night we had a window open. Abruptly I became conscious of traffic noise, and Jane told me later that she did too. This is the 9th Dr. Instream experiment. Each week we send Dr. Instream Seth's material for him.)(我翻动笔记本时发出一点声音，珍在10:10分时停了比较久。因为这是一个温暖的夜晚，所以我们把窗户打开。我突然意识到外面的交通噪音，珍后来告诉我她也注意到了。这是第9次殷斯翠姆博士实验。每周我们会寄给殷斯翠姆博士赛斯资料。)
A fountain pen, and a desk. A pale yellow handkerchief in a triangle in Dr. Instreams pocket, breast pocket.一支钢笔和一张桌子。一条淡黄色手帕折成三角形在殷斯翠姆博士的口袋，胸前的口袋。
If possible he should emotionally think of us. He is thinking of us on an intellectual level now. Concentrating, but trying too hard intellectually. (Pause at 10:12.)如果可能的话，他应该情感性地想到我们。他现在是从理性的层面想到我们。是够专注，但太用理性了。(10:12停顿)
If he were to call me an old faker, I should get him more quickly. I get the number 4, but do not know to what this refers.如果他要叫我老骗子，那我应该更快地逮到他。我收到数字4，但不知道这指的是什么。
Ruburt gets the child who is squalling below in the lower apartment, and it is no help. But we shall try harder in our own way.鲁柏听到楼下公寓的孩子在哭闹，这对我们真是没有帮助。但我们还是应该用我们的方式更努力一点。
(I too had just become conscious of the baby below us. Actually the child cried but briefly. Jane had paused at 10:15.)(我也刚刚注意到楼下的婴儿。事实上这孩子虽然哭，却是短暂的。珍在10:15分停顿。)
I see flowers on the dining room table at his apartment. They have been to a movie.我看到他公寓的餐桌上有花。他们看完了一部电影。
His hypnosis experiments are not doing as well as he hoped, as far as other parties are concerned. They have to do with direct stimuli, applied through hypnosis at a distance; and there is a connection in his mind with myself here, and those experiments.他的催眠实验进行得不如他所预期，因为有其他方牵涉其中。通过远距离催眠的运用，他们必须面对直接的刺激物，他在心理上和我有连结，还有这些实验也是。
Something I believe also to do with conditioned reflexes, set up through the hypnotic situation, with himself as hypnotist, and in connection with two other particular individuals.我相信通过催眠地点的设立，这也跟某些制约的反射有关，他自己是催眠师，和两个特定的人有关联。
He will have success with part of the experiment, having to do with an S. What he plans is entirely feasible however, and quite possible. There is a personality quirk, so to speak, that may snag him here, and the word snag has more than one meaning.他的实验有部分将会成功，和一位S人士有关。他的计划是完全可行且可能的。这么说好了，有个个人的怪癖可能会阻碍他，而这个字阻扰不只一个意涵。
(Jane took a pause that lasted for one minute, at 10:22.)(珍在10:22停顿了大约一分钟。)
I believe the object has to do with a locket that belongs to his wife, or that belonged to a female child.我相信这个物件与属于他太太或属于一个小女孩的一个小盒子有关。
He wants a cigarette as this moment (pause at 10:25), though this is far from unusual.他现在想抽一支烟(10:25停顿)，虽然这也没有什么不寻常。
I thank him for his interest and his time.我谢谢他的时间以及他对我们的兴趣。
Do you have a test for me this evening?你今晚有测试给我吗？
("Yes.”(“有。”
(I handed over the usual double envelope, and Jane took it without opening her eyes. I had decided to forget the envelope test unless Seth asked for it, for it would make three tests in a row.(我交给珍一个普通双层信封，她闭起眼睛接过它。我决定除非赛斯要求，否则我不会提供这个信封测试，三个测验照顺序来。
(Jane held the envelope lightly in both hands and paused briefly. This is the 15th envelope test.)(珍轻轻地用双手握住信封，短暂的停了一下。这是第15次信封测试。)
Now again, give us a moment and we shall see what we can do. These are impressions.现在请再给我们一点时间，看看我们能做些什么。有这些印象。
A turnabout. Part of a missive. The color yellow. Something swings, or something swinging. The number 5, as in the afternoon.一个转变。文件的一部分。黄色。有东西转动，或转动的东西。数字5，在下午。
Two people, as in a negative. Ruburt thinks of his aunt and uncle in New York. This is an associative connection on Ruburt’s part. (Pause.)底片中两个人。鲁柏认为是他在纽约的叔叔婶婶。和鲁柏的联想有关。(停顿)
A connection however with a man and woman, not yourselves. Older than yourselves. (Pause.) A connection with an afternoon scene, perhaps your parents, Joseph, and an automobile.和一个男人、女人有关联，不是你们。比你们老。(停顿)与一个下午的情景有关联，约瑟，也许是你的父母，还有一部汽车。
A connection with your parents’ back yard. (Pause.)跟你父母的后院有关联。(停顿)
A distant connection with a trip by train, and the service. Flowers, and death of a dog. (Pause.)较远的关联是一趟火车之旅和仪式。花，和一只狗的死。(停顿)
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:33. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet. She told me she had no idea that there would be an envelope test.(10:33分休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，声音轻柔。她告诉我她并不知道会有信封测试。
(See the tracing of the dental appointment card on page 1, and my notes about the card on page 2. The card refers to the appointment that Jane kept while in a trance state, to have her teeth cleaned. The test data appeared to contain some far-ranging impressions, but we seemed to be able to connect of them up without trouble.(看上面有关牙医预约单的描绘图，以及上面有关这张单子的我的注记。这张是牙医预约单，在那次预约里，鲁柏在出离状态时洗牙。这个测验资料似乎包含了一些笼统的印象，但我们毫不费力的就把它们连结起来。
(Jane particularly remembered the appointment because it is the first she ever made voluntarily. This she calls “a turnabout” from previous habit. The card can be “Part of a missive.” We both saw “something swinging" as the dental drill suspended over the chair. We thought “The number 5" good, since the appointment was for May 5.(珍特别记得那次预约，是因为有别于之前的习惯，那是她第一次主动预约的，她称这为“转变”。这张单子也可说是“部分的文件”。我们看到“转动的东西”是挂在椅子上的牙医钻头。我们认为“数字5”很对，因为预约那天是5月5日。
(Jane was sure “The color yellow" referred to the fact that she well remembers wearing a new, bright yellow shift while keeping the appointment.(珍很确定“黄色”指的是，那天她穿着一件新的、亮黄色的连衣裙去看诊。
(We regarded, offhand, the data on my parents as probably distortive or associative, as the material on Janes aunt and uncle. We thought it possible that “a man and woman, not yourselves. Older than yourselves", referred to the parents of Marie Colucci, the dentists wife. The Coluccis are personal friends of ours. On a visit to their home this summer we met Marie’s mother, in Elmira on a visit from New Jersey. Marie had made the trip to New Jersey, to get her mother, by train.(我们很快地认定关于我父母的资料，可能和珍的叔叔婶婶一样是曲解或联想，我们认为“一个男人一个女人，不是你们，比你们老”，指的是牙医的太太玛莉•克劳西[Marie Colucci]的父母，克劳西夫妇是我们的朋友。在今年夏天拜访他们的时候，我们遇到了玛莉的母亲，她从新泽西到埃尔迈拉来。玛莉搭火车到新泽西去接她妈妈。
(We thought this connection with “a trip by train" might be the distant connection referred to by Seth, when we remembered that while Marie Coluccis mother had been visiting in Elmira, the mother's husband died of a heart attack at home in New Jersey, while bowling. This would be the connection with “service” and “Flowers, ” meaning funeral.(我们认为赛斯指的“火车之旅”应该是比较远的关联，我们记得玛莉•克劳西的妈妈曾到过埃尔迈拉，她妈妈的先生在新泽西家中打保龄球时心脏病去世了。这可能与“仪式”和“花”有关，指的是葬礼。
(Jane was sure “death of a dog” referred to the last dental appointment she had had previous to May 5,1965. This would be 3 years ago; Jane said she recalled this vividly because our dog, Mischa, died within two days or so of that long-ago appointment. The appointment itself had also been a painful one.(珍很确定“一只狗的死”指的是，她在1965年5月5日那次看牙医时的事，那是3年前了；珍说她记得很清楚，因为我们的狗米夏在那次看牙医前两天过世了，那次看牙的过程也很痛苦。
(Neither of us understood the reference to an automobile, particularly. During break I mentioned that I hoped Seth would take a few minutes to verify our interpretations of his data, or to correct us, before he closed the session.(我们俩都不知道“汽车”指的是什么。在休息的时候，我提到希望赛斯在这节课结束前，能花一些时间确认或更正一下我们对这些资料的解读。
(Jane had been relaxing on the bed during break, and resumed speaking from there. She lay on her side, her head propped up by one hand. Her glasses were on; because of this I thought her eyes might open eventually. Her pace was good, her voice quiet as she resumed at 10:45.)(珍在休息时放松地躺在床上，然后重新开始说话。她侧身躺着，手撑着头，戴着眼镜；因为这样，我猜她的眼睛可能是张开的。她的速度平稳，声音轻柔，在10:45分重新开始。)
We will now end our session. I hope to finish the material concerning Ruburt’s dream, however. I would give it now, but I imagine that you are weary.现在，我们要结束这一节了。我希望把关于鲁柏那些梦的资料讲完。我会现在讲，我想你们也累了。
(“Yes.”)'(“好。”)
Our own test material was only slightly distorted, and quite legitimate.我们的测验资料只有一点扭曲，其余是相当合格的。
The appointment was made in the afternoon. The service was a funeral service, hence the connection with flowers, which also reinforced the fifth month.这个预约是下午订定的。仪式是指丧葬仪式，与花和5月都有关联。
The appointment was made at five in the afternoon, incidentally.这次预约很巧的也是订在下午5点。
The older people represented the dentist’s in-laws, and the distortion occurred here, for Ruburt picked up correctly the idea of parents, but thought they were your own.老夫妇指的是牙医的岳父母。扭曲发生在这里，鲁柏相当正确的接收到父母这个想法，但他以为是你的父母。
The automobile was the mother's automobile, which was parked outside of the Colucci residence the evening you visited. They drove back.汽车是指母亲的汽车，你们拜访克劳西家那天晚上车就停在门口。他们已经开回去了。
(As soon as Seth said this, I remembered seeing the automobile parked before the Colucci’s house on the evening Jane and I visited there. Since their home is in the country, and not even close to any other house, the car couldn't be connected to anyone outside the Colucci family. And of course it was not the dentist’s car, which we are familiar with. This is the somewhat complicated sequence of events here: Marie Colucci took the train to her parents' home in New Jersey, and drove her mother back to Elmira in the parental automobile. When Marie's father died of a heart attack in NJ, Marie drove her mother back to Jersey in the parental car, then returned to Elmira herself by train.)(当赛斯说到这里，我就想起来，那晚我和珍拜访克劳西家时，有看到一台车停在门口。因为他们的家在很乡下，附近都没有别的房子，所以这台车一定是和克劳西家有关的人的。当然不会是牙医的车，他的车我们很熟悉。这里解释起来有点复杂；玛莉·克劳西坐火车去她父母位于新泽西的家，然后开她父母的车载她妈妈回到埃尔迈拉。当玛莉的父亲在新泽西死于心脏病的时候，玛莉用她父母的车载她妈妈回新泽西，然后再自己搭火车回埃尔迈拉。)
The death of a dog you interpreted correctly, but the death and flowers and service applied, also, all together, to the death of the parent.关于一只狗的死，你们解读得很正确，但是这里的死亡，花和仪式也同时适用于这位父亲的死。
There was a very slight connection with your own parents, however, in that Ruburt mentioned the dentist and the trance to them at their latest visit here. And a secondary connection with a car—not close, not a close connection—in which your parents traveled on that occasion.这里有一点和你父母有关联，上次你们的父母来看你们的时候，鲁柏曾向他们提过这位牙医和出离状态。第二个关联是车——有点远，这是一个有点远的关联——你父母偶尔也用车旅游。
You may take a break, or end the session as you prefer.你可以选择暂停或结束。
(“We’ll end it then. ’’)(“那我们就结束吧。” )
My heartiest regards, and my particular regards to Ruburt, who is following through in good humor.我最衷心的祝福，特别是对鲁柏，他以一种幽默感看待这件事。
Did you have a question?你还有问题吗？
(“It can wait. I was going to ask you to say something about my sneezing spell.”)(“我可以等，我本来想问你有关打喷嚏的事。”)
You had the particular reaction because you misinterpreted an element of Ruburt’s dream, of which you knew, but I believe you had forgotten it.你有这个特别的反应，是因为你错误的解读了鲁柏一部分的梦，你曾知道它，但我想你已经忘了。
(Jane still lay on the bed. Now she groped for her pack of cigarettes, and lit one. Her eyes opened very briefly, and barely enough for her to see, as she struck the match. Then she resumed talking and smoking with her eyes closed.)(珍仍躺在床上。她摸索着她那包烟，点燃一根。她的眼睛只在点火柴的时候短暂睁开一下，然后就闭着眼睛边抽烟边说话。)
It had to do with the fact that in his dream, the second radio was in your room, and he received a shock when he tried to turn it off.这跟梦中的一个情况有关，第二个收音机在你的房间，鲁柏试着要关掉的时候，他吓到了。
You interpreted this to mean that you had pushed him, perhaps, that perhaps were it not for you he would not have become as deeply involved as he is, in this endeavor.你的解读是，这表示你太逼迫他了，如果不是为了你，他不会这么努力、这么深的牵扯进这件事。
You have felt this way fairly often. You felt responsible for the shock of his dream. It is true the sessions would not have been possible without your encouragement and help, and without the reinforcement of your own abilities.你常常有这种感觉，你觉得要对他梦里的震惊负责。这是真的，如果不是你的鼓励和帮助，还有你自己能力的加强，这些课是不可能持续的。
You should be able to see that Ruburt has grown intellectually, emotionally, and psychically, as a result of the sessions, as have you. Not only has his inner self expanded, but his ego has become stronger, even while it has become more flexible. So there is no need for your concern in that regard.你应该看到因为这些课，鲁柏在智性、情感和心理层面都成长了，还有你也是。不只他的内我扩大，他的自我也变得更强，同时更有弹性。所以你在这方面是不需要担心的。
The sneezing was a panic reaction. Naturally you do not want to hurt Ruburt in any way, and you felt somewhat responsible because in his dream he could not turn off the radio which represented his abilities.打喷嚏是一种恐慌反应。很自然地你不想以任何方式伤害鲁柏，但是你多少觉得自己有责任，因为在梦中，鲁柏不能关上代表他能力的收音机。
(Jane's eyes opened briefly. They were very dark as she looked at me.)(珍的眼睛短暂张开。深邃地看着我。)
Now, I could continue along these lines for quite some time, and I am perfectly willing to do so, for your edification rather than my own. If you prefer that we do this while it is fresh in our minds, then take a break and we shall continue. And if not, do not ask me leading questions, and we shall end the session.现在，我会持续这个主题一段时间，我会这样做的原因是为了教导你们而不是为了我自己。如果你们想趁这个话题还新鲜时继续，那我们休息一下再开始。如果不是，就不要再问我重要的问题，我们这一节要结束了。
I am rather closely allied with you both this evening.我感觉今晚与你们特别亲近。
(“I guess we’d better close then.”)(“我想我们最好结束。”)
We will indeed let you have your well deserved rest, and I shall say good night, as a talkative old friend might.我们值得好好的休息，我应该像个多话的老友一样向你们说晚安了。
Its been very enjoyable.”(“这节很有趣。”
([Jane, after a pause:] “It's me again. At least I think I am.”([珍，停顿了一下]：“还是我。至少我感觉我是。”
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:03. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes were open at the end of the session, her voice quiet, and she was smiling. I might add that while Jane was reading her dreams to me just prior to the session, I was only half listening as I got ready to take the notes. But it seems that actually I listened very well.)(11:03分结束。珍像平常一样出离。她的眼睛在课的尾声一直睁着。她的声音轻柔而且在微笑。我要说明，当珍在课前对我叙述她的梦时，我因为要准备笔记只有半只着，但现在我是真的完全听明白了。)

SESSION 200 第200节 珍的梦续 我是那个伸手的人


OCTOBER 20, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年10月20日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(At supper time this evening I voiced my opinion of the tactics of Jane’s publisher, Frederick Fell, in no uncertain terms, with the rather obvious implication that Seth could comment upon the situation should he care to.(在今晚用餐的时候，我直接表达了我对珍的出版商佛德瑞克·费尔所用策略的看法，我明显的暗示赛斯，应该对这个他所关注的情况评论一下。
(I planned no envelope test for this session, thinking that the test material on the Gallaghers in Puerto Rico, and on Dr. Instream, would be enough for one session. I was more interested at the moment in having Seth finish his analysis of Jane’s two dreams, which he began last session, and made it a point to say so just before the session tonight.(这节课我不打算做信封测试，我想这一节课有波多黎各的加拉格夫妇和殷斯翠姆博士的测验就够了。我现在更感兴趣的是，赛斯能把鲁柏的这两个梦分析完，他从上节课开始讲，而且在今晚的课开始前，他也表示这个话题会继续。
(We have not heard from the Gallaghers, incidentally, and do not expect to. The four of us agreed not to exchange mail, leaving any communications up to Seth while Bill and Peggy are on vacation.(顺便一提，我们没有再听到关于加拉格夫妇的消息，也并不期待会听到。我们4个同意在比尔和蓓度假期间不要交换邮件，全交由赛斯来沟通。
(Last Monday noon, October 18, our friend John Bradley visited us while making his rounds as a traveling drug salesman. He was too busy to witness Mondays session, but promised to visit us on Tuesday evening, October 19. During the day on Tuesday, John had to attend an important business meeting of his regional office in Binghamton, NY, perhaps sixty miles from Elmira.(10月18日，星期一中午，我们的朋友约翰·布莱德利在拜访客户途中来看我们，他是一个药品推销员，因为他那天太忙了，所以不能参加星期一的课，但他答应会在10月19日星期二晚上再来拜访我们，在星期二那天，约翰要去纽约宾汉顿的地区办公室参加一个重要商业会议，那里距离埃尔迈拉大约60英里。
(Remembering her success in clairvoyantly tuning in on Bill Gallagher as he made his business errands on the evening of October 8, Jane decided to try the same thing with John on Tuesday. The difference here was that John had no forewarning of Jane's efforts, since she didn’t get the idea until after he left us Monday. See Session 196 in Volume 4 for the Gallagher material.(在10月8日晚上，珍成功的用千里眼收到了比尔·加拉格出差时的讯息，珍决定要在星期二也对约翰做同样的实验。不同的是这次约翰事前并不知情，因为珍是在星期一他离开的时候才有了这个主意。请参照第四册第196节关于加拉格的资料。
(At 8 PM Tuesday, Jane wrote down 13 impressions, all dealing with John Bradley's supposed activities. She was ironing at the time, and pleasant music was on the radio. She wrote the impressions in an offhand manner, she said, without straining; she had no idea at the time as to whether any of them were correct. John arrived from Binghamton perhaps three quarters of an hour later. Going over the list with us in the course of the evening, he confirmed 10 of Jane's impressions as correct. Some of them were quite striking.(在星期二晚上8点，珍写下13个可能和约翰·布莱德利的活动有关的印象。她当时正在烫衣服，收音机里传来愉快的音乐。她说当时是以一种轻松不费力的方式写下这些印象；她那时并不知道这些印象是否正确。约翰大约在45分钟后才从宾汉顿到这里，晚上他跟我们一起浏览这个清单，他确认了珍写的印象有10个是正确的。有些印象还是惊人的正确。
(Jane keeps separate records of such experiments, and has this one written up in the same manner as the Gallagher experiment that is included in the 196th session.(珍把这类实验分开记录，以像第196节记录加拉格实验同样的方式写下来。
(The session was held in our small back room. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her voice was quiet to begin, her pace quite slow.)(这一节课在我们后面的小房间里举行，珍坐下来闭起眼睛开始说话，她的声音在开始时轻柔，速度比较慢。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I will finish discussing the dreams.我会把这些梦讨论完。
First however I would like to speak briefly about Ruburts attempts at telepathy with Philip last evening. Such exercises are excellent training, and they will boost his confidence, particularly where distance is a factor, as it was last evening.首先我想先简短的说一下昨晚鲁柏试图感应菲利普的这件事。这样的练习是很棒的训练，有助于提高他的自信心，特别是昨晚那种情形，当距离是一个要素的时候。
(Philip is John Bradley’s entity name, according to Seth.)(根据赛斯的说法，菲利普是约翰·布莱德利存有的名字。)
This will help in the Dr. Instream material. The results of the Philip experiment were quite adequate, and some rather specific points were covered.这也对殷斯翠姆博士的资料有帮助。对菲利普的实验结果已经是相当合格的了，一些特定的重点都涵盖了。
Now, concerning Ruburt’s second dream. Let me say first of all that the many rooms and apartments to be explored all represented various facets of psychic realities, hence his anticipation in the dream. The shop within the apartment had to do with the physical dimension and various physical abilities which are based on past-life experiences.现在，关于鲁柏的第二个梦，首先，许多有待探索的房间和公寓，代表了不同面向的心灵实相，因此他在梦中是期待着的。在公寓里的商店与奠基在过去世经验的物质面向和不同的物质有关。
He thought the clothing was on sale, that it was cheap at the price, but it only seemed so because he did not know that he had already paid for it. Here he found an excellent jacket which he realized was his own from a previous season.他认为这件衣服在拍卖，以这个价钱来说它很便宜，但那只是因为他不知道他已经付过钱了；在这里他发现一件很棒的夹克，随即明白那是他自己上一季的衣服。
The jacket was green and warm. It represented what will seem like a new ability to him, when he will shortly discover it in himself.夹克是绿色的而且很暖。这代表了一种对他来说似乎像是新的能力，但很快他就会发现那能力本来就在他之内。
He will however then realize, or he should realize, that this ability was his in a past life, but unused, and is now awaiting him. It will bring both warmth and confidence, and will give him protection.不过他后来会明白，或他应该要明白，这个能力在过去世是属于他的，但是并没有被使用，而这个能力现在正等着他，这会带给他温暖和信心，而且会保护它。
In his dream he is also aware that these people like him, and that in some manner he has been acquainted with them in the past. This also brings forth feelings of rediscovery and joy that accompanied the dream. The persons involved were good friends indeed in a past life. They were images of the men whose voices spoke to him in his earlier dream, when he was so frightened; and when he leaped so gracefully from the banister, I was the one who extended an arm to assist him.在梦里他也察觉到这些人是喜欢他的，而以某种方式，他在过去已经认识他们了。这也随后在梦里带给他一种再发现和快乐的感觉。在梦里的人确实是他过去世的好朋友。他们是在早先那个梦里对他说话的人，当时他很害怕；当他以一种优美的姿势从栏杆跳出去的时候，我是那个伸出手帮他一把的人。
(Jane smiled, her eyes still closed. Her pace had picked up and her voice had now grown somewhat stronger and deeper.)(珍面带笑容，眼睛仍然闭着。她的速度慢慢加快，声音也更大更深沉。)
In the dream however I was a young man with olive skin, from a previous existence. That is, it was myself in a previous existence. There were the other men whose voices were also heard in the first dream. This time however the intended vote of confidence was given emotionally, through smiling gestures and so forth.不过在梦里，我是一个有着橄榄肤色的年轻人，这个形象来自于前世。那是我自己的前世。在第一个梦里有另一些男人的声音。他们透过微笑的表情等等，在情感上加强信心。
The separate building of apartments represented possibilities另一栋公寓建筑代表更远将来的可能性，
in the more distant future. Ruburt is not ready for them yet. The one room into which he looked for example was not vacant, or ready for him in other words. The ability represented by the jacket however represents the fairly immediate future.鲁柏尚未对它们准备好。例如，他看到的那房间并不是空的，或为他准备好的。夹克代表的能力意味着非常近的未来。
His dancing and high spirits are self-explanatory. His excellent mood upon awakening showed that the import of the dream was clear to him on a subconscious basis.他的舞蹈和高昂的情绪是很明显的。他醒来后的好心情显示了对他的潜意识而言，这个梦的重要性是很清楚的。
I do have a few more remarks, very few, on this second dream. However now I suggest a brief break.关于第二个梦我还有一些要补充。不过我建议现在先短暂休息一下。
(Break at 9:20. Jane had been dissociated as usual for at first delivery. She kept the deeper voice and fast pace until break.(9:20休息。珍在第一阶段出离如常。直到休息前她都保持着低沉的嗓音和较快的速度。
(Jane said she hadn’t consciously connected the voices in the first dream with the olive-skinned males in the second dream. She well remembered the young man who gracefully assisted her off the banister in the second dream. He had, Jane said, exceptionally beautiful and smooth olive skin. He was not very tall, but short, slim and well proportioned, with dark hair. Jane doesn’t recall this young mans features specifically, nor for that matter the features of any of the other males. She remembers the fact that they were all smiling, and their smooth olive skins.(珍说，她并未有意识的连结第一个梦里的声音和第二个梦里橄榄肤色的男性。她记得很清楚，在第二个梦里那个年轻人以优美的姿势协助她跨越栏杆。珍说他有着特别美丽平滑的橄榄色皮肤。他并不是很高，但短小精瘦，比例均匀，也有着深色的头发。珍不特别记得这个年轻人或梦里其他男性的长相，她记得他们都在微笑，还有他们平滑的橄榄色肌肤。
(It was now time for the second clairvoyant test with the Gallaghers in Puerto Rico. Jane began speaking while seated and with her eyes closed. Her voice was now quiet, and she used many brief pauses. Resume at 9:30.)(现在是时候开始对波多黎各的加拉格夫妇做第二次透视测验了。珍坐下开始说话，眼睛闭着。她现在的声音很轻柔，而且中间短暂的停了很多次，在9:30分继续。)
Please give us a moment.请给我们一点时间。
Your friends, my friends, the Jesuit and the cat lover, are sleeping in a different room than they were at our last session.你们和我共同的朋友，耶稣会信徒和爱猫人士，正睡在和上节课感应时不一样的房间。
It is close to water, and further west, and in a different town or location. (Pause.) It is to the rear rather than the front of the building, to the side and rear. With a tree immediately outside the window; a bushy sort of tree with something like spikes on it. (Pause.)房间靠近水，位在更西边，在一个不同的城镇或地方。(停顿)房间位在建筑物的后面而不是前面，比较靠边或靠后的地方。窗户外面有一棵树；是一种浓密的、很多细钉子形状的树。(停顿)
Some sort of theater. They have visited or it is close, and they passed it on their way to this place.类似戏院。他们曾去参观或经过一个类似戏院的地方。
There is a phone in this room. They saw a motion picture about a woman with lovers, and a cripple, or perhaps a dwarf. They purchased a crucifix, I believe, small, to be worn on a chain. (Pause.)这房间里有一部电话。他们看了一部动作片，是关于一个女人和她的情人，还有一个伤残人士，或也许是侏儒。我相信他们买了一个十字架，小小的，可以挂在项链上。(停顿)
They ate at a place with wide windows and blinds, closed because of the sun. One extremely long window at the front, the entire length of the building, covered with this blind.他们在一个有宽大窗户的地方吃饭，因为挡太阳，窗户都被百叶窗遮起来了。前面有一个特别长的落地窗，占了建筑物的一整面，也被百叶窗遮起来了。
They ate with Peggy’s sister and husband, or they talked about them during the meal, in an immediate fashion, thinking of them very strongly. Perhaps making an appointment with them for this evening.他们和蓓的妹妹以及她先生吃饭，或者是当他们在用餐时曾以热切的方式谈到或想到他们。也许这晚他们正和他们订定聚餐。
(Peggy 's sister had been married on the Saturday before Peggy and Bill left for Puerto Rico. The oddity here is that the sister and her new husband also went to Puerto Rico on their honeymoon; however they left for the island Saturday night, whereas Peggy and Bill left for Puerto Rico the next day, Sunday. As far as Jane and I know, the two couples had made no plans to meet down there, nor did they particularly want to.)(蓓的妹妹在蓓和比尔去波多黎各前的那个周六结婚了。奇怪的是，她妹妹和妹夫也去波多黎各度蜜月；不过他们是星期六晚上去的，而蓓和比尔是隔天星期天才出发，就珍和我所知，这两对夫妻并没有打算在当地碰面，也并不特别想这样做。)
The sister's husband has a squat build, and uses his hands often in work.他妹夫是矮胖的体型，在工作中常会用到他的手。
(Jane and I have not met the husband or sister. Jane now took a long pause at 9:41.)(珍和我没有见过她妹夫和妹妹。珍在9:41分时有个较长的停顿。)
Let me see if we can pick them up at this moment.让我看看此刻我们是否能接收到什么。
A connection with dice. An old man, and jewelry. A minor disturbance. I think of a pack of cigarettes, not American brand, though neither of them smoke. A shawl, as a gift. A particular dead-end street that should be significant to them on their return.和骰子有关。一个老人和珠宝。一次小骚动。我想到一包烟，不是美国的牌子，虽然他们俩都不抽烟。一条披巾，是一个礼物。有一条特别的死巷子，在回程时应该对他们有重要的意义。
I have the impression: clor-ra-door (my phonetic interpretation) but do not know to what it refers. Also an interior lake.我的印象是:克－拉－朵[clor-ra-door](我的语音解释),但我不知道这指的是什么。还有一个内陆湖。
I suggest your break, and then we shall pick up your Dr. Instream. Figuratively speaking, of course.我建议你们休息一下，然后我们应该换招呼殷斯翠姆博士了。当然是象征性地说。
(Break at 9:46. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice average. As in the last session when dealing with the Gallaghers, she had no visual images to accompany her delivery.(9:46休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，声音适中。在上一节提到加拉格夫妇时，她的口述并没有伴随着视觉影像。
(When she began speaking again her pace was slow for the most part, with many pauses. She sat with her eyes closed. Resume at 10:00. This is the 10th Dr. Instream test.)(当她再次开始说话时，大部分时间速度较慢，多次停顿。闭着眼睛，坐着。10点重新开始。这是第10次殷斯翠姆博士试验。)
I have an additional impression here, on our friends. It is of a small, light wooden object. (Pause.)关于我们的朋友，我在这里接收到一个额外的印象。是一个又小又轻的木质物件。(停顿)
I believe this evening our Dr. Instream is a little late. In any case he is not ready for us yet. (Pause.) A car stops, and he gets out of it.我想今晚我们的殷斯翠姆博士有点迟到。不管怎么说，对我们他尚未准备好。(停顿)一辆车停下，他从车上走下来。(注：见下列休息时罗的注释)
Give me a moment.等我一下。
He has been with other people, rather formally dressed. He has had drinks at a public establishment this evening, perhaps the Howard Johnson’s which you visited; and an affair at the college.他和其他人在一起，穿着相当正式的服装。他今晚在一个公共场合喝酒，也许是你们造访过的霍华德·约翰逊酒店(Howard Johnson’s)；大学里正举办着一个活动。
I think the car is a Buick. (Pause at 10:05.) He makes an evening visit to his office, and perhaps has coffee in the cafeteria. He speaks to a man in the hall outside the cafeteria. There is some confusion in his mind as to whether or not he can be with us in time, and his thoughts dwell on the matter.我想这辆车应该是别克。(停顿10:05)他今晚去了办公室，也许在自助餐厅喝了咖啡。他在自助餐厅外的大厅和一个男人说话。他有些不确定是否能即时赶上和我们的约会，他的心思一直在这件事上。
The man he spoke to in the hall is somewhat of a nuisance to him, in some way acting as some kind of impediment.对他来说，在大厅和他说话的那个人多少是个麻烦人物，他在某方面阻碍了他。
(Jane now took a pause lasting for a minute, from 10:09 to 10:10.)(珍现在停了差不多一分钟，从10:09至10:10。)
Dr. Instream also thinks of a telephone call he is expecting. He is in his office late. The phone call may have to do with his wife. She drives him home, I believe. He is inside his house.殷斯翠姆博士也想到了一通他正等待着的电话。他今天进办公室晚了。这个电话可能和他的妻子有关。我想是她开车载他回家。他现在在他的房间里。
(Pause at 10:12.)(10:12停顿)
He smokes on the verandah. There is a brief disagreement between his wife and himself. He goes to his room and tries to contact us. He thinks of a knife.他在阳台抽烟。他和太太之间有短暂的争执。他进了房间，试图和我们连络。他想到了一把刀。
Do you have a test for us, Joseph?约瑟，你还有测试要给我们吗？
(“No. I thought you might like to finish up on Jane's dream material. ")(“没有。我想让你把珍的梦讨论完。”)
We will then have a very brief break, and I will finish that discussion.那我们就短暂休息一下，然后我会结束这个讨论。
(Break at 10:14. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet. She had used many short pauses, other than those noted.(10:14休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，声音轻柔。她短暂停了很多次，比我注记下来的次数还多。
(While giving the data involving the car at the beginning of the test, Jane said she had a feeling of unsureness at to the location of the car. She didn’t know whether it was at Dr. Instreams office or at his home. She also didn’t know whether the unsureness referred to Seth or herself.(当测验开始，说到有关车的时候，珍说她对车的所在地有一种不确定感。她不知道车是在殷斯翠姆博士的办公室还是在他家，也不知道这种不确定感是来自赛斯还是她自己。
(Jane resumed while seated and with her eyes closed, in a stronger voice and a more rapid pace, at 10:20.)(珍在10:20分重新开始时，闭着眼睛坐着。她比较大声，速度也比较快 。)
It is interesting to see how the second dream was intertwined with events and concerns having to do with everyday realities.看到第二个梦是如何与每天实相的事件和日常琐事交织着，是很有趣的事。
They formed the outer framework for the second dream. At the same time the dream generated sufficient energy to lift Ruburt and his moods from a slavery to physical events. That is, the dream allowed his native good spirits to return in force, and to operate in a healthy fashion regardless of physical events.他们形成了第二个梦的外在架构。同时，这个梦也集结了充分的能量，把鲁柏从屈从于物质事件的心情给提振起来。那表示，这个梦允许他天生的好心情大量的回归，不理会物质的事件，而以一种健康的方式运作着。
Your Mr. Fell is indeed a different sort of personality than yourself, Joseph, but his omissions are not deliberate. Merely the result of lack of discipline and an avoidance of details; and indeed, a meeting between the three of you would be beneficial, indeed.约瑟，你们朋友的费尔先生，与你们相比，确实是一个与众不同的人格，但他的疏忽不是有意的。仅仅是一种缺乏纪律和逃避细节的结果；而你们三方的会面确实是有帮助的。
Believe it or not, Ruburts letter was a surprise to him. He will feel hurt, but cover this with a cosmopolitan manner.不管你信不信，鲁柏的信让他很惊讶，他感觉受伤，但以一种假装无所谓的(cosmopolitan)方式来掩饰。
(Jane took a long pause at 10:27.)(珍在10:27，停顿了很长时间。)
He has been away because of family difficulties.他离开是因为家庭有困难。
(Jane had been smoking since break. She now opened her eyes briefly and put out her cigarette.)(在休息时珍一直抽烟，现在她短暂的睁开了眼，并熄灭了她的烟。)
The therapeutic dream cut short Ruburts poor mood by a good two weeks, and the same tactics can be utilized in the future most productively.疗愈梦缩短了鲁柏两周以来的坏心情，而同样的方式可以在未来更有效的被利用。
Your own dreams just written down have to do with a change of pace on your part.你们自己刚写下的梦，和你们步伐的改变有关系。
(This surprised me. Seth here referred to two rather brief but vivid and colorful dreams I had written down just before tonight’s session began. Jane came back to the studio just as I finished. I told her I was noting a couple of dreams down, but did not describe them to her since time was getting short.(这点让我很惊讶。赛斯这里讲的是我在今晚课前刚记录下来的两个梦，这梦虽然简短，但逼真且多彩。我写完时珍正好回到工作室。我告诉她我正记下几个梦，不过因为时间短暂，我并没有描述内容给她听。
(During our daily life we do not take the time to describe in detail each dream we have to the other, unless obvious connections arise in future events, or the dream happens to be unusually vivid in some way. My two short dreams mentioned above were a little more vivid than usual, but otherwise not unusual, I thought. I now tried to lead Seth on.(在日常生活里，我们通常并不会花时间向对方描述每一个梦的细节，除非这个梦和未来事件有明显的连结，或这个梦在某些方面是不寻常的逼真。上述两个我提到的短梦比平常的梦更逼真，但除此以外也不至于到不寻常的地步，我现在正试图引导赛斯谈论它。
(“I didn’t tell Jane anything about those dreams.”)(“我并没有跟珍谈过这几个梦。”)
I realize that you did not. The change of pace may be in connection with two people, your relationships to two people.我知道你没有。步伐的转变可能和两个人有关联，你和两个人的关系。
(Jane now took a rather long pause.)(珍在这里停顿比较久。)
The colors have to do with quickening intensity of an inner nature. The quickening intensity could seem to involve a chase or pursuit. You are close to achieving a goal, having to do with your work.这些颜色和内在本质的加快强度有关。加快的强度似乎涉及了一种追赶或追求。你接近完成一个目标，这和你的工作有关。
An unknown, or not seen, man has to do with that portion of your goal which you are about to reach, but have not yet reached.一个不认识或没见过的人，他和你可以达到但还没达到的那部分目标有关。
(On the spur of the moment I began to concentrate on having Seth tell me more about this man. I was not sure whether he referred to this man as being part of my dreams, of whether he meant this unseen man existed physically.(当下我开始专注，希望赛斯多告诉我有关这个人的事，我不确定他指的是出现在我的梦里，还是他说的这个没见过的人事实上存在。
(At the same time Jane did something she has seldom done since she began speaking while sitting down. Her cigarettes lay on a bookcase out of her reach. Her eyes opened very slightly; she got up, reached the cigarettes, lit one and sat back down.)(同时，珍做了一件当她坐下开始说话后很少会做的事。她的香烟放在她拿不到的书架上。她的眼睛微微张开；起身，拿起并点燃一根香烟然后回来坐下。)
The symbol of a road involves the distance from one life to another, and the change from one set of parents to another. The aggression can be channeled into the pursuit of your goals. There was something to do with a child in the dream somewhere.路象征了从一世到另一世的距离，还有从一对父母换到另一对父母。攻击性可以疏导为对你目标的追求。这里和梦中某处出现的小孩有关。
(“I don’t remember that. ")(“我不记得这个了。”)
We will now take a break, or you may end the session as you prefer.我们现在休息一下，或你想结束的话也可以。
(“We’ll take a short break.”(“那我们短暂休息一下吧。”
(Break at 10:40. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed for the most part. Her voice had been quiet, her pace slow.(10:40休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛大部分时间都闭着，声音轻柔，速度缓慢。
(Copies of my two dreams in question follow. I am quite sure that I remembered but parts of both dreams. At any rate there follows what I wrote in my dream notebook.(附记正在讨论的我这两个梦，我很确定记得大部分的梦。以下的内容是我记录在梦的笔记本上的。
(Dream # 1; Monday night, October 18: In color. I was showing a young man in his early twenties some things about drawing. He was blonde, a man I did not know. Deep voice, straight hair, white shirt sleeves. He had a drawing board to which he had fastened a sheet of rough watercolor paper, and carried this around with him. I saw that he had covered the paper with fine-line figure drawings and portraits, in pencil and pen. This is an unusual way to work on watercolor paper. Good drawings, and I still remember one profile head in line, quite clearly.(第一个梦：10月18日，周一晚上：梦是彩色的，我把某种素描的东西给一个大约20出头的年轻人看。他是金发，一个我不认识的人。低沉的声音，直发，穿白衬衫。他带着一块画板，上面夹着一张粗糙的水彩画纸。我看到在水彩纸上用铅笔和原子笔画的、细致的人像素描画。在水彩纸上用这样的画法是很少见的。是一幅好画，我还清晰的记得画中人的侧脸。
(Dream # 2; Tuesday night, October 19: In very bright and vivid color. Had to do with our Ford station wagon, which is blue. In a big old garage with Jane, I was ready to drive the car away, but then seemed to look up at it on a hoist. I saw that the radiator was pulled away from the rest of the motor, that hoses and other connections dangled, and that the oil and water had drained away. I realized the car hadn’t been used in a long time.(第二个梦：10月19日，周二晚上：梦中的色彩非常明亮清晰。这梦跟我们的福特加长厢型车有关，车子是蓝色的。我和珍在一个很大的旧车库里，我正准备把车开走，却看到车被吊在上面，我看到水箱掉了出来，管子和其他连接器吊着，水和油漏了出来。我发现这辆车子已经很久没用了。
(Then I saw that the car sat on a steep grassy bank, beside a river I believe, and that another old jalopy had somehow been moved in front of our car so that we couldn't move it. The bank was covered with brightly colored high grass and weeds. Jane and I tried to walk along a path toward the car. The path was worn down to the bare earth. We were barefoot, and now I saw that the path was littered with pieces of broken glass. I think I backed up, telling Jane something to the effect that we had already gone too far. Neither of us were cut or injured.(然后我看到这台车停在陡峭的绿色岸边，临着一条河，还有另一辆老爷车停到我们车子的前面，所以我们动弹不得。岸边覆盖着颜色鲜艳、长得很高的杂草。珍和我试着沿着小路走向车子。小路光秃秃的。我们光着脚，然后我看到小路上覆盖着玻璃碎片，我记得我后退，告诉珍我们已经走得太远了。我们两个都没有被刮伤。
(At break I did not tell Jane anything about the contents of either dream. I thought that what Seth had said so far was related to the dreams in most cases, without being very specific, and was especially interested in his remarks about the intensity of color; this is true of the second dream especially. I also thought the material on my being close to achieving a goal good, in that I have had definite feelings along this line lately. Nor had I said anything to Jane about this; it is my habit to see how things work out instead of making predictions.(在休息的时候，我并没有告诉珍任何关于这两个梦的内容。我想赛斯目前大部分所说的都和这些梦有关，虽然没有很具体，我对他提到颜色强度的这部分特别感兴趣；第二个梦特别是这样。我也认为我靠近一个目标的这个资料很棒，最近对这部分特别有感觉。我没有和珍说过任何关于这点的事；我的习惯是看看事情会如何发展，而不是先预测。
(I did mention to Jane at break that I was concentrating on a question. I then added another question, I told her, but said no more other than that. I wondered whether Seth could answer the two questions. The second question was merely whether Seth could tell us anything about the blue car featured in the second dream.(我在休息的时候的确和珍提到，我正专注在一个问题上。我告诉她我后来又加了另一个问题，但没有说得更多。我不知道赛斯是否会回答这两个问题。第二个问题是，赛斯是否能告诉我们任何关于第二个梦里的主角、那辆蓝色车子的事。
(Jane said she wished Seth had not taken a break, but had continued with the dream material. I did not know whether I had said too much myself or not. Jane resumed in the same quiet manner, with her eyes closed, at 10:44.)(珍说，她希望赛斯不要暂停，能继续这个梦的资料。我不知道我是否说了太多。珍在10:44以同样轻柔的方式开始，她的眼睛闭着。)
I have been rather enjoying myself with our last material.我相当享受我们最后的资料。
Ruburts ego reared its rather belligerent head during break. However, even this head is more kindly of late.鲁柏的自我在休息时生气的探出头来，虽然他的头脑最近已经温和很多了。
A road, a highway or a railroad, a group of people and something pulls away. A landscape, quite vivid, and yourself. Two other people, a clump of trees.一条路，一条高速公路或铁路，一群人，有东西拉开。一座灯塔，非常逼真，和你自己。两个人，一个树丛。
Ruburt wants to say a whistle, so we will let him say it. This is a result of the train connection on his part. He is doing very well.鲁柏想要发出汽笛声，所以我们会让他发出声。这是因为他连结到了火车。他做得很好。
("Yes. ’’(“是的。”
(Jane now took a long pause.)(珍现在停顿了很长时间。)
A lake. A chase. You are after something, and fear it gone or unattainable.一个湖泊。一场追逐。你在追着某个东西，你怕它走了或无法达到。
(“I don’t remember that. ’’(“我不记得这个了。”
(Jane raised a finger, her eyes still closed.)(珍举起一根手指，她的眼睛仍然闭着。)
You should not comment, for when you do so you leave us open, because you give clues; and these clues do help in any case, my dear friend.你不应该评论，当你这样做的时候，你让我们对你的提示开放；我亲爱的朋友，不管怎样这些提示确实有所帮助。
The lake however was in the early part of the first dream.不过湖泊出现在第一个梦较早的部分。
You may take a short break, very brief. Then ask any questions that you prefer, and we shall end the session. Questions having to do with the dream, incidentally.你们可以短暂休息一下，很短。然后问任何你想问的问题，而我们应该要结束这节了。顺带一提，问题最好跟梦有关。
(Break at 10:53. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet. She said Seth’s admonishment to me hadn't bothered her. Neither of my mental questions had been answered.(10:53休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，声音轻柔。她说赛斯对我的提醒并不困扰她，我心里的问题都还没被回答。
(During break Jane again lay on the bed, or half reclined, while she smoked. She began to speak from this position. For part of the delivery at least her eyes were open. I found it a little hard to tell when they might be partially open since she left her glasses on, and reflections interfered. Her voice was quiet, her pace rather fast. Resume at 10:58.)(休息时珍再次躺在床上，半斜躺，吸着烟。她开始用这种姿势说话。一部分口述的时间她的眼睛是睁开的。我发现去分辨她的眼睛是不是睁开有点困难，因为她戴的眼镜会反光。她的声音轻柔，速度较快。10:58分继续口述。)
The failure perhaps was my own. The dream material should have been continued without a break. However I felt that Ruburt might need one. Still we have done well, as you should discover when you read your dreams over once more.失误是我造成的，梦的资料应该继续而不该中途休息。但我觉得鲁柏可能需要休息。我们仍然做得很不错，当你再读一次你的梦时，就会发现了。
Had you asked the two questions mentally without letting Ruburt know they were significant, you should have received your answers. This is simply because this sort of thing is fairly new with him, and so he was on guard. Later it will not matter.如果当时你在心里问这两个问题，没让鲁柏知道这是重要的，你应该已经收到答案了。只是因为这种事对他来说还太新，所以他会有防卫。过一阵子应该就没问题了。
We will therefore close our session. My best regards to all. And from what our Mr. Gallagher is doing at this moment, I must say that I think he would make a poor Jesuit indeed.我们要结束这一节了。我对所有人致上最深的祝福。至于加拉格先生现在在做什么，我必须说，我认为他现下大概不是一个好教徒。
I am quite prepared to continue. However I realize that you must be weary.我本来准备再继续。不过我想你们一定累了。
(“Were getting there. ’’(“我们的确是。”
(Jane, after a pause, with her eyes wide open: “It’s me.”(过了一会儿，珍眼睛睁大：“是我。”
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:01. Jane was dissociated as usual. I believe her eyes were closed most of the time. Jane said she didn’t know, that during the session she wasn’t concerned one way or the other.(11:01结束。珍出离如常。我相信她的眼睛大部分时间是闭着的。珍说她不知道，在上课时她没有注意到这个。
(Jane was very curious as to what new abilities lay in store for her, especially the one that Seth said she would shortly discover. We speculated that Seth’s method of interpreting my dreams in this session might have something to do with it.)(珍对在那儿等着她发挥的新能力非常好奇，特别是那个赛斯说她很快就会发现的能力。我们猜想赛斯在这节解读我的梦的方式，可能和这个能力有关。)

SESSION 201 第201节 私人课


OCTOBER 25, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年10月25日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(I planned no envelope test for this evenings session, thinking its place could be taken by the third and final Gallagher clairvoyant test.(今天晚上的课我不打算做信封测试了，我想，第三次也就是最后一次对于加拉格夫妇的透视测验，应该可以取代它。
(Jane has now settled all matters pertaining to her ESP book with her publisher. In the 198th session, Seth said she would receive a letter from her publisher by the next Saturday. Jane did receive a letter then from his secretary, but not a definitive one. It is thus interesting to note that she received the information she wanted by the next Saturday, however; October 22, Friday, to be exact. We have yet to receive any word on our kitchen enlargement, which Seth also predicted would be settled by the Saturday after the 198th session.(珍已经和出版商解决了有关ESP这本书的问题。在第198节，赛斯曾说过她会在下周六收到出版商的信。珍确实从他秘书那儿收到了信，但事情并没有明确的结果。不过有趣的是，她确实在下周六前得到了她想要的讯息；正确的日期是11月22日星期五。我们还没得到关于厨房扩建的消息，赛斯曾在第198节预言这件事会在星期六有结论。
(There follows a copy of my dream of Thursday night, October 21, as taken from my dream notebook: “I dreamed briefly that the first of the two short stories Jane has sold has now been published—The Big Freeze, I believe—and that as a result Jane can now get paid for it.” I hoped Seth would comment on the dream.(接下来是我从梦的笔记本上摘录的梦，时间是10月21日星期四晚上：“简短地说我梦到珍卖掉的两篇短篇故事，其中的第一篇出版了——《大寒》(The Big Freeze)，结果是珍可以收到稿费了。”我希望赛斯会谈谈这个梦。
(Saturday, October 23, Jane learned that her short story, The Big Freeze, was on the stands, in Dude Magazine. She had not been notified by the magazine that it would be. She is also to be paid on publication, rather than acceptance of the material. The magazine had appeared on the stands Friday, October 22.(10月23日星期六，珍知道了她的短篇故事《大寒》登上了《城市人》这本杂志。她事前并没有收到杂志社的通知。她的文章是被刊登了才会收到稿费。这本杂志在10月22日星期五上架。
(In the 200th session, Seth said Jane's publisher, Frederick Fell, would be hurt by Jane's demands for action, but would cover it with a cosmopolitan air. In his letter of October 22, the publisher certainly did write a cosmopolitan letter, in our opinion.(在第200节，赛斯说过，珍的出版商佛德瑞克·费尔(Frederick Fell)因为珍的行动要求而受伤，但他会以一种不在意的态度(cosmopolitan air)掩饰。以我们的看法，他确实写了一封专业不带情绪的信。
(The session was held in our back room and was free of interruptions. Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her voice was quiet, her pace quite slow in the beginning.)(这一节课是在我们后面的房间举行的，比较不会受到打扰。珍说话的时候坐着，眼睛是闭着的。她的声音轻柔，速度在一开始时较慢。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Your dream was an excellent example, Joseph, of a clairvoyant one, in which definite new information was received. The information was specific, and you retained most of the identifying data.约瑟，你的梦是预知梦的一个绝佳例子，在梦里你收到了明确的新讯息。讯息是针对特定的事，你记得大部分可认出的资料。
You were given the precise title of the dream content; that is, you knew the particular story was called The Big Freeze. It is true that you forgot that the title itself was a part of the dream, yet you did remember enough so that you were sure of the particular story. You knew it was the first, rather than the second.你给了梦的内容一个正确标题；你知道这特定的故事名字是《大寒》。事实上，你忘了这个标题，本身也是梦的一部分，但你记得够多内容，所以能确定是这篇。你知道是第一篇，而不是第二篇。
There was also a rather humorous translation here. When you awakened you felt chilly; although you could not remember having been given the title, The Big Freeze, this information was translated into bodily sensation. You were consciously concerned over financial matters. You were wondering when any additional funds would be received, and this gave impetus to your abilities. You asked a question and received an answer.这里也有个很幽默的转译。当你醒来时觉得很冷；虽然你不记得梦的标题，大寒，但这个讯息却转译为身体的感觉。你在意识上一直为财务的问题伤脑筋。想知道何时会有额外的收入，而这激发了你的能力。你问了一个问题所以得到了一个答案。
The sensation of cold was a clue to the title of the story, but one you would not have recognized on a conscious level. There is no reason for you to worry about financial matters. You are hardly in any difficulties here, nor will there be any.冷的感觉是这篇故事标题的线索，但是在意识层面你并不了解。你不需要担心财务问题。你们在这方面不会遇到什么问题，将来也不会有。
(Oddly enough, I remember waking up chilly in the morning last week, but do not know whether this followed the dream. I made no conscious connection with the dream in any case, and it seems to me I might have woken up chilly on more than one night last week also.)(真奇怪，我记得上周早上起床时觉得冷，但我不知道这是伴随着这个梦而来。我根本没有意识把这和梦连结在一起，而且上周似乎不只一个晚上我醒来后觉得冷。)
Ruburt did well in regenerating his energies these past few days. The outlet was excellent for him, and in this case incidentally the energy was far from lost, though it was used. You were both wise in your decision to make some purchases for your apartment. The objects were bought in high spirits, with money well earned, and they will retain to some rather strong degree the psychic exuberance which has become part of them, and will therefore add to the overall constructive climate of your dwelling.鲁柏在过去几天重新提振了精神。去畅货中心对他是很好的，顺道一提，在这件事上，虽然有用到体力，但消耗不大。为你们公寓去采买的这个决定是很明智的。用努力赚来的钱和兴高采烈的心情买来的东西，会保留强大的心灵丰沛能量，且使得强大的心灵丰沛能量成为它的一部分，而帮助了整体居家的建设性氛围。
I am speaking again of quite practical connections here, for as energy forms matter, matter and energy are inseparable and objects obtain their character from their owners, and from the circumstances surrounding them.再次地，我现在在这里说的是很实际的连结，能量形成物质，物质和能量密不可分，物件会从它们的拥有者和周围的环境，获取它们的特质。
(We think this passage helps explain some of the results Jane has been obtaining in her envelope tests.)(我们认为这一段有助于解释珍从信封测试得到的某些结果。)
I wanted to make a note here, that the tape recorder should work very well as Ruburt plans to use it in connection with collecting dream data.我想要补充一下，当鲁柏计划要用录音机来收集梦的资料时，它会运作得非常好。
I have used a portion of this session to deal with rather personal matters, and of course we discussed particular dreams at sessions immediately previous. This is fine, but we will shortly return to our material.我想用这节课的部分时间来处理一些比较个人的问题，我们在上一节的课里也讨论过一些特定的梦。这没关系，我们会很快的回到我们的资料。
I will now suggest a brief break before we deal with our friends. And incidentally, Ruburt’s experience in psychological time was quite legitimate.在开始讨论我们的朋友之前，我会建议一个短暂的休息。附带一提，鲁柏在心理时间的经验是十分合理的。
(Break at 9:19. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes had remained closed, and her voice quiet; her pace had picked up considerably as she spoke along.(9:19休息。珍在第一阶段口述时出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，声音轻柔；她的速度在开始说话后回复正常。
(Jane knew which psy-time experience Seth referred to. I’d made the quick diagram following her directions. From her psy-time notebook:(珍知道赛斯指的心理时间经验是什么。我在她的说明下很快的画了简图。这是从她心理时间的笔记本上摘录的：
(Friday, October 22, 11 AM-12 Noon. I was doing so well when the alarm rang at 11:30 that I set it for another half hour beyond my usual time.(10月22日星期五，中午11点至12点。我的心理时间做得非常好，所以当闹钟在11:30响的时候，我把它又往后延了半个小时。
(None of what I saw was very clear. I felt I stood on a long narrow porch or verandah with a railing. On either a double-story motel, or a motel of one story that was raised up higher than usual. I looked over and down at a pool, and felt that beyond this either the ocean or a large body of water was visible. Doors opened off the long narrow porch which extended full length, and I wondered whether Bill and Peggy Gallagher were staying here. I thought their room might have the door near the center of the porch. I had an impression of Peg sitting by the pool, with Bill in it.(我看得并不是很清楚。我感觉我站在一个狭长的、有栏杆的阳台上。是个两层楼高的旅馆，或是一层加高的旅馆。我往下看向泳池，感觉泳池后方是海或是一大片水域。通往狭长阳台的门打开着，我不知道比尔和蓓是否待在那儿。我想他们的房间应该有个门靠近阳台正中央。我有一个印象是蓓坐在泳池旁，和比尔在一起。
(I kept telling them I was standing nearby, just in case they could see anything of me. I still knew I was lying on the bed however, while I tried to project myself to their location.(我一直试图告诉他们我站在附近，如果他们有可能看到我的话。我试着投射我自己到他的所在地，虽然我知道我仍躺在床上。
(After I reset the alarm I tried to wander to the other side of the motel to find a name sign. Instead I watched a man from above and behind; dressed in suit, hat, carrying a bag or briefcase. He crossed a blacktop expanse of some kind by a large bulky building. Bill?(在我重设了闹钟以后，试图漫游到旅馆的另一边，看看有没有写着名字的招牌。不过我从上面的后方看到一个男人穿着西装，戴着帽子，拿着一个袋子和公文包。他穿过建筑物前的柏油路。是比尔吗？
(As to sensations: First I achieved a partial projection of some kind, and thought I might complete it but didn’t. Strong thrilling sensations, feelings of being swept away. Odd movements of some sort. I could feel the blanket over me and my pillow at neck move in odd fashion as if my physical body was making unaccustomed movements, but thought I was motionless. Very strong momentary feelings of being swept away, though these are poor words to describe this. Extreme lightness, weightlessness.(我的感觉是：首先我达成了某种部分投射，虽然我好像完成了，但其实并没有。有一种强烈震颤的感觉，好像被席卷过般。一种很奇怪的动感。我可以感受到盖在我身上的被子和垫在脖子下的枕头，以一种不寻常的方式在动，好像是我的身体有一种不寻常的移动，虽然我知道我是静止的。瞬间强烈被席卷的感觉，虽然这形容得不够好。特别轻，毫无重量。
(Once thought I saw mountains, as though floating. Then feeling of change of direction, more straight upward, yet still retained bed self. Once I was aware that I was looking up at treetops against a gray sky. When alarm rang second time some lightness remained. I did exercises, lightness vanished as soon as I turned thoughts to daily matters. End of account.(有一度我认为，好像漂浮着看到了山。然后有一种方向变了的感觉，更直立，虽然我仍在床上。有一度我感觉，好像站在树梢上看着灰色的天空。当闹钟第二次响的时候，这种轻盈感还在。我做了一些运动，当我把注意力转到日常事物时，这种轻盈感就消失了。报道结束。
(It was now time for Jane to attempt to tune in on Bill and Peggy Gallagher for the last time while they were on vacation. We were not sure but thought they might be on the way home from Puerto Rico by now. Jane began speaking with her eyes closed. Her pace once again became quite slow, with many pauses; although she would give a paragraph of material rather quickly at times between pauses. Resume while sitting down at 9:29.)(现在是时候开始珍最后一次的尝试，在比尔和蓓·加拉格度假时接收他们的讯息。我们不确定，但猜想他们此时应该在从波多黎各回家的路上。珍开始说话时眼睛闭着。她的速度一度变得很慢，中间停顿了好几次；虽然有时她在停顿中间会比较快的说出一段资料。9:29分坐下，重新开始。)
Ruburt did indeed pick up some material for his own writing today, and the complete break from his normal activities was very beneficial.今天鲁柏的确自己接收到一些讯息，在他的日常生活中，有一个完整的午休是非常有益的。
Now, give us a moment.现在，请等我们一下。
An airplane. Directly behind our friends (pause), there is a female in blue. Directly across from our friends, there is a couple of middle-aged.... (Pause, at 9:30; Jane shook her head in vexation.) We will try to clear this up. The couple come from Daytona or Dayton. The man has a connection with the paper business, but not a newspaper. The production of paper itself.一架飞机。有一个穿蓝色衣服的女性在我们朋友的旁边(停顿)。有一对中年夫妇……直接经过我们朋友旁边(9:30停顿；珍烦恼地摇了摇头)我们等会儿会试着理清。这对夫妇是来丹塔那(Daytona)或丹顿(Dayton)。男的跟纸业有关，但不是报纸。是纸张本身的生产。
(Both Jane and I have been to Daytona Beach, Florida, but neither of us has ever been to Dayton, Ohio.)(珍和我去过佛罗里达州的丹塔那海滩，但我们都没有去过俄亥俄州丹顿。)
Arrive New York eleven, perhaps 11:05. (Jane shook her head.) There is something, a gate or a runway with the number 3, 5; 35, possibly the number on their luggage ticket. But one of these is a 35. (Pause.) The woman directly behind our friends’ seat may have a child with her. If so a female child, but there is no man in that seat. (Long pause.)11点到纽约，也许是11:05分。(珍摇摇头)登机门或跑道上面有数字3，5；35，也有可能是行李票上的号码。而且其中一个是35(停顿)，坐在我们朋友正后座的这个女人，可能旁边带着一个孩子。如果有的话是一个女孩，那个座位上不是男性。(长时间停顿。)
They walk through a large building, most likely a terminal, for there are counters of a sort to the right. Our friend’s ulcer may show a slight twinge here, as he passes through the terminal. There is a short discussion concerning where to go next. (Pause at 9:40.)他们穿过一栋很大的建筑物，很可能是航厦，右手边有某种柜台。我们朋友的溃疡在穿过航厦时可能有点发作，有一个短暂的讨论是关于接下来该往哪里走。(停顿9:40)
Some place during their journeys they met a white-haired gentleman. I believe the name begins and ends with an A. His age about 62, perhaps older. (Long pause.)他们在旅程中遇见了一位白发绅士。我相信他的名字开头和结尾都是A。他的年纪大约62岁，或者更老。(长时间停顿)
The interest was of a business rather than a social one, in connection with this man.有兴趣跟这个男人打交道，应该是出于商业上的考量胜过社交上的考量。
At this time, that is now (9:44), our cat lover is reading. Our Jesuit is studying people, and they are flying.此时，就是现在(9:44)，我们的爱猫人士正在读书。我们的耶稣会信徒正观察着人，他们正在飞航旅程中。
A dress or coat of many buttons. A small boy several seats ahead. (Long pause, at least one minute.) I suggest your break.一件有很多扣子的衣服或外套。一个小男孩坐在离他前面几排的位子上。(长时间停顿，至少1分钟)我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:48. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet. Many of her pauses toward the end of the delivery had been long.(9:48休息。珍出离如常。一直闭着眼睛，声音轻柔。很多接近她口述尾声时的停顿都很长。
(Jane said she had a very vague impression of what she took to be the interior of an airplane while she was speaking. She could not describe it in so many words, and had no idea if she was correct to begin with, since she has never been inside an airplane. She appeared to have no memory of pictures of airplane interiors.(珍说，当她在说话的时候，有一个对机舱内部模糊的印象。她无法用很多的字眼来形容，也不确定开始形容对不对，因为她根本没进过机舱里面，也不记得曾看过机舱内部的照片。
(I was busy writing down the above paragraph when I realized Jane had fallen silent. To my surprise I saw that she was leaning back in her chair with her eyes closed once more. She resumed in a very quiet voice at 9:51.)(当我发现珍停下来的时候，赶忙写下上面这一段。出乎意料的，我看见她又再次靠向椅背，闭起眼睛。她以一种很轻柔的声音在9:51继续。)
Also a cab ride. Our cat lover laughs. A three-dollar fare, which seems large. An old, rather than a younger cab driver (pause) with a stubby neck.还有一趟计程车车程。我们的爱猫人士笑了。三块美金的车资，似乎有点多。一个相对比较老的计程车司机，(停顿)，脖子又粗又短。
A direction that is mainly to the right, after one turn. (Pause.) A room on the fifth floor or higher, but not lower. They eat a meal here also. I pick up some connection with the word M—在第一个转弯后，方向大致往右。(停顿)一间在5楼或5楼以上的房间，不会是5楼以下。他们也在那里吃晚餐。我接收到与M字的一些关联——
(M?)(M ？)
Elm, and this building. You had better break.榆木(Elm注：发音类似M)，还有这栋建筑。你们最好休息一下。
(Break at 9:57. Jane was dissociated as usual. She said she "knew Seth was going to do that, ” that he had some more to say.(9:57休息。珍出离如常。她说她“知道赛斯将要做什么”，他还有好多话要说。
(Jane said her attitude has changed quite a bit by now, in that she lets “anything through now, at least to a degree.” Otherwise we wouldn’t be learning anything about distortions, she said. Jane added that when Seth mentioned the right turn, or direction, she had a very definite inner sensation of turning to the right, after traveling in a straight line.(珍说，她现在的态度有点改变，不管是什么，她就“让它来吧，至少到某个程度”。否则，她说，我们怎么从扭曲中学到东西。珍加了一段当赛斯提到右转，或方向的时候，她有一种在直行一段之后非常明确往右转的内在知觉。
((Once again Jane's pace was slow when she began speaking again. She sat with her eyes dosed, her hands to her face. Her voice was quiet. Resume at 10:06, with the 11th Dr. Instream test.)(珍再次开始说话时速度较慢。她眼睛闭着，坐着，手放在脸上。她的声音轻柔。在10:06分重新开始，这是第11次殷斯翠姆博士试验。)
Give us a moment.等我们一下。
A cloth, like a handkerchief, laid upon the table, and a candle. Red I believe. (Pause.)桌上放着一件衣物，像领巾，还有一根蜡烛。我想是红色的。(停顿)
He concentrates, and he is thinking of a number, perhaps a zero. He sits at a straight-backed chair. I have the impression of a tall piece of furniture near him. (Pause.) Extremely tall, as an upright, rectangular shape, and it is dark. I believe it is behind him.他正专注想着一个数字，也许是0。他坐在一把直背靠椅上。我接收到一个印象，有个很高的家具在他旁边。(停顿)非常高，是直立的、长方形的，深色的。我想它就在他身后。
The room does not seem to be well lighted, for this piece of furniture is in shadow. The table is a round one, with other straight-backed chairs nearby. Some also in shadow. (Pause.)房间似乎不太亮，因为这个家具立在阴影中。桌子是圆的，在旁边有着其他直立靠背的椅子。有一些也在阴影中。(停顿)
The backs of the chairs are of an open type that is not completely solid or filled in. Perhaps glass doors (long pause; at least one minute), but an expanse of glass.椅子的后背是中空的，并不是实心全填满的那种。也许有玻璃门(长时间停顿；至少1分钟)，总之有大片的玻璃。
An identification by number. He wears something checked, small checks, but of a darkish rather than light, or bright, overall color. He makes a fist. (Pause.) Now I think of two candles, and the piece of cloth is white, the cloth on the table.有一个号码的识别证。他穿着格纹，小格子，整件衣服近深色，而不是浅色或亮色。他握拳。(停顿)现在，我想到两根蜡烛，在桌子上的衣物是白色的。
An M, S. (Pause.) A disagreement today between Dr. Instream and a man with a mustache, over money and a policy, having to do with how funds should be used. Some connection with a fortification (pause) or government training program of military nature.一个M，S(停顿)今天，殷斯翠姆博士和一个留着胡子的男人有争论，是关于钱和政策，应该和如何使用资金有关。和某种防卫工事有关联(停顿)。或是和军事性质的政府训练方案有关。
A dispersal. Two coins on the table. 1930. One of the coins is dated 1930.散布。桌子上有两枚硬币。1930。其中一枚硬币的日期是1930年。
I suggest your break. Do you have a test for me?我建议你们休息。你还有测试要给我吗？
(“No.”)(“没有。”)
I thought I would be polite and ask.我想我应该要礼貌地问一下。
(“Were taking it easy on you tonight.”(“我们今晚对你比较客气。”
(Break at 10:24. Jane reported that she had been very well dissociated during the delivery. She sat quite still while giving the material in a quiet voice, with her hands to her face the whole time, and used many pauses.(10:24休息。珍描述说她的口述是在一个很好的出离状态下进行。她坐得很直，以一种轻柔的声音来给资料。她的手一直放在脸上，中间很多停顿。
(Jane resumed in the same quiet manner, but at a little faster pace, at 10:32.)(珍以同样轻柔的声音在10:32重新开始，但速度比较快一点。)
We will now bring our session to its close.现在要结束我们的课了。
Ruburt will have some additional short-story sales in the near future, partly as a result of this story. At least one before the publication of the other story that has already been sold.鲁柏最近会有其他的短篇故事卖出，有部分是因为这篇故事。在另一篇故事出版前至少有一篇会卖出。
There will be word concerning the sister of Ruburts mother. Not of a fortunate nature.有一些关于鲁柏母亲姐姐的讯息。不是幸运的那种。
My heartiest regards to you all. You embark upon a most productive season, that will be important for you both. I anticipate it for you with affectionate regard. Approximately four days from now, I believe your Dr. Instream will receive an important letter, for which he has been waiting, and that he will receive confirmation concerning his own hypnosis experiments.我对你们俩最衷心的祝福。你们开始了最富创造性的时期，这对你们俩来说都很重要。我对你们有最深的期待。从现在起大约4天内，我相信殷斯翠姆博士将会收到一封很重要的信，是他期待已久的，对他催眠实验的肯定。
Possibly in New York your other friends eat turkey. It is better to eat turkey than crow.你们另外的朋友也许在纽约吃火鸡。吃火鸡比吃公鸡好。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:41. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes remained closed, her voice quiet. She remembered most of what she had said.(10:41结束。珍出离如常。她一直闭着眼睛，声音轻柔。她记得大部分她说过的话。
(In the 104th session, Seth said that Jane would sell some of the short stories from the group she was working on at the time of the session. The two sales, including the one just published, are from this group; in addition Jane missed out on other sales from the group because various publishers wrote her that although they liked her material, they already had similar ideas in inventory. Jane has now begun work on another group of short stories. Enough time lapses between her short-story work so that it is easy to keep the groups separate. See Volume 3.(在第104节，赛斯说过，在我们的课期间珍会卖掉一些从她工作团体里写的短篇故事。有两篇卖了，包括刚出版的这一篇就是从这个团体来的；此外有一些短篇没卖出去，因为有不同的出版商写信告诉她，虽然他们喜欢她的文章，但手上已经有类似的题材了。珍现在开始在另一个团体写短篇故事，短篇故事的工作之间有足够的空档，所以很容易错开不同的团体。见第三册。
(Jane's aunt, mentioned by Seth, lives in New York City. Jane has not seen her for some years, but keeps in touch via the aunt's sister, Jane's mother.)(赛斯提到的珍的姨妈，现在住在纽约市。珍已经好几年没有见过她，但会通过她的妹妹，珍的母亲，来保持联络。)
(Xerox copies of the name cards used in the 16th envelope test, in the 202nd session for October 27,1965.)第202节 ▲内在感官 再谈暗示 信封16

SESSION 202 1965年10月27日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课


OCTOBER 27, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED用在1965年10月27日第202节第16次信封测试的名片影本
(Jane talked with Peggy Gallagher briefly on the telephone this morning and learned that the Gallaghers returned to Elmira yesterday, Tuesday, from vacation in Puerto Rico. Jane learned little about their trip other than that the Gallaghers took many notes to use in checking against Seth’s notes; and that Bill found himself involved in a “strange experience” with a piano player and what he thought was telepathy. The four of us get together this weekend to hash over all the notes.(珍今天早上简短的和蓓∙加拉格通了电话，得知加拉格夫妇在昨天星期二的时候，刚从波多黎各度假返回到埃尔迈拉。珍对他们的旅行所知不多，只知道加拉格夫妇做了很多记录，以便和赛斯的记录相对照；还有比尔发现，他对一个钢琴演奏者陷入一种“奇怪的经验”里，他认为那是心电感应。我们4个会在周末把这些记录讨论一遍。
(For the envelope test I used a pair of name cards made by our friend Bill Macdonnel for his art studio, the Cameron Gallery. Bill gave us these cards perhaps a year or so ago, shortly after he opened his gallery. Each card is handmade and thus somewhat unique. More than anything else, I was interested in seeing if Jane could distinguish that the test involved two objects. I placed the cards between two pieces of Bristol board, then sealed them in the usual double envelopes.(在信封测试中，我用了两张我们的朋友比尔·麦唐纳[Bill Macdonnel]为他的艺术工作室——卡梅隆艺廊(Cameron Gallery)所制作的名片。这些名片大约是一年前，比尔开了他的艺廊不久之后给我的。每张卡都是手工做的，所以张张独特。我很有兴趣知道珍是否能分辨测试中涉及了两个物件，我把卡夹在两张纸板中间，然后放进信封里面。
(Jane has been working hard these days, and before the session tonight she remarked that her eyes were tired. The session was held in our quiet back room. Jane spoke while sitting down. Her eyes were closed, her voice somewhat deeper than usual, although not loud; and her pace was rather slow in the beginning.)(珍这几天工作得很认真，在举行今晚的课之前，提到她的眼睛很酸。这一节课是在我们后面那间比较安静的房间里举行的。珍说话的时候坐着，她的眼睛闭着，声音比平常更低沉，虽然没有很大声；她的速度在开始时比较慢。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I would like to discuss the inner senses in connection with some of the other material that you have been given more recently.我想讨论一下内在感官，那和我最近给你们的资料有关。
First however I have a suggestion for Ruburt along the following lines. He is now at the point where he can greatly improve the condition of his eyes, and his vision, through consistent self-suggestion. The following phrase should be beneficial: I am relaxed and at ease, and confident. I can see easily and well.首先，我想给鲁柏以下的建议。他可以通过持续的自我暗示，大幅度的改善他眼睛的症状和视力。以下的说法应该会很有帮助：我是放松自在且有自信的。我能轻易的看见而且看得很清楚。
Now. As you know, the inner senses belong to that part of human personality that is not physically materialized. At various times I have spoken concerning the reality of what you refer to as the astral body. You must remember that over a year ago we discussed tissue capsules. The astral body is of this nature. It is composed of electromagnetic components. It is simply the unseen self.如你们所知，内在感官是属于人类人格未被物质显现的那部分。在不同的时间，我曾经提过你们所谓灵体的实相，你们应该记得一年多前我们讨论过的组织囊，那就是灵体的本质。它是由电磁成分组成的，简单地说，它就是看不见的自己。
(Seth began discussing the inner senses in the 20th session; by the 50th session he had gone into some detail on nine of them, with more to come. By the 59th session he had also included eleven basic laws of the inner universe, plus three properties of physical material.(赛斯开始讨论内在感官是从第20节开始；在第50节，他很仔细地谈到了其中的9种，还有更多没说的。在第59节，他谈到内在宇宙的11种基本定律，加上3种物质原料的特性。
(The 7th inner sense is: Expansion or Contraction of the Tissue Capsule. In Volumes I and 2 see the 39th, 40th and 43rd sessions among many others.)(第七种内在感官是：组织囊的扩张或收缩(Expansion or Contraction of the Tissue Capsule)。见第39、40和43节。)
This does not mean that it cannot be seen on occasion, but it cannot be perceived through use of the unaided physical senses. It is that indeed which contains the memories and experiences, in codified units, of the present individual. It is that part which survives physical death. It is that part which in physical life is intertwined with the physical image.那并不意味着它不能偶尔被瞥见，只是无法被独立的肉体感官接收到。它包含了目前个人被编织成单位的记忆和经验，是在肉身死后仍存活着的那部分。它是在物质生活中和物质形象交织的那部分。
