The basic consciousness is never physical. Yet within your system it must collect experience within the physical system, hence the physical body. But experience itself is not physical, and cannot be contained within physical matter. Therefore this experience, collected within the physical field, is held in codified form by this inner self or astral identity. It is only by understanding the connection between the physical and nonphysical self, and the communication systems that operate here, that the true nature of human personality can be studied. While we are dealing now with your own species, it should be realized that all consciousness also possesses its own astral identity. The inner senses are part of this nonphysical self. They allow the personality to retain its relationship with nonphysical reality, permitting the material self to focus within its earthly environment.最基本的意识永远不是物质的。但在你们的系统却必须透过身体系统，也就是肉体，汇集经验。但经验本身不是物质的，无法被物质所包含。因此这些在物质世界所汇集的经验，就会被内我或星光本体(astral identity)编织成型。只有了解物质和非物质自己之间的连结，和在其中运作的沟通系统，那么人类人格的真正本质才能被了解。当我们谈到你们的族类时，你们必须明白，所有的意识都有它自己的星光本体。内在感官是这个非物质自己的一部分，它让人格保留了它和非物质实相的关系，也让物质取向的自己专注在地球的环境。
The inner senses collect information of which the conscious self may not be aware. The astral identity of course is aware of communications from both the inner and outer environment. The astral identity is therefore actually a more complete representation of the whole personality, and its abilities are far-reaching. The inner ego of which we have spoken is the director of this astral identity. You should see now how this fits in with some of our older material.内在感官会接收到一些并不为有意识的自己所知觉的讯息。当然星光本体对内在和外在环境的交流是觉知的。星光本体的确是整个人格更完整的代表，它的能力也是更广大的。我们说的内在自我是这个星光本体的指挥者。你们应该看看这如何呼应我们先前的资料。
(Seth began discussing the inner ego along with the inner senses, so material on it is woven through the sessions. A few recent sessions dealing with the inner ego are: 94, 151, 162, 173. See Volumes 3 and 4.)(赛斯开始讨论内在自我和内在感官，将这些资料编入整个课程。最近的课程讨论到内在自我的是：第94、151、162和173节。见第三册和第四册。)
When the physical self sleeps the astral image may indeed wander. It always returns to the physical body during physical life. Its telepathic and clairvoyant abilities are not hampered in any way by the ego when that self sleeps. In waking hours the communications system is more or less closed on the ego’s side, but in sleep the barriers are lifted and knowledge from the inner self has a freer flow.当肉身的自己睡着的时候，星光的形象就真的开始游荡。当物质生命还在的时候，它总是会回归肉体。当自己睡着的时候，它的心电感应和预知能力并不会被自我以任何方式所阻碍。在醒着的时候，沟通系统或多或少在自我那方被关闭，但在睡眠时，屏障会打开，从内我来的知识会更自由的流动。
Obviously then so-called astral projection occurs frequently in the sleeping state. It also occurs however in the waking state, although the ego is not aware of such projection as a rule. When through training there is greater communication between the inner and outer selves, then it is possible for the ego to realize what has happened.很明显的，所谓的灵体投射常常在睡眠中发生。然而它也会在醒时发生，虽然自我通常并不觉知这样的投射。当通过练习，内我和外我之间会有更多的沟通，自我才更有机会明白，发生了什么。
I have told you that dreams are a continuing process, whether or not the ego wakes or sleeps, and whether or not it has, or retains, any knowledge of the dreaming. So also the astral self journeys often, whether the ego wakes or sleeps.我曾告诉你们，不管自我是否醒着，也不管它是否保留了梦的内容，梦是一个连续的过程。所以不管自我是醒着或睡着，星光自己的旅行都常常发生。
I suggest a brief break, and we shall continue.我建议一个短暂的休息，然后我们再继续。
(Break at 9:27. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes had remained closed. Her voice had been somewhat deeper than usual, her pace quite even after a slow start. Jane spoke almost as though she were reading aloud, with an occasional emphasis.(9:27休息。珍在第一段出离如常。她的眼睛闭着，声音比平常更低沉。她的速度一开始比较慢，后来慢慢平稳。珍以一种大声朗诵的方式说话，有时会重点加强。
(Jane's pace was again slow, her eyes closed and her voice quiet, when she resumed at 9:36.)(珍的速度再一次慢下来，她的眼睛闭着，声音轻柔，在9:36重新开始。)
The inner ego is then the “I” of the astral body.内在自我就是灵体(astral body)的“我”。
The inner ego is then this inner identity. It is closely allied with the entity, and connects a reality that is purely psychic, the reality of the entity, with a reality that is mainly physical, the reality of the physical self.内在自我就是内在本体。它很靠近存有，连结着一个纯心灵的、存有的实相，和一个主要物质的、物质自己的实相。
The inner senses perceive the psychic reality and transmit messages from it. We speak of these as separate, again, only for convenience, for we have but various abilities and various aspects of a self. The divisions are arbitrary. This is very important.内在感官感知心灵的实相且转译从那儿来的讯息。我们以一种好像分开的方式来说，只是为了方便，我们有不同能力和不同层面的自己。这种分法是武断的，了解这个很重要。
Now. Regard the inner senses in connection with the nature of action and electromagnetic reality, for the perceptions of the inner senses are themselves action, and as such they change both the perceiver and the thing perceived. You can see then that even this astral image is always in motion and never static, and its condition alters the physical self even as the physical self acts upon the astral image.现在。内在感官和行动的本质以及电磁实相都有关联，因为内在感官的感知本身即是行动，因为如此，它们改变了知觉者和被知觉物本身。你会发现，即使星光形象也总是在动，从来都不是静止，而它的状态改变了物质性的自己，即便物质的自己是跟着星光形象行动的。
Any dream is experienced differently by these various aspects of the self. There is not one objective dream that is merely perceived in various fashions. The various levels of the self create their own dreams, which do have meanings to all layers of the personality. But you cannot think of a dream as a concrete block that is for example chipped off in pieces that then apply to these imaginary levels. All of these aspects of the self are so intertwined that arbitrary distinctions must be made for you simply to explain them.任何一个梦都被不同层面的自己，不一样的经验着。并没有一个客观的梦是只以不同的方式被感知着。不同层面的自己创造他们自己的梦，这些梦对人格的所有层面都有意义。但你不能把梦想成是一整大块，切成小块应用于这些想象的层面。所有层面的自己都是交织的，武断的分别只是用来让你明白的简化说法。
Incidentally, suggestion will reach many aspects of the self, and some which are very distant from the ego, for you are setting into motion psychic action, which is behind all realities. Suggestion will reach portions of the self of which the ego is entirely unfamiliar. Suggestion can indeed change experience which has already passed.附带一提，暗示会达到很多层面的自己，有一些层面甚至离自我很远。因为你设定一个在所有实相背后的心灵行动之动作，暗示就会到达自我完全不熟悉的那部分自己。暗示的确能改变已经发生的经验。
It can change the individuals present reaction to the past event, and alter the original implications and meanings that were once connected with such an event. Suggestion can shape future events because any action changes that which existed before it, and that which shall exist after it within your system.它可以改变一个人现在对过去事件的反应，而改变和这件事有关的最初影响和意义。暗示可以形塑未来的事件，因为在你们的系统中，改变了过去就等于改变了未来。
This is different however from cause and effect for basically a specific action will not give a specific effect, only. Within your system, you only perceive certain actions out of an endless variety of actions. So you take these few as inevitable results of a given cause.这和因果是不同的，基本上，一个特定的行动并不只会有一个特定的结果。在你们的系统，你只会从无穷尽不同的行动中，接收到某些行动。而你却认为这些少数行动是某些不可避免的果。
Suggestion then can shape the future. Expectation enters in here particularly of course. Suggestion can shape dreams, and the dreams themselves then operate as action. A strong dream can be a more significant psychic action than any physical experience, and it can change the course of the personality completely.暗示可以塑造未来，这是理所当然的，因为期待加进来了。暗示可以改变梦，而梦本身就可以像行动般的运作。强烈的梦是一个可以比任何物质经验更重要的心灵行动，它可以完全改变人格的方向。
The inner senses will also react to suggestion. If you therefore suggest that you become more aware of their activities, then so you shall. You are giving suggestions, whether or not you realize it, constantly. You are forming your own physical image with all its strengths and weaknesses whether or not you are aware of it.内在感官也会对暗示起反应。如果你暗示自己将对这些活动更加觉知，那你就会。不管你明不明白，你都不断在给自己暗示。不管你有没有意识到，你都一直在形成自己物质形象的所有优点和缺点。
Suggestion, well used, with training and knowledge, will therefore allow you to alter the very cells of your body. The inner senses can be requested to operate in such a way that the ego will accept their communications. For the astral body is not some distant and alien other self, but it is even now that portion of yourself that you know but cannot see, that you feel but cannot touch.好好运用训练过和富有知识的暗示，能让你改变身体的每一个细胞。内在感知能以某种方式被要求运作，因此自我就可以接受彼此的沟通。灵体并不是某种遥不可及和陌异的自己，而是现在，你知道但看不到的自己，你感觉到但摸不到的自己。
I suggest a brief break.我建议短暂休息。
(Break at 10:02. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her pace good, her voice about average.(10:02休息。珍出离如常。她闭着眼睛，速度平顺，音量适中。
(Once again her pace was quite slow when she resumed. She sat with her hands to her eyes and her voice was quiet. This is the 12th Dr. Instream clairvoyant test. Resume at 10:10.)(再次的，她的速度在重新开始时比较慢。她坐着，手盖在眼睛上，声音轻柔。这是第12次殷斯翠姆博士的透视测试。10:10重新开始。)
Give us a moment.请给我们一点时间。
Something is turning, like a top, but as it turns it has many colors. It is more straight and slender than a top. (Pause.)某个东西在转动，像个陀螺，当它转的时候会有很多颜色。它比陀螺更直更细。(停顿)
There are several people with Dr. Instream, about a table. (Pause at 10:13.) There is a crash, audible from the table, but it comes from another room.有几个人与殷斯翠姆博士围在桌边。(10:13停顿)有一个东西破碎了，在桌子这里也听得到，但那是从另一个房间传来的声音。
His feet are tired. He thinks of an umbrella, and is now in a very small room or enclosure. He holds something up high that dangles, as from a chain or string. It dangles freely, like a pendulum, and he watches it. (Pause.)他的脚很酸。他想到一把伞，现正在一个很小的房间或小地方。他举高某个从链子或绳子下连着会摆动的东西，它像摆钟般自由的摆荡，而他看着它。(停顿)
There is a connection with something that is round as an apple; that is, round like an apple but smaller in size, and it turns perhaps on the end of a chain. It belongs in a box that is small and square. (Pause at 10:19.)与某个像苹果一样圆的东西有关联；开关像苹果，但比较小。也许在链子的末端。它属于一个小的方盒子。(停顿10:19)
He has his glasses off. His left foot has been bothering him. He wears a green robe with a tassel on the belt ends. The tassel is yellow or gold, or there are bands of yellow or gold by the tassels. He may have a late caller this evening. (Long pause.)他摘下眼镜。他的左脚有一点不舒服。他穿着绿色长袍，衣带尾端有流苏。流苏是黄色或金色，或流苏上有个环是黄色或金色。他今晚可能会接到一通很晚打来的电话。(长时间停顿)
I think of five nickels, perhaps in his pocket or on the bureau in a small stack.我想到五枚五分镍币，也许在他的口袋或小书柜的抽屉里。
I suggest your break. (Pause.) Or do you have a test for me?我建议你们休息一下。(停顿)或者你们还有测验要给我吗？
(“Yes. "(“是的。”
(It was 10:24, and too late for an envelope test in my opinion. In the 197th session, Seth had suggested I give Jane these tests unannounced during the middle of the session. I had forgotten to do so, and when I realized this at last break had assumed it would be better to wait until next session.(现在是10:24分，我觉得做信封测验会太晚了。在第197节，赛斯建议我在课堂中可以不事先预告而给珍一些测验。我忘了这么做，在上一段休息时我想起这件事，我想也许该等到下一节再试试看。
(Jane took the double envelope, her eyes still closed, and sat quietly holding it in both hands. Her pauses were rather brief. This is the 16th envelope test.)(珍拿起信封，她的眼睛仍闭着，安静地坐着，用双手握着信。她的停顿相当短。这是第16次信封测试。)
Give us a moment and we shall see what we can do.等一下，我们看看可以怎么做。
These are impressions. The shape of a star. A connection with a particular event, with some unpleasant connotations.有这些印象。星星的形状。与一件特别的事有关，带有一些不愉快的含意。
The number two. I think of green, the color that is of grass on summer afternoons. A representation. Two people. Yourself a year ago.数字2。我想到绿色，是那种夏天午后草坪的颜色。一种表达。两个人。一年前的你自己。
A connection with music, and somehow a more distant impression of a seesaw. That is, not here (Jane held the envelope up, shaking it, her eyes still closed) but connected with what is here; as a children’s game. Brown and gray.与音乐有关，某种与跷跷板有关的遥远印象。那不是在这里(珍拿起信封，摇一摇，仍然闭着眼睛)，但是和在这里的东西有关联；是一种儿童的游戏。棕色和灰色。
Four, six (pause) a location with much space, and a steeple shape. An incident to remember, and a connection with F E B, as in February.4，6(停顿)一个空间很大的地方，一个尖塔形状。一件值得纪念的事，与“FEB”有关联，好像是2月。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:31. Jane had been dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet. She said she had been surprised to hear herself ask for the test.(10:31休息。珍出离如常。一直闭着眼睛，声音轻柔。她说很惊讶地听到自己要求这个测验。
(We discussed the test results and made some connections. We did not think Seth would clear up the doubtful points, at least not all of them, because of the lateness of the hour. This I regretted, though thinking the test was a good one. Jane was now tired.(我们讨论了测验的结果，而且做了一些连结。因为已经很晚了，我们不认为赛斯会理清有疑惑的部分，至少不会是全部。这点我很遗憾，虽然测验是很成功。珍现在很累。
(The design on Bill Macdonnel's handmade name cards can be “The shape of a star” as far as conventional symbols go. At least it can to me, as an artist; Bill is also an artist. Jane and I drew a blank on “a particular event, with some unpleasant connotations ” at the moment.(比尔·麦唐纳设计的手工名片可以是“星星的形状”，上面有个传统符号。至少以艺术家来说，我觉得像是；比尔也是艺术家。珍和我当时在空白处写上“一个特别的事件，带有一些不愉快的含义”。
(We could make many interpretations of “The number two. "My personal idea is that "The number two" refers to the fact that two items comprise the test object. We did not know what to make of the color green impression. Any painting in Bill's gallery could be “A representation. " “Two people" is also open to many interpretations. “Yourself a year ago" I regarded as valid, since I had paintings of my own on exhibit at Bill's gallery on the occasion for which he made these cards; and the event took place around a year ago, although I do not know the exact date offhand.(我们可以对“数字2”有很多的解读。我个人的想法是，“数字2”代表了测验的物件有两个。我们不知道绿色的印象指的是什么。比尔画廊的任何一幅画都是“一种表达”。“两个人”也可以有很多解读。“一年前的你自己”我认为是有根据的，当时我的画也在比尔的艺廊展览，就是在那里他做了那些名片；这件事大约发生在一年前，虽然我不知道明确的日期。
(“A connection with music" can result from the fact that Bill played jazz on a phonograph at his gallery during the exhibition in which I participated last winter; he plays music also at each exhibition he presents.(“和音乐有关” 可能是指去年冬天我的画展览时，比尔在他的艺廊里用老式的留声机放着爵士乐；他自己每次展览的时候都放音乐。
(The “impression of a seesaw... as a children's game, "is quite interesting to us, and we believe a good example of the way associative memory can work while also being accurate. At the time of the exhibition I participated in at Bill’s gallery last winter, he had not had the gallery open very long. Building was still going on; in the back room were sawhorses he had borrowed from a carpenter, plus many other tools, scraps of wood, etc. Note that the sawhorse shape and the support for a child’s seesaw would be practically the same. Jane is very attached to playground accoutrements; she has especially fond memories of children’s seesaws and swings. Indeed, playgrounds have an almost mystical significance for her and she uses them often in her paintings.(“一个跷跷板的印象……像一种儿童的游戏”，这对我们来说很有趣，我们认为这是一个所谓联想记忆也行得通的好例子。去年冬天我参加比尔画廊举办的展览，那时他的艺廊刚开没多久，有些工程还在进行；在后面的房间有他的木匠借来的锯木架，还有很多工具、碎木屑等等。我有注记锯木架的形状和儿童跷跷板的支座几乎是一样的。珍一直很喜欢游乐场的设施；她对儿童的跷跷板和荡秋千有很好的回忆。游乐园对她有着几乎神秘的重要性，她常把它们作为绘画的素材。
(“Four, six" did not ring a bell with us. Bill’s gallery, which takes up the entire ground floor of a downtown store location, is certainly “a location with much space.” We are not sure of the “steeple shape," unless it may apply to some of the modern sculpture also on exhibit in the gallery last winter.(我们不知道“4，6”代表的意思。比尔的画廊占用了市中心一家商店的一整层楼，确实是“一个有很大空间的地方”。我们不确定“一个尖塔的形状”是什么，它可能是指去年冬天同时展在艺廊的现代雕塑。
(We wondered whether “An incident to remember... as in February, ”might be connected with the first impressions given, “a particular event, with some unpleasant connotations.”(我们猜想“一件值得记忆的事……就像是2月”，可能和第一个给的印象“一个特别的事件，带有一些不愉快的含义”有关。
(Jane resumed in a quiet voice, with her eyes closed, at 10:37.)(珍以轻柔的声音在10:37分重新开始，她的眼睛闭着。)
We will now end our session.我们现在要结束这节课了。
The unpleasant event had to do with several errors in introduction, made by Ruburt at that location during a reception.这个不愉快的事件，和鲁柏在接待处介绍人的时候所犯的一些错误有关。
My heartiest regards to you both.我对你们俩最衷心的祝福。
(“Good night, Seth. ’’(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:37. Jane was dissociated as usual and her eyes remained closed.(10:37结束。珍出离如常，她的眼睛仍闭着。
(The unpleasant event referred to by Seth made several pieces of information given in the test data fall into place for us. The errors in introduction made by Jane at the gallery reception were humorous, but also so obvious that their significance could be hardly missed. One involved a cousin of mine whom we hardly see; the other involved the director of the other gallery in town, the Arnot, for whom Jane had worked until a couple of months before the reception at Bill’s gallery, which we now believe did take place in February.(赛斯指的不愉快事件，让我们想起了测验资料里的几个讯息。珍在艺廊接待处介绍人时所犯的错误挺有趣的，这个错误太明显了，所以很难忘。这和一个我很少见的表亲有关；也和城里另一间艺廊的总监有关，阿诺[Arnot]，珍在比尔艺廊接待处工作前曾在他那里工作了几个月，我们现在想起来那正发生在2月。
(Jane's relations with this man became so acerbic that she left his employ in the fall of1964. At the time Seth said it was a wise move, and that from that point on Jane would do well with her writing. This has been the case. Seth also dealt rather extensively with the conflict between Jane and the director of the Arnot in the following sessions: 74, 75, 77, 79, 82, 84 and 85. All of Seth’s material on the situation has worked out. At the time, we found the psychological information contained in these sessions very helpful. See Volume 2.(珍和这个人的关系后来变得很紧张，所以她在1964年秋天离开了这个工作。当时赛斯说这是一个明智的决定，从那时开始，珍的写作就很顺利。这就是事情发生的经过。赛斯也曾在以下几节大量的讨论珍和总监阿诺的冲突：第74、75、77、79、82、84和85节。赛斯的资料在当时帮了大忙。那时我们觉得这几节所包含的心理层面讯息帮助很大。见第二册。
(Jane and I encountered her ex-employer at the reception at Bill's gallery last winter. Jane was acting as an unofficial hostess. In introducing this man to another couple, or trying to rather, Jane discovered in mid-sentence that she had forgotten his name.)(去年冬天，珍和我在比尔的艺廊接待处遇到了她的前雇主。珍表现得有如自己是个女主人一样。在向另一对夫妻介绍这个人时，珍话说了一半才发现她竟然忘记了他的名字。)

SESSION 203 第203节 比尔、蓓私人课 接近“上帝”


OCTOBER 28, 1965 9:40 PM THURSDAY UNSCHEDULED1965年10月28日 星期四 晚上9:40分 临时课
(Bill and Peggy Gallagher visited us this evening, and Seth came through later in the evening. Before this however we had the time to go over the three sessions in which Seth dealt with the Gallaghers while they were on vacation in Puerto Rico; these are sessions 199, 200, and 201.(比尔和蓓·加拉格今晚来拜访我们，过一会儿赛斯也透过来。在此之前，我们找时间讨论了这三节里赛斯谈到的，有关波多黎各度假的加拉格夫妇资料；这些资料在第199、200和201节。
(Seth/Jane scored many hits in the material dealing with Peg and Bill. Some of these are quite startling. There were misses of course, and statements that hinted at, or came close to, events and thoughts involving our friends. It developed that the notes Peg and Bill kept did not often coincide with Seth's material.(赛斯－珍答对了很多关于蓓和比尔的资料，有些是惊人的正确。当然也有一些失误，也有一些很接近我们的朋友所发生的事件和涉及的想法。事情的演变是，蓓和比尔所记的笔记并不总是和赛斯的讯息相符。
(As Seth stated in the 201st session, Jane's psychological time experience of October 22, involving the Gallaghers, did prove to be quite legitimate; along with some less striking psy-time events Jane experienced during the week Peg and Bill were in Puerto Rico.(赛斯在第201节里所提到的，有关珍在10月22日的心理时间中感受到关于加拉格夫妇的资料，事后证明是非常合格的；另外比尔和蓓在波多黎各的那周，珍也经验了一些心理时间事件，但没有那么令人印象深刻。
( The session tonight did not dwell on the recent experiments however, although Seth did express himself as pleased because we were pleased. Jane has made copies of the clairvoyant material from the three sessions involving the Gallaghers; they are to write in their account of what actually transpired after each of Seth's predictions or statements. We will then assemble all of the data into coherent form and include it in an early future session. Jane's psy-time experiments will also be so treated so that we have a unified body of work covering this experiment. We are most grateful for the wholehearted cooperation of the Gallaghers.(不过今晚的这节课，并不会停留在最近的实验上，虽然赛斯表示只要我们愿意他就愿意。珍复印了在这三节课里所提到的，关于加拉格夫妇的预知资料；在记录里，第一个赛斯的预测和陈述后面都会附注真实发生了什么。我们会把所有资料写进清楚的表格，然后附录在最近的这几节课里。我们也会把关于珍的心理时间实验用同样方式写下来，那我们就会有关于这次实验的完整记录，很感谢加拉格夫妇的全力协助。
(Some quotes from Seth will be given from tonight's unscheduled session, since I did make rather thorough notes. They are not all verbatim, however. Jane was in a fine mood, spoke rapidly as Seth for the most part, and I did not try to record each word. Her eyes were open at times, her voice good but not loud except for one or two brief occasions. She smoked while speaking, and for the most part sat or kneeled on the floor before our long coffee table; these are favorite positions of hers, not at all unusual when we have company.(在夜晚的临时课里赛斯会举例说明，我有做相当完整的记录。不过并不是逐字稿。珍的心情还不错，大部分时间以赛斯的身分说得很快，我并没有试着记录每个字。她的眼睛有时候会睁开，音量适中，只除了一两次短暂的比较大声外。她说话的时候抽着烟，大部分时间坐着或跪坐在我们的长咖啡桌前；这是她喜欢的姿势，有时我们在一起时她会这样。
(Seth came through as we were discussing the rather striking fact that while in Puerto Rico the Gallaghers met a woman physiotherapist from Duke University. I do not have her name at the moment. This woman knows Dr. Rhine well. It seems that her department and Dr. Rhine's are somehow linked at Duke, and that his incoming mail goes through her department. We will obtain more details. The lady told Peg and Bill a good deal about the workings of Dr. Rhine's department; and how, now that he is past 70, the mandatory college retirement age, arrangements have been made for him to continue his work in parapsychology through a foundation which is apparently connected to or with the college.(当我们讨论到一件令人印象深刻的事，就是在波多黎各，加拉格夫妇遇到了一位从杜克大学来的女性物理治疗师的时候，赛斯透过来了。我现在并不知道她的名字。这个女人和瑞恩博士[Dr. Rhine]很熟。在杜克大学，她的部门和瑞恩博士的部门好像有关联，他的信件会通过她的部门。我们会得到更多的细节。这位女士告诉比尔和蓓很多关于瑞恩博士的部门所做的工作内容和方式；虽然他已经超过70岁，到了大学强制退休的年龄，但透过一个和大学有关的基金会安排，让他可以继续超心理学上的研究。
(Shortly after the session began Seth told us that we would receive another letter from Dr. Instream “within a few days.” Seth also suggested Jane and I write to Dr. Rhine. The Duke physiotherapist had told Peggy that Dr. Rhine answers each letter he receives personally, “even those from crackpots.”(这节课刚开始不久，赛斯就告诉我们，我们将会在“几天内”收到殷斯翠姆博士的另一封信。赛斯也建议珍和我写信给瑞恩博士。杜克大学的物理治疗师告诉蓓，瑞恩博士会亲自回每一封信，“即使是疯子写的”。
(Seth said it was coincidence that the Gallaghers and the woman from Duke were in Puerto Rico at the same time, but not coincidence when they met. There was telepathic exchange between the three of them. Dr. Instream knows Dr. Rhine.(赛斯说，加拉格夫妇与杜克大学的女士同时在波多黎各是巧合，但他们的相遇并不是巧合。三人之间有心灵感应的交流。殷斯翠姆博士认识瑞恩博士。
(Quotes from Seth that follow, in caps as usual, are not verbatim for the most part, but close approximations. It will be remembered that Seth refers to Bill Gallagher as the Jesuit, and to Peg as the cat lover. Seth now speaks to them:)(以下是赛斯的陈述，像平常一样是大写，大部分并不是逐字稿，但也很接近了。注意赛斯称比尔为耶稣会信徒，而称蓓为爱猫人士。现在赛斯对他们说话：)
You must know by now... You are pleased enough with our results so that you both are easier with me now... You are good for Ruburt in our sittings. You are permissive enough so that he doesn’t become wary.现在你们要知道……你们对我们的结果还算满意，所以对我比较放心了……在这段期间你们对鲁柏来说帮助很大。因为你们的宽容，也许他不会变得过于小心翼翼。
Through the woman at Duke our Jesuit picked up inner information which he has given to Ruburt... Ruburt doesn’t know he has received it... The Jesuit doesn’t know he has given it. The Jesuit... has already given Ruburt information about Dr. Rhine, telepathically; this happened at the time.透过杜克大学的女士，我们的耶稣会信徒接收到内在的讯息，他把这讯息传给鲁柏……鲁柏并不知道他有接收到这讯息……而耶稣会信徒也不知道他有传讯息给鲁柏。耶稣会信徒……已经以心电感应的方式告诉鲁柏关于瑞恩博士的讯息了；这在那时就发生了。
(Peggy and Bill met the woman from Duke in Puerto Rico.)(蓓和比尔在波多黎各遇到那位杜克大学的女士。)
There is constant telepathic communication... This operates with you both and Ruburt, and of course with me. And Joseph knows things in a different way; not as direct as a rule, though he picks up other things...心电感应的沟通是持续发生的……这发生在你们和鲁柏之间，当然也发生在和我之间。而约瑟以不同的方式了解事情；以非常常规的方式，因此他收到其他的东西……
Ruburt is not aware of the Jesuit's messages, but Seth is. The Jesuit sent the information he picked up from this woman telepathically, about the character and nature of Dr. Rhine and his foundation.鲁柏并没有觉知到耶稣会信徒的讯息，但赛斯有。耶稣会信徒以心电感应的方式送出他从那位女士那里所接收到的讯息，是有关于瑞恩博士和他的基金会的特征和本质。
(Seth told Peg and Bill there is constant communication between them telepathically. He said the four of us would embark “on excellent circumstances" this winter but did not elaborate. Seth told Bill that he took his problems with him on vacation, especially the ulcer, and Bill heartily agreed. Seth then repeated some general suggestions concerning the ulcer, given in earlier sessions. Bill showed us his Japanese “tranquilizer, "a small black wooden carving he had bought in Puerto Rico.(赛斯告诉蓓和比尔，他们之间一直持续有心电感应的交流。赛斯提到我们4个人在这个冬天将会开始进入“非常好的状态”，但他并没有详细说明。赛斯告诉比尔在假期中他的老问题仍在，特别是溃疡，比尔由衷的认同。然后赛斯重复了前几节针对他的溃疡所给的一些建议。比尔把他的日本“疗愈小商品”(tranquilizer)秀给我们看，一个他在波多黎各买的黑色小木雕。
(Seth then launched into a long topic involving Peggy, her job at the newspaper, and another girl there. He stressed many times that the situations he foresaw were not drastic or alarming in any great degree, and that Peg could handle them. This discussion grew out of Seth’s remarks concerning a very close call Bill had while skin diving in Puerto Rico. The remarks Seth made about this were to the effect that had we asked specifically about potential dangers the Gallaghers might encounter on their trip, he could have given warnings. As it was no such requests were made, thus no warnings given before Peg and Bill left.(赛斯开始另一个长篇的话题，是有关蓓在报社的工作，和在那里的另一个女性。他强调很多次，他预见的情况并不至于太糟糕，蓓可以应付它们。这个讨论是有关比尔在波多黎各浮潜时差点溺死的事。赛斯会提到这个，是因为行前我们特别问赛斯，加拉格夫妇此行是否会遇到一些可能的潜在危险，如果有，赛斯可以给他们一些提醒。但是因为他们没有要求，所以在临行前赛斯并没有给什么建议。
(Seth now began in some detail on the situation at the local newspaper.)(赛斯现在开始说关于地方报社的一些细节。)
The cat lover should look out for someone... This is not too serious... At your newspaper. A situation may have developed in your absence: You should be advised. This implies a nuisance rather than a momentous event...爱猫人士应该注意一个人……并不是太严重……在你的报社。如果你不注意情况可能会更严重；你应该被提醒。这不算大事，却是件麻烦事……
Give us a moment.等我们一下。
I think now of a woman who is eager, who intends you no harm, but who could convince herself that she was not harming you one iota while she stabbed you in the back.我现在想到一个急切的女人，她并不打算伤害你，不过当她背后捅你一刀的时候，她可能也会说服自己那也并不算怎么伤害你。
([Peg:] “Has she already started working there?”)([蓓：]“她已经开始这么做了吗?”)
This is a minor circumstance... Not one to be on the angry defensive about, but merely alert. Indeed this does seem to refer to the young woman Ruburt has met... There is not unfriendliness here, but ambition.有一个小状况……还不至于需要愤怒的戒备着，只是个小提醒。这的确指的是鲁柏遇到的那个年轻女士……这并不是不友善，只是野心罢了。
([Peg:] “Is it the new Chinese girl?”)([蓓：]“是那个新来的中国女孩吗？”)
Indeed.是的。
We see your Kimball as new mayor, though I do not usually think in political terms.我们认为金博(Kimball)将会是新的市长，虽然我并不太常从政治的角度来想事情。
(Here Seth referred to the Elmira mayoralty contest. Both Jane and I know Howard Kimball, the Republican candidate. His sister lives in a downstairs apartment. Peg now questioned Seth further about the Chinese girl at the newspaper.)(赛斯在这里指的是埃尔迈拉的市长竞选。珍和我都认得哈威∙金博(Howard Kimball)，他是共和党的候选人。他的妹妹住在楼下的公寓里。蓓现在继续问赛斯有关于报社那个中国女孩的事。)
Her subconscious ideas were developing in your absence. She has no particular designs, consciously, as far as you are concerned... She has strong subconscious energies, and she has a goal, and you are in the way.在你离开的这段期间，她的潜意识里有一些想法滋生。就你所关心的，她在意识上并没有一个特别的计划……她有很强的潜意识能量，而且有一个目标，而你妨碍了她。
(Whereupon Peggy remarked that she was used to that kind of competition at the newspaper. She has been aware for some time that each new woman reporter seems to regard her, Peg, as competition.)(蓓在这里提到，她已经很习惯报社里的这种竞争了。她很清楚每个新进的女记者都会把她——蓓，当成竞争的对象。)
I will let our Ruburt rest, at least for a moment or so. Now and then I do indeed look down at him from my painting. I have at times been more presentable than that. Someday we shall show that face, and this face (Jane pointed to herself) for I am a stubborn gentleman, and in my own time we shall indeed give quite adequate proofs of what I am.我会让鲁柏休息，至少休息一会儿。偶尔我的确会从我的画像往下看着他。我有时会比那张画像所画的更体面一点。总有一天我们会秀出那张脸，那这张脸(珍指着她自己)是一张顽固的绅士脸，在某个未来，我们将对我是什么这点给予适当的证明。
I am indeed one of many but not one of a kind. I am simply the only one of a kind that you know.我的确是许多当中的一个，但不是某一类当中的一个。我仅仅是你们所知某一类当中的唯一一个。
(Break at 10:20. Jane had been dissociated as usual. She had remained in her position on the floor, shifting about but never getting to her feet. Her voice had been average but lively, and her eyes had been open much of the time. She had been smoking, her manner quite relaxed and happy.(10:20休息。珍出离如常。她在地板上稍微挪动了一下，但仍维持着姿势。她的声量适中但有活力，眼睛大部分的时候都是张开的。她抽着烟，姿势十足和愉快。
(The portrait referred to by Seth happened to hang on a wall facing Jane this evening. In the 168th session, Seth stated the painting represented him, but he did not say in which life. The idea "came" to me one day and I painted the portrait without a model. It is quite successful, and depicts an elderly, rotund, bald man standing by a window through which strong light streams. He gestures toward the viewer. As soon as I began work on it last spring, Jane insisted it was of Seth. I did not know who it represented consciously; merely that I had a very clear mental image of a face and figure to paint. The work progressed with considerable ease. See Volume 4.(赛斯指的肖像画今晚刚好挂在珍对面的墙上。在第168节，赛斯提过那幅画就是他，不过并没有说是哪一世的他。有一天我突发奇想，没有参考模特儿就画了一张肖像画。画得蛮成功的，描绘出一个年纪稍长、矮胖、秃顶的男人站在强光洒进来的窗边。他的手朝向观看者。打从我去年春天开始画这幅画，珍就坚持那是赛斯。我意识上并不知道那是谁；只是照我心里一张很清楚的脸和身材的印象去画。画进行得很顺利，请参照第四册。
(During break, Bill Gallagher described his narrow escape from drowning while skin diving in Puerto Rico. Bill is an expert swimmer and diver, but got caught unawares between an incoming and an outgoing tide offshore, in choppy water, and nearly perished. Bill said the panic that seized him was as dangerous, if not more so, than the tides.(在休息的时候，比尔·加拉格描述了他在波多黎各浮潜时死里逃生的经过。比尔是个游泳和潜水专家，但在不注意的情况下被近海起伏的浪潮给困住，差点死掉。比尔说，当时随之而来的恐慌比浪潮更让他感觉危险。
(Jane resumed with her eyes closed at the start, while sitting on the floor again, at 10:30.)(珍在10:30分重新开始时眼睛闭着，再次坐在地板上。)
You know enough to use the trance state very well... The trance would have helped you concentrate and disintegrated the panic, within seconds... You knew enough, and you had the impetus. You would have had to say only: I am now in a light trance state, and I will deal with the problem at hand.你很清楚的知道要利用出离状态……出离状态可以在短时间内帮你专注并且化解恐慌……你知道得很清楚而且你有动力。你只需要说：我现在是在一个轻度出离状态，我可以处理手边的问题。
...You can also use this technique whenever you are overwhelmed by the pain of an ulcer, or a business problem. You know enough now to use it....……当你被溃疡的痛或生意上的难题席卷时，也可以用这个技巧。你现在知道得够清楚，可以使用它了……。
(Bill now asked Seth if an Indian village had ever been situated over the spot where he had done most of his skin diving in Puerto Rico. He had heard talk while there that this had been the case perhaps two hundred years ago, before that section of land had settled beneath the water. He thought the village there, if there had been any, would have belonged to the Carib Indians.(比尔现在问赛斯，他在波多黎各浮潜的那些地方，是否曾有一个印第安村落存在。他听到传闻大约200多年前，在这块土地还没有沉下水底之前，村落是存在的。他认为在那里的村落，如果存在的话，应该是属于加勒比海的印第安人。
(Note that in the unscheduled 192nd session, Seth and Bill also had an interchange concerning underwater artifacts, Indians, Vikings and Jesuits in this section of the northeastern USA. If what Seth said in that session can ever be verified, some history books will have to be rewritten. Again, see Volume 4.(在第192节临时课里，赛斯和比尔对沉在水底下的工艺品，印第安人、维京人和美国东北部耶稣会的人，有了一段交流讨论。如果赛斯在这节说的内容能被证实，那一些历史课本就要重写了。再次的，请参照第四册。
(Jane, as Seth, listened to Bill's question, then shook her head. Her eyes were closed.)(珍，是赛斯的时候，听了比尔的问题，然后摇摇头。她的眼睛仍闭着。)
It was Inca, your village... Their main cities were in Peru. They traveled by sea then, but also over the land. Their journeys are responsible for many artifacts that cannot be explained... They reached Florida, but not inland in this country... The seacoasts.是印加人，你说的村落……他们主要的城市在秘鲁。他们从海路，也从陆路来。有很多无法解释的工艺品是缘自于他们的迁徙……他们曾到了佛罗里达州，但没有进入内陆……在沿海岸。
They set up small villages for outposts, for inland explorations...他们设了一些小村落作为前哨基地，用来勘察内地……
They also set up two cities in particular, which were highly developed. Their remains have not yet been discovered...他们也特别设立了两个城市，这两个城市是高度开发的。它们还未被发现……
One of these is in another portion of South America. The place you refer to was just a village base to explore from... They expected other ships from Peru which did not come. They died, and their home city was never aware of their location.其中一个位于南美的另一区。你指的地方只是一个用来探堪的村落基地……他们等待着其他从秘鲁来的船只，不过没有等到。他们死后，他们的故乡也从来不知道他们的位置。
I am having difficulties here with the location... of the second city... around a place called Cape Horn, I believe. But those were not local Indians in your location.我有点困难得到他们的位置……关于第二个城市……我想是靠近一个叫合恩角(Cape Horn)的地方，但他们不是你说的那地方的本地印第安人。
(Bill now commented on his interest in reading recently of the ancient Viking map which Yale University now possesses. The map has recently been authenticated, and purports to show the Vikings in the New World several centuries before Columbus.)(现在比尔谈到他最近的兴趣是阅读耶鲁大学里保有的古维京地图，这张地图最近被证实了，这意味着维京人到新大陆的时间比哥伦布还早几世纪。)
It is interesting... I am more interested in that you are like Joseph, always trying to lead me on... I am simple and quiet and peace-loving... And I will get to our cat lover yet... We shall dissipate this fear of our feline friends.这真的很有趣……我觉得更有趣的是你像约瑟，总是试图领我到……我是简单、安静和爱好和平的……我现在要谈到我们的爱猫人士……我们应该消除我们猫科朋友的恐惧。
Your ego is fearful and set up in arms about cats.你的自我很害怕，所以对猫设下了防卫。
(An amusing exchange now developed between Seth and Peg concerning cats. As if to help matters out, our cat got up from his perch on the TV set and jumped down. He walked over to Peg; I picked him up and deposited him in another room. In doing so I missed part of the exchange between Seth, Bill and Peggy, but I heard laughter. I returned to my chair in time to hear the following:)(赛斯和蓓针对猫交换了有趣的意见。仿佛要帮助讨论似的，我们的猫从电视架上站起来一跃而下。它走过蓓；我把它抱起来放到另一间房间。因为这样我错过了一些赛斯、比尔和蓓的讨论，但我听到笑声。我回到座位的时候正好听见下面的对话:)
... fear with a funny face.……古怪的表情害怕着。
(Seth remarked that our weather neither excited or concerned him, and that personality affects weather. He then threw out the God concept as a question for general discussion. He was greeted with a large silence momentarily. Seth asked for ideas from Bill and Peg; it will be remembered that in past sessions he said he would go into this question when they witnessed sessions.(赛斯提到，我们的天气并不会让他兴奋和担忧，还有人格会影响天气。他接着抛出上帝这个概念作为概括性讨论的问题。现场立刻就安静了下来。赛斯问比尔和蓓他们的想法；记得在前几节课时他曾说，当他们参与课的时候，他会讨论这个问题。
(After a moment Bill said he thought his beliefs regarding religion were more or less traditional.)(过了一会儿，比尔提到他对宗教的信仰或多或少比较传统。)
I don’t like the sound of this... We shall here let Ruburt open his eyes... Lets have better ideas.我不喜欢这种说法……我们应该要让鲁柏大开眼界……说说看更好的意见。
(I asked Bill to elaborate on his previous statement. Bill's answer included the idea that he believed a god would have to appear to the human race in humanoid form so that we could understand it.)(我请比尔详细地解释他上一段的说法。比尔的答案包括，他相信神应该以人的形体出现在人类面前，所以我们才能了解。)
...The humanoid God idea? I appear to you as Ruburt, but I am not primarily Ruburt...……这个人形化上帝的概念？我以鲁柏的样子在你面前出现，但我主要的身分不是鲁柏……。
(Bill remarked that in terms of our existence our Christ was a supernatural being.)(比尔提到，从我们的存在里，基督是一个超自然存在。)
Your Christ had abilities which I still do not have... and he did appear in your form, but he was not of your form... Your people saw but a small fragment that they could understand... a fragment that was part of a larger reality they could not understand...你们的基督有着我还尚未拥有的能力……他的确是以你们的形体出现，但他并非你们的形体……你们看到的仅仅是你们能了解的一小段片段……一小段来自于一个你们所不能了解的更大实相……
We have discussed this to some degree in our sessions... I speak of psychic gestalts. You see but portions of these pyramids of intelligences... what we are able to see at any one time.我们曾在课里讨论过一些……我所谓的心灵完形。你只看到这些智性金字塔的一部分……我们可以随时回来看。
(See the following sessions for material on the God concept, psychic and pyramid gestalts, and related questions: 51, 81, 95, 97, 115, 135, 146. 9, 151, 177, among others, in Volumes 2, 3, and 4.)(有关上帝的概念、心灵和金字塔完形，及相关的问题请参照以下几节：51、81、95、97、115、135、146-149、151、177节，在第二、三、四册。)
There will be a change in 100 years... when you will be able to see more... You will see through a growth of ability and consciousness... an enlargement... that has been growing for 500 years... the change began in the Middle Ages, existed briefly, died, then began again...在100年之内将会有一个改变……到时你们会看见更多……通过能力和意识的增长，你们将会看见更多……一种扩展……已经扩展了500年……这个改变始于中世纪，短暂出现，消亡，然后再开始……
It will involve an expansion of consciousness, not physical knowledge... You will directly and simply perceive more... I cannot make Ruburt find all the words. Your God is part of a larger reality. We see what we can see... This larger reality is also a part of our dreams: it is more important and vital than breath, for you are all part of this individually. There is a give and take between you and the stars on a physical basis, just as there is also a connection between selves and what you call a god.那涉及了一种意识的扩展，不是物质的知识……你会单纯直接的接受到更多……我无法让鲁柏找到所有这些字眼。你们的神是更大实相的一部分。我们看看我们能得到什么……这个更大的实相也是我们梦的一部分：它比呼吸还要重要且不可缺少，因为你们个别的都是这个整体的一部分。在你和物质界的星辰之间有着施与受，就好比在你们自己和你们所谓的神之间也有一种连结。
There is no real division between you and God and I... only a unity that you cannot as yet understand.在你和上帝和我之间并没有实际的分野……只有一种你尚未理解的统一。
(Bill asked Seth what he thought of the direction in which the writings of Father Teilhard de Chardin led, and Seth enthusiastically agreed these writings are valid. Jane, her eyes open, looked at Peggy sitting quietly on the couch.)(比尔问赛斯，他想到了有关查丁神父[Teilhard de Chardin]的文章，赛斯很热切的同意这些文章是合理的。珍，她的眼睛睁开，看向静静坐在沙发上的蓓。)
Our cat lover is so silent.我们的爱猫人士很安静啊。
([Peg:] “I don’t understand enough about it. ")([蓓：]“我对这方面懂得不多。”)
Your finger is a part of your physical organism... It does not know what your brain is doing. Prayer is very important... Your toenail is also a part of you... In the same way we are related to God.你的拇指是你身体组织的一部分……它并不知道你的头脑是怎么运作的。祈祷是非常重要的……你的指甲也是你的一部分……以同样的方式我们和上帝是连结的。
You are part of God in that you are part of the consciousness that is, but you are not apart from a god who looks down on you and speaks... There is indeed as you conceive of it no hell or heaven. These ideas have been distorted through the ages... You could call hell a separation from the main stream of consciousness called God, but this is impossible actually...你是上帝的一部分，因为你是那意识的一部分，你并不有别于一个往下看着你、对你说话的神……当你认为没有所谓的地狱或天堂时，这是真的。这些概念在时代里被扭曲了……你可以把地狱称为和上帝这个主意识分开的地方，但事实上那是不可能的......
(Peggy asked Seth what religion, in his opinion, came closest to God as defined by Seth.)(蓓问赛斯，以他的看法，哪一个宗教最靠近他所定义的上帝。)
I do not want to puncture idealistic balloons. Buddhists are perhaps closer, but no religion comes close really... The man or woman feeling identity with each day that passes comes close.我不想戳破那理想化的气球，也许佛教是比较接近的，但没有任何一个宗教是真的接近的……一个对逝去的每一天感到一体的男人或女人是接近的。
(In the following passages Seth hit his high point as far as feeling and emphasis are concerned. At times his delivery became passionate. I did not get it all down. Jane spoke from her position on the floor; with her eyes closed, her voice strong but not shouting.)(接下来的几段，当赛斯要强调他的感受和重点时，他会提高音量。有时候他的口述变得热切。我并没有把所有的话语都写下来，珍在她坐着的地板上说话，她的眼睛闭着，音量强但不是大吼。)
Sentiment is practical. The idea of birth and death each day is close. Those who cry when they hurt a flea come close... Those who appreciate the consciousness in every rock, tree, bird... come close. Fools and idiots are often wiser than the wise man. Hatred is death. All things are sacred, and every thought is a reality and has its own potential for creation and destruction.情感是实际的。每一天诞生和死亡这样的概念是接近的。那些当他们伤害了一只跳蚤而落泪的人是接近的……那些能感恩在于每一块石头、每一棵树、每一只鸟的意识的人……是接近的。傻瓜和白痴常常比明智的人更有智慧。恨是死亡。所有的东西都是神智的，每一个意念都是一个实相，有着它自己创造和毁灭的可能性。
Experiencing every moment comes close. I myself am not known for humility. Nevertheless my existence is dependent upon many things of which I know not. I learn through many existences, but I do not set myself up as many of you set yourself up, and I do not determine what shall be destroyed or who or what shall remain... Such actions... are based on cowardice... Any idea of a God, no matter how distorted, will triumph, for He exists in everything that you know. And when you kill so much as an ant, so do you kill part of Him in most practical terms.去经验每一个片刻是接近的。我自己并不以谦逊著称。尽管如此，我的存在是依赖着许多我不知道的事物。这是我从很多世里学到的，我不规划我自己，就好像你们很多人规划你们自己那样，我并不决定什么应该被摧毁，或谁或什么应该被保留……这样的行动……是基于惧怕……任何关于一个神的概念，不管有多扭曲，都是成功的，因为祂存在于你所知道的每件事物中。当你杀死了一只蚂蚁，以最实际的说法，你杀死了一部分的祂。
When you kill in thought, you kill indeed.当你在意念中杀戮，你的确杀戮了。
(End at 11:06. Jane had been well dissociated. Her eyes had remained closed during the last part of this delivery; her voice had strengthened considerably and she had become quite impassioned. She said she “gets embarrassed when Seth talks like that.”)(11:06结束。珍在很好的出离状态。在最后一段口述时，她的眼睛仍闭着；她的音量相当强烈，有时变得很热切。她说“当赛斯这样说话的时候”，她“觉得很窘”。)

SESSION 204 第204节 任何事都不是命中注定(约翰私人课)


NOVEMBER 1, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年11月1日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(No envelope test was held during the session.(这节课没有信封测试。
(The session was witnessed by John Bradley. John is from Williamsport, PA; he is a salesman for Searle Drug and has witnessed quiet a few sessions. He has also been the subject of some of Seth’s material. Jane, incidentally, felt strongly that John would witness the session, so she was not surprised when he visited us unannounced at 8:30 PM. John told us he could stay only until 10 PM. In the meantime he had a little story to tell us.(约翰·布莱德利有参与这节课。约翰是从宾州威廉波特来的；他是塞尔药厂的业务员，来上了好几节课。他也是一些赛斯资料里的主角。珍有强烈的预感约翰今天会来，所以当晚上8点半，他毫无预警地出现时，她并不怎么惊讶。约翰告诉我们他只能待到晚上10点。同时他有一个小故事要告诉我们。
(John spent last week making the rounds of doctors offices in Williamsport. One day while driving about town he felt strongly that he should return home. He felt that mail awaited him, that the letter was from his district manager, and that it concerned a raise for him. Ego-wise, John doubted the whole thing, especially so since he had not been getting along too well with his superior recently.(约翰上周都在拜访威廉波特的诊所。有一天当他快开到镇上的时候，突然有一种强烈的感觉，觉得他应该要回家。他觉得有一封信在等他，那封信是来自他的经理，内容和升职有关。对自我而言，约翰不太相信这整件事，特别是最近他和上司处得不怎么好。
(But he did drive home. As he walked out to his mailbox he felt certain the letter was there. It was; it did confirm that he had been given a raise by the company. The raise was totally unexpected, he told us. John wondered whether Seth would comment upon the experience.(但他还是开车回家了。当他走到邮箱时，很确定信就在那里。它的确在；这封来自公司的信确认了他的升迁。他告诉我们，这个升迁完全是意料之外的。约翰希望赛斯能对这件事发表一下看法。
(See also page 11 of the 200th session for notes on the clairvoyant/telepathic experiment, involving John, that Jane conducted successfully the last time he was in this territory. This concerned John’s business trip to Binghamton, NY. Jane wrote down 13 impressions; and John later confirmed 10 of them.(参照第200节，有关对约翰心电感应实验的笔记，上一次在这个部分，珍表现得很成功。那是关于约翰到纽约宾汉顿的出差。当时珍写下了13个印象；后来约翰确认了其中10个。
(The session was held in our front room, and was free of interruptions or distractions. It was obvious that Jane was in a good mood before the session, and Seth reflected this. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed; her pace was quite fast, her voice definitely stronger and more active than usual. She began speaking actually at 8:58.)(这一节是在我们前面的房间举行的，中间没有被打断或干扰。珍在上课前有着明显的好心情，而赛斯也反映了这一点。珍开始说话时坐着，眼睛闭着；她的速度蛮快的，声音明显地比平常强烈而有活力。她在8:58分开始。)
I bid you all a fond good evening.我祝你们有个愉快的夜晚。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
My particular welcome this evening to our friend Philip. As he knows his experience was indeed legitimate, and he can expect more of them.今晚特别欢迎我们的朋友菲利普。就如他所知道的，他的经验确实是合理的，他可以预期未来会有更多这样的经验。
(Philip is John's entity name.)(菲利普是约翰存有的名字。)
His familiarity with our sessions has made it possible for him to become more aware of the constant communication that exists between the inner and the outer selves.对我们课的熟悉，让他变得更觉察存在于内我和外我之间持续的交流。
I wish this evening that you had your recorder going, since I feel somewhat hampered by the slow pace that is necessary otherwise. All due regards, Joseph, for your limitations.我希望今晚你们有用录音机，因为我感觉多少被必要的慢速度给妨碍了。老实说，约瑟，这是因为你的局限。
Now in the affair of the raise, you picked this up, Philip, first of all telepathically from the mind of your superior. You were also aware of it however clairvoyantly. In your mind’s eye you literally saw the letter and read its contents, though you were not aware of the actual action as it occurred. The original decision however was made somewhat previous to the meeting which you attended, but it was at that time not yet definite. And your behavior at the meeting reinforced your superiors decision, and made it certain.现在，菲利普，在这个升职事件中，你先以心电感应的方式接收到了上司的想法。你也以某种洞察力觉察到这件事。在你的心智之眼，你的确看到了信，也读了它的内容，虽然当真正的行动发生时你并未觉知到。在上一节你去开会前，原本就有这个决定，但当时还未真的确定。而你在会议中的表现强化了上司的决定，这件事就被确定了。
(This is the Binghamton meeting referred to here. John attended it on Tuesday, October 19, and it was while he was engaged in this endeavor that Jane tuned in on his activities. John clashed with his superior at the meeting, and because of his outspoken actions had no thought of getting a raise.)(这里指的是宾汉顿会议。约翰是10月19日星期二去参加的，而当时珍在试着接收他的活动。约翰在会议上和他的上司起了冲突，因为他直率的行动，他根本没想到会被升职。)
It was not however your general behavior that made this difference, but a particular remark which was addressed I believe to the meeting at large; and which was a tip-off to your dissatisfaction, and which in some way was aimed particularly, he believed, at your immediate superior.不过并不是因为你整体的行为造成了这个不同，而我想是在会议时你特别强调的一点；这透露出了你的不满，而以某种方式特别针对了你的直属上司。
Perhaps we can get the specific remark, perhaps not, but if we do we will slip it in.也许我们会得到具体的评论，也许不会，如果得到了，我们再把它加上去。
(“Not too fast.”(“不要太快。”
(Jane was in a good mood and speaking rapidly for Seth. I had been writing practically at top speed since the session began. At break John confirmed that he had made a remark of dissatisfaction to the meeting at large. It concerned expense-account allowances for gas and oil, and John's superior took this as aimed at him personally; the two men clashed on the floor, verbally.)(珍的心情很好，以赛斯说话时速度很快。在课开始时，我已经尽力用最快的速度跟上了。在休息的时候，约翰证实了他在会议里确实充分表达了他的不满。这和汽油开销的额度有关，约翰的上司认为这是在针对他个人；两个人在会议室大吵一架。)
There will still be a connection however with another company, as I mentioned previously. And there is also an affair which will come up shortly, that will take your attention and time.这仍和另一家公司有关，就如我之前所提到的。有一件事情会很快的到来，而那会耗上你的注意力和时间。
(Again, see the 199th session, in which Seth’s information on drug companies in Minneapolis is confirmed by John. John now laughed at Seth/Janes amusing reference to an affair.(再次的，参照第199节，赛斯提到明尼亚波利斯的药厂，约翰也确认过了，看到珍－赛斯谈到这件事时逗趣的表情，约翰笑了。
([John:] “What kind of an affair, Seth?”)([约翰：]“赛斯，是怎样的事情？”)
I indeed anticipated that you would ask.我正期待你会问呢。
I am not here referring in particular to any affair that might prove embarrassing. I am referring to an affair... Give us a moment... of a family nature that has not yet developed, but that will develop shortly.我在这里指的并不是那些可能让你感到难堪的事。我指的是一个事件……等一下……是一个尚未形成的家庭事件，但将会很快的发展。
I believe this has to do with parents rather than with your wife or children, and also that it involves a financial nature. We will see what else we can get through on this.与其说这件事是和你太太和小孩有关，倒不如说是和你父母有关，是财务性质的事件。我们看看还会收到什么。
(Jane now took a pause that lasted a minute. She sat quite still, her eyes closed, her head down.)(珍现在停顿大约一分钟，她坐得很直，眼睛闭着，低着头。)
Give us a moment, and we will play around a bit.等等，我们还会提到。
We have to work this way with our friend Ruburt, though he is indeed improving. In regards to your raise, the number 3 comes up. I am trying to loosen Ruburt up here, for he is always afraid of wrong results, and this hampers me.我们必须和鲁柏以这种方式工作，虽然他的确有进步了。关于你的升职，数字3跳了出来。我现在正试着让鲁柏松绑，他总是害怕答案错误，而这妨碍了我。
We will however do what we can, and explanations can come later.不过我们先做我们能做的，等一下再解释。
(Briefly, Seth now burst out in a loud, deep and humorous voice.)(短暂的，赛斯突然发出一个大又低沉幽默的声音。)
This is a test. Testing, one, two three; if you will indeed forgive my attempts at humor. The number three in regard to the bonus. This is not very clear. 3 or 300. 30 or 300. I want to loosen him. Ruburt, up in regards to you, however, for I intend to indirectly look in on you, with your permission, during some of our sessions.这是一个测试。测试，1，23；如果你不介意我的幽默。数字3和奖金有关。不是很清楚。3或300。30或300。不过关于你的部分，我试图让他，也就是鲁柏松绑，在我们的课程当中，在你的同意之下，我试图拐个弯看进你的内心。
I assume from the earlier conversation that we have your permission.我假设从之前的对话中，已经得到你的同意了。
([John:] “Yes you do.”) Permission, and a very airy attitude indeed. I am however enjoying myself. I will let you all take a break. No one is tired but Joseph, for I have kept him going at a steady rate indeed.([约翰：]“你的确是。”)确实是以一种相当漫不经心的态度同意的。我现在乐在其中。我会让你们所有人都休息一下。除了约瑟，大家都不算累，我会让他保持一种稳定的速度进行。
(Break at 9:15. Jane reported that she had been dissociated as usual for a first break. Her eyes had remained closed. Her voice had been stronger than usual, the pace indeed fast.(9:15休息。珍说她在第一段时出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，声音比平常更大，速度较快。
(John Bradley told us that when Seth mentioned his becoming aware of more inner communications in the future, he felt a twinge of fear. John said one of his favorite expressions has been that he had never wanted to be able to read tomorrow’s paper today. I answered that perhaps John was beginning to change his mind at least subconsciously.(约翰·布莱德利告诉我们，当赛斯提到，在未来他将会对内在的交流更为觉察时，他感到了一阵害怕。用他喜欢的说法是，他不想今天就读着明天的报纸。我回应约翰，也许他的潜意识已经开始改变这种想法了。
(John now delighted Jane by telling her that the figure 30 is the correct one, exactly, concerning his raise—thirty dollars a month.(约翰很高兴地告诉珍，有关于他的升职，数字30是正确的答案，非常精准——一个月30美元。
(John wasn’t sure what financial venture involving parents could mean, although he described a complicated tax and property and business transaction that his father-in-law is involved in at the moment in Bradford, PA. The father-in-law has a great deal of money tied up in the venture and is trying to extricate himself.(约翰并不确定关于父母的财务风险指的是什么，虽然他描述他的岳父此时在宾州布莱福[Bradford, PA. ]牵涉了一件复杂的税务、不动产和生意上的买卖。他的岳父有一大笔资金绑在这个投资上，他也试着要从中挣扎。
(Before the session Jane and I asked John if he would cooperate in some telepathic! clairvoyant experiments like those involving the Gallaghers recently. John would make a good subject, we thought, because he lives some distance away and Seth could tune in practically whenever he pleased.(在这节课前，珍和我问约翰，他是否愿意配合我们做一些心电感应或透视实验，就像最近我们对加拉格夫妇所做的那样。我们认为约翰会是很好的对象，因为他住得离我们有点距离，而如果他愿意，赛斯可以随时对准他做透视测验。
(Jane resumed in the same good voice, with her eyes closed and at a little slower pace, at 9:25. She spoke to John.)(珍以相同清楚的声音在9:25分开始，她的眼睛闭着，速度慢了一点。她对约翰说话。)
I believe you have another appointment.我想你有另一个约会(appointment)。
We could have done fairly well this evening with you were you here, or were you able to remain for the full session. On another occasion we will see more fully what we can do.如果你在的话，我们今晚会做得非常好，或许你可以一整节都留下。在另一节我们可以更完整的看看该怎么做。
The situation to which I referred was not the one regarding your father-in-law, though that will be resolved.我刚指的状况并不是你的岳父，虽然他的事会解决的。
The conversation had to do with policy on the company’s part. But not only generally on a high level, but policy as it filtered down through the hierarchy; and a particular policy, a way of treatment.这个讨论和公司方面的政策有关。公司的政策不只是影响高层，而会往下影响所有的阶层；一个特别的政策 ，一种对待方式。
You see, in a full session dealing with an individual, I can interweave material. Ruburt cannot follow me then and he cannot block me then. He does not indeed block me on purpose, but the results would be the same.你看，用一整节课处理一个对象，我仍可以穿插资料。鲁柏跟不上我，也阻挡不了我。他并不是有意阻挡我，但结果是一样的。
The situation however in the family does involve your own parents. I would say specifically your mother. The conversation of which you are thinking is the one to which I refer concerning the raise.关于这个家庭情况涉及的是你自己的父母。我特别指你母亲。你现在想到的正是我所提关于升职的谈话。
There will be others if you remain with the company, for much of your superior’s income is dependent upon your own, and he has only at the most two other salesman in his territory which are lucrative for him. One is a short man, already beginning to bald. And your superior himself worries about his own position.如果你仍留在这个公司，还会有其他的升迁，因为你上司的薪水大部分要依赖你们，他手下只有两个人对他是比较有用的。一个是那个较矮的男人，已经开始秃顶了。你的上司自己也在担心他的位置。
This is a general-enough statement, but at the last meeting he had cause to wonder about it even more.这是一个很平常的表达，但在上次会议中，这导致他想得更多。
(Jane now took a long pause, sitting quietly with her eyes closed. Her pace was now, again, quite fast.(珍现在停得比较长，她闭上眼睛安静地坐着。她的速度再次的变得十分快。
(To avoid too many notes at break, I can add some comments as the session progresses. At next break, John confirmed Seth's statement that his superior was worried about his job. John also agreed with Seth that only two other salesman are selling well in the division. The short man who is already beginning to bald, John knows as Bill Driscoll; John told us he is a very good salesman and the only one in the division fitting that description. Driscoll is not old, John said, merely balding prematurely.(为了避免在休息中还要写太多笔记，我在课程进行中就加上了一些评论。在下一段休息时，约翰证实了赛斯的说法，他的上司的确在担心他的工作。约翰也同意赛斯说的，在他的部门只在两个销售员销售得好。矮小且已经开始秃顶的男人，约翰说是比尔·崔斯寇[Bill Driscoll]；约翰告诉我们，他是一个非常好的业务员，而且是部门里唯一符合赛斯描述的人。约翰·崔斯寇并不老，只是过早秃顶。
(As stated before, the floor clash between John and his superior involved expense accounts. John agreed that this was high-level company policy that filtered down to the local level.)(之前说过，约翰和他上司在会议中的争吵是关于津贴。约翰同意这是一个高阶层的公司政策，而且会影响到一般的阶层。)
The family situation is not immediate, this week for example, but it is developing.这个家庭的情况并不紧急，比如说它并不是在一周内发生，但是正在酝酿。
I told you that you would have other telepathic or clairvoyant experiences. I did not say however that you would be able to read tomorrows headlines today, so you need have no such fears. Your ego is a sufficiently well-developed one so that you need not worry but that it will set up acceptable blockages, and shield you.我告诉过你，你将会有其他的心电感应或透视经验。不过我说的并不是你会在今天就读到明天报纸上的头条，所以不需要这么害怕。你的自我发展得很好，它会设下可接受的屏障来保护你，所以你不需要担心。
Does that make you feel better?这样说有让你感觉好一点了吗？
(Seth delivered this material in a very amused manner. John laughed.(赛斯以一种逗趣的方式传述这段资料。约翰笑了。
([John:] “It's my turn to catch it tonight. "([约翰：]“今晚换我来感应一下。”
(Janes voice boomed out briefly.)(珍短暂地提高音量。)
When your turn comes you will know it, and tonight is not the night.当你时候到了就会知道，今晚还不是时候。
When you intend to leave in the middle of a session, there is hardly time for me to light into you adequately, or to answer the questions that I think we could answer. I am not harsh with you. Indeed, I have been harsh with no one, though I have been tempted at times. And I am always hampered both by time and because of mechanical difficulties, and because we must be so still and silent.当你打算中途离席，我还没有足够的时间感应或回答我认为我们可以回答的问题。我并不是对你严苛。事实上我从没有对任何人严苛，虽然我有时真的很想。我总是会被时间和技术上的困难阻碍，因为我们必须如此的稳定和安静。
([John:] “I have a question. A month ago, when I was talking to a female, a voice definitely said to me: “No, no. ” What's the significance of that?")([约翰：]“我有一个问题，一个月前，当我打算和一位女性说话的时候，一个声音很明确地告诉我：“不，不要。”那代表什么意义？”)
The voice was a male voice, was it not?那是一个男性的声音，是吗？
([John:] “I believe so.”)([约翰：]“我相信是。”)
And you did not recognize it.而你不认得这个声音。
([John:] "No. ’’([约翰：]“不认得”。
(Seth/Jane, smiling, eyes closed:)(赛斯/珍，微笑，闭着眼睛:)
Then I shall not tell you. I shall not indeed.那么我不应该告诉你。我确实不应该。
([John:] “Was it your voice? It happened so suddenly I didn’t have time to think. It was very unexpected.”)([约翰：]“那是你的声音吗？发生得太快了，我没有时间好好的去想。那非常的出乎意料。”)
You see you put me, as you very well know, in a strange position. For if I say it was my voice, then I was where I was not invited to be.你很清楚，你把我放进了一个奇怪的位置。如果我说那是我的声音，那就表示我出现在我没被邀请的地方。
([John:] “It was in a public place, and it was perfectly all right for you to be there.”)([约翰：]“那是一个公共场所，你出现在那里毫无问题。”)
Well, I try to be gentlemanly. While I do not try to tune in indiscriminately with those with whom I am acquainted, nevertheless my range is wide, and at times I pick up information, and I am projected to places. And so it was, and it was my voice.好吧，我只是想表现得有绅士风度一点。我并不随意的去感应那些熟人，不管我的范围有多广，有时候我收到讯息，然后我会投射到一些地方。所以当时是这种情形，那的确是我的声音。
But then, Ruburt has heard my voice and did not recognize it. For I do not speak like this under normal circumstances. I did not mean to intrude.当时，鲁柏听到了我的声音但认不出来。因为在正常的情况下，我不会这样说话。我并无意干扰。
I suggest you take a break for the sake of Joseph’s fingers. If you have time we shall explain this evening. If not we shall explain another time.为了约瑟的手指，我建议你们休息。如果你有时间，今晚我们会再解释。如果没时间那就下次再说。
(Break at 9:43. Jane was dissociated as usual, she said. Her eyes had remained closed as far as I had noticed. Her voice had been good, her pace very fast toward the end of the delivery.(9:43分休息，珍出离如常。就我注意到的，珍的眼睛仍然闭着。她的音量平稳，速度在口述最后变得非常快。
(John had to leave to make a telephone call regarding business. He had decided to see if he could postpone his business appointment until tomorrow. Before he left however, he described to Jane and me a plan that he had broached to his brothers and sisters, concerning the care of his invalid mother in Philadelphia. John said this could be the family situation that is developing, and that Seth referred to.(约翰离席打了一通生意上的电话；他决定试看看能否把生意上的约会延后到明天。在他离席前，告诉珍和我，他打算和兄弟姐妹讨论如何照顾他们在费城久病衰弱的母亲。约翰说这可能是赛斯所指的一个正在酝酿的家庭状况。
(I might mention here a situation that John, Jane and I, and Bill Gallagher have long been aware of. This is the fact that John, Jane and Bill all have mothers who were, or are, bedridden with arthritis. Bill’s mother has died. Quite a while ago Seth remarked that this fact is one of the reasons John and Bill were drawn to the sessions; but he has not elaborated.(我在这里应该提一下，约翰、珍和我、以及比尔·加拉格都很熟悉这种情况。事实上，约翰、珍和比尔都有一个因为关节炎久卧病榻的母亲。比尔的母亲过世了。不久前赛斯曾提到，这是其中一个约翰和比尔会被吸引课堂的理由；但他没有详加说明。
(John was still talking when Jane spoke up as Seth abruptly at 9:55. She was sitting down; she looked directly at John, her eyes wide open and very dark. Her voice was deep.)(当珍在9:55分突然以赛斯的身分说话时，约翰仍在打电话。她坐着；她直接望向约翰，眼睛睁开，眼神深邃。她的声音低沉。)
My friend, you had better leave now. And if you can return by eleven, then do so.我的朋友，你最好现在离开。如果你能在11点前回来，就这么做做吧。
([John:] “Okay, Seth. ’’([约翰：]“好的，赛斯。”
(John had his hat and coat on, and left at 9:56. Jane said Seth was extremely well tuned in on John tonight; she hoped that he would be able to return this evening while things were going so well. Jane also said she felt that Seth had more information on John’s mother, but that she had blocked it.(约翰拿起他的帽子和外套，在9:56分离开。珍说赛斯今晚把感应约翰这件事做得很好；事情进行得这么顺利，她希望他今晚能回来上课。珍也说她感觉到，赛斯对约翰的母亲有更多的讯息要说，但是被她阻挡了。
(John hadn’t mentioned the episode about hearing the voice in the bar to us previously, and at break Jane and I asked him to say no more about it to us; we hoped to see if Seth could say more about the circumstances instead, should John make it back to the session.(约翰之前并没有向我们提到在酒吧听到声音的这个插曲，在休息的时候，珍和我希望他不要对这件事说得更多；如果约翰可以回来上课的话，我们希望赛斯能代替他对这件事解释一下。
(John did tell us the event happened about a month ago. This places it in time a couple of weeks before we saw John last time, during the Binghamton meeting affair. But then John hadn’t witnessed a session, and the voice episode had slipped his mind, two weeks ago. John heard the voice in a dancing establishment called The Elms, in Elmira Efeights, which is a small town adjacent to Elmira. Jane and I have been there once, many months ago.(约翰告诉我们，这件事大约发生在一个月前。这是在我们上次看到约翰的几周前，在宾汉顿的会议期间。后来约翰没有来上课，所以就把两周前这件有关听到声音的插曲给忘了。约翰是在靠近埃尔迈拉的一个小镇，埃尔迈拉高地，那里有一个叫“埃尔迈”[The Elms, in Elmira Efeights]的跳舞场所里听到声音的。珍和我几个月前曾到过那儿一次。
(As far as we know, this is the first overt experience we have encountered where Seth has spoken to another party while separated, in our time and distance, from Jane. It raises many questions if it is a legitimate experience; if legitimate, it would seem to be a most significant development. We are well aware that it could be said Seth was merely taking credit for another persons psychic experience.(就我们所知，这是我们第一次遇到的经验，赛斯，在我们的时间，隔着一段距离下，不透过珍向另外一个人说话。这提出了很多问题，包括这是否是一次合理的经验；如果是合理的，这似乎是一个最重大的发展。我们都很清楚地知道，这可以说另一个人的心灵经验是源自于赛斯。
(If genuine, does this experience imply an expansion of Jane's abilities, along with Seth's, or does it merely mean that once others accept the possibility of psychic expansion, they too become receivers? This would imply the separate existence of Seth; he has claimed all along to be an “energy personality essence. ’’(如果是真的，这个经历是否暗示了，珍的能力伴随着赛斯的能力也扩展了，或是那仅意味着当其他人接受了心灵扩展的可能性后，也能成为接收者？这可能暗含了赛斯的独立存在；他称自己是一个“能量人格元素”。
(This thought comes to me: Quite a few sessions ago Seth remarked that an event would occur which would bind John, Jane and I together. I searched briefly for the remark but did not locate it.(我冒出一个想法，前几节课赛斯曾提到一件事会发生，那件事会把约翰、珍和我绑在一起。我想了一下，并没有想到是什么事。
(It was now time for the 13th Dr. Instream clairvoyant test. Jane resumed speaking with her eyes closed and while sitting down. Her voice was good; her pace was much faster while giving this material than in any of the previous sessions. She used but a very few brief pauses. Resume at 10:01.)(现在是时候开始第13次殷斯翠姆博士的透视测验。珍坐着开始说话，眼睛闭着。音量适中；她的速度较前几节给这些资料时更快。她有几个很短暂的停顿。10:01分重新开始。)
Now please give us a moment. (Pause.)现在等我们一下。(停顿)
Our friend Dr. Instream is thinking about a book. It is from his bookcase, or it has been on his bookcase.我们的朋友殷斯翠姆博士正想着一本书。这书在他的书架上，或曾经在他的书架上。
I see a page number, 373 I believe, and a passage brings to mind hooded figures. Connotations of the Middle Ages, and of a female with a headdress that is pointed, and then a veil. I do not know, perhaps a connection here with the heroine of an opera, or medieval novel. And still speaking of the passage, a room of medieval surroundings such as a castle. These are impressions connected with the page. (Pause.)我看到了页码，我想是375，有一段让我想到戴头巾的人。中世纪的含义，有一个戴着尖顶帽子的女人，还有面纱。我不太清楚，也许和一个歌剧的女主角，或是中世纪的小说有关。同一节提到一间像是中世纪背景的房间，像一个城堡。这些是对这页的印象。(停顿)
Again a candle, but a tall one, and a floor with many designs, as of diamond shapes. I am sorry Joseph that the recorder is not going, as I feel restrained and could speak more quickly.再次地，一支蜡烛，但却是一支很高的蜡烛，一个有复杂图案的地板，形状是菱形。约瑟，我很遗憾录音机不能用，我可以讲得更快，我觉得被局限住了。
Perhaps this is a scene from the novel or an opera, for now there are two very tall candles, with golden holders and many shadows. (Pause.) And the entrance of a male character. Perhaps a deathbed scene, but I do not hear music, and it would seem that music would be connected with an opera. But the scene is macabre.也许这是从一本小说或歌剧里来的场景，有两支非常高的蜡烛，有着金色的支架和很多阴影。(停顿)一个男性角色的登场。也许是弥留的场景，但我没有听到音乐，歌剧似乎都会和音乐连在一起。但这场景是和死亡有关联。
Is he perhaps at a play, or theater production? (Pause.)也许他在剧中演某个角色，或他是剧场制作人？(停顿)
The hypnosis experiments have not been productive these last few days for Dr. Instream, though they may have seemed so. Again a snag develops, which may or may not yet appear to him. There is something that holds him back, that he knows but does not realize that he knows.在过去几天，殷斯翠姆博士的催眠实验并不顺利，虽然看起来可能不是这样。再一次一个阻碍正在发生，也许对他而言并不明显。有某种东西阻碍了他，他知道，但却不明白他知道了。
(Jane had been speaking as rapidly as I could write. She still sat with her eyes closed, her hands raised to her face. Her voice was average in volume.)(珍说话的速度很快，我几乎来不及写。她仍坐着，眼睛闭着，手举到脸上。她的音量适中。)
Now, separately, I sense a framework, as of a house that is not yet fully constructed. It may have to do with a young relative of his (pause), or close friend, or someone connected with him. The house is on a hill. The framework is there but it is open, with the walls not yet constructed completely. (Pause.)现在，我另外感觉到一个还没有完全盖好的房子结构。这可能和他一个年轻的亲戚有关，(停顿)或很亲近的朋友，或某个和他有关的人。房子在山上。它的结构在那里，但是露天的，墙还没有完全盖好。(停顿)
They suggest matchsticks. I sense a turnabout for him. (Pause.) An intermission now, I sense. He speaks with many people. (Pause at 10:11.)他们感觉像是火柴棒。我感受到他的一个转变。(停顿)我感应到现在是中场休息时间。他在和很多人讲话。(10:11停顿。)
I think his Dr. Snygg has two daughters.我想史奈博士(Dr. Snygg)有两个女儿。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:12. Jane reported that she was very well dissociated—far-out, as she puts it. Her eyes had remained closed. She was aware that she had given much material on Dr. Instream, comparatively speaking, in a short time.(10:12休息。珍说她在很好的出离状态，她用的字眼——很深远。她的眼睛仍闭着。她知道相对上来说，她在很短的时间内给了许多殷斯翠姆博士的资料。
(As break arrived we heard John Bradley returning up the stairs. He had succeeded in postponing his business appointment until tomorrow. We asked him to say no more about his voice experience yet, to see what else Seth could pick up on it. Instead the conversation turned to the fact that last week Jane was offered a part time job as a dancer in a local supper club. Both of us like to dance, and Jane is an expert dancer. Now during break we amused ourselves discussing some of the humorous aspects of such a potential situation.(在休息的时候，我们听到约翰•布莱德利上楼的声音。他成功地把商业会议延到了明天。我们要求他不要说关于他听到声音的经验，看看赛斯另外可以讲些什么。然后话题转到上周珍得到了一个兼职工作，是在本地的晚餐俱乐部当舞者。我们两都很爱跳舞，珍是个跳舞达人。在休息的时候，我们聊起这些可能性情况好玩的一面，大家都觉得很有趣。
(Jane resumed at a good pace, her voice average, her eyes closed, at 10:26.)(10:26分珍以一种良好的速度开始，她的音量适中，眼睛闭着。)
I do indeed find the conversation very interesting. As you know I make no attempt to regulate Ruburts activities, and I should find it highly hilarious to find him in such a position, or positions. We will leave the matter there, with one addition: I do not approve personally. This does not mean however that I would go so far as to caution him against it.我真的觉得这个讨论很有趣。如你们所知，我无意管束鲁柏的行动，当我发现他面临这种情形时，我应该会觉得很有趣。我们先放下这件事，另外追加一点：我个人并不赞同。但那并不意味着我会警告他远离。
I spoke as I did when I did, Philip, because of what the woman had in mind, which did not specifically enter your conversation. She did not make her ideas plain in words.当我想说的时候，我会以我的方式说，菲利普，因为这个女人心里所打算的，并没有在你们的对话之中显露出来。
I did not like the implications of her background. I am not speaking of a social background, as you should know. I am speaking of a psychic background and environment that were, and are, unhealthy and detrimental, and with which you should not become involved. I am speaking of a psychic environment only, and of a home situation on her part which has deeply colored her activities, and which regulates her relationships.我不喜欢她的背景可能带来的影响。你应该知道，我说的不是社会背景。我说的是一种不健康的、有害的心灵背景或环境，你不应该牵涉其中。我说的仅仅是心灵环境，至于她的家庭状况，也深深地影响了她的行为和宰制了她的社交关系。
For she is grasping in a way that is gluttonous and disastrous for those with whom she comes in contact. There is a reaching out, but a reaching out which is not for the good. Again, I am not speaking in terms of any kind of morality as it is socially understood. I am speaking of emotional health, and of demands.她会用一种贪婪和灾难性的方式抓住她想靠近的人。这里有一种需索，但又不是一种好的需索。再一次，我并不是以一种社会所理解的道德标准说这件事，我说的是情感上的健康还有需求。
There is a child in the background here also, and many situations which mold the child.在这个背景下也牵涉到一个孩子，很多情况会塑造这个孩子。
My comments made you wonder, as they were meant to. There is also a man in the background here, involved with the woman, and a legal paper.我的解释可能会让你惊讶，本就该如此。这样的背景下也有一个男人，和这个女人有法律纠纷。
When I spoke you listened. You did not say something that you would have said otherwise.当我说的时候你听见了。所以那时你并没有说你可能会说的话。
(Jane now took a pause that lasted at least one minute.)(珍现在停顿了至少一分钟。)
It would appear that all bars are long and narrow. There was a particular decoration however at the center of the bar. Ruburt now thinks of his Green Pastures, but this is his idea not mine. We will mention it in passing. It clears the air.似乎所有的酒吧都是狭长型的。在酒吧中心有一个特别的装饰。鲁柏现在想到他的“绿色牧场”(Green Pastures)，但这是他的想法而不是我的。当发生的时候我们会再提。这不会有混淆。
(The Green Pastures is the name of another bar in town. Jane and I have been there a few times, but not recently. As stated earlier, Jane and I visited The Elms, the scene of John’s adventure, once some months ago. We did not enter the bar however, but stayed in the dancing room of the establishment; thus we have no knowledge of the bar, what decorations it might have had, etc.(“绿色牧场”是镇上另一间酒吧的名字。珍和我去过几次，但不是最近。之前提到的，珍和我几个月前曾去过“埃尔迈”，就是约翰发生奇遇的地方。我们并没有进入酒吧区，只待在跳舞的地方；所以我们不清楚酒吧的装潢是什么样子。
(At break John confirmed that there was a child in the womans background, and a legal paper. He heard both mentioned in a general way during his conversation with the woman, and cannot recall more details at the moment. He had not told us this consciously. John said another man was with the woman when he talked to her, and that actually he spent as much time talking with her male companion as he did the woman. John was unable to say whether, in his opinion, the male companion is the man referred to by Seth. John had not told us before this that the woman had had a male companion.(休息的时候，约翰确认了这女人的背景资料里有一个孩子，还涉及了法律纠纷。在和这女人的对话中他听到过，但记不起更多的细节。他并不是有意识地告诉我们这个。约翰说当他和这个女人说话时，有另一个男人陪在他身边，事实上，他与这个男性同伴说话的时间和这个女人说话的时间一样长。约翰不确定这个男性同伴是不是赛斯提的那个男人。约翰之前并没有告诉过我们这个女人有个男性同伴。
(John said the conversation he was involved in was innocuous enough, at least on the surface, but that when he head the voice speak to him within he became more cautious. He has not seen the woman or been to The Elms since.)(约翰说他们当时的对话是无伤大雅的，至少表面上是，但当他听到那声音对他说的话之后，他变得更小心。后来他再没有去过“埃尔迈”，也再没有见过这个女人。)
We will say no more concerning the family situation for several reasons, which you shall undoubtedly know in good time. The sister of which you spoke is indeed involved, but not in the precise manner in which you imagine.我们没有对所谓家庭状况说得更多有几个理由，适当的时机你就会知道了。你提到的姊妹确实牵涉其中，但不全然是以你所想像的那种方式。
You have been coming to sessions off and on now for some time, and I appreciate your interest, and we shall do what we can for you; and we have made headway on Ruburt’s part.你来来去去我们的课已经有一段时间了，我感谢你对这些课的兴趣，我们看看能为你做些什么；在鲁柏的部分我们也进步了。
I will suggest a short break and we shall continue. How can you want to know the future so badly, and be so afraid of knowing it at the same time?我建议一个短暂的休息，然后我们再接着继续。
([John:] “Curiosity, I guess, and then knowing I will be following a certain course— )缺
This is not the case, for your own expectations are the actions which mold what you call the future, and it is never static and never definite; for you can change it at any moment, as any action changes any other action. You are always free to act, but every action changes that which is acted upon, and you constantly change your so-called future; and the events that I see may indeed be changed at any time.缺
(“Not too fast.”(“不要太快。”
(Once again Seth was racing along, as far as my writing speed was concerned. Jane's eyes had, I believe, opened briefly a few times; her face was turning more toward John much of the time here. She gave no notice that she heard me.)(以我的手写速度来看，赛斯又在竞走了。我想珍的眼睛有几次短暂的睁开；大部分的时间她的脸都朝着约翰。她没显现出有听到我的声音。)
We shall go into this, for it affects you deeply, and it worries you deeply.我们应该深入这件事，因为它深深地影响你，也让你很担心。
I do however suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:43. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had been closed for the most part, her voice had been good, her pace fast.(10:43休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛大部分时间都是闭着的，音量适中，速度快。
(John thought he agreed with Seth’s statements on free will. He said he has been concerned for some years with the conflict between the idea of predestination and free will, theologically speaking, and believes his questions stem from his early school days.(约翰认为他认同赛斯所说的自由意志。他说他关注这个有关于宿命论和自由意志的议题已经有几年了，理论上来说，他相信这个问题源自于他早期的求学生涯。
(Reiterating, John told us the talk he engaged in with the woman and her male companion at The Elms, about a month ago, seemed innocent enough on the surface. The two warning words he heard so clearly within, “No, no, ” had no direct bearing on the conversation of the moment, he said; yet they were so definite, so emphatic and even urgent, that he paid heed to them. The adjectives are John’s.(再重申一次，约翰告诉我们，大约一个月前他和这个女人和她的男性同伴在“埃尔迈”说话的时候，他们的对话从表面上来看是无伤大雅的。她说这两句警告“不，不要”，他听得很清楚，这对当时的对话并没有直接的影响。但是这声音是那么的明确、有力，甚至急切，所以他听从了。这是约翰的形容。
(John was now considering trying to locate the woman, to check up on Seth. He was joking, yet perhaps serious also. He was curious however, and was talking about whether he should really make the attempt when Jane resumed in a good voice, and with her eyes closed at 10:50.)(约翰现在考虑找出这个女人，和赛斯所说的核对一下。他在开玩笑，也许也有点认真。他很好奇，当他提到他是否该试着这么做时，珍以一种清楚的声音开始了，她的眼睛闭着，在10:50继续。)
—like a child who is about to be burned.——就像一个将要被烧死的小孩。
([John, laughing:] “Correct, Seth.")([约翰笑了：]“你说的对，赛斯”)
There was indeed an unhealthy effect that came from the womans personality, and you my friend were in immediate danger.这个女人的性格确实有着不健全的部分，当时你，我的朋友，是处在一个立即的危险之下的。
In some way she saw you as a solution to problems, and could have latched upon you had your interest at that point shown itself in any fashion whatsoever.在某些方面她视你为问题的解决之道，如果你以任何方式表现出你对她的兴趣，她有可能会拴住你。
There is a house, not in the western section of town, the third or fourth house in the middle of a block, in which she dwells. She would have used you quite unconsciously. But in many ways she is very strong, and you would have been driven to return. My words were a warning, and I do not warn without reason, and I do not cry wolf.她住的那栋房子，不在小镇的西边，是在中间那条街数来第三或第四栋。她可能是无意识地想利用你。但在很多方面她是很强壮的，你可能会被载回家。我的话是个警告，但我不会无来由的警告，我不会大喊狼来了。
(Jane paused.)(珍停顿。)
I am unsure here. I believe she was a Catholic, and that to some extent this had something to do with her own difficulties.这里我不确定。我相信她是个天主教徒，某个程度她的困难和这有关。
(John told us at break that he wasn’t sure either, but that he thought the woman was a Catholic.)(约翰在休息时告诉我们，他认为这个女人是个天主教徒，但是他也不确定。)
The situation of which I spoke concerning the family may occur in February, perhaps the beginning of the month, perhaps the second.我所提到关于家庭的情况可能在二月发生，也许在月初，也许在月中。
Now, when you speak of free will you automatically think in terms of your own time sequence, for you are caught within it. Those who are not within it can see past, present and future, and the interchange of action.现在，当你说到自由意志的时候，你自动以你身在其中的时间顺序来思考。那些不在其中的人却可以看到过去、现在和未来，以及行动之间的那些互换。
Let us suppose that you are watching a movie production.让我们假设你正在看一部电影。
You have nothing to do with making the movie, nothing to do with the plot or the characters, yet you can see the ending, and from the action you know what the developments will bring. You in no way affected the developments within the action; nor were they predestined, but worked out by the characters involved.你和电影的制作无关，和剧本及角色也无关，但你可以看到结局，从一个行动你可以看到后续的发展。你无法影响这个行动之后的进展；它们也不是命定的，而只是随着其中的角色而发展。
You are merely apart from them, and able to switch backward or forward as you wish. Now we are speaking of a planned movie, with a plot. Now however consider another analogy, where action envelopes and changes within a different dimension. I can look in on it and see its progress, but the action develops as it will, and is free.你只是和这些分开，如果你想，可以往前转或往后转，我们现在说的是有剧本、有剧情的电影。现在想想另一种比喻，当行动在一个不同的维度里覆盖且改变，我可以看进行动且看到它的发展，但是这个行动却如它本然的发展，是自由的。
One dream can change the development of a personality, and change his physical course. To those of us not within your system, we can turn into that dream, pick it up in other words. But the dream is not predestined, and the dream develops because of the personality involved.一个梦可以改变一个人格的发展，及改变他人生的方向，对我们这些不存在你们系统的人，可以神入这些梦，以另一种方式感受它。但是梦并不是注定的，它会因为做梦者的不同而有不同的发展。
(Seth’s remark above, “turn into that dream", involves the fourth inner sense: the Conceptual Sense. He discussed this to some extent in the 37th and 38th sessions. See Volume 1: “The fourth inner sense involves cognition of a concept in much more than your usual intellectual terms. It involves experiencing a concept completely, to the extent of being a concept completely. You do not leave what you call yourself behind; you merely change what you are into a different pattern. Concepts have what we call electrical and chemical composition. The molecules and ions of the consciousness change into the concept, which is thereby directly experienced. You cannot truly understand or appreciate any other thing unless you can become that thing. You can best achieve some approximation of an idea by using psychological time...”)(赛斯上面所提到的“神人这件事”，涉及了第四个内在感官；观念感官。他在第37节和38节有讨论一些。见第一册：“第四种内在感官涉及了比你们一般知性的方式更多观念的感知。它涉及了去完成的经验这个观念，到某种程度完全变成了这个观念本身。你并没有把你所谓的自己丢下；只是以另一种方式改变你本身。观念有着我们称为电性和化学的组成。意识的分子和离子变成了观念，然后借此直接的经验。你不可能真正的明白或了解这些东西，除非你变成它们。你可以达到最接近这个想法的，是利用心理时间……”)
You have more free will than you imagine, for you have not only your present personality with which to work.你比你所想像的更具有自由意志，你并不只是你现在正在运作的人格。
Do I go too swiftly, Joseph?约瑟，我速度太快了吗？
(“A little bit.”)(“有一点。”)
But you have on a subconscious level all the knowledge and experience of your previous selves upon which to build. Your dreams are free from the restrictions imposed by your ego, and your dreams affect your daily life much more than you know. For situations appear in them that affect your actions, and these are elements from your own previous selves. This is a large subject; but though I can tell you some things about your future, the future is not predestined, and subconsciously you are well aware yourself of what will happen, and all human beings are.但你在潜意识的层面，有着之前的自己们所建立起来的所有知识和经验。你的梦是自由的，不受你的自我强加的限制，而你的梦远比你所知道的更影响你的日常生活。在梦里出现的情况会影响你的行动，而这些是来自于你之前自己们的因素。这是一个很广大的主题；虽然我可以告诉你某些关于你未来的事，但这个未来并不是注定的，潜意识里你很清楚的觉知到自己将会发生什么，而所有的人类都是这样的。
It is only the ego which seems to make such questions important, because of the restrictions of its nature.只有自我才会觉得这样的问题很重要，这是因为它天性的限制。
I will here suggest a break again, out of deference to our Joseph’s diligence; and if you have any questions, Philip, I will do my best to answer them. And if you resented my intrusion, I am indeed regretful.出于对约瑟勤奋的尊重，我再次的建议你们休息；菲利普，如果你有其他任何问题，我会尽全力回答。如果你对我的干扰感到生气，我真的觉得很抱歉。
([John:] "Absolutely not. ’’([约翰：]“绝对不会。”
(Break at 11:07. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed for the most part. Her voice had been good, her pace quite fast. Surprisingly enough, in spite of all my writing my hand felt little fatigue.(11:07分休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛大部分时间是闭着的。她的音量适中，速度很快。我有点惊讶的是，虽然写了那么多，我的手只觉得有一点累。
(John now told us that he knew the name of the woman in question, but did not give it to us; we requested that he wait on this.(约翰现在告诉我们，他知道上述提到的这个女人的名字，但并没有让我们知道；我们要求他再等等。
(The Elms is actually in Elmira Heights, which is like a suburb of Elmira to the northeast. We were discussing Seth’s location of the womans house as he gave it on page 47, when Jane came through as Seth, briefly at 11:18.)(“埃尔迈”事实上在埃尔迈拉高地，位于埃尔迈拉东北方的郊外。我们现在正讨论赛斯提到的这个女人房子的位置，当赛斯短暂的从珍的身上透过来时，时间是11:18。)
The house is in the northeastern section, but to the west of the location in which you met the woman.这个房子位于东北部，但是在你遇到这个女人地点的西边。
(Break again at 11:19. The above information is correct, as John Bradley verified the day after this session. John occasionally has free time between his visits to doctor’s offices, and on November 2 he used some of it to check up on Seth, and give us the information. Without seeing the woman in question again, he located her house. He did not tell us how he did this, or give us the name of the street on which she lives. He drew a map of the location of the house in relation to The Elms, however; a copy of the map is included at the end of this session, and it can be seen that the house is in the northeastern section of Elmira Heights, as well as also being northeast of Elmira, and is west of the location of The Elms.(11:19再次休息。上述的信息是正确的。约翰在课后的那天确认了。约翰偶尔在拜访医生办公室的空档会有一些自由时间，在11月2日，他用了一些时间去核对赛斯所说的话，然后告诉我们这个消息。他找到她的房子，但并没有再见这个女人。他并没有告诉我们他是怎么做到的，或给我们她住的街名。不过他仍然画了一张关于这房子的地点相对于“埃尔迈”的地图，这张地图的副本附在这节的最后，可以看到那房子位于埃尔迈拉高地的东北部，同时也在埃尔迈拉的东北部，却是位于“埃尔迈”的西边。
(Jane resumed, with her eyes shut and in a good voice, at 11:22.)(11:22分，珍重新开始，她的眼睛闭着，声音平稳。)
She would have used you as a buffer between herself and another male, and as a bargaining point. I was referring to her subconscious energies when I spoke of force. I was not referring to the personality which she exhibits. She would have exaggerated the slightest interest you showed in her, and an unpleasant situation would have resulted; an unfortunate one involving yourself and the other male to whom I referred. Therefore I spoke out.他想利用你作为她和另一个男人之间的缓冲器，以此作为讨价还价的目的。当我讲到力量的时候，我指的是她潜意识的能量。我并不是指她展现出来的个性。她把你对她所展现的一点点兴趣给夸大了，这很可能会造成一个不太好的结果；一个对你和对我所提到的男性都很不幸的结果。所以我出声了。
Again, you see, you did not have to hear me, and you did not have to listen. But because you heard me and because you listened, the probable future was changed.你知道，再一次的，你不一定会听到我的声音，而你也不需要听从我的建议。但因为你听到，而且听从了，而这个可能的未来就被改变了。
It is possible, Joseph, that there could be this evening a change in Ruburts features, and we shall let this go at that, for we know him too well to say more.今晚鲁柏的容貌会有一点改变，约瑟，那是可能的。我们应该顺其自然，我们太了解他了，所以无须多说什么。
(Both John and I had been watching Jane as usual as she spoke; neither of us observed any unusual feature changes in her throughout the session.)(约翰和我在珍说话时像平常一样的看着她，但我们整节课都没有观察到她的容貌有什么不同的改变。)
Now the man involved has something to do with mechanics. I am not sure of the age. Between, I should say, 27 and 37, though this is not precise, I know. I have the feeling she may be older.现在和她有关的这个男人做着类似机械工的工作。我不确定年纪。我会说大约在27至37之间，虽然我知道这不精确。我感觉她的年龄可能比较大。
(John told us later that the male companion with the woman was a car salesman; hence Jane's possible associative connection with mechanics. Still, as said before, we do not know for sure whether the womans male companion of that evening is the male referred to by Seth.(约翰后来告诉我们，这个女人的男伴是一个汽车销售员；因此珍才有可能会连结到机械工。就像之前说的，我们并不确定那晚这个女人身边的男伴是否是赛斯指的那个男人。
