(John also told us later that he felt the woman herself was the one who was 27; certainly not over 30, in his opinion. Her male companion was older, John said, but he did not know by how much.(约翰后来还告诉我们，这个女人应该是27岁；以他的看法，不会超过30岁。约翰说她的男伴年龄比较大，但他说他不清楚大多少。
(Note by John Bradley, June 8,1966: “Companion at bar with woman was a car salesman and about 24. 26 years old. He is not the man involved with the woman. This man is 38. 39years old.”)(约翰在1966年6月8日的笔记上写着：“在酒吧里这个女人的同伴是个销售员，大约24至26岁。他不是和这个女人有关的那个男人。那男人大概38或39岁。”)
Now, Philip. Indeed when I speak of the future I do see possibilities, and speak in terms of trends of activities that may change. This is why, often, our specific dates do not materialize as given, or why events foreseen do not occur as given. For at no time are any events predestined. There should be no such word in your vocabulary, for with every moment you change, and every heartbeat is an action, and every action changes every other action.现在，菲利普。当我提到未来的时候，我的确看到了可能性，以一种可能改变的活动趋势来说。这也是为什么常常我们所提到的特定未来并没有实现，或预知的事件并没有发生的原因。因为从来没有任何事是注定的。在你们的字条里应该没有这样的字眼，在每一个你改变的瞬间，每一次心跳是一个行动，而每一个行动会改变另一个行动。
I am able to look from a different perspective, but still I see only possibilities. And on that particular evening I saw a possibility that was not attractive. You and I changed that possibility, and what I foresaw therefore will not come to pass; and your own action in allowing yourself to hear me speak helped change that action.我可以从另一个观点来看，但我仍只能看到可能性。在那一晚，我看到了一个不太好的可能性。你和我改变了那个可能性，我所预见的并没有发生；你允许自己听到我的话这个行动帮助改变了下一个行动。
We shall try to put the session on a more informal basis, and I will be glad to answer any questions that you have, within reason.我们应该让我们的课更不拘小节一点，我将会很高兴回答你们任何的问题，只要是合理的。
([John:] “Can you tell me about the other man in my division who’s selling well, besides Bill Driscoll?")([约翰：]“你能告诉我除了比尔·崔斯寇，我们部门另一个销售成绩良好的人是谁吗？”)
An older man than the one I described.比我所描述的人更年长一点。
([John:] “What does he look like?”)([约翰：]“他长什么样子？”)
Give us a moment. Bigger than the man I described, with more hair, though he is older. I believe he wears glasses.等一下，比我所描述的人再大只一点，更多头发，虽然他年纪比较大。我想他戴着眼镜。
([John:] “With more hair?”)([约翰：]“有更多头发？”)
With more hair, though he is older. One of the men I believe is precisely 37. The second man occasionally wears glasses. His hair is a shade of brown, though not a definite well-defined color.有更多头发，虽然他年纪比较大。我想其中一个男人刚好是37岁。第二个男人有时候会戴眼镜，他的发色是一种咖啡色。虽然不是一种明确好定义的颜色。
([John:] “What specific sports is he interested in?”)([约翰：]“他对什么体育运动感兴趣?”)
Which man?哪个人？
([John:] “The second one.”)([约翰：]“第二个。”)
I think of a game like hockey, though I do not precisely see how hockey could be involved. Perhaps it is golf, then, with an instrument of this sort. (Jane, her eyes closed, gestured as though stroking or swinging, her arms stiff.) If so however there is a connection, perhaps in younger years, with skating, as on ice.我想是类似曲棍球的运动，虽然我没确实的看到和曲棍球是如何相关的。也许是高尔夫球，带着这类用具的运动。(珍，她的眼睛闭着，手臂伸直做出类似击球或摆动的姿势。)不过，也许在他年轻的时候，和冰上溜冰有一些连结。
There may be a secondary interest in a game like tennis, but I do not see anything else in that line. I feel a connection with bowling, but believe this to be a mistaken conception, perhaps on Philips part.也许有第二个兴趣是类似网球的运动，但我没有看到其他类似的。我感觉和保龄球有关联，但我想这是一个错误的理解，也许和菲利普有关。
I will give you all a brief rest.我建议你们短暂地休息一下。
(Break at 11:39. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had been closed, her voice good, her pace fast. See the Bill Driscoll material on page 41.(11:39休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着。她的音量适中，速度快。
(John identified the second man described by Seth as a Mr. Dudley, and said that like Bill Driscoll, Dudley is a good salesman. Dudley has brown nondescript hair, is older than Driscoll but not bigger, and plays tennis and handball. Dudley used to play golf, John said, hence Seth's gesturing as though acting out a sport which required some kind of hitting or swinging instrument.(约翰确定赛斯所描述的第二个男人是唐利[Dudley]先生，而且他说就像比尔•崔斯寇，唐利是一个很好的销售员。唐利有着无甚特色的咖啡色头发，比崔斯寇年长，但不算大只，玩网球和手球。约翰说唐利过去曾打高尔夫球，因此赛斯摆出一个需要某种击球或摆动器具的运动。
(John thinks Mr. Dudley's sales are on the way up, also, but has seen no actual figures on which to base that estimate specifically. Dudley also sometimes wears glasses. Jane felt Seth had wanted to give this information earlier but that she blocked it.(约翰认为唐利先生的销售成绩越来越好，虽然并没有什么特别的证据。唐利有时候也戴眼镜。珍感觉赛斯早就想给这些讯息，只不过被她挡住了。
(Neither John or I observed any feature change in Jane.(约翰和我都没有觉察到珍的容貌有任何变化。
(Since the hour was late, John told us the name of the woman discussed by Seth: Judy Fuller. Later we found a Judy Fuller in the phone book, but this Fuller does not live on the correct street, either. Either Judy Fuller does not have a telephone or it is under another name.(因为时间已经晚了，约翰告诉我们，赛斯讨论的这个女人名字是茱蒂•富勒[Judy Fuller]。后来我们在电话薄上找到茱•富勒[June Fuller]，但这个富勒并不住在正确的那条街。或许茱蒂•富勒并没有电话，或她的电话是登记在其他人的名下。
(Note by John Bradley, June 8,1966: “Girl’s name is Judy Fuller. Judy Fuller is listed in phone book under her old address.”(约翰在1966年6月8日的注上写着：“女孩的名字是朱迪∙富勒。朱迪∙富勒的旧地址有登记在电话簿上。”
(Jane resumed at an average pace, with her eyes open part of the time, at 11:51.)(珍以一般的速度重新开始，她的眼睛有时候是睁开的，11:51。)
I will indeed, because of the expression upon your face, my dear Joseph, bring our session to a close.因为你的表情，亲爱的约瑟，我决定结束我们的课。
We have done the best we could this evening. We could have done better, perhaps, without the interruption. Nevertheless we did well enough indeed.我们今晚尽力了。如果没有被打断，也许会做得更好。不过我们确实已经做得够好了。
There is more pertaining to our friend Philip, but for several reasons we shall let it lie for now. The reasons have to do with my judgment rather than any fear of distortion.这更适用于我们的朋友菲利普，出于几个原因，我们现在应该把这个先搁着。我会这么做是来自于我的判断，并不是鲁柏扭曲。
However our friend has developed his abilities in ways that he will not be able to close off, and that is after all not so terrible indeed. He shall not be reading tomorrows newspaper today, but he shall be more receptive to communications from the inner self, and his own ego shall be better informed, though this will not necessarily make it any happier.无论如何，我们的朋友正在发展一种他不能阻隔的能力，这其实并没有这么可怕。他不会在今天就读着明天的报纸，但他应该更乐于接受来自内我的交流，他的自我应该更乐于被知会，虽然这并不一定会让他更快乐。
Now we think of an episode—I will avoid the word affair—a particular episode occurring a while back in connection with Philip's daughter, in her bedroom or by her bed. I believe late at night, perhaps when she was ill, but in connection with strong feeling on his part.现在我想到一个插曲——我会避免用绯闻这个字——一个和菲利普的女儿有关的特定插曲，在她的房间或在她的床边。我相信是发生在深夜，当时也许她生病了，但在男生的部分是有着强烈的感情。
I hesitate to use the word oath or vow, but something along these lines. Perhaps a promise would be more fitting as a word to describe what I am thinking of.我犹豫着该不该用誓言或誓约这样的字眼，但是某种类似的意思。也许承诺会是一个更好的字眼来描述我所想到的。
Now as to the session, Joseph. I leave this to your discretion. We shall end it when you prefer. (I nodded yes.)现在约瑟。我让你自由决定。如果你想要，我们就结束。(我点头说好)
We then bid you all a most fond and affectionate good evening. We may indeed end up with another session before Monday, but if so we shall see to it that you do not write up all our notes. I do my best in my own way to look out for all of you, and yet I am also limited as to my actions within your system. You must often read between the lines when I speak. Subconsciously you pick up more than you realize, and subconsciously you make preparations for events of which you may be consciously unaware. I cannot spell all things out, and I would not do so if I could.我祝你们都有一个感性的夜晚。我们应该在星期一之前的另一节课结束这个讨论，如果这样的话，我们看看，也许你不用详细的写下所有记录。我会尽力用我的方式照顾你们，但在你们的系统里，我的行动是受限的。你们必须常常读我说过的话。潜意识里你们接收到的会比了解到的更多，潜意识里你们会为意识上并不觉察到的事件做好准备。我没办法说得更清楚了，即使可以我也不打算这么做。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at midnight. Jane was dissociated as usual. She said she thought Seth interrupted the material on Johns daughter which Seth intended as another display of telepathy because he realized the hour was late and the material too long and involved.)(在午夜结束。珍出离如常。她说，她认为赛斯中断了有关约翰女儿的资料，是因为赛斯打算再次展现心电感应，但是他知道时间已经晚了，相关的资料又很长。)
(Copy of John Bradley's map, concerning the Judy Fuller material.)缺
(I was in my studio at the back of our apartment, putting the notes for this session away, when Seth came through again briefly as Jane and John talked in the font room. The exchange was finished by the time I walked back to them. It was to the effect that within three years Jane and I would have our own house.(我正在我们公寓后面我的工作室里把今晚的笔记归位，当珍和约翰在前面的房间说话的时候，赛斯再一次短暂的透过来。当我走回去的时候，对话已经结束了。话题谈到三年内我和珍会有我们自己的房子。)
(Seth came through with this, we believe, because he had expressed a wish that we had our recorder going this evening, and because he evidently wanted to sound out strong and loud and could not do so in an apartment house. Seth told John our house would have privacy.(赛斯透过来说这个，我们认为是因为今晚他曾表达过，他希望我们使用录音机，也因为他很想以一种大声有力的方式来表达，但在公寓里是不能那么做的。赛斯告诉约翰，我们以后的房子会更有隐私。
(Jane and I do not usually use the recorder for sessions because it doubles the time involved in transcribing notes. We realize spontaneity is important, but our time is limited. We have considered holding just one longer session a week, in which the recorder could be used. Jane prefers two sessions a week personally, however, and many sessions ago Seth also said he preferred more than one session a week.)(珍和我在课堂上通常不用录音机，因为那会让我们在写笔记的时候花双倍的时间。我们了解自发性是很重要的，但是我们的时间有限。我们有考虑过一星期只上一堂比较长的课，这样就可以使用录音机。不过珍个人希望一周能有两节课，而且赛斯在前几节课曾说过，他希望一星期不只上一堂课。)

SESSION 205 第205节 感性　理性


NOVEMBER 3, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年11月3日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(No envelope test was held during the session.(这一节课没有信封测试。
(In the unscheduled 203rd session of October 28, Seth told us we would shortly get another letter from Dr. Instream “within a few days.” On November 2, four days later, we received a short letter from Dr. Instream in which he asked that Jane and I “simply continue as we are going.” This noon Jane told me she thought Seth might have something to say tonight about the attempts at communication with Dr. Instream.(在10月28日第203节的临时课里，赛斯告诉我们，我们很快地会“在几天之内”收到殷斯翠姆博士的另一封信。在11月2日，4天后我们收到殷斯翠姆博士的一封短信，他要求我和珍“单纯地继续做我们正在做的事。”今天中午珍告诉我，她认为赛斯今晚可能会试图对与殷斯翠姆博士交流的这件事发表一些看法。
(Also in the 203rd session, Seth said Howard Kimball would be elected mayor of Elmira. On November 2nd, Howard did win the election though of course there is a fifty-fifty chance that guessing could produce the same prediction.(同样在第203节，赛斯说过哈威•金博会当选埃尔迈拉的市长。在11月2日，哈威真的赢得了这次选举，当然，这是50对50的机率，如果用猜也很可能会得到一样的结果。
(John Bradley witnessed the last session. In it Seth mentioned developments to come within Johns family, involving his mother particularly. Jane also felt she blocked some of this data. The next day, yesterday, Jane had a most unusual experience for her. It involved a peculiar heavy sense of premonition of some kind, as of us personally, or our families, but might be related to John’s family. We have not seen him since Monday, and probably will not for at least two weeks. The sense of premonition lasted for about three hours with Jane, then lifted. She has the experience written up elsewhere.(约翰·布莱德利参与了上一节课。在课里，赛斯提到约翰家里正酝酿的事，特别和他母亲有关。珍也感觉她阻挡了这里的一些资料。第二天，也就是昨天，珍有一个很不寻常的经验。这涉及了某种强烈的预感，我们个人或是我们的家人会和约翰的家人有关联。自从星期一之后，我们就没看过他了，大概至少有两周会看不到他。珍的预感大约持续了三个小时，然后就消失了。她把这个经验写在别的地方。
(The session was held in our back room and was a quiet one. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her pace was quite slow at times, her voice quiet.)(这节课在我们后面那间比较安静的房间里举行。珍开始说话时坐着，眼睛闭着。她的速度有时十分慢，声音轻柔。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. May I personally thank our Dr. Instream for his recent letter. I have a few comments that I would like to make here.现在。我个人想先感谢殷斯翠姆博士最近的来信。我等一下会有一些评论。
We have been progressing, actually at a good consistent rate, considering the fact that no tests of any kind have ever been attempted before we became acquainted with Dr. Instream.事实上我们正以一种持续的、良好的速度在进步，在认识殷斯翠姆博士之前，我们并没有尝试做过任何测验。
In our tests with the Jesuit and the cat lover, we hit on several specific points. The one that comes to mind right now, though there were others, concerns the three-dollar cab fare, which they considered too high, and the right-hand turn, all of which were given here, and which proved out exactly.在我们对耶稣会信徒和爱猫人士的测验中，命中了几个具体的重点。虽然还有其他的，但我现在想到的是三块钱的计程车费，他们认为太贵，还有转向右手边，这些答案都是我们在这里给的，事实也证明很正确。
Ruburt’s own experience was also specific, in that his description of the place at which the Gallaghers stayed was highly accurate.鲁柏自己的经验也很具体，他所描述关于加拉格夫妇所住的地方是非常正确的。
(See the 201st session.)(请见第201节。)
In our recent session with Philip, otherwise known as John Bradley, we also hit some specific points. The raise was one, the description of another salesman was another; and there were more in that session.在我们最近与菲利普，也就是约翰·布莱德利的课里，也命中了一些具体的重点，升职是一点，另一点是关于另一位销售员的描述；那节课里还有更多。
Now there is an emotional rapport, set up of course within some time, that exists between these persons. Ruburt is therefore able on his own to pick them up, so to speak, when conditions are good. This is a big help to me.现在和这些人之间建立一种情感性的和谐已经有一阵子了。因此当状况好的时候，鲁柏才能够接收到讯息。这对我是很大的帮助。
The intellect is highly important. It has little to do however with the framework within which our tests take place. The idea of a game will indeed work more to our advantage, for this is not an intellectual exercise. The intellect can be used most handily in tabulating our results, but it will not help us to get our results, unless it is utilized as a means toward discovering how best to harness the emotions for communication purposes.理智是很重要的。但是它对我们测验由之产生的结构作用不大。反而一种游戏的概念会对我们更有利，因为这不是一个理智上的演练。我们可以用理智轻易地把结果列成表，但它并不能帮助我们得到结果，除非它是被用来当作一种方法，去发现为了交流的目的如何更好地利用情感。
(Jane now took a pause lasting at least one minute.)(珍现在停顿了至少一分钟。)
If you dislike the term emotions in this context, the word vitality may be substituted. I personally appreciate your interest, Dr. Instream, and we shall indeed succeed. Again, do not concentrate on an intellectual level, if possible. When Ruburt tries too hard, he often blocks material by losing spontaneity; and when you try too hard, you interrupt any communication, or at least make it more difficult.在这里如果你不喜欢用情绪(emotions)这个字眼，或许可以用活力(vitality)来取代。殷斯翠姆博士，我个人很感谢你对我们的兴趣，你们会成功的。再次的，如果可能，不要一直专注在理智的层面。当鲁柏太努力去尝试，他反而会因为推动了自发性而阻挡了资料；当你试得太努力，会打断所有的交流，至少会把它变得比较困难。
(Jane took another long pause.)(珍又一次长时间停顿。)
While we are still developing, the specifics that we have picked up in these tests with others show me that Ruburt is developing as I would like. There is still of course much more to be done before we can operate with a predictable accuracy.我们还在发展，在这些测验里我们所接收到的特定讯息，显示了鲁柏正以我希望的方式发展。在我们能更准确的预测之前，还有很多可以做的。
Nevertheless what we need in our work with you is an emotional rather than intellectual attempt, and from your letter I believe that we see eye to eye here.不过在我们的工作中，所需要你的是一种情感胜过理智的企图，从你的来信看来，我相信在这点我们的看法是一致的。
I will suggest a short break.我建议一个短暂的休息。
(Break at 9:21. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first break. She had been smoking when she began this evening, and put out her cigarette without any trouble as she continued to speak. She also sipped wine. I assume her eyes were at least slit-ted open for her to perform these tasks, but if so I could not tell. Her voice was stronger than usual, her pace quite slow by break time.(9:21休息。珍在第一阶段出离如常。今晚刚开始时她正抽着烟，当她开始说话时就把烟熄灭了。她也喝了一点酒。我猜当她这么做的时候眼睛应该有微微张开，但即使这样我也看不出来。她的声音比平常有力，到了休息的时候，她的速度变得十分慢。
(Jane was again smoking when she resumed, and this time I could see that her ryes were narrowly open. Her pace was again slow, her voice fairly strong. Resume at 9:30.)(当她重新开始的时候，珍又抽起了烟，这一次我有看到她的眼睛微微地睁开。她的速度再次变慢，声音相当努力。9:30重新开始。)
Now. Some of this rapport business will take care of itself through the natural course of events, in your letters back and forth for example. And if you yourself have a more flexible, easier, less intellectual attitude toward our tests, this will make our task easier.现在。随着事情的自然发展，融洽的默契会自然建立，例如你们之间的信件往来。如果你们对我们的测验怀抱着一种更有弹性、更轻松、比较不那么理性的态度，这会让我们的工作更容易一点。
This is difficult to put into words. Feel toward us rather than think at us, and let us see how we do. Self-suggestion may be most beneficial when possible, when used to put you in this more intuitive frame of mind. Turn your emotions towards us, and I think we’ll be able to pick up your objects.这很难诉诸语言。不要想到我们，要感觉我们，让我们看看可以怎么做。如果可能，自我暗示是最有利的，那会把你放在心智的一个较直觉的模式下。把你的情感转向我们，那我想我们就能接收到你的物件。
If the objects used are those to which you are emotionally attached, this will also be of some considerable help. I realize that this would seem to limit the choice of objects which have a meaning for you, and still allow for a variety that is wide.如果所使用的是一个你很有感情的物件，这将对我们有相当大的帮助。我明白要选择对你有意义的物件这点，似乎限制了你的选择，但它仍预留了相当广的范畴。
At least a significant object of some sort. It need not belong to you, but it should have some meaning for you, to get the best results. Keep the object in mind, but do not concentrate upon it so intensely that you block out your own emotional, (underlined) vitality.至少要是某种有意义的物件。这不一定要是你的东西，但一定要是对你有意义的东西，这样才会得到最好的效果。把这个物件放在心中，但不要太强烈的对它集中注意力，那样你反而会挡住了自己情感的(划线)活力。
I am mentioning these points here, as they can help us. I may try varying a few conditions from this end. We shall see. Ruburt has himself gained some confidence as a result of our own tests, and also as a result of tests that he has tried on his own. One in particular that involved again Philip, or John Bradley.我在这里提到这几点，是因为这可以帮助我们。为了我们这一方，我可能试着改变一些情况。我们再看看。因为我们这些测验的结果，鲁柏开始有了一点信心，有一些测验的结果是他自己尝试的。特别有一个是和菲利普，或是约翰•布莱德利有关。
(See page 11 of the 200th session.)(见第200节。)
I have been endeavoring to build up his confidence at this end, and am glad to see that we are succeeding to some extent, since this is as necessary as anything else with which we have to deal. My heartiest good wishes to you, sir.为了这个目的，我很努力地帮助他建立自信心，而且很高兴地看到已经有一些成效了，因为这和我们要做的事同样是必须的。先生，我衷心的祝福你。
There is some material I would like to give concerning the examination of dreams, and some instructions that you should find of interest. There may be some slight inconvenience involved. However you can take your time about this, Joseph and Ruburt.我还想再给一些关于梦的测验资料，还有一些你应该会感兴趣的说明。这可能会有一些困难。不过，约瑟和鲁柏，对此你们可以慢慢来。
It is an experiment concerning the recorder, somewhat along the lines which Ruburt had planned, but with certain innovations. There is no need to try the experiment night after night in succession, however. Three nights out of a week for a certain number of weeks should be sufficient.是有关于录音机的实验，鲁柏本就计划这么做，但是做法有一些改变。不过不需要每晚都持续着这个实验。一星期三个晚上，持续个几周应该就够了。
However, I suggest a break so that we pick up our friend on time.我建议你们休息一下，这样可以准时开始感应我们的朋友。
(Break at 9:44. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes were closed for the most part, her voice subsiding to average, her pace on the slow side. She resumed in the same manner at 10:00.)(9:44休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛大部分时间都是闭着的，声音回复到平常的音量，速度偏慢。她在10点以同样的方式重新开始。)
Ruburt’s confidence, or lack of it, was a stumbling block at our end.对我们要达到的目标来说，鲁柏的缺乏信心是个绊脚石。
While this is not completely overcome by any means, we are certainly on our way to overcoming it, and this will help matters. I do want to have on record my own comments concerning my warning to Philip, or John Bradley, and the implications that are involved. This and the dream material will be our next subjects of discussion.当这点还没有被各种方式完全克服前，我们肯定要用自己的方式来克服它，而这也有助于事情的发展。我真想把我对菲利普或约翰•布莱德利的警告，以及其中的意含给录下来。这些和梦的资料会是我们下次讨论的主题。
Now however give us a moment.现在等一下。
(As usual, Jane now sat with her head down, her hands raised to her eyes. She took a pause lasting at least one minute. Her pace while delivering the material on Dr. Instream was the slowest yet, I believe. This is the 14th test.)(一如往常，珍现在坐着，头低着，手举到眼睛上。她停顿了大约一分钟。我想她的速度在提到殷斯翠姆博士的资料时是最慢的。这是第14次试验。)
He is more relaxed. He looks at a watch, a round one. It seems to be the kind to which a chain was once attained. (Pause.)他更放松了。他看着表，一个圆形的表。似乎有一条链子附在表上面。(停顿)
He has a white shirt on. The collar seems to be open, and the sleeves rumpled somehow toward the cuffs in a noticeable fashion. Not completely rolled up for example, but perhaps partially.他穿着一件白衬衫。领口似乎是敞开的，袖子以一种时兴的方式捲起来。比如并不是完全的捲起来，也许只是捲起一部分。
He has just taken off a suit jacket, and he sits down by a dark desk. (Long pause at 10:07.) A wastepaper basket with wires, perhaps crisscrossing wires. The top of the basket coming out in some sort of an arrangement that resembles the top of a flowerpot.他刚脱下西装外套，在一个深色书桌前坐下。(长时间停顿10:07)废纸篓里面有电线，也许是交错的电线。废纸篓顶端露出了类似花盆的瓶口。
The room is an office. (Pause.) I think of the word wisteria. (Long pause.)这个房间是一间办公室。(停顿)我想到紫藤这个词。(长时间停顿)
He seems to be asking me a question. (Pause at 10:12.) Does it have to do with music? Again I pick up wire. (Pause.) An ornament that is heavy, dark green, almost greenish black.他似乎问了我一个问题。(停顿10:12)是和音乐有关吗？再一次的，我感应到电线。(停顿)一个很重要的装饰品，深绿色，几乎是带绿的黑。
His hypnosis experiments have a unique effect or success, that should be meaningful to him by the time he reads this material.当他在读这个资料的时候，他的催眠实验有着不寻常的成效或成功，那应该对他有意义。
4 and 4 are 8. I do not know to what this refers. An oval mirror. Oval rather than absolutely round. Long and oval.4和4是8。我不知道这指的是什么。一个椭圆形的镜子。是椭圆形而不是圆形。长的椭圆形。
I think of a missionary. (Pause.)我想到了传教士。(停顿)
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:18. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed; her voice had been quieter, her pace quite slow. She said she must have been concentrating, because her neck felt stiff at break.(10:18休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着；她的声音比较安静，速度十分慢。她说她一定很专心，因为休息的时候她发现脖子很僵硬。
(During break Jane relaxed by laying on the bed. She resumed from this position, her head propped up on one hand, her voice quiet, her eyes closed. She was also smoking as she spoke. Resume at 10:26.)(在休息的时候，珍放松地躺在床上。她以这样的姿势重新开始，用一只手撑着头，声音轻柔，眼睛闭着。她说话的时候也抽着烟。在10:26重新开始。)
We will now end our session.我们现在要结束这一节了。
I would continue it, for there is some material that I am anxious to give you, but our last session was a long one.我会继续，有一些资料我急着要告诉你，但我们上一节课太长了。
There will be another short-story sale shortly for our Ruburt.鲁柏很快会卖出另一个短篇故事。
My best regards to all of you. I feel quite frisky if you two do not.我衷心的祝福你们所有人。你们可能要睡觉了，但我仍觉得精力充沛。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:29. Jane was dissociated as usual. She said Seth could have cheerfully gone on, but she didn’t encourage it.(10:29结束。珍出离如常。她说赛斯还可以愉快地继续，但是她没有鼓励他这样做。
(Seth also said Jane would have some short-story sales in the 201st session. This is a possibility of course since Jane has material out. See the notes on page 24.)(赛斯在第201节也说过珍卖出一些短篇故事。这当然是一个可能性，因为珍已经把东西寄出了。)

SESSION 206 第206节 怎样记录梦


NOVEMBER 8, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年11月8日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(An impromptu unscheduled session was held last Friday evening, November 5, for a group of young people. No notes were taken, nor were they intended according to Seth, but I want to note a few points.(一堂即兴的临时课在11月5日，上星期五晚上，对着一群年轻人举行，我没有做笔记，据赛斯说，他们也并不打算这么做，但我还是想记下一些重点。
(The group of four, exclusive of myself, makes the largest gathering Seth has yet addressed. Jane and I knew they were interested in psychology and ESP in general and had encouraged their reading on the subjects. They did not know about Seth but were somewhat familiar with our work in ESP, and of course would learn of Seth’s existence when Jane's ESP book is published. Probably we would have preferred that our friends, two young men and two young ladies, do more background reading before meeting Seth; on the other hand, with the coming publication of Jane’s book we have been somewhat curious as to the reaction of interested friends to Seth. Conditions were good last Friday evening so Seth spoke at some length in a general way.(除了我之外，团体还有4个人，是有史以来最多人的聚会。珍和我知道他们大部分都对心理学和ESP感兴趣，所以我们鼓励他们多读一点关于这方面的主题。他们不知道赛斯是谁，但是对我们ESP的工作多少有点了解，当然等珍ESP的书出版了，他们就会知道赛斯的存在。也许我们应该让我们的朋友，两个年轻男士和两个年轻女士，在遇见赛斯前先做一些背景阅读；另一方面，随着珍的书即将出版，那些会对赛斯有兴趣的朋友，我们多少也对他们的反应感到好奇。上星期五晚上的状况很好，所以赛斯比平常讲得久。
(Although they were surprised at first our guests did not stay surprised long, and began to bombard Seth with questions. He answered the ones that would make sense to them offhand, and parried others or simply stated the answers would make no sense to them at the moment. Some of the questions were surprisingly acute, and involved aspects of the existence of Seth, and his abilities, that Jane and I had not thought of.(虽然一开始他们感到很惊讶，但是并没有惊讶得太久，然后就开始用一堆问题来轰炸赛斯。他回答那些他们很容易就能理解的问题，然后回避或是简单回答那些他们当时还未能理解的问题。有一些问题是惊人的敏锐，是有关于赛斯的存在层面，还有他的能力等问题，这些是珍和我没有想过的。
(One question concerned what Seth actually “sees" when he is confronting a witness, and he answers this briefly in tonight’s session. I would like to note one physical effect that took place. There was a lighted candle on the coffee table before the group, and as Seth was speaking the flame increased noticeably in height. I called the witnesses' attention to the effect. All windows were closed since it was a chilly evening, and the air was quite still. The enlarged flame lasted for several minutes, then gradually subsided. The flare-up of the candle flame was sudden, not gradual.(有一个问题是，当赛斯面对一个参与者的时候，他究竟“看到”了什么，赛斯在今晚的课里简短地回答了这个问题。我想要记下一个当时发生的物理现象。在聚会之前，咖啡桌上摆了一支点燃的蜡烛，当赛斯说话的时候，火苗明显地会窜得特别高。我称之为参与者的专注效应。因为那是一个寒冷的夜晚，窗户都关上了，所以空气是停滞的。增强的火焰持续了几分钟，然后渐渐趋缓。蜡烛火焰是突然剧烈的燃烧，而不是逐渐的增强。
(The same effect took place during the 182nd session, which was witnessed by the Gallaghers. Seth stated then, as he did last Friday, that he was at times able to produce such effects when Jane, or Ruburt, was not alert and consequently on guard.(同样的情形曾出现在第182节，当加拉格夫妇在场的时候。然后赛斯说，就像上星期五所做的，他有时候也能弄出同样的效果，当珍或鲁柏不那么警戒和防卫的时候。
(No envelope test was held during the session this evening.(今晚这节课没有信封测试。
(The session was held in our back room and was quiet. Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed for the most part. Her voice was quiet, her pace fairly good, although with pauses.)(这节课是在我们后面的房间举行的，很安静。珍说话时坐着，她的眼睛大部分时候都是闭着的。她的声音轻柔，虽然中间有停顿，但速度相当快。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth. “)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
This will be a fairly short session, and I will go easily with you this evening because I have kept you so busy.这会是很短的一节，我今晚会让你们轻松点，因为之前我让你们太忙了。
There are some matters that I said we would discuss, concerning experiments in recording dreams via your recorder, using suggestion to awaken you after a dream sequence. I also told you that we would discuss some implications arising from the fact that Philip was able to hear my voice, and we shall not overlook these matters.我们会讨论我之前提到的一些问题，是有关于用录音机录下你们梦的实验，还有运用暗示让你们在一连串的梦境醒来。我也告诉过你们，我们将会讨论菲利普能听到我的声音这个事实所蕴含的意义，我们不应该忽略这些问题。
(Philip is John Bradleys entity name. See the 204th session. Jane and I were certainly hoping Seth would go into John's experience, whereby John heard from Seth, more deeply.)(菲利普是约翰·布莱德利存有的名字。请见第204节。珍和我确实希望赛斯能更深入的讨论，关于约翰听到赛斯声音的这个经验。)
There is however something else that I would like to take up immediately. It had not entered my mind to explain it to you earlier. In most instances, or at least in many instances, I do nor see the particular physical image of a witness to a session; but indeed as you described it, I see what you may call a composite image, an energy reality that is composed of past personalities, and in many cases also of future personalities that will be adopted by the inner self.不过有一些其他的事我想要马上提起。之前我从未想过要对你们解释。在部分的情况，或是至少在很多的情况下，我并没有在课堂中看到参与者所谓的特定肉体形象；但如果真要描述，我看到的是你们称为集合形象的、由过去的人格们组成的能量实相，在很多例子，未来人格们的形象也会被内我给采用。
I can, it is true, focus exclusively upon the present individual. This merely involves a change of focus on my part, and a narrowing of focus and concentration. There is much more that can be said here, but we shall save it for another occasion. The matter was in your mind, and I am giving you a simple and direct answer.这是事实，我能完全的专注于现在的个体上，在我的部分这只涉及了改变焦点，把焦点窄化且专注。这里还有更多可以说的，但是我们应该把它留到下一次。问题在你的心里，我只给你一个简单直接的答案。
Now. A word concerning the dream experiments. You may try these at your convenience. Obviously because of your schedule you cannot at this time embark upon any rigorous experimentations in this respect, for your sleep would sadly suffer.现在，有关梦的实验。当你们有时间的时候应该试试。当在以你们现在的日程安排，不可能在这方面着手任何严格的实验，否则可能会没时间睡觉。
Now we all know that various kinds of experimentation is being done, are being done, concerning the dream state. However, very little work, if any, is being carried on along the lines I am about to suggest.现在我们都知道，关于梦境有各种各样的实验都已经做过了，或是正在做，但是，关于我所建议的那方面研究却非常少。
Ruburts dream notebook has come along very well. In most cases however he writes down only those dreams which he remembers upon awakening. Suggestion will allow him, or will allow you Joseph, to awaken yourself as soon as a dream is completed.鲁柏的梦笔记进行的非常好。大部分的情形，他只写下醒来记得的那些梦。暗示会让他或是让约瑟你，在梦一做完的时候马上醒过来。
The dream will be fresh. If your recorder is suitably situated with the microphone easily at hand, then you can speak your dream with less effort than is required to write it down. Of course records should be kept. The simplest part of the experiment will involve the use of self-suggestion in dream recall.趁梦记忆犹新的时候，如果你的录音机放在适当的位置，麦克风是在手边容易取得的话，你就可以比写下来更轻松的讲出你的梦。当然录音带必须留着。实验最简单的部分，就是运用暗示让梦被记起来。
The number of remembered dreams should be much higher than your present system allows. There are some interesting elements however that I want you to look out for. I will not tell you much about them however, since your own minds should be free, and you should come to your own conclusions.被记起来的梦的数量，应该会比你现在用的方式来得多很多。我希望你留意一些有趣的要素。不过我不会告诉你更多，因为你的心应该是自由的，应该得出你自己的结论。
I would suggest however that the first recalled dream for any given evening be compared with the first recalled dream from other evenings, that the second recalled dream from any one evening be compared with the second dream from other evenings, and so forth. This should prove highly interesting, and if such experiments are carried on consistently over a period of years, then the results could lead to excellent evidence for the various layers of the subconscious and the inner self, of which I have spoken for so long.不过我会建议的是，任何一个特定晚上第一个被记起来的梦，应该和其他晚上第一个被记起来的梦做比较，然后任何一个晚上第二个被记起来的梦，应该和其他晚上第二个被记起来的梦做比较，以此类推。这应该会非常有趣，如果这样的实验持续地超过一年，那么其结果，将会对我说了很久的潜意识和内我的不同层面，做出最好的证明。
(Jane had been smoking. Her eyes now slightly open, she put her cigarette out.)(珍在抽烟。她的眼睛现在微微地睁开，把烟熄灭。)
Particular notice should also be taken of characters and settings, and the approximate period of history in which the dream action occurs. If a dream seems to occur in no specific location and in no particular time, then these facts should also be noted.应该要特别注意角色和场景，还有梦的活动大约发生在哪一段经历里。如果一个梦似乎发生在不特定的地点或不特定的时间里，那这个事实也应该要被记录下来。
Unknown characters within the dream action, persons unknown to you in everyday life, should be given careful attention also, and the roles which they play within the dream drama. The primary colors of a dream should be noted. It certainly goes without saying that all remembered dream events should be checked against reality, as you have been doing, so that any clairvoyant dreams are clearly checked and recorded.在梦的活动里不认识的角色，或你日常生活里不认识的人也应该要特别注意，特别是他们在梦中剧里所扮演的角色。一个梦里的主要颜色也应该被注明。不用说，所有记得的梦中事件都应该拿来和实相比对，如果你这么做了，那么任何预知梦都会清楚地被核实和记录。
Of course telepathy within dreams also occurs, as you know. I am sure you realize the difference between these, but basically such dreams are the same. The distinctions are you own. All attempt also should be made through correspondence to check such details.当然如你所知的，在梦里心电感应也会发生。我相信你明了其中的不同，但基本上这样的梦是一样的。你自己要分辨，也应该要去做相关细节的核对。
I will now suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:20. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her voice had been quiet, her pace fast enough. Her eyes had been open slightly for some of the time.(9:20休息。珍在第一阶段出离如常。她的声音轻柔，速度够快。她的眼睛有时候会微微张开。
She resumed in the same manner, but with her eyes closed, at 9:38.)她以同样的方式在9:38分重新开始，不过眼睛是闭着的。)
You see, I am giving you good breaks this evening.你们瞧，今晚我有让你们好好的中场休息。
There are many ways that you can approach these dream experiments. You may if you prefer begin by suggesting that you will awaken after each of the first five dreams. If possible we want to get the continuity here.你们有很多方式来研究这些梦的实验。如果你愿意，可以开始暗示自己在前5个梦的每一个梦之后醒过来。如果可能的话，我们希望在这里有一种连续性。
You have many more than five dreams a night, however. I believe Ruburt’s top number of recalled dreams for one night was thirteen. Now there is something else here that must be considered. The very self-suggestions that will enable you to recall your dreams may also change their nature, to some extent, for any action changes any other action.不过，一个晚上你可能会做超过5个梦。我想鲁柏记下梦的最高记录是一晚上13个。现在，这里有一些要注意的。强烈的自我暗示可以让你记得你的梦，也可能在某程度里改变它们的本质。因为任何行动会改变另一个行动。
(Seth dealt with this problem to some extent in the 194th session, when he spoke concerning the article on dreams in The New Yorker magazine for September )(赛斯曾在第194节某程度的谈过这个问题，当他说到1965年9月18日《纽约客》杂志上关于梦的那篇文章时。)
This is all right, and the effect will be minimized when the newness has worn off. Again, if preferable we want to record the dreams in the sequence in which they occur, so that the self-suggestion should always include “I will recall the first three dreams,” or the first five dreams or whatever number you arbitrarily chose to begin.不过没关系，当新鲜度消失的时候，影响就会慢慢减低。再一次，如果可以，我们希望以梦发生的顺序来记录，所以自我暗示应该总是包括“我会记得前3个梦”或前5个梦，或不管你选择要记起几个梦。
You may try two different wordings for a start, and now I am speaking of the precise wording. The first: “I will wake up after each of my first five dreams, and record each one immediately.”一开始的时候，你可能要尝试两种不一样的用语，现在我说的是精准的用语。第一个：“我会在前5个梦的第一个梦之后醒过来，然后很快地记下每一个梦”。
Now the second alternative wording would be the same as the one I have just given you, but the “wake up” could be omitted. That is, it is possible you see, for you to record these dreams, speaking into the microphone without awakening, in your terms.现在第二种用语和我刚才给你的是一样的，但是“醒来”可以被省略。你看，以你们的说法，不需要醒过来，只用麦克风就记录下这些梦是可能的。
(Jane's eyes were now open again, wide this time and very dark. She was again smoking, and speaking rather quickly.)(珍的眼睛再次睁开，这次睁大且眼神深邃。她再一次抽烟，说得相当快。)
This is definitely not only possible but certainly the most convenient. You should however try both methods, and discover which works the best for you. By all means, if at all possible, the recorder, Joseph, should be in your bedroom. It is the immediate dream recall we are after. We want you to record the dream at the instant of awakening, or at the instant that the dream is about to dissolve.这的确不只是可能，而且还是最方便的。你应该两种方法都试试，然后看看哪一种方式对你最好。当然，约瑟，录音机最好是放在你的房间里。我们现在说的是梦的立即记录。我们要你在醒来的那瞬间，或在梦将要消散的那一瞬间把梦记下来。
The time involved in going from one room to another could result in the loss of dream content and vividness. The very motor responses demanded on the part of the body, and the extra arousal tendency, would force you to lose a great deal of valid material. I would much rather that you work less, if necessary, using the recorder in the bedroom, than work more intensively leaving the recorder in another room.从一个房间走到另一个房间的时间，可能会导致梦的内容和逼真度消失。身体所需要的动作反应和额外唤起的倾向，会迫使你失去大量有效的资料。如果必要的话，我宁愿你把录音机放在房间里然后做得比较少，这胜过你把录音机放在另一个房间里然后做得比较多。
For it is the dream we are after, the dream experience itself in all the vividness that we can capture, and if you are going to get a watered-down version in any case, then you might as well continue with your present method of dream recording, and not lose any sleep.因为我们说的是梦，我们要捕捉的是梦经验本身的逼真度，如果你想要得到的是稀释了的版本，可以继续你现在记录梦的方式，然后不用损失任何睡眠。
You will experience the vivid realization of your own dreams in this manner, and with some training you will record as much of the whole dream experience as any investigators manage to record when the training is done by a mechanical device, or another individual. And you will also be gaining, additionally, excellent discipline and training over your own states of consciousness, and this in itself you see will be an important yardstick of progress for you both.以这种方式，你会生动地领会自己的梦，伴随着一些训练，你能记录下整个梦的经验，就像训练有素的研究员以一种仪器，或用另一个人来记录的一样多。此外，你也会对自己的意识状态得到极佳的纪律和训练，而这会是你们两个发展的一个重要里程碑。
(Jane's eyes were now closed.)(珍的眼睛现在闭着。)
Now mankind uses but a portion of his capabilities, and when you are along in these experiments, properly set up, you will find that you handle them very well, with no draining of energies or difficulties. Your sleeping hours are already productive. We shall also use them to give you training in the utilization of various stages of consciousness, that will result in time with excellent control over various aspects and stages of your own awareness.人类现在只运用了他一部分的能力，而当你适当的设置这些实验，会发现你处理得非常好，不会消耗你的能量或遭遇困难。你的睡眠时间也是有生产力的。我们也在睡眠时间训练你运用不同状态的意识，为了让你能极佳的控制自己觉知到不同层面的状态。
And added to this, the training will give you valuable information regarding the nature of dreams in general, the stages of the subconscious, and the inner life of the personality when it is dissociated from its physical environment to some considerable extent.再加上这一点，这个训练会给你有关于一般梦的本质、潜意识的阶段，和当人格离开物质环境到相当大程度时的内在活动是什么，这些很有价值的讯息。
I now suggest your break.我现在建议你们休息。
First here a small note. Much later there will be other suggestions for you, in which you will direct your sleeping self to perform various activities in sleep, visit certain locations, bring back information and so forth. This is obviously still very much in the future, but it is well within the abilities of human personality, and within the realms of your own abilities.首先一个小提醒。过一阵子将会有其他的建议给你们，让你们可以引导梦中的自己在梦中从事不同的活动，参访某些地方、带回来某些讯息等等。这明显的还是很未来的事，但它蕴含在人类人格的能力和你自己能力范围里。
(Break at 10:00. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed since last noted. Her voice had been quiet, her pace fast.(10:00休息。珍出离如常。自从上段笔记后，她的眼睛一直闭着。她的声音轻柔，速度快。
(It was now time for the 15th Dr. Instream clairvoyant test. As usual Jane spoke now with her eyes closed, except for one instant when she put out her cigarette. Her voice was quiet, her pace not too slow for the most part except for a few long pauses. Resume at 10:07.)(现在是时候开始第15次殷斯翠姆博士透视测验。像平常一样，珍说话时眼睛闭着，除了她把烟熄掉的时候。她的声音轻柔，速度大部分的时候并不慢，只除了一些较长的停顿时间。10:07分重新开始。)
Give us a moment, and you may relax a moment longer while we try to pick up Dr. Instream... who sits at a desk or table that has a lamp on it. Not a table lamp type of thing, but a desk lamp variety, perhaps of brown metal.等我们一下，当我们试着感应殷斯翠姆博士的时候，你可以放松一下……他坐在一个书桌或茶几前，桌上有一盏灯。不像是一般的茶几灯，比较类似书桌灯，也许是金属咖啡色。(停顿)
(Pause.)我想光是直接照在坐在书桌前的他身上，他也以这种方式坐着，光照在他前方。
I believe that the light is concentrated directly in front of him upon the desk or tabletop, and that he sits more or less like this, with the light filling in front of him. (Here Jane, her eyes still closed, leaned forward in her rocker and took a position as though she were sitting at a desk with her elbows on it, her hands raised toward her head.)(在这里，珍的眼睛仍闭着，她在摇椅上往前倾，摆出一个好像坐在书桌前、手肘放在桌上的样子，她的手举向头。)
There may be something white, a piece of paper perhaps, in front of him, upon which the light falls.在他面前，灯光落下的地方有某个白色的东西，也许是白纸。
I think of a letter from another university, of three or four very brief paragraphs, not taking up the whole page.我想到从另一封大学来的信，只有短短三四段，不到一张纸。
(Jane now took a long pause.)(珍现在停顿比较久。)
This may be the sheet of paper to which I referred. It may well be a letter that you have written him, and he concentrates on my name; and thinks (pause) of a picture in a frame, of his wife I believe, but not one just taken.也许是我刚刚提到的那张纸。也有可能是你写给他的信，他专注在我的名字上；他想到(停顿)一张在相框里的相片，我想是他的妻子，并不是刚照的那张。
(Jane took a pause lasting about a minute, at 10:13.)(珍停了大约一分钟，10:13。)
Now he switches off the light and tries without it. I believe he has on a white shirt, and loose collar, and he thinks, “Well now, Seth, well now. What about it, huh?” (Pause.)现在他关上了灯，试着习惯没有灯光。我想他穿着白色衬衫，宽松的领子，然后他想着，“那么现在，赛斯，现在。你觉得呢?”(停顿)
The picture may also have flowers in it. She has a hat on; and you may take a break, or end the session as you prefer.照片里可能也有花，她戴着帽子；你可以休息，或你想结束这一节。
We’ll take a short break then.我们短暂地休息一下。
(Break at 10:19. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her pace had been very slow toward the end of the delivery.(10:19休息。珍出离如常。她的速度在口述快结束的时候变得非常慢。
(Once again Jane relaxed on the bed during break. Again she began to speak from the bed, propped up on one elbow, her eyes closed, at 10:21.)(珍再次在休息的时候放松地躺在床上，再度开始时，她撑起一只手肘从床上说话，眼睛闭着，在10:21分继续。)
The conditions simply happened to be excellent the evening that Philip heard me speak to him.当菲利普听到我对他说话的那个晚上，情况正是最好的时候。
There is no particular reason why others could not hear me, but practically speaking the ego is usually on guard to prevent such communications. The ego regards anything but itself as an alien, even the portions of the individual’s own subconscious. Since these are so often denied by the ego, it is no wonder that voices such as mine only infrequently break through.并没有什么特别的理由其他人不能听到我说话，但实际上来说，自我通常会在警戒状态以避免这样的沟通。除了他自己，自我认为其他任何东西都是外来物，即使是这个个体自己的潜意识。因为经常被自我否认，无怪乎像我这样的声音只能罕见地穿透过来。
If Philip did not already have a familiarity with me in these sessions, it would have been very difficult for me to have made my voice clear to him. It also happened that I was speaking in warning, and therefore his own subconscious was willing to let the contact take place.如果不是在这几节课里，菲利普已经对我比较熟悉，我将会很难让他听清楚我的声音。当然那也是当我要出声警告的时候，他自己的潜意识愿意让这样的接触发生。
Philip was not consciously thinking of me, and his ego was not on guard. His subconscious mind however did consent to the contact, because I impressed upon it the fact that I considered the situation potentially dangerous to him.菲利普并没有有意识地想到我，因此他的自我并没有在警戒状态。不过他的潜意识心智的确同意了这样的接触，因为我深刻的让他知道，这种情况对他有潜在的危险。
Now we can as you prefer, Joseph, go more deeply into this now, or at our next session.现在，约瑟，如果你想，我们可以更深入的探讨它，或是你要留到我们下一节再说。
(“We’ll make it next session then. ")(“那我们下一节再讲。”)
I will indeed wish you all a good evening. My heartiest regards and good wishes.我祝你们所有人有个美好的夜晚。我最衷心的致意和祝福。
(“Good night, Seth, and thank you. "(“晚安，赛斯，那就谢谢了！”
(End as 10:29. Jane was dissociated as usual, her eyes closed, her voice quiet, her pace about average.(10:29结束。珍出离如常。她的眼睛闭着，声音轻柔，速度一般。
(Once again, Philip is John Bradley's entity name. In a general way, we believe contact between John and Seth took place between four and five weeks ago. We did not quiz John about this when he witnessed the 204th session, but will do so next time we see him.(再说一次，菲利普是约翰•布莱德利存有的名字。一般来说，我们相信约翰和赛斯的接触发生在之前的第四周和第五周之间。当他上第204节的课时，我们没有问他，下次我们见到他的时候打算问他。
(Jane feels the voice John heard within can have one of three explanations: It was Seth; it was a subconscious creation on John's part; it was a telepathic communication, on a subconscious level, from Jane to John.)(珍觉得约翰听到声音这件事，可能是三种解释里的一种：是赛斯的声音；是约翰潜意识的创造；在一种潜意识的层面，约翰和珍的一种心电感应沟通。)

SESSION 207 第207节 头朝北睡觉有利健康


NOVEMBER 10, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年11月10日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(No envelope test was held during the session.(这节课没有信封测试。
(It will be remembered that during the 199th, 200th and 201st sessions Seth conducted clairvoyant/telepathic tests with the Gallaghers while they were on vacation in Puerto Rico. Jane and I have now received from them their checklist, made against Seth's predictions and statements, and as soon as it is typed up the material will be inserted into a session.(记得在第199、200和201节里，赛斯对当时正在波多黎各度假的加拉格夫妇做了透视/心电感应的测验。珍和我收到了他们的核对清单，这会用来和赛斯的预测和陈述做比较，当这份资料打好后，会附在课程里。
(Before the session I mentioned that I hoped Seth would say more about John Bradley hearing Seth, as related in the 204th session. Seth gives us at least a little more information on this in the following sessions.(在这节课之前，我提到希望赛斯能多说一点关于第204节里，约翰听到赛斯声音的这件事，赛斯在随后的课里透露了更多的讯息。
(Just before the session Jane read an article in Fate magazine for December 1965, entitled Radiesthesia; Science of Tomorrow. Seth comments on the article.(在上课之前，珍在读1965年12月《命运杂志》上的一篇文章，标题是《感应力：明日的科学》。赛斯会对这篇文章作出评论。
(The session was held in our back room and was a quiet one. Jane spoke while sitting down. Her eyes opened narrowly at times during the session. She was smoking as she began speaking, at a slow pace which grew faster as the delivery progressed.)(这节课是在我们后面那个比较安静的房间举行的。珍说话时坐着。她的眼睛有时在课堂中微微的睁开。她开始说话时正抽着烟，速度较慢，随着口述的进展慢慢变快。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth. ")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
We will cover some of the points that you have in mind.我们会涵括你心中的几个重点。
Let me first make a few comments concerning the article which Ruburt has just finished reading.让我先评论一下鲁柏刚刚读完的那篇文章。
I told you many sessions ago that the most healthy conditions could be achieved for the human organism if the body when sleeping lay in a north-south position, and I repeat this remark now. (Seth made this statement well over a year ago, saying I believe that the reasons had to do with earthly magnetic fields.)我在几节课前曾告诉过你们，人体要达到最健康的状态，可以在睡眠的时候身体以南北的方向躺下，我现在把这点重复一次。(赛斯在一年多前提过这一点，我相信原因是和地球磁场有关。)(注：睡觉时把头向北是非常好的，但只有在你们的层面。由于磁场的属性，你们的分子会作更高效地排列。第35节)
The reasons do indeed have to do with electromagnetic realities which we have mentioned earlier. I have in mind some experiments that can be done in the future, but I do not suggest them now as you are busy enough. The suggestions have to do with the growing of plants under various conditions.原因的确是和我们之前提到的电磁实相有关。在未来也许我们可以做一些实验，但我不建议现在，你们已经够忙了。这个建议和处在不同情况下植物的生长有关。
Now. It is not likely that I will be heard by anyone for some time in the way that Philip heard me speak. Again, the condition simply happened to be favorable. I have told you that all action is psychic action, but the terms used make little difference. All action does have an electromagnetic reality, which is usually not perceived by the physical senses.现在，菲利普听到我说话的这件事不太可能发生在其他人身上。再一次，这刚好是在很有利的情况下发生的。我曾告诉你们，所有的行动都是心灵的行动，但用这样的名词差别不大。所有的行动都有一个电磁的实相，这通常不会被肉体感官接收到。
The various levels of the self possess this sort of reality. They are actions which are aware of themselves as identities, whether or not such distinctions are made by the ego. They are sensitive to other realities which fall within their particular range, and they repel actions which do not.不同层面的自己拥有这类实相。他们觉察自己本体的行动，不管这样的区分是否为自我所界定。他们对落入他们特定范畴的其他实相是敏感的，而将不属于的行动推开。
For a psychic communication to take place the communication must fall within the particular range of electromagnetic reality that can be picked up by the receiver, and by that particular level of the receiver's self that is able to translate it into meaningful terms. If, that is, you want any kind of proof. Otherwise the communication is simply received and acted upon automatically without leaving a trace. It merely becomes part of a new action, giving no evidence of its source.一场心灵交流的发生，交流必须落在接收者可以收到的电磁实相特定范畴，然后接收者自己的特定层面可以转译这些作为有意义的用语。假如你想要任何证明的话，在另一方面，交流仅只自动地接收和行动，不留一点痕迹。它只变成一个新行动的一部分，所以对它的来源无法给出证明。
For all my humor concerning the particular communication to Philip, I wanted him to be conscious of hearing me. Actually this caused an interruption of action, in order to make the source of the communication stand out in his mind. Otherwise he would have merely automatically recorded my warning, and reacted to it smoothly without any realization on the part of the ego.我所有的感觉关注在和菲利普的特定交流上，希望他可以有意识的听到我。事实上，为了让交流的来源从他的心智中突显出来，这导致了一个行动的中断。否则他只会自动地记下我的警告然后继续流畅的反应，而在自我那部分没有任何意识。
(See page 41 of the 204th session.)(见第204节。)
The sort of things with which we are involved then often imply an interruption of action of this kind, and a translation or transformation of data from one range of electromagnetic energy to another. On those occasions when Ruburt has heard me more or less directly in his psychological time experiments, there has always been on his part a sound quite independent of himself, from outside of himself, of static. If you recall, on several occasions he was so certain of the static that he checked to see if he had left the radio on by mistake.我们涉入的这类事情通常暗示了这种行动的中断，和从一个范畴的电磁能量到另一个范畴的电磁能量，资料的转译或转变。当鲁柏在他的心理时间实验或多或少直接听到我的这种时候，他总是有一个独立自己之外的部分，从外面来的一种静电干扰。如果你记得，有些时候，他如此确定是静电干扰，以至于会检查看看是否不小心把收音机打开了。
The voice seemed to finally be formed, or to rise above this static, and on one occasion the voice was extremely loud.这声音似乎终究被形成，或由静电干扰中升起，曾有一次声音非常大。
(This occasion was June 17,1964, was a psy-time experience of Jane's, and also involved her receipt of information about John Bradley. See the notes in Volume 4, on page 274, for a summary given during the 190th session. Jane says she has had this experience of static from which a voice emerged three times, all during psy-time.(那次是发生在1964年6月17日珍的心理时间，这也和她接收到约翰·布莱德利的讯息有关。请见第190节的摘要。珍说这种声音浮现的电波干扰经验有过三次，都发生在心理时间时。
(Note also that Jane had this experience during what she first thought was a dream on October 15,1965. See the 199th session and the notes on her two dreams. Seth at the time told us the first “dream" was not a dream.)(在1965年10月15日，珍有过这样的经验，她第一次认为是梦。见第199节关于她两个梦的记录。赛斯当时告诉我们第一个“梦”并不是梦。)
This was the result of my attempt to give the voice an independence, to form sound within your physical system without working through Ruburts vocal cords, but to impress your physical system kinetically.这是我试图要给这个声音一个独立性的结果，不通过鲁柏的声带去运作，而是征用你们物质系统的动能，在你们的物质系统里形成声音。
In these instances the electromagnetic components were made to change range, so that they could be picked up by the physical ear. The static was the coming together of the components before the words were formed from them.在这些例子上，电磁组成会改变范畴，然后它们可能被身体的耳朵接收到。静电干扰是当字句被它们形成前，组成成分要聚合起来的时候发生的。
In Philips case, in one way, my job was easier, since the words were not picked up from the outside. He heard them, but clearly, from within.从某方面来说，在菲利普的例子里，我的工作比较容易，因为字句并不是从外界接收到的。他从内在清楚的听到它们。
They could not have been received by the physical ears because the necessary transformation of components had not been made within that range. Now, Ruburt helped me, though consciously he was not aware of this, because of the peculiar circumstances.它们不能被身体的耳朵接收到，因为成分的必要转变并没有在那个范畴里形成。现在，鲁柏帮了我，虽然他在意识上对此并不觉察，因为这是个特殊的状况。
In a trance state the electromagnetic aura that surrounds and is a part of the physical body, changes. The changes can be perceived through the use of several instruments, and by some individuals without instruments. A certain instability is set up electromagnetically that allows the individual to handle greater frequencies and ranges.在出离状态，物质身体一部分围绕着的电磁光改变了。这种改变可以使用几种工具去接收到，但有些人不需要使用工具。某种以电磁性建立的不稳定性，允许了某些个体能掌握更广大的频率和范畴。
In a fully ego-oriented state of consciousness this is not so, for the ego constantly tries to maintain a rigid electromagnetic balance. This is obviously impossible, but in the attempt egotistical identity is helped in its efforts to maintain a more or less closed system of perceptions.在一个完全源自于自我的意识状态并非如此，因为自我会一直试图去维持一个僵化的电磁性平衡。这明显是不可能的，但自我中心本身会试图尽力去维持感知或多或少的封闭性。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:31. Jane had been dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes had been open at times. Her voice was average but her delivery had become quite fast.(9:31休息。珍在第一段出离如常。她的眼睛有时候会张开。她的音量适中，但口述变得有点快。
(When Seth is speaking rapidly I find that I write rapidly in order to keep up, often without much awareness of what I am putting down as far as meaning goes. Because of this I occasionally miss out on asking what may seem like obvious questions. A case in point in the above delivery would be the passage where Seth states: “Now Ruburt helped me, though consciously he was not aware of this, because of the peculiar circumstances.” I would have liked this explained at the time. As it is it must wait for the next session.(当赛斯说话比较快的时候，我发现为了跟上我也写得比较快，常常不怎么意识到我写了什么或那是什么涵义。因为这样，我有时会错过去问一些似乎很明显的问题。例如上一段口述时赛斯说：“现在，鲁柏帮了我，但是他在意识上对此并不觉察，因为这是个特殊的状况。”我当时希望赛斯可以解释更多。但这样的问题必须等到下一节。
(I had planned a question to mention aloud at break, however, and this was simply whether it would have been possible for me to hear the static and the voice at the same time Jane has on her few occasions, had I been present and close to her.(我打算在休息时大声的提一个问题，这问题是，当珍有几次听到电波干扰和声音的同时，如果我在场而且很靠近她的话，也有可能听到吗？
(Jane resumed speaking, with her eyes closed and in an average voice, at 9:43.)(珍在9:43分重新开始说话。她的眼睛闭着，音量适中。)
It should be clearly understood that the physical system with its physical objects are, the objects are, composed from the electromagnetic realities behind them.有一点需要清楚的了解，在物质系统中的物质物件，这些物质物件，是由其后的电磁实相所组成的。
All of these realities are not physically materialized, and some are materialized physically to a stronger or weaker degree than, say, an object regularly accepted as physical.所有这些实相并不都是物质形体化的，有些或多或少程度被物质形体化了的物体，才通常被接受称之为物质。
A dream for example again does not have the solidity of a chair, but a dream does have reality in physical terms. The planets and the stars are materialized more fully than a chair, or similar physical objects. A thought has a particular electromagnetic identity which will fall within a certain range of intensities, and therefore indirectly as you know can be received by another individual who is simultaneously open to that particular range.例如，一个梦并不具有一张椅子的坚固性，但一个梦的确有着物质方面的实相。行星和星辰比起一张椅子或类似的物质物件更完整地被形体化。一个思想有着特定的电磁身分，它会落在特定强度的范畴里，因此会如你所知道的，间接被另一个同时开放在那特定范畴的个体所接收。
(See the sessions from 122, 130, in Volume 3.)(见第三册第122至130节。)
Now, various men in this country and abroad are indeed experimenting quite scientifically with various instruments, and within ten years much of this will be accepted within scientific circles.现在，国内外许多不同的人确实以不同工具十分科学的实验着，10年内更多这样的经验会被科学圈所接受。
(Jane now paused and smiled, her eyes closed.)(珍现在停顿并且微笑，她的眼睛闭着。)
Your question is a nice one. That is, not as simple as you supposed, nor as easy to answer indeed, but we shall have a try at it.你的问题是个好问题，那确实不是如你所认为的那么简单，也不容易回答，但我们还是应该尝试看看。
In the particular instances when Ruburt heard me, I simply do not know whether or not you would have heard me, and there are several reasons for this. I impressed or affected Ruburts ear rather directly because this was the easiest procedure. In other words the actual sound effects, had you been listening, might have appeared as a loud whisper.在鲁柏听到我声音的这个特别的例子中，我真的不知道你能不能听见我，而这有几个原因。我相当直接的加强或影响了鲁柏的耳朵，因为这是最容易的步骤。换句话说，你所听到的实际音效，可能像是一种比较大声的低语。
The volume in Ruburts case was caused by proximity, among other things, and if I set up a small sound very close to him, so that it has an explosive and loud effect; but it was directed in such a manner that it was in a large measure closed off. That is, I affected the physical system but only a small portion of it, but then directed the effect purposefully in one direction.在鲁柏的例子，音量是由接近的其他东西所引发的，如果我发出一个很靠近他的小声音，那会有激增和放大的效果；但它是朝向一个如此特定的方向，以致它的大部分都是被隔离的。那是我只影响了小部分的物质系统，但把音效有目的性地朝向一个方向。
Now if you had been present. I could have formed a larger effect which you could have heard clearly.现在如果你在场的话。我可以形成一个更广大的效果，那么你就能听得清楚。
(“Could you do this sometime during a session?")(“你能偶尔在课堂里那么做吗？”)
We shall see, we may indeed.我们看看，确实有可能可以。
(During the 68th session Seth stated that eventually, as Janes abilities grow, it should be possible for him to speak to us from different locations in the room, independent of Janes position, and that it might also develop that he could speak to us from his own apparition. During this session an apparition was seen by a witness. The phenomenon lasted for upwards of an hour, and we have the drawings of it, made by the witness, Bill Macdonnel, on file. See Volume 1.)(在第68节，赛斯说过，随着珍的能力增长，最后他是有可能从有别于珍的位置、房间的不同角落对我们说话，那也可能发展成他可以从自己的幽灵状态对我们说话。在这节课，一个幽灵被一个参与者目睹。这个现象持续了一小时以上，我们有把它画下来，是由参与者比尔∙麦唐纳所画的，这放在档案里。见第一册。)
There are some matters here involved difficult to explain. It is as if I sealed a portion of your physical system off, so that the voice did not travel outward from it. An invisible cabinet like effect, if you prefer, within which energies were concentrated and directed.在这里有一些情况很复杂，很难去解释。那就好像我关闭了你一部分的身体系统，所以声音没办法到表面。你可以称之为一个隐形的壁柜反应，在其中能量是专注且有方向的。
A small note here: my candle effect was quite legitimate the other evening. This sort of thing will almost always occur without Ruburt’s conscious knowledge for a long time to come. The reason is simply that conscious knowledge of such an effect would inhibit him, regardless of his best intentions, and the energy used would block the action or effect that I was trying to deliver.这里有一个小重点：那晚我的蜡烛效应是十分合理的。当没有鲁柏有意识的知识干预，这类的事总是会发生。原因很简单，对这种效应有意识的知识会妨碍它发生，不管他的最佳意图是什么，被使用的能量会阻挡我试图传送的行动或效应。
(See the notes on the unscheduled session of November 5,1965, on pages 57，58.)(见1965年11月5日临时课的笔记。)
Such effects occur when my own energies are high, and when conditions are excellent. So many conditions are necessary that it does not happen often, though it is possible that the frequency may be quickened in the future.这样的效应会在我自己能量很高昂或状况极佳的时候发生。因为很多条件是必要的，所以它不常发生。虽然发生的频率有可能在未来加快。
I see no reason to specialize, however. I have used the candle twice merely to show Ruburt that I could affect independent objects, and to show you that I could.不过没有必要特殊化。我用了这个蜡烛两次只是要展示给鲁柏看，我可以影响独立的物件，还有展示给你看我可以。
I will suggest your break so that we may tune in on Dr. Instream on time.我建议你们休息，然后我们可以准时感应殷斯翠姆博士。
(Break at 10:05. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes were closed for the most part, her voice average, her pace quite fast. She gave the impression of being really involved in the material this evening, and I was on the point of asking for a break when it came.(10:05休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛大部分时间都闭着，音量适中，速度相当快。她给了几个确实和今晚资料有关的印象，当她这么做的时候，我提出要休息一下。
(Once again Jane spoke quite slowly while giving the 16th Dr. Instream data. Her eyes remained closed for the most part, opening only as she put out a cigarette. Her voice was quiet. Resume at 10:10.)(再次地，珍在给第16次殷斯翠姆博士资料的时候说得十分慢。她的眼睛大部分的时候都闭着，只有在她熄灭香烟的时候才睁开。她的声音轻柔。在10:10分重新开始。)
Now give us a moment. (Pause, one minute long.)现在，等一下。(停顿，一分钟。)
I do not seem to find him at home, and I think of water, and of his walking near the water. (Pause.) In the back, behind his place of residence, and another person with him, I believe a male, though I am not certain of this. (Pause.)他似乎不在家，我想到水，他走路的地方接近水。(停顿)在他住的地方后面，有个人和他走在一起，我想是个男性，虽然我对此并不确定。(停顿)
I do believe it is a male however. (Pause at 10:14.) Perhaps with the initial “R”, or “P”. A conversation having to do with history, particularly eighteenth-century England.不过，我真的认为那是男性。(10:14停顿)或许缩写是“R”或“P”。有一段对话和历史有关，特别是18世纪的英格兰。
The other man seems to have a connection with three women in particular. A conventional relationship, perhaps a wife and two daughters (pause) or a wife and two sisters. (Pause.) The name Erickson is mentioned, and a trip of his, I believe a projected trip. A conversation, the conversation, turns to statistics. Dr. Instream thinks of us during this time however, and now they walk back toward the house. (Pause.) I pick up some connection with a box, a small box, that is in Dr. Instream's possession, and that he may be intending to give to someone as a gift, containing pearls or something of that description. (Pause.)另一个男人似乎特别和3个女人有关。一种传统的关系，可能是妻子和两个女儿(停顿)或妻子和两个姊妹。(停顿)有个名字艾瑞克森(Erickson)被提到，还有他的一次旅行，我想是一次计划中的旅行。一场对话，这场对话转向统计学。不过殷斯翠姆博士在这段时间有想到我们，现在他们正走回这间房间。(停顿)我收到和一个盒子有关，那是殷斯翠姆博士的东西，他可能把它作为礼物送人，里面有珍珠或类似的东西。(停顿)
Could it be his wife’s birthday perhaps? In any case it seems that he intends to give her the box. (Long pause.)会是他妻子的生日吗？不论如何，他似乎打算给她这个盒子。(长的停顿)
The other man may have papers in a briefcase, in which Dr. Instream is interested.另一个男人的公文包里可能有文件，那是殷斯翠姆博士感兴趣的东西。
You may as you prefer take a break or end the session.你可以休息或结束这节。
(“How about giving us Dr. Instreams entity name before we end the session?”)(“可以在结束这节课之前，给我们殷斯翠姆博士存有的名字吗？”)
I would prefer that we wait on this for several reasons. When it is given I want to give other material that is connected with it.因为几个原因，我希望我们等一等。当给名字的时候，我希望能同时给其他相关的资料。
I do not mind speaking to your young friends under good conditions; perhaps the recorder can be utilized at such times, and Ruburt can be put to work typing up any additional notes. The number of sessions will never get out of hand, and we shall always be highly discriminating before we speak to anyone, under any conditions.在良好的状况下，我不介意和你们的年轻朋友说话；在这种时候也许可以使用录音机，鲁柏可以为附加的笔记打字。课程的次数不应该失控，不管任何情况下，在我们对任何人说话之前，总该有高度的辨识力。
My heartiest good wishes. I could speak longer, however out of due consideration I shall not.我最衷心的祝福。我可以说得更久，不过我想我不应该那么做。
You will however find a considerable change in your health, though your health is not poor, if you change the direction of your bed as I have suggested.无论如何，如果你像我所建议的改变床铺方位，将会发现你们的健康有相当大的改善，虽然你们的健康本来就不差。
Good night, my pigeons. I will fly away without flapping my wings, for I am a wise old bird.晚安，我的小鸽子们。我不需要煽动翅膀就可以飞走，因为我是一只有智慧的老鸟。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:29. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her pace toward the end of the session was again fast.(10:29结束。珍出离如常。她的速度在结尾的时候再次加快。
(Jane now remembered that as Seth had spoken about her being able to hear the sound of his voice, the left side of her head and scalp, from the top of her head down to her neck, had tingled very strongly for several minutes. She had never had the sensation before, and found it difficult to put into words.(珍现在想起来，当赛斯说到他可以听到他声音的时候，她的头部和头皮的左半边，从头顶到脖子的地方，持续了几分钟非常强烈的刺痛感。她从来没有这样的感觉，所以很难把它诉诸言语。
(Seth ended the session upon an amused and pleased note.)(赛斯以一种有趣和愉快的语调结束了这一节。)

SESSION 208 第208节 ▲主要、次要实相


NOVEMBER 15, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年11月15日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(No envelope test was held during this session.(这一节没有信封测试。
(The session was held in our back room. Jane spoke while sitting down, and at a rapid rate for the most part. She smoked throughout the session, and her eyes were open most of the time; indeed they opened wide before she had spoken for more than a few minutes. Her voice was average.)(这一节课在我们后面的房间举行。珍坐着，大部分时间以一种比较快的速度说话。她这节课抽着烟，眼睛大部分的时候是睁开的；在她说话的前几分钟里，眼睛睁得很大。她的音量适中。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I am glad to see such a lively discussion immediately before a session, which shows you are on your toes.我很高兴看到课前有这么生动的讨论，那表示你们都准备好了。
I am aware of several matters that you would like me to discuss, and we shall cover them. There are however several points that I would like to make.我明白你们希望我能讨论几个问题，我们会在课堂里涵盖它。不过我想要提出几个重点。
My remark in our last session, concerning the aid that Ruburt subconsciously gave me in connection with the voice effect, did not have to do with the inner voice heard by Philip. I believe this was perhaps an error in your paragraphing.上一节我提到，有关声音效果时鲁柏潜意识给我的帮助，但那和菲利普听到内在声音的事无关，我想这一段你写错了。
(See page 65. Philip is John Bradley’s entity name.)(菲利普是约翰·布莱德利存有的名字。)
Ruburt helped me in producing that voice that he himself heard, simply because of certain electromagnetic alterations that occur within the trance state; and Ruburt was in a trance state upon the specific occasion of which I was speaking.鲁柏帮助我制造出那个他自己听到的声音，因为在出离状态时发生某种电磁的改变；而当我说话的那个特定时刻，鲁柏是在出离状态中。
(See the 190th session in Volume 4 for notes on this. This psychological-time experience of Jane's also involved John Bradley.)(见第4册第190节关于这段的笔记。珍的心理时间经验也和约翰·布莱德利有关。)
It was easier for me to make certain realignments and adjustments of a necessary nature. The other point that I wanted to make was that while your physical time, or clock time, has no overall basic reality, and is not a primary reality, that runs through various fields or systems, it is nevertheless an electromagnetic reality within your own system, for you have created it on mental terms.对我来说，去做一个必要本质的某种调节和调整是比较容易的。另一个我想提的重点是，你的物质时间或时钟时间并非全都是基本实相，它并不是充斥在不同场域和系统间的首要实相，不过是你们自己系统的电磁实相，是你用心智的名号创造出来的。
(Jane, her eyes wide open, was now speaking quite rapidly and with much emphasis. She seemed very involved with the material, swept along with it in an enthusiastic, cooperative way.)(珍的眼睛睁大，现在说得比较快，比较多重点强调。她似乎非常专注于这个资料，以一种热切的、配合的方式表达。)
It is therefore some force to be reckoned with. If it were a primary reality, you would not escape from it even in the sleeping state. Those realities which are primary and basic you can never escape from. This should give you an idea, for those realities which run through all systems, and which are primaries, are those which exist for you in all conditions of consciousness and under any circumstances.它因此会被认为是某种力量。如果它是首要实相，那即使是在睡眠状态，你也无法逃离它。你永远不可能离开那些首要或基本实相。这应该会给你一个想法，那些充斥着所有的系统、而且是首要的实相，是指不管在任何情况、任何意识状态下，对你而言都存在着的实相。
Those realities however which appear only in certain stages of consciousness, are secondaries. This is perhaps one of the most important bits of information I have given you; for if you are bright enough, and I think that you are, then you have a yardstick by which to measure the nature of primary reality, from which all other manifestations are spun.那些只出现在某种意识阶段的实相是次要的。这也许是我给你们最重要讯息中的其中一个；如果你们够聪明，而我认为你们是，那你们就有一个标准，从所有衍生的示现物中，去衡量首要实相的本质。
I have been leading up to this point in my own way, for the dream experiments that we plan will enable you to accumulate in time a list of primaries. I want you however to come across this knowledge on your own, through these experiments, for you will learn more that way.我一直用自己的方式引导你们了解这一点，我们计划的梦实验能让你即时累积首要实相的名单。不过，我想要你们通过这些实验自己去理解这知识，以这种方式你将会学得更多。
If ever in a dream experience you defy gravity, then gravity is not a primary reality, but only a manifestation within your own physical system. If clock time is escaped within the dream state, then clock time is not a primary. What you cannot escape within any range of consciousness, can be called a Primary Condition, and you may capitalize the term.如果在一个梦的经验里，你曾经违反了地心引力，那么地心引力就不是一个首要实相，而只是在你自己物质系统里的一个示现物。如果在梦的状态，你逃脱了时钟时间，那么时钟时间就不是一个首要实相。在任何范畴的意识下你都无法逃离的，才能称之为一个首要状态(Primary Condition)，你可以大写这个名词。
Incidentally, if it is not now known by your scientists, it will be shortly discovered that the physical organism does not age in sleep at the same rate at which it ages in the waking state. Aging, therefore, is not a primary. Again, this does not mean that secondary conditions such as aging and gravity and clock time, do not have effects within your system, obviously. It is only that these must be recognized as secondary conditions that do not therefore basically (underlined) affect the inner self, which is to a large degree independent of your system.附带一提，如果你们的科学家尚未知道这一点，那么它也很快地会被发现，你们物质的有机体，在梦里和醒时衰老的速度并不一样。因此，衰老并不是一个首要实相。再次的，这并不表示像衰老、地心引力，和时钟时间这样的次要状态，在你们的系统里不会有影响，这是很明显的。只是你必须了解次要状态基本上无法(划线)影响内我，它很大程度独立于你们的系统之外。
A recognition of the differences between primary and secondary conditions can however allow you to minimize the effect of the secondary conditions to some considerable degree.认出首要状态和次要状态的不同，能让你相当大程度减缓次要状态的影响。
Here now once more, let me repeat that thoughts are definite electromagnetic realities. Therefore, being actions, they affect all other actions, and if I repeat this in session after session, I do so, so that it will never be forgotten. Therefore these secondary conditions are strengthened through the very act, or misact of thinking that they are primary rather than secondary elements in action.这里让我再重复一次，思想是明显的电磁实相。因此，行动本身，影响了所有其他的行动，如果我重复这一点一节又一节，我是这样做的，那它就永远不会被忘记。因此这些次要状态，会被基于你认为这些行动是首要而非次要元素之思考的正确或不正确行动所强化。
Two men for example, of precisely the same physical age, of precisely the same physical condition, will be in completely different states of mind, of competence, of effectiveness and of strength, as a direct result of their inner beliefs as to their relative freedom within the framework of the physical system in which they exist.比如说，两个人在完全相同的生理年纪，有着完全相同的身体状况，但基于他们内在信念的直接结果，和他们存在的物质系统架构内的相对自由度，他们会有着完全不同的心理状态、能力、效率和强壮程度。
The man who does not realize his basic independence from the physical system will not have the same freedom within it.一个不明了他是基本独立于物质系统的人，不会在其间有着同样的自由。
(Here Jane's voice deepened and became louder momentarily. Her delivery was fast and emphatic, as indicated partially by the underlined words. Her eyes were wide open and very dark.)(这里珍的声音会片刻的低沉和变得大声。她的口述在部分画线的字眼上比较快和有力。她的眼睛睁大，变得非常深邃。)
He will be at all times a prisoner of clock time and of aging, for he will consider these the primary conditions under which he must operate. And the action, or actions involved in this belief will therefore act upon the physical cells of his body with vengeful force, because he has himself directed them to do so.他将永远是一个在时钟时间以及衰老里的囚犯，因为他会认为这是不可避免运作着的首要状态。而这个行动或涉及这个信念的行动，会以一种报复性的力量作用在他身体的物质细胞里，因为他自己会引导它们这么做。
You will find it a most rewarding experience, once these experiments have been begun, for you will yourselves discover the difference between primary and secondary conditions. Obviously the secondary conditions are to some extent necessary for your survival as a physical organism, but you are more than a physical organism now, and you shall be other than a physical organism in your future.你将会发现它是最有报偿的经验，一旦这些经验开始，你自己将会发现首要和次要状态之间的不同。很明显的，次要状态到某种程度对你这个物质有机体的存活是必要的，但是现在，你不只是一个物质有机体，在未来也不该只是一个物质有机体。
And the conditions that are necessary, the primary conditions that are necessary for your existence as other than a physical organism, already exist, therefore, and can be perceived and studied with the equipment which is a part of every individual.而那些必要的状态，那些有别于一个物质有机体、对你的存在是必要的首要状态已经存在，因此可以被每个人内在所具备的装备感知和学习。
Are your hands tired?你的手累了吗？
("No.”(“没有。”
(Actually my writing hand was tiring, but I thought Jane was in an exceptionally good mood, and that she might want to continue. Seth must have caught on though.)(事实上，我写字的手已经累了，但我想珍正处在一种特别好的心情下，她应该想要继续讲下去。赛斯一定是可以感受到的。)
We will shortly take a brief break.我们短暂的休息一下。
I have had several matters to discuss with you; our sessions in general, the matter of spontaneity and discipline, your own fears, rather natural enough, concerning any subconscious effect I might have on Ruburt.我有几件事想和你讨论；关于我们的课，自发性和自律性的问题，你们自己的恐惧，虽然那很自然，却关系着任何我可能对鲁柏潜意识的影响。
Both of you have been concerned with these questions, and they should be discussed. I would not like the matter of the sessions in general, and the subconscious influence question, to go by the board, and in one way or another we must find time for those matters.你们两个都关心这些问题，而它们也应该被讨论。我不想忽视关于我们整体的课，还有潜意识影响的问题，不管用什么方法，我们都要找时间讨论这些问题。
I could have spoken at any time on the question of spontaneity and discipline. It may appear that Ruburt is too easy or too willing to hold sessions. However his ego is very well in control, so well in control that on occasion when I would have spoken on these very matters, I have not been allowed to do so. Of course I realize the time limitations, and others.关于自发性和自律性的问题，我任何时候都可以讲。鲁柏看起来似乎太容易也太愿意举行这些课了。不过他的自我控制得极严，有时候当我想讲这些真正的问题时，却不被允许这么做。当然，我明白时间的限制，和其他的。
One small point: I have never manipulated his subconscious, in any manner. And both of you called me the evening of our last unscheduled session. We will devote some time to this whole matter.一个小重点：不管以任何方式，我从未操纵他的潜意识。是你们两个在上一次临时课的那晚呼唤我出来的。我们会花一些时间来谈这整件事。
Take your break.休息吧。
(Break at 9:31. Jane said she was very well dissociated for a first delivery. She felt that Seth came through as a personality to a good degree. She said she could tell this by feeling her features in unaccustomed positions as Seth delivered the material. Janes eyes were open for most of the session, her delivery very emphatic and fast, her voice about average.(9:31休息。珍说她第一段口述的时候是在非常好的出离状态。她感觉赛斯很大程度上是以一个人格到来的。她说她可以分辨这个是因为当赛斯口述的时候，她的身体会处在一些她不习惯的姿势中。大部分的课，珍的眼睛都是睁开的，她的口述快而有力，音量适中。
(The unscheduled session Seth referred to above is the one held on Friday, November 5, for our four young friends. See the notes about it on page 57. Consciously I had not wanted to have the session, since I thought our guests hadn't had enough time to study related material.(赛斯上面指的临时课，是11月5日星期五为我们4个年轻朋友举行的那一节。意识上我并不想有这节课，因为我认为我们的客人没有足够的时间来学习相关资料。
(Jane resumed in a little slower manner. Her eyes were open part of the time, her voice quieter. Resume at 9:41.)(珍以一种比较慢的方式重新开始。她的眼睛部分时间是睁开的。她的声音较轻。9:41继续。)
Now. If an experience is a part of the waking state, but not a part of the sleeping state, if it is part of the sleeping state but not a part of the waking state, then it is not a primary experience.现在。如果一个经验是醒时状态的一部分，却不是睡眠状态的一部分，如果它是睡眠状态的一部分却不是醒时状态的一部分，那它就不是一个首要经验。
This, again, is not to say that it is not real, but that it is not a primary reality that is more or less constant for the inner self. If an experience is a part of all levels of consciousness—this includes the trance state—then it is a primary experience.再次的。这并不是说那就不是真实的，而是说对内我而言，那就不是一个不变的首要实相。如果一个经验是所有意识层面的一部分——这包含了出离状态——它就是一个首要经验。
Identity of the inner self operates very well within primary conditions. It is dependent upon primary conditions. Its manipulation of primary conditions gives it the knowledge of itself. Identity is retained within the dream state, is it not?内我本体在首要状态下运作得非常好。它依赖着首要状态，对首要状态的操纵给了有关它自己的知识。本体即使在梦的状态也维持着，不是吗？
(“Yes.”)(“是的。”)
Yet within the dream state the familiar physical props sometimes disappear. The inner I operates very well without them. In order to manipulate a physical reality however, the inner I needs a self that is acclimated to physical conditions; hence the ego.但在梦的状态，熟悉的物质支柱有时会消失。没有它们，内在的我也可以运作得非常好。不过为了操纵一个物质实相，内在的我需要一个可以适应物质状态的自己；那就是自我。
As you know therefore we have differentiated between an outer ego, who manipulates within physical reality, and an inner ego who directs the activities of the inner self. Now then, the next step should indeed be clear. In the main, the ego deals with secondary realities, and in the main, the inner ego deals with primaries.因此如你们所知，我们区分一个外在自我，它操纵着物质实相，和一个内在自我，它指挥着内我的活动。那么现在，下一步就应该很清楚了。基本上，自我处理次要实相，而内在自我处理首要实相。
Nevertheless primaries also exist within the physical universe, and secondaries appear often as props within the dream world.不过首要实相也存在于物质宇宙中，而次要实相常常是以支柱的形式出现在梦的世界。
Again, none of these issues are clear-cut, and the distinctions, many of them, are for simplicity’s sake. Many primaries will show secondary characteristics. For example, within your clock time there are definite primary characteristics of time as it exists in a primary condition.再次的，这些问题都不是能清楚划分的，很多的区别都是简化了的。很多首要的会显示出次要的特质。例如在你们的时钟时间之内，有着明显的首要特质，以一个首要状态存在着的时间。
Once more, even the word time is misleading, but within the boundaries of your clock reality every individual feels at times—but you see that the use of the word itself binds us—but every individual feels now and then the primary sense of existence that is not arbitrarily divided into moments and hours; and he therefore escapes from a secondary condition into the realization of a primary reality behind it. A consistent, carefully recorded and extended examination of the dream state will, once more, permit you to compare those conditions and realities which show themselves in both the waking and dream states.再次的，即使是时间这个字眼都是容易误导的，但在你们时钟实相的分界线，每一个个体偶尔都会感到——但是你们看，字眼本身的使用就会束缚了我们——但是，每一个个体偶尔都会感觉到，存在的首要感觉并不能被武断地分割为瞬间或是小时；因此他逃离了一个次要状态，而进入了对在其背后首要实相的理解。一个持续地、仔细地对梦状态的记录和长期的检视，会容许你去比较那些在醒时和做梦状态都同时显示着的状态和实相。
I believe that it is close to our appointment time. I will allow you a brief break.我想我们的课接近尾声了。我让你短暂休息一下。
(Break at 9:59. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained open much of the time, although her delivery had been slower. She had still been quite emphatic in speaking. She said she had not been conscious of anything else while speaking; that is, Jane heard no other noises, etc.(9:59休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛大部分的时间都是睁开的，虽然她的口述有点慢，说话时仍十分有力。她说当她在说话时，没有意识到任何事；那是指珍没有听到其他的噪音等等。
(This is the 17th Dr. Instream test data.(这是第17次殷斯翠姆博士测验的资料。
(During break I turned on an electric heater that has a fan for circulating the air. It makes a gentle sound we are used to, and I inadvertently left it on when Jane began speaking again. As usual she now sat with her eyes closed and her hands to her face. Her voice was quiet, her pace slow. Resume at 10:06.)(在休息的时候，我打开一个电热器，它有风扇可以循环空气。它发出一个我们都很习惯的柔和声音，当珍再次说话的时候，我没注意，仍让它开着。就像平常一样，她现在坐着，眼睛闭着，手放在脸上。她的声音轻柔，速度缓慢。10:06分重新开始。)
Now give us a moment.现在等一下。
Simply, Joseph, for our test turn off your machine, please.约瑟，为了我们的测验，请关掉你的机器。
(I did so.)(我关了。)
Thank you. (Pause.)谢谢。(停顿)
I pick up a strong connection with Dr. Instream and two other men this evening, with whom he has been particularly involved.我感应到殷斯翠姆博士在今晚和另外两个男人有强烈的关联，是特别和他有关系的人。
One is some years younger, and one approximately, in any case, of his own generation. One has dark hair, one has blondish or white hair. This second man wears glasses. (Pause.)一个比他年轻几岁，另一个大概和他同辈。一个是深色头发，另一个是金色或白色头发。第二个人戴着眼镜。(停顿)
I will change this—forgive me. The dark-haired man wears glasses.抱歉——我更改一下。深色头发的男人戴眼镜。
They have been together today, or are together now, the three of them in an office, I believe; though I am not certain, Dr. Instreams office.他们今天一整天都在一起，或是现在在一起，我想他们三个在办公室；虽然我不确定，在殷斯翠姆博士的办公室。
It seems that although this is somehow connected with the university, that their particular conversation has to do with a matter that will be carried on without official university knowledge. (Pause. Janes pace was faster now.)看起来似乎和大学多少有些关联，但他们对话的事件大学官方并不清楚。(停顿。珍的速度现在比较快。)
I believe a woman is involved, though she is not at this meeting, but seems to have something to do with the matter under consideration. One man has recently been on a long trip. The light-haired man.我想涉及了一个女人，虽然他不在这个聚会里，但似乎和他们在考虑的这个情况有关联。其中一个男人最近有趟长途旅行。浅色头发的男人。
There is a secondary mention of money, though I do not believe it is directly connected with the main matter. (Pause.) I also believe that Dr. Instream had a drink of a liquor which he is not accustomed to drinking as a rule. (Pause.) That he would not ordinarily choose, for example.再次提到金钱，虽然我不认为这和主要情况有直接关系。(停顿)我也相信殷斯翠姆博士在喝一杯不是平常习惯喝的酒。(停顿)，比如那不是他平常会选择的酒。
I see the woman in a connection with yellow or gold.我看到这个女人和黄色或金色有关联。
She is in the background of this matter. I believe there are plans for a future meeting when snow will be on the ground. One of the men has a daughter who is sickly, ailing at present. Perhaps with an illness connected with the lungs. (Pause at 10:16.)她和这个状况有关。我想他们打算未来在下雪的时候再聚。其中一个男人的女儿目前生着病，身体很弱。也许是一种和肺部有关的疾病。(10:16停顿)
An indication here of the possibility of an automobile accident for one of the men within a six-month period. (Pause.) On a corner by a large brick building, red building. The accident possibility not applying to Dr. Instream.这里显示了其中一个男人在6个月内会遇到交通意外的可能性。(停顿)在一栋大型砖造、红色建筑物的转角。这个意外的可能性并不是指殷斯翠姆博士。
It is not a fatal accident, for the man involved, in any case. And again, this is only a possibility, and many circumstances could change this. (Pause.)无论如何，对涉及的男人来说，这并不是一场致命的意外。再次的，只是一个可能性，很多情况下可能会改变。(停顿)
The light-haired man is the one with which I feel the accident connection, and if it occurs it will be a direct result of his reaction to a letter.浅色头发的男人是我感觉会和这个意外有关的人，如果这发生了，会是他对一封信反应的直接结果。
Dr. Instream has been to a store this evening. (Pause.) There are some papers due. He is late with them, on a business matter.殷斯翠姆博士今晚去了一家商店。(停顿)有些文件到期。他迟到了，是关于公事的。
I seem also to think of a lease, but do not know to what this refers.我似乎也想到了一个契约，但不知道这指的是什么。
Now, you may take a short break and we will continue, or end the session as you prefer.现在，你可以短暂休息一下，然后我们再继续，或如果你想的话，我们可以结束这一节。
(‘‘We’ll end it then.”)(“那我们就结束吧。”)
Then I wish you all my heartiest regards and good wishes.那么我衷心地祝福你们。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:21. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed during the delivery, her voice had been average, her pace also about average toward the end of the material.)(10:21结束。珍出离如常。她的眼睛在口述时仍闭着，音量适中，在接近尾声的时候，她的速度恢复正常。)

SESSION 209 第209节 梦记录的训练(续)


NOVEMBER 17, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年11月17日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(No envelope test was held during the session.(这节课没有信封测试。
(The session was held in our back room. Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed for the most part during the first half of the session. Her pace was good for the most part, her voice average.)(这节课在我们后面的房间举行，珍坐着说话，在课的前半段，她的眼睛大部分时间都是闭着的。她的速度大部分时候都很好，她的音量适中。)
Now then, good evening.现在，晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
This business of primaries and secondaries will concern us for some time, and in more ways than you suppose. For we are outlining the stages of an investigation of the nature and conditions of consciousness.我们将会用比你所以为更多的方式，关注首要和次要问题一段时间。我们会概述对意识的本质和情境的研究阶段。
Whether or not you realize it, you have already begun such an investigation, and Ruburt's careful notes and recordings of his dreams, over nearly a three-year period, and your own dream recordings, are only the beginning.不管你明不明白，你都已经开始了这样的研究，将近三年来鲁柏对他的梦小心记录和做笔记，还有你自己梦的记录，这些都只是开始而已。
So far you have analyzed these dreams as best you could, but soon you will begin to look at them in a new way. The dream experiments with the recorder will be much more proficient. These investigations will also deal with a systematic examination into all levels of consciousness.到目前为止你尽可能地去分析这些梦，但很快地，你会开始以一种新的方式看待它们。你们会对在录音带里的这些梦实验更熟练。这样的研究也将会对意识的所有层面做个系统考察。
Autohypnosis then will be utilized in an effort to discover what experiences are common in various levels or trance states, and these shall be examined in a search for primary and secondary conditions. These experiments however are for the future. Some of the data I will give you as a guide, but much you shall do on your own.
