There is no way to probe the realities of consciousness except that a personality travels through all levels of consciousness open to him, and do so in such a way that he can retain and apply the information that he receives in these inner travels.然后努力利用自我催眠去发现在不同层面或出离状态，什么经验才是共通的，而这些经验将会在寻找首要和次要状态时被检验。不过这些实验是在未来。有一些我给你的资料是作为引导，但大部分你应该自己来。一个人格除了旅行过所有展开在他面前的意识层面，没有其他方法去探究意识的实相，而以这种方式这么做，他能保留和应用这些从内在旅行中得到的讯息。
The potentialities of human personality cannot be examined as one would crack open a nut to see what is inside. The dream experience is a living, moving action. To some extent it can never be captured, but we shall capture enough of it for our purposes. And the suggestion which I have given you will, after some practice, allow you to awaken and speak the dream into your recorder almost automatically.人类人格的潜力，不能以敲开一个核桃看看里面是什么的这种方式去检验。梦的经验是一个活生生的、会动的行动。它到某种程度是不可能被捕捉的，但为了我们的目的，我们还是要尽量去捕捉。而我给你的建议，经过一些练习，将会让你几乎是自动醒来，然后对着你的录音机说出你的梦。
And now, if Ruburt worries that he does not carry his share of the work load, because you spend so much time typing our sessions, then the work of typing the dream experiences, both his and your own, shall be his. These dream records shall be kept continually throughout the years, and will yield valuable information. Information, incidentally, that can stand quite on its own regardless of my connection with it, and it shall be added to your life’s work.而现在，如果鲁柏担心他没有分担这个工作，因为你已经花了这么多时间为我们的课打字，那么这项为他和你的梦经验打字的工作，应该由他来做。这些梦的记录应该保存几年，那么就会产生很有价值的讯息。顺带一提，讯息本身会为它自己说话，不管我和它的连结是什么，它应该被加入你们的终生工作里。
I now suggest a brief break.我现在建议短暂休息一会。
(Break at 9:14. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first break, and was somewhat surprised that Seth broke his delivery so soon. Her pace had been good, her eyes had remained closed.(9:14休息。珍在第一段出离如常，她有点惊讶赛斯这么快就中断了他的口述。她的速度良好，眼睛仍闭着。
(Her eyes began to open at times now as the session progressed. First they were narrowly open, then later opened quite wide. Her pace was a bit slower, and she was smoking as she resumed at 9:20.)(在课进行的时候，她的眼睛有时候会睁开。刚开始是微微地睁开，后来就睁得很大。她的速度有点慢，在9:20重新开始的时候，她正在抽烟。)
Now. There are indeed common mental experiences that exist in all levels of consciousness, and these are what we shall be after.现在，意识的所有层面中，的确有着共同的心理经验存在，而这些是我们要寻找的。
Your records must be immaculately kept. The material will indeed serve for several books for Ruburt, and I suggest that serious thought be given to the bedroom setup so that the recorder is easily accessible. An extremely dim light may be used if necessary. As the experiments continue you should automatically be able to switch the recorder off and on in the dark.你的录音带一定要好好地保存。这些资料会在鲁柏的好几本书里帮到他，我建议卧房的摆置仔细地想过，录音机要放在很容易取得的地方。如果必要时可以点亮些微灯光。在实验进行时，你最好能在黑暗中自动的开关录音机。
I mentioned earlier that with training you can do this in your sleep. You have no idea as yet of the amount of data that can be obtained through these efforts. The dreams will be scrutinized for many elements. Some you are familiar with and some you are not.我之前提过，经过练习，你即使在睡梦中也可以这么做。对经过这样的努力能得到多少资料，你还没有概念。梦中的很多元素会被认真检查。有一些是你熟悉的，有一些是你不熟悉的。
The action performed within the dream; the location; the lack of specific location; the time in which the dream appears to occur; the apparent movements through time within any given dream; the emotional content; the surface psychological content; the work done within the dream; the familiar persons spoken to; the unfamiliar persons spoken to; the relation of the dream to past events and to events immediately preceding sleep; the dream events in relation to future events; messages that are given or sent in sleep.梦里完成的行动；地点；缺乏具体的地点；梦发生的时间；在任一个特定的梦里透过时间的表层活动；情感的内容；表层心理的内容；梦里完成的工作；曾说过话的熟人；曾说过话的陌生人；与过去事件和睡前发生事件相关的梦；和未来事件相关的梦；在梦中收到和传送的讯息。
Dreams will be categorized in various ways when enough of them are gathered. You will find I believe that particular kinds of dreams occur with definite seasonal variations. Particular interest should be given to the space that you perceive within a dream. Are you, for example, aware only of the specific location in which the activities happen, or are you aware of a further space extent?当搜集得够多，梦可以用不同的方式来分类。你将会发现我说的，有特定的梦会发生在明显季节变化的时候。在梦中应该要特别注意你感知到的空间。例如，你只觉察到活动发生的特定地点，或你觉察到更进一步的空间范围？
You will learn to take a certain portion of purpose with you through suggestion, so that you can attempt to enlarge the dream space of which you are first aware. You can extend it in other words. The investigation will always be concerned with the search for primaries and secondaries. On many occasions an apparent primary reality will later be seen to be secondary, as a result of experiments with the trance state.透过暗示你将会学习带着一部分特定的目的，因此你能试图去扩展你首先觉察到的梦的空间。换句话说，你能扩展它。这个研究的重点将会关注在寻找首要和次要实相上。在很多时候，因为出离状态实验的结果，一个表面上的首要实相会在后来被视为次要实相。
Your psychological-time experiments will serve you well in the future in relation with these endeavors. We shall of course set you about studying the conscious state also. We shall have you using your physical senses to a much higher degree than is normal with you now.因为这些努力，你的心理时间实验会在未来帮你很大的忙。我们当然也应该让你学习意识状态。我们应该使用你的身体感官到比现在正常使用更高的程度。
(Jane's eyes had been wide open during much of the last two pages of material. As in the last session her delivery had been quite enthusiastic and definite. Much of the time she had been smiling.)(珍的眼睛在最后两页资料的时候睁大。就像在上一节她口述时那样的热情和明确。大部分的时间她都在微笑。)
The investigation will allow you to probe into the realities of conscious wakefulness, extending your sensual perceptions so that you can probe further outward into physical reality. This is indeed an ambitious project. We shall proceed as we always do, slowly but steadily; and you shall change along the way, for the very actions involved will change you. I might add for the better.这个研究将让你探究醒时意识的实相，扩展你的感官感知，所以你能朝外探究更进一步的物质实相。这的确是个雄心万丈的工程。我们应该像平常进行的那样，缓慢但持续；沿着这个方向你将会改变，这些涉及的真正行动会改变你。我应该这么说，是往更好的方面。
("Good ’’)(“很好。”)
You will learn to deal with primaries, while giving secondary realities their due. Give unto Caesar the things that are Caesars... I am sure you see what I mean.当你更了解次要实相的时候，将更能学习处理首要实相，把凯撒的还给凯撒……我相信你明白我的意思。
("Yes.”(“是的。”
(Again Seth was very amused.)(再次地，赛斯觉得很有趣。)
All of these projects are interconnected, and they will help both of you in your writing and painting, and greatly increase your capabilities in your own fields. Again, we shall proceed cautiously, precisely but steadily, and always you shall be in control. But when we are finished, and it will not be for a long time, you should be able to travel from any state of consciousness to another and back again, safely, with full awareness of your identity.所有这些计划都是互相连结的，而它们将会有助于你们两个的写作和画画，大幅度增加你们自己领域里的能力。再次的，我们应该小心进行，确实且持续，你们应该总是在可以掌控的状态。当我们完成的时候，而那并不会很久，你应该可以从任何一种意识状态旅行至另一种意识状态，然后再次安全地回来，伴随着对你身分的完全觉知。
For your identity is dependent upon primary reality, which is a certain kind of action, and all of this will lead to heightened consciousness under all circumstances.你的身分依赖着首要实相，而这是某种行动，而所有这些都会引导你在任何情况下加强意识。
As a side benefit, ultimately, recall of past lives may be achieved, and a synthesization, by yourself, of your past personalities.最后，一个附带的好处是，你可能会想起所有的前世，还有你自己和前世人格的综合体。
Hypnosis is not generally understood in its true light. The hypnotist is not necessary except as a director; and indeed in most cases such a director is necessary. But the hypnotic state is simply a level of awareness in which the personality is freewheeling, so to speak, dissociated from physical reality in its usual terms.催眠的真实面貌并不为人所了解。除非是以一个指导者，否则催眠师并不是必要的；但的确在大部分情况下，这样的指导者是必要的。但是催眠状态仅仅是一种层面的意识，在那种状态下，人格是无拘无束的，且是和一般所处的物质实相出离的。
He is still dependent upon it symbolically, however, generally speaking. The inner ego however can be utilized in such a dissociated state as such a director of activities, with sufficient training. I must emphasize that indeed years of training are required. But then the experience is ten times more rewarding and informative.不过一般而言，他仍象征性的依赖着它。透过充分的训练，在这样一个出离状态下，内在自我可以被用来成为行动的指导者。我必须强调几年的训练是必要的。但这个经验会提供你10倍以上的报偿和信息。
You have what you may think of then as a split action, where one portion of the self, the inner ego, is allowed to travel through the other states of action that compose the whole self, purposefully as a director, and retain the knowledge thereby received.你可能会认为这是个分裂的行动——当一部分的自己，内在自我，有目的性地以一个指导者，被允许去游历过组成全我的其他状态的行动，并保留因此而得到的知识。
You may now take another break, as I believe I have been speaking too swiftly for you.你可以再休息一下，我想我对你们说得太快了。
("Fast enough, Seth.”(“非常快，赛斯。”
(Break at 9:47. Jane was dissociated as usual, she said. Her pace had indeed been fast, her voice average, her eyes wide open much of the time. She had smoked almost steadily.(9:47休息。珍说她出离如常。她的速度确实很快，音量适中，大部分时间眼睛都睁大着。她几乎一直在抽烟。
(An overall impression I have is that Seth is very interested in the forthcoming dream-recording project, and that along with various tests this will occupy us for a long time. Jane and I have made a tentative recording setup in the bedroom, and probably will begin experimenting with it soon.(我整体的印象是，赛斯对即将来到的，梦的记录计划非常感兴趣，而这些不同的测验将会占据我们很长一段时间，珍和我在卧房弄了一个暂时的录音装备，可能会很快地开始实验。
(Again Jane began speaking at a fast rate and with emphasis. Her eyes were open, after closing briefly at the start of the delivery. Resume at 9:58.)(再次的，珍以一种快速有力的方式说话。她的眼睛在一开始口述时短暂闭上，然后睁开。在9:58分重新开始。)
I have only one small point to make here before we have our appointment with Dr. Instream.在我们和殷斯翠姆博士的约会开始前，我只有一个重点要提出来。
This, if I may say so, is an excellent idea. It is this. Once a week to begin with, you will suggest before sleeping that you send a particular message, which you have written down, to another person whose name is also given on the piece of paper, that is of course dated.我可以这样说，这是一个极好的主意。方法如下。刚开始一周一次，你在睡前暗示自己送出一个特定的讯息给另一个人，讯息内容和这个人的名字都写在纸上，写上日期。
This information to be sent by you in the dream state. It will not be restrained by the ego to any large degree. There will be some difficulties here however, since the information, if legitimately sent, will be picked up by the individual in his own dreams, and therefore may escape detection. For this reason an order, may be in order, if you will forgive my pun, such as “come and see me Thursday afternoon."讯息是由你在梦的状态下送出的。它在很大程度上不会被自我给限制。不过这里会有一些困难，因为这个讯息如果被合理的送出，那将会被那个人在他自己的梦里接收到，但也有可能他会觉察不到。因为这个原因，一个指令是需要的，如果你不介意我的双关语，就像“星期四下午过来看我”。
This idea is not fully developed however, and is in the future, but we should work out a definite plan along these lines. And for curiosity’s sake, Ruburt may send you a message in such a manner, which he has of course earlier written out and concealed, and you may do the same, as a warming-up exercise.这个想法还没有完全的发展成熟，不过我们应该就这部分在未来订定一个明确的计划。为了满足你们的好奇心，鲁柏可以用这种方式送给你一个讯息，当然他事前要把它写下来封好，你也可以做同样的事情，把它当成一个暖身运动。
Now, give us a moment please.现在，请给我们一点时间。
(It was 10:02. Jane’s eyes closed, even though she was smoking. She sat with her head down and a hand to her face. Her voice was quiet. Her pace was fairly good in the beginning of the test but eventually slowed considerably. This is the 18th Dr. Instream test.)(现在是10:02分。珍的眼睛闭着，即使她正在抽烟。她坐着，头低着，一只手放在脸上。她的声音轻柔。她的速度在测验开始前相当好，但终于慢了下来。这是第18次殷斯翠姆博士测验。)
A room with very high ceiling, small, that is almost taller than it is wide. A chair inside upon which our friend sits. A light bulb directly above, and a book in his hands or on his lap. With many pictures.一个房间里有很高的天花板，很小，高度几乎长过宽度。我们的朋友坐在中间的椅子上。一个灯泡在他的正上方，一本书在他的手上，或是他的腿上。书里有很多照片。
Copyright date 1903, or 1933, with handwriting inside the first page. (Pause.) A bookmark that reminds me of a fabric, of natural color, as of bamboo color. (Pause.)著作日期1903年或1933年，第一页里有手写的笔迹。(停顿)一张书签让我联想到布料，一种自然的颜色，像竹子的颜色。(停顿)
He has told someone else of these particular experiments with us, and that person is particularly aware of him this evening. (Pause.)他告诉另一个人这些和我们的特别实验，而这个人今晚有特别想到他。(停顿)
The other person, a male, is an excellent receiver, by the way, and is partially in contact with Dr. Instream this evening. Whether or not he is consciously aware of this, I do not know.顺便说一下，这另一个人，男性，是一位极佳的接收者，特别在今晚和殷斯翠姆博士有接触。我不知道他是否有意识地觉察到这个。
This other man is at a party of sorts, a gathering. (Pause at 10:07.) Dr. Instreams own experiments in hypnosis are now going well, and he received a particular communication yesterday in regard to them. Either then, or the communication was sent yesterday.这另一个人正在某种聚会的场合。(停顿10:07) 殷斯翠姆博士自己的催眠实验进行得相当好，他昨天收到了关于它们的特定信息，或这信息是昨天送出去的。
(Janes eyes now opened briefly.)(珍的眼睛短暂睁开。)
I get the number 3 4 1, but do not know to what it refers. Also some turbulence in domestic rather than professional affairs for today. Having to do with a relative, and a variation in usual schedules, daily schedules. (Pause.)我接收到数字341，但不知道它指的是什么。今天也发生一些骚乱，是在家庭上而不是工作上。和一个亲戚有关，还有一个日常的行程有变动，每天的行程。(停顿)
An annoying physical symptom also, I believe in the left hand. Merely irritating. A nervous reaction of functional nature.一个烦人的身体症状，我想是在左手。只是有点让人心烦。一个功能本质上的神经性反应。
(Jane took a long pause at 10:11, sitting quite still and with her eyes closed.)(珍在11:11有个长的停顿，她坐得相当直，眼睛闭着。)
He appears unusually tired this evening. He says “Now see here, Seth, lets have something definite,” and puts his hand out, like this.他今晚看来似乎特别的疲倦。他说“现在看这里，赛斯，来一点明确的吧”，然后举高他的手，像这样。
(Here Jane held out and up her doubled up right hand. She took another long pause at 10:14.)(珍在这里伸出她的右手，举高，她在10:14有另一个长的停顿。)
I pick up also the number 5. Something to do with a document. He turns to the left now, and reaches up high, and takes down an object. (Pause.) Oval, with initials on it, or I am connecting the initials with it. It was given to him by the man with whom he was speaking the other evening, by the water, as we mentioned then.我也接收到数字5，和一个文件有关。他现在转向左边，伸手从高处拿下一个物件。(停顿)椭圆形的，有缩写在上面，或我和这缩写有关联。这是在另一个晚上和他说话的那个男人给他的，在水边，我们之前提过的。
The man has left now, on a trip I believe.这男人现在离开了，我想是去旅行了。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:17. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had opened but once as noted, her pace had varied considerably. She resumed at a good speed, her eyes opening and closing, at 10:25.)(10:17休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛只有一次睁开，速度变动得相当大。她以一种平稳的速度重新开始，眼睛在10:25睁开又闭上。)
I am giving you a brief session because of our last long one.我给你简短的一节，因为上一节课很长。
On some occasion however I do want to discuss this matter of our sessions, as to when they should and should not be held; and I repeat: in no way do I ever attempt to influence Ruburt’s subconscious mind.不过有些时候，我真的想讨论关于我们课程的这个议题，它们什么时候应该，什么时候又不应该举行；然后我再重申一次；我从不曾意图影响鲁柏的潜意识心智。
(Jane's eyes opened wide as she looked at me.)(珍看向我的时候眼睛睁得很大。)
Now, I do not see you, as a rule, as a series of separate compartments, but rather more in your entirety. It is therefore difficult for me to make distinctions as to your conscious intent and subconscious intent. And in many cases your subconscious intent comes through strongly.现在，在多数情况下，我并不是以一连串分隔开的方式来看你们，而是以一种整体的方式，因此对我而言，去区分你们与潜意识的意图是有困难的。在许多情况下，你们潜意识的意图反而更强烈。
The particular unscheduled session which bothered you both apparently was the one which was requested subconsciously by you both; and it benefited those for whom we gave it to a rather considerable degree.表面上看起来似乎困扰着你们的这节特殊的临时课，其实是你们两个潜意识要求的；而且它相当大程度地有益课里的成长。
(This would be the unscheduled session held on the evening of Friday, November 5, for our four young friends. See my brief notes on this prefacing the 206th session.)(这里指的是11月5日星期五晚上，为我们4个年轻朋友举行的临时课。请看第206节前言里我简短的注记。)
There is conscious discipline which can be used by Ruburt, that can negate the subconscious permission, if you so determine, and this with practice will come very easily. As entireties—I use the phrase purposely—however, you respond to many influences that may or may not result in a session.鲁柏用意识上的自律来否定潜意识的许可，如果你们够有决心，再加上练习，将可以非常轻易地克服。以一个整体，我有目的的用这个措辞——无论如何，你们会对许多影响起反应，不论那影响是否来自于我们的课。
(Jane and I tried an experiment involving one of the young couples that witnessed the unscheduled session of November 5. We saw them the next Friday evening also, November 12. We answered many of their questions during the evening. During the evening Jane felt that Seth could have easily come through, but in the interests of our experiment she did not allow him to. Seth accepted her decision, she told me at the time, gracefully and did not make any effort to go against her wishes.)(珍和我做了一个实验，和11月5日参与临时课的一对年轻夫妻有关。我们在11月12日下一周的星期五晚上又看到他们。那个晚上我们回答了很多他们的问题。在那晚珍感觉到赛斯可以很容易的透过来，但为了我们的实验，她不允许他这么做。她告诉我，赛斯优雅的接受了她的决定，而且没有努力去违反她的意志。)
In any case, there are simply certain circumstances that I have set up myself as a system of balances, so that the number of sessions will stay within reason, within your idea of reason. You are perfectly capable, and Ruburt is perfectly capable, ideally speaking, of holding five sessions a week without ill effects. I do realize that this is highly impractical, so you have no worries in this regard.无论如何，有个简单且确定的情况，那就是我把我自己设为一个系统的平衡者，因此课的数量会维持在一个合理的范围，以你们角度的合理。理想上来说，一周举行5次课对你是没问题的，对鲁柏也是完全没问题的，而且不会有不好的影响。但我明白这是很不现实的，所以在这方面你们不用担心。
I do want to point out however that the only circumstance here, or mistake to make regularity a disadvantage, is the practical, physical inconvenience which would be from your end most annoying. And Ruburt would be the first one to rebel.不过，我想指出的是，这次的特例课有其实际用处。虽然它打破了定期课的好处，造成了你们现实上的不便，成为你们这端的困扰，而鲁柏会是第一个反对的。
You may do as you prefer now. I will end the session or continue along these lines.现在你们可以选择你们想要的。我会结束这节或持续这些话题。
(“Well end it then.”)(“我们结束吧。”)
My heartiest regards to you both.我衷心地祝福你们。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安,赛斯。”
(End at 10:34. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes opened at times, her voice was average, her pace rather fast.)(10:34结束。珍出离如常。她的眼睛有时候睁开，音量适中，速度稍快。)

SESSION 210 第210节 海伦•戴尔的肿瘤 信封17


NOVEMBER 22, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年11月22日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(The 17th envelope test was held during this session. The test object, sealed in the usual double envelopes, was the insurance slip for the manuscript of Jane's ESP book, dated August 30,1965. A drawing of it is not necessary since the test data did not coincide by a wide margin. The data, and Seth’s explanation of the results, appear in their regular places in the session.(这一节课举行了第17次信封测验。测验的物件被封在普通的信封里，是珍ESP书手稿的投保单，上面的日期是1965年8月30日。物件的描绘是不必要的，因为测验资料与结果并不相符。这资料和赛斯对结果的解释以同样方式收录在这节里。
(At 8:30 PM this evening our landlady, Marian Spaziani, and a friend of hers visited us briefly. Marian and her friend, Helen Dyer, both know of the sessions but have not witnessed any. Helens husband recently died after an operation for lung cancer; this evening Helen described to Jane a recent experience in which she felt her husband was speaking to her while she slept. Helen told us she has dreamed of her husband many times, but felt this particular experience was something other than a dream; she stressed its clarity, its reassurance and simplicity.(今晚8:30，我们的房东太太玛丽安•史帕日尼和她的一个朋友短暂地来拜访我们。玛丽安和她的朋友海伦•戴尔(Helen Dyer)都知道我们的课，但并没有参加过。海伦的丈夫最近在肺癌手术后过世；海伦告诉珍她最近的一个经历，她感觉丈夫在她睡着的时候对她说话。海伦告诉我们她梦见丈夫很多次，但她感觉这个特别的经验和做梦不同；她强调它的清晰、确实和简单。
(It might be mentioned here that quite a few sessions ago Seth dealt with a similar vivid experience of Marians, in which she received a message from the father of her husband; the father died perhaps a year ago. See the 100th and 101st sessions.(这里要提到几节课之前，赛斯曾处理过玛丽安类似的逼真经验，那次她收到公公的讯息；她公公大约是一年前过世的。见第100和101节。
(The session was held in our back room. Jane spoke while sitting down, in a quiet voice for the most part. Once again she was smoking as the session began; this meant her eyes had to open at least narrowly to find the ashtray, but she was looking down in the act and I could not actually tell whether or not they did open. Jane's pace was quite slow, with many pauses, in the beginning. I should note here that Marian and Helen left us at 8:55, and that Helen lives just a block from us.)(这节课在我们后面的房间举行。珍坐着说话，大部分时候都是以一种轻柔的语调。再次的，在课开始的时候，她抽着烟；这表示她在寻找烟灰缸的时候，至少眼睛有微微地睁开，但她那时正看着下方，因此我不确定她的眼睛有没有睁开。珍的速度在开始时有点慢，有很多停顿。我在这里应该注明，玛丽安和海伦在8:55分时离开了，海伦住在离我们一条街外的地方。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(Jane now took a long pause, quite an unusual procedure after the opening salutation.)(现在珍有一个长的停顿，在开始的问候语之后，这并不寻常。)
I find myself following the two woman who have just left here. They are on their way, or rather, have just arrived at the home of the woman who lives in this town. They will have a long chat together.我发现我自己跟随着那两个离开这里的女人。她们正在路上，或是刚抵达住在镇上那女人的家。她们会聊很久。
I pick up an incipient malignancy in the woman whose husband recently died. I believe in the abdomen. I say incipient because the condition is momentarily at a point where it can develop cancerous globules; or the condition, a beginning tumor, can retreat and shrink, and entirely disappear, according to the inner climate of the womans psyche.我接收到这个刚死了丈夫的女人有初期的肿瘤。我想是在腹部。我说初期是因为此时这个情况只是暂时的，有可能会发展成癌肿瘤，或这个初期的肿瘤有可能缩小或完全消失，就看这女人心灵的内在氛围。
(Jane delivered the above paragraph with many pauses.)(珍口述上一段时有很多的停顿。)
She is balanced on a thin line of normalcy at this time. I am speaking organically here. Despair and self-destructive tendencies can so alter the chemical composition that a malignant tumor could develop, again in the abdominal area.她现在正平衡在一个正常状态的边缘。我这里说的是器官上的。绝望和自我毁灭的倾向能改变化学成分，而进一步发展成恶性肿瘤，再次的，是在腹部的位置。
It may not so develop, and subconsciously she is aware of this. I do not intend, particularly, that this information should be passed on at all. I am merely giving you the information because I picked it up during her visit.也可能不会这样发展，而潜意识她是觉知到这点的。我并不特别想要把这个讯息告诉她。我给你们这个讯息只是因为她来访时，我接收到了。
The choice is hers to make. It should however be noted here that contact of this type, personal contact, does help. It has nothing to do with the particular abilities that are being used, per se. These operate quite as effectively through distance; and for that matter, though less often, through time.选择是她的。不过这里必须说明，这样的接触，个人性的接触是有帮助的。就其本身而言，它和这里使用的特殊能力无关。这些能力可以有效地跨距离运作，或这么说，虽然不常发生，但有时候也可以跨时间运作。
At Ruburt’s stage of development however, he reacts as a result of emotional impetus, which is picked up rather directly, and which acts as additional energy in transmission. It is for this reason that he now and then does enjoy visitors to sessions, because he instinctively feels that he is thereby learning to manipulate and use these abilities oftentimes, and thereby learn the various subjective feelings that accompany valid perceptions, and to distinguish these from subjective feelings that turn out to be based upon invalid perceptions.不过在鲁柏的发展阶段，他对情绪刺激的结果起反应，他很直接地接收到，而这个行动是一个额外传递的能量。因为这个原因，他有时会很享受课程里有人拜访，因为他直觉地感觉到，他会因此而学会操纵和使用这些能力，也学会了伴随着有效感知的不同主观感受，和去区辨那些建立在无效感知上的主观感受。
In other words, he enjoys the practice, whether or not he knows it. When for fairly long periods there are no witnesses to sessions, then both Ruburt and myself do indeed lean toward unscheduled sessions when informed friends of yours are present. On the other hand when several sessions in a row, regular sessions, are witnessed, then of course I grow impatient because I am anxious to get back to our own material, which is stressed when we are alone.换句话说，不管他知不知道，他享受着这个练习。有很长一段时间，我们的课并没有参与者，因此鲁柏和我确实倾向当你们有联络的朋友在场时，再举行临时课。但另一方面，当连续几节定期课都有人参与时，理所当然的，我越来越不耐烦，我急着要回到在我们独处时才能着重我们自己的资料。
I meant to mention this earlier, for there is some pattern to our unscheduled sessions which you have not realized. This is why I worked so well with Philip, to make the most of the opportunity while we did have a guest.我之前就打算提这个，我们的临时课有一些模式是你们所不了解的。这就是为什么菲利普在的时候我表现得那么好，当我们有客人的时候，我要尽可能地把握机会。
(See the 204th session. Philip is John Bradley’s entity name. To date 40 sessions have been witnessed out of 210. Jane's eyes were now opening and closing rather frequently as she spoke.)(见第204节。菲利普是约翰·布莱德利存有的名字。我要注明到目前为止，210节课里超过40节有参与者。珍的眼睛在她说话时很频繁的睁开又闭上。)
For training is necessary as with all things, and although Ruburt has excellent abilities he needs also, shall we say, such direct laboratory experience.训练对所有的事都是必要的。我们应该这么说，虽然鲁柏有很好的能力，他也需要这种直接的实验经验。
We certainly would not want all of our sessions to be witnessed by any means, so you have no fear in that direction. On the other hand again, such experience is necessary and quite valid, and should be accepted certainly as a part of our work.我们当然不希望所有的课都有人参与，所以在这方面你们不用过度担心。再次的，在另一方面，这样的经验是必要且十分正常的，它也确实应该被接纳为我们工作的一部分。
Now, speaking once more about our primary and secondary conditions, it should be said now that this will not be as simple as it might appear. Many breakdowns and also syntheses will be needed. Ruburt brought up a point, I believe; he observed that the experience of talking occurred in both the waking and the dreaming states, but did not think that these represented primaries.现在，再次的说到首要和次要状态，可以这么说，这没有它看起来的那么简单。那需要很多的分解和结合。我想鲁柏提到了一个重点；他观察到说话这个经验，同时存在于醒时和梦里的状态，但不认为这代表了首要状态。
Talking represents a primary, the primary of communication. Walking represent a primary, the primary of motion. We will have much more to say along these lines, and I give you these as examples only. We shall see if you can work out others by yourselves.说话代表了一种首要，沟通里的首要。走路代表了一种首要，动作里的首要。在这方面我们还有很多可以说的，我只给你几个当成例子。我们应该看看你们是否能自己得出结果。
I now suggest your break.现在我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:27. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes had opened and shut often. Her pace had been quite rapid after the slow beginning. She remembered the material concerning Helen Dyer, and now told me she had felt an immediate rapport with Helen when she entered our apartment this evening, and a desire to help her in some way. Helen has been in our place once before, perhaps a couple of years ago.(9:27休息。珍在第一段出离如常。她的眼睛经常的张开和闭上。在一个缓慢的开始之后，她的速度变得相当快。她记得关于海伦·戴尔的资料，她现在告诉我，当海伦今晚踏进我们的公寓时，她感到了一阵亲切，和想要用某种方式去帮助她的渴望。海伦以前曾来过我们住的地方一次，大概几年前了。
(In the 185th session Seth dealt to some extent with what he called Jane's healing ability; one point he made was that the desire to help others would aid the development of this ability. Seth of course has given specific data on various physical ills for some witnesses, and for Jane and me. Whenever the advice was acted upon it worked out very well, whether the difficulty discussed was physical or psychological.(在第185节，赛斯曾提到一些关于珍的疗愈能力；他提到一点，想要助人的渴望会增加这种能力的发展。当然赛斯也给了一些参与者，还有珍和我有关于不同身体疾病的特定资料。当时的建议事后证明非常有效，不管讨论的是身体上的，或是心理上的困境。
(At times Jane gets “feelings" about the physical condition of an individual, whether it is a friend or someone she passes on the street. Sometimes these intuitions involve the approaching death of the individual concerned. She has felt other psychological states also, and now notes them down when they occur. These developments have been quite recent. A recent example involved her sensing the breakup of the marriage of a friend with whom I work, some two weeks before the friend told anyone. I had suspected nothing amiss personally.(有时候，珍会对一个人的身体状态有“感觉”，不管是朋友或路人。有时候，这样的直觉涉及了一个人所担心的迫近死亡。她也会感觉到其他人的心理状态，当它们发生的时候她会把它记下来。这样的发展是最近才发生的。最近的一次经验是，她感觉到我工作上的一个朋友婚姻会破裂，大约在这个朋友还没有告诉任何人的两周前。我自己则是完全没发觉有什么不一样。
(Seth's malignant diagnosis in this session represents the most drastic to date, and left Jane and me wondering about the best course of action to take in such cases. Jane resumed at a good rate, and with her eyes closed, at 9:39.)(赛斯在这一节的恶性肿瘤诊断代表了某种急切性，也让珍和我去思考这样的情形该采取什么行动才是最好的。珍在9:39分以一种很好的速度重新开始，她的眼睛闭着。)
Now first of all, in line with your conversation during rest period. Under no circumstances should this information I have given you be passed on to the woman involved, or to any of her friends.首先，和你们休息时间所讨论的话题相关。我给你们的这个讯息，在任何情况下都不应该告诉这个女人或她的朋友。
If this seems to involve you in a problem with morality, then let me add here that such information, on its own, unless handled with utmost care, would immediately involve the negative suggestion that could lead easily to the very condition that we hope she avoids.如果这让你们有道德上的疑虑，那让我再补上这样的讯息，除非以极小心的方式来处理，否则这会立即给她一个负面暗示，而那可能会很轻易的把事情导向我们希望她避免的那种情况。
She told you of an experience that seems to be a dream, in which her husband spoke to her in terms of encouragement. She will have several other such experiences, for her husband is aware of the situation, and is helping her all he can.她告诉你们的似乎是一个梦中经验，有关她先生对她说的一些鼓励的话。她将会有其他类似的经验，因为她的先生觉知了这个情况，所以尽他所能来帮助她。
If she accepts the help on an intuitive basis it will indeed change the course of her life in the future. There are sufficient constructive elements about her if she chooses to take advantage of them.如果她在直觉层面接受了这个帮助，那就会改变她未来人生的方向。这里有充分的建设性元素——如果她选择善用的话。
This should not concern you.你们不需要太过担心。
(It was 9:45. I placed the test envelope in Jane's lap while she gave voice to the above sentence. She gave no sign that she was aware of my action, other than a slight movement of her legs, but she picked up the envelope almost at once. Her eyes were still closed. She held the envelope in her right hand, making no effort to determine its contents by feeling, twisting, etc.)(现在是9:45。当珍说上面这一段的时候，我把测验的信封放在她的腿上。看不出来她有觉察到我的动作，只轻轻地动了一下她的腿，但她最后拿起了信封。她的眼睛仍闭着。她右手拿着信封，轻松的以感觉、搓碰来确定信的内容。)
We will now see what we can do with your envelope. Please give us a moment. (Pause.)我们现在来看看能对你的信封做些什么。请等我们一下。(停顿)
These are impressions. A mist; that is, I believe M-I-S-T, and a long road. (Pause.) In parenthesis here, Ruburt's own connection is with the Gallaghers. An afternoon involving three people. A massage. Something like a... I do not know the phrase... like a bandage used to bind wounds at pressure points. (Pause.)有以下印象。雾；我想那是M-I-S-T，和一条很长的路。(停顿)这里插入一句，鲁柏自己和加拉格夫妇的连结。和3个人有关的一个下午。一个讯息。一个东西像……我不知道那个词……像一个在施压点包扎伤口的绷带。(停顿)
Ruburt and dark treetops. A connection with wood, rather strongly, as of many trees, and another connection with a long wooden table, as of a picnic table. (Pause.)鲁柏和深色的树梢。和木头有连结，相当强烈的，像是很多树，另一种连结是和一个长型的木头桌子，像是野餐的桌子。(停顿)
Ruburt’s own perceptions are somewhat confused here because he thinks of two photographs. One in which he is perched in a tree. This one taken in California, and the other one of the two of you, taken at your New York glen, by a picnic table, in which your images are almost hidden by the trees.这里鲁柏自己的感知有点混淆了，因为他想到了两张照片。一张是他坐在一棵树上，这张是在加州照的。另一张是你们两个在纽约峡谷的一张野餐桌前照的，你们的身影几乎隐没在树间。
So give us another moment here. (Pause.) We will try and say that a photograph is involved, that it is a fairly dark one, that Ruburt is in it, perhaps also a dog. The dark portions are shadows of trees, or perhaps rocks.现在给我们一点时间。(停顿)我们尝试着说一下，这和一张照片有关，照片相当暗，鲁柏在里面，也许还有一只狗。暗的部分是树影，也或许是石头。
There is a man connected with the photograph. Ruburts husband. (Pause.) But it has to do with the past, at least five years ago.有一个男人和这张照片有关。鲁柏的先生。(停顿)但这和过去有关，至少是5年前。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:57. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her pace had been quite slow. I had the impression as she spoke that she was struggling to sort out what she wanted to say.(9:57休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，速度十分慢。我有这个印象，当她说话时，努力的整理她想要说的。
(Jane said she was somewhat startled to feel the envelope touch her lap. She hadn't expected a test, and I hadn't mentioned it to her before the session. Actually I had prepared the test envelope some weeks ago.(珍说当信封碰到她大腿的时候，她有点惊吓。她没有预期会有信封，我在课前也没有跟她提过。事实上，我在几周前就准备好这个测试信封。
(Jane said that at the moment she had no idea why she clung to the photograph idea. Although she was a little tired, she didn't feel particularly bad. She now revealed that she had actually seen within three photographs, rather than the two mentioned. She saw these photos quite clearly, she said, and knew that two of them were in our album, and the third in a file of her own. From the descriptions given I recognized them also.(珍说，一度她不清楚为什么会紧抓着照片这个想法。虽然她有一点累，但并不感觉特别糟。她现在透露，事实上她看到三张照片，而不是之前提到的两张。她说这些照片她看得很清楚，知道其中两张在我们的相框里，第三张在她自己的档案夹中。经过上面的描述我也知道是哪几张。
(Since Jane had developed the photograph idea so consistently in the test, we thought something must have happened to put her on that track, and we said aloud that we hoped Seth would deal with the reasons for this before ending the session.(因为珍在测验中一直扩展照片的这个想法，我们认为可能有什么事会发生，所以才让她这么想，我们大声地说出，希望在这节课结束前，赛斯能告诉我们这件事的原因。
(It was now time for the 19th Dr. Instream test. Jane's pace was now again very slow. Although I could not see her doing so, her eyes must have opened a trifle to find the ashtray, since she was again smoking. She sat with one hand to her face, her head tipped down, speaking quietly. She took many pauses, some of them long. Resume at 10:06.)(现在到第19次殷斯翠姆博士测试时间。珍的速度再次变得非常慢。虽然我没看到她这么做，但她的眼睛一定稍微睁开着去找烟灰缸，因为她又再次抽起烟来。她坐着，一只手放在脸上，头低着，很轻的说话。她停顿了很多次，有时候很久。在10:06分重新开始。)
Now give us a moment. Then I shall have some remarks to make later. (Pause.)现在，等我们一会儿。等一下我应该有些评论要说。(停顿)
A new interior, or one that we have not seen earlier. (A long pause at 10:07.) A neighboring town or village. Three or four people (pause) with cards of some kind. Two doors to the room, and old-fashioned furniture.一个新的，或是一个我们之前没有见过的内装。(10:07长时间停顿)邻近的城镇或村庄。3或4个人(停顿)或某种卡。房间有两扇门，还有老式的家具。
Many small objects on display, and a chest of large proportions. A beaded framework, as of a beaded lamp. An old bible in which family records may be kept. (Long pause.)摆放着很多小物件，一个大柜子。像是缀有珠子的灯。放着一本家庭版的旧圣经。(长的停顿。)
The number ten, and the number 375. Also a fee involved. (Pause.)数字10，和数字375。也和一个费用有关。(停顿)
This is all we will attempt on this, this evening, and I will have a few words with you, Joseph.我们今晚就试到这儿，我有一些话想对约瑟你说。
(Jane's voice was determined, her eyes still closed.)(珍的声音很坚定，她的眼睛仍闭着。)
First of all, I do not want any envelope tests given before the Instream material is delivered. It may be my fault. I neglected to mention this in an outright manner, but in the past I never requested the envelope until after the Instream material.首先，我不希望有任何信封测验放在殷斯翠姆博士的测验之前。这可能是我的错。我忽略了以一种直接了当的方式去说明这点，但在过去，我从不会在完成殷斯翠姆博士的资料前要求信封测验。
There is a good reason for this. You always check on the results of the envelope test immediately afterward.这里有一些很好的理由。你们总是在信封测验之后立即检查结果。
(Janes eyes now opened wide. She stared at me as she lit a cigarette. Her eyes then closed.)(珍的眼睛现在睁得很大。她点烟的时候注视着我。然后她闭着眼睛。)
Therefore, if the results are poor, this undermines Ruburt’s confidence for the following tests. This is rather important. I have no objection now to the fact that you check the results of the envelope tests immediately afterward; but only when this occurs after the Instream material.因此，如果结果是不好的，这就削弱了鲁柏对接下来测验的信心。这是很重要的。我现在并不是反对你们在信封测验后立即检查结果；但前提是，那只限于在殷斯翠姆博士测验之后。
This fact hampered that work this evening. Ruburt knew the earlier test was poor, and he set up defenses.这件事阻碍了今晚的工作。鲁柏知道之前的测验结果不好，所以他树立起了防卫。
Now as to the poor results themselves in the envelope test. Primarily there are two reasons for our unsatisfactory results. He did not want to have the test given to him while the Instream material had not yet been given for one thing, and so this did not work for us. To begin with however he simply was not at his best in any case.现在，关于信封测验不好的结果，我们的结果不够令人满意主要有两个原因。第一个是，他不希望在殷斯翠姆博士的测验之前有另一个测验，所以这对我们行不通。不过简单来说，他今天并没有处在一个好的状态。
He was shocked by the earlier information that I had given concerning the woman, and this led him to block further information for the evening. He worked, or allowed me to work through, the layers of personal subconscious only, which now and then may yield valid information, but highly distorted as a rule, and unreliable for our purposes.他对于我之前给的那女人的讯息感到很震惊，而这让他在今晚阻挡了更进一步的讯息。他工作，或只允许我透过个人潜意识工作，这偶尔可能会产生有效的讯息，但通常会是高度扭曲，且对我们的目的是不可靠的。
He put himself back in time, seeing three photographs of himself, progressively further away from the present, in order to separate himself from the sort of information that he heard himself giving earlier this evening. So all in all he was not working at his best, and it can hardly be expected that he do so constantly.他把自己丢回过去，看着他自己的三张照片，逐步地远离当下此刻，这是为了把他自己从他今晚稍早所给的那些讯息分开。因此从各方面来说，他今晚不在最佳状态，而他也不应该总是被期待在这个状态。
The point about the test envelopes however should be well taken. This is , one of the main reasons why, in the Rhine experiments, results were not given until a certain sequence of tests had been completed, or a given series.不过关于信封测试的这一点，应该被好好的记下来。这也是其中一个主要的原因，为什么在瑞恩实验的时候，直到一系统测验完成之后我才给了结果。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
One point here. I allowed the test to continue because, again, such episodes can teach you lessons. I tried to separate the levels, for a while, of perception; but Ruburt by then would not open up the deeper layers of communication. You may now take your break.这里还有一点。我让这个测验进行，因为再次的，这样的一个插曲也可以教你们一些课题。我曾一度试着分开感知的层面；但那时鲁柏并没有打开更深层面的沟通。你们现在可以休息。
(Break at 10:28. Jane had been dissociated as usual. Her eyes opened slowly. Her pace however had been much faster.(10:28休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛慢慢地睁开，不过她的速度变得比较快。
(In the 197th session Seth suggested that I not wait for him to request an envelope test. In a recent session also he said it was not wise for such tests to be given at the end of a session, when Jane is tired. Hence I thought I had picked a good time to give her the test envelope. I did not anticipate that it would not be a good test because of previous information, or that it could interfere with subsequent tests.(在第197节，赛斯曾建议我不需要等他要求才做信封测验。在最近一节课里，他也说这种测验放在课的最后是不明智的，因为珍已经累了。因此我认为我挑了一个好时间来让她做信封测验。我没有想到，因为之前的结果而造成了测验结果不够好，或它可能干扰接下来的测验。
(During break Jane relaxed on the bed. She began speaking from there after break, her head propped up on one hand, her eyes closed, her voice quite amused. Resume at 10:30.)(在休息的时候，珍放松地躺在床上。在休息后她从那里开始说话，她一只手撑起头，眼睛闭着，声音听起来挺愉快的。10:30分重新开始。)
Now. We are going to give you the week of Christmas off, for all students have a holiday sometime. We may even give you a report card. Tonights performance will not pull your average down too far, but perhaps we can bring it up for you in the meantime.现在。我们将会给你们一周的圣诞假期，因为所有的学生偶尔都该有一个假期。我们甚至应该给你们一张成绩单。今晚的表现并不会把你们的平均成绩拉下多少，但也许我们可以在这段时间里把它拉上来。
We will at any time, Joseph, accept envelope tests, as long as they are given to me after the Instream material. There is indeed more that should be said along these lines, and perhaps at our next session we shall make certain points clearer in this regard.约瑟，我们可以在任何时候接受信封测验，只要它们是在殷斯翠姆博士资料之后就行了。关于这方面还有更多可说的，也许在下一节我们可以针对这一点说得更清楚。
I suggest that we end the session; and I will also discuss the material of a personal nature that you have in mind at a later session. My heartiest wishes and good night.我建议我们结束这一节；我也会在下一节讨论你们心里那些个人本质的资料。我衷心的祝福和晚安。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:34. Jane was dissociated as usual.)(10:34结束。珍出离如常。)

SESSION 211 第211节 梦的研究 比尔、蓓见证课程


NOVEMBER 24, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年11月24日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(No envelope test was held during the session.(这一节没有信封测试。
(Bill and Peggy Gallagher were witnesses to the session. As usual the presence of witnesses fired Seth up. His delivery was more active and quite fast from the beginning. Jane's eyes however remained closed. For much of the session she sat on the edge of her chair, leaning forward with her hands clasped together. She began at 8:58.)(比尔和蓓·加拉格参与了今晚的课。就像平常一样，访客的出现激发了赛斯。他的口述从一开始就比较生动而且十分快。不过珍的眼睛仍闭着。大部分课的时间，她都坐在椅子边缘，双手交叠，身体向前倾。她在8:58开始。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I am indeed glad to see that you are all in such high spirits. For a spirit I am indeed in a rather high mood myself.我真的很高兴看到你们精神如此高昂。我自己现在心情也很好。
Of course I welcome our Jesuit and our cat lover, as always. There are however some points that I would like to clear, and I would also like to add to your instructions concerning our dream experiments—since I know, Joseph, that you can’t wait to begin them.当然，我一如既往地欢迎我们的耶稣会信徒和爱猫人士。不过有几点我想要说清楚，关于我们梦的实验，我也想多教你们几招——因为约瑟，我知道你已经等不及要开始了。
(Jane faced me while speaking this last phrase, her eyes still closed, and in good humor.)(当说到最后一句时珍面向我，她的眼睛仍闭着，而且是以一种幽默的方式来说。)
Now, I would suggest that two main categories in particular be given special notice. These as you know will have to do with primary and secondary reality. And each dream should be scrutinized first of all with these main points in mind. You must look out for pitfalls, and use your critical faculties. Ruburt uses his critical faculties supremely well in scrutinizing my activities and nature, so I have no doubt that he can also apply them to the job at hand.现在，我建议要特别注意两大类。你知道这些和首要以及次要实相有关。首先在心里，每个梦都应该以这些主要重点来检查。你应该要留意陷阱，并运用你批判的天赋。鲁柏在检查我的活动和本质的时候，把他批判的天赋使用得极好，所以我毫不怀疑对于即将到来的工作，他也能将此天赋运用得很好。
You will need to use your wits carefully, for secondary realities will often appear to be primaries. I mentioned earlier that it might seem that walking, for example, was a primary, since it appears that you walk in your dreams. You also walk in the waking state, and you can actually walk, and also appear to walk, in the trance state. Nevertheless, walking is part of the primary of motion.你将需要小心地使用你的理解力，因为次要实相常常看起来像首要实相。例如我之前提到，走路似乎是首要实相，因为你在梦中走路。在醒时的状态，你也在走路。你能实质上走路，也能在出离状态看起来在走路。因此，走路是动作首要的一部分。
Now there are several kinds of time, that will appear within your dreams, and you must sort these out carefully. While sleeping in your present time, you may have a dream that concerns your personal past, while the dream is concerned with events that you know to have occurred many years ago. Nevertheless you may experience these events as happening within the present.现在，有好几种时间会出现在你的梦中，你必须小心分辨它们。当你正睡着的时候，你可以做一个关于个人过去的梦，在梦里可能会涉及发生在几年前的事件。不过，你可能现在经验着这些发生的事件。
The present within which you seem to experience the dream is not, however, the present in physical time, the present in which your body lies upon the bed. There is a fine distinction here, and one that you shall learn through experience for yourselves, for I shall not tell you all.你似乎在经验着这个梦的现在并不是物质时间的现在，这个现在，你的身体正躺在床上。这里有很细微的分别，这是你应该从你自己的经验里学习的，我不应该全部告诉你。
It should be obvious to you also that within your dreams a spatial location that belongs in present physical time can be experienced in the past or in the future within the dream framework, and there is much more here than meets the eye; and you must be careful so that you catch it. What you do with it will be up to you.这对你来说应该也是很明显的，在你梦中一个属于现在物质时间的空间位置，能在梦的架构中以过去和未来被经验，这比原来想的要更复杂有趣多了；你必须很仔细，那么你才能抓住它。你要怎么做由你来决定。
I am particularly interested myself in these projected experiments, and as a preliminary for them we shall have you work with suggestion alone before you attempt to begin with your recordings.我自己特别感兴趣的是这些投射实验，在你开始用录音机之前，你先单独以暗示的方式初步去做。
Now I will give you a short break, and again my welcome to our friends, and I do not mean to ignore them. We shall indeed have you, Joseph and Ruburt, working in your sleep, as Ruburt earlier remarked, and you shall be glad of it. For the dream will not be captured in a laboratory by scientists who will not look into their own dreams.现在我们短暂休息一下，再次欢迎我们的朋友，我并不是有意要忽略他们。就如鲁柏之前所提到的，约瑟，你和鲁柏应该开始在睡梦中工作，而你们应该对此感到高兴。梦不会在实验室里被没有审查他们自己的梦的科学家们所捕捉。
The nature of dreams will only be discovered in such a manner as I am suggesting.梦的本质只有以我所建议的这种方式才能被发现。
(Break at 9:10. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes had remained closed, her pace had been quite fast and expressive. She resumed in the same manner at 9:28.)(9:10休息。珍在第一段出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，速度十分快且富有表达力。她以同样的方式在9:28分重新开始。)
Now. I will continue. Man will not learn the basic nature of reality by studying the physical universe alone, nor will he learn it by studying the personality as it operates within the physical universe alone.现在。我将继续。人类仅仅用学习物质宇宙的方式，或仅仅学习在物质宇宙里运作的人格，并不能学到实相的基本本质。
The nature of reality can only be approached by an investigation of reality as it is directly experienced in all levels of awareness: reality as it appears under dream conditions, under other conditions of dissociation, and as it appears in the waking condition.实相的本质，只能以直接经验觉知的所有层面这样的实相调查方式，才能被接近：出现在梦状态的实相，出现在出离状态的其他实相，和出现在醒时状态的实相。
Most studies even dealing with the conscious state are extremely superficial, dealing only with those upper layers of egotistical awareness that are immediately concerned with the manipulation of the self within physical reality.大部分的研究，即使是处理意识状态的那些都十分肤浅，只处理那些自我觉察面的表层，那直接有关物质实相里这个自己的操纵面。
All layers of the personality are indeed conscious layers. They simply operate in the manner of compartments, so that often one portion of the self is not aware of other portions. As a rule when you are awake you do not know your sleeping self; you know your neighbors far better, so your sleeping self appears mysterious indeed. When you are awake, as Ruburt himself has written, you cannot find the dream locations that have been so familiar to you only the night before.人格所有层面都确实是意识的层面。它们仅以区隔的方式来运作，因此自己的一部分常常并不觉察自己的其他部分。通常当你醒着的时候，你不知道睡着时的自己；你对你的邻居还比较了解，因此你睡着时的自己实际上仍然是很神秘的。当你醒着的时候，就像鲁柏写下的，你无法找到仅一个晚上之前你还很熟悉的梦中地点。
In your sleep you may have greeted friends who are strangers to your waking self. But consider the other side of the coin. For when you are asleep, you cannot find the street upon which you live your waking hours, and when you are asleep you do not know you waking self. The sleeping self is your identity.在你的梦里，你可能会欢迎那些对醒时自己来说是陌生人的朋友。但想想事情的另一面，当你睡着的时候，你无法找到醒时住的那一条街，当你睡着的时候，你不认得醒时的自己。睡着的自己是你的本体。
Now there are indeed connections between these two conditions. And there are definite realities that exist in both states, and these uniting realities will be what you are looking for. For only by finding these can you discover the nature of the human personality and the nature of reality within which it must operate.现在在两种状态之间一定有连结。有明确的实相存在于两种状态下，而这个联合的实相就是你要寻找的。只有找到这些，你才能发现人类人格和其运作的实相本质。
We have also spoken of the dream as a drama, and you must discover the various levels upon which these dramas take place. It will not be as difficult when you are under way as it may seem to you now.我们也提到梦是一场戏，你必须去发现这些戏剧发生的不同层面。当你开始做了之后，你会发现那并没有现在看起来的那么困难。
My dear Jesuit, shall I turn my chair around and face you full?我亲爱的耶稣会信徒，我应该转动我的椅子完全面向你吗？
([Bill:] “As you wish.”([比尔：]“随你喜欢。”
(Seth broke off his material to introduce this bit of humor because Bill, sitting perhaps five feet away, was leaning forward and staring intently at Jane as she spoke. Smiling, her eyes still closed, Jane now shifted her chair so that she did face Bill squarely.(赛斯中断他的资料，带着一点幽默说起这个，因为比尔坐在大概5英尺远的地方，当珍说话的时候他向前倾，很专注地看着她。她微笑着，眼睛仍闭着。珍现在移动她的椅子，让她的脸正对着比尔。
(A reminder, that Seth's favorite term for Bill is the Jesuit; for Peggy, the cat lover.)(再提醒一下，赛斯喜欢称比尔为耶稣会信徒；而称蓓为爱猫人士。)
You will also discover, as I have mentioned, that the various levels of the subconscious will yield their own characteristic data, and as your records grow this will become apparent to you. It is obviously necessary then that your suggestion is given precisely as I gave it to you, for we want the dreams recorded in consecutive order whenever possible.你也会发现，像我之前提到的，潜意识的不同层面会产生他们自己独有的资料，当你的记录变多了，你将会发现这很明显。有一点显然是必要的，你的暗示必须确实是我告诉你的那个样子，因为我们尽可能希望梦是以连续的顺序被记录的。
(See the 206th session.)(见第206节。)
This is most necessary. Certain questions may appear too simple to ask, but you must ask them and you must use your brains here.这是最必要的。某些问题问起来似乎太简单，但你必须问，这里必须用你的脑子。
Are your muscles tired—你的手酸吗——
(“No.”(“不。”
(Since Seth paused after giving voice to the question, I answered, since I had been writing at a fast pace. I soon saw that I shouldn’t have however, since Jane now turned the same humorous expression toward me that had confronted Bill a few minutes ago.)(赛斯提了这问题以后停顿一下，我回答了，我以一种很快的速度在写字。不过我很快发现不该这么做，因为珍现在以几分钟前对比尔同样幽默的表情转向我。)
—after a dream of much activity? I was not inquiring after your welfare. However, I am glad that you are in good condition.——在一个这么多活动的梦之后？我不是为你的福利而问的。不过我很高兴你的状态很好。
I want you to ask questions along these lines, and attempt to answer them through your records and experience.我希望你们在这方面多问问题，并且试着透过你们的记录和经验去回答它们。
You see, the work involved in these experiments will of itself allow you to be extremely flexible, and you will discover finally that you can bring a portion of your consciousness with you while you sleep. A portion of the self will be investigating other portions of the self. We shall also have you using suggestion to bring about certain types of dreams in which we may be interested.你们看，这些实验所涉及的工作本身就会让你们变得十分有弹性，而最后你会发现，当你睡觉的时候会带着你自己一部分的意识。我们也应该让你运用暗示去带出某种我们可能会感兴趣的梦。
I do have here a thought, my Jesuit friend. Surely you can arrange a spotlight, and we could set it here.耶稣会信徒，我的朋友，我在这里有个想法。当然你可以装一个舞台灯，但我们也可以把它设在这里。
(Again in a jovial mood, Jane indicated a spot just in front of her rocker. Bill had been still peering intently at her.)(再次的，以一种愉快的心情。珍指着她摇椅正前方的一个位置。比尔仍就专注地看着她。)
Incidentally, joking aside, some time in the future it would not be a bad idea, if it ever could be arranged, to take Ruburts blood pressure before, during, and after sessions; also his weight.顺道一提，撇开这个玩笑，也许在未来它会是个不坏的主意，如果可以安排的话，在课之前、中间、之后测量鲁柏的血压；还有她的体重。
You could perhaps learn something from such innocent tests as these. You see, theoretically, you could find out how much I weighed, or if I had physical weight indeed, could you not? Or if Ruburt weighed less during sessions, then you would have a dilemma.从这些单纯的测验，你也许可以学到一些东西。你们看，理论上如果我真的有物质重量的话，你可以发现我有多重，不是吗？或如果鲁柏在课堂中变得比较轻，那你就会处于一个困境了。
I am going to suggest a brief break, and we shall make our Dr. Instream appointment.我建议一个短暂的休息，然后我们应该赴殷斯翠姆博士的约了。
(Break at 9:48. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed. Her pace had been fast throughout, her voice somewhat stronger but not loud by any means.(9:48休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着。她的速度自始至终都很快，声音有力但并不大声。
(Our session was being held in our front room. Up until now none of us had noticed the traffic noise past the front of the house; but now that a test was to come I became conscious of it. Later Jane, Bill and Peggy concurred.(我们的课在前面的房间举行。直到现在我们没有人注意到房子前面的交通噪音；但现在测验要开始了，我开始注意到它。过了一会儿，珍、比尔和蓓也注意到了。
(This is the 20th Dr. Instream test. As usual Jane now began to speak at a much slower pace. She sat with her head down, a hand raised to her closed eyes. Resume at 9:58.)(这是第20次殷斯翠姆博士测试。一如往常，珍现在开始以一种很慢的速度讲话。她坐着，头低着，一只手放在闭着的眼睛上。9:58重新开始。)
Now, give us a moment. (Long pause.)现在，等我们一下。(长时间停顿)
A company, with four men and three women. A room with a fireplace, so it would seem that this is not Dr. Instream's apartment. (Pause.)和4个男人还有3个女人在一起。一个有壁炉的房间，看起来似乎不是殷斯翠姆博士的公寓。(停顿)
A late arrival, another man and woman, who live outside of town. This is, I believe, academic. (Pause.)住在城外的另一个男人和女人，迟来的到达。我想这是学术性质的。(停顿)
A clock of an ornate nature. Of gilt color. The clock itself is round.一个装饰华丽的时钟，金色的。钟体是圆的。
(Here Jane began to describe the shape of the clock in the air with her hands, as she spoke with her eyes closed. Since she was so definite about the clock’s shape, I made a quick drawing of my version of her description. This of course caused me to miss out on a few words of her verbal account, so I took the chance and asked her to repeat her description. This is the first time I have asked her a question during a test. She responded without a sign of bother or irritation, and her second description was the same as the first, as near as I could tell.(这里，珍开始用手在空中比划钟的形状，当她在说的时候，眼睛是闭上的。因为她对钟的形状描述得很明确，我依据她的描述很快地画了一张素描。这让我错过了几句她的话，所以我趁机要求她重复她的描述一遍。这是第一次我在测验中问她问题。她回答时不带一丝困扰和生气，而且就我所知，她第二次的描述和第一次是一模一样的。
(A copy of my drawing, and of drawings of the clock by Bill Gallagher and by Jane herself, will be included in the notes at next break.)(我的素描副本，还有比尔·加拉格和珍自己对钟的素描副本，会一起放在下次休息时的笔记里。)
Around the clock the gilt shape comes down in this fashion. We are now forming the base. The base of the clock itself is ornate with small pink flowers or figures upon it, and I believe a green felt beneath the base.钟四周金色的边是这样的。我们现在说到基座。钟的基座是华丽的，带有粉红色小花的图案。我想在基座下有绿色的毛边。
It is not an electric clock. (Pause.) I believe that Dr. Instream is looking at it.它不是电子钟。(停顿)我想殷斯翠姆博士正看着它。
I also believe that he lost or misplaced an item from his own office at the school today. (Pause.) Or he misplaced it earlier and went to look for it today. The item having to do with cigarettes. A holder perhaps, or a lighter, but of that nature. (Pause.)我也认为殷斯翠姆博士今天在学校他自己的办公室里，掉了一个东西或忘了那个东西在哪里。(停顿)或者他之前忘了放在哪，今天回来找。这东西和香烟有关。也许是烟嘴或是打火机，类似那样的东西。(停顿)
I also am of the impression that he received a letter today from a previous woman student, having to do perhaps with references that she was requesting. (Pause.)我也有个印象是，他今天收到之前一位女学生的信，也许和她要求一封推荐信有关。(停顿)
One of the women in this gathering wears a large blue or gray brooch (pause) that I believe he has noticed. (Pause.) He has been or very shortly will be, informed of a change in his teaching schedule that he did not expect or anticipate, having to do with the morning hours of Tuesday and Thursday, I believe, though I am not certain of the precise two days. The change was not expected. (Pause.)在聚会中的一个女人戴着很大的蓝色或灰色胸针(停顿)，我想他有注意到。(停顿)他已经被通知或即将被通知他的教学时间会有变动，这是他没有预期的，我想也许是星期二或星期四早上的时间，但我不确定正确是哪两天。这个变动是意料之外的。(停顿)
You may take at this time a brief break, and that is the end of our Instream material. Except that you may wish the good doctor a happy holiday for me.你可以短暂休息一下，殷斯翠姆博士的资料结束了。除非你要替我祝这位好博士假期快乐。
(Break at 10:11. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed; her pace had picked up considerably toward the end of the delivery. She told me my question did not bother her; also that she saw the clock she was describing pretty clearly. She was aware of the traffic noise.(10:11休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着；她的速度在最后口述时恢复正常。她告诉我，我的问题并没有困扰她；她也很清晰地看到了她所描述的钟。她有注意到交通噪音。
(Jane and Bill now made their drawings of the clock, without seeing each other's or mine, and my copies of all three are below. Its apparent the three of us agreed pretty closely on what we saw. Note that only Jane points up the uneven gilt surface in her version.)(珍和比尔现在正在画这个钟的素描，他们都没有看对方或是我的图，我们三张图的副本附在下面。很明显我们三个看到的东西都很相近。注意到只有珍的版本有不规则的金边。)
(When Jane began speaking again her pace was once again fast. Her eyes were closed, her voice average. Resume at 10:20.)(当珍再次开始说话的时候，速度变得比较快。她的眼睛闭着，音量适中。在10:20重新开始。)我的版本 比尔的版本 珍的版本
Now that our Instream material has been taken care of, we can do whatever you like, within reason of course. We can end our session, I can continue with the material that I have been giving you, or I will be glad to answer questions.现在我们殷斯翠姆博士的资料已经讲完了，我们可以做任何你们想做的，当然要有适当的理由。我们可以结束这一节，我可以继续刚刚给你们的资料，或我也会很高兴回答任何问题。
It is indeed up to you. Perhaps you would like merely a social discussion of your own, and if so you are welcome to it.它真的由你们决定。也许你们只想要自己的社交讨论，如果是这样，我也很欢迎。
([My question:] “Have you got a question, Bill?”([我问：]“你有问题吗，比尔？”
([Bill G.] “What significance do you attach to the fact that you seem to be right-handed, but left-handed in sessions?”)([比尔G.]“你似乎是右撇子，但在课堂里你是左撇子，这有什么意义吗？”)
Are you referring to Ruburt, or are you speaking to me?你是指鲁柏，还是在说我？
([Bill:] “To Ruburt through you.”([比尔：]“直通你的鲁柏。”
(At an earlier break. Bill had mentioned to me, while Jane was out of the room, that he believed Jane was right-handed but that Seth used predominantly left handed movements. I had noticed this, but told Bill Jane had talked at times of being left-handed as a child; I told him I remembered Jane saying something about being made to write right-handed in school.)(在早先休息的时候，比尔向我提到，当珍不在课堂上的时候，他相信珍是右撇子，但赛斯大部分的动作主要是用左手。我没有注意到这点，但我告诉比尔，珍说过好几次，她小孩子的时候是左撇子；我告诉他，我记得珍说过类似在学校被强迫用右手写字之类的话。)
Ruburt, indeed, should give his own answers. Far be it from me to answer for him. I use one hand, and he uses the other, primarily.鲁柏应该自己回答。我绝不会替他回答。基本上，我用一只手，而他用另一只。
([Bill:] “Why?”)([比尔：]“为什么？”)
I always used one hand, and he used the other.我总是用一只手，而他用另一只。
([Bill:] “I’ve been wondering why your basic gestures are different than Janes.”)([比尔：]“我一直很好奇为什么你的基本手势和鲁柏不同。”)
My dear Jesuit friend. Do I not try to explain things clearly, and am I not grossly misunderstood? I have been saying for some time now that I am myself, and that Ruburt is someone else. It follows that our gestures would therefore be different. Would you not say so?我亲爱的耶稣会信徒朋友。难道我没有解释清楚，我是不是很容易被误解？我已经说了一段时间，我是我自己而鲁柏是另一个人，因此我们的手势才不同。难道不是这样吗？
([Bill:] “I don't know. I've been wondering whether I would think so.”([比尔：] “我不知道。我一直很好奇为什么我会这么想。”
(The pace was now even faster, and occasionally I omitted a word in the notes to keep up; this did not alter any meanings. Seth was most amused and pleased at the exchange. Jane sat with her eyes still closed; her movements and facial expressions were active.)(现在的速度更快，偶尔我会在笔记时掠过一个字以便能赶得上；这不会改变任何意思。赛斯在交谈时显得十分有趣和愉快。珍坐着，眼睛仍闭着；她的动作和脸部表情显得很有活力。)
I’m glad to see you have had a good think session. Now. If you are thinking in terms of secondary personalities, you can prove nothing one way or another. A secondary personality could indeed use gestures that are different (with humor). Either way, this would be no proof as to my independent nature. I am glad to see that it has been bothering you.我很高兴看到你们在这一节里思考了一些东西。现在，如果你们认为这是第二人格，你也无法证明任何事。一个次要人格也能用不同的手势(幽默)。另一方面，这也无从证明我的独立本质。我很高兴看到这令你们困扰。
([Bill:] “I was curious as to what you would say.”)([比尔：]“我很好奇你会怎么说。”)
My own answer is that I am an energy personality essence, momentarily in contact with your physical system, and that I am allowed to operate through Ruburt.我自己的回答是，我是一个能量人格元素，短暂的和你们的物质系统有接触，而我被允许透过鲁柏来运作。
(See the 63rd and 88th sessions in Volumes 2 and 3 respectively—although Seth has dealt with this problem often before and after these sessions.(依序见第二册和第三册，第63和68节——虽然赛斯常常在这些课之前或之后提到这个问题。
([Bill:] “Then you use Ruburt’s mechanical equipment, the voice, the eyes and body and so forth, to speak to us.”)([比尔：]“所以你用鲁柏的机械装备、声音、眼睛，和身体等等来向我们说话。”)
I do, and I use them in the manner that I have used mechanical faculties of my own when I had them.是的，而且我以当我还有自己的机械能力时的使用方式来用它们。
([Bill:] “And does this include Ruburt’s facial expressions also?”)([比尔：]“而这也包括鲁柏的面部表情吗？”)
It does indeed, though the face does not fully adopt my own expression. First of all, as far as the hands are concerned, to be left or right-handed has to do with inner mechanisms and brain patterns that come first, before the motions of the hands. Characteristically, I operated in certain manners that resulted in the primary use of my left hand, when I was focused within physical matter.的确是的，虽然这张脸并无法完全表现出我自己的表情。首先，关于手，是左撇子还是右撇子，这是和在手的动作之前先跳出来的内在机制和大脑模式有关。当我专注在物质世界的时候，我以某种独特方式运作的结果，会造成我主要使用我的左手。
When I am allowed to manifest myself again to some degree physically now, then I manipulate physical matter in my own characteristic fashion.如果我现在再被允许在某种物质程度上去显示我自己，那我会以我自己独特的方式去操纵物质物体。
As to facial expression, this again is somewhat the same matter, for in this case matter does not matter. Physical expression, facial expression, is again the result of the personality’s characteristic method of manipulating the physical organism, and when I operated primarily as such I had my own characteristic way of doing so.至于脸部表情，这多少是同样的情形，在这件例子上，非关物质。身体表情、脸部表情，再次的，都是人格独特方式操纵物质有机体的结果，当我运作时主要是带着我自己独特的方式。
Now and then with Ruburt, to a smaller or lesser degree, my own habits therefore show through, for I manipulate his muscles in a different way than he does. But, scientifically again, this would not be proof of my existence as an independent personality who has survived physical death. Not that this concerns me, for it does not.有时和鲁柏一起的时候，我自己的习惯多多少少会显露出来，因为我和他操纵肌肉的方式并不同。但再次的，在科学上，这并不能证明我的存在是一个超越物质死亡的独立人格。但这对我并不重要，一点也不重要。
There is more involved in your questioning, you see, than you imagine. Do you have another?你看，你的问题比你想象的涉及得更多。你还有其他问题吗？
([Bill:] “Not particularly, I guess.”([比尔：]“我想没有特别的了。”
(Seth/Jane now turned toward Peggy, who had been sitting quietly by Jane's eyes were still closed, although she was smiling. It will be remembered that Seth has strong subconscious abilities.)(现在赛斯/珍转向蓓，她一直静静地坐着。珍的眼睛仍旧闭着，虽然她在微笑。这让我想起赛斯有很强的潜意识能力。)
Our silent cat lover...我们安静的爱猫人士……
([Peg:] “You've said in the past that we would notice changes in Ruburt's features. ")([蓓：]“你在过去曾说过，我们会注意到鲁柏脸部的改变。”)
Indeed. On some occasions I can make them very obvious.确实是的。在一些情况里我能让它们变得非常明显。
([Peg:] “What does it take to make them obvious? You said something about conditions. ")([蓓：]“要让它们变得明显需要什么条件呢？你好像说过需要条件。”)
Certain conditions indeed.某些条件是必须的。
([Peg:] “How are conditions now?”)([蓓：]“现在的条件怎么样？”)
What we need you see are various elements that usually combine spontaneously, but that can be caused to combine when they would not usually combine. This I can usually take care of fairly well. However, I have freedoms that Ruburt does not have, and I am freer to use my abilities than he is.你们需要的是经常自发性的去结合不同元素，但当它们没有像平常那样结合的时候，我们也能引发它们结合。这我通常能处理得非常好。无论如何，我有鲁柏没有的自由，我比他更能自由地使用我的能力。
I work carefully in cooperation with his ego, for we do not want to startle it. When such changes occur in an obvious manner, we shall see that you both are present.我很小心地和他的自我合作，因为我们不想吓到它。当这种改变是以很明显的方式发生时，我们应该确认你们两个都在场。
(The most obvious instance of a change in Janes features occurred in the 68th session, and was witnessed by Bill Macdonnel and myself in full light. This was very definite and easily seen. See Volume 1.)(最明显的一次珍脸部改变的例子，发生在第68节，比尔·麦唐纳和我在充足的光线下目睹。这是很明显、很容易看到的。见第一册。)
The conditions are not physical conditions. These would be the simplest. The conditions have to do with the amount which Ruburt is willing to allow me to have of the physical matter of which he is composed, and of which he is naturally jealous.条件并不是物质的条件。这些是最简单的。条件指的是鲁柏他愿意允许我拥有多少他所组成的物质身体，还有他很自然的嫉妒心。
([Peg:] “Why would this cause him concern?”)([蓓：]“为什么他会在乎这个？”)
His ego is his ego, and because it is his he loves it indeed. All egos fear that which is not ego. A necessary defense mechanism, which is part of each personality.他的自我是他的自我，因为它是他的，所以他真的爱它。所有的自我都害怕不是自我的东西。那是每个人格里一部分必要的防卫机制。
(Peggy pointed at a life-sized oil portrait of Jane that I had painted.(蓓指向一个真人大小的、我画的珍的油画。
([Peg:] "Wouldn’t it be simpler for you to cause a feature change in something like a picture?”)([蓓：]“对你来说，去改变画里人的脸会不会比较简单？”)
Now we are speaking of something aside from Ruburts features. When he is off guard, as he was when Philip was present, then we can achieve very much.现在我们讲的是和鲁柏的脸不同的东西。当他卸除防备，就像菲利普在场的那时候一样，那我们就可以做到很多。
(Philip is John Bradley's entity name. See the 204th session.(菲利普是约翰·布莱德利存有的名字。见第204节。
([Peg:] "Well, it seems to us that it’s impossible to change the features of a living person. Why wouldn't it be easier to change a picture?”)([蓓：]“对我们来说，去改变一个活生生人的脸似乎是不可能的。为什么不简单一点去改变一张画？”)
It would be difficult for me to change the features of a third individual indeed, but far less difficult to change Ruburt’s features, since he gives me permission to work through him, and his mental and psychic abilities would help me. A picture would not help me on its own.对我来说，去改变第三人的脸确实是困难的，但去改变鲁柏的脸是比较容易的，因为他允许我透过他工作，还有他的心智(mental)和心灵能力可以帮我。一张画本身是无法帮我的。
No one, you see, wants more proofs than our friend Ruburt, but often consciously he wants so much that he closes the doors through which I can come, and sets down barriers that belong to the ego alone.没有人会比我们的朋友鲁柏更想要证明，但常常当他有意识地想要更多证明的时候，就会关上了我来的门，设下了属于自我本身的屏障。
I will let you have a break, and you can congratulate me, Joseph, for keeping my voice so well under control. I hear mighty yells when it is out of control, but no comments when it is under control.我会让你们休息，还有约瑟，你们可以恭喜我，因为我可以把音量控制得这么好。每当失控的时候会被人嫌，但当控制得好的话就没人可以批评了。
(“Thank you.”(“谢谢你。”
(End at 10:40. Although Seth indicated a break this turned out to be the end of the session. Jane had been dissociated as usual, and her eyes had remained closed. Her pace had been quite fast at times, and as stated before I occasionally skipped a word in her delivery, or shortened a phrase, etc., without altering any meanings.(10:40结束。虽然赛斯说的是休息，但最终变成结束了。珍出离如常，她的眼睛仍闭着。她的速度有时候会十分快，如同之前提到的，我偶尔会在她口述时跳过一个字，或是缩短句子等等，但不会改变任何意思。
(Her voice had been well under control, once or twice becoming stronger for a moment or two, and also displaying a trace of the “brogue” it sometimes acquires. I equate this accent with an Irish accent, though the two are not exactly alike as far as I know.)(她的音量控制得很好，只有一两次变得比较大声，还有，有时候也会带有一些口音。我认为这个口音是爱尔兰口音，虽然就我所知两者并不完全相像。)
(Tracing of the test paper used in the 18th envelope test, in the 212th session for November 29,1965.)用在1965年11月29日第212节第18次信封测试的测试纸素描

SESSION 212 第212节 各项体格测试记录实验 信封18


NOVEMBER 29, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年11月29日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(The 18th envelope test was held during the session. The test object is simply a drawing in black ink of the same symbol used in the first envelope test, of August in the 179th session. See that session for an explanation of the personal meaning this symbol has for us. I made the drawing for this evenings test on white paper; the paper was thin and the heavy black ink struck through the paper rather clearly. See Volume 4.(这一节会举行第18次信封测验。测验物件是简单用墨水画的，和1965年8月18日第179节第1次信封测验所用的符号相同。见那节关于这个符号对我们个人的意义解释。我为今晚的测验在白纸上画了一张图；纸张很薄，深黑色的墨水很清楚的穿透这张白纸。见第四册。
(Before tonight's session Jane and I were discussing ways and means of taking her blood pressure, her weight and various other measurements of a physiological nature before, during and after sessions. Seth referred to this in the last session briefly. We know several doctors on a social basis, but for various reasons hesitate to ask one of them to perform these duties; we would also like to repeat these studies regularly, and could hardly expect a medical man to be available in this respect.(在今晚的课之前，珍和我正讨论用什么方法和方式，在课之前、中间、之后，测量她的血压、体重和其他不同的生理特征。赛斯在上节课曾短暂的提到这个。我们认识几个熟悉的医生，但因为各种不同的原因，迟迟没有向任何一个人要求执行这些任务；我们也想定期地重复这些研究，但很难期待一个医疗人员在这方面能配合。
(The name of Father Martin came up in the conversation. He is a monk in a nearby monastery, an ex-doctor, and knows of the sessions casually. He has not witnessed any. Jane and I like him, but doubted his availability very often. One reason is that he gets up at 4 AM to work on the monastery farm.(在交谈中，马丁神父的名字跳了出来。他是附近修道院的修士，过去是医生，偶然间知道了这些课，但他没有参加过。珍和我喜欢他，但不确定他是否可以常常来。有一个原因是他早上4点要到修道院的田里工作。
(Another project we would like to explore is photographing Jane during sessions. I could handle this with a little practice. We talked of illustrating Jane's book on the Seth material, which she is now writing.(另一个我们想要探讨的计划，是在课程中拍摄珍。透过一些练习，我想我可以应付。我们也谈到，可以加些插图在珍现在写的这本赛斯资料里。
(Jane has decided that she smokes too much during sessions; as a result she did not smoke while dictating this evening, but did light up at breaks. The session was held in our back room, and was a quiet one. Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed for the most part. Her pace was quite slow in the beginning, but by first break was up to its usual rather fast state.)(珍觉得她在课程中抽太多烟了；结果她今晚口述的时候没有抽烟，但在休息的时候抽烟了。这节课是在我们后面的房间举行的，这间比较安静。珍坐着说话，大部分时候她的眼睛都是闭着的。她的速度在开始时十分慢，但在第一段休息后就恢复了平常比较快的速度。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I have been most interested in the topic under discussion immediately before our session. Such medical examinations as you have in mind would be excellent from several standpoints, and we shall have further suggestions on all these lines.我对我们的课开始之前的讨论十分感兴趣。你们心中所想的这类医学检验从几个观点上来说是很好的，我们会在这些方面有更进一步的建议。
Your acquaintance, Father Martin, will work out well if arrangements can be made. This sort of arrangement is more important than the other matter under discussion, concerning a possible photograph of Ruburt during a session. You may of course do as you like. I have nothing against such a photograph being taken or used.你们的熟人马丁神父，如果安排得好的话他会做得很好。这类安排比其他讨论中的、有关在课程中拍摄鲁柏的事还重要。你当然可以做你想要做的，我完全没有反对这样的拍摄或照片的使用。
The presence of a medical man however can stand us in good stead. You are quite lucky in knowing several medical men to begin with. Of course these matters should be handled as simply as possible.无论如何，有个医疗人员的出席对我们是很有帮助的，你们十分幸运能认识几个医疗人员以便开始去做。当然这些事情都应该尽可能简单的安排。
I have another suggestion, incidentally, that you might find most helpful. I would suggest that you purchase a reliable set of scales. Later on, using self -hypnosis, you can experiment to see whether or not you weigh less when you suggest that you will become lighter and lighter.顺便一提，我有另一个你可能会觉得很有帮助的建议。我会建议你们买一个精准的磅秤，之后用自我催眠，你们可以实验看看，当你暗示你的体重 会变得越来越轻的时候，你的体重是否会减少。
The scales can also be used for weighing Ruburt before, after, and during sessions. He shall weigh in, as fighters do, though this is indeed a different kind of arena.这个磅秤也可以用来测验鲁柏在课前、课中间，和课后的体重。他应该像个拳击手一样的称重，虽然这是完全不一样的活动。
I am going to let you find your own answers, but any such tests and examinations will be welcomed by me, as long as they are conducted in such a way so that our sessions are not disturbed. And I anticipate no difficulties here.我会让你们寻找自己的答案，但任何这样的测验或检验我都是欢迎的，只要它们是以不打扰我们课的前提下进行。我估计在这里不会有什么困难。
It would do no harm to purchase a thermometer, taking Ruburt's temperature before, after and during some sessions. Anything that you learn is to your benefit along these lines, and will serve us all well. The thermometer could also be used of course to test any temperature changes occurring in a regular trance state. These are merely suggestions which I feel may be of benefit.买一个体温计，在课前、课中间、课后去测量鲁柏的体温也是不错的。在这方面你学到的任何东西对你都是有帮助的，而且也会帮助到我们。体温计当然也可以用来测量在平常出离状态时体温的改变。这只是一些我觉得可能会有帮助的建议。
Again, any changes, or any lack of changes will be significant, and will help you distinguish the differences between various levels of consciousness as they show themselves physically within the organism. You see here that if temperature and pulse is noted before sessions, you may find a correlation that exists between these and specific instances of clairvoyance as demonstrated during a given session, and another given session. Do you follow my point here?再次的，任何改变，或任何的缺乏改变都是重要的，它们能帮助你们区辨在意识的各种层次，有机体在身体上表现的不同。你看在这里，如果体温和脉搏在课前有注记，你可能会发现存在于特定一节，关于一般和特定预知例子里，它们之间的相关性。你知道我这里的重点吗？
("Yes.")(“知道。”)
I could go on for quite a while, mentioning things that you could do. They all would add to your work load, though none of them alone would take much time. You have available, through your television set I believe, data having to do with outside temperature, wind velocity and so forth. For your own records you could note these before a session, and look for correlations.关于你们可以做的事，我可以持续地谈好一阵子。它们会增加你们的工作量，虽然单独做其中任何一个都不会花太多时间。我相信透过你们的电视台，可以获得关于外界温度、风速等等的资料。在课前，你可以注记这些在你们自己的记录里，并寻找相关性。
(Elmira is on a cable TV system, and one channel presents a 24 hour weather report. Constantly, one after another, dials show time, temperature, humidity, barometric pressure, rainfall, wind direction and wind velocity.)(埃尔迈拉的有线电视系统上，有个频道是24小时播报气象的。持续地，一个接着一个的显示时间、温度、湿度、气压、降雨量、风向和风速。)
Humidity and barometric pressure would also be helpful. You are functioning within an environment. The psychic and exterior environments are closely connected, and the correlations are available if you know where to look for them.湿度和气压也是有帮助的。你们是在一个环境里运作。心灵和外在环境是紧密相连的，如果你们知道在哪找，是可以找到相关性的。
I would definitely speak to this Father Martin before approaching anyone else, simply because his attitude would enable him to work well with us, I believe that he may be available, though not for any long period. He would be much more apt to be discreet and dependable, and he is more or less outside the regular community in which you live, which could be to your benefit. He is highly intelligent, perceptive and no ones fool.在你们接触其他人之前，我肯定要和这个马丁神父说话，单纯只是因为他的态度会让他和我们配合得很好，我想他应该是可以的，虽然时间不会很长。他比较谨慎和可靠，而且多少处在你们平常生活的团体之处，这可能会对你们有利。他十分聪明、理解力强、不易受骗。
I suggest your first break.我建议你们第一次休息。
(Break at 9:25. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes had remained closed; her pace had been fast as break approached.(9:25休息。珍在第一段口述时出离如常。她的眼睛仍旧闭着；她的速度在接近休息时变得比较快。
(Father Martin is well read in ESP and related fields; he conducts a correspondence also with monks in other countries, including a Tibetan monk.(马丁神父读了很多ESP和相关领域的资料；他也和其他国家的修道士有书信往来，包括一个西藏僧侣。
(Jane resumed again with her eyes closed, and at a somewhat slower pace, at 9:33.)(珍重新开始时眼睛闭着，速度比较慢，9:33。)
The weather readings from your television station will also be handy in relation to the projected dream experiments.你们电视台的气象报告，在做有关投射梦的实验时也会有帮助。
It will do no harm to note them down before you retire. I believe that you will note some rather significant correlations, if you find the time to carry any of these investigations through with any regularity. And the regularity will be very important.在你们睡前不妨把它们记下来。我想你们会记下一些相当重要的相关性，如果你发现这些资料中间里带有任何规律性，那这种规律性就会非常的重要。
These will only indicate correlations however, and not basic conditions. They will be correlations between basic conditions, and there is quite a difference here. There is so much that can be done, and I know that you have little time to do them. You see, there are also other circumstances which could be noted, to your advantage, such as the phases of the moon, and others which would be more difficult to ascertain.不过这些仅指出相关性，而不是基本状态。在基本状态之间会有相关性，而这是十分不同的。还有很多可以做的，但我知道你们只有很少的时间可以做。你知道，这是对你们有益的，还有其他情况可以记录，比如月亮的盈缺，还有其他比较难弄清楚的。
All of this does not have to be done at once however, and all in all enough shall be done.不过所有的这些不用一次做完，到最后也差不多会做完。
Our last discussion concerning your personal lives helped you both, incidentally. You may insert this into the record or not, as you choose. This remark, that is.顺带一提，我们上一节里关于你们个人生活的讨论，对你们俩都有帮助。你们可以选择是否把这个加进记录里。就是这一段。
I would definitely suggest that some of the items we mentioned in this session be used in connection with our sessions, for a beginning. There are obviously connections between the psychic and physical self, and there is no reason why you should not begin to investigate these for yourselves.做为一个开始，我会明确的建议，在这节课我们提到的一些项目可以运用在我们的课里。在心灵和身体的自己之间有着明显的连结，为了你们自己，没有理由不去研究这些。
The physical circumstances which you may discover should never be interpreted as conditions in themselves, under which we operate with varying degrees of efficiency, again, but merely as interconnecting correlations between two sets of intangibles. I will make this clearer at a later time.你可能发现物质环境绝不应该以情况本身被解读，在此我们以不同程度的效率运作，再次的，但只是以两组不可测量之间相连的相关性。我之后会说得更清楚。
(Jane has not been smoking during her deliveries this evening. However she now took a sip of wine. Though I could not see whether her eyes opened or not, I assume they did sufficiently for her to pick up her glass without fumbling.)(珍在今晚口述期间没有抽烟。不过她喝了一口酒。虽然我没有看到她的眼睛是睁开还是闭上，但我猜是睁开的，因为她毫不迟疑地拿起了酒杯。)
As far as our dream experiments are concerned, I believe that you will discover definite correlations of a rather important nature that exist between the incidence of precognitive dreams, and data having to do with temperature and weather.就我们梦的实验而言，我相信你们会发现一个相当重要本质的明确关联，存在于预知梦事件，还有与此相关的温度、天气等资料之间。
I will see if you can discover these for yourselves, but if not I shall point them out for you when the time comes. I do not believe that it is possible for you to carry your dream experiments far enough to discover certain other factors that do exist between various layers of the subconscious, and falling temperature rates in the physical organism. Therefore I will mention the point here.我会看看你们能不能自己发现这些，如果不能，我会在恰当的时间指出来。我不认为你有可能怀抱着梦的经验够远到能发现某些其他因素，这些因素是存在于潜意识不同层面，和体温隆下的温度差之间。因此我会在这里指出来。
It would be necessary to take your temperature many times during the evening, and to correlate the findings with the various levels of the subconscious as they displayed themselves through their characteristic activities within the dream series. Such an experiment would be extremely difficult.在晚上多量几次你的体温是必要的，然后去寻找在一连串的梦里面，当不同层面潜意识透过它们独特的活动显示自己时的相关性。这样的实验会非常的困难。
It should be noted however, that with the exception of several other circumstances the various levels of the subconscious can be found to fall within definite temperature ranges. To some extent this fact can be ascertained through hypnosis. However, suggestion as to the effect that the subjects temperature should rise or fall would tend to obscure the effect.不过我应该指出，除了一些其他情况是例外，潜意识的不同层次会落在明确的温度范围。到某些程度这事实可以透过催眠弄清楚。不过，关于受测者体温应该是上升或下降的效果暗示可能会模糊了这个效果。
This correlation between the layers of the subconscious and temperature ranges is true, or rather observable, only when the personality is in an inactive state. Suggestions of motion or excitement given to it would change and affect the temperature reading, so that this characteristic temperature range could be unnoticed.在潜意识不同场面和温度范围的相关性是真实的，或可察觉的，不过只有在人格不活动的状态。对动作或刺激的暗示都会改变或影响温度的判读，因此这种独特的温度范围可能不被察觉。
Illness and other factors can also obscure this fact. I am speaking in terms of a healthy, normal individual, in good health.疾病和其他因素也会模糊了这个事实。我现在谈的是有着良好状态和健康的正常人。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:58. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her voice was average, her pace also. She said she slits her eyes open when she picks up a wineglass, knocks the ashes off a cigarette, etc. Her head is usually tipped down in such movements and I can detect no opening of the eyes.(9:58休息。珍出离如常。她的音量和速度适中。她说她拿酒杯和抖掉烟灰的时候有微微睁开了眼。在做这些动作的时候，她的头常常是低着的，我无法察觉她的眼睛有没有睁开。
(It was now time for the 21st Dr. Instream test. As usual Jane spoke in a quiet voice, sitting with her hands raised to her closed eyes. Her pace was not very slow, however, although she took a few long pauses. Resume at 10:03.)(现在是时候开始第21次殷斯翠姆博士测验。如往常一样，珍坐着，手放在闭着的眼睛上，以一种轻柔的声音开始说话。不过她的速度并不很慢，虽然有些时候停顿很久。10:03重新开始。)
Now. Give us a moment please.现在。请等我们一会儿。
I pick up the impression of a series of confusing circumstances earlier today, for our Dr. Instream. (Long pause.)在今天稍早，我接收到一连串印象，是关于我们殷斯翠姆博士一连串令人费解的情况。(长时间停顿)
I am picking up his emotional feeling toward them, the circumstances. Whatever they were, they annoyed him considerably. There may have been a book involved. (Long pause.)我接收到他对它们，也就是这些情况的情绪感受。不管它们是什么，它们让他非常生气。可能牵涉到一本书。(长时间停顿)
A connection with another man who visited him recently, and who spoke of a colleague who is from another state, and in the same field as Dr. Instream. (Pause.) A disagreement over, I believe, professional papers and publications, rather the contents of these.和一个最近拜访他的男人有关，而这男人提到一个来自另一州的同事，他和殷斯翠姆博士是在同一个领域。(停顿)我想有一场争论是关于专业论文和出版物的内容。
I pick up the initials A. R., but am not sure to what they refer. Now the impression of a small wooden box, quite small (pause) with something like medals or buttons in it. The size perhaps of a small box in which file cards could be kept. It is on a shelf, and is of dark wood. (Long pause at 10:11.)我接收到缩写A. R. ，但不确定它们指的是什么。现在有一个小木盒子的印象，相当小(停顿)，里边有类似徽章或钮扣的东西。这个小盒子的尺寸大概可以放进档案卡。它放在一个架子上，是深木色的。(长时间停顿10:11)
I believe Dr. Instream is in a room that is not his own, a different room than he has been in any other time during our appointments. (Pause.) A long wall without windows is in it. Adjacent to this wall, a wall with a door. Opposite the long wall, a wall with several windows. The walls of a grayish color.我想殷斯翠姆博士不在他自己的房间，在平常和我们有约时不同的房间。(停顿)一个很长的墙面，没有窗户。邻着这道墙面的，是一道有门在上面的墙。和很长的那面墙不同，这面墙有几个窗户。这墙是浅灰色的。
A shadow passes the door, of a woman I believe, in some outfit of floor length, a floor-length skirt or robe. (Pause, at 10:17.)有个阴影穿过这道门，我想是个女人，穿着某种及地长的服装，一件及地长的裙子或袍子。(停顿10:17)
Do you have a test for me?你还有测验要给我吗？
("Yes.”(“是的。”
(As usual I handed Jane the standard sealed double envelope containing my drawing of the symbol shown on page 95. She reached out for it without opening her eyes, then sat quietly holding it in both hands. Momentarily, she laid her left hand flat upon the envelope. This is the 18th envelope test.)(像往常一样，我交给她一个标准信封，里面有着本节刚开始时我画的象征符号。她伸手接过，没有睁开眼睛，然后静静的坐着，双手握着它。极短暂的，她把左手平放在信封上。这是第18次信封测试。)
Ruburt would have preferred that I did not speak out because of our last episode.因为上一插曲，鲁柏会宁愿我没有说出来。
Anything you learn however is to your advantage. Give us a moment, if you please.不过你们学到的任何东西对你们来说都是有益的。请等我们一下。
These will be impressions. Something that is filled on both sides, that is, with neither side entirely vacant. An association with you, Joseph, and an afternoon, either in 1963 or when you were 43. At least these are the numbers that I receive impressions of.以下这些是印象。两面都有东西，没有一面是完全空白的。和你，约瑟，还有一个下午有关联，在1963年，或是当你43岁的时候。至少这些数字是我接收到的印象。
Also a connection with a supper engagement, with two others beside Ruburt. The word congratulations. I do not specifically mean that the word is on the item, but that somehow congratulations are connected with an event associated with the item.也和一次晚餐的约会有关，鲁柏的旁边有其他两个人。恭喜这个字。我并不是具体指这个字在物件上，但恭喜和与这个物件相连的事件有关。
Yellow. Paper; not of course the envelope. A series, as of quickly following events, and a canyon or rock shape.黄色。纸张，当然不是指信封。一连串快速接连的事件，和一个峡谷或石块的形状。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:24. Jane was dissociated as usual, she said. Her eyes had remained closed. Her pace on our own test had been faster than on the Dr. Instream material.(10:24休息。珍说她出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着。在我们自己的测验，她说话的速度比殷斯翠姆博士的资料时还快。
(As stated on page 95, the black ink drawing struck through the thin test paper so that it was visible on both sides of the paper. This could be "neither side entirely vacant.” The test object is paper, and is connected with me since my name is on it, and I made the drawing. I was 43 until June 20 in 1963.(就像前面提到的，黑墨水的素描划过很薄的测验纸，因此纸的两面都可以看到。这可能是“没有一面是完全空白的”。测验物件是纸，和我有关是因为我的名字在上面，而且是我画的。我在1963年6月20满43岁。
(We did not press Seth for an item-by-item interpretation of the rest of the impressions.
