I had prepared this test envelope for last Wednesdays session but did not use it then; the session was witnessed by the Gallaghers and the test was shoved aside by other developments, notably the impromptu discussion between Seth, Bill and Peg. We ate during the course of the evening, but do not know whether this would be a "supper engagement, with two others beside Ruburt.”(我们没有逼着赛斯一项一项的解释其他印象。我在上周三的课就把测验信封准备好了，直到今天才用上；加拉格夫妇有参与那节课，因为其他事件的发展，测验就被摆在一旁，特别是赛斯、比尔和蓓的那场即席讨论。我们今晚一起吃饭，但不知道这是否就是“晚餐的约会，鲁柏的旁边有其他两个人”。
(Jane resumed at a slow pace, with her eyes closed, at 10:35.)(珍以一个较慢的速度重新开始，她的眼睛闭着，10:35。)
Now. If tests of this nature are to be given at all, they should be given with some kind of regularity, so that Ruburt accepts them as simply another part of the sessions.现在。如果会有这种性质的测验，它们应该要有某种规律性，那么鲁柏就可以很容易地接受这是课的另一部分。
His confidence will then be maintained through the averages of our successes, which all in all will be quite good. Isolated tests do not work well, for they upset what he considers the normal circumstances of our sessions. When given they should follow our Dr. Instream material.他的信心也会因为我们成功的平均率而维持，那从各方面来说都是很好的。单独的测验不会做得很好，因为它们干扰了他认为是我们课的正常情况。信封测验应该排在殷斯翠姆博士资料之后。
When the tests are given regularly we will automatically hit those evenings when conditions are excellent for reception. We shall of course also hit evenings when conditions are not so good, but these will not annoy you when you have successes under your belt.当测验是规律进行的，在状况极佳的那些夜晚，我们就会自动命中答案。当状况没有那么好的夜晚，我们也应该会命中答案，因为之前的成功经验会让这些不至于令你们太烦恼。
You are investigating these matters, and should be interested in discovering what you can about when we succeed, and when we do not.你们既然在研究这些问题，那么应该会对我们成功或不成功时，你们能做的是什么感兴趣。
I will end the session or continue as you prefer.你们想我结束这一节，或你们想继续，随你便。
(“Well end it then.”)(“我们结束好了。”)
My best regards to you both, and a good evening.我对你们俩最衷心的祝福，晚安。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:41. Jane was dissociated as usual.)(10:41结束。珍出离如常。)
(Tracing of the envelope front used in the 19th envelope test, in the 213th session for December 1,1965.)用在1965年12月1日第213节第19次信封测验上的信封正面素描

SESSION 213 第213节 节日情结 信封19


DECEMBER 1, 1965 9:50 PM WEDNESDAY1965年12月1日 星期三 晚上9:50
(The 19th envelope test was held this evening. The test object was the front of an envelope mailed to us by Jane's father last July. See the tracing on page 101. The writing was in blue ink on white paper. Note the error, 1985, in the postmark; I thought Seth might comment on this but he did not. The envelope front was folded once and placed between two sheets of Bristol, then sealed in the usual double envelopes.(今晚举行第19次信封测验。测验物件是一个信封的正面，是珍的父亲去年7月寄给我们的信。见上图素描。字迹是用蓝墨水写在白纸上。注意邮戳上“1985”的这个错误；我原先想赛斯可能会评论这点，可他没有。信封正面折起来夹在两张纸中间，然后放进普通信封里。
(Tonight’s session began at 9:50 PM. After supper this evening Jane expressed a desire to vary the routine, although she did not want to skip the session. On impulse I invited her out for a beer. There were go-go girls at the neighborhood tavern we went to, and both of us enjoyed the break in routine. Jane, very amused, commented every so often that she received little “messages” from a certain party, expressing approval of our actions, and merely suggesting that we do get to the session at least a few minutes before the Instream material was due.(今晚的课在9:50开始。在今晚的晚餐后，珍表达了想要改变惯例的渴望，但她并不打算跳过这一节。在一个冲动之下，我邀请她出去喝啤酒。在我们常去的邻近酒吧，里面有跳舞女郎，我们两个都很享受生活中这种休憩的时光。珍非常愉快的说，她不时会从一个特定的派对收到短短的“讯息”，表达了对我们行动的赞同，而只是建议我们至少在殷斯翠姆博士资料开始前几分钟回到课堂。
(As mentioned by Seth in the last session, I have begun keeping a record of outside weather data from our television weather channel. This includes humidity, barometric pressure, etc., as detailed on page 97. This record is for session nights only; I do not know whether it is necessary to insert the data into each session. When we begin our dream experiments with the recorder, we will also keep a daily weather record, again as suggested by Seth.(上一节赛斯所提到的，我开始从我们的电视气象频道记录外面的天气。这包括了湿度、气压等等，细节见第212节。这个记录只包含有课的晚上；我不知道是否有必要把这些资料放进每节课里。当我们开始用录音机记录梦的经验时，我们也会记录每天的天气，这也是赛斯建议的。
(The session was held in our front room. With the windows closed traffic noise was not a problem. Jane began speaking while sitting down, in an average voice and at a good pace from the beginning. Jane 's eyes opened wide immediately after Seth’s greeting, which is most unusual. They were very dark. Seth/Jane was quite pleased and amused, and spoke with a smile. Jane was smoking.)(这节课在我们前面的房间举行。把窗户关上后交通噪音就不是问题。珍坐着开始说话，以一种适中的音量和良好的速度开始。在赛斯的问候之后，珍的眼睛马上睁得很大，这是很不寻常的。她的眼神很深邃。赛斯/珍十分愉快和高兴，说话的时候带着微笑。珍在抽烟。)
Now then, good evening my friends.现在，晚安，我的朋友们。
(“Good evening, Seth.'')(“晚安，赛斯。”)
It is perfectly all right now and then to vary your schedule in this manner, and probably all in all most beneficial.有时候以这种方式变动你们的日程安排是完全没问题的，可能从各方面来说这是最有益的。
You probably also came to this conclusion by yourselves, and while I would not make the habit of beginning our sessions later than usual, occasionally such tardiness is more than justified. The use of the different room is also beneficial, to vary the routine.你们自己也可能会得到这样的结论，我并不认为课较晚开始会变成习惯，但偶尔这样的延迟是合乎情理的。使用不同的房间，改变常规，也是有益的。
We will of course shortly give our Dr. Instream material, and so I shall not become involved in any complicated matters beforehand. You have both been doing very well however, and shortly we shall be having an anniversary of sorts, I believe.我们将会很快地提供殷斯翠姆博士的资料，所以我不应该在测验前涉及任何复杂的问题。无论如何你们两个都做得非常好，我相信很快就到我们的周年纪念日了。
(Our first regular session was held on December 2,1963. )(我们的第一节定期课是在1963年12月2日举行的。)
There were a few remarks that I intended to make concerning the Christmas season, and perhaps I shall make them now.我打算针对圣诞节发表一些评论，也许我现在就该这么做。
If it seems to you that there is a great gap existing within Christianity, between ideals expressed, and actions, then let me tell you that conditions would indeed be far worse if these ideals had not initially been expressed, and if they were not yearly reaffirmed.如果对你们而言，在基督教的理想表达与作为之间存在着巨大鸿沟，那么让我告诉你们，如果那些理想一刚开始没有被表达而且没有在每年圣诞节被重申的话，情况的确是更糟的。
As you both suppose, enough constructive psychic energy is generated during the holiday season to recharge psychic batteries, so to speak, for quite some time. Were it not for this your whole race would be in much more serious a predicament.就如你们所认为的，足够的建设性心灵能量在假期季节重新集结，而使心灵电池重新充电，可以说已经有好一阵子了。若非如此，整个人类都会处在更严重的困境里。
One of the reasons, Joseph, for your own lack of festive spirit in the past has been the result of your realization that this gap between idealism and action is great. You could not therefore enter into what you felt to be the hypocrisy of the season. All the more since you have no particular conviction, anymore than Ruburt has, concerning the historic existence of a Christ.约瑟，你在过去缺乏节日精神的原因之一，是因为你了解这个存在于理想与作为之间的鸿沟是巨大的(注：罗一到圣诞节就会身体不舒服)。所以你进入不了你感觉是虚伪的节庆。关于历史上基督的存在，你不比鲁柏更确信。
To some extent I have explored some of this, but it will do you well to join wholeheartedly into the very necessary spirit of the time, for it is constructive and most beneficial. And in so doing you help yourself and others.到某种程度我探索了关于这些的一部分，但对你而言，全心参与这个时代非常必要的基本精神是有帮助的，因为它是建设性且很有助益的。而如此做时，你帮助了自己也帮助了其他人。
Now. There was no historic Virgin Birth, and no historic Crucifixion. This does not mean that these do not represent symbolic realities.现在。并没有一个历史上的圣母玛利亚诞生(Virgin Birth)，也没有一个历史上的钉十字架(Crucifixion)。这并不意味着这些就不代表一个象征实相。
I am going to give you a brief break, and then we shall meet with our Dr. Instream; and I shall afterwards discuss this matter somewhat further.我让你们有个短暂的休息，然后轮到我们和殷斯翠姆博士的约会了；我应该在之后更深入的讨论这个话题。
(Break at 10:00. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first break. Much of the time her eyes had been wide open and very dark. Her pace had been good, her voice average, and she had smoked.(10:00休息。珍在第一阶段出离如常。大部分时间她的眼睛都睁得很大，眼神深邃。她的速度很好，音量适中。她在抽烟。
(Seth has dealt with psychic gestalts, religion, the Crucifixion, beginnings and endings, etc., under the general heading of the God concept, at various times. See the following sessions among others: 24, 27, 31, 51, 62, 66, 81, 95, 97, 115, 135, 145, 146, 147, 149, 151, 177.(赛斯曾在不同的时间谈过心灵完形、宗教、钉十字架、开始和结束等等，在上帝概念之下的广泛主题。见以下各节：24、27、31、51、62、66、81、95、97、115、135、145、146、147、149、151、177。
(Seth has referred to my lack of holiday enthusiasm in the past. I have been conscious of this ever since and have been making attempts to improve it. So far this season, I believe my attitude has shown a marked improvement.(赛斯在过去曾指出我缺乏对节庆的热情。自那时开始，我就有意识到这点并着手改进。因此这一次节庆，我相信我的态度已经有明显进步。
(It was now time for the 22nd Dr. Instream test. As usual Jane sat with her hands raised to her closed eyes while giving the data. She used pauses but all in all her pace was not particularly slow. Her voice was quiet. Resume at 10:03.)(现在是第22次殷斯翠姆博士测试。就如往常一样，在给资料的时候，珍坐着把手放到眼睛上。她有停顿，但整体来说，速度不特别慢。她的声音轻柔。10:03重新开始。)
Now. Give us a moment.现在。等我们一下。
Again it seems, as I believe one time before, he is in a room that is at least partially below ground level. With chairs, many chairs in it, of the straight-backed variety.再次地，我想他似乎是在一间有部分是在地下室的房间里面。有椅子，里面有很多椅子，有很多把直背的椅子。
(Pause.) Whether or not this is a cafeteria I do not know, but he and others seem to be drinking coffee. (Pause.) He is dressed in a business-type suit this evening, with shirt and tie, standing up and talking to two other people.(停顿)不知道这是否是自助餐厅，但他和其他人似乎在喝咖啡。(停顿)他今晚穿得西装笔挺，有衬衫、领带，站着和另外两个人说话。
He finds the conversation in some way inadequate. He is trying to get definite answers from a man who does not seem able to give them. The man is taller than Dr. Instream, somewhat younger, but not in the same department at the university.他发现这对话某方面来说是不够的。他想要从一个男人身上得到明确的答案，但这男人似乎无法给他。这个男人比殷斯翠姆博士高，稍微年轻一些，但并没有和他在大学的同一部门。
The doctor looks at his watch. (Pause at 10:08.) He received a book by mail today, a biography sort of book, having to do with a personality of the late 1800 s. A medium.博士看着他的表。(10:08停顿)他今天收到一本书，一本传记类的书，和一个19世纪后期的人有关。一个灵媒。
There are four or five people, now, in his immediate parry. Two of these are woman I believe. (Pause.)现在有4、5个人在他所在的聚会里。我想两个是女人。(停顿)
He made a trip to his office, and spoke briefly with one man there. (Pause.) Again, some sort of connection with a small black box, very small. The top is black. I do not know about the bottom half.他去了他的办公室，向在那里的一个男人说了一会儿话。(停顿)再次地，和一个小的黑盒子有某种关联，盒子非常小。顶部是黑色的。我不知道底部是什么颜色。
Cocktails earlier (pause), and dinner, with a woman in a restaurant. Your Howard Johnsons. The dinner costing $4.75. (Pause.) The dinner was of a business-mixed-with-social affair. (Pause.)先喝鸡尾酒(停顿)，然后吃晚餐，和一个女人在餐厅。是你们的哈沃强森饭店。晚餐花了4.75美元(停顿)。这顿晚餐兼具了生意和社交的性质。(停顿)
Do you have a test for me?你有测验要给我吗？
("Yes.”(“是的。”
(It was 10:15. This is the 19th envelope test. As usual I handed Jane the sealed double envelope. She held the envelope quietly, her eyes still closed. She took a sip of milk, then sat with her left hand to her face.)(现在是10:15。这是第19次信封测试。像往常一样，我递给珍一个封好的信封。她安静地拿着信封，眼睛仍闭着。她喝了一口牛奶，然后坐着把左手放在脸上。)
Now we shall see, again, what we can do. Give us a moment. A connection with water. One, two, three, or three of a kind. A connection with a commercial venture. A connection again, with an afternoon and two people, yourself and Ruburt.现在，再次地，我们应该看看我们能做什么。等我们一下。和水有关联。1、2、3，或一种里面的3个。和一项商业性的冒险有关。再次的，和一个下午以及两个人有关联，你自己和鲁柏。
Ruburt here thinks of a photograph of the two of you, taken at Marathon. (Pause.) A border. Horizontal lines that are similar to each other. A late spring, or a spring or summer month.鲁柏在这里想到你们两个在马拉松比赛时拍的一张照片。(停顿)一条边。很相似的几条水平线。晚春，或一个在春天或夏天的月分。
A strip, and a connection with an event that was not particularly pleasant. Light and dark, with shadow shapes. A connection with another individual, a male.狭长的海滩。和一件不特别愉快的事件有连结。浅色和深色，有着阴影。和另一个人有连结，是男性。
A photograph, and a connection with someone who visited here.一张照片，和某个曾到这里拜访的人有连结。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:22. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed except when she had sipped milk briefly. Her pace had been faster than usual for the material on both tests, her voice average.(10:22休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，除了她喝牛奶的时候。她在两个测验时的速度比平常快，音量适中。
(See the tracing of the test object on page 101. All in all the envelope test results were much superior to the previous two tests, and Jane was pleased. “A connection with water” can be our Elmira, New York address, 458 W. Water Street, or that both Ormond Beach and Daytona Beach, Florida, are on the ocean.(请看上面给出的测试物件素描。从各方面来说，信封测验的结果比前两次测验好，而珍很高兴。“和水有关联”可能是指我们在纽约州埃尔迈拉的住址，西华特街458号，或是佛罗里达州的欧蒙海滩[Ormond Beach]以及丹塔那海滩[Daytona Beach]，这些地方都在海边。
？(A later addition by Jane: “I’d say it was referring to the return address—Ormond Beach on the ocean.”(珍后来补充：“我会说它是指寄件人地址——在海边的欧蒙海。”
(“One, two, three, or three of a kind, ” can be the July 3 postmark date on the envelope. The envelope is addressed to Jane and me, “yourself and Ruburt, ” but we do not particularly see where “afternoon” comes in. I remember the photograph of Jane and me taken at Marathon, Florida. “A border” regarding the test object does not ring a bell, but “Horizontal lines that are similar to each other, ” are the postmark cancellation lines. The letter was mailed in July, “a spring or summer month.”(“1、2、3，或一种里面的3个”可能是信封上的邮戳日期7月3日。这封信是寄给珍和我的，“你自己和鲁柏”，但我们并不特别知道“下午”指的是什么。我记得珍和我的照片是在佛罗里达州的马拉松拍的。关于测验物件的“一条边”并没有让我们想到什么，但“很相似的几条水平线”是邮戳上的戳印。这封信是7月寄出的，“一个在春天或夏天的月份”。
(Jane insists that “A strip” refers to the beautiful long beaches at both Daytona and Ormond, which adjoin each other. Without going into personal details, we can say that Seth is correct when he refers to “A connection with an event that was not particularly pleasant”; this involved us and Jane's father in Florida.(珍坚持“狭长的海滩”指的是，紧邻着丹塔那和欧蒙的美丽狭长海滩。不用说到细节，当他说到“和一件不特别愉快的事件有连结”时，我们就知道赛斯是对的；这涉及了在佛罗里达时珍的父亲和我们的关系。
(We do not see a connection with “Light and dark, with shadow shapes" particularly: Jane's father, who addressed the envelope, can be “A connection with another individual, a male.” Jane’s father is of course “someone who visited here, " but we do not know what “A photograph" means, particularly, in the test data, since Seth did not elaborate.(我们不特别知道“浅色和深色，有着阴影”有什么关联。珍的父亲，寄信的人，可以是“和另一个人有连结，是男性”。珍的父亲当然是“某个曾到这里拜访的人”，但我们不知道“一张照片”在测验资料里特别指的是什么，因为赛斯没有细说。
(Usually now we do not ask Seth to explain every reference made in a test if we do not see any connection. We list what we see as connections, and have noted that if we are really puzzled about any test data, Seth will say something about the problem after break.(通常我们不会要求赛斯解释每个我们不明白的测验参考资料。我们列下我们认为有关联的，也会列下我们觉得特别困惑的。赛斯会在休息后根据问题发表看法。
(Jane now resumed with her eyes closed, and at an average rate, at 10:30.)(现在珍重新开始的时候眼睛闭着，以一种适中的速度，10:30。)
Now. I am going to give you a brief session, since you do have one coming, and you have been most faithful.现在。我给你们一节很短的课，因为你们有另一节即将到来，而你们一直是最忠诚的。
I wanted to have a test, and what I said regarding tests in the last session still holds.我想要有一个测验，而我上一节所说关于测验的事依旧算数。
This feeling that Christmas represented hypocrisy has been one of the main reasons for your own low spirits during the season, for it represented a rather deep disillusionment with the culture in which you were nurtured.圣诞节代表着虚伪，这样的感觉是你在圣诞季期间，心情低落的其中一个重要原因，而它代表了对一个滋养你的文化相当深的理想幻灭 。
(Jane's eyes now opened, and for the rest of the delivery they opened and shut often.)(珍的眼睛现在是睁开的，剩下的口述它们常常睁开又闭上。)
The legend of Christ is of great psychic import however, and is intrinsically true. This does not mean it is based in historical fact. In many ways it is more true than historic fact, for man himself created that which had not been provided. The creation nevertheless happened in quite real terms, and is part of mankind’s inner recognition of the pyramid gestalts of which I have spoken.无论如何，基督的传奇有着伟大的心灵重要性，它有着内在的真实。这并不代表它是基于历史的事实。在很多方面来说，它比历史的事实更真实，人类自己创造了那本未被提供的。无论如何这个创造以十分真实的形式发生了，而且我说过它是一部分金字塔完形的人类内在认可。
This was as close as man could come in his imagination to that which is, and this is all right. The basic idea behind Christmas is definitely important, whether or not the intellect is able to see its significance.这近乎人类想像力的极限，而这是没有问题的。圣诞节背后的基本概念明显是重要的，不管理智是否能看到它的重要性。
Now. Psychologically alone this is beneficial, for it acts against those feelings of despair that can creep up during the winter season. And by reminding men of a birth and a resurrection it hints at the innate abilities of the race to transcend physical time and space.现在。单独以心理上来说这是有益的，它抵抗了在冬季里渐渐变强的绝望。借着提醒耶稣出生的复活，它暗示了种族超越物质时间和空间的内在能力。
The getting out of oneself that is involved is excellent therapy, and therapy that does others good, as well as the self involved. There is much more here, however. Culturally speaking, there is a strong connection with pagan intuitions, deep and meaningful, that found newer and broader expressions.那涉及的个人死后复生是极佳的治疗，而这个治疗不论对涉及的自己或是他人都是好的。不过这里还有更多。文化上来说，这里和异教的教义有着强烈的连结，是深远而有意义的，那建立了更新更广的表达。
The character of Christ as it is portrayed is an excellent one, since it stressed human rather than specifically male qualities. Or should I say it stressed human qualities rather than those unfortunately considered male qualities. It stressed the best qualities of the race as a whole.他所描绘的基督性格是极好的，他强调了人性而不是特定的男性特质。或者我应该说，他强调了人生的特质胜过那些所谓不幸的男性特质。它强调了整个种族最好的特质。
The personality of Christ is an idealization, and a clue to the entity of which each individual personality is composed. And as far as prayer is concerned, though I realize that neither of you pray in those terms, someone does indeed listen. The self who prays listens, and makes necessary adjustments and improvements. For the individual is part of All That Is, and therefore partakes of the abilities of the psychic gestalts of which we have so sketchily spoken.基督的人格是一个理想化的事物，暗示了每个个别人格所组成的存有线索。就一个祈祷者而言，虽然我明白你们两个不以那种方式祈祷，但某个人确实是在听着的。祈祷的自己在听着，然后做必要的调整和进步。因为个人是一切万有的一部分，因此共享了我曾概略说过的心灵完形能力。
I will now close our session, with my fondest good wishes to you both, and I believe that we have set Ruburt back on a fairly steady line.我现在要结束这一节了，我对你们俩最深的祝福，我想我们让鲁柏回到了相当稳定的连线。
("Yes.”)(“是的。”)
Sometime shortly we shall discuss some personal material if you wish.很快的，我们应该会讨论到你们所希望得到的一些个人资料。
("Yes.’)(“好的。')
Your little excursion this evening was quite helpful.你们今晚小小的出游是十分有帮助的。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:45. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had opened and closed frequently, and she had been smoking. She felt good over the test results.)(10:45结束。珍出离如常。眼睛常常睁开又闭上。她抽着烟。她对测验结果感觉很好。)

SESSION 214 第214节 所有的行动基本上都是自发性的 信封20


DECEMBER 6, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年12月6日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(An unscheduled session was held on Friday evening, December 3,1965, in our apartment. Beginning at about 10:15 PM, Seth spoke at no great length to six people, myself included. The six witnesses comprise Seth’s largest audience to date. Bill and Peggy Gallagher were present, and Ann Diebler, and Don and Marilyn Wilbur. The last three named are from the group of young people who witnessed the unscheduled session of November 5,1965. See the notes on page 57, preceding the 206th session. Ann and Marilyn work with me at Artistic Card Co.(1965年12月3日星期五晚上，在我们公寓里举行一节临时课。大约晚上10:15分开始，赛斯简短的对6个人说话，包括我在内。这是听众最多的一次，有6个人。比尔和蓓·加拉格、安·黛伯乐(Ann Diebler)，还有唐(Don)和玛丽莲·韦伯(Marilyn Wilbur)都有出席。最后3名是参与了1965年11月5日临时课的年轻人。见之前第206节的注记。安和玛丽莲和我一起在艺术卡公司工作。
(Seth gave Don Wilbur a few lines of information concerning a job change he was considering, and Don has a copy of this material. Seth told Ann Diebler he could not at this time answer her questions concerning a friend in Newport News, Virginia, because he has not yet established an emotional rapport with her. He did willingly answer many other questions asked by Ann, Marilyn and Don, questions mostly based on the material itself and the concepts involved.(赛斯给了唐·韦伯几段他所关心的、关于工作变动的讯息，唐留有这段资料的副本。赛斯告诉安·黛伯乐，他无法现在回答她的问题，是关于她在维吉尼亚州新港报社的一个朋友，因为他尚未和她建立情感的密切连结。他很愿意回答安、玛丽莲还有唐所问的其他问题，问题大部分是根据资料本身和其牵涉的概念。
(Peggy Gallagher, a feature writer for the Elmira Star-Gazette, is in Washington DC for a few days this week on business. Seth volunteered to give information about Pegs activities while she is in Washington, and Jane also plans to tune in on Peg via psychological-time experiments. Both of these methods were used with some success during the Gallaghers' vacation in Puerto Rico last October.(蓓·加拉格是埃尔迈拉星报的专栏作家，这周正在华盛顿首府出差几天，赛斯自告奋勇要提供关于蓓在华盛顿活动的讯息，珍也打算透过心理时间的实验来感应蓓。两种方式在10月加拉格夫妇的假期时都曾被使用，而且小有成绩。
(Jane and I have yet to prepare Seth's material on the Puerto Rico experiments, for insertion into the record. We have now decided to present Seth’s hits and near misses only, plus Seth’s data on the Washington experiment, in one of the sessions falling due the week after this.(珍和我尚未准备把和波多黎各实验有关的赛斯资料放进记录里。我们现在决定只把赛斯命中的和几乎命中的资料，加上华盛顿的赛斯资料，放在下一周的其中一节课里。
(Apropos of Peggy’s Washington trip, Seth gave predictions when asked to during Friday's unscheduled session. He also asked the Gallaghers not to say any more about the trip to him, once the subject had been brought up. I took no notes Friday evening, but Peggy did. They accompanied her to Washington, and at Seth’s request she will also make notes while there. There follows a copy of Seth’s material on the trip, as noted down by Peggy:(至于蓓的华盛顿之旅，赛斯在星期五的临时课里曾给过预言。当这个话题被提起的时候，他也要求加拉格夫妇不要对他说任何有关旅行的事。我星期五晚上没有记录，但蓓有。她带着这些资料去华盛顿，而且在赛斯的要求之下，她在那里也会做记录。以下是蓓写下关于这趟旅行赛斯所说的资料。
(“You will meet a woman dressed in green... A clock that doesn’t keep proper time... There are three men in particular with whom you will be associated... You will meet a man you do not like... You will have a grand view of an occasion... A turnoff that does not bring you where you want to go... An unscheduled social engagement, not in a private home but a public place... The number 5 and the number 321... Another room besides the one that has been planned.”)(“你会遇到一个穿绿衣服的女人……一个不准的时钟……有3个男人将会特别和你有联系……你会遇到一个你不喜欢的男人……你会看到一个壮丽的风景……一条没有领你到你想要的地方的岔路……一个不预期的社交聚会，不在私人住宅，是在公共场所……数字5和数字321.。这一间房间旁边的另外一间房间已经被预定了。”
(Since Peggy has now been made aware of Seth’s predictions, Jane and I now wonder what part, if any, suggestion might play in the events that transpire in Washington DC. Is it possible that the recipient of such predictions can influence physical events, either consciously or unconsciously?(既然蓓现在已经知道了赛斯的预言，我们很好奇在预言后，暗示在华盛顿的旅程中扮演了什么样的角色。当一个人接受这样的预测后，有可能会影响物质事件吗，不管是意识或无意识？
(A somewhat similar question arises concerning a dream Jane had on November 30th, and a few lines of the data given for the 22nd Dr. Instream test; see the following lines on page 104 of the 213th session: “He received a book by mail today, a biography sort of book, having to do with a personality of the late 1800's. A medium.” This material is dated December 1; there follows Jane's dream of the night before.(有一个类似的问题是关于珍在11月30日所做的梦，和第22次殷斯翠姆博士测验所给的几行资料；见第213节。“他今天收到一本书，是传记类的，和一个19世纪后期的人有关。一个灵媒。”这资料注明在12月1日；以下是珍在那夜所做的梦。
(“November 30. Dream not very clear now. 'The Medium ship of—1885. ’ I saw a book with this title. A study of the medium ship of a mother and daughter, it seems. Of the Eisenhower or the Kennedy families? As dream opens I see a house; a farmhouse? Someone is bringing this book to the man or men who live there. This is a country rather than a town house. The man who is given the book startles the man who gives it to him by quoting a line from Dante having to do with (his?) not appointing God. This may have been written inside the book cover, for example. Was the book written by a woman? Woke up finally and wrote this down on scrap paper.”(“11月30日。现在梦并不很清晰。《灵媒术—1885年》，我看见一本书的标题是这个。它似乎是一对母女的灵媒术研究。艾森豪[Eisenhower]或肯尼迪[Kennedy families]家族？梦一开始时我看见一个房子 ；一座农舍？有人带着这本书给住在那里的一个或几个男人。这比较像一个乡下房子而不是城镇的房子。送这本书的人被收这本书的人吓了一跳，因为收这本书的人从但丁里引述了一段话，和(他？)不接受上帝的话。比如这可能是写在书的封面里。这本书是一个女人写的吗？醒来后把这个写在一张小纸片上。
(Another possibility here is that Jane and Seth can work as a team, since Seth has said often that Jane has abilities of her own. If this is true in this particular instance, then the dream would contain elements of distortion. We find the study of dreams more and more interesting. Jane has now begun a book on dreams, to be done concurrently with her book on the Seth material itself.(在这里另一个可能性是珍和赛斯能以一个团队工作，因为赛斯常说珍有她自己的能力。如果这是真的，在这个特别的例子里，这个梦可能包含了扭曲的元素。我们发现梦的研究越来越有趣。珍现在在开始写一本关于梦的书[注：可能指《梦与意识投射》]，会和她的赛斯资料同时完成。
(Also on dreams, recently I have had two extraordinarily vivid dreams involving my brother in Rochester, whom we usually see about twice a year. Seth said during Friday 's unscheduled session that these two dreams are significant, and that tonight's regular session would deal with them. My brother, Bill, is due for a visit here next week; which fact was unknown to us when I had the pair of dreams.(也是关于梦，我最近有两个非常真实的梦，是关于我在罗彻斯特的弟弟，我们通常一年见两次。赛斯在星期五的临时课里说过这两个梦很重要，今晚的定期课会谈到它。我弟弟比尔下周会来这里；当我做这两个梦的时候，我们都不知道这件事。
(The 20th envelope test was held during this session. See the tracing on page 107. For the test object I used part of one of the paper napkins Jane and I were given when we varied our routine prior to the 213th session, and visited a local discotheque for a beer. See the notes on this on page 102. The results of tonight 's test were very interesting. While we were in the discotheque ultraviolet lights were turned on when the entertainment began; this means the test object was viewed by us in this unusual light, and this fact shows in tonights test data.(第20次信封测验会在这节课举行。见上面的素描。测验物件我用的是第213节当时我们更改了行程安排，到附近一家迪斯可舞厅喝啤酒，在那里拿的一张餐巾纸。见上面注记。今晚测验的结果非常有趣。当迪斯可舞厅的节目开始、紫外线灯打开的时候；这意味着我们是在这种不寻常的灯光下看到这个物件，而这个事实反映在今晚的测验资料里。
(Tracing of the quarter of a paper napkin used in the 20th envelope test, of December 6.1965, in the 214th session.)1965年12月6日第214节第20次信封测验上用的一张四分之一纸巾的素描
(Tonights session was held in our back room, and was a quiet one. Jane did not smoke while speaking. As usual she sat down; her eyes remained closed for the entire session. Her rate of speaking was good from the start, her voice quiet.)(晚上的课在我们后面的房间举行，是比较静的那一间。珍说话的时候并没有抽烟。如往常一样她坐下；她的眼睛整节课都是闭着的。她说话的速度从一开始就很平稳。声音轻柔。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now, I told you that I would discuss two dreams in which you were interested. However, since we are going to devote some time to our cat lover, in Washington, I will not begin the discussion of those dreams now. I could not do them justice in a short period, and would like to devote most of one session to them; and so we shall very shortly. Instead let us speak briefly on time and action.现在，我告诉你们我将会讨论你们感兴趣的这两个梦。不过我们会分给我们在华盛顿的爱猫人士一点时间，所以我现在还没有要开始讨论这两个梦。我无法在短时间内充分发挥我的能力，我希望能用将近一节的时间来讨论它们；我们很快就会开始。让我们简短的说一下时间和行动。
(Seth’s favorite name for Peggy Gallagher is the cat lover, since Peg is afraid of cats; and he likes to call Bill Gallagher the Jesuit, because of his never-ending questions.)(赛斯最喜欢叫蓓·加拉格爱猫人士，因为蓓怕猫；他喜欢叫比尔·加拉格耶稣会信徒，因为他没完没了的问题。)
As I have told you, all action is basically spontaneous. Only your perception of it adds the illusion of time to action. You think, for example, that any given action consumes or devours or takes up a certain amount of time. Therefore you think of time as something that contains action.如同我告诉过你们的，所有的行动基本上都是自发性的。只有你对它的感知给行动添加了时间的幻觉。比如说，你认为任何特定的行动都会消耗、吞噬或占用一定量的时间。因此你认为时间是某种包含行动的东西。
(Seth has given so much material on action that it cannot be assigned to a few sessions. It was mentioned by name before the 15th session or thereabouts. It has been especially stressed since the 120th session, and so continues.)(赛斯给了太多有关行动的资料，所以它无法被涵盖在短短几节内。在第15节左右有提过。从第120节开始特别强调，还有很多。)
The dimensions of action itself have nothing to do, basically, with your conception of time. Instead the dimensions of action have to do with intensities; not only the intensities of the electromagnetic components that compose them, but with intensities as they are translated into psychological terms. Therefore the psychological experience of a particular event or action has little to do with clock time.基本上，行动的维度本身和你们对时间的概念无关。相反的，行动的维度和强度有关；不只是组成它们的电磁成分强度，还有它们转译为心理条件的强度。因此一个特定事件或行动的心理经验和时钟时间甚少相关。
It is instead composed of the intensity with which it is felt by a given individual. When you speak in terms of the depth of a river, you speak in terms of distance, physical distance. When you speak in terms of the depth of a psychological experience or action, you mean something else entirely, for this is a depth of intensity. And you travel through an experience only so far as your own experience of intensity will allow you.相反的，它是由特定个体所感受到的强度所组成。当你说到河的深度，你是以一种间距，物质的间距来说；当你说到一个心理经验或行动的深度，你指的是一件完全不同的事，因为这是一种强度的深度。而你只能旅行过一个你自己强度的经验能允许你到的地方。
(Here Seth begins to elaborate on the material on electrical fields and intensities, given in the 120th to 130th sessions. See Volume 3.)(这里赛斯开始详述电子场域和强度的资料，在第120至130节有提到，见第三册。)
The psychological feeling of intensity has its own electromagnetic reality. An action is an experienced intensity, and need not involve motion in physical terms. As I have said, every action is a part of every other action, and affects every other action, and is also so affected itself. This is not however your cause and effect theory at all.强度的心理感受有其自身的电磁实相。一个行动是一个被经验的强度，不需要涉及物质说法的动作。我之前说过，每一个行动都是每一个其他行动的一部分，因而影响了每一个其他的行动，也影响了它本身。不过这并不是你们的因果论。
For the actions are spontaneous basically, again, and the effects exist so swiftly that it is impossible to say that one occurs before or after the other, or causes another. This could be likened to some gigantic, spontaneous motion that happens very swiftly. When you viewed such a gigantic motion with a slow camera, then you would get the effect that you receive within your system, of a continuous time. Where actually perhaps a sudden explosion had taken place, you would see a slow progression of light and motion.再次地，行动基本上是自发性的，而结果发生的如此迅速，以至于不可能去说哪一个发生在前、哪一个发生在后，或哪一个引发了哪一个。这可以比喻成某些非常迅速发生的、庞大的、自发性的动作。当你以慢镜头检视这个庞大的动作，你会在你们系统里一个连续性的时间内接收到结果。事实上，当一个突然的爆炸发生的时候，你会看到光和动作的一个缓慢进程。
Your concept of time does not of course change time itself, but it does force you to perceive actions in a certain manner. Much of this is the result of the limitations of the physical organism, but much more is the effect of the development of the ego, which attempts to set itself up and apart from action.你对时间的概念当然不会改变时间本身，但它会迫使你以某种方式来感知行动。这大部分是由于物质有机体局限的结果，但更多的是自我发展的结果，它意图造成它自己与行动的分离。
The inner self and the deeper layers of the subconscious are relatively free however from the egos false gods, and it is for this reason that precognitions are at all possible. For these layers of the self are simply able to perceive a larger portion of action than the ego is able or willing to perceive. As a rule, the ego will not even accept the information that is derived in such a manner, for to do so would be to deny those artificial precepts of continuity upon which it feels its dominance rests.不过内我和较深层的潜意识，相对于自我所谓的伪神们是比较自由的，而也是这个原因，预知才是可能的。自己的这些层面比起自我能更简单或更愿意意识到更大一部分的行动。在多数的情况下，自我甚至不会接受以这种方式得到的讯息，因为如果这么做的话，就会否认了那些它感觉主要根基建立其上的连续性人工准则。
The ego however is quite secure. It would exist regardless, now, of the particular theories of time which might be held, for it is strongly anchored as a specific manipulator of physical reality. And physical reality, believe it or not, is not dependent upon the theory of time as a series of moments.不过，自我是十分安全的。不管现在所持有的特定时间理论是什么，它会存在，因为它以一个物质实相的具体操纵者强烈地扎根着。而不管你相不相信，物质实相并不依赖着时间是一连串片刻的这个理论。
Your institutions, both cultural and educational, may be dependent upon time as a series of moments, but physical reality itself is not.你的风俗习惯，不管是文化或教育方面，可能依赖着时间是一连串的片刻，但物质实相本身不是这样的。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:25. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first break. Her eyes had remained closed, and she did not smoke. Her pace had been good from the beginning.(9:25休息。珍在第一阶段出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，而她没有抽烟。她的速度从一开始就很好。
(See the 149th-152nd sessions for the material on moment points and time. Once again, the material on time is woven through the sessions. Seth began discussing time in the 14th session. See the sessions 120. 130 for material on the electrical field and time, in Volume 3.(请见第149节至152节关于片刻点和时间的资料。再次地，关于时间的资料是交织在课程里。赛斯在第14节就开始讨论时间。见第三册第120至130节关于电子场域和时间的资料。
(Jane has been reading J.B. Priestley’s book, Time and Man, recently. She is well aware that Seth often discusses her reading matter. She remarked that tonight Seth had elaborated on a few statements Mr. Priestley had made; that is, Seth was not paraphrasing, but carrying ideas further.(珍最近正读普莱斯利(J.B. Priestley)的书，《时间与人类》。她觉察到赛斯常常会讨论到她阅读的内容，她提到今晚赛斯详细描述了普莱斯利的一些声明；赛斯没有解释，但把这个想法带得更深。
(We thought it might be time now for Seth to give some data on Peggy Gallagher and her activities in Washington, DC, since in giving the data on the Gallaghers in Puerto Rico last October, he had done so at 9:30 in each session. Jane now resumed with her eyes closed, and at a good pace. She was smiling. Resume at 9:35.)(我们认为现在是时候来一些蓓·加拉格在华盛顿首府的活动资料，上次关于加拉格夫妇10月在波多黎各的资料，赛斯是在课的9点半给的。现在，珍重新开始时眼睛闭着，以一种很好的速度。她在微笑。在9:35分重新开始。)
One small note here.一个简短记录。
Your physicists know that time does not exist, basically, as a series of moments, one following the other. Therefore my earlier remark that physical reality was not dependent upon time as a series of moments should be obvious.基本上，你们的物理学家知道时间并不以一连串的片刻、一个接着另一个的方式存在。因此对于我之前的论点，物质实相并不依赖着一连串片刻的时间，应该是很容易理解的。
Physical reality is dependent upon your sensual perception of action, and that is all.物质实相是依赖着人们对行动的感官感知，而那就是全部。
Obviously we have more to say here, and so we shall. For since you are operating still within time as a series of moments, we do not have time for that discussion now.显然我们在这里有更多可以说的，而我们也会这么做。因为你们仍以时间是一连串的片刻来运作时，我们就没有时间做这样的讨论。
Please give me a moment—and what happens to it when you give it to me?请等我们片刻——当你把片刻给我的时候，它发生了什么？
(Jane, her eyes still closed, paused briefly at 9:37. Her pace now slowed somewhat, and she held a hand up to her closed eyes.)(珍，她的眼睛仍闭着，短暂的在9:37停顿了一下。她现在的速度慢了下来，把手举到她闭着的眼睛上。)
Now, we shall see what we can do.现在，我们看看我们能做什么。
A talk concerning survival of your nation. Our friend the cat lover attends this discussion, perhaps in a room numbered 312.一场关于你们国家存活的讨论。我们的朋友爱猫人士参加了这个讨论会，也许在一间数字312的房间。
The speaker is interrupted. A question-and-answer session. Three main speakers in the discussion itself. Survival is a strong issue here, though it may not be the title of the discussion, formally.演讲者被打断。一场问与答的会议。讨论会本身有3个演讲者。生存在这里是一个强烈的主题，虽然它可能不会是正式讨论会的名称。
A tow-headed man with whom our friend comes into contact. She may not like him overmuch.我们的朋友和一个淡金发色的男人有接触。她可能并没有很喜欢他。
(It will be recalled that during the unscheduled session of last Friday, December 3, Seth stated that Peggy would meet a man she wouldn’t like. Jane and I wonder what part, if any, suggestion can play in such statements, perhaps unwittingly leading the recipient to react adversely to an individual.)(回忆在12月3日星期五的临时课里，赛斯说过蓓会遇到一个她不喜欢的人。珍和我很好奇，这样的陈述会不会有哪一部分的暗示在运作，也许无意间会引导接受者向一个人做出不良的反应。)
Something to do with a federation. Pamphlets are given out. Directions to a northeast location perhaps, though I do not know, for tomorrows lecture.某个和联邦有关的东西。有小册子发送。也许指向一个东北的所在地，虽然我不清楚，是不是在明天的演讲会上。
A particular man with a camera slung over his shoulder, who gets our friend's attention. A handkerchief shows above his breast pocket. Pointed, that is a pointed handkerchief, with an initial, perhaps a C or G.一个摄影机挂在肩上的特别的男人得到我们朋友的注意力。胸前的口袋露出手帕。尖尖的，一条尖尖的手帕，有缩写在上面，也许是C或G。
A grab bag of some kind. Theater-type chairs rather than benches.某种手提袋。比较是戏院那种椅子而不是凳子。
Incidentally, our Jesuits ulcer bothers him this evening, quite strongly.顺道一提，我们的耶稣会信徒今晚胃不舒服，十分严重。
A measurement of abilities, though I do not know to what this refers. 14,000 in all attend, in all sections, though at various times.一个关于能力的测量，虽然我不知道那指的是什么。参与的有14000人，所有的区，虽然是在不同的时间。
The hotel on a corner. Her room above three floors. A man across the way. The number 421.旅馆在转角。她的房间在3楼以上。一个男人在对面。数字421。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:51. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes remained closed. Her pace had picked up considerably by the time break arrived.(9:51休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着。当接近休息的时候，她的速度大幅度地加快。
(Note that in Friday's session Seth had mentioned the number 321 to Peggy. In the material above Seth gives the number 312, which is a scrambled 321, and later the number 421. See page 108: Three other impressions checked out.(注意星期五的课，赛斯曾对蓓提到了数字321。在上面的资料，赛斯给了数字312，是一个顺序错了的321，后来是数字421。见前面相应页面：确认了3个印象。
(It was now time for the 23rd Dr. Instream test. Once again Jane sat with her hands raised to her closed eyes. Her pace was not too slow, although broken by many pauses. Resume at 10:04.)(现在是时间开始第23次殷斯翠姆博士测试。再次珍坐着，手举在闭着的眼睛上，她的速度并不慢，虽然中间有很多停顿。10:04重新开始。)
Now. Give us a moment once more, for your Dr. Instream material.现在。为了你们的殷斯翠姆博士资料，请等我们一下。
A very smallish crowded room. I believe a cocktail party. A woman seems to be the main hostess, though a man is present with her.一个又小又挤的房间。我想是鸡尾酒派对。一个女人似乎是女主人，虽然有一个男人在她身边。
Dr. Instream is present, in an absent-minded way. Something is discussed by Dr. Instream and a man, an event that is to occur in February. The first to the middle of the month, rather than to the end. (Pause.)殷斯翠姆博士也出席，以一种心不在焉的态度。殷斯翠姆博士和一个男人在讨论着什么，一件发生在2月的事。是月初至月中，而不是月尾。(停顿)
A fabric. He seems to be thinking of a fabric that is nubby. (Pause.) Three late arrivals. One of these someone he has been waiting for, or hoped would arrive. A male of middle age, with a mustache. (Pause at 10:09.)一种布料。他似乎想到了一种粗粗的布料。(停顿)3个晚到的人。其中一个是他等的人，或是他希望会到的人。中年男士，留着胡子。(10:09停顿)
He thinks, or speaks, of Dr. Erickson. Or he and the man who arrived late both have Dr. Erickson as a common acquaintance. Perhaps he introduced them.他想到或提到艾瑞森博士。或他和那个晚到的客人都认识艾瑞森博士。也许他向他们介绍他。
Two of the late arrivals are men, and one is a woman.3个晚到的客人有两个是男人，一个是女人。
The fabric is either a wall hanging, such as a curtain, or a woman’s dress. I pick up the number 13. Could this be the date in February for the event? Or perhaps there are 13 guests present.这布料或者是挂在墙上的，比如是窗帘，或者是一个女人的衣服。我收到数字13。这有可能是2月那个事件的日期吗？或也许有13个客人出席。
I also think of January 3 as a fairly important date for Dr. Instream. (Pause at 10:12.)我也想到，1月3日对殷斯翠姆博士来说是相当重要的日子。(10:12停顿)
Now, do you have a test for me, Joseph?现在，约瑟，你有测验要给我吗？
("Yes.”(“是的。”
(I handed over the double envelope, and as usual Jane took it with her eyes remaining closed. She held the envelope in both hands for a moment, then delivered the data with short pauses. This is our 20th envelope test.)(我拿出信封，就如往常一样，珍闭着眼睛接过它。她用两手握着信封一会儿，停了一下，说出日期。这是我们的第20次信封测试。)
Please give us a moment. These are impressions.请等我们一下。有这些印象。
A turn up, something turned up. A photograph. I think of white, snow white. A house. A connection with the past, and with your parents.翻起，某个东西翻起。一张照片。我想到白色，雪白。一间房子。与过去还有你的父母有关联。
Also a connection with another person beside yourself and Ruburt. Purple. Large letters. Something fairly important occurred the following day. A machine such as an automobile, perhaps.也和另一个在你和鲁柏身旁的人有关联。紫色。大的字母。某件相当重要的事发生在接下来的那一天。一个机器，也许是汽车。
The color yellow as in sunlight, and a gathering. Strongly connected—this item strongly connected with yourself. I see your initials.一种像阳光一样的黄色，和一场聚会。很强的连结——这东西和你有很强的连结。我看到你名字的缩写。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:17. Jane was dissociated as usual. She said she didn't particularly remember what she had said on the three tests, but could to some degree if she stopped to think.(10:17休息。珍出离如常。她说并不特别记得这3个测验她说了什么，但如果回想的话，可以想起一些。
(See the tracing of the test object, the napkin from the discotheque, on page 107.(见测验物件的素描，迪士可舞厅的餐巾纸。
(The design on the napkin covers one quarter of the surface area, and it was this quarter which was “turned up" to us when the waitress placed the folded napkins on the table before us. There was of course no photo involved, or a house or any connection with my parents, or the past.(餐巾上的图案占了四分之一的区块，而侍者在我们来之前就把餐巾纸放在桌上，这占了四分之一的设计图案是“翻起”在桌上。这里当然没有涉及照片，或一间房子，或是和我父母及过去有关联。
(Jane felt that “white, snow white, ” was valid data, even though she was thinking of a certain photo of my parents house, taken when there was deep snow. She saw this white as very bright. See my notes on page 109. When the ultraviolet lights were turned on in the discotheque, some colors were activated more than others. The light was actually quite dim, but the ultraviolet made anything white appear to be blinding white-paper, socks, white shirts, etc. The effect was very striking. The napkin was of white paper.(珍感觉“白，雪白”是有效的资料，因为她有想到某张有照到我父母房子的照片，是在积雪很深的时候照的。她看到这个白非常亮。见前面我的注记。当紫外线灯在迪士可舞厅打亮的时候，有某些颜色会比其他颜色更为鲜明。灯光实际上十分暗，但紫外线让所有白的东西像白纸，袜子、白衬衫等等都更加雪亮。效果很惊人。餐巾纸也是白色的纸。
(There were two female dancers at the discotheque, and Jane felt that “a connection with another person” referred to one of these, although she couldn't say why. We did not know either of them. One was brunette, one was blonde. Both of us liked the brunette the best, for whatever reason, and certainly she was the better dancer of the two.(在迪士可舞厅有两个女性舞者，珍感觉“和另一个人有关联”指的是两个舞者其中的一个，虽然她说不出为什么。这两个人我们都不认识。一个是深褐色头发，一个是金色。我们两个都更喜欢深褐色那一个，不知道是什么原因，但她的确是两个人当中跳得比较好的那个。
(Jane felt good about “Purple. Large letters.” See the tracing. The word discotheque on the napkin was printed in a blue that was strongly on the red side, although actually short of being an outright purple. The letters are of course large. “Something fairly important... the following day” did not ring a bell with us. “automobile" could refer to our driving to the discotheque, though there could be other meanings here, we think.(珍觉得“紫色，大的字母”很正确。见素描。在餐巾纸上迪士可舞厅这个字是用蓝色印上的，旁边有明显的红色，虽然事实上并不是完全的紫色。字母很大。“某件相当重要……接下来那一天”并没有让我们想到什么。“汽车”可能指的是我们开车去迪士可舞厅，虽然我们认为也可能是其他的意思。
(“yellow, as in sunlight, ” is as interesting to us as the snow-white data listed above. Jane wore a white blouse to the discotheque. When the ultraviolet lights were turned on however, we were surprised to see a large, bright yellow stain on the front of her now brilliantly-white blouse. This stain was invisible in ordinary light. In addition, we discovered more similar yellow stains on both of Jane’s palms. We never did discover the source of the stains.(“黄色，像阳光一样”就像上面雪白的资料一样让我们觉得很有趣。珍穿上一件白色的上衣去迪士可舞厅。不过当紫外线灯打亮的时候，我们很惊讶地看到一大片亮黄色的污渍出现在她雪白的上衣上。在平常的光线之下，污渍是看不到的。另外，我们在珍两手的手掌上也发现相似的污渍。我们没发现污渍的来源。
(“a gathering" can refer to the crowded discotheque, or bar. I wouldn’t say the napkin was an “item strongly connected" to me, although it was my napkin rather than Jane's that I used for the test. Nor were my initials on it.(“一场聚会”可能指的是拥挤的迪士可舞厅或酒吧。我不会说餐巾纸对我来说是“连结很强的物件”，虽然它比较算是我的，而不是珍的，因为我把它用在测验上。我的缩写字母也没有在上面。
(Jane said that as she began giving the data, the association she made with Seth's data, “white, snow white, ” led her to consider the particular photo of my parents' house taken after a deep snowfall. She said that at this stage of her development it is very difficult for her to tell when such personal associations enter in, unless Seth himself notes it by saying “Ruburt here thinks of a photograph, "etc. Jane said she saw the photo in her mind’s eye, but that as she continued to speak, she eventually received a hazy picture, a “nebulous impression, " of a bar. She did not mention the bar in the test data, and indeed had forgotten it until our discussion of the test brought it back to her mind.(珍说当她开始给资料的时候，她和赛斯的资料有连结的是，“白，雪白”，这让她想到一张特别的照片，是大雪后我父母的房子。她说以她现在发展的阶段，她很难去分辨这种个人连结是什么时候进来的，除非赛斯有注解“鲁柏现在想到一张照片”，等等。珍说她在她的心眼看到这张照片，但当她接着说话的时候，最后有收到一张朦胧的图片，一个“模糊的印象”，有关一个酒吧。她在测验资料里并没有提到这个酒吧，她根本忘记了，直到我们讨论到测验的时候她才想起来。
(Jane finished her comments by noting that there isn’t much she can do at the moment about being sidetracked by such personal associations, except to keep it in mind. She does believe that this knowledge has in itself prevented her from being led astray from Seth’s data a few times in the past, and that her ability in separating Seth's data from her own will grow.(珍最后的结语是这种个人联想的转译，在现阶段她能做的很有限，除了把它放在心上。她也相信这个知识本身曾在过去几次避免她从赛斯资料岔到别的地方，还有她分辨赛斯资料和自己资料的能力会成长。
(We now hoped Seth would comment on the test before ending the session. Jane resumed in a quiet voice, with her eyes closed, at 10:30.)(我们现在希望在结束这节课之前，赛斯可以对这个测验说一些评语。珍以一种轻柔的音量在10:30重新开始，她的眼睛闭着。)
Now, we will end our session.现在，我们要结束这一节了。
We picked up some valid impressions. The other person was your dancer, upon whom you both were strongly focused.我们收到一些有效的印象。这另一个人指的是你们的舞者，你们两个都强烈的注意到她。
The important event had to do with some kind of a family nature, and involved one of the two dancers, and their parents, or the parents of whichever girl was involved. I believe the event concerned the other dancer, the blonde.这件重要的事和某种家庭性质有关，涉及两个舞者中的其中一个，和她们的父母，或涉及其中不管是谁的父母。我想这件事和那个金发的舞者有关。
(There may be an outside chance that we can confirm this data. A friend of ours who lives in our apartment house knows the two dancers, who live together in the neighborhood. But we do not know them, and this was the first time Jane and I had been in the discotheque in over a year.)(也许有一些外围的管道可以让我们去检核这个讯息。一位住在我们公寓的朋友认识这两名舞者，她们一起住在这附近。但我们并不认识她们，这也是这一年多来我们第一次去这家迪士可舞厅。)
The snow white referred to the colors, or to the color, rather, of the napkin in the light. The snow I used merely because the white was so blinding, and this led Ruburt to his own associations, concerning your parents’ house, and a particular photograph which was taken in the wintertime. But we managed to continue on after this, to deliver some fairly decent impressions. He is still learning, and it is quite all right.雪白指的是颜色，或是这张餐巾纸在灯光下的颜色。我用雪白仅仅是因为这个白是如此刺眼，而这让鲁柏有了他自己的连结，有关于你父母的房子，和一张在冬季拍的，特别的照片。但我们在这之后仍试着传递一些相当正确的印象。他仍然在学习，所以这是没有关系的。
My fondest wishes to you both, and to our Dr. Instream. I would suggest, incidentally, that you both if possible find time to do the yoga exercises daily, as they provide excellent discipline, and tend to unify various portions of the self. Also, during Christmas week, when I am giving you a vacation, I would suggest that Ruburt rest from psychic affairs entirely.我对你们俩，还有我们的殷斯翠姆博士致上最深切的祝福。顺道一提，如果可能的话，我会建议你们两个找时间每天做瑜珈，它会提供极佳的纪律，而对统一自己的不同部分有益。还有在圣诞假期，当我让你们放假的时候，我会建议鲁柏从心灵的事务中完全的休息。
Now if you have any questions, you may take a brief break, and I will answer them, or you may end the session as you prefer.现在，如果你们还有任何问题，可以短暂的休息一下，然后我会回答，或是你们想结束这一节也可以。
(“What do you think of Jane's book on dreams?”)(“对于珍有关梦的那本书，你有什么想法？”)
Ruburt has a very good beginning, and the book should be very successful; later books on the subject will be more advanced, with experiments to back up theory, but this book will be a very good start. A slight change of title will be beneficial. If you have no more questions, then I shall bid you a fond good evening.鲁柏有一个很好的开始，这本书应该会很成功；过一阵子这类主题的书将会进步，会有很多实验来佐证理论，但这本书会是一个很好的开始。稍微改动一下标题会更有利。如果你们没有更多的问题，我要祝你们晚安了。
(“What title change do you recommend?”)(“你会建议标题怎么改？”)
He will think of it.他会去想。
(“I guess that's it, then. Good night, Seth.”(“我想也是，晚安，赛斯。”
(End a t 10:42. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed.)(10:42结束，珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着。)
(Tracing of the woodblock print used in the 21st envelope test, in the 215th session for December 8,1965. )用在1965年12月8日第215节第21次信封测验的木刻版画素描

SESSION 215 第215节 自我和智性 直觉和观念 信封21


DECEMBER 8, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年12月8日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(The 21st envelope test was held during the session. The test object sealed in the usual double envelopes was a woodblock print, made by an artist friend of ours, Roy C. Fox, and enclosed with Roy's Christmas card of last Christmas. It is a black and white print on very thin, almost transparent paper. Once again the test results were interesting, and somewhat different in nature. (We were not sure that Seth would have any data on Peggy Gallagher during the session, since we thought it possible she had left Washington, DC by now.(这节课会举行第21次信封测验，在信封里的测验物件是一张木刻版画，这是我们的艺术家朋友罗伊·法克斯[Roy C. Fox]制作的，它附在去年圣诞节他寄的圣诞卡片里。它是在非常薄、几乎透明的纸上制作的黑白印刷。再次的，测验结果十分有趣，而且在本质上有些不同。(我们并不确定赛斯在这节会不会有关于蓓·加拉格的资料，我们认为她现在可能已经离开华盛顿首府了。
(It will be remembered that on two past occasions Seth has taken credit for making a candle flame grow noticeably in height. See my notes prior to the 206th session, pages 57. 58. Both of these sessions were witnessed. Seth told us he was able to do such things when Ruburt’s attention was elsewhere, but that as soon as “he", or Ruburt, became conscious of the possibility of such effects they were usually unattainable.(记得过去有两次，赛斯把蜡烛的火焰弄得相当高，见第206节的笔记。两节课我们都亲眼目睹了。赛斯告诉我们，当鲁柏的注意力在别处的时候，他就可以做这样的事，但当“他”，或说鲁柏意识到这种效果的可能性后，通常就没法做到了。
(Before the session this evening I wondered what effects Seth might be able to demonstrate, on a consistent basis, if a candle were lit just before each session, as a matter of routine, and then ignored as much as possible. The idea being that if it became part of the regular session routine Jane would forget about it, thus allowing any possible effects to come through without worrying about them. At first I was joking about the idea, but when Jane said it was all right to go ahead with the idea, I took her up on it. When we were set up for the session, I placed a lighted candle on the shelf beside me, behind some books so that Jane could not see it. Since the room was well lighted the candle flame would make no noticeable difference, in the event it flared up while her eyes were open.(在今晚的课之前，我很好奇赛斯在一个持续的基础上想展现什么样的效果，如果蜡烛在每一节课前都会点上的话，那这就是一个课的常态，也能尽可能地被忽略。这个想法是，如果这成为课的一部分，珍就会忘了它，这就不会困扰她，而她也能允许任何效果的呈现。一开始我是开玩笑地说出这个想法，但当珍说可以试试看的时候，我就这么做了。当我为这节课准备的时候，在我旁边的书架上放了一个点燃了的蜡烛，旁边有一些书挡住，所以珍看不见。因为房间很亮，烛火并没有造成什么不同。火焰变旺的时候，她的眼睛睁开。
(The session was held in our small back room. No windows were open, and by measurement I determined that the candle flame burned at a remarkably consistent 7,-inch height. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her pace was rather slow, with many pauses, yet her voice was somewhat stronger than usual. She sat much of the time with a hand raised to her face. She was not smoking. She began speaking at 9:01.)(这节课在我们后面的小房间举行。窗户没有开，我测量出蜡烛的火焰明显持续燃烧了四分之三英寸高。珍开始说话时坐着，眼睛闭着，她的速度比较慢，有很多停顿，但音量比平常大一点。她坐着的时候大部分时间手举到脸上。她没有抽烟。她在9:01开始说话。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth. ")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. Let us continue our discussion. I did not say that action was not motion. I want this clear. Action is motion, but not necessarily motion that is perceived in physical terms.现在。让我们继续我们的讨论。我不会说那个行动不是一个动作。我希望这是清楚的。行动是动作，但动作并不必然以物质的方法被感知。
Your conception of time is dependent upon your perception of action, and that portion of action which you can perceive and appreciate. There is no doubt here that the intuitions can at times perceive action far more completely than can the intellect. And time, therefore, physical clock time, is much more alien to the intuitive self than it is to the intellectual self.你们对时间的概念是依赖着你们对行动的感知，而且是你们能感知和珍视的那部分行动。这里毫无疑问，直觉有时候比智性更能完全的感知到行动。因此时间，物质的钟表时间对直觉的自己比对智性的自己陌生多了。
Logic builds its monuments step by step, one thought before the other in a series where each thought or deduction is dependent upon the thought before. The intuitions are of a more spontaneous nature, and less dependent upon such step-by-step movements.逻辑(Logic)一步步地建立它的典范，一个想法接着一个想法，一连串的想法或推演是依赖前一个想法。直觉有一个更自发的本质，较不依赖如此一步接着一步的推演过程。
(It was now 9:09. I had been glancing occasionally at the candle flame as I wrote. It burned within a foot of my left hand. The flame had now increased perhaps a quarter of an inch in height, and burned steadily at that level; this meant an increase from 3/4 of an inch to one inch.(现在是9:09，有时候我写字时会瞥向蜡烛上的火焰。它在我左手边一英尺处燃烧着。火焰现在增加了大约四分之一英寸高，以这个高度稳定地燃烧；这代表烛火从四分之三英寸增加到一英寸(一英寸等于25.4毫米)。
(I was not sure of what I was observing. Jane gave no sign of any kind, and Seth had not even mentioned the candle; I had thought he might smile at the idea. The increase in the flames height had not been as sudden and dramatic as in the two previous instances noted on page 117. But the candle flame now burned at this new height just as steadily as it had before the increase, and continued to do so.)(我不确定我在观察什么，珍没有任何表示，而赛斯根本没有提到蜡烛；我想他可能会对这个想法微笑。火焰增加的高度并不像前两次的例子那么地突然和显著。但现在烛焰在这个新高度燃烧得和之前一样稳定和持续。)
The ego attempts to break down action into smaller and smaller units. The intuitions try to perceive action as a whole. The ego breaks down for purposes of examination, the intuitions construct. Both the ego and the intuitions, in performing their functions, obviously create action. The self may of course be considered as a gestalt of action, perceived in a different manner by various levels of itself.自我试图把行动分解为更小的单位。直觉试着感知行动的整体。自我是为了检验的目的而分解，而直觉是组成。自我和直觉都在执行它们的功能，很明显地创造了行动。自己当然可能以一种行动的完形来考虑，由它自己不同的层面以不同的方式来感知。
On one hand, basically, the self is limitless, both electromagnetically and because of the nature of action, which affects all other action. The self does not however proceed along straight lines, from a birth to a death. This is only the self that the ego perceives. Action cannot remain inactive or motionless, though the motion may not always be apparent.基本上，从一方面来说，自己是无限的，不管是电磁方面或因为行动的本质，都会影响所有其他的行动。不论如何，自己并不是以一种直线的、由出生到死亡的方式行进。这只是自我感知到的自己。行动不能保持不活动或静止——虽然行动并不总是显而易见。
Egos concept of itself as a rock of unchanging identity is highly ludicrous, since its perceptions constantly change it from what it was. It is not a thing proceeding, by any means. This is not to deny the human aspects of the ego, for the ego is also somewhat like a light carried in front of the inner self, a light that gives meaning to the physical universe and to its objects. It enables the inner self to manipulate within physical reality. It translates outer data to the inner personality.自我对它自己的概念是个如磐石一样不会改变的身分，而这是十分可笑的，因为它对它是什么的这个看法是持续不断在改变的。无论如何，它不是一个进行中的东西。这不是否认自我的人性面，自我也有点像是内我在前方提着的灯，一个赋予物质宇宙和在其中的物件意义的灯。它让内我可以在物质实相里操纵，把外在资料转译给内在的人格。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:21. Jane had been dissociated for a first break as usual. She maintained the heavier, emphatic voice, even with the pauses.(9:21休息。珍在第一阶段出离如常。她保持着深沉、有力的声音，即使是在停顿的时候。
(The candle flame had maintained its increased height very steadily until close to break time, when I thought it began to fluctuate a bit. At break I thought it was mainly at its original lower height. Jane could not see it, and did not ask about its behavior. We agreed not to mention it during sessions, no matter what took place. I had wondered if the increased height of the flame had resulted from the body of the candle “warming up, ” since it was a thick one, perhaps five inches tall. When the flame subsided however at break, I did not know what to think, and decided to merely record what I saw without being concerned.(蜡烛火焰非常稳定的保持着增加后的高度，直至休息时分我才觉得它有一点波动。我认为休息时火焰回到原始比较低的高度。珍看不到它，也没有问起它。我们同意在课堂上不管发生什么都不要提到它。我想知道火焰增加的高度是否源自于蜡烛本身的“燃烧效应”，因为蜡烛很厚实，大约5英寸高。不过休息时火焰渐渐减弱，我不知道该怎么想，然后决定不要太烦心，只把我看到的记录下来。
(Jane now sat with her eyes closed and spoke in a slow voice with many pauses, most of them short. Her eyes remained closed. Resume at 9:31.)(珍现在坐着，眼睛闭着，以一种缓慢的声音说话，很多次停顿，大部分都很短。她的眼睛仍闭着。在9:31重新开始。)
Now give us a moment, please.现在，请给我们一点时间。
A banquet by your cat lover, with long narrow tables. A disturbance of some sort, though not necessarily here. An endeavor to reach someone whom she was unable to contact, the initials perhaps W. B.爱猫人士参加一个宴会，里面有一张狭长的桌子。有某种骚动，虽然不一定是在这里。努力去联系某个她无法联络的人，缩写也许是W.B。
Again, a clock that did not work correctly.再次，一个不太准确的时钟。
(This bit of data was also given to Peggy on Friday, December 3, during the unscheduled session preceding her Washington trip. By now, also, I saw that the candle flame had climbed back up to its one-inch height; it continued to burn steadily at that height. Jane's voice had lost its heavier edge.)(这些资料也曾在12月3日星期五，蓓华盛顿之旅之前的那节临时课告诉过她。现在我又看到焰火爬升到之前一英寸的高度；它以这个高度持续稳定的燃烧着。珍的声音不再那么低沉。)
Something with a new format. Ten people in a separate party or gathering, in which she took part. Something having to do with March 10.某件新计划的事。有10个人参加她出席的聚会，某件事和3月10日有关。
A room with a yellow wastepaper basket. Flowers in the room, perhaps roses. But florists flowers.一间有着黄色废纸篓的房间。有花在这间房里，也许是玫瑰。是花店的花。
An event at eight, last evening, in a different room than the room in which a previous meeting was held, that she attended.昨晚8点，她出席了一个活动，不是之前举办会议的那个房间。
(The candle flame subsided to its beginning 1/4-inch height for a few minutes, then climbed back up again.)(蜡烛火焰减弱到一开始的四分之三英寸高，持续了几分钟，又再次升高到原来的高度。)
McNamara. A white taxicab. Identified by a round symbol on it, with a border inside the circle, and some sort of figures. Whether these are people, shapes or object shapes, I do not know. The symbol is of more than one color, however, and fairly dark against the white. I am seeing it in the evening, so the color of the symbol is not very clear. It is in front of a stone building.麦纳马拉(McNamara)。一辆白色的计程车。上面有个圆形的符号可供辨识，里面有个圆形的边和某种图案。不过我不知道图案是人形还是物件。这个图案不只一个颜色，不过比起白色是相当深的颜色。我是在晚上的时候看见它，所以图案的颜色不是很清楚。它停于一栋石造的建筑物之前。
An unusual attachment of aides goes with the group which she accompanies. There is some hesitation at a gate while this gathering waits. While clearance is made, but it is a short hesitation.在她参加的团体里，助手们跟得很紧。在闸口有一些延续，大家等了一会。等着批准核可，但只是耽搁了一下。
I pick up something to do with a ballpark, or a park that has been used, or a stadium that has been used for ball games.我收到和棒球场、曾去过的公园或曾举办球赛的运动场有关的某个东西。
Something to do with a pocketbook. Did she misplace it? It is a shoulder variety however. Perhaps it was a camera.和手提包有关。她找不到了？是肩背的那一种。也许它是一个照相机。
I suggest a brief break.我建议一个短暂的休息。
(Break at 9:45. Jane had been dissociated as usual, and her eyes had remained closed. The candle flame once more subsided to its original lower level. At either the 3/4, or the one-inch level, the flame burned very steadily, for there was no draft. Nor did it seek out intermediate levels.(9:45休息。珍出离如常，她的眼睛仍闭着。烛火曾一度减弱到原始较低的高度。不管是四分之三或者是一英寸，火焰燃烧得很稳定，因为没有风。它没有中间的高度。
(Seth dwelt on the taxicab symbol, and as he did so I found myself hoping that Peggy would notice it. We have wondered before about Seth making statements concerning something that might be in the presence of the subject for the test, only to have the subject fail to notice it. This happened in a test about a year ago, involving Bill Macdonnel on vacation in Cape Cod. Seth described a certain rowboat with initials and a symbol on its bow; but since Bill failed to notice rowboats in general, we were at a loss as to the accuracy of Seth’s information. Seth did insist that this particular boat had been in Bill’s close vicinity.(赛斯对计程车的符号描述得很详细，当他这么说的时候，我发现我很希望蓓能注意到它。我们之前很好奇，因为赛斯曾说到某个测验中可能存在的物件，只是这个物件并没有被注意到。这发生在一年前的一个测验里，是比尔·麦唐纳那次在鳕鱼角的假期。赛斯描述了某种划艇，在船头上的缩写和图案；但是因为比尔没有注意到划艇，我们就失去了检验赛斯讯息正确性的机会。赛斯坚持这种特别的小艇曾在距离比尔很近的地方。
(During this break Jane said she had the feeling the pocketbook data, given at the end of Peggy's test, might not refer to Peggy at all, but to “something or someone else.” As it developed in our envelope test tonight, this could be true. If so it is an example of the “bleeding" of test material from one test to another during the same session. Seth has told us this is a possibility. In this specific case also, clairvoyance enters in, since the envelope test had not been held yet. Telepathy and precognition could also be factors.(在休息的时候，珍说她有一种感觉，在蓓的测验尾声提到的手提包资料，可能指的不是蓓，而是“其他事或其他人”。按照我们今晚信封测验的发展，这可能是真的。如果是这样，那它是同一节课里从一个测验“渗漏”到另一个测验资料的一个例子。赛斯告诉我们这是可能的。在这个特别的例子里，预知力涉入了，虽然信封测验还没有举行。心电感应和预知能力可能是原因。
(Jane said she didn't see anything within while giving the Gallagher data.(珍说当她在给加拉格资料的时候，没有看到任何东西。
(It was now time for the 24th Dr. Instream test. As before, Jane sat quietly with her eyes closed, her right hand raised to her face. The candle flame remained at its original 3/4-inch level. Resume at 10:01.)(现在是第24次殷斯翠姆博士测试。一如以往，珍静静地坐着，眼睛闭着，她的右手举到脸上。烛火停在最初四分之三英寸的高度。10:01分重新开始。)
Now. Give us a moment for our Dr. Instream material.现在。为了我们殷斯翠姆博士的资料，请等一下。
He is in his room (pause), a photograph of his wife on a dresser. Some books or papers on the bed. (Pause.) Is he dressing to go out at this hour? Or do I have him earlier? (Long pause at 10:04.)他正在他的房间(停顿)，梳妆台前有一张他太太的照片。一些书或文件在床上。(停顿)他在这个时间要换装出去吗？或我看到的是他之前的情形？(长时间停顿10:04。)
A strained relationship between himself and another, a man. (Pause.)在他和另一个男人之间有紧张的关系。(停顿)
Hypnosis experiments temporarily at a standstill. He is focusing on us, however (pause), trying to send us a message about a round object and a piece of paper, that is written on about a third of the way down, with neat indentation, perhaps five lines or so.催眠实验暂时在一个停滞的状态，不过，他注意着我们(停顿)，试着传送给我们一个讯息是有关一个圆形的物件和一张纸，写了三分之一，很整齐的编排，大概有5行左右。
Very even, as if lines from a poem. The indentations are so neat. (Pause) But the lines themselves are fairly long.非常平均，字句好像来自一首诗。编排非常整齐。(停顿)不过字句本身相当长。
I believe, though I am not certain, that this is handwritten rather than typewritten. The letters are small. There may be a book, a fairly large one, beneath the paper, with something like dull gold-edged pages, or so it would appear when the book is closed. And brownish covers to the book.我想，虽然我并不确定，这应该是手写而不是打字的。字母很小。可能有一本书，相当大本，在文件下面，书合起来的时候会看见书页边似乎是暗金色的。书的封面是棕色的。
I do not believe it is a new book. I have the impression of worn leather, though I do not actually believe the binding is of leather, but of something allied in appearance. (Pause.)我不认为这是一本新书。我有个印象是旧的皮质，虽然我不真的认为封皮是皮质的，但外观看起来是某种类似的东西。(停顿)
Two candlesticks. I have the impression also that he is discouraged, but affairs will work out well for him.两个烛台。我有印象他有点沮丧，不过事情会越来越好。
I pick up quite strongly a discouragement on his part this evening. But again, his affairs will work out. The discouragement seems to be connected with his work, and a lack of confidence that is temporary. By Sunday he will feel much better, partially as a result of intervening circumstances, and partly because his mood will simply have changed. (Pause at 10:16.)我今晚接收到他十分强烈的沮丧。但再次的，他的事情会越来越好。沮丧似乎和他的工作有关，他暂时失去了信心。但到星期天他会觉得好多了，部分是因为中间发生的事情结果，部分是因为他的心情单纯的改变了。(10:16停顿)
Now, do you have a test for me?现在，你还有测验要给我吗？
(“Yes.”(“有的。”
(Jane reached out to take the usual double envelope from me. She did not open her eyes. She sat quietly holding the envelope in one hand, with the other raised to her face. Her pauses were brief. This is our 21st envelope test.)(珍伸手向前从我这拿走了普通信封。她没有睁开眼睛。她静静地坐着，一只手拿着信封，另一只手放在脸上。她停顿的时间很短。这是我们第21次信封测试。)
Again, please give us a moment.再次的，请等一下。
I wanted to add something about shipyards to the Gallagher material.我想在加拉格的资料里面加上和船坞有关的某个东西。
(In the apartment below ours a baby began to cry. The sound was subdued, yet plain enough in our very quiet room. I was afraid Jane might be distracted, but she gave no outward sign. She continued after a pause. The baby soon stopped crying.)(我们楼下的婴儿开始哭。声音不大，但是在我们非常安静的房间就显得很清楚。我害怕珍会被打扰，但是她没有显露出来。她停顿了一下就继续。婴儿很快就停止哭泣了。)
Our own test, then. These are impressions.接下来是我们自己的测验。以下是印象。
Two people at a table with straight chairs.两个人坐在餐桌旁边的直背椅子上。
An item recently purchased. A connection with a February event. A circular object of sun or moon shape. A color green. 1965. A connection with two other people, I believe male and female.一个最近购买的物品。和2月的事情有关。一个圆形的物件，有着太阳或月亮的圆形。绿色的。1965。和其他两个人有关联。我想一个是男人一个是女人。
A lack of discretion. A border. The number 3.缺乏判断力，一个边。数字3。
Something like ropes, or something tied. A connection with a parent. The color blue. Ruburt thinks of the package that his mother sent him, containing a sweater, and the stamp on the package.某个像绳子的东西，或某个捆绑的东西。和父母有关。蓝色的。鲁柏想到他母亲寄给他的包裹，里面有一件毛衣，邮戳在包裹上。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:23. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her pace had been interrupted by many short pauses. The candle flame had remained subdued.(10:23休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着。她的速度因为很多短暂的停顿而被打断了。烛焰停留在减弱后的高度。
(At first the envelope test data left us at a loss, until memory began to work. To sum up first, we saw that Seth had used the name of the artist who had executed the block print, Roy Fox, as a starting point for data involving Jane and Roy and me, but for some reason had not dealt with the test object itself. We do not know why this happened, since Seth did not discuss the results this evening. Jane’s mother and a Christmas present also entered the test data, for reasons we do understand; here Seth tells us that Ruburt thinks of the package that his mother sent him.(起初测验资料让我们很困惑，直到后来我们才想起来。首先来总结，我们看到赛斯用了制作木刻版画的艺术家，罗伊·法克斯(Roy Fox)的名字，作为了珍、罗伊和我的资料的开始，但因为某些原因没有提到测验物件本身。我们不知道这为什么会发生，因为赛斯今晚并没有讨论结果。珍的母亲和圣诞礼物也出现在测验资料中，可能有着我们不了解的原因；这里赛斯告诉我们，鲁柏想到他母亲寄给他的包裹。
(Roy Fox is a personal friend of ours. Last Christmas he arranged for me to have a show of paintings at Harris Hill Inn, just outside Elmira, in February 1965. The show lasted for a month. It opened on February 2,1965, and on the following Sunday, February 7, Jane and I were guests at the Inn, to discuss the show with anyone interested.(罗伊·法克斯是我们的一个朋友。去年圣诞节他安排我在1965年2月，埃尔迈拉附近的汉瑞斯高地饭店[Harris Hill Inn]办一个画展。这个展持续了一个月。它在1965年2月2日开幕，然后在接下来的星期天，2月7日，珍和我是这间饭店的客人，我们会和任何感兴趣的人讨论这个展现。
(This brings us to the first item in the test data, “Two people at a table with straight chairs.” On February 7 Jane and I spent several hours at the Inn, seated on straight backed chairs at a dining table, ready to answer questions from all and sundry.(这让我们想到测验资料的第一项“两个人坐在餐桌旁的直背椅子上”。在2月7日珍和我在饭店花了几个小时，坐在餐桌旁的直背椅子上，准备回答所有人的问题。
(We see no connection at the moment with “An item recently purchased.”(我们当时没有想到任何和“一个最近购买的物品”有关的连结。
(“A connection with a February event, " is the show at Harris Hill Inn, arranged by Roy Fox. “A circular object of sun or moon shape” does not mean anything in particular to us, although on the walls at the Inn were various circular objects, such as clocks, a barometer, etc. The same applies to “A color green.” Many of my paintings, being landscapes, are predominantly green. The show was held in “1965.”(“和2月的事情有关”是指在汉瑞斯高地饭店罗伊·法克斯安排的展。“一个圆形的物件，有着太阳或月亮的圆形”并没有特别对我们有什么意义，虽然在饭店墙上有好几种圆形的物件比如时钟、一个气压计等等。同样的这也适用于“绿色的”，很多我的画、有关风景的主要颜色都是绿色。这个展在“1965年”举行。
(“A connection with two other people... male and female, ” refers to the fact that Jane and I were scheduled to meet a young married couple, friends of ours, later in the afternoon at the Inn. They did appear: Judy and Lee Wright, who witnessed the unscheduled 129th session, incidentally, that was held that same evening, February 7,1965. See Volume 3.(“和其他两个人有关联……男人和女人”指的是珍和我那天傍晚安排和一对年轻夫妻在饭店会面，他们是我们的朋友。他们的确出现了：茱迪和李·赖特，顺道一提他们也参与了第129节的临时课，这节课是在同一天晚上，1965年2月7日举行的。见第三册。
(“A lack of discretion” is of particular interest to Jane and me, since this is a most apt description of a situation Roy Fox was involved in during that February, 1965, and for several months before and after that month. The situation was common knowledge, so no confidences are violated to say that at the time Roy was keeping company with a woman who was separated from her husband, but not divorced. She had several children. Roy is a man in his sixties, had never married, and since he seemed so completely happy in this situation we had assumed marriage would follow. The womans husband returned to Elmira last summer, however.(“缺乏判断力”对珍和我来说特别有趣，因为这是对罗伊∙法克斯在1965年2月涉及的处境最适合的描述了，而这情况在这个月前后又持续了好几个月，这个情形大家都知道，所以说出来也不算泄漏隐私。当时罗伊和一个与先生分居但还未离婚的女人在一起。她有几个孩子，罗伊是一个60多岁的男人，从未结过婚，他当时似乎很开心，所以我们都认为他们接下来会结婚。不过这个女人的先生在去年夏天回到了埃尔迈拉。
(“A border. The number 3, ” refers we believe to the notice for the show, printed in the local paper on February 6,1965. It was a two-column notice with a heavy black border, and stated that I would be at the show on February 7,1965, from 1 to 3 PM.(“一个边。数字3”我们相信这指的是画展的通知，印在1965年2月6日的地方报纸上。它是两行的通知，四周有着很深的黑边，宣告着我在1965年2月7日下午一点到三点有一个展。
(The rest of the test data applies to the Christmas package Jane’s mother sent her early this week. The package was wrapped with twine, contained a blue knitted sweater, etc. Why this information cropped up in a test we do not know. We can see the connection with the Roy Fox data however, since Roy made the block print; his name is also on the test object. We would like to know why Seth chose to use Roys name as a springboard, however, instead of sticking to the test object.(其他资料说的是，珍的母亲在这个礼拜一开始时寄给她的圣诞包裹。包裹是用麻绳绑的，里面有一件蓝色的毛衣等等。我们并不知道为什么这个讯息会出现在测验里。不过我们看到和罗伊·法克斯的关联，因为罗伊做了这个木制版画；他的名字也在测验物件上。不过我们想知道为什么赛斯选了用罗伊的名字当作出发点，而不是停留在测验物件上。
(See the notes on page 120, dealing with the data in Peggy Gallagher 's test, concerning a misplaced pocketbook of the shoulder variety. As stated, Jane at the time of the Gallagher test said she believed this information did not refer to Peggy. After the envelope test material was in on tonight's test, she then realized an incident involving a lost shoulder-variety pocketbook of her own.(见上面的笔记，蓓·加拉格测验的资料，有关不见了的、肩背大小的手提包。之前说过，珍在加拉格测验时曾说，她认为这个讯息指的并不是蓓。在今晚测验提到信封测验的资料后，她才明白这个事件指的是她自己丢了肩背包的手提包。
(Harris Hill Inn was closed on Monday, February 1,1965, and Jane and I met the proprietor there Monday evening and hung the paintings. When we left Jane left her favorite pocketbook behind; she did not realize this until sometime later. The next day the proprietor of the Inn brought Janes pocketbook to her. If this information was misplaced in the earlier Gallagher material, then what accounts for it? It appeared in the Gallagher material before the envelope test was held, and of course Jane could not know what the envelope test object was beforehand, by ordinary means. Seth has stated that such terms as telepathy, clairvoyance, precognition, etc., are of but relative usefulness; perhaps this instance is but an example of the ability of part of the mind to dissolve the time barrier.(汉瑞斯高地饭店在1965年2月1日星期一那天休息。珍和我在星期一晚上挂画的时候遇到了业主，当我们离开的时候，珍掉了她最喜欢的手提包；她直到后来才发现。第二天，饭店的业主带来珍的手提包还给她。如果这个讯息误放在之前的加拉格资料里，那么是什么引起了这个现象？在信封测验举行之前，它出现在加拉格的资料里，当然珍事先并不知道信封测验的物件是什么。赛斯曾用这样的字眼像是心电感应、千里眼、预知能力等等，这些都是相对有用的；也许这个例子是代表部分心理能力可以消融时间藩篱的例子。
(It is actually Friday, December 11 as I type this. We have now obtained a written detailed report on Peggy Gallagher's trip to Washington, as compared to Seth’s material on Peggy in the last two sessions. Seth scored many hits—Jane's best effort in these tests by far. The material will be incorporated in a very early session, along with the material on the Gallagher's Puerto Rico vacation of last October. I am leading up to the statement that Peggy detected a very clear example of bleeding through of data in the 214th session. She states that the material at the beginning of the Dr. Instream test data, on page 113, applies to a cocktail party she attended in Washington on Monday, December 6. Peggy states Seth’s description here of the cocktail party is quite correct, even to the fact that a woman was the main hostess, and that a man, her husband, was present with her. The smallish crowded room data applies also here. More details will be given later. See Session 214.(我打这篇文字是在12月11日星期五。我们手里有一份有关蓓∙加拉格华盛顿之旅的详细手写报告，可以和前两节赛斯说的、关于蓓的资料相对照。赛斯命中了很多项——是目前这些测验中珍做得最好的。这些资料会被并入比较早期的课，和10月加拉格夫妇的波多黎各假期资料放在一起。蓓发现在第214节的资料里，有一个非常清楚、有关于渗漏的例子。她指出殷斯翠姆博士测验一开始的资料，也适用于她在12月6日星期一在华盛顿参加的鸡尾酒会。蓓说赛斯在这里对鸡尾酒会的叙述是十分正确的，有一个女主人，还有一个男人在她身边，是她的先生。那个很小很挤的房间资料也适用于这里。等会儿会有更多细节。见第214节。
(And as Seth has mentioned before, such a bleeding through of data from one test to another is a possibility. Nor does the above example mean that Dr. Instream did not attend a cocktail party.(赛斯之前提过，这种资料从一个测验渗漏到另一个测验是可能的。上面的例子并不代表殷斯翠姆博士没有参加鸡尾酒会。
(Jane would like me to add here that she believes the envelope test data of this evening developed the way it did because of the emotional content of events involving Jane, Roy and myself. Whereas Roy's block print, while appealing to us both, was comparatively lacking in such emotional content, intrinsically.(珍希望我在这里加注，她相信今晚的信封测验资料会这样发展，是因为这个事件的情感内容涉及了珍、罗伊和我。而相较之下罗伊的木制版画对我们两人缺乏了这种情感内容。
(Jane now resumed at an average pace, with her eyes again closed, at 10:33.)(珍在10:33分以适中的速度重新开始，她的眼睛闭着。)
I am not going to discuss our test this evening.我今晚不会讨论我们的测试。
However, we will shortly hold a session where we discuss our tests in general, as this will be of benefit to you. It will help you to interpret our data. Also, I have not forgotten your dreams, and next week we shall have time for them.不过我们很快会举行一节课来讨论我们的测验，这对你们是有益的。我会帮助你们解读我们的资料。我也没忘记你们的梦，下周我们会找时间讨论它们。
Unless you have some questions we will end our session.除非你们还有问题，否则我要结束这节课了。
(“Do you want to say something about the candle-flame test? "(“你想说关于蜡烛火焰的测验吗？”
(The candle flame had been burning quite steadily at its original 3/4-inch level since break at 9:45. Jane now smiled.)(自从9:45分的休息后，烛火就十分稳定的在原始的四分之三英寸处燃烧着。珍现在微笑。)
What do you want me to say?你们想让我说什么？
(“Do you think this kind of test is a good idea?’)(“你认为这种测试是好主意吗？”)
There is nothing wrong with the idea. We shall see what we can do. We have been trying to see what we can do.这个主意没什么错。我们应该看看我们能做什么。我们一直试着看看我们能做什么。
(“Yes. I wondered. "(“是的。我想知道。”
(Jane now sat quite still. Her eyes remained closed, The candle was to her right, approximately at right angles to her body as she sat facing forward. Remember she could not see the candle in any event, since it was hidden behind books, and that the room was well lighted. As the moments passed and Jane did not move or speak, I had plenty of time to observe that her eyes did not open. The candle was some three feet away from her, and well away from any draft possibly created by her breath, for instance.(珍现在坐得很直。她的眼睛仍闭着，蜡烛在她的右侧，当她坐着，脸朝前方的时候，大约是在她身体右边的角落。记住不管怎样，她是看不到蜡烛的，因为它在书的后面，而房间是明亮的。随着时间过去，珍没有动也没有说话，我有很多时间观察，她的眼睛并没有睁开，蜡烛大约在离她三英尺处，所以她呼吸对烛火影响不大。
(As soon as I realized that Jane or Seth might be attempting something, I sat very quietly myself so as not to stir the air, and breathed shallowly through my nose with my head somewhat averted. I did not even move my hand to write until close to a minute had passed. The air in the room was very still. Yet soon after this strange interlude began, the candle flame grew quite definitely back to its one-inch height, and remained there steadily.(当我了解到珍或赛斯可能正试着要做什么的时候，我就很安静的坐着，避免搅动了空气，我的头转开，用鼻子很浅的呼吸。甚至有接近一分钟我没有动一下我的手去写字。房间的空气是停滞的，当这个奇怪的插曲开始的时候，蜡烛火焰很明显的升回了一英寸高，而且在那里稳定地保持着。
(Seth broke the silence well after a full minute had passed, according to the sweep hand on our electric clock.)(根据我们的电子钟，在将近一分钟过后，赛斯打破了宁静。)
My best wishes to you, and a fond good evening.我对你们最大的祝福，祝你们有一个愉快的夜晚。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:36. Jane was dissociated as usual The candle flame remained high, but was not as steady as it had been. Jane said that while she sat silently she felt as though Seth was somehow focusing “sideways ” on the candle.(10:36结束。珍出离如常，烛火仍然很高，但不像之前这么稳定了。珍说当她静静坐着的时候，她有一种想法，赛斯以某种方式“侧面”专注于蜡烛。
(Jane told me she felt a definite thrust of what she presumed to be energy toward the candle. It was a feeling she had not experienced before. She also had the thought as she sat quietly that Seth wanted to say something about the candle. Jane felt she might distort the information, however, because she realized that whatever she wanted to say was not automatic as it usually is; therefore she said nothing.(珍告诉我，她感觉一股明显的推力，她推测是朝向蜡烛的能量。那是她从没有经验过的感觉。她也有一种想法，当她安静地坐着的时候，赛斯想要对蜡烛的事说些什么。珍觉得她有可能曲解了讯息，因为她了解到，不管她想说什么都不是像平常一样自动地说出来；因此她什么也没说。
(Jane was relaxing on the bed, as she often does after a session, with her head propped up on one hand. She was smoking as we discussed the candle experiment. Both of us stared at the flame. It was now a little higher, and bright and steady, reaching the highest level of the evening. We stared at it for perhaps a minute. Seth then came through again, briefly; Jane was still smoking, and her eyes were closed. Resume at 10:45.)(珍放松地躺在床上，就像平常课结束的时候一样，她的手撑着头。当我们讨论到蜡烛实验的时候，她正抽着烟。我们两个都盯着蜡烛看。现在烛火有比较高一点，很明亮很稳定，达到今晚最高的高度。我们大约盯了有一分钟。赛斯再一次透过来，短暂的；珍仍在抽烟，她的眼睛闭着。在10:45分重新开始。)
Now. Do not emphasize the candle. Simply have it present during sessions, and lit. But do not draw Ruburts attention to it. Certainly not in the beginning, for we want him to consciously forget that the candle is here.现在。不要过分强调蜡烛。简单的在课堂中点亮它，让它在那儿。不要把鲁柏的注意力拉到它身上。尤其在一开始的时候，我们希望他有意识的忘掉蜡烛在这里。
(“Yes.”)(“好的。”)
That is all.这就是我要说的。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:46.)(10:46结束。)

SESSION 216 第216节 罗的梦解析


DECEMBER 9, 1965 8:30 PM THURSDAY UNSCHEDULED1965年12月9日 星期四 晚上8:30 临时课
(It will be remembered that in recent sessions Seth has promised to discuss two dreams which have been on my mind recently. Both of these involved my younger brother Bill, who lives in Rochester, NY with his wife and 3 children.(记得在最近的课里，赛斯答应要讨论最近在我心里的那两个梦。这两个梦牵涉了我的弟弟比尔和她的妻子，还有3个孩子住在纽约的罗彻斯特。
(Actually, I have had a series of five dreams since October 27,1965, which I believe to be closely related. All of them involved myself in situations of rather drastic physical stress or outright peril. Since the outcome of the dreams left me whole, however, it seemed their symbolic meaning concerned conflicts other than the physical, and I was interested in pinning these down.(事实上，我从1965年10月27日开始就做了5个一连串的梦，我相信它们是紧密相关的。所有的梦都是我处在一种相当强烈的身体压力或是十分危险的情况中。因为梦的结果我最终都没事，似乎它们关于矛盾的象征意义高过实质意义，而我对去找到原因很感兴趣。
(The last in the series took place last night, and since it dealt with extreme situations concerning my own death, Jane and I thought it wise to inquire into it. I had thought of next Monday's session as being soon enough at first, but by now the dreams were on my mind enough so that we thought of an unscheduled session. Also, other material in the regular sessions seemed to push the dream material aside.(最后一个梦发生在昨晚，因为它涉及了一种极端的情况就是我的死亡，珍和我认为探询它才是明智的。我本来想最快是在下星期一的课里询问，但因为这些梦放在我心里很沉重，所以我们想要举行一节临时课。况且定期课里的资料似乎会把梦的资料排挤到一旁。
(The five dreams occurred on the evenings of October 27, November 19, December 1, December 3, and December 8. Since Seth deals only with dreams of November 19, December 1, and December 8, only these will be presented here from my dream notebook. Seth calls them dreams number 1, 2, and 3. The two dreams not given here are closely similar to the three presented below.(这5个梦发生在10月27日、11月19日、12月1日、12月3日和12月8日晚上。因为赛斯只讨论了11月19日、12月1日和12月8日的梦，所以我就只将这些记录在我的梦笔记本上。赛斯称它们为1号、2号和3号梦。两个没有记录在这里的梦和以下的3个梦是十分相似的。
(Dream # 1; November 19,1965: This was extremely sharp and vivid in detail, and in full color. My younger brother Bill and I were in a very deep mountain valley, with steep rocky brown walls. We were trapped in this valley and knew we might not get out. It was not too large. We were actually in a rickety old house on the valleys slope, perhaps halfway up. There was a sharp drop-off below us. Part of the time I was looking out of a window, and part of the time I stood on the roof or a porch with Bill, our backs pressed up against the side of the house. The shingled roof slanted down and was covered with a fine snow. We were afraid to move because it was very slippery.(1号梦：1965年11月19日: 这个梦的细节非常清晰，逼真而且颜色鲜明。我的弟弟比尔和我在一个很深的山谷里，四周是棕色陡峭的石壁。我们被困在这个山谷里，知道可能没有办法出去了。这个地方并不是很大。事实上我们是在谷里坡地上的一间不太稳固的老房子里，大概半山腰的地方。我们下面有一个陡坡。有时候我从窗口往外看，有时候我和比尔站在屋顶或门廊上，我们的背紧靠着墙。木板的屋顶是斜的，上面覆盖着雪。因为非常滑，我们很害怕移动。
(Then I was looking at Bill, off to my left. He was too close to the edge of the porch roof. I hollered at him to be careful. Even as I did he slipped, landed on his backside, then tumbled over the edge as he scrambled for his balance. I heard him hit the ground with such force that I was very afraid he had broken a limb. I then looked over the edge of the roof, and to my great agitation I saw that Dick had not only fallen off the roof and hit the ground hard, but that now he had slipped over the edge of a steep cliff beside the porch, and was saving himself only by grasping a skinny little shrub that was in the process of loosening in the frozen ground. At the same time, Bill looked up at me and I thought he was smiling; or at least he didn’t appear to be worried.(然后，我看着在我左边的比尔，他太靠近屋顶的边缘。我叫他小心点。即使我这么做了，他还是滑了下去，背朝下，试着维持他的平衡但还是跌倒了。我听见他撞到了地上，这样的冲力我恐怕他已经断了一条腿。然后我从屋顶往下看，焦虑地看到迪克不只掉下屋顶，很重的撞到地面，现在他还滑下了门廊边的陡峭悬崖，只抓住了一棵小灌木，而这个灌木正被拔离结冰的地面。同时，比尔往上看着我而我想他在笑；或至少他看起来并不担心。
(I then realized that I could go over the edge of the roof at the corner, where there was a drainpipe to use as a handhold, then reach down and save him by lifting him back up with one hand. I also realized that I could move more easily on this slippery roof than I had thought possible.(我后来明白我可以走到屋顶的角落边，那里有一根排水管可以抓住，然后我往下伸手把他拉上来。我也发现，我可以比我以为的更轻易地在很滑的屋顶上移动。
(Dream # 2; December 1,1965: In color, and sharp and vivid and very detailed. My younger brother Bill and I were in swimming. The water was a beautiful light blue-green, almost like bathwater, and was extremely pleasant and comfortable. We were in a stream above a high and rapid waterfall, with the surface of the water about us broken by rocks. I got the idea of going over the waterfall while holding my breath, yet hesitated.(2号梦：1965年12月1日: 彩色的，清晰、逼真而且细节清楚。我的弟弟比尔和我正在游泳。水是美丽的浅蓝绿色，几乎像洗澡水，十分舒适宜人。我们在一条溪，下面是又高又急的瀑布，围绕着我们的水面被石块分割开。我有一个想法，想闭气穿过这个瀑布，但是迟疑了。
