(Then Bill went ahead, his body curled up into a ball, much like a fetal position. I saw him coast over the edge of the fall. I followed, holding my breath, and felt no shock or fear especially. It was very pleasant. I went deep down into the water at the base of the falls. I let myself float along, knowing that if I held my breath I would rise to the surface. At the same time I somehow knew there was a large underground rock ahead in the stream. It was like a pillar or barrier, dark and rough, reaching up high toward the surface. Still under water, I opened my eyes in plenty of time to see it ahead, and avoided hurting myself against its rough surface.(然后比尔走在前面，他的身体卷曲成一个球状，很像胎儿的姿势。他行动到瀑布的边缘。我跟着，屏住呼吸，并不感觉特别惊讶或害怕。它非常的吸引人。我往下朝瀑布底下走去。我让我自己漂浮着，知道如果我屏住呼吸，就能浮到水面上。同时我不怎地知道溪水底下有很大的石头。它像是柱子或是分界线，颜色很深，表面很粗糙，几乎高到水面。在水底时，我大部分时间都睁开眼睛往前看，避免碰到石头粗糙的表面而伤到自己。
(I later thought of the pillar like rock as a phallic symbol; and of the warm water and the fetus like position of my brother as reincarnational information.(我后来想到柱状的石头就像阴茎的象征；在温暖的水中，还有我弟弟胎儿般的姿势就像转世的讯息。
(Dream # 3; December 8,1965: Again in color. A long involved dream; believe part of the beginning of it escaped me as I woke up. The dream had to do with the fact that for some reason I was to be executed, by painless injection. I do not know why. At least part of the time I was in a brick-walled room partially underground. I think my father was to give me the needle.(3号梦：1965年12月8日: 再次是彩色的梦。一个很长的梦；我想当我醒来的时候，梦一开始的部分我已经忘了。梦里我不知什么原因要被处决，是以无痛注射的方式。我不知道原因。至少有部分时间我在一个砖墙的房间里，这个房间有部分在地底下。我想是我父亲要给我注射。
(To the best of my recall I was not very afraid at any time, yet was sad and concerned. There was an examination table in this room, and I was to lay there while I received the injection. Part of the time I looked out of a window made up of many small panes of glass, and saw Jane on a swing outside the window. She was fully grown, dressed as though in the summertime; someone else was on the swing with her, but I do not know who. She didn't appear to be worried about my predicament.(我印象最清楚的是，那时我并不害怕，只是伤心和忧虑。这个房间里面有一个手术台，当我接受注射的时候是躺在上面。有一些时间我从很多块小片玻璃组成的窗口往外看，看到珍在窗外的秋千上。她成年了，穿着像是夏天的衣服；有个人在她旁边也在荡秋千，但我不知道是谁。她看起来并不担心我的处境。
(I believe that my own feeling was one of sadness that I wouldn't be with her, more than anything else in the dream. Part of the time I was also outside of this brick room. I also believe that I had received the injection, and that it was supposed to take effect hours ago, but hadn't done so. So here I was hours later, wandering around. I thought of Jane but did not see her, and still felt this sadness and concern much more than any fear. I believe the dream ended on this note. At no time in the dream did I actually see my father; I merely knew he was there, and involved.(我想，不能再和她在一起是我在梦里最大的悲伤。有一些时间我是在这间砖墙房间之外，我相信我被注射过了，几个小时前就应该出现效果，但却没有。所以几小时后我仍在这里游荡着。我想到珍，但并没有看到她，我仍然觉得这种悲伤和担忧胜过任何害怕。我想梦就在这里结束了。在梦里我并没有真的看到我父亲；我只是知道他在那里，和事情有关联。
(The two dreams not given but very similar to the three here quoted involved myself and cancer and my survival, and my being separated from Jane again, and strongly aware of sadness and concern.(另外两个没有记录的梦和写在这里的3个梦很像，都涉及了我自己，癌症和我的存活，和珍再一次的分开，还有强烈的觉察到悲伤和担忧。
(Jane and I think the following material an excellent example of the way Seth interprets dreams, and it is presented in full. Seth doesn't get all the way through his analysis, but promises to in an early session. However, he told us enough tonight to make me feel much better.(珍和我认为以下的资料是赛斯诠释梦的一个最佳范例，而且它是完整的呈现。赛斯没有讲完他的分析，但他答应会在最近的一节课里这么做。无论如何，他今晚告诉我们够多，也让我觉得好多了。
(When Jane expressed a willingness to hold the session, she sipped a glass of wine while we waited for Seth to appear. I sat beside her on our living room couch, notebook in my lap. We listened to music. Nevertheless the start of the session caught me by surprise. Jane took off her glasses, closed her eyes and began to speak in a quiet voice.)(当珍表达了她想要举行这节课的时候，在等待赛斯出现的时间，她喝了一杯酒。我们坐在客厅的沙发上，我坐在她旁边，笔记本在我大腿上。我们听着音乐。尽管如此，课一开始的时候我还是吓了一跳。珍放下她的杯子，闭上眼睛，以一种轻柔的声音开始说话。)
Now, there is no need for a musical accompaniment to this session.现在，这节课不需要音乐相伴。
(“Just a minute then. "(“等我一分钟。”
(I turned off the television set. Jane's eyes were closed, but were to shortly open briefly; they remained closed for most of the session. Her pace was fairly fast, although she waited until I sat down again before resuming.)(我关掉电视机。珍的眼睛仍闭着，但很快的短暂睁开一下；大部分上课时间她眼睛都是闭着的。她的速度相当快，虽然她等我再次坐下来时才重新开始。)
The dreams are realities on several levels.这些梦在几个层面是实相。
Primarily they refer to your own subconscious feelings toward your father. Not only in regard to yourself, but in regard to your younger brother, and to Ruburt. Now this is on one level, and for a few moments we shall speak about the dreams on this level only.它们主要指出你对你父亲潜意识的感觉。不只关于你自己，还有关于你弟弟和鲁柏。现在这是在一个层面上，而接下来的一些时间，我们只在这个层面讨论这些梦。
(Her eyes now closed again, Jane wagged a forefinger at me.)(珍的眼睛再次闭上，朝我摇摇食指。)
You lose advantage, Joseph, from your recorder. You lose the advantage of your recorder. In sessions such as these it would be most handy for you.约瑟，因为录音机，你失去了你的优势。因为你没有录音机所以失去了优势。像这样的课，它对你应该是最方便的。
Ruburt could transcribe the notes, and I could speak to you more clearly.鲁柏可以抄录这些笔记，而我也可以对你们讲得更清楚一点。
On this level therefore, the three most important of these dreams are related: the two regarding your brother, and the dream that had to do with execution by needle, a painless one, to be carried out by your father.所在这个层面，这些梦里有3个最重要的部分是相关的：二号梦关于你弟弟，而那个和注射处决有关的梦，一种无痛的处决，是由你父亲执行。
In the first dream you see your younger brother slipping on an icy roof and falling. You go to his aid; discovering that you can manipulate better than you thought, you jump off the roof only to discover that your brother had also fallen over the edge of the cliff and was hanging on until you could get to him.在第一个梦里，你看到你弟弟在结冰的屋顶上滑倒掉了下来。你过去帮忙他，然后发现你能操纵得比你以为的要好，你跳下屋顶，发现你弟弟也掉落在悬崖边，他抓住树枝直到你伸手拉他。
The second dream finds you both in water, headed toward a falls. You think of holding your breath and going under, but your younger brother does this before you, and you follow. You are not hurt and you avoid a barrier that is in the water.第二个梦里，你发现你们都在水中，面朝着一个瀑布。你想要屏住呼吸，从下面走进去，但你弟弟先你这么做了，你跟着他。你没有受伤，你避开了水里的一个石块。
In the third dream you face a painless execution which is to be carried out by your father, who will give you the needle. You see Ruburt, who is on a swing, and you are concerned and sad. Later you find yourself unhurt. You wander about, see Ruburt once more, and again you are concerned for him.在第三个梦里，你面临了一个由你父亲执行的无痛处决，是他给你注射的。你看见鲁柏，他在秋千上，你很担心和悲伤。过了一会儿你发现自己并没有受伤，你觉得奇怪，再一次看向鲁柏，你很担心他。
(Note that the last line above says I saw Jane again in the dream. My own notes say I did not see her again; that is, I did not remember doing so when I awoke and wrote out my account of the dream. I may very well have actually seen Jane twice in the dream.(注意上述最后一行，有关我在梦里再次的看向珍。我自己的笔记上并没有写我再次看向她；当我醒来写梦的记录时，并不记得我有这么做。我很有可能真的在梦里看了珍两次。
(Seth also notes a few other discrepancies, later in the session, between the actual dream events and my written account.)(在课的后半段，赛斯也说了其他几个在真实的梦和我的记录之间不一致的地方。)
(I realize that I have left some details out, but the details that have been left out belong in other layers of the dreams).我明白我省去了一些细节，但这些省略了的细节是属于梦的其他层面。
Now. All of these dreams have to do with your subconscious feeling that you and your younger brother could go under, mainly in a financial, but also in an emotional way, because of your father.现在。所有这些梦都和你还有你弟弟内心潜意识的感觉有关，主要是财务上的，但因为你们的父亲，这同时也是情感上的。
The furnace which you are all purchasing for your family is important here. The snow and ice in the first dream represent the fact that your parents were not warm. Dick went in debt to get the furnace. He fell into debt, as he fell off the roof; and on his part the purchase was an emotional and impulsive one.你们为你们家买的暖气炉在这里很重要。第一个梦里的雪和冰代表了你们的父母并不温暖。迪克是借款买这个暖气炉。他掉进借贷里就如同他掉下屋顶；在他的部分，这种购买是一种情感和冲动下的行为。
Although you did not really agree, you leaped in to help him; as you jumped off the roof to go to his aid, you found that he had fallen farther than you thought over the edge of the cliff, and was hanging on. This represented further debt that he has taken on. He had fallen further in debt.虽然你不真的同意他的做法，但你还是跳下去帮他；当你跳下屋顶帮他的时候，你发现他比你想的跌得更远，跌到了悬崖边吊着。这代表他借了更多的钱。他在借贷中跌得更深。
Now you are afraid in the next dream that you both are in over your heads, so you see yourself and your brother in the water. He is still ahead of you, for he is now up to his neck in debt. You are not but you fear that your family situation, your parent situation, could put you in a like condition.现在，在下个梦里你很害怕你们会失控，所以你看到你和弟弟在水里，他仍然在你前面，他的债务现在已经到他的脖子高了。你并没有，但你害怕你家人的处境，你父母的处境，这有可能会让你陷入同样的情况。
You then project this, thinking that it would happen to your brother first. So he goes under first, and you follow. You come to the surface because you realize that you would never in actuality let that kind of a situation keep you under for long. You do not see your brother because you are not so sure that such a condition could not keep him under indefinitely.你投射这个担心，认为它可能会先发生在你弟弟身上。所以他先走进水底，而你跟着。你浮到水面上是因为你明白，你不会真的让你自己陷入那样的处境太久。你没有看到你弟弟，因为你不确定他是否会无限期地被陷入那种情况里。
(My account of the dream doesn't mention my actually coming to the surface of the water, but does deal with my holding my breath so that I will automatically rise to the surface; I had no doubt in the dream that I would do so. Nor did I see Dick again after we went over the falls. Seth is correct here.)(我对这个梦的记录并没有提到我真的浮到水面上，但有提到我屏住呼吸，所以我会自动地浮上水面；我不怀疑我在梦里会这么做。在我们走过瀑布后我也没看到迪克。赛斯在这里是对的。)
I suggest a brief break; and while we are at it, we shall tie these in with the third and most significant dream. I presume your hand is tired.我建议一个短暂的休息；当我们开始的时候，我们会把这些和第三个也是最重要的梦做连结。我猜你的手酸了。
(“A little.”(“有一点。”
(Break at 8:55. Jane said she had been dissociated more than usual, especially for a first delivery. She thought Seth might have seen to this in order to keep her from blocking. Her eyes had opened once briefly near the beginning of the session. Her rate of speaking had kept me writing rapidly.(8:55休息。珍说她比平常在更深的出离状态，特别是第一段。她认为赛斯可能是为了不让她阻挡讯息。她的眼睛在课开始的时候短暂睁开了一次。她说话的速度让我必须写得很快才能跟得上。
(At break I remarked to Jane that she need not hold a session of regular length this evening. Now that we had a little information, I thought we could wait for more if she didn’t care to continue. She resumed in the same fast manner, her eyes closed, at 9:00.)(在休息的时候我和珍说，她今晚不需要举行和平常一样长的课。现在我们得到了一点讯息，我想我们可以等，如果她不介意继续的话。她的眼睛闭着，以同样快的说话方式在9:00重新开始。)
While we are at it, you had better get what you can.当我们在讨论的时候，你最好尽力得到你能得到的。
The first dream stated the situation as you saw it at present. Dick you saw as having fallen into debt; and you, by increasing your financial allotment to your parents to help pay for the furnace, had jumped in after him to his aid.第一个梦宣告了你现在看到的处境。你看见迪克落入了债务里；而你为了帮忙付暖气炉的费用而增加了对父母财务上的分配，你为了帮他忙也随他跳下海。
The second dream projected the fears of the first, anticipating what you were afraid would happen in the future.第二梦投射了第一个梦的恐惧，预期着你所害怕的将会在未来发生。
You would both go under. You thought you could come out all right, but you were not certain of your brother.你们两个都走进水底，你认为你可以完好的出来，但你不确定你的弟弟也可以。
Now the last dream looks for the causes behind the situation, and the main key to it is the needle symbol, which on the one hand is a symbol for the penis. But it is not a phallic symbol, which has wider and deeper symbolic and racial implications than this one.现在最后一个梦寻找着情况背后的原因，主要的关键是针头这个象征，它一方面是阴茎的象征。但这里它不是阴茎的象征，它有着更广更深的象征性和种族性的意涵。
To some extent also the water symbol of the previous dream represented your mothers womb, and was a connection to the penis symbol of the next dream. Now. The execution, which you feared, was a symbol for the death of many hopes, both financial hopes and artistic ones. For you would have to get further work, you feared, to help your parents. And to you this would represent a type of execution.到某种程度，水在前一个梦的象征也代表了你母亲的子宫，它和下一个梦里的阴茎象征有连结。现在你所害怕的死刑，是一个代表很多希望死亡的象征，包含财务上和艺术上的。你害怕为了帮助你的父母，你必须得接更多的工作。而这对你来说就代表了某种死刑。
It was to be painless simply because your father did not mean in the dream to hurt you on purpose. But he would do it nevertheless, so you felt. The puzzlement is obvious. You did not see how he could do this to you.它是无痛的，只因为在梦里你父亲并不是故意要伤害你。尽管如此，他还是这么做了，所以你会有这种感觉。这里的困惑是很明显的。你不明白他怎么能对你这么做。
In the earlier dreams you were certain of your capacity to survive the situation which you feared. In this dream you faced the possibility that you would not survive so easily. Ruburt is in this episode because now you worry about the effect of your own reaction upon his condition in general.在之前的梦里，你很确定你有能力从恐惧的处境下存活下来。在这个梦里，你面临着一个可能性，你可能没那么容易可以存活下来。鲁柏在这个插曲里，因为现在你担心自己的反应会对他的情况有所影响。
Also, you are not at all certain in the dream that you would not prefer him to find outside employment, rather than increase your own work load, if a situation arose in which money was needed for your parents. Because your parents rather than his were involved you felt sadness and concern, because such a move on your part, you felt, would be unfair.同时，在梦里你并不确定如果你父母需要更多钱，与其增加你自己的工作量，你会不会宁愿让他去外面找工作，但因为是你的父母而不是他的父母牵涉进来，你感觉悲伤和担忧，因为是你的部分有变动，你感觉这并不公平。
In the end however you have survived. You are still concerned for Ruburt because you realize that as a matter of survival added funds for your family would have to come from his efforts, since your own painting time is too important to lose. Your father personally did not appear because literally you could not see him doing this to you. So you did not see him give you the needle.不过最后你还是存活下来了。你仍然担心鲁柏，因为你明白要从你家里增加的负担存活下来多少要靠他的努力，因为你自己画画的时间太重要了，你不能失去它。你父亲并没有出现，因为你无法看着他对你做这件事，所以你没有看到他为你注射。
For a very good reason you have forgotten a portion of the dream. At the last moment you simply walked out of the room, and refused to have this done to you. You did not remember this detail simply because it seems to you that you should make every sacrifice for your father. The concern and sadness you felt then, for Ruburt, was false, and added on to hide the fact that you had refused to be sacrificed.你有非常好的理由忘了这一部分的梦。在最后一分钟，你确实走出了这个房间，拒绝了这件事。你不记得这个细节，只因为对你来说，你似乎应该为你父亲做任何的牺牲。你对鲁柏感到的悲伤和担心是不正确的，这是为了隐藏你拒绝被牺牲的事实。
Do you understand this last portion?你了解最后这一部分吗？
(“Yes. ’’(“是的。”
(Jane's eyes had opened once again, rather briefly. They open again within a couple of paragraphs, when she lights a cigarette and sips at a glass of wine. Seth is right; I did forget the above portion of the dream, and my notes bear no reference to it.)(珍的眼睛再次短暂睁开。在几个段落后，当她点燃一根烟又喝了一口酒的时候，她的眼睛又再度睁开。赛斯是正确的；我的确忘了梦在上面描述的那一部分，我的梦里并没有提到它。)
You are subconsciously very concerned with your parents’ situation, and also you anticipate financial difficulties because of them. You are also worried about your brother, and all of these have piled up.你潜意识很担心你父母的情况，也因为他们，你预期着财务上的困难。你也担心着你弟弟，所有这些都不断的累积。
The other dream levels had to do with reincarnational material. Your brother is taking too much on as a result of his own impulsive nature, and you recognize that he could indeed go under long before yourself, so to speak, although he is younger.梦另外的层面和转世的资料有关。你弟弟因为他本身冲动的本质而负担了太多。你明白他的确比你陷得更深，虽然他比较年轻。
The dreams very clearly show your fear and concern. There is also some element of distorted clairvoyance, in that your fathers death—when it does occur, and it is not imminent—will finally be a painless one.这些梦非常清楚地显现了你的害怕和担忧。这里也有一些元素是扭曲了的预知力，你父亲的死——当它发生的时候，并不是即将要发生——最后将会是无痛的一种。
(Added later: Seth was correct. My father’s death was peaceful and painless—six years later, on February 5,1971.)(后来加注：赛斯是正确的。我父亲的死是平静无痛的 ——在6年后，1971年2月5日。)
You are ashamed to admit that to some extent you resent the payments that you both make, and this is the main reason why these fears were not recognized sufficiently by the ego, but forced into the subconscious where they made themselves known in this manner.某种程度上，你很羞于承认你怨恨着你们两个所欠下的贷款，这是为什么这些恐惧没有被自我充分认出的主要原因，它们被推进了潜意识，只能以这种方式被了解。
You may now end the session, or take a break as you prefer. I believe I have answered your most urgent questions. There are other dream connections that can be made if you want to pursue them further, however.你现在可以结束这一节，或者你想要休息。我想我已经回答了大部分紧急的问题。不过如果你要更进一步的探索，有其他梦的连结是可以讨论的。
(“Perhaps you can finish this tip next session then. ’’)(“也许你可以在下一节课完成这个讨论。”)
As you wish.如你所愿。
(“I’d like to thank you very much. ’’)(“我想要谢谢你。”)
I stand thanked.我接受你的感谢。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 9:20. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes were closed most of the time, her pace quite fast. She said she could have continued, but I thought we had made a good start.)(9:20结束。珍出离如常。她的眼睛大部分时间都是闭着，她的速度十分快。她说她可以继续，但我认为我们已经有一个好的开始了。)
(Tracing of the child's drawing used in the 22nd envelope test, in the 217th session for December 13,1965.)用在1965年12月13日第217节第22次信封测验上的孩童绘图案

SESSION 217 第217节 人格的相互作用 梦解析 信封22


DECEMBER 13, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年12月13日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(In the unscheduled 203rd session of October 28, with the Gallaghers as witnesses, Seth gave some information having to do with the Incas reaching Florida and building small settlements. Whether this is established historically Jane and I do not know. We would merely like to note here the appearance of an article in the New York Times for December 5,1965. This had to do with a team of anthropologists launching a four-year study to assess the culture of a wandering tribe of Indians in South Florida. The Indians came from Central or South America. Some remains have been found. The article did not say these Indians were Inca. Interestingly enough, one of the three anthropologists heading the expedition is Dr. John M. Lonyear 3d, of Colgate. Serious digging begins next month.(在10月28日第203节的临时课里，加拉格夫妇也参加了，赛斯给了一些印加人到佛罗里达州建立小部落的讯息。珍和我并不知道这是否在历史上有记载。我们只在这里摘录了1965年12月5日纽约时报里出现的一篇文章。这是有关一个人类学家的团队从事了4年的研究，评估南佛罗里达州一个印第安流浪部落的文化。这些印地安人来自中南美洲。有一些已经被发现了。文中并没有说这些印地安人是印加人。有趣的是，3个人类学家中领导探险的是哥盖德大学的约翰·朗易博士。重要的挖掘在下个月开始。
(The 22nd envelope test was held this evening. The test object was a ball-point pen drawing of a dog; my four-year-old nephew made it while my brother Bill’s family and Jane and I visited my parents last Sunday. I thought David’s drawing good for one his age, and added notes of my own. I intended to file it for the future, but today decided it would make a good test subject. Jane had not seen it. The drawing is on paper the weight of this page. A drawing on the back doesn’t apply here. I sealed it in the usual double envelopes, between two pieces of Bristol.(今晚要举行第22次的信封测试，测验物件是一张画，是用圆珠笔画的狗；是上个星期天我弟弟比尔一家，还有珍和我拜访我父母时，我4岁的侄子画的。我认为以大卫的年纪来说，他画得很好，就加了我自己的评语。我打算在将来放入档案，但今天我认为这会是一个好的测验主题。珍没有看过它。这画是画在和这一页一样重的纸张上。画的背面没有用在这里，我把它放在两张纸板中间，封在信封里。
(As suggested by Seth in the 212th session, I have been keeping a record of outside weather conditions just preceding each session. Seven categories of data are involved.(就如第212节赛斯建议的，我在每一节课之前记录外面的天气。包含了7种类型的资料。
(Once again, as described in the 215th session, a candle was lighted just before the session began. As before, it was sheltered from Jane's vision. The room was well lighted. As soon as I lit the candle the flame soared up to a height that was easily two inches, and remained there without interruption for about twenty minutes. This was twice as high as in the 215th session. The same candle was used. Jane knew it was lit of course but we did not talk about it, and she did not see the flame until first break. I could not account for the extraordinary height of the flame. There were no drafts; the session was held in our small back room, and the windows were closed.(再次的，就如第215节描述的，在课开始之前，我就先把蜡烛给点燃了。像以前一样，珍的视线看不到它。房间很亮。当我点燃蜡烛的时候，火焰急升到近两英寸高，而且不间断地维持在这个高度将近20分钟。这是第215节时焰火高度的两倍，我用的是同样的蜡烛。珍知道蜡烛被点燃了，但我们没有提到它，她直到第一次休息时才看到火焰。我无法说明这火焰意想不到的高度。这里并不透风；这节课在我们后面的小房间举行，窗户是关着的。
(Jane began speaking while sitting down, at an average pace and in an average voice; her pace soon began to speed up. As in the 213th session, her eyes opened as soon as she began speaking, which is quite unusual. Janes eyes continued to open and close while she spoke.)(珍开始的时候以一种适中的速度和声音说话；她的速度一开始不久就加快。就像在第213节，当她开始说话的时候，眼睛睁开，这很不寻常。当她说话的时候，珍的眼睛持续睁开和闭上。)
You may put this into your records or you may not, as you prefer. And you will have to take my word for what I am saying for the present, regardless of how impatient you may be.你可以决定要不要把这个放进记录里，不管你会不会不耐烦，你必须把我现在说的话记下来。
Ruburt’s book will do very well. I am not speaking now in terms of riches. Nevertheless your immediate financial worries will definitely be over within a two-year period, when his other books will also begin to show in financial terms. You will be quite comfortably situated.鲁柏的书会进行得很顺利。我现在说的不是金钱方面。不管怎样，你们财务上的烦恼会在两年内明确的消失，他其他的书也会开始卖钱。你们会过得很舒服。
I suggest that you purchase the Sherman book by all means.我建议你们务必买下舒曼(Sherman)的书。
Your holiday plans can be of excellent benefit to you both. Your friend Mark telepathically picked up your attitudes concerning his friend at your last meeting, not this evenings meeting, and he changed some of his plans because of your attitudes.你们的假期计划会对你们俩个非常有益。你们的朋友马克在上次聚会的时候，心电感应式地收到了你对他朋友的态度，不是今晚的聚会，因为你们的态度，他改变了一些他的计划。
On that particular occasion he was, contrary to appearances, quite open to suggestion because he was off guard. You did him a service by going out with him that evening, although you may have not realized it. And in some respects he is good for you. Particularly you, Joseph. He stretches you, both your sympathies and your understanding, and you both benefit.当他在某些特殊的时刻，当他放下防卫的时候，和外表相反，他对建议是持开放态度的。那晚你和他出门帮助了他，虽然你可能并不知道。在某些方面，他对你们是好的。特别是你，约瑟，他扩展了你，不管是你的同情心或理解力，你们双方都受益。
(The book mentioned by Seth is one on ESP by Harold Sherman.(赛斯在这里提到的是一本ESP的书，是哈罗•舒曼[Harold Sherman]所著。
(Mark is Bill Macdonnel’s entity name. Bill has witnessed several earlier sessions. The holiday plans concern a party we planned with Bill, to be held at his art gallery.(马克是比尔·麦唐纳存有的名字。比尔参与了之前好几节课。假期的计划包括了我们打算和比尔办的派对，是在他的艺术画廊举办的。
(Jane and I went dancing with Bill and his girlfriend, whom we had not met before, two weekends ago. Bill appeared to be much smitten, and during the evening paid little attention to us, much to our amusement. This evening he surprised Jane and me by telling us he was not seeing the girl anymore. Jane and I said nothing to him about his girl; we liked her very much. She is quite young. Bill is 27.)(珍和我在两周前的周末和比尔还有他的女朋友一起去跳舞，之前我们没有见过他的女朋友。比尔似乎是突然强烈的爱上她，那晚他很少注意我们，这一点我们觉得很有趣。今晚珍和我很讶异的听到他说，他再也不见这个女孩了。珍和我没有对他说过任何有关这女孩的话；我们非常喜欢她。她十分年轻。比尔27岁。)
We shall have much to say concerning the interaction of personalities on many occasions, as there is much that is not understood. The interactions are so swift that they cannot be physically measured, and the sort of parties that you are planning are of great psychic benefit from a variety of standpoints.关于人格在很多场合之间的相互作用，我们还有很多可以说的，还有很多不被了解的。这些相互作用是如此迅速以至于它们无法被有形的测量，而你们计划中的这类派对，从很多不同的观点来说，都具有很大的心灵方面的助益。
Now. Let us return to our discussion on action, and tie this in with action as it is seen within dreams. Your own dreams greatly affect the actions that you take within the physical situation, and as you know telepathy operates within dreams.现在。让我们回到对行动的讨论，而把这点和梦里看见的行动做连结。你自己的梦会很大程度地影响你在物质情境下所采取的行动，而如你所知的，在梦里心电感应运作着。
This material is somewhat of a personal nature. Nevertheless your young brother, this previous weekend, rather suddenly displayed an inclination to say no when he felt that needless demands were being put upon him.这个资料带有几分个人的本质。前一个周末，你弟弟突然拒绝了丢在他身上的过分要求。
Your parents definitely let him know that they wanted a new television set, and he quite uncharacteristically told them it was impossible as far as he was concerned. His physical action, his refusal, was based upon a telepathic communication with you, in the dream state, on those evenings when you had the dreams which I interpreted for you.你的父母十分明确的让他知道他们想要一台新电视机，而他很不像他地告诉他们这不可能。他的物质行动，他的拒绝是奠基于他和你在梦境时的沟通，就是我解释给你听的，你做梦的那几个晚上。
(See the unscheduled 216th session, the notes on my dreams involving my younger brother Bill, and Seth's analysis.)(见第216节临时课，我梦的笔记里包含了我的弟弟比尔，还有赛斯的分析。)
This firmness on his part saved the situation, for your parents clearly understood what could be expected and what could not be expected. There is obviously no way to prove that this communication took place. On those evenings however when you dream of a certain individual, you may strongly suspect that the same individual is dreaming of you. The trouble is that the other individual most likely has not trained himself to recall his dreams, and so we can prove little.他坚定的立场拯救了整个情况，因为你的父母很清楚地明白了什么是可以期待的，而什么是不能期待的。很明显的，没有任何方式可以证明这样的沟通曾发生过。不过在那些你梦到特定对象的夜晚，你可以强烈的怀疑那人也梦到你。困难点是那个对象很可能并没有训练自己去回忆他的梦，所以我们能证明的不多。
The telepathic message picked up in dreams under such circumstances will of course be interpreted by the dreaming self in its own way, symbolically, so that the dream actions may not appear to be the same. If it were possible to examine two such allied dream communications however, the connection between them would be very clear. In years to come we may be able to work along these lines, but this will be in the future. It is nevertheless an important point.在这种情况下，梦里所接收到的心电感应信息，当然是象征性地以梦的自己本身的方式来解读，因此这些梦的行动可能看起来也不相同。不过如果有可能去检查两个如此类似的梦的沟通，那它们之间的关联就会非常清楚。在未来的几年里，我们会在这个方向努力，但这是以后了。不过这会是一个重点。
Ruburt will benefit by our vacation, and also by Shermans book. There are some good hints in it. Obviously I cannot tell you everything at once, and the man’s abilities are well developed. We are doing quite well ourselves, considering our circumstances, and we shall do better.鲁柏会因为我们的假期，还有舒曼的书而受益。这里有一些很好的暗示。显然，我无法一次告诉你们每件事，而这个人的能力发展得非常好。我们自己也做得很好，考虑到我们的情况，我们应该做得更好。
Our results with Dr. Instream have been better, by far, than fair. But he is still looking for more specific data, and I believe we can give it to him.关于殷斯翠姆博士测验的结果，我们越做越好。但他仍在寻找更明确的资料，而我相信我们可以给他。
Our tests must be considered in the light of action, for this is what they are. They involve a more immediate and basic action than physical mobility, and therefore we are concerned with manipulations that are not physical. The associations, personal associations on Ruburt’s part, when they are directly connected to test objects in our envelope tests, represent to some degree a step forward on his part.我们的测验必须从行动方面来考虑，因为那是它们的本质。它们涉及了比物质移动性更立即和更基本的行动。因此我们考虑到非物质的操纵。这些联想，鲁柏这部分的个人联想，当它们和我们信封测验的测验物件直接关联的时候，代表了他在某种程度上更进一步。
We are not speaking of my part now; for in such cases the connections are becoming specific, you see, and the preliminary connection has been made. The personal associations on his part that do not apply to the test object, do represent the fact that his own abilities have not fully developed.我们现在不是在说我的部分；你知道在这样的例子，连结会变得很明确，初步的连结会形成。在他的部分，个人联想没有应用到测验物件上，代表了他自己的能力还没有充分发展。
Within a fairly decent amount of time, Ruburt and I will be able to work hand in hand, so that our own separate perceptions will build up together, to a more or less precise picture of the object involved. But upon many occasions his personal associations now are connected with the object; so he does not fight me, but we work together.在一个合适的时间点，鲁柏和我将会携手合作，所以我们自己不同的感知力会一起增进，对牵涉的物件多少有一个正确的画面为止。但在很多情况下，他个人的联想是和物件有关联的；所以他没有和我作对，而是我们一起合作。
I suggest a brief break. I also suggest that during our vacation you take your own time, extra time, for reading. It will also be to your advantage to make a habit of taking a sketch pad with you to parties and so forth; since you are known as an artist, this will not be considered unusual or strange, and your own work will benefit. You will pick up intuitional data concerning various personalities in action, and this will aid you in your painting.我建议一个短暂的休息。我也建议在我们的假期，你花时间，额外的时间来阅读。养成一个习惯，带画板去派对等地方也是对你有益的；因为大家都知道你是个艺术家，这并不会让人觉得是不寻常或奇怪的，对你自己的工作也有利。你会收到很多直觉的资料是关于行动中的不同人格，而这也会帮助你的绘画。
(Break at 9:30. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes had frequently opened to some extent, though not fully; they had been very dark. Her pace had been quite fast.(9:30休息。珍在第一段出离如常。她的眼睛常睁开到某个程度，虽然并不是完全睁开；它们非常深邃。她的速度十分快。
(The candle flame had begun to subside about ten minutes ago, and was now down to about a 3/4-inch height, from its estimated high of two inches earlier in the session. It now burned quite steadily at this low point, just as it had burned equally steadily earlier.(蜡烛的火焰10分钟前就开始减弱，从课一开始大约两英寸高，降到现在大概四分之三英寸高。它在这个低点燃烧得十分稳定，和早先一样的稳定。
(Shortly after Jane began speaking again the candle flame climbed back up to a two-inch height. Her eyes were now closed, her pace once again good. Resume at 9:40.)(当珍再次开始说话的时候，蜡烛火焰很快地升高到两英寸。她的眼睛现在闭着，她的速度一度很好。在9:40重新开始。)
In actual cash Ruburt will receive approximately $3,500.00 in the following year, though this will not represent all that he will make, and the amount will double in the next two years. From then on you will do very well. Again, you may or may not insert this in the record, as you prefer.在接下来的一年，鲁柏会收到大约3500美金，虽然这并不代表他全部所赚的，在接下来的两年内，金额会增加一倍。从那时候开始，你们会发展得非常好。再次的，你不必把这个加到记录里，这由你决定。
Now. Briefly I would like to return to your dreams, the same ones that we began to interpret the other evening.现在。我想先简短地回到你的梦，那天晚上我们解读的那几个梦。
(Again, see the unscheduled 216th session. We hadn’t asked Seth specifically to continue with these dreams, but still hoped he would, soon.)(再次地，见216节临时课。我们那时没有要求赛斯继续讲这几个梦，但我们希望他会这么做，在很短的时间内。)
On another level they represent something quite different. You saw your young brother in a fetus position, for he will be born again within the physical universe, and you will not. You averted the barrier, which was another existence within this field. He did not.在另一个层面，它们代表十分不同的东西。你看到你弟弟以一个胎儿的姿势，是因为他将在物质宇宙中再出生一次，而你不会。你避开了这个障碍，那是这个领域的另一次存在。而他没有。
He went first however because he will die shortly before you, and incidentally in many years to come, and not at a young age. He will live to old age, particularly to compensate for an early death in a past existence.他走在前面是因为他会比你早死一点，附带一说，那是很多年以后，并不是年轻的时候。他会活到老年，特别为了补偿他前一世的早死。
He will take particular joy in watching his own children develop, because he did not develop in that past life to maturity, though this of course was not definitely in your dream.他会特别开心看着自己的孩子发育成长，因为他前一世没有活到成年，虽然这在你的梦里并不明确。
(Since I am nine years older than Bill, it appears that we will both be quite ancient at death. I do not believe that Jane would have allowed such data to come through too many sessions ago, although she did permit Seth to say quite a while ago that she herself would live to old age. That data was also connected to dream analysis and reincarnation.(我大了比尔9岁，我们死的时候似乎都十分老了。如果在许多节课之前，我不认为珍会让这些资料透过来，虽然之前她允许赛斯说她会活到老年。那个资料也和梦的分析和转世有关。(注：实际上，珍死的时候才55岁)
(Seth was giving general reincarnational data on my family and on Jane's as early as the 9th session, while avoiding such things as times of death, etc. Actually the concept of reincarnation made its appearance in the first session. Seth began to be more specific on family reincarnational data when he told Jane and me in a very early session that neither of us would be born again on the physical plane; this, he said, accounted for our lack of children and the desire for them. Seth explained that both of us had been parents before, experiencing both the male and female roles. We have a little material on this; we always are intending to ask for more but somehow don't seem to get around to it. See Volume 1.)(赛斯早在第9节的时候，就给了关于我的家人和珍转世的资料，当时避开了死亡的时间等。事实上，转世的概念第一节就出现了。赛斯开始对家庭转世的资料更为明确，他在很早的课里就告诉珍和我，我们两个不会再出生在物质地球；他说，这个解释了我们没有孩子以及缺乏有孩子的欲望。赛斯解释我们两个都曾经当过父母，同时都经历了男性和女性的角色。关于这点我们有一些资料；我们总是企图问更多，但不知怎地就是没有得到答案。见第一册。)
You saw Ruburt outside the window because he was not directly involved with the relationship between you and your father.你见到鲁柏在窗外，因为他没有直接涉入你和你父亲之间的关系。
The swing represented your feeling that after all Ruburt was relatively free, on the one hand, from the problem. Therefore you saw him as swinging free. This represented part of your feelings. The other part was represented by your concern for him, for although he was not as directly affected as you, he would still be involved. The waterfall represented physical death on this level, you see, both of you dying, your brother and yourself; but he first and already adopting the birth position, for he will choose another life rather quickly. He is impulsively drawn to things of earth.秋千代表了你的感觉，最后鲁柏是可以从这个问题当中自由脱困的。因此你看到他自由自在的荡秋千。这代表了你一部分的感觉。另一部分代表了你对他的关心，虽然他不像你直接的被影响，他仍然会被牵扯进来。瀑布在这个层面代表了肉体的死亡，你明白吗，你和你弟弟，两个人都死了；但他已经先采取了一个出生的姿势，这代表他很快会选择另一次人生。他很冲动地被拉回地球。
(Jane's eyes had again been opening and closing rather often. The candle flame, now, attained its highest point of the evening; it was well over an estimated two inches in height, rising up to such a height that a thin trail of black smoke escaped from it. Since the windows were still closed and there were no drafts, I could not account for the flame's height. The candle is a large one, with a diameter of at least two inches and with very little taper. As before it sat out of the reach of Jane’s breath, and although it was closer to me I took care to keep my head averted so that my own breath could not influence it. Perhaps temperature changes within the candle could influence it after it has burned for a while, although it felt no warmer to me.)(珍的眼睛再次很频繁的睁开又闭上。现在，蜡烛火焰达到了今晚最高的高度；粗估超过了两英寸高，有一层薄薄的黑烟升起。因为窗户仍关着，也没有通风，我无法解释火焰的高度。这蜡烛很大，直经最少有两英寸，烛心很短。像以前一样，它在珍的呼吸影响不到的地方，虽然它离我比较近，我很注意地别开我的头，不要让我的呼吸影响到它。也许当蜡烛燃烧了一会后，它本身温度的改变会有影响，虽然我并不感觉有变得比较暖。)
He will be born in a warm climate. You both started out from a cold one, hence the snow. Much of this is indeed personal, but is involved here. I would like to make it plain that your mother literally prods your father enough to keep him from withdrawing completely, and he has much to thank her for regardless of their differences.他将会出生在气候温暖的地方。你们两个都从一个有雪、寒冷的地方开始。这是很个人的，但和这里是有关的。我想很清楚地说，你母亲确实激励了你的父亲，避免他完全地退缩，不管他们有多不同，他直的应该多谢她。
Without her there would be no vividness for him, for he is unable to relate himself outward. It was because she wanted to feel close to you that she called you this evening, more than anything else, although there was a misunderstanding involved.因为他无法自己和外界连结，如果没有了她，他不会这么的丰富。她今晚打电话给你，最主要的是想跟你靠近，虽然这里有一些误解。
Your own attitudes toward the family have changed considerably, and have become more tolerant since our sessions. Such tolerance helps you as well as those otherwise involved. Ruburts own attitude toward his mother has also become less rigid, largely as a result of our sessions. When you are quiet and not condemning others you can see them more clearly, and you are not afraid of them for you become stronger. You will find yourself enjoying the Christmas season, even with your relatives, for you understand now that a basic reality is involved.从我们的课开始后，你自己对家人的态度就改变了很多，你变得比较宽容。这种宽容就像其他事一样的帮助了你。鲁柏自己对他母亲的态度也变得比较不固执，很大部分是因为我们的课。当你比较沉静而不那么谴责他人的时候，可以比较清楚的看到他们，不会害怕他们，因为你变得强大了。你将会发现你自己能享受圣诞季，即使是和你的亲戚在一起，因为你现在了解了其中所涉及的基本实相。
You had better take a brief break before our Dr. Instream material.在我们的殷斯翠姆博士资料开始之前，你们最好短暂地休息一下。
(Break at 9:59. Jane had been dissociated as usual. Her eyes had opened and closed quite often, and she had smoked a cigarette. Her pace had been fast.(9:59休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛频繁的睁开又闭上，她抽了一根烟。她的速度比较快。
(The candle flame maintained its unusual height until break, then it began to subside somewhat, and continued to do so through the Dr. Instream material to follow. However it did not reach its earlier 1/4-inch low point. Jane said she had been aware of no feeling of energy thrusting sideways out of her toward the candle, as she had been in the 215th session. This is the 25th Dr. Instream test.(蜡烛火焰直到休息时都维持着不寻常的高度，然后它减弱了一点，在后来的殷斯翠姆博士资料时也持续地减弱。不过并没有减弱到早先四分之三英寸的低点。这是第25次殷斯翠姆博士测试。
(As usual now Jane's pace slowed up, though not to a great degree. She sat with her eyes closed, her face tipped down to meet the ashtray beside her. Resume at 10:07.)(现在，一如以往，珍的速度开始减慢，虽然并不是很大的程度。她坐着，眼睛闭着，她的脸朝下，看着旁边的烟灰缸。10:07重新开始。)
Now give us a moment, please. (Pause.)现在，请等一下。(停顿)
A somewhat unusual event today for our friend. That is, not an event that is usually within his daily schedule, involving two other people. (Pause.) The circumstance having a connection with a letter from the western portion of the country, or west of his location, from a university or large foundation of some sort, or from a man who is connected with such a group.我们的朋友今天有个不寻常的事件。那不是一个在他日常行程里的事件，和其他两个人有关。(停顿)这个情况和从美国西边来的一封信有关联，或是在他所在地的西边，信来自一个大学或大型基金会之类的，或来自于和这类团体有关的一个人。
An occasion also at his home, where five were present. (Pause.) Another situation involving a young man and a family connection. He wears a robe with a large pocket, rather unusual pocket. (Pause.)一个场合，也在他家，有5个人出席。(停顿)另一个情况涉及了一个年轻人和其相关的一个家庭。他穿着有大口袋的外衣，相当不寻常的口袋。(停顿)
I pick up a connection with cork, but do not know to what this refers. (Pause.) Will you put Ruburt's cigarette out for him, please.我收到一个与软木塞的连接，但并不知道这指的是什么。(停顿)可以请你帮鲁柏把烟熄灭吗？
("Yes.”(“好的。”
(This is the first time I can recall where Jane herself interrupted such test data in this manner. She did not appear to be distracted, however, or to break off in the middle of a piece of information. I put out the cigarette; its smoke had been drifting toward her.)(这是我记得的第一次，珍以这种方式打断了测验资料。不过她看起来并没有分心，或在讯息的中间被打断。我把烟熄了；烟飘向她。)
The unusual event I mentioned occurred I believe about three this afternoon, or he learned of it then.我想我提到的不寻常事件发生在今天下午3点，或是他听到它的时间。
A succession of numbers in a row, backwards, as of 10, 9, et cetera.一连串连续的数字，倒数的，像10，9之类的。
He is feeling better now than he did at our last session.他现在感觉比我们上节课的时候好多了。
A connection now with Dr. Rhine, and some arrangements or a letter. The initials, I believe J. B. R., and a letter from a publisher. The initials could be J. R. B..现在和瑞恩博士有个连结，一些约定或一封信。我想缩写是J.B.R.，还有一封从出版商寄来的信。首字母可能是J.R.B.……
(J. B. R. of course being Dr. Rhine’s initials. And J. R. B. can be the initials of Jane Roberts Butts. Dr. Rhine is also a para-psychologist.)(J.B.R.当然是瑞恩博士的缩写。J.R.B.也可能是是珍·罗伯兹(Jane Roberts Butts)的缩写。瑞恩博士也是一位心理学家。)
Do you have a test for me?你有测验要给我吗？
(“Yes.”(“有的。”
(It was 10:15, and time for our 22nd envelope test. Jane took the sealed double envelope from me without opening her eyes. Now she did something new for her in these tests. For several seconds she held the envelope directly against her forehead. Her eyes remained closed. Then she lowered the envelope to her lap.)(现在是10:15，是时候开始我们第22次信封测试。珍闭着眼睛从我手中接过了信封。现在在这些测验上，她做了一些新尝试。有几秒钟她握着信封直接放在她的前额上。她的眼睛仍闭着。然后她把信封往下放在大腿上。)
Give us a moment, please.请等一下。以下是印象。
These are impressions. The numbers 1, 2, 3. A room. Round shapes. The number 12. Perhaps the twelfth month, though I am not sure.数字1、2、3。一间房间。圆形。数字12。也许第12个月，虽然我不确定。
A connection with another location, perhaps out of this town. Two people, yet some connection with a summer scene, and water.和另一个地点有关联，也许在城外。两个人，和夏天的场景还有水有些关联。
A stopwatch, though I do not know to what this refers. An upright composition. A group, but I pick up busts rather than full figures, and a round object. People about a round object, such as a table.一个码表，虽然我不知道这指的是什么。一个直立的姿势。一个团体，虽然我接收到的是破碎而不是整体的形象，一个圆形的物件。人们围着一个圆形的物件，像是桌子。
6 as in 6 o’clock. A letter or note. The color yellow. Light tissue paper. 1963 or 1963.6，像是6点。一封信或一张短签。黄颜色。很轻的薄纸。1963 或1965。
Something missing, and someone who could not come.某个错过的东西，和某个不能来的人。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:22. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her pace had been fairly good. She said that nothing she said in either test made particular sense to her.(10:22休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，速度相当快。她说不管在哪一个测验里，都没有哪一句话让她有特别的感觉。
(The candle flame had fluctuated a bit at low ebb during the tests, but had not reached its previous height by far.(在测试期间，烛焰在低点时有一些波动，但目前没有达到它之前的高点。
(Jane said she received a few visual images during the envelope test, but that they were not sensational by any means. They will be mentioned below.(珍说在信封测验的时候，她接收到一些视觉印象，但没有什么特别的，下面会提到。
(See the tracing of the test object on page 131. During last Sunday there was a family gathering at my parents' home in nearby Sayre, PA. There were twelve people in all: My parents, Jane and /, my brother Loren, his wife and son, and my brother Bill and his wife, and their two daughters and one son. Bill’s son is named David, he is four years old, and it is he who drew the test object, with a black ballpoint pen on white paper.(请见上面的描图。在上星期日，在我父母邻近宾州塞尔的家有个家庭聚会。总共有12个人；我父母、珍和我、我弟弟洛伦、他的太太和儿子，还有我弟弟比尔和他太太，还有他们的两个女儿和一个儿子。比尔的儿子名叫大卫，现在4岁，是他画了这个测验物件，用黑色的圆珠笔在白纸上画的。
(As Seth explains on page 134 of this session, some of the test data tonight represents preliminary connections with the test object, just as in the last envelope test with the drawing made by Roy Fox. Thus Janes personal associations are now often connected with the test object, and she is working with Seth and not against him.(如同赛斯在这节课前面所解释的，今晚有一些测验资料代表了和测验物件初步的连结，就像上一次信封测验里罗伊·法克斯的画一样。珍的个人联想现在常会和测验物件有关，还有她和赛斯是一起合作而不是对抗他。
(Jane said that Seth’s count of 1, 2, 3 was his way—or Jane's?-—of leading up to the number 4 that I wrote on the drawing, referring to David’s age. ‘A room” is too general. Also “Round shapes"; although there are round shapes on the drawing. "The number 12" can apply easily enough. Not only is the month of the test the twelfth month, but there were twelve people present in Sayre the day the test object was drawn. And again, the test object was drawn on December 12th, and so dated by me.(珍说赛斯用他的方式数123——或珍的方式？——准备数到数字4，这是我在画上写下的，关于大卫的年纪。“一间房间”太广泛了，“圆形”也是；虽然画里面有很多圆形。“数字12”很容易套用。不只是测验的月份是12月，也是测验物件在塞尔被画的那天，有12个人出席。再次，测验物件是在12月12日画的，我有把日期记下来。
(At first Jane and I thought that the out of town location applied to our going to Sayre yesterday. Then we saw that it referred to a visit Jane and I made to visit Bill in Rochester last summer, for here “summer scene, and water ' enters in. We went swimming with Bill and his family in Lake Ontario. We recall this especially because the usual beaches at Rochester were polluted by hordes of dead fish; we had to drive some distance to find a suitable swimming spot.(原先珍和我认为，城外指的是我们昨天去了塞尔，后来我们发现它指的是去年夏天珍和我去罗彻斯特拜访比尔的事，因为这里有包含“夏天的场景和水”。我们和比尔，还有他的家人去安大略湖游泳。我们特别记得这个，因为罗彻斯特大部分海滩都被一大群死鱼给污染了；我们必须开一段距离才能找到适合游泳的地方。
(“A stopwatch" does not ring a bell with us. We think David’s drawing of the dog can be called an “upright composition. " The next statement, about “A group... busts rather than full figures... people about a round object, such as a table, ” is quite interesting, and can apply twice, as the number twelve applied four times. My parents dining room table is round, and of course we ate Sunday dinner at this table. My parents also have a round mirror-topped coffee table in the living room. It is a low table; often a group of the children would be playing games on the table, and to do this they had to sit on the floor. Thus only their torsos projected above the tabletop, and were reflected in the mirror.(“一个码表”并没有让我们想到什么。我们认为大卫画的那只狗可以称为“一个直立的姿势”。下一句关于“一个团体……破碎而不是整体的形象……人围着一个圆形的物件，类似桌子”，这十分有趣，可以适用两次，就像数字12适用了4次。我父母的餐桌是圆形的，星期天的晚餐我们当然在这个桌子上吃饭。我父母在客厅也有一个圆形的镜面咖啡桌，它是一个比较低的桌子；一群孩子通常会在桌子上玩游戏，而要这么做他们必须坐在地上。因此只有他们的部分身体会在桌面上，被镜子照到。
(6 as in 6 o’clock is not specific enough for easy conscious connection. “A letter or note" can refer to the notes for reference I made on David’s drawing. “The color yellow" we think is a strong connection to the drawing of the dog; Dick recently obtained a puppy for his children, and when Jane and I asked David to describe the dog he called it orange at first, then yellow.(6，好像是6点，但不够具体，无法轻易地做有意识的连结。“一封信或一张短签”可以是我贴在大卫画上的附录短签。“黄颜色”我们认为和画中的狗有很强的关联；迪克最近给了他的孩子一只狗，当珍和我要大卫描述这只狗的时候，他先说它是橘色的，然后说它是黄色的。
(“Light tissue paper" may be nebulous. Jane and I gave the children their Christmas presents Sunday, and rather than wait for Christmas they opened the gifts then. They were wrapped in regular Christmas paper; if this is called tissue. It can be a connection. The test object was drawn in 1965 of course, not 1963. The thought here is that calligraphically the numerals 3 and 5 are quite similar.(“很轻的薄纸。”是含糊的。珍和我在星期天给了孩子他们的圣诞节礼物，但还没等到圣诞节，他们就把礼物拆开了。礼物是用一般的圣诞纸包装的；如果这可以称是薄纸的话，它就有连结。这个测验物件当然是在1965年画的，而不是1963年。这里有一个想法是，数字3和5的书写是有一点类似的。
(Finally, “Something missing, and someone who could not come, ” is also interesting. As soon as the test was over, and I believe before she knew what the test object was, Jane told me that she believed “Something” and “someone” referred to the same thing. Only one member of the family was missing at the gathering Sunday, and this was my brother Lorens daughter Linda, who was at work in Scranton, PA. It was too far away for her to make the trip up to Sayre, and back, in one day.(最后，“某个错过的东西，和某个不能来的人。”也是有趣的。当测验一结束，我认为珍还不知道测验物件是什么的时候，珍告诉我，她相信“某个东西”和“某个人”指的是同一个。在星期天的聚会里只有一个家人没有回来，那是我弟弟洛伦的女儿琳达，她在宾州史广特[Scranton]工作。因为太远了，她无法一日来回塞尔和史广特之间。
(Jane also said that Seth was going to say something about lettering on the test object, but she did not give voice to it. I had made notes on it.(珍也说赛斯会说某些在测验物件上的字，但最后她没有为他说。我把这记下来。
(The candle flame was still down when Jane resumed, with her eyes closed, at 10:30.)(珍在10:30重新开始的时候，蜡烛火焰仍然是微弱的，她的眼睛闭着。)
We will now close our session, though you may watch the candle for a moment, as I am teaching Ruburt how to use energy. It is a rather simple matter of directing basic energy along certain lines outside of the physical organism. Everyone does this subconsciously to begin with.我们现在要结束我们的课了，虽然你们可以注视蜡烛一会儿，就像我教鲁柏如何使用能量。它是一件相当简单的事，指挥基本能量沿着物质有机体之外的某条路线而去。每个人潜意识都开始这么去做。
(As soon as Seth mentioned the candle, its flame began to grow. Rather quickly the flame reached up to a height beneath its maximum for the session, which was well over an estimated two inches, its growth now was quite respectable however, perhaps to something just under two inches. Considering the earlier displays by the flame, I now had a question.)(赛斯提到蜡烛的时候，火焰开始增强。很快地，火焰升到了接近今晚最高的高度，估计大概有两英寸，它增加得十分快，几乎接近两英寸了。想到之前火焰的展示，我现在有一个问题。)
(“Were there earlier demonstrations by the flame that weren't accidental?’)(“之前火焰的展示不是偶然的吗？)
There were. We would like to perfect this. Smoothly however, so that we are able to announce it ahead of time, to show that other conditions are not working such as drafts and so forth. Have you been watching the candle as I spoke?是的。我们要精益求精。顺利的话，我们可以提早发现其他有妨碍的情况，比如透风等等。我说话的时候你们有看着蜡烛吗？
(“Yes.”(“是的。”
(Jane's eyes were still closed, and the flame was still up.)(珍的眼睛仍闭着，火焰仍然很高。)
Now it should be getting quite a bit higher.现在应该高了一点。
(“Yes.”(“是的。”
(Seth paused briefly. The flame climbed a little more. It was quite steady, but still short of its high for the evening.)(赛斯短暂停了一下。火焰爬升得更高了一点。它很稳定，但仍未达到今晚最高的高度。)
And now I suggest we end the session.现在我建议我们结束这一节课。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:33. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed. She now told me that once again she had felt the peculiar sideways thrust, as of energy, directed toward the candle to her right. See page 124 of the 215th session for the first instance of this effect.(10:33结束。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着。珍现在告诉我，她一度感觉到侧面奇怪的冲力，像是能量朝向她右边的蜡烛。见第215节第一次出现这种效果的例子。
(Jane now relaxed on the bed. Peculiarly now, we saw the candle flame shoot up to equal its previous high, well over two inches. A delayed reaction (Jane now felt no energy thrust.)(珍现在放松地躺在床上。现在很不寻常的，我们看到蜡烛火焰升到和之前的高度一样高，超过两英寸。一个延迟的反应？珍现在没有感受到任何能量的冲力。)
(Tracing of the envelope front used in the envelope test, the 23rd, in the 218th session for December 15,1965.)用在1965年12月15日第218节第23次信封测验的信封正面素描

SESSION 218 第218节 普莱斯利 唐尼时间理论 信封23


DECEMBER 15, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年12月15日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(The 23rd envelope test was held this evening during the session. For the test object I used the front of an envelope addressed to Jane and me by my mother. I folded it once as indicated, enclosed it between two pieces of Bristol, and sealed it in the usual double envelopes.(第23次信封测验在今晚这节课举行。我用的测验物件是我妈妈寄给珍和我的信封正面。我像标示的那样把它对折起来，放在两张纸板中间，再放进信封里。
(Today Jane read all day, finishing up J. B. Priestley’s book, Man and Time, which she liked very much. She had read nothing by Priestley before, nor by Dunne, mentioned extensively in the Priestley book. After supper this evening Jane told me she thought Seth had come through twice, briefly, as she went about her daily chores before the session. Both instances concerned the Priestley book, which had excited her.(珍整天都在阅读普莱斯利[Priestley]的书，这本《人类和时间》( Man and Time)是她非常喜欢的。她以前没有读过普莱斯利或唐尼[Dunne]的书，后者在普莱斯利的书里常提到。今天晚餐后珍告诉我，她认为当她在课前做一些日常琐事的时候，赛斯有短暂的透过来两次。两次都和普莱斯利的书有关，这让她很兴奋。
(When I lit our test candle at 8:55 PM, the flame at once shot up to an estimated height of three inches; I had not seen it do this before. It smoked noticeably for a few moments. The flame then settled down to a steady height of about 1-1/4 inches, and remained there through first break. As usual, the flame was shielded from Jane's vision during her deliveries.(当我在晚上8:55分点燃我们测验的蜡烛时，火焰一度窜升到将近三英寸；我从来没有看过它这样。它明显的冒了一会烟。后来火焰降回稳定的一又四分之一英寸高，然后持续这个高度到第一次休息。如往常一样，在珍传述的时候，火焰放在她看不到的地方。
(The session was held in our back room. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Before the session she had remarked that she hoped Seth would mention Priestley’s book. Her pace was now average to begin, but quickly speeded up.)(这节课在我们后面的房间举行。珍坐着开始说话，她的眼睛闭着。在课前她提到，希望赛斯能谈谈普莱斯利的书。她的速度一开始适中，后来逐渐加快。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. Our friend Ruburt has finally discovered the works of Dunne, I see, and he has also been reading Priestley on the subject of time.现在。我们的朋友鲁柏终于发现唐尼的作品，而他也在读着普莱斯利关于时间主题的书。
Ruburt has not been reading Dunne, incidentally, but Priestley’s interpretation of Dunne, which is something else again, but fairly accurate.附带一提，鲁柏没有读过唐尼的书，他读的是普莱斯利对唐尼的理解，那是另一个东西，虽然是相当正确的。
I am glad that you did not encounter these ideas earlier, since we cannot therefore be justly accused of having borrowed any of them. Ruburt is amazed at some of the similarities that exist in the concept of time as I am giving it to you, and the concepts held by Dunne and Priestley.我很高兴你们之前没有碰过这样的想法，因此我们不会被指控借由任何这样的观念。鲁柏对于我告诉过你们的、关于时间的概念，和唐尼以及普莱斯利所提出的概念之间存在的相似性十分惊奇。
(Jane was both amazed and delighted. She came across the Priestley book while browsing in the library recently. We have heard of Dunne, of course, but have yet to read any of his works; for some reason the library here has none of his books.(珍既惊异又高兴。当最近在图书馆浏览的时候，她走到普莱斯利的书前。我们当然有听过唐尼，但没有读过任何他的作品；基于某些原因，图书馆里没有他的书。
(Jane now smiled as Seth began to consider the theories of both men. Before the session she had hoped Seth would discuss them. As it developed, the session proved to be an unusual one.)(当赛斯开始思考这两人的理论时，珍正在微笑。在课前，她曾希望赛斯能讨论他们。后来的发展证明了这一节并不是寻常的课。)
Now. Priestley is indeed the priestly fellow, and Dunne is far from done, If you will forgive my jest. Portions of both of their theories are correct.现在。普莱斯利确实是神职人员，但如果你不介意我的玩笑，唐尼却相距甚远。他们两人部分的理论是正确的。
Sometimes one of them is accurate on one point, and the other one completely off, other one completely are both wrong.有时候其中一个在某一点是正确的，而另一个却完全不是，而有时候他们都是错的。
All in all however they came much closer to reality than most; and therefore there is an added dimension in their works. This added dimension is simply a result of their intimacy with other dimensions of time, about which most others remain as ignorant as possible.不过从各方面来说，他们比大部分的人都更靠近实相；因此在他们的作品里有一个添加的面向。当大部分的人还停留在不知不觉的时候，这个添加的面向单纯是他们和时间的其他面向很靠近的结果。
(Janes eyes now opened to some degree as she lit a cigarette. Her eyes now alternated often between opening and closing. Her pace was fast. She had finished the Priestley book just before supper, and said she hadn’t had time to think it over; but someone had been thinking it over.)(现在珍的眼睛在她点烟的时候微微睁开。她的眼睛常常频繁的睁开又闭上。她的速度是快的。她刚在晚饭前读完了普莱斯利的书，说她还没有时间好好的想一想；但有人已经想过了。)
Priestley does not go far enough with his time one, time two and time three, but he is fairly correct up to that point. In a different way he says many of the things that I am saying. I have told you that upon physical death the ego becomes the subconscious in the next existence, and that its conscious knowledge is retained electromagnetically.普莱斯利在他的时间一、时间二，和时间三探讨得不够深，但他在那一点上是相当正确的。他以另一种不同的方式说了很多我在说的东西。我告诉过你们，在肉体死亡的时候，自我在下一个存在状态会变成潜意识，而它有意识的知识仍以电磁的方式保存着。
(Seth began dealing with these ideas in the very early sessions, mixing it in with reincarnational data. He elaborated to some degree in the sessions on the electrical field and related subjects: In Volume 3, see sessions 122-135.)(赛斯在很早期的课里就开始提到这些想法，和转世的资料拼在一起。他在电性场域和相关主题的课里详述了一些：在第三册，见第122至135节。)
Now. Priestley puts it somewhat differently but the results are the same. According to him the consciousness, the individual consciousness of time one, becomes something else at physical death, and the consciousness that is part of time two in physical life becomes dominant in the next existence. There is one large difference here between us however, and I believe an important one. Priestley’s individual, after death, with his dominant time two consciousness, has available to him what was time one during physical life.现在。普莱斯利以某种不同的方式来说，但结果是一样的。据他所说，意识，时间一的个别意识，在肉体死亡后变成了其他的东西，而在物质生命里，部分时间二的意识变成下一个存在的主宰。不过在我们之间有个很大的不同，我想这是很重要的一点。普莱斯利所说的个人在死后，他的主要时间二的意识对他而言就像是时间一在物质生命时是可利用的。
He can use it, use the knowledge obtained therein, learn from its mistakes, and advance. But this individual as seen by Priestley at this particular point is somewhat limited, still, by this time one. Time one is available to him, though not necessarily as a series of moments, one after another. From this he is free, but he is still somewhat bound by those events, though he may learn from them. According to Priestley, while the individual therefore is free from successive moments, he still does not have easily available, at fingertips so to speak, any information or realizations from time three. I am using Priestley’s terms here.他能用它，用在那里得到的知识，从它的错误和发展中学习。但在这特别的一点上，普莱斯利认为个人仍然是多少受限于时间一的。时间一对他是可用的，虽然并不必然是以一个接着一个、一连串的片刻。从这一点，他是自由的，但他多少仍被那些事件所束缚，虽然他可以从它们之中学习。据普莱斯利所说，当个人从连续性的片刻当中释放出来时，他还是不能那么容易的从时间三随手得到任何的资讯或理解。我用的是普莱斯利的字眼。
Time three, after the individuals physical death, becomes for him what time two is for him during this existence. It is therefore available only to the same degree that time two is available to him now.在个人肉体死亡后的时间三，变成了对他而言在这个存在里的时间二。因此他现在能利用时间三多少就像他过去能利用时间二多少一样。
Priestley’s concept here becomes more limiting than he realized. At this point Dunne overtakes him precisely where he and Dunne disagree. For once having hypothesized times one, two and three, Dunne continues onward as is the case, and Priestley simply stops here in this particular respect.在这里，普莱斯利的概念变得比他所以为的更为限制。在这一点，唐尼和他不同，唐尼超越了他。一旦假设了时间一、二和三，就像这个例子，唐尼持续向前，而普莱斯利在这方面就停滞不前。
I suggest a brief break, and we shall continue along these lines, for we are able to go ahead where Priestley and Dunne were not. We are able to do this, or I am able to do this, precisely because I am from beyond Priestleys time one, two and three, and therefore free of the distortions which even he is unable to avoid.我建议一个短暂的休息，然后我们应该继续这些讨论，我们可以继续往前达到普莱斯利和唐尼所未曾达到的。我们将会这么做，或是我将会这么做，因为我恰好来自于超越了普莱斯利的时间一、二和三的所在，因此我可以免于他不可避免的曲解。
In concept, again on this particular point, Dunne went further. But in doing so he ended up in a frenzy, losing sight of where he was. And no wonder. It is simply because I am outside of these times that I can see through them more clearly, and there is no particular reason why I should be considered wiser in this respect than they. I am simply in a better position to observe. If Dunne were able to write another book now, on his time theories, he would be able to correct several of his well-intentioned errors.再次的，在这特别一点上的概念，唐尼是更先进的。但当他这么做之后却是以一个狂乱、迷失了自己所在之处的方式结尾。这并不奇怪。正因为我在这些时间之外，因此我可以更清楚的看穿它，这并不是因为我在这方面比他们更有智慧。我只是单纯地在一个更好的位置去观察。如果唐尼能现在写另一本关于时间理论的书，他就能改正一些他善意的错误。
(Break at 9:26. Jane was dissociated as usual, she said. Her eyes had opened narrowly frequently. She said that consciously, at the moment, she could not explain what she had just said. Her pace had been fast, and my writing hand was aware of this.(9:26休息。珍说她出离如常。她的眼睛常微微睁开。她说当时，她意识上无法解释她刚才所说的。她的速度十分快，而我写字的手很了解这一点。
(The candle flame had not varied since the beginning of the session. It was not warm to the touch except at the edge of the lip, and even here it was only warm.(自从课开始后，蜡烛的火焰就没有变化。除非触碰蜡烛边缘。否则并不会觉得暖，即使是蜡烛边缘也仅只是暖而已。
(Jane's delivery had been quite emphatic, and it remained so when she began speaking again. She resumed at the same fast pace, again smoking and with her eyes closed, at 9:36.)(珍的传述十分有力，当她再次说话时也保持这样。她以一样快的速度在9:36重新开始，再次的，她的眼睛闭着，抽着烟。)
When the individual reaches Priestleys time three, then he is left with little individuality. Priestleys vision of the birds and the life spirit is not too much different from nirvana. At least only in degree, and this simply will not do.当个人达到了普莱斯利的时间三，那么他只剩一点个人性。普莱斯利对这类人和这类生命精神的想像和涅槃没有什么差别。至少只是程度上的不同，而实事根本就不是这样。
It is true that Priestley speaks in terms of consciousness being retained at this stage, but a consciousness devoid of personality is an odd bird indeed. The personality structure changes, it is true, but consciousness of overall identities within any given unit of consciousness is always retained. There is no blending or merging, willy-nilly, into a gigantic ever-rushing-on spirit of life. And the spirit of life in these terms cannot be considered as something apart and separate from, and outside of, those consciousnesses which illuminate it, and through which they are illuminated. And here is our second difficulty with Priestley.当普莱斯利说到，在这个阶段意识是被保留的，这点是真的，但一个意识完全没有人格确实是很奇怪的。人格结构改变了，这是真的，但在意识的任何特定单位里的总体身分意识总是被保留的。而不会不管你的意愿，混合和消融进一个巨大的、不断往前的生命精神体里。而以这种说法的生命精神体，并不能被视为有别于或在那些照亮它的意识之外，而是通过生命精神体，意识被照亮。而这里是我们关于普莱斯利的第二个难题。
It is one thing to conceive of basic time as being outside of physical time, for the sake of making a point; but it must be realized that Priestley's time one, while only real to the ego, is nevertheless a part or a materialization that exists within this basic time framework, and the life force is at the same time within as well as without.为了建立论点去构想基本时间是在物质时间之外是一件事；但必须明白普莱斯利的时间一，只对自我而言是真的，它不过是存在这个基本时间架构的一部分或一个实现，而生命力同时在当中也不在其中。
That is, the life force is constantly renewed by those consciousnesses of which it is formed. The consciousnesses therefore are not simply filled up by a life force which then deserts them to go on its way, for these consciousnesses are themselves portions of the life force, and form its shape, if you will, and continuing existence.那表示，生命力是持续由形成它的那些意识不断更新的。因此意识不是仅仅被生命力所充满，而生命力为了走它的路又把意识丢弃；这些意识是生命力的一部分，形成自己的样子，然后持续存在。
(Seth gave his first lengthy dissertation on the above theme in the 12th session, of January 2,1964. He places the subject under the general term of fifth dimension. He spoke on the idea for several typewritten pages; this was his longest delivery by a wide margin at the time, and Jane and I were quite surprised. See Volume 1.)(赛斯在1964年1月2日第12节，针对上面的主题给了一篇长篇论文。他把这个主题放在第五空间的广泛领域里。他讲这个概念讲了好几页；这是关于时间的宽广距离，他讲的最长口述，珍和我都很惊讶。)
The flame feeds the fire and the fire feeds the flame. Therefore, while this time one of continuous moments is no longer experienced after death, it is still a reality within basic time itself, a reality toward which the personality simply is no longer focused. Because the individual is focused within time one now, you still realize, or should, that the time one is only a small portion of time, and that other kinds of time exist of which you are not aware.火焰增强了火势，而火势也会增强了火焰。因此，当死后不再经验这个连续片刻的时间一时，它仍旧是基本时间本身的一个实相，一个人格已经不再关注的实相。因此个人现在关注着时间一，你要了解或应该了解，时间一仅只是时间的一小部分，而有其他你并不觉察的时间种类。
But when you leave time one behind, or because you leave time one behind at death, this is no reason to imagine that time one exists separate and apart from basic time. The same sort of error here exists concerning the life force, as I mentioned. You are merged with the life force now, and no one can deny that you are individualistic.但当你离开了时间一，或因为死亡你离开了时间一，就不用去想像时间一不同于基本时间的存在。像我之前提到的，关于生命力也有同类的错误存在。你现在和生命力是融合的，没有人能否认你的个人性。
(Jane's eyes began to open at times now. Her delivery was fast and emphatic. The candle flame remained the same.)(珍的眼睛现在有时候会睁开。她的口述快且有力。蜡烛火焰停留在同样的高度。)
It is a mistake to assume that any future or inevitable merging with a life force is ahead of you, in those terms. This is an error that is precisely due to that which Priestley himself abhors: distortions in thought caused by reliance upon the concept of time as a series of moments.以另一种说法，去假设任何未来或不可避免的生命力融合在你之前，是错误的。这刚好是普莱斯利本身所厌恶的一个错误。想法的扭曲是由于相信时间是一连串的片刻这个概念。
Priestley cannot help himself here, for it is not possible entirely for him to escape from his own time system, with the best of intentions. And in many respects his theories come very close to explaining the way things are. The idea of reoccurring time is simply off base, practically speaking.普莱斯利在这里是无能为力的，即使有着最好的意图，但他完全不可能跳脱他自己的时间系统。但在很多方面，他的理论已经非常接近的解释了事物本质。实际上来说，时间再生的这个想法是个单纯的错误。
(Jane now took a long pause.)(珍现在有一个长的停顿。)
There are two particular points that I want to make this evening, if at all possible.如果可能的话，今晚我想提两个特别的重点。
One concerns myself and where I would stand in this time framework, and you should find this highly interesting. The other has to do with Dunne, for in one instance he saw further than Priestley, for he carried these times further. But he also fell into an understandable error. For at some point the separate selves of Dunne’s, with their separate times, become aware of each other, and merge into the sort of superconsciousness that we have always called the entity.一个涉及了我自己和我所在的这个时间架构，你们应该会觉得这个非常有趣。另一个和唐尼有关，有一点他比普莱斯利超前，他把这些时间更往前一步。但他也陷入了一个可以理解的错误。在同一点，唐尼分别的自己们和他们分别的时间，变得觉察彼此，而融合进我们现在称作存有的这种超意识。
These times do not go on indefinitely in the precise manner that Dunne thought. Neither do they stop as Priestley believes, at time three. There is a merging of selves into what you may call a superconsciousness, a synthesis; and from then on, dear friends, there is a beginning toward something new, and a something of which I am not prepared to speak this evening, but of which I shall speak in the near future.这种时间并不像唐尼认为的，以一种明确的方式无限期地持续下去。它们也不像普莱斯利所相信的，会停滞在时间三。有一个自己们的融合，进入你们可能称作是超意识或集合体里；从那里开始，我亲爱的朋友，就是一个新事物的开始，而这是我今晚还不打算说的，但我在不久的将来会说。
I suggest a break.我建议休息。
(Break at 10:00. Jane said she was well dissociated. Her eyes had remained closed for the most part. She had appeared to be wrapped up in the material, speaking rapidly and with much emphasis. The candle flame remained unchanged, burning steadily at an estimated height of 1/4 inches.(10:00休息。珍说她的出离状态很好。她的眼睛大部分时间是闭着。她似乎完全沉醉在资料里，说得很快，强调了很多地方。蜡烛火焰仍然维持不变，稳定的在大约一又四分之一英寸的高度燃烧着。
(We would think in the last paragraph of his delivery above, Seth hinted at the psychic gestalts of which he has spoken very briefly at various times. We gather that he visualizes a chain of such gestalts, with each link one of greater complexity. He has called them “great building blocks of energy.”(我们会想想他在上面口述的最后一段。赛斯暗示了一个心灵完形，他在不同时间曾短暂提到过。我们收集着他构思的一连串这样的完形，每个都与更大的错综复杂相连。他称它们为“能量的伟大建筑石块”。
(It was now time for the 26th Dr. Instream test. As usual Jane spoke while sitting down, with her head tipped down and her hands raised to her closed eyes. Her pace now slowed somewhat, and her voice was quiet. Resume at 10:06.)(现在是时间开始第26次殷斯翠姆博士测试。一如往常，珍坐着说话，头低着，手举起来放在闭着的眼睛上。她的速度现在稍微慢了一点，声音轻柔。10:06重新开始。)
Now give us a moment please, for our Instream material.现在，为了我们的殷斯翠姆博士资料，请等我们一下。
(Pause.) A fond farewell of some sort this evening. Is someone going on a trip?(停顿)今晚有某种深情的告别。有人要去旅行吗？
Important papers in a briefcase. An upsurge of interest in the doctors hypnosis experiments. (Pause.) Something now turned up, on a desk or table. I believe, again, a piece of paper with a format like a letter.公文包里有重要的文件。对博士的催眠试验有急剧上升的兴趣。(停顿)现在某个东西在书桌或餐桌上出现。我想是一张有格式的纸，像是一封信。
I pick up the initials R. B.. The letter concerns a particular event, a meeting which has not yet occurred, and it concerns another person also, beside the person who wrote the letter, and beside Dr. Instream. That is, another person in particular, though more may be involved in the event when it occurs. (Pause.)我收到缩写R.B.。这封信和一件特别的事件有关，一个还未发生的聚会，除了写信的人和殷斯翠姆博士，它也和另一个人有关。那另一个人可能更牵涉进那即将发生的事件。(停顿)
It may take place in March.它可能发生在3月。
The letter is from someone in the south or southwest. Or the other person who will be connected with the meeting resides in the south or southwest. (Pause.)这封信可能来自某个在南方或西南方的人。或另一个将和聚会有关联的人是住在南方或西南方。(停顿)
I pick up a rather disconnected or disjointed impression concerning an elephant, or perhaps this is a trunk. I do not know to what it refers. (Pause.) Unless it has to do perhaps with the farewell earlier mentioned.我收到一个相当不连贯或是无关的印象，和一只大象或一个象鼻有关。我不知道它指的是什么。(停顿)除非它和之前提到的告别有关。
Do you have a test for me?你还有测验要给我吗？
(“Yes.”.(“是的。”
(It was 10:15. Jane took the usual double envelope from me without opening her eyes. Reading over the last session, she had been surprised to learn that she had held the test envelope to her forehead for a few minutes, since she didn’t remember doing this. Now, she once again pressed the test envelope to her forehead, this time more deliberately, and with both hands. She continued to hold it there. Her eyes were closed, her voice very quiet. This is the 23rd envelope test.)(现在是10:15。珍闭着眼睛从我手里接过信封。读完上一节后，她相当惊讶的发现，她曾把信封放在她前额几分钟，因为她不记得她有这么做过。现在她再次把信封压在她的前额，这一次更小心翼翼，而且是用两只手。她持续地把手放在那里。她的眼睛闭着，声音轻柔。这是第23次信封测试。)
Now, give me a moment and we shall see what we can do.现在，等一下，看看我们能做什么。
A framework. Two people. An assortment of objects or shapes.一个框架。两个人。各种各类的物件和形状。
A connection that I do not see clearly, with a missionary. A note. The mention of a time.和一个传教士有个我看不清楚的连结。一张短笺。提到一个时间。
Ruburt here is thinking of your monk. Because of my mention of the word missionary, this started a train of his personal associations.鲁柏在这里想到你们的修道士。因为我提到传教士这个词，这开始一连串他个人的联想。
Now. Something square, as a plot. A connection with four other people, and a road, or road shape. Unusual shadows. A cake. Something that two people know, and two other people do not know.现在。某种正方形的东西，像一块地。与其他4个人，还有一条路或路的形状有关。不寻常的阴影。一块蛋糕。某两个人知道、但其他两个人不知道的东西。
Paper with printing. Your handwriting. A connection with an address that is not your own. Something to which no reply is expected, and a connection with an animal.有印刷字体的纸。你的笔迹。和一个地址有关联，但不是你的地址。某件不预期会有回复的事，和一个动物有关联。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:23. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed for both tests. She sat with the test envelope pressed to her forehead the whole time. The candle flame burned at the same steady height.(10:23休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛在两个测验里都闭着。她坐着，所有的时间都把信封压在她的前额上。蜡烛的火焰在同样稳定的高度燃烧着。
(Seth did not elaborate on the test envelope impressions, so what follows are our own interpretations. For his own part, Seth was too eager to get on with his discussion of Priestley’s book, it developed.(赛斯没有详述信封测验的印象，所以下面是我们自己的解读。事情会发展至此，是因为赛斯太急着继续讨论普莱斯利的书。
(See the tracing of the test object on page 140. It is of the front of an envelope addressed to Jane and me by my mother on December 1. The letter contained in this envelope figures in the test results, and will be kept on file with the envelope. The letter would be quoted here except that the contents are rather personal. It is of course available however to anyone seriously considering these tests, should they be that interested.(请见上面物件的素描。它是一封寄给我和珍的信封正面，是我妈妈在12月1日寄的。在测验结果里出现过的信封内容，会放进属于信封测验的档案里。在这里会引述这封信——除了太过私人的内容。不过任何认真关注这些测验，或对它们有兴趣的人都可以阅读。
(“A framework" refers to the clear-cut single-line frame that borders Washington’s portrait on the current five-cent stamp. The envelope is addressed to “two people, ” meaning Jane and me. The “assortment of objects and shapes” refers to the words making up the letter.(“一个框架”指的是清楚、单线，在现在5分美元华盛顿肖像邮票上的边框。这封信是寄给“两个人”，指的是珍和我。“各种各类的物件和形状”指的是组成信件的文字。
(Seth’s unclear connection with “a missionary” is interesting. My brother Loren is mentioned in the letter contained within the test envelope, and his father-in-law is a retired minister. The letter of course can be “A note”.(赛斯和“一个传教士”的不清楚连结很有趣。在测验信封里的信里有提到我弟弟洛伦，他的岳父是个退休的传教士。当然这封信可以是“一张短笺”。
(“The mention of a time” is easily accounted for in the same letter. In it my mother discusses the visit Jane and I were due to make to my parents on Sunday, December 5th. The date was not mentioned, just the word Sunday. My mother then canceled this visit of ours by telephone, and Jane and I then journeyed to visit my parents in Sayre, PA, on the following Sunday, December 12. It was on this visit that I obtained the test object used in the last session, the 217th.(“提到一个时间”在这封信里很容易理解。在信里，我妈妈讨论到珍和我预定12月5日去拜访他们的事。没有提到日期，只提到星期天这个字。后来我母亲打电话取消了我们的这次拜访，珍和我才在12月12日、下一个星期天去宾州塞尔看望他们。也是这次拜访，我才拿到了用在上一节第217节的测验物件。
(The monk mentioned by Seth refers to our friend Father Martin, who is mentioned in the 212th session. Apropos of this, Jane now said she remembered that Seth’s use of the word missionary did set up her own chain of association involving Father Martin. She said Seth put her back on the right track by mentioning this.(赛斯提到的修道士，指的是我们的朋友马丁神父，在第212节课里有提过他。关于这点，珍现在说，她记得当赛斯用修道士这个字眼时，的确引起了她自己有关马丁神父的一连串联想。她说赛斯提到这点把她导回正确的路上。
(Jane said she was sure “Something square" referred to the dimensions of the test envelope when it was folded, although it does not measure out as a perfect square. The “connection with four other people" works out well, since the letter concerns a situation involving both my parents, my brother Loren and my brother Bill, other than Jane and me.(珍说她很确定“某个正方形的东西”指的是测验信封折起来的大小，虽然测量起来并不是正四方形。“和其他4个人有关”说得很好，因为信里提到的情况除了珍和我以外，涉及了我的父母、我弟弟洛伦和比尔。
(“Road, or road shape, "and “Unusual shadows” are too general. There may be a vague connection with “A cake, ” but it would be several times removed from the test object. We did not have cake for dessert at the family gathering on December 12 for instance.(“路或路的样子”和“不寻常的阴影”太笼统了。可能和“一个蛋糕”有模糊的关联，但跟这个物件没什么关系。比如12月12日的家庭聚会上，我们饭后甜点并没有吃蛋糕。
(“Something that two people know, and two other people do not know, " is good, since my mother’s letter specifically concerned such a situation. Jane and I were the two who did know, and my parents were the two others who did not know. This matter was straightened out on December 12.(“某个两个人知道、但其他两个人不知道的东西”说得很正确，因为我母亲的信里特别关心了某种情况。珍和我是两个知道的人，而我父母是另外两个不知道的人。这件事在12月12日解决了。
(The test object is “Paper with printing, ” the printing being the machine-applied cancellation, in my opinion, rather than my mothers handwriting. “Your handwriting” meaning mine, does not apply.(测验物件是“有印刷字体的纸”，印刷的字是用机器印的注销，而不是我母亲的手写。“你的笔迹”指的是我的笔迹，但不适用。
(Jane said she was confused while giving the data “A connection with an address that is not your own”. She wasn’t sure Seth meant an address that was ours, or was not ours, so she tried to relax and let it come through without distortion. And of course the letter came to us from an address not our own. “Something to which no reply is expected, " is also good, in that we were due to see my parents within a few days after my mother wrote to us.(珍说当给“和一个地址有关联，但不是你的地址”这个资料时，她很困惑。她不确定赛斯指的是我们的地址或不是我们的地址，所以她试着放松，让资料没有扭曲的透过来。当然这封信是从不是我们地址的地方寄来的。“某件不预期会有回复的事”说得也很对，因为在我母亲写信给我们的几天后，我们就要见到我父母了。
(Jane said “a connection with an animal" is also valid, in that while she went for a walk during our December 12 visit to the family gathering in Sayre, she saw a dog, possibly a stray, that aroused in her a strong desire to own a dog. She still misses our dog Mischa, who died three years ago. So do I.(珍说“和一个动物有关联”也是正确的，在12月12日我们去塞尔参加家庭聚会时她出去散步，在一条小路上她看到一只狗，它可能走失了，这唤起了她想要拥有一只狗的强烈欲望。她仍然很想念我们的狗米夏，它3年前死了。我也很想它。
(Jane began speaking in a most emphatic and enthusiastic manner. Her eyes were closed but she was smoking; her eyes soon opened however. The candle flame remained at its steady 1/4 inch height. Resume at 10:37.)(珍以一种最有力和热烈的方式开始说话。她的眼睛闭着，但她在抽烟；不过她的眼睛很快的睁开来。蜡烛火焰仍然稳定的停在一又四分之一的高度。10:37重新开始。)
Now. Since you have a vacation coming up, I want to make certain that I cover one point in particular.现在。因为你的假期即将到来，我想确定我特别涵盖了这一点。
(Jane now smiled broadly.)(珍现在正开心地笑。)
For Ruburt has a grand idea. A great glimmering of enlightenment has hit him. I hope it did not hurt him; because while his idea is not right in one way, it is not wrong.鲁柏有一个很好的主题。很棒的灵感闪过他的脑袋。我希望这样说不会伤到他；因为一方面来说，他的想法不是对的，但也不是错的。
Having read Priestley’s ideas about Dunne, Ruburt now wonders if I am not a future self of his own, according to Dunne’s ideas; that is, if I am not one of those future selves of which Dunne speaks, or if I am not consciousness number two, or three even, of Priestley’s concept.读了普莱斯利对于唐尼的想法，鲁柏现在想知道，根据唐尼的想法，我是否不是他未来的自己；如果我不是唐尼所说的那些未来自己们，或我不是普莱斯利概念里的第二意识，或甚至第三意识。
Now. Such thoughts are excellent mental exercise for him, and while he is not precisely correct in either of these suppositions, in a basic manner I cannot say that he is precisely wrong.现在。这样的想法对他是很好的心智练习，当他的这两个假设不是完全正确的时候，以一种基本的方式，我也不能说他是完全错误的。
Long before he read any notions such as these. I told you that I spoke through the third undifferentiated level of the subconscious, did I not?早在他读这类观念之前。我就告诉过你们，我是透过未分化的第三层潜意识对你们说话，不是吗?
(“Yes.”(“是的。”
(Jane was again smiling. Seth devoted the 88th session of September 16,1964, to explaining what he meant by this. He had mentioned it before at various times without elaboration. He also dwelled on the subject to some extent in the 152nd session, the 157th, and others. Again, reincarnation is involved in a basic way.)(珍再次笑了。赛斯在1964年9月16日第88节，就努力地解释过他所说的这个意思。他没有详细说明，但他曾在不同的时间里提过。他也详细讨论这个主题到某个程度，在第152节、157节和其他节。再次的，以一种基本的方式，转世和这有关。)
Now. While Dunne and Priestley and myself used different terms often to express the same concept, we also differ in many respects as far as these theories are concerned. My third undifferentiated layer, you see, would correspond to the consciousness of Priestley's third time, which is why I can tell you that at that point individuality is indeed maintained, and personality continues.现在。当唐尼和普莱斯利，还有我自己常常用不同的字眼来表达同样的概念，在这些理论的很多方面我们也不同。你知道的，我的未分化第三层相当于普莱斯利的第三时间意识。这是为什么我告诉你在那一点上，个人性确实会被保留，而人格持续着。
Otherwise I should be all life force and no self. Now, I communicate through this level of Ruburt’s consciousness. It is subconscious to him or to his ego, but it is not without consciousness by any means. And again, I communicate through that level. At my own level this is not in itself difficult.否则我应该全部是生命力而没有自己。现在我透过鲁柏意识的这个层面来传达。对他或他的自我来说，它是潜意识，但它绝不是没有意识。再次的，我透过那个层面传达。在我的层面，这本身并不困难。
The difficulty lies in making this communication, which is direct from me, to what would be Ruburt’s time three self, clear to the time one self of Ruburt's, which must speak these words, in what could be called Priestley’s time one.困难点在于要做这个沟通，是从我这里直接到所谓鲁柏的时间三自己，再很清晰地到鲁柏的时间一自己，就是如此，也就是所谓普莱斯利的时间一。
Communications such as these, incidentally, can be explained quite adequately within Priestleys system. Very nicely indeed. Not thoroughly but nicely. Completely, if you do not ask too many tricky questions.顺带一提，这种类似的沟通十分适合用普莱斯利的系统来解释。确实非常巧妙。不是能完全的解释，但能蛮巧妙的解释。如果你们不问太多棘手问题的话。
Priestley's theories, although he would not use them in this way, could be used to give some insight along these directions. But because Priestley stopped with time three, you would have to pick up Dunnes, until Dunne himself finally goes wrong.普莱斯利的理论可以用来了解这些方向，虽然他自己并没有这么用。但因为普莱斯利停在时间三，你可以接着用唐尼的理论，直到最后他走错了路之前。
Now I would be number six self, so to speak, according to Dunne. According to Priestley however, at this point in his theory, I would simply be that life force, or part of it, with no individuality. Priestley is more correct in depth however, though Dunne goes further, only to peter out. Nevertheless I would be a number six self. Using the same terms, however, I will make some distinctions. For as a number six self I have complete knowledge of all the other selves.现在，根据唐尼，可以说我是第六号自己。不过根据普莱斯利的理论，我就单纯是生命力，或部分的生命力，没有个人性。无论如何，普莱斯利在深度上更加正确，虽然唐尼走得比较远，只是渐渐枯竭。尽管如此，我是一个第六号自己。不过，用同样的字眼，我要做一些区隔。作为第六号自己，我有着所有其他自己全部的知识。
Now I could indeed be Ruburt’s number six self, you see. I am not, but I could be. It is entirely possible however, using Ruburt as an example, for Ruburts number six self, to communicate with Ruburts number one self; these communications sifting through the intervening selves however, and unfortunately. Now these various times of Priestley’s and Dunnes have much in common with the planes of which I am speaking in our discussions, and the value fulfillment of our material is akin to Priestley’s insistence on depth within any given moment.你看，现在我可能确实是鲁柏的第六号自己。我不是，但我可以是。不过，以鲁柏当例子，鲁柏的第六号自己是完全可能和鲁柏的第一号自己沟通的；不过不幸的，这种沟通透过了介于中间的自己们的审查。现在这些普莱斯利和唐尼所说的不同时间，和我们的讨论中我所说的程度有许多地方相同，而我们资料里的价值完成和普莱斯利在任何时刻对深度的坚持是同性质的。
I go into particulars however concerning how this depth is achieved, as you know, if you recall a diagram that I outlined for you concerning moment points in the past.我对这个深度是如何达成的特别感兴趣，如你们所知，如果你们记得过去我画给你们有关片刻点的图表。
("Yes.”(“是的。”
(Jane had looked at me for confirmation. See the 149. 152nd sessions. Jane made the drawing referred to by Seth immediately after the 149th session. I have always intended to work up a finished drawing on the idea.)(珍为了确定看了我一眼。见第149至152节。珍在第149节课之后立即在赛斯的指示下画了一张图，我总是试图想在这个想法上画一张完整的草图。)
Now. While I am not Ruburts number six self, and I should know, this is not to say that I may not be Ruburts number eight or nine self.现在。虽然我不是鲁柏的第六号自己，我应该知道这并不是说我不能是鲁柏的第八或九号自己。
At this point I am at the level, again, that could be compared to Dunne’s number six self, as myself. I communicate through the third undifferentiated layer, that could be compared to Priestleys consciousness at number three time.再说一次，在这一点上，我自己所在的层面可以比作唐尼的第六号自己。我透过未分化的第三层传达，那可以比作普莱斯利第三号时间的意识。
I repeat myself because I want to make the points plain, and this material is difficult. But things simply do not happen as Dunne supposed they did. He was correct in carrying his times further than Priestley, but he was incorrect in assuming the serialization continued indefinitely along the same lines.我重复说着是因为我想把这点说清楚，而这个资料是困难的。但事情并不简单的像唐尼所假设的那样发生。在把他的时间带得比普莱斯利更远这点上，他是对的。他的不对在于，他假设沿着相同的路线是无限持续的连载。
His observations were not complete enough, for there are changes occurring now that he did not perceive. Therefore he did not project them into these other times. The becoming self grows more and more aware of its own portions, and of these various aspects of time in which these portions are or will be focused.他的观察并不完整，因为他没有感知到现在发生的改变。因此他没有投射它们到这些其他的时间。这个逐渐变为的自己越来越深知到他自己的部分，而在时间的不同面向上，这些部分会或将会被注意到。
I do not believe that Dunne understood this. There is no serialization as he imagined, after a certain point, simply because this progression of selves through various times in a serial fashion is no longer necessary. The selves reach a point which is not a theoretical point, but a particular mathematically existent point, whereby these times and selves simply become one, or in our terms, an entity. I must stress that individuality is never lost. But this is too complicated a subject to cover this evening. We have explained it rather adequately in terms of action however, and gestalts of selves do not imply a giving-up of individuality at all. It should be remembered here that reincarnation is simply a fact, and one which is not accepted by Priestley or Dunne.我不认为唐尼了解这个。在某一点过后，并没有他想像中的连载，单纯是因为透过一连串不同时间的自己们的这种发展不再是必要的。自己们会达到一个点，那不是一个理论上的点，而是一个特别的数学上存在的点，借此，这些时间和自己们简单地变成了一个——用我们的字眼——存有。
Reincarnation, considered in this light however, is much more logical indeed than a reoccurring time. And incidentally it is also much more logically a part of these theories, although both Priestley and Dunne would be unable I believe to admit this.我必须强调，个人性是永远不会失去的。但这个主题太复杂，今晚无法涵盖。不过我们在谈到行动的时候曾经解释过，自己们的完形并不暗含着放弃个人性。这里要记得，转世是一个简单的事实，但它却不被普莱斯利或唐尼所接受。
Now. At some point you, Joseph, and Ruburt and myself, are part of the same entity. This entity is that synthesization that Dunne did not foresee, but it in no way implies a loss of individual identities. This is extremely difficult to explain, since when I use the word individual identity, I am not referring primarily to egotistical identity alone. As a matter of fact, I am in one way, and in one way only, a future self—this is extremely simplified—of Ruburts; that could be compared I suppose to a theoretical number twelve self, according to Dunne.不过，以这个角度来考虑转世，远比时间再生的观念要有逻辑多了。顺带一提，它也比这些理论的其中一部分要有逻辑多了，虽然我认为普莱斯利和唐尼两个人无法承认这一点。
But we three are all part of another entity, or rather of an entity that exists at that point where Dunnes serialization breaks down and a new synthesis takes place.现在。在某一点上，约瑟你和鲁柏和我自己是同一个存有的部分。这个存有是唐尼没有看到的合成体，但它并不是指个人身分的丧失。这非常难解释，当我用了个人身分这个字，主要并不是单独指自我的身分。事实上，以某方面来说，我是鲁柏的一个未来自己——这是极度简化的说法；我想根据唐尼，这可以比作一个理论上的12号自己。
