Now. In that respect I am closer to Ruburt than I am to you. However I have been connected with both of you in the past, and this is something for another night. And at that point of synthesization we will be part of the same entity.但我们3个都是另一个存有的一部分，或更确切地说，是存在于唐尼的连载崩溃和新的合成发生那一点的存有。
This is all for the sake of simplicity—现在。就那一点而言我和鲁柏比和你亲近。不过，我和你们两个在过去都有关联，这可以另外找个晚上再说了。在合成的那一点，我们都是同一个存有的一部分。
(Here Jane laughed.)这些全部都是简单化的说法——(珍在这里笑了)
—believe it or not. For we are actually, you see, part of the same entity now. Therefore, if you will bear with me, you represent one of the selves through which I must travel in order to communicate. Is this clear?——不管你相信不相信。我们现在确实是同一个存有的一部分。因此，如果你们对我有耐心，你们代表了为了沟通、我必须旅行过的自己们的其中一个。这样清楚吗?
(“Yes.”(“是的。”
(Jane, still smiling, stared at me. Her wide-open eyes were very dark.)(珍仍然笑着盯着我看。她睁大的眼睛十分深邃。)
Would you like a break?你们要休息吗？
(“Yes.”(“是的。”
(Break at 11:22. Jane now said she had been very well dissociated during the last delivery. She had a vague memory of her eyes opening at times. She had smoked a lot, and her voice was getting dry. Her delivery had been fast and emphatic.(11:22分休息，珍现在说，在最后一段她的出离状态非常好。她有一个模糊的记忆，眼睛有时会睁开。她抽了很多烟，声音变得比较干涩。她的口述又快又有力。
(Except for an occasional mild spurt, the candle flame had remained at its same level.(除了偶尔轻微的冒出火苗外，蜡烛火焰仍然停留在同样的高度。
(Seth began explaining his source and the source of this material in the very early sessions. In the 15th session for example he likened his state to the dream state of a physical individual. By the 24th session he was dealing with the problems involved in communicating with us. By the 63rd session he was explaining his state as energy not materialized into mass; this after telling us in the 54th session that Jane, Seth and I had been part of the same entity once; he could not tell us this earlier, he said, because Jane and I would have immediately jumped to the conclusion that he was part of Jane's subconscious mind.(赛斯在很早期的课里就开始解释他的来源和这些资料的来源。例如第15节，他把他的状态比作一个肉体个人的梦的状态。在第24节，他解释了和我们沟通会涉及的问题。在第63节，他解释他的状态是没有转化为质量的能量；在第54节他曾告诉我们，珍、赛斯和我是同一个存有的一部分；他说，他无法更早的告诉我们这一点，是因为珍和我会很快地跳到一个结论，就是他是珍潜意识心智的一部分。
(In the 45th session Seth said a little to the effect that I assisted her in drawing upon the energy necessary for these communications. In the 88th and 152nd sessions Seth went into Jane's third undifferentiated layer to some extent, then elaborated a little more on the relationship between us in the 157th session.(在第45节，赛斯说的意思差不多是这样，在这些沟通中，我帮助她带出了必要的能量。在第88节和152节，赛斯提到一些珍的未分化的第三层，然后在第157节更详细的描述了我们之间的关系。
(Jane's delivery remained fast and emphatic. Her eyes were open and she was smoking when she resumed at 11:25.)(珍的口述仍然快又有力。当她在11:25重新开始的时候，她的眼睛睁开，抽着烟。)
Now. I will not keep you longer, though it grieves me to stop here.现在。我不会再耽误你们太久，虽然停在这里让我有点难过。
It is because of the peculiar connection of selves that our communications are possible. It is for the same reason that such communications are relatively rare, for many conditions and circumstances are necessary; and the number one self is made to bear strains unfamiliar to it, and to perceive data which does not make sense within its number one time system.因为自己们之间的特殊连结，我们的沟通才变得可能。也是由于同一个原因让这样的沟通相对来说很少，因为很多状况和条件都是必须的；而一号自己必须去忍受不熟悉的张力，和了解在一号的时间系统里说不通的资料。
Because of this I have always leaned on the side of caution. But these strains, and this data, to some extent lift the number one self from the limitations of the number one time, and lends an advancement ordinarily not possible. For the number one time has changed for both of you since our sessions began, and it no longer seems the prison that it did earlier.因为这个原因，我总是比较小心。但这种张力，和这样的资料，某种程度解除了一号自己在一号时间里的限制，而提供了一个正常来说不可能的发展。自从我们的课开始后，对你们两个来说，一号时间就已经改变了，它似乎不再是之前的那个牢笼。
The number one time cannot contain other times but the consciousness, with help, can to some extent perceive these other times. And this perception then allows consciousness to escape some of the confinements of that one time. Our spacious present of which I have spoken contains all times, but it is not a thing apart from them, nor precisely their sum. It is ever unfolding and mobile, and changing itself.一号时间不能包含其他的时间，但透过帮助，意识可以某程度察觉到这些其他的时间。而这个感知后来允许了意识逃过时间一的某些禁锢。我说过的，我们广阔的现在包含了所有时间，但它不是一个有别于它们的东西，也不完全是它们的总和，本身始终是展开的、流动的和改变的。
I am sorry. I forgot your writing hand, which I suppose is somewhat wilted.我很抱歉。我忘了你在写字的手，我想它们现在有点酸。
("Yes.”(“是的。”
(In the 44th session, Seth began a list of qualities and attributes which are included in the spacious present. To date there are eleven of these: Value climate of psychological reality; energy transformation; spontaneity; durability; creation; consciousness; capacity for infinite mobility; law of infinite changeability and transmutation; cooperation; arrival and departure, meaning physical birth and death; and quality depth, the perspective in which an idea can expand, replacing our time and space.)(在第44节，赛斯开始列了一张广阔的现在所包含的特质和属性。总共有11项：心理实相的值气候；能量转化；自发性；耐久性；创造；意识；无限移动的能力；无限变化和变形的法则；合作；抵达与离开，意指肉体的出生与死亡；还有品质深度，一个概念可以扩张、取代我们时间和空间的观点。)
Therefore I will regretfully end our discussion for this evening. I believe it is apparent in our own tests, incidentally, that some preciseness is beginning to show through, for in the general associations connected with the object, identifying points concerning the specific object now appear.所以很遗憾地，我要结束我们今晚的讨论了。
I will be with you during your holidays, even if I am not your idea of the popular Santa Claus.顺道一提，我想在我们自己的测验里，很明显的一些准确度开始显现，在和物件有关的广泛联想上，辨认出关于现在出现的特定物件中的要点。
(“Good night, Seth.”在你们的假期里我会和你们在一起，即使我不是你们理想中那个受欢迎的圣诞老人。
(End at 11:35. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had opened at times. The candle flame had shown no noticeable change of importance during the session; Jane said she had not been aware of the flame one way or another all evening. My writing hand was tired. Before the session Jane had been tired; she now felt fine. She said Seth could have continued all night.)(“晚安，赛斯。”
#NAME?(11:35结束。珍出离如常。她的眼睛有时候是睁开的。蜡烛火焰在课中间没有什么大的变化；珍说她整晚都没有注意到火焰。我写字的手酸了。在上课之前珍就很累；她现在感觉比较好。她说赛斯可以整晚继续下去。)
(While Bill and Peggy Gallagher were on vacation in Puerto Rico last October, Seth gave impressions concerning them in the following sessions: the 199th for October 18; the 200th for October 20; and the 201st for October 25. No correspondence, phone calls, etc., were exchanged between the four of us during this time.(当比尔和蓓·加拉格10月在波多黎各度假的时候，赛斯在以下几节给了关于他们的印象：10月18日的第199节；10月20日的第200节；以及10月25日的第201节。我们4个在这段期间没有书信、电话往来等等。
(The Gallaghers went over Seth’s material with us orally a day or two after returning from vacation; this was on the evening of the unscheduled session for Thursday, October 28, and I had time for but a few quick written notes. We obtained this written account from them later, and in the course of checking data with them several times Jane and I soon realized much effort could be saved by getting a written account as soon as possible after any such experiment.(加拉格夫妇在假期回来的一两天后，就和我们一起口头讨论过赛斯的资料，这是在10月28日星期四晚上的临时课，我只有时间做一点快速的笔记。我们后来从他们那里拿到这个手写的记录，在和他们几次查核资料的期间，珍和我很快的了解到，在任何这类的实验后，尽快地拿到手写报告会省下很多力气。
(Thus Jane and I followed this procedure concerning the data Seth gave on Peggy’s business trip to Washington, DC in December. A written question-and-answer period was held with Peggy a day or two after her return. Peggy cooperated wholeheartedly and gave much information. I stressed that we did not want to put words into her mouth concerning Seth’s data, and she agreed that we did not.(因此在12月赛斯给了关于蓓到华盛顿首府出差的资料后，珍和我遵循了这个流程。在蓓回来的一两天后，我们写了一张问与答的问卷。蓓全力配合，并给了很多的讯息。我要强调我们并没有强迫她帮赛斯的资料说话，她也认同我们并没有这么做。
(Seth’s statements are presented in full from each session, with the comments from Peggy and Bill just below each statement in italic type. The Gallaghers agreed on each answer, concerning the Puerto Rico material. They arrived in San Juan, Puerto Rico, on Sunday, October 17. We begin with Seth’s material on them from the 199th session for October 18,1965, at 9 PM.)(每一节里赛斯的陈述会完整呈现，在每一条下面会用华文楷体字来写下蓓和比尔的评论。加拉格夫妇确认了关于波多黎各资料的每一个答案。他们在10月17日星期日抵达了波多黎各的圣乔安[San Juan]。我们开始在赛斯资料里谈他们，是在1965年10月18日晚上9点的第199节。)
A large white or pastel building, they had something to do with today. Flowers here.一栋白色或浅色的大型建筑物，这和他们今天要做的事有关。有花在这里。
(“Our hotel was white. There were many different colored flowers along the road near our hotel. ’’)(“我们的旅馆是白色的。靠近旅馆的路边有很多不同颜色的花。”)
Iron grillwork. Hacienda... Lucinda (phonetically.铁制的花格图案……哈希达(发音)。
(“No to both. ’’)(“两个都没有。”)
They passed here. Bars at the windows of iron, not in jail.他们经过这里。窗户上有铁栏杆，但不是监狱。
(“Yes. Most open windows barred, in Spanish tradition. ")(“是的，根据西班牙的传统，大部分的窗户都有栏杆。”)
Newspapers sold in front, outside.外边前面有卖报纸。
(“No, but newspapers sold at hotel desk. ")(“没有，但在旅馆柜台有卖报纸。”)
Later at another end of this same city, they pass shacks.等会在同一个城市的另一端，他们穿过棚屋。
(“Yes.')(“是的。”)
This is at the northwest portion.这是在西北部。
(“Generally, north or northeast.”)(“通常来说，是北或东北方向。”)
A street. Saint Severin (phonetically.一条街。圣赛维任。(Saint Severin根据发音)
(“No.”)(“没有。”)
A rather high pile of dark dirt.一堆很高的深色的土。
(“No. ')(“没有”)
They stay at a pink stucco building.他们停留在一幢粉红色刷的建筑物里。
(“The building had a rough cement finish, but was not pink.”)(“这栋建筑有很粗糙的水泥墙，但不是粉红色的。”)
With porch enclosures that are round. The base is not round. The portion between the... what would be the porch railing and the roof is round. They bicycled.前面围绕的门廊是圆形的。基座不是圆的。中间的部分……在阳台栏杆和屋顶部分是圆的。他们之前骑过车。
(“No.")(“没有。”)
Perhaps in their room there is a rather elaborate l amp, on a table, that depicts a scene, that glows when it is lit.在他们房间的桌上也许有一盏相当精巧的桌灯，桌灯上有画，当点亮的时候会显现出来。
(“There was a rather ornate table lamp of bamboo in our room, decorated with flowers painted flowers.”)(“我们的房间里有一盏相当华丽的、竹制的灯，上面装饰着花朵的花。”)
Give us a moment again, and we will try to pick them up now. (At 9:50.) Outdoors, on a verandah.等一下，我们现在正试着接收它们。(9:50)外面，一条走廊上。
(“No. But the guest house in which we stayed on Friday had a verandah.”)(“没有。但在我们星期五待的民宿有一条走廊。”)
Nearby suitcases open.不远处的行李箱打开着。
(“Yes. In our room on Monday night.”)(“是的。在星期一晚上我们的房间里。”)
A low scooped blouse, and a pale skirt.一件低领上衣和一条浅色的裙子。
(“No.’)(“没有。”)
The owner of the place where they stay is 50 or thereabouts. Name beginning with an M, and ending with an A.他们待的地方，屋主年龄大约50岁左右。名字开头的字母是M，结束的字母是A。
(“Don't know.")(“不知道。”)
And a connection with a dog.和一条狗有关联。
(“At the guest house where we stayed on St. Thomas a large dog, a family pet, was around most of the time. This again was on Friday and Saturday, October 22,23.”(“我们在圣汤玛士待的民宿有一只大狗，是只宠物狗，大部分时间都在附近晃。再次的，这是在10月22和23日，星期五和星期六。
(Note that this information was given on Monday, October 18.)(请注意这个讯息是在10月18日星期一给的。)
They think of an island that sounds like Sumatra, but is not. It is two words. More like San Mutro, though I do not believe that is exact.他们想到一座岛，听起来像苏门答腊，但不是。有两个字。更像圣慕川(San Mutro)(发音)，虽然我不认为那是确切的拼音。
(“We discussed going to the nearby island of St. Thomas. ”)(“我们有讨论要去附近的圣汤瑞士岛[St.Thomas]。”)
An avenue beginning with a B, or San B, period, where they ate lunch. San Beninno (phonetically) or similar.一条以B或圣•B(San B)开头，句号。他们在那里吃午饭。圣班诺(San Beninno)(发音)，或类似的音。
("No.”)(“没有。”)
A striped awning. A dinner at 375. I believe this is the cost.条纹遮雨篷，晚餐是375。我相信这是指价格。
(“On Monday night, one of the dinners cost $3.75. On the following Sunday, a restaurant where we ate had a striped awning. ’’)(“在星期一的晚上，每个人的晚餐要价3.75美元。在接下来的星期日，我们吃饭的一家餐厅有条纹遮雨篷。”)
A blue blanket on the bed where they sleep.他们睡的床上有一条蓝色的毯子。
(“No. Green and white. ’’)(“不对，是绿色和白色。”)
A purchase of an item that is like a small sculpture. I get a bear shape.他们买了一个像小雕塑的东西。我猜是一只熊的形状。
(“In St. Thomas on the following Monday, we bought a small sculpture of a bird.”)(“在接下来的星期一，在圣汤玛士买了一只小鸟的小雕塑品。”)
Some rain.下了一些雨。
(“It rained a little, as it did nearly every day.")(“似乎每天都会下一些雨。”)
(From the 200th session, Wednesday, October 20,1965, at 9 PM. As usual Seth's impressions are in regular type, the written comments of Bill and Peggy Gallagher in italics below.)(出自第200节，1965年10月20日星期三晚上9点。就如往常一样，赛斯的印象是微软雅黑体(注：根据本文字体)，比尔和蓓·加拉格的评论用华文楷体。)
Your friends, my friends, the Jesuit and the cat lover are sleeping in a different room than they were at our last session.你们和我共同的朋友耶稣会信徒和爱猫人士正睡在和上节课感应时不一样的房间。
(“No.')(“不是。”)
It is close to water, and further west, and in a different town or location.房间靠近水，位于更西边，在一个不同的城镇或地方。
(“Our hotel was close to water, on the beach. But it was the same hotel we stayed in last Monday. ’’)(“我们的旅馆靠近水，位在海滩上。但和我们上周一待的旅馆是同一间。”)
It is to the rear rather than the front of the building, to the side and rear.房间位在建筑物的后方而不是前方，比较靠边或靠后的地方。
(“Yes. We had a rear corner room.”)(“是的，我们住的后面转角的房间。”)
With a tree immediately outside the window; a bushy sort of tree with something like spikes on it.窗户的外面紧临着一棵树，是一种茂密的、很多细钉子状的树。
(“Yes. It was somewhat like a palm tree, only shorter. The leaves made noise in the wind.”)(“是的，它有点像棕榈树，只是短一点。叶子因为风声而发出了声音。”)
Some sort of theater. They have visited it or it is close, and they passed it on their way to this place.某种剧院。他们曾去参观或经过一个类似戏院的地方。
(“No. ’’)(“没有”)
There is a phone in this room.在这房间里有一部电话。
(“Yes.’)(“是的。”)
They saw a motion picture about a woman with lovers, and a cripple, or perhaps a dwarf. They purchased a crucifix, I believe, small, to be worn on a chain.他们看了一部动作片是关于一个女人和她的情人，还有一个伤残人士，或也许是侏儒。我相信他们买了一个十字架，小小的，可以挂在项链上。
(“No to both.”)(“两个都没有。”)
They ate at a place with wide windows and blinds, closed because of the sun. One extremely long window at the front, the entire length of the building, covered with this blind.他们在一个有大窗户的地方吃饭，但是因为挡太阳，窗户都被窗帘遮起来了。前面有一个特别长的落地窗，占了建筑物的一整面，也被窗帘遮起来了。
(“This is possible. This type is common in Puerto Rico.”)(“有可能。这种类型在波多黎各很普遍。”)
They ate with Peggy’s sister and husband, or they talked about them during the meal, in an immediate fashion, thinking of them very strongly. Perhaps making an appointment with them for this evening.他们和蓓的妹妹，还有她先生吃饭，或者是当他们在用餐时，曾以热切的方式谈到或想到他们。也许那晚他们正和他们订定聚餐。
(“We ate with them Monday night, October 18. We no doubt discussed them today, since Monday night the four of us made plans to go to the nearby island of St. Thomas, next Friday, October 22.”(“我们在10月18日星期一晚上和他们一起吃晚餐。因为星期一晚上，我们4个计划在10月22日星期五去附近的圣玛汤士岛，所以我们的确有和他们一起讨论。”
(See the notes on page 13 of the 200th session. Peggy’s sister was married on Saturday, October 16; the bride and groom left immediately for Puerto Rico on their honeymoon. Peggy and Bill left for Puerto Rico on vacation on Sunday, October 17. Jane and I were told that the two couples had no plans to meet in Puerto Rico, oddly enough; we recall Peggy saying for instance that she would not want to honeymoon with relatives close by. But these plans were obviously changed, the two couples soon meeting in San Juan.)(见第200节的笔记，蓓的妹妹在10月16日星期六结婚；新郎新娘很快地就到波多黎各度蜜月了。蓓和比尔在10月17日星期日出去到波多黎各度假。珍和我被告知这两对夫妻很奇怪的并没有打算在波多黎各见面，我还记得蓓说，她不会希望度假时有亲戚打扰。但这些计划明显的改变了，两对夫妻很快地在圣胡安见面了。)
The sisters husband has a squat build, and uses his hands often in work.他妹夫是矮胖的体型，在工作中会用到他的手。
(“No, as to the husband’s squat build. He is tall and slender. Yes, in that he uses his hands in his work. He is a contractor.”(“不是，她先生不是矮胖型的。他又高又瘦。是的，他在工作中常用到手。他是一个建筑包工。”
(Again on page 13, it is noted that Jane and I had not met the bride and groom. Later we found out that we had met them once, briefly, while they were engaged. Neither of us are acquainted with the other members of Peggy's family, however, and at the time the 200th session was held neither Jane or I were consciously aware we had indeed met Peggy’s sister and her fiance.)(再次的，在前面课里有注明珍和我从未见过新郎和新娘。后来我们发现我们见过他们一次，很短暂，在他们订婚的时候。我们两个和蓓其他的家人都不熟，在第200节的时候，珍和我都没有有意识的觉察到我们曾见过蓓的妹妹和她的未婚夫。)
Let me see if I can pick them up at this moment. (At 9:41 PM.) A connection with dice.让我看看此刻我能否接收到什么。(晚上9:41)和骰子有关。
(“Yes. Not on Wednesday; but Thursday night we stopped at a casino where there were dice, and gambling. ’’)(“是的，不是在星期三，而是在星期四晚上我们停留在赌场，那里有骰子和赌博。”)
An old man, and jewelry.一个老人，和珠宝。
(“Yes to both. Bill clearly remembers a white man, at least 60years old by his estimate, who stood next to him at the roulette table at the casino. Bill noticed that the man wore three rings on his fingers; he thought this quite unusual. ")(“两个都是正确的。比尔很清楚的记得一个大约60岁左右的白人，是男人，站在他身边，赌场的轮盘桌旁。比尔注意到这个男人的手指上戴了3个戒指；他认为这很不寻常。”)
A minor disturbance. I think of a pack of cigarettes, not American brand, though neither of them smoke. A shawl as a gift.小骚动。我想到一包烟，不是美国的牌子，虽然他们两个都不抽烟。一条围巾，是一件礼物。
(“No to these three.”)(“这三样都没有。”)
A particular dead-end street that should be significant to them on their return.特别有一条死巷子，在回程时应该对他们有重要的意义。
(“Our hotel was on a street that dead-ended at the ocean.”)(“我们海滩上的旅馆就是在一条死巷子里。”)
I have the impression: Clor-ra-door, but do not know to what it refers. (Phonetically.我有这个印象：克－拉－朵(clor-ra-door)。但我不知道这指的是什么。
("No.")(“没有。”)
Also an interior lake.还有一个内陆湖。
(“Yes. At our hotel, The Americana, there is a very shallow pool that is actually half in and half out of the hotel, on the ground floor, which is one level lower than the lobby. This pool runs inside the hotel from the outside and is decorated with flowers, etc.”(“是的，在我们的旅馆，美洲旅馆里有一个很浅的池子，一半在旅馆里面一半在旅馆外面，在一楼，大厅在二楼。这池子从外面扩展到旅馆里，有花在旁装饰着。”
(From the 201st session, Monday, October 25,1965, at 9 PM. As usual Seth’s impressions are in regular type, the written comments of the Gallaghers in italics below each statement.)(出自第201节，1965年10月25日星期一晚上9点。就如往常一样，赛斯的印象是微软雅黑字体，比尔和蓓·加拉格的评论用华文楷体。)
An airplane. Directly behind our friends there is a female in blue.一架飞机。有一个身穿蓝色的女性在我们的朋友旁边(停顿)。
(“On Sunday noon, October 24, we returned by airplane from St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, to San Juan, Puerto Rico. There was a woman dressed in blue on the plane. But she sat immediately forward of us, and to the right.”)(“在10月24日星期日中午，我们从维京岛的圣汤玛士搭飞机回波多黎各的圣胡安。有一个身穿蓝色衣服的女性在飞机上。但她坐在我们右前方。”)
Directly across from our friends there is a couple of middle-aged... (Jane pauses, shakes her head in puzzlement.) We will try to clear this up. The couple come from Daytona or Dayton. The man has a connection with the paper business, but not a newspaper. The production of paper itself.有一对中年夫妇……直接经过我们朋友旁边，(珍停顿下来；有点伤脑筋的摇摇头)我们等会儿会试着理清。这对夫妇是来自丹塔那(Daytona)或丹顿(Dayton)。男的跟纸业有关联，但不是报纸。是纸张本身的生产。
(“We don't know. We don't remember such a couple. ’’)(“我们不知道，我们不记得有这一对夫妇。”)
Arrive New York eleven, perhaps 11:05. (Again Jane shakes her head in puzzlement or vexation.)在11点抵达纽约，也许是11点5分。(珍再次迷惑又苦恼的摇摇着)
(“We arrived in New York on Tuesday, October 26, at 4 PM. "(“我们是在10月26日星期二下午4点抵达纽约的。”
(“However, when we flew to St. Thomas from San Juan on Friday, October 22, our plane left the airport at 10:45 AM. "(“不过，我们10月22日星期五从圣胡安飞往圣汤玛士时，我们的飞机是在上午10:45起飞。”
(Perhaps Janes puzzlement while giving the data on this page was caused by her confusing several airplane flights. The Gallaghers were involved in four airplane trips in a space of five days: From San Juan to St. Thomas, and back; from San Juan to New York City; from New York City to Elmira, NY.)(也许珍在给这页资料时的困惑，是来自于她弄混了好几班的飞机航班。加拉格夫妇在5天的时间内搭乘了4次飞机：从圣胡安到圣汤玛士，回程；从圣胡安到纽约市；从纽约市到纽约州的埃尔迈拉。)
There is something, a gate or runway with the number 3... 5... 35. Possibly the number on their luggage ticket. But one of these is a 35.登机门或跑道上面的数字3……5……35，也有可能是行李箱的号码。但其中一个是35。
(“Our luggage ticket number was either 455 or 455.”)(“我们行李票号码是453或455。”)
The woman directly behind our friends’ seat may have a child with her. If so a female child, but there is no man in that seat.坐在我们朋友正后座的这个女人可能旁边带着一个孩子。如果有的话是女孩，那个位子上不是男性。
(“On our flight to New York City, a woman and child sat across the aisle and a little ahead of us. There is no man with them. We don’t recall whether the child was male or female.”)(“在我们飞往纽约市的航班，一个女人和一个小孩坐在走道的另一边，坐在比我们前面一点。没有男性和他们一起。我们不记得那个孩子是男生还是女生。”)
They walk through a large building, most likely a terminal, for there are counters of a sort to the right.他们穿过一座很大的建筑物，很可能是航厦，右手边有某种柜台。
(“Yes. We did walk through such a large terminal on our arrival in New York City.")(“是的，当我们抵达纽约的时候，我们的确穿过了这样一栋航厦。”)
Our friend’s ulcer may show a slight twinge here as he passes through the terminal.我们朋友的胃溃疡在穿过航厦时可能有点发作。
(“Yes. Bill's ulcer did bother him then.”(“是的，那时比尔的溃疡发作。”
(Bill told us his ulcer bothered him somewhat more than usual during his vacation. He said that usually he has complete freedom from pain on such junkets.)(比尔告诉我们, 在这次度假中他的溃疡比平常要严重。他说通常在这样的旅行中，他是完全不会痛的。)
There is a short discussion concerning where to go next.有一个短暂的讨论是关于接下来该往哪里走。
(“Yes. We decided to look for a place to have a sandwich before the flight to Elmira.”(“是的，在飞往埃尔迈拉之前，我们决定找一个地方吃三明治。)
Someplace during their journeys they met a white-haired gentleman. I believe the name begins and ends with an A. His age about 62, perhaps older. The interest was of a business rather than a social one, in connection with this man.他们在旅程中遇见了一位白发绅士。我相信他的名字开头和结束的字母都是A。他的年纪大约62岁，也许更老。有兴趣跟这个男人打交道，应该是出于商业上的考量胜过社交上的考量。
(“No.")(“没有。”)
At this time, that is now (9:44, Monday, October 25) our cat lover is reading. Our Jesuit is studying people, and they are flying.此时，就是现在(10月25日星期一)，我们的爱猫人士正在阅读，我们的耶稣会信徒正观察着人，他们在飞航旅程中。
(“On the plane on Tuesday, October 26, I read during the trip. Bill spent his time studying people. ”)(“在10月26日星期二的航班上，我整段飞行都在阅读。比尔则花时间观察人。”)
A dress or coat of many buttons.一件有很多扣子的衣服或外套。
(“No.")(“没有。”)
A small boy several seats ahead.一个小男孩坐在离他前面几排的位子上。
(“No. ”)(“没有。”)
Also a cab ride. Our cat lover laughs. A three-dollar fare, which seems large.还有一趟计乘车程。我们的爱猫人士笑了。3块美金的车资，似乎有点多。
(“Yes. This took place a week before, on the Sunday night we arrived in San Juan, October 17. We paid a $3. 00 fare to go from the airport to our hotel. We thought the fare much too high and were both angry; the last time we had visited San Juan the same ride cost less than $2.00; perhaps $1.50.”)(“是的，这发生在一星期之前，在10月17日我们抵达圣胡安的那个星期日晚上。从飞机场到旅馆我们花了3块美金的车资。我们都很生气，因为觉得车资太高了；上一次我们来圣胡安，同样的距离花了不到两块美金；大约是1.5块美金左右。”)
An old, rather than a younger cab driver, with a stubby neck.一个相对比较老的计程车司机，他有着粗短的脖子。
(“The cab driver was younger rather than older. But the back of his neck had a peculiar rough and mottled appearance that did make him appear to be older to us when seen from the rear. His neck could be called ‘stubby’ .”)(“这个计程车司机是比较年轻，而不是较老。但他的后头异常的粗短且有斑点，如果从后面看的话，会觉得他比较老。他的脖子可以称做粗短。”)
A direction that is mainly to the right, after one turn.在第一个转弯后，方向大致向右。
(Giving this material during the session, Jane felt the motion, very swift, of the turn.(在课堂中给这段资料的时候，珍感觉到了移动，急转弯。
(“Yes. The cab driver did take a sharp right and go in that direction. This happened after the cab driver ran through a red light and frightened us.)(“是的，计程车司机的确急转往右行驶。这发生在司机闯了一个红灯吓到我们之后。”)
A room on the fifth floor or higher, but not lower. They eat a meal here also. I pick up some connection with the word elm, and this building.一个在5楼或5楼以上的房间，不会是在5楼以下。他们也在那里吃晚餐。我接收到榆木这个字和这栋建筑有一些关联。
(“Our hotel room was on the fourth floor. We see no connection with the word elm.”(“我们的旅馆房间在4楼。我们没有看到和榆木这个字有关联的东西。”)
(The Gallaghers believe that the following impression, given by Seth in the same session as applying to Dr. Instream, applies instead to them. Jane gave the data after the break which had presumably ended the Gallagher test:)(加拉格夫妇相信在同一节课里，赛斯接下来给的，关于殷斯翠姆博士测验的印象，应该是用在他们身上的。珍给这些资料应该是在休息过后，大概是加拉格测验要结束的时候：)
A cloth, like a handkerchief, laid upon the table, and a candle. Red, I believe... Now I think of two candles, and the piece of cloth is white, the cloth on the table.桌上放着一件衣物，像领巾，还有一根蜡烛。我想是红色的……现在，我想到两根蜡烛，在桌上的衣物是白色的。
([Peggy:] “At a restaurant on Sunday night, we had candles on the table. The tablecloth was white. We had red placemats, giving a checked effect.”([蓓：]“在星期日晚上的餐厅里，桌子上有蜡烛。桌布是白色的。餐垫布是红色的，有格纹。”
(At the end of the 201st session, concluding the Gallagher Puerto Rico tests, Seth stated:)(在201节课最后，涵盖在加拉格夫妇的波多黎各测验里，赛斯说:)
Possibly in New York your other friends eat turkey. It is better to eat turkey than crow.你们其他的朋友也许在纽约吃火鸡，吃火鸡比吃公鸡好。
(The Gallaghers said they did not eat turkey sandwiches upon arriving in NYC, but other kinds.)(加拉格夫妇说他们抵达纽约市没有火鸡三明治，而是吃其他口味的。)
(Concluding the 197th session of October 11,1965, held a week before the Gallaghers left for Puerto Rico on vacation, Seth stated:)(以下涵盖在1965年10月11日，第197节课里，这节课是在加拉格夫妇去波多黎各度假的前一周举行的。赛斯说:)
I believe a rather bizarre event will occur, regarding the Gallaghers, at approximately five o’clock during their vacation.我想有一件关于加拉格夫妇的，很怪异的事将会发生，在他们的假期期间，大约5点的时候。
(Bill Gallagher had a narrow escape from drowning while skin diving in Puerto Rico. He hardly lists this as a bizarre experience. Seth deals with it to some degree in the unscheduled 203rd session of October 28,1965.(比尔·加拉格在波多黎各浮潜时有一次死里逃生的经验。他很难把这个列作是一个怪异的经验。赛斯在1965年10月28日第203节的临时课里有提到一些。
(Bill did have one experience in Puerto Rico, however, that he said might be called bizarre. He is quite sure he hasn't had any other experience like it, and believes that if he hadn't been somewhat familiar with these sessions that this one too would have escaped his notice; that is, he would not have followed it through.(不过比尔说，他在波多黎各的确有一个可以称作是怪异的经验。他很确定从来没有过类似的经验，他相信如果不是他对这些课有些熟悉，这个经验很可能会逃过他的注意力；他不会追踪这事情的发展。
(The experience did not take place at five o’clock, but later one evening while Bill and Peggy were in a restaurant in San Juan. As an entertainer the restaurant had a white Puerto Rican female pianist. During a break she stood next to Bill at the bar. Bill then had the strange feeling that she would at once go back to her piano, on a raised platform, and begin to play. She did so. Bill then proceeded to name, in the correct order, the first three numbers the pianist would play. He has no idea as to how he was able to do this, or why he felt impelled to. After his first three correct calls he felt the ability wane, and began to make errors.(这个经验并不是在5点发生的，而是再晚一点，当比尔和蓓在圣胡安的餐厅时，这个餐厅有个表演者，是个波多黎各的白人，女性钢琴师。在休息的时候，她和比尔站在酒吧旁。后来比尔有一种奇怪的感觉，她会立刻回到她的钢琴前弹奏，那是在一个升高的舞台上。她的确这么做了。后来比尔又以正确的顺序说出了这个钢琴师弹奏的前三首曲子。他不知道他是如何做到的，或为什么他感觉被驱使着这么做。在前三个正确的答案后，他感觉能力减弱了，然后就开始出错。
(The pianist also sang the numbers she played.(这个钢琴师在弹奏的时候也唱着歌。
(Jane also tried psychological time experiments while the Gallaghers were in Puerto Rico. During these she lay quietly on the bed with her eyes closed and tried to contact Peggy and Bill either by acting as a receiver of data, or projecting her astral body to their location. All of the experiments took place in the late morning hours, usually lasting about half an hour. Jane tried five times, from Monday, October 18, to Friday, October 22,1965.(当加拉格夫妇在波多黎各的时候，珍有试着做心理时间实验。做实验的时候，她躺在她的床上，眼睛闭着，试着去联络蓓和比尔，不管是作为一个资料者，或是投射她的灵体到他们的位置。所有这些尝试都是在早上较晚的时间，通常持续半个小时。从1965年10月18日星期一到10月22日星期五，珍总共试了5次。
(The Gallaghers gave their written answers to this material just as they had to Seth’s material. This time in the following copy, Janes psy-time notes are in regular type, followed by the Gallaghers' comments in italics.)(加拉格夫妇针对这个资料手写下他们的答案，就像他们对赛斯做的一样，接下来，珍的心理时间笔记是微软雅黑体，接着加拉格夫妇的评论是华文楷体。
(October 18, 11:30 to Noon, Monday: Jane specifically requested information of the Gallaghers, but she did not list anything they were able to identify.)(10月18日星期一11:30到中午：珍明确要求了加拉格夫妇的讯息，但她没有写下任何他们可以确认的事。)
(October 19, 11:10 AM to 11:50 AM:)(10月19日上午11:10至11:50:)
Music, not from a radio. A spectacular.音乐，不是从收音机里来的，精彩的表演。
("Possibly. People always seemed to be singing. ’’)(“有可能。在那里人们似乎总是在唱歌。”)
San Wano Beach (phonetic.圣瓦诺海滩(San Wano Beach)(发音)
(“Yes. Twice we swam at San Juan Municipal Beach.”(“是的。我们在圣胡安的市立海滩游泳过两次。”
(Note by R.F.B.: After Peggy and Bill left for Puerto Rico, I quizzed Jane to see how much geographical knowledge she had of the island. It developed that she had but the most general idea, to the effect that it lay south of Florida in the Caribbean. She did not know the name San Juan, for instance; nor had the Gallaghers told her, since we asked them to tell us nothing about their projected trip as soon as it was mentioned.)(罗的笔记：在蓓和比尔前往波多黎各后，我问珍她对这个岛的地理资料知道多少。她有的是最基本的资料，它位于加勒比海的佛罗里达州南部，例如她不知道圣胡安这个地名；加拉格夫妇也没有告诉过她，因为我们要求他们不要告诉我们任何有关旅游的计划。)
Bill wears olive trunks.比尔穿着橄榄色泳裤。
("They were blue.”)(“它是蓝色的。”)
Peg wears one-piece black bathing suit with a V-neck.蓓穿着黑色V领的连身泳衣。
(“No. A flowered blue bathing suit.”)(“不是。是有印花的蓝色泳衣。”)
Building on high cliff a stilt-like arrangement built out. Beach below, cove type.建在很高的悬崖，是很夸张的建筑。海滩在下面，小海湾。
(“There were several of that type on St. Thomas.”(“在圣汤玛士有几间这种类型的)。”
(Nor did Jane know that both Puerto Rico and St. Thomas are both very hilly islands.)(珍并不知道波多黎各和圣汤玛士都是属于多山的岛。)
(Note that this data was received on October 19, and that the Gallaghers did not arrive in St. Thomas until October 22. Seth also gave information pertaining to St. Thomas on October 18.)(注意这个资料是在10月19日接收到的，加拉格夫妇直到10月22日才抵达圣汤玛士。赛斯在10月18日也给了关于圣汤玛士的讯息。)
Charlie. Or someone calls Bill, Charlie?查理。或有人打电话给比尔，是查理吗？
(“No.")(“没有。”)
Now I look up at the bottom of something that is rising, I think like a small plane or boat, maybe.现在我抬头看到某个升起来的东西底部，我想也许是一架小飞机或是船。
(“This is possible. Aircraft seemed to be about us all the time.”(“有可能。小飞机似乎一直都在我们附近。”
(The boat reference here makes us think also that it could be a reference to Jane's next data.)(这里提到的船让我们想到，它也可能和珍下一个资料有关。)
I see someone male: Bill? Diving, or at least underwater. Flippers, don’t recall a tank, seems he has a mask though.我看到某一个男性：比尔？在潜水，或至少在水面下。蛙鞋，不记得有氧气筒，他似乎戴着面具。
("Yes. Bill went swimming. Also snorkeling, with the face mask but no tank.”(“是的，比尔去游泳。也去浮潜，有戴面具但没有氧气筒。”
(The snorkeling device enables the diver to breath through a tube to the surface while remaining underwater. Bill said the boat reference above, reminds him of the peculiar look thinks appear to have on the surface of the water when seen from below. Several times while snorkeling he was close to coral cliff or outcroppings rising above him. Surf breaking over his head appeared to have a "white sideways movement.” It had a more or less solid look, like the white ceiling of a room.)(浮潜的装置是让潜水者在水里透过一根到水面上的管子呼吸。比尔说上面提到的船，让他想到从水底往上看水面时的一个奇怪景象。有几次浮潜的时候，他很靠近高过他的珊瑚礁或岩石，海浪拍打着他的头，好像出现一种“白色的侧面震动”。它看起来很厚实，像是房间的白屋顶。)
Peg on shore dries her hair with a white towel. It’s wet. Did Bill splash her?蓓在岸上用一条白毛巾擦干她的头发。它们是湿的。比尔有朝她泼水吗？
([Peg.]”I had a white towel, but used it to sit on sand. Bill didn’t splash me.”)([蓓]“我有一条白毛巾，不过是用来铺在地上。比尔没有朝我泼水。”)
Small white skull.小的白色的骷髅头。
(“Bill has a definite general association here, but cant recall any details. "(“比尔在这里有个明确的一般性连结，但不记得任何细节。”
(Later Bill told us the skull association may be linked to the skeletons of fish he saw on the ocean bottom while skin diving; but he is not at all sure.)(后来比尔告诉我们骷髅头的联想，可能和他在浮潜时看到水底的鱼骸骨有关；但他并不确定。)
Small crucifix.小十字架。
("No. )(“没有”)。
(October 20, 11:30 AM to Noon: Jane tried unsuccessfully to speak to Bill Gallagher. She had a quick clear image of a high sand hill leading down to a beach. The Gallaghers said this is quite possible, but of course could say little else about such a general impression.)(10月20日，早上11:30至中午，一小时：珍试着和比尔·加拉格说话，但没有成功。她有个很快的、清楚的印象，是有一个很高耸的沙丘连绵到海岸边。加拉格夫妇说这是十分可能的，但当然对这种笼统的印象没法多说什么。)
(October 21, 1I am to 11:30 AM, Thursday:)(10月21日，早上11:00到11:30，星期四:)
Not much. San Quanamo or San Cuatamalo Beach? Eating peaches or sitting on beaches.... Impressions were words.没有太多。圣枪那莫(San Quanamo)或圣嘉特玛洛(San Cuatamalo Beach)海滩？吃桃子，或坐在海滩上……印象是字。
(The Gallaghers brought back with them a map of Puerto Rico, including a street map of San Juan. It is interesting to note that the U.S. Naval Reservation of San Geronimo lies across a couple of hundred yards of open water from the spot where Bill Gallagher went swimming and skin diving.)(加拉格夫妇从波多黎各带回地图，包括一张圣胡安的街道地图。这里很有趣的注明了美国在圣吉若尼莫(San Geronimo)的海军基地？距离比尔·加拉格游泳和浮潜的地方不过几百码。
(October 22, 11 am until Noon, Friday. One hour:(10月22日星期五，上午11点到中午，一个小时：
(In the 201st session for October 25, Seth commented: “...and incidentally, Ruburts experience in psychological time was quite legitimate. " Jane’s account of Friday's psy-time experience was included in the 201st session along with our drawing; it is repeated here, with the addition of the Gallagher's comments and Peggy’s drawing.)(在10月25日第201节，赛斯曾评论：“……顺道一提，鲁柏在心理时间的经验是十分合理的。”珍对星期五心理时间经验的描述，会和我们的图一起放在第201节；这里再重复一次，另外附加了加拉格夫妇的评论和蓓的画。)
I was doing so well when the alarm rang at 11:30 that I set it for another half-hour beyond my usual time.我那天做得很好，以致当闹钟在11:30响的时候，我把它又往后调了半个小时。
None of what I saw was very clear. I felt I stood on a long narrow porch or verandah with a railing. On either a double-story motel, or a motel of one story that was raised up higher than usual somehow, from ground level.我看到的都不是很清楚。我感觉我站在一个狭长的走廊，或有栏杆的阳台上。在一栋两层楼高的汽车旅馆，或是一层楼高的旅馆，但盖得比平常的旅馆高一些。
([Peggy:] “This is a good description of the guest house where we stayed on St. Thomas on Friday and Saturday, October 22. 23. The guest house was two story, and built on the side of a steep hill; it had the feeling of being raised up because of this. It had a long porch with a railing and benches.”)([蓓：]“这是对我们在10月22日至23日，星期五和星期六，在圣汤玛士所住的旅馆一个很好的描述。旅馆有两层楼，建在陡峭的山边；也是因为这样，会有一种高起来的感觉。一个有着栏杆和长椅的长阳台。”)
I looked over and down at a pool, and felt that beyond this either the ocean or a large body of water was visible. If the ocean, perhaps part of a bay with shores visible?我往下看着泳池，感觉在更远处有海，或是可见的面积水域。如果是海的话，也许有部分是连着可见到海岸的海湾？
([Peggy:] “Looking out from the porch, we saw the bay and the ocean beyond it.”)([蓓：]“从阳台往外看，我们可以看到更远处的海湾和海。”)蓓的画 珍对她所看到的第二个版本
(In Session 201, see the drawing I made following Janes instructions, after her psy-time experience. Note the similarities between that art and Peggy’s draining above. I added the lettering to Peggy’s drawing, as well as to Jane's second version of the same scene, shown on page 162.)(在201节，珍的心理时间练习后，我按着她的指示画了一张图。注意这张画和前页蓓的画之间相似之处，我在蓓的画上加了文字，就像上图，
(Jane's second version of what she saw.)珍对同一景象的第二个版本那样。)
Doors opened off the long narrow porch which extended full length, and I wondered if Bill and Peg were staying here. I thought their room might have the door near the center of the porch.狭长阳台上的门是打开着的，我想知道比尔和蓓是否待在这里。我认为他们的房间可能有一个很靠近长廊中间的门。
([Peggy:] “Yes. Our door opened off the center of the porch.”)([蓓：]“是的。我们的门打开后是长廊的中间。”)
I had an impression of Peg sitting by the pool, with Bill in it. I kept telling them I was standing nearby, just in case they could see anything of me. I still knew I was lying on the bed however, while I tried to project myself to their location.我有一个印象是，蓓坐在泳池边，而比尔在泳池里。我试着告诉他们我站在附近，如果他们可以看到我的话。不过我知道，当我试着把自己投射到他们的位置时，我是躺在床上的。
([Peggy:] “At no time did we have any awareness of Janes presence.”)([蓓：]“我们完全没有觉察到珍的存在。”)
After I reset the alarm I tried to wander to the other side of the motel to find a name sign. Instead I watched a man from above and behind; dressing in suit, hat, carrying a bag or briefcase. He crossed a blacktop expanse of some kind and walks on sidewalk by a large bulky building.当我重设闹钟后，我试着游荡到汽车旅馆的另一边，看看有没有旅馆的名字。我往下却看到一个男人；穿着西装，戴帽子，带着袋子或公文包。他穿过一条柏油路，走在一个大型建筑物的人行道上。
([Peggy:] “Yes. Bill watched such a man from just outside the guest house. He was colored. Bill watched this man each morning: he noticed the man because he wore a suit and hat as though for business, instead of the usual tourist attire. He carried a black briefcase. The large bulky building was a post office.”)([蓓：]“是的。比尔在旅馆外面有看到这样一个男人。他是有色人种。比尔每天早上都看到这个人；他会注意到这个人是因为他穿着西装，戴着帽子，看起来是去上班，而不是普通观光客的打扮。他带着一个黑色公文包。这栋大型建筑物是一家邮局。”)
Now as to sensations:现在我们来谈感觉：
First I achieved a partial projection of some kind, and thought I might complete it but didn’t. Strong thrilling sensations, feelings of being swept away. Odd movements of some sort. I could feel the blanket over me and my pillow at neck move in odd fashion as if my physical body was making unaccustomed movements, but thought I was motionless. Very strong momentary feelings of being swept away, though these are poor words to describe this. Extreme lightness, weightlessness.首先，我达到某种半投射的状态，我认为也许是能成功，但并没有。强烈的兴奋感，感觉被席卷过。某种奇怪的动作。我可以感觉我身上的毯子和我颈后的枕头以一种奇怪的方式在动，就好像我的身体在做一种不熟悉的动作，虽然我并没有在动。非常强烈瞬间被席卷过的感觉，虽然这是很贫乏的形容词。极度的轻，好像没有重量。
Once thought I saw mountains, as if I were floating.有一度我好像飘浮着，我想我看到了山。
([Peggy:] "It is very hilly on St. Thomas.”([蓓：]“圣汤玛士有很多山。”
(As stated before, Jane did not know that both Puerto Rico and nearby St. Thomas are very hilly.)(像之前提过的，珍并不知道波多黎各和邻近的圣汤玛士有很多山。)
Then feeling of change of direction, more straight upward, yet still retained bedself. Once I was aware that I was looking up at treetops against a gray sky.然后感觉到方向的改变，更直立，但仍在床边。有一度我觉察到，我从树顶往上看向灰色的天空。
(October 25, 11:30 to Noon, Monday: Poor results.(10月25日。早上11:30至中午，星期一：效果不佳。
(The map of Puerto Rico, brought back by Bill Gallagher, contains a street map of San Juan and other large cities together with an index of street names. A quick study for names similar to those given phonetically by Seth/Jane during the experiments has yielded no results, with the exception of the apparent similarity between San Geronimo and Jane’s psy-time impressions of San Quanamo and San Guatamalo. Any other similarities discovered later will be added to the record.(由比尔·加拉格带回来的波多黎各地图，包含了圣胡安和其他大城市里的街道名称索引。迅速地找了一下。有没有和珍/赛斯在练习中提到的拼音类似的，但是仍没有结果，除了圣吉若尼莫与珍心理时间时说的圣枪那莫和圣嘉特玛洛的印象明显相似。任何其他部分的类似之处，如果之后发现会加进记录里。
(Peggy Gallagher is a feature writer for the Elmira Star-Gazette and Advertiser, a Gannett Newspaper. During December 6 to 9 the paper sent her to Washington, DC to attend A Seminar on Poverty, conducted by the Office of Economic Opportunity which is headed by R. Sargent Shriver.(蓓·加拉格是埃尔迈拉星报与广告商嘉纳报社的专栏作者。12月6日至9日，报社送她到华盛顿首府参加一个关于贫穷的研讨会，是由沙觉·萧文领导的经济发展办公处所举办的。
(Seth gave data on Peggy's trip in the 214th and the 215th sessions, December 6 and 8. He also gave some preliminary data on the trip during an unscheduled session held on December 3; Peggy took a copy of these predictions with her to Washington. Seth listed nine predictions and Peggy verified three of them. Seth gave them in Peggy's presence; his score in the two sessions held while she was in Washington was much better.(赛斯在12月6日和8日，第214节和215节的课中给了关于蓓这次出行的资料。在12月3日的临时课里，赛斯也给了一些关于此次出行的初步资料；蓓带着这些预言的副本到了华盛顿。赛斯列了9项预言，蓓确认了其中的3项。赛斯的预言是蓓在场的时候给的；在蓓去华盛顿出差的那两节，赛斯的得分高了很多。
(As soon as we realized that Peggy 's trip would furnish a good opportunity for another test, we asked her to say no more about it. By then we knew she was going to Washington, but Jane does not believe Peggy told her specifically, for instance, that Peggy was to cover a seminar on poverty. Be that as it may, we were told little in advance of the trip. Peggy herself did not know about the trip until a few days before she left.(当我们发现蓓的出行会提供另一次测验的好机会后，我们就要求她不要再说任何资料。后来我们知道她要去华盛顿，但珍不认为蓓告诉过她，她要去参加一个有关贫穷的研讨会，但就算她可以说了，我们对她这趟旅程也所知甚少。蓓直到她离开的几天前才知道会有这次出行。
(She returned to Elmira on December 9 and a written question-and-answer session was held on December 10. Jane and I made an effort to obtain detailed answers to Seth's statements, and Peggy cooperated in excellent fashion. The interview lasted about two hours. Once again, we stressed that we did not want to concerning Seth's material, and she agrees that we did not.(她在12月9日回到埃尔迈拉，12月10日就举行了一节手写问与答的课。珍和我努力的要从赛斯陈述中找到详细答案，而这里蓓非常配合。会谈持续了大概两个小时。再次的，我们要强调，关于赛斯所说的资料，我们并没有硬要蓓说什么，蓓也认同我们并没有这样做。
(As in the Puerto Rico experiments, Seth’s material is presented line by line, in regular type, with Peggy’s answers below. These answers are quotes from my notes made during the interview. Begin with Seth's material from the 214th session for December 6,1965.)(就像波多黎各的实验一样，赛斯的资料是一行一行地呈现，微软雅黑的字体是赛斯，蓓的答案列在下面。这些答案部分是从会谈中我的笔记里摘录出来的。赛斯的资料是从1965年12月6日第214节的课开始。)
Now, we shall see what we can do. A talk concerning survival of your nation. Our friend the cat lover attends this discussion.现在，看看我们能做什么。一场关于你们国家生存的讨论。我们的朋友爱猫人士参加了这次讨论。
(Peggy did attend this discussion. The talk didn’t concern the survival of our nation, but of some individuals within it; it was a seminar on poverty.)(蓓的确参加了这场讨论会，讨论的主题不是国家的生存，而是针对某些族类；是关于贫穷的研讨会。)
Perhaps in a room numbered 312.也许在一间编号312的房间。
([Peggy:] “ The room number began with an 8.” Peggy knows this because the seminar was held on the eighth floor of a building occupied by the Office of Economic Opportunity; in an executive conference room of the OEO.)([蓓：]“房间号以8开始。”蓓会知道这一点是因为研讨会在大楼的8楼，也是经济发展办公处的所在；是在经济发展办公处的管理人员会议室里。)
The speaker is interrupted.演讲者被打断。
([Peggy:] “Yes. The speakers were constantly interrupted by the various reporters attending.”)([蓓：]“是的。演讲者一直被好几个进来的记者打断。”)
A question-and-answer session.一场问与答的会议。
([Peggy:] “Yes. A question-and-answer session was held after each speaker had finished his formal talk.”)([蓓：]“是的。在每个讲者的正式报告后有一个问与答的会议。”)
Three main speakers in the discussion itself.讨论会本身有3位主要的演讲者。
(Peggy said either 3 or 4 speakers addressed the seminar in the morning session on Monday, December 6.(蓓说在12月6日星期一早上的研讨会里，有3或4个演讲者。
(She tried to determine the exact number later, from her own notes, but was unable to do so.)(她后来试着从她的笔记去确定真正的演讲者人数，但还是无法确定。)
Survival is a strong issue here, though it may not be the title of the discussion, formally.生存在这里是一个主要的议题，虽然它可能不是讨论会的正式标题。
(As stated, the title was A Seminar on Poverty. However, the discussions dealt with the survival of the hard-core poor, the deprived, on a strong, even desperate level, Peggy said. The seminar concerned the literal survival of these individuals, and methods of raising their standard of living. Much more than money was involved here.)(如上所述，蓓说标题是贫穷的研讨会。这场讨论是关于赤贫，已经强烈到危机程度的穷人生存。这场研讨会关注的是这些人的生存，还有提升他们生活水平的方法。而不只是讨论金钱。)
A tow-headed man with whom our friend comes in contact. She may not like him overmuch.我们的朋友接触到一个蓬头垢面的男人。她可能不是很喜欢他。
(Peggy met a black-haired man whom she found to be “repulsive. ’’She told us she considered this person to be really upsetting to her personally; it was a case of one individual taking a strong dislike to another.(蓓有遇到一个她觉得“十分讨厌”的黑发男人。她告诉我们，她真的觉得这个人让她十分不舒服；这是一种一个人很不喜欢另一个人的例子。
(“You will meet a man you do not like’’ is one of the advance predictions given Peggy by Seth during the unscheduled session of December 3. Jane and I have wondered what part suggestion might play in such a case. Peggy told us she had also been aware of this, and that she could say that her dislike of the individual in question transcended any suggestion that conceivably could be operating.)(“你将会遇见一个你不喜欢的男人”，这是赛斯在12月3日临时课里对蓓说的一段预言。珍和我很想知道，在这个例子里这是否有暗示的作用。蓓告诉我们，她也觉察到这一点，但是她说，她对这个人的不喜欢已经超过了任何可能运作的暗示。)
Something to do with a federation.某个与联邦有关的东西。
(Nothing specific here, unless this is a distorted reference to the obvious fact of government buildings, etc., in Washington.)(这里不够明确，除非这是扭曲的关联，指的是在华盛顿很明显可见的政府大楼等等。)
Pamphlets are given out.小册子被发送。
([Peggy:] “Yes.” Peggy said the reporters were deluged with pamphlets every day they were present. She herself accumulated a stack of pamphlets seven inches high, weighing several pounds.)([蓓：]“是的。”蓓说这些记者每天都被蜂拥而至的小册子淹没。她自己累积了大约7英寸高，几磅重的小册子。)
Directions to a northeast location perhaps, though I do not know, for tomorrow’s lecture.在明天的演讲上，也许有朝着东北方的一个所在地，虽然我不知道那是什么。
(The seminar remained in the same building on Tuesday. But on Wednesday, Peggy was in a group taken by bus to Camp Kilmer, which has been taken over by the OHO. Camp Kilmer lies northeast of Washington.)(星期二的研讨会都在同一栋大楼。但在星期三，蓓在一个乘车到基墨尔营地的团体中，这地方现在是由经济发展办公处管辖。基墨尔营地位于华盛顿的东北方。)
A particular man with a camera slung over his shoulder, who gets our friends attention.一个特别的男人，他的肩上挂着摄影机，他得到了我们朋友的注意力。
(Peggy remembers one cameraman, out of several present, who carried his camera slung on a strap over his shoulder.)(蓓记得其中有一个摄影师，把摄影机挂在他的肩膀上。)
A handkerchief shows above his breast pocket. Pointed, that is a pointed handkerchief, with an initial, perhaps a C or G.他胸前的口袋露出一条领巾。尖尖的，是一条露出尖角的领巾，领巾上有着缩写，也许是C或G。
(Peggy quite clearly recalls a man with such a handkerchief in his breast pocket. She remembers this because the handkerchief had four sharp points showing, which she considered unusual, very much out of the ordinary. She cannot recall however whether this man was also the cameraman. She does not remember any initials.”(蓓很清楚地记得，有个男人的胸前口袋就有这样的领巾。她记得这个是因为领巾上有秀出4个尖角，非常不寻常。她不记得这个男人是不是那个摄影师。她不记得任何缩写。)
A grab bag of some kind.某种手提袋。
("No.”)(“没有”)
Theater-type chairs rather than seats.戏剧型的座椅，不是普通的座椅。
([Peggy:] “Yes. They were folding-type chairs with cushioned seats, as found in theaters. They were very comfortable. These chairs were lined up at long narrow tables. The whole conference except for trips was held in this particular conference room. ’)([蓓：]“是的。是那种有坐垫可折式的椅子，就像在戏剧院里的那一种。它们坐起来非常舒服。这些椅子排在一张狭长的桌子前。除了出访，整个会议都在这间特别的会议室里举行。”)
Incidentally, our Jesuit’s ulcer bothers him this evening, quite strongly.顺带一提，我们的耶稣会信徒今晚溃疡发作得很厉害。
(Yes, most definitely. This evening, Monday, December 6, Bill Gallagher 's ulcer bothered him to such an extent that he called a doctor. This he seldom has to do.(是的，确实是。在今天晚上，12月6日星期一，比尔的溃疡痛到他打电话给医生。他很少这么做。
(Tests resulting from this upset led to the medical opinion that Bill has two ulcers. However a recheck of old X-rays seems to show that the second ulcer had previously existed, but had not been detected. Needless to say, neither Jane nor I had seen Bill, or heard from him, since the unscheduled session of last Friday, December 3. We saw him later in the evening of December 10, after the interview with Peggy.)(测验结果导向了一个医学上的看法，就是比尔有两处溃疡。不过重新翻看过去的X光片，第二处溃疡似乎以前就存在，只是没有被发现。不用说，自从12月3日星期五的临时课以后，我们就没有看到或听到比尔，我们在12月10晚上，和蓓会谈后才又再次看到他。)
A measurement of abilities, though I do not know to what this refers.一个能力的评量，虽然我不知道这指的是什么。
([Peggy:] “Yes. " Peggy said a large part of the seminar was devoted to discussing methods by which it would be determined which individuals would be able to take part in various programs. Their capabilities, intellectual, financial, physical, etc., would have to be determined.)([蓓：]“是的。”蓓说研讨会大部分时间都是在讨论方法，关于个人该如何决定参加不同计划的哪一种。会由他们的能力、智力、经济力、体力等方面来做决定。)
Fourteen thousand in all attend, in all sections, though at various times.所有区域共有14000人参加，不过是在不同的时段。
(Peggy said that at the seminar many thousands of people were mentioned at different times. She had no idea of the total however, but said the 14,000 figure would not be unreasonable. She thought she might have a total figure in her notes, taken for the series of articles she is to write for the local paper, but a check of the notes yielded no clues here. 14,000 people of course did not attend the seminar.)(蓓说在不同的时间点有提及这个研讨会有几千人参加，不过她不知道总数，只说有14000人也不是不可能。她认为她的笔记里应该有总数，是由她写给地方报纸一系列的文章来的，但查了笔记后发现没有。参加讨论会的可能没有到14000人。)
The hotel on a corner.旅馆是在转角。
([Peggy-.] “Yes.’’)([蓓：]“是的。”)
Her room above three floors. A man across the way. The number 421.她的房间在3楼以上。一个男人在对面。数字421。
(Peggy's room, #208, was on the second floor. She doesn't know whether a man had the room across the way, and has no connection to offer for 421.(蓓的房间号208，是在二楼。她不知道是否有一个男人住在对面，也不知道421和什么有关。
(Jane took a break at this point, seemingly ending the Gallagher test before she went into the Dr. Instream test. However, Peggy said the first paragraph of the Insteam material applied to her Washington trip:)(珍在提到这一点时休息。似乎要结束加拉格的测验而开始殷斯翠姆博士的测验了。不过，蓓说殷斯翠姆博士资料的第一段也适用于她的华盛顿之旅：)
A very smallish crowded room. I believe a cocktail party. A woman seems to be the main hostess, though a man is present with her.一间很小很挤的房间。我相信是鸡尾酒会。一个女人似乎是酒会的主人，虽然有个男人站她旁边。
(Monday night Peggy attended a cocktail party in a private home in Washington. The party was held in several small crowded rooms, plus a large room. The main hostess was a woman, Judy Carlyle, who is affiliated with the poverty program. Mrs. Carlyle's husband was present in an unofficial capacity, and was introduced to Peggy.(星期一晚上，蓓参加了一个在华盛顿私宅举办的鸡尾酒会。酒会是在好几间很小很挤的房间，再加上一间大房间举办的。派对主要的主人是个女人，茱蒂·卡利，她也是参与贫穷计划的一份子。卡利的先生也出席这个非官方的场合，他被引荐给蓓。
(In the unscheduled session for December 3 Seth said Peggy would meet a woman dressed in green. Peggy met no such woman. After the cocktail party however, Peggy found she couldn't remember the color of Mrs. Carlyle's dress. She checked by phone; Mrs. Carlyle had worn a red dress. Later note by RFB: Red and green are opposites on the artisit’s color wheel.)(在12月3日的临时课里，赛斯说蓓会遇到一个穿绿色衣服的女人。蓓没有遇到这样的女人。不过，在酒会结束的时候，她发现不记得卡利女士穿什么颜色的衣服。她打电话去确认；卡利女士穿的是红色的衣服。后来罗伯的笔记；红色和绿色是色轮中的对比色。)
(We now begin with Seth's material on Peggy's Washington trip, from the 215th session, December 8,1965 )(我们要开始赛斯在1965年12月8日，第215节里所说的，关于蓓在华盛顿之旅的资料。)
A banquet for your cat lover, with long narrow tables.爱猫人士参加一个宴会，里面有一张狭长的桌子。
([Peggy:] “Yes. "Peggy attended such a banquet. It was held in the same executive conference room as all the other seminar meetings; as stated, tables were long and narrow, with theater-type chairs. Lunch was also served at these tables each day).([蓓：]“是的。”蓓参加了这样的一场宴会。这场宴会是在举办所有其他研讨会的那间管理人员会议室里举行的；如上所述，狭长型的桌子，像剧院的椅子。每天的午餐也是在这张桌子上面吃的。)
A disturbance of some sort, though not necessarily here.有某种骚动，虽然不一定在这里。
([Peggy:] “Yes. To wind up the seminar on poverty a press conference was held with Sargent Shriver, director of the poverty program. The disturbance occurred when an incensed group from Syracuse appeared and tried to disrupt the conference time reserved for the reporters.”([蓓：]“是的。这个贫穷研讨会最后的会议是由贫穷计划的负责人沙觉·萧文所举办的。骚动发生在从西拉库斯来的一个激动团体，他们试着打断大会要开放给记者的时间。”
(Peggy thought the group was very rude. The group was silenced by Shriver and told to wait for a later meeting with him. The group itself Peggy said, was obviously very angry. The incident occurred Wednesday at 5 PM.)(蓓认为这个团体很粗鲁，后来因为萧文答应等会儿和他们开会，才把事情平息了下来。蓓说这个团体显然非常的愤怒。这事件发生在星期三下午5点。)
An endeavor to reach someone whom she was unable to contact, the initials perhaps W. B.努力去联系某个她无法联络上的人，缩写也许是W.B。
([Peggy:] “Yes, although the initials are R. D.” Peggy wanted to talk with a certain official on the poverty program; his offices were on a floor lower than that of the seminar, in the same building. Peggy went to the man's offices on Tuesday and waited for some time there. Failing to see him, she made an appointment for Wednesday, but did not keep this appointment because of the press of other business.)([蓓：]“是的，虽然缩写是R.D.”蓓想要和贫穷计划中的某个特定人员联络；他的办公室和研讨会在同一栋建筑，不过是在低一层楼。蓓星期二到这个人的办公室等了一会儿。没有看见他，她预约了星期三再去，但因为其他事而没有赴约。)
Again, a clock that did not work correctly.再次的，一个不太准确的时钟。
(Peggy said she had an experience involving time. At her hotel she left a message with the desk clerk to be awakened at 7 AM Tuesday. The desk clerk failed to call her and she was late getting to the seminar.(蓓说她有个和时间有关的经历。在她住的旅馆，她留讯息给柜台，希望他们星期二早上7点叫她起床。但柜台没有打电话，所以去研讨会的时候，她迟到了。
(This is, also, one of Seth’s predictions given during the unscheduled session of December 3, before Peggy left for Washington.)(这也是蓓去华盛顿之前，赛斯在12月3日临时课里的其中一个预言。)
Something with a new format.某个新计划的事。
(Peggy said she has no connection here.)(蓓说这里她没有想到任何的连结。)
Ten people in a separate party or gathering, in which she took part.10个人，在她参加的一个团队或聚会。
(Yes, in that Peggy was in the small separate gathering that visited Camp Kilmer, northeast of Washington, on Wednesday. See page 165. Peggy remembered that the bus taking them to Camp Kilmer was far from full; her notes later confirmed that 12 reporters and 2 aides made the trip.)(是的，蓓星期三参访华盛顿东北方的基墨尔营基地时，是在一个小团体里。蓓记得载他们到基墨尔的巴士并没有坐满；她从笔记上确认，车上有12名记者，还有两名助手。)
Something having to do with March 10.某件与3月10日有关的事。
([Peggy:] “No.”)([蓓：]“没有。”)
A room with a yellow wastepaper basket. Flowers in the room, perhaps roses. But florists flowers.一个有着黄色废纸篓的房间。房间里有花，也许是玫瑰。是花店的花。
(Peggy has no recollection here.)(这里蓓不记得了。)
An event at eight, last evening, in a different room than the room in which a previous meeting was held, that she attended.昨晚8点，她出席了一个活动，不在之前举办会议的同一个房间。
([Peggy:] “No. All meetings at the seminar were held in the same room.”)([蓓：]“没有。所有研讨会都在同一个房间举行。”)
McNamara.麦纳马拉(McNamara)。
([Peggy:] “Yes. "Seeing the above word in the material caused Peggy to say that it was quite unusual. At the seminar Peggy was surprised to hear the name of Secretary of Defense McNamara brought up rather strongly in connection with Sargent Shriver and the poverty program. The connection being a comparison of the two men’s tactics in running their respective departments. Peggy said the point was hammered at more than once during the seminar.)([蓓：]“是的。”看了上面资料的字后，蓓说那很不寻常。在研讨会中，蓓很惊讶地听到国防部秘书长的名字麦纳马拉常被提起，他和沙觉·萧文，还有贫穷计划有很深的关系。他们各自带着自己的部门较劲。蓓说这一点在研讨会期间被提到不只一次。)
A white taxicab. Identified by a round symbol on it, with a border inside the circle, and some sort of figures. Whether these are people, shapes or object shapes, I do not know. The symbol is of more than one color, however, and fairly dark against the white. I am seeing it in the evening, so the color of the symbol is not very clear. It is in front of a stone building.一台白色的计程车。有个圆形符号在上面可供辨认，里面有个圆形的边，和某种图案。不过我不知道图案是人形还是物件。这个图案不只一个颜色，不过是很深的颜色，还有白色相对比。我是在晚上的时候看见它，所以图案的颜色不是很清楚。它位于一个石造的建筑物之前。
(Peggy said she took a taxi Tuesday evening, after dark. She cannot offer any information on whatever symbol the cab carried however, but did state the cab was of a “light color.” The cab was also in front of a stone building—Garftnkel’s Department Store.(蓓说她星期二晚上有搭过计程车。不过她无法提供任何关于计程车上符号的讯息，但她确定计程车是“浅色的”。计程车也的确停在一栋石造大楼的前面——嘉芬科百货公司。
(Arriving later in the evening, Bill Gallagher told us that the taxicabs of the predominant cab company in Washington are painted white. They carry a symbol on their front doors that is semicircular in shape, the design being based on the Capitol Dome. The symbol is of course in dark color against the white background.)(比尔·加拉格到的比较晚，他说华盛顿主要的计程车公司都把计程车漆成白色。车子前门有个符号是半圆形，这个设计是来自国会山庄的圆顶。符号当然是深色对比白色的背景。)
An unusual attachment of aides goes with the group which she accompanies.在她所在的团体里，助手们跟得很紧。
(Peggy believes this is a reference to the bus ride to Camp Kilmer. As stated before, two aides accompanied the twelve reporters. Not unusual, then.)(蓓认为这里指的是，到基墨尔营地的巴士之旅。如之前所说，两个助理陪伴着12个记者。那时没感觉有什么不寻常。)
There is some hesitation at a gate while this gathering waits. While clearance is made, but it is a short hesitation.在闸口有一些延迟，大家等了一会。等着批准核可，但只是耽搁了一下。
(Peggy said there was no hesitation or delay at the gate to Camp Kilmer, since the military does not occupy the camp anymore. The camp is run in its entirety now by the OEO.)(蓓说在去基墨尔营地的闸口并没有延迟，因为军队已经不驻扎在营地了。营地现在由经济发展办公处[译注：OEO经济机会办公室Office of Economic Opportunity]来营运。
I pick up something to do with a ballpark, or a park that has been used, or a stadium that has been used for ball games.我收到和棒球场、曾使用的公园，或曾举办球赛的运动场有关的某个东西。
(Peggy said she attended two meetings at Camp Kilmer that were held in a moderate-sized auditorium.)(蓓说她在基墨尔营地参加了两次会议，是在一个中型讲堂举办的。)
Something to do with a pocketbook. Did she misplace it? It is a shoulder variety however. Perhaps it was a camera.和手提包有关。她丢了？不过是肩背式的。也许它是一个照相机。
(Peggy lost her glasses and a ring at the seminar. She found the glasses but not the ring. No pocketbook of hers was involved.(蓓会议上丢了眼镜和戒指。她找到了眼镜，但没有找到戒指。没有涉及钱包。
(See page 122. At the time of the 215th session, Jane said she believed the pocketbook data, above, applied to herself, and as it developed a lost pocketbook connection involving. Jane did grow out of the 21st envelope test, held in the 215th session.(见第205节，珍说她相信关于上述手提包的资料，是在说她自己，后来的发展是，有关珍丢失的手提包资料是在第215节第21次的信封测验。
(See also the notes on page 122, concerning the possibility of Seth giving information, in such tests, on something that is not noticed by the subject. A good example here is the taxicab symbol material on page 167. 68.)(见第215节的相关注释，关于受试者在这样的测验里没有注意到赛斯讯息的可能性。这里有个很好的例子是关于计程车符号的资料。
(Before our envelope test in the 215th session Seth added one more line to the Gallagher test material; see page 121:) I wanted to add something about shipyards to the Gallagher material.(在215节的信封测试之前，赛斯对加拉格测验加了一行资料:)我想在加拉格的资料里面加上和船坞有关的某个东西。
(At first Peggy saw no connection here. Then she remembered that when she arrived in Newark, NJ from Elmira, she transferred to Kennedy Airport on Long Island by helicopter. During the trip, at an altitude of no more than 600feet, she thus flew over many of the docks, piers and shipyards lining the Brooklyn waterfront. She thought at the time that Bill would have enjoyed the sight, since he likes ships. The helicopter flight traveled past the Statue of Liberty.)(刚开始蓓并没有发现任何连结。后来她想起来，当她从埃尔迈拉抵达新泽西州的纽华克时，她在长岛的肯尼迪机场转搭直升机。旅途中，大约不到600英尺的高度，沿着布鲁克林码头区，她飞过了很多船坞、码头和修船厂。她认为比尔当时很享受这片风景，因为他喜欢船。直升机有飞过自由女神像。)
(Peggy verified three of the nine predictions Seth gave in the unscheduled session of December 3, prior to her Washington trip. Two of the three correct items have been listed in their place in the above material. The third prediction, listed on page 108, is this:)(蓓在她的华盛顿之行之前，就确认了赛斯在12月3日临时课给的9个预言之中的3个。3个正确项目的其中两个放在上面的资料了，第三个预言，是下面这个:)
An unscheduled social engagement, not in a private home but a public place.一个不预期的社交聚会，不在私人住宅，是在公共场所。
(This developed when Peggy spent an unplanned evening, including dinner at a restaurant, with her brother and his family, who live in Washington.)(蓓和她住在华盛顿的弟弟和他家人意外的度过了一个晚上，包括去餐厅吃晚餐。)
(Tracing of the hospital visitors pass, furnished by Lorraine Shafer, and used as the test object in the 24th envelope test, in the 219th session for January 3,1966.)第219节 片刻点 自己一 信封24

SESSION 219 1966年1月3日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课


JANUARY 3, 1966 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED医院访客通行证的素描，由洛琳·雪佛提供，用于1966年1月3日第219节第24次信封测验的物件
(This is our first session since December 15,1965. The rest was our longest since the sessions began two years ago, and did us both much good. We were ready to go back to work, although Jane confessed to some feeling of nervousness as session time approached. But she did well. She had no urge to speak for Seth during vacation.(这是我们在1965年12月15日之后的第一节课。是自从两年前我们的课开始后休息最长的一次，这对我们两个都非常好。我们准备好回来工作了，虽然珍承认当接近上课时间时，她有一点紧张的感觉。但她做得很好。在休息期间她并不着急为赛斯说话。
(See the tracing on page 169 for the test object for this evenings envelope test. It was furnished by Lorraine Shafer, who witnessed this session. Details will be presented in the body of the session, as they developed. The last session witnessed by Lorraine was the 195th, of October 4,1965. See Volume 4.(见上图今晚信封测验，测验物件的描绘图由参与这节课的洛琳•雪佛所提供。细节会在课程中详述。上一次洛琳参与的课是1965年10月4日第195节，见第四册。
(The session was held in our large front room. Jane began speaking while sitting down. Her eyes were closed, her voice a little stronger than usual, and her pace quite good. She smiled as she began. Her voice was rather dry.)(这节课是在前面比较大的房间举行的。珍坐下开始说话。她的眼睛闭着，声音较平常有力，速度极佳。当开始的时候她在微笑，声音有点哑。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
After your long vacation, you should be quite ready to plunge into our activities anew. You should be. I do not see any signs however of any great enthusiasm as we resume.在你们的长假后，应该准备好重新投入我们的活动了。你们应该是这样的。不过当我们重新开始时，我没有看到你们伟大的热情。
Perhaps your holidays take more out of you than I do.也许你们的假期比我让你们更累。
(“Yes. ”)(“是的。” )
My greeting to Marleno, and my sympathy to Ruburt as he struggles to plow through his Dunne.欢迎玛蕾诺，还有对鲁柏致上我的同情，他正努力的把唐尼的书读完。
(Marleno is Lorraine Shafer’s entity name. Jane has obtained three of Dunnes book through the state library at Albany, and we are in the midst of reading them.)(玛蕾诺是洛琳•雪佛存有的名字。珍从阿尔巴尼州图书馆(Albany)借了3本唐尼的书，我们读到一半。)
I am ready to resume our previous discussion, and look forward to a most effective year, in your time one.我准备好重新开始我们上一次的讨论，也期待更有成效的一年，在你们的时间一里。
Now. If you will recall our early sessions dealing with value fulfillment, let us now consider what I prefer to call a moment point. This moment point, as you know, refers to any given present instant. If you are thinking in terms of Dunnes theories, then start out with this moment point as it is seen in time one by self one.现在如果你们记得我们前几节课讨论过的价值完成，让我们现在来想想所谓的片刻点。这个片刻点，如你所知的，指的是现在的一瞬间。如果你以唐尼的理论来想，片刻点可以看作是自己一的时间一。
(Early in the sessions Seth began giving us lists of the inner senses and the basic laws of the inner universe. Value fulfillment, or the value climate of psychological reality, is the first basic law of the inner universe; Seth presented it in the 45th session in some detail. See Volume 2.(在课的早期，赛斯开始给我们一些内在感官的名单和内在宇宙的基本法则。价值完成或心理实相的值气候是内在宇宙的第一个基本法则；赛斯在第45节曾提过一些细节，见第二册。
(See the following sessions for details on moment points: 149, 150, 151, 152.)(见以下几节关于片刻点的讨论：149、150、151、152。)
The ego can perceive only certain portions of any given moment point or present instant, and it sees the moment point indeed as if it were one of a series of lights that approaches the ego from one side, and passes him by on the other side. The ego perceives this moment point, then, very much as if it were a flat cardboard-like object which comes, is flashed before him, and disappears.自我只能意识到特定的片刻点，或当下一瞬间的一部分，它看着片刻点就像它是一连串从一个方向靠近自我的光之一，且从另一个方向通过它。自我感知到这个片刻点，接着就好像它像个平的、厚纸板般的物件而来，在它面前闪过，然后消失。
The ego cannot see that this moment point is open, so to speak, and represents an opening into many other dimensions. These dimensions may be traveled through; but they may not be traveled through by the ego, for the ego can only perceive those dimensions which it is physically equipped to see, or perceive.自我无法看见这个片刻点是开放的，可以说它代表了很多其他维度的开口。这些维度可以被旅行过；但它们不是被自我旅行过，因为自我只能察觉到那些物质装备可以看见或注意到的维度。
Other portions of the self, on the one hand, are not so limited. It must be clearly understood however that these other portions of the self are incapable of the ego’s intense focus within physical reality. Their focus is elsewhere. However, these selves are not limited as is the ego to one main field of perception only, in the manner which Dunne believes. Dunne does leave intervening areas between dimensions which may be perceived by an observer from a neighboring dimension, but all in all his serial selves are to some large degree prisoners of those dimensions in which they exist.在另一方面，自己的其他部分没有这么受限。不过有一件事必须清楚的了解，自己的这些其他部分无法像自我一样，强烈的贯注在物质实相。它们的注意力在其他方面。不过，这些自己们不像自我，只能在一个主要领域里感知那样的受限，就像唐尼相信的那方式。唐尼的确留下在维度当中的中间区域，那可以被邻近维度的观察者感知到，但终究他所谓连续性的自己，到一个很大的程度被它们存在其中的维度所囚禁。
Such is fortunately not the case.但很幸运的，那并不是真的。
Now. These other selves are more freewheeling. There are indeed limitations inherent within their structure, but in all cases any given identity is more than the dimension in which it finds itself. Its limitations may be great, but the limitations are set not by the identity’s nature but by the dimension in which it exists.现在。这些其他的自己们更加无拘无束。在它们的结构里的确有着固有的限制，但在所有的状况里，任何特定的身分大过它自己所身处的维度。它的限制也许很大，但限制并不是由身分的本质，而是由它存在的维度而设定的。
(Consider the whole of the next paragraph underlined for emphasis. Jane was by now speaking more rapidly and with much intent and conviction. She used many forceful gestures, although her eyes remained closed.)(考虑把下一段整段划线做强调。珍现在说得更快，带着热切和坚定。虽然她的眼睛仍闭着，她比了很多有力的手势。)
The identity may, and will, move out of its dimension into another, and it therefore has within it the innate capacity to perceive more than it is allowed to perceive at any given point by the limitations set upon it.这个身分会，而且一定会，离开它自己的维度而进入其他的，因此它天生具备感知能力，比它当下被加诸其上所限制的感知更多。
Two of these statements may appear at first glance to contradict themselves, but you shall shortly see that they do not, and you are left for now with a pretty question: for does the self, or identity, then form the perceptive dimension in which it exists, or is it created by the dimension?这两个说法乍看之下好像自相矛盾，但你很快会发现它们并没有，然后你现在会有一个很好的问题：自己或身分是来自于它所存在的知觉维度，或是它是被这个维度所创造的？
Take a brief break and we shall continue.短暂的休息一下，我们还会继续。
(Break at 9:16. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. She had been wrapped up in the material, speaking fast and with much emphasis.(9:16休息。珍在第一阶段出离如常。她全神贯注在资料上，说话快且有力。
(During break Lorraine asked if we still conducted envelope tests. When we said yes, she told us she had brought a test envelope with her. Moreover, it was one I had given her myself when she witnessed the 172nd session of July 26,1965. Handing her the two envelopes and the two pieces of Bristol, I had asked her to pick a test object, seal it up, and give it to me the next time we saw her, without telling me what the test object was. She had picked the test object last August, then mislaid the envelope and forgotten it; in addition I hadn't asked her for it.(在休息的时候，洛琳问我们是否要进行信封测验。当我们说是，她告诉我们她带了一个测验信封过来。而且这是我在1965年7月26日第172节给她的。当时我给她两个信封，我要求她选一个测验物件，封好，然后在下一次我们看到她的时候拿给我，不要告诉我测验物件是什么。她去年8月就选好测验物件了，然后把信封随意一放就忘了；而我也没有向她要。
(Lorraine handed me her envelope while Jane was out of the room; thus Jane did not see it before the test. It was tightly sealed. I did not mention to either Jane or Lorraine whether I had planned a test for tonight. Lorraine did not tell me the contents of her envelope. Jane didn't comment on it and I let the matter rest.(当珍在房间外面的时候，洛琳拿她的信封给我；因此珍在测验前没有看过它。它封得很紧。我并没有和珍或洛琳提过我打算今晚安排测验。洛琳没有告诉我信封的内容。珍没有评论，而我也没有多问下去。
(Jane resumed in the same fast and active, emphatic manner, again with her eyes closed, at 9:30. Her voice was still dry.)(珍在9:30分以同样快速、活跃、有力的方式重新开始，再一次，她的眼睛闭着。她的声音仍有点哑。)
I am indeed taking it very easy this evening, to break you in again, so to speak.我今晚说得很慢，为了让你们慢慢地了解。
The vacation has done you both good however, and your energies have indeed replenished themselves. I have some slight trouble with Ruburt when sessions are not regular. However this effect is fleeting, and as always I bear with such things in my usual manner.无论如何，这个假期对你们两个都是好的，你们确实重新充满能量。当课不是定期举行的时候，我和鲁柏确实会有一点小麻烦。不过这个影响是短暂的，像往常一样，我会用我平常的方式忍耐这些事。
(Jane smiled and paused. She cleared her throat rather often.)(珍微笑，停顿。她常常清喉咙。)
Now let us begin again.现在让我们再次开始。
We start once more with our moment point. For now this moment point which appears within your physical universe is but a small materialization of larger portions of the spacious present. In the dreaming state, when the ego is released from its idea of time as a series of moments, then other portions of the self can travel through these moment points, and you have here a journey through depths that have nothing to do with your (underline your) concept of time or space.我们再次开始谈我们的片刻点。现在，这个出现在你们物质宇宙的片刻点，是这个广阔的现在较大部分的一个小小实现。在梦的状态，当自我从时间是一系列的片刻这种概念里解脱出来，那自己的其他部分可以旅行过这些片刻点，然后在这里，你会开始一趟和你的概念中的时间空间无关的、穿越深度的旅行。
You journey through intensities, as I have told you. These moment points are like spirals however, and journeying through them these other portions of the self will come in contact with both future and past actions, that have occurred, or will occur, according to the view point of the ego.如我告诉过你的，你透过强度旅行。这些片刻点就像螺旋形的，透过旅行过它们，这些自己的其他部分，根据自我的观点，同时与已经发生和尚未发生的过去和未来的行动接触。
To this degree Dunne was correct. But the important point, if you will forgive a pun, is that these moment points are all intensities, electrical realities, and traveling through such dimensions involves a transformation of energy from one intensity to another. The whole self, or the entity of which I speak, is composed of all of these selves, but it must be realized that all divisions between these selves are illusions, basically speaking. For the sake of discussion we separate them, but in doing so we almost manage to change the very nature of that which we attempt to study.唐尼到这个阶段是对的。但重点是，如果你允许我一语双关，这些片刻点是所有的强度，电性实相，而旅行过这类维度涉及了能量从一个强度转变成另一个强度。全我，或我所说的存有，是由所有这些自己们组成，但基本上来说，必须了解的是，这些自己们的所有分隔都是幻相。为了讨论，我们区隔它们，但这么做之后，我们几乎改变了我们试图研究的、它们的基本本质。
There is nothing contradictory in the overall in supposing that these multitudinous selves exist simultaneously. And any law of physics that appears to make this supposition incorrect is a law that is an illusion, and that in itself leads to false perceptions.假设这些众多自己们的同时存在是完全不矛盾的。任何看起来让这个假设是错误的物理定律都是一个幻相，而它本身会带向一个错误的感知。
(Besides the sessions on moment points, see those on the electrical field and on action—too numerous to list here.)(除了关于片刻点的这些课，可参阅那些有关电性场域和行动的课——这里有许多可以列举的。)
Such communication between these various selves who compose an entity is natural, continuous. The ego does not perceive the communications, obviously; but the ego, you must understand, is not self one alone, it is only a portion of self one, or the physical self.这种组成存有的、不同自己间的沟通，是自然的、持续的。明显的，自我不能感知这种沟通；但你必须了解，自我并不只是自己一，它只是自己一或这个物质自己的一部分。
Other portions of self one are to some extent aware of these other dimensions. Now you see where we are heading. For now consider what we shall call self A. And we shall say that he is the physical self in the physical universe. He is composed of physical matter, he is composed of psychological matter, a portion of this latter being ego. From your own work you realize however that this individual, or self A, is indeed more than physical matter, even while he exists within the physical dimension.自己一的其他部分某程度是觉察到这些其他的维度。现在你们知道我们要说的标题了。现在思考一下我们称作的自己A。而我们应该说他是物质宇宙里的物质自己。他是由物质成分所组成的，也是由心理成分所组成的，后者的一部分是自我。不过从你们自己的工作可以了解这个人，或自己A，确实不只是物质成分，即使当他存在这个物质维度里。
In the dreaming state and in other states of consciousness, he can indeed to some degree become aware of perceptions which will be neglected by the ego alone. In other words, psychologically there is only one portion of self A that is limited in its perceptions to the physical dimension, and that is the ego.在梦的状态或意识的其他状态，他确实某种程度能觉察到只被自我所忽略的感知。换句话说，心理上自己A只有一部分对物质维度的感知是局限的，而那是自我。
But self A is not limited to the egos perceptions only, therefore it may be said that self As perceptions are not limited, in toto, to the field in which it exists. For it is not so limited in dreams and in other states, yet while consciousness is in these other conditions, self A still exists within physical reality.但自己A并不局限在自我的感知里，因此可以说，自己A的感知并不完全的局限在他所存在的领域。在梦或其他的状态里就没有如此的局限了，当意识还在这些其他的状况时，自己A也仍存在于物质实相里。
If self A were limited to the perceptions of the ego, and if self A were limited then to the dimensions in which it found itself, then my dear friends precognition in dreams would be impossible, and in order to perceive the future self A would of necessity be forced to discontinue existence within the physical system.假如自己A是局限在自我的感知里，而假如自己A是局限在他所在的维度里，那么我亲爱的朋友，梦里的预知就是不可能的，而为了感知未来，自己A就必须被迫在物质系统里终止存在。
I am going to give you a break, and we shall begin then with our material for Dr. Instream, and see what we can do with our time systems.我要让你们休息一下，然后我们要开始我们殷斯翠姆博士的资料了，看看在我们的时间系统里能做什么。
(Break at 9:50. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed. Her delivery had again been fast and very emphatic. Jane said she “felt" parts of the delivery. She said she could have spoken much faster had my writing been able to keep up.(9:50休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着。她的口述快且有力。珍说她“感觉到”口述内容的一部分。她说她能说得快到我跟不上。
(At break Jane mentioned something that had been on her mind. She was aware of course that Lorraine had brought a test envelope. Jane now wondered whether I would try to be tricky, and perhaps keep Lorraines envelope for a later test, while giving her the usual envelope that I had prepared. Jane took it for granted that I had a test envelope ready also. I didn't commit myself in any way.(在休息的时候，珍说了一件她心中想的事。她当然知道洛琳带来一个测验信封。珍现在想知道，我会不会试着用些计策，也许把洛琳的信封放到下一次的测验，而把我平常准备的信封给她。珍理所当然地认为我一定也有一个测验信封。我没有肯定地回答会是怎样。
(It was now time for the 27th Dr. Instream test. As usual Jane sat with her eyes closed, her left hand to her face, her head down. Her pace was slow at the start, but picked up rather well as the test proceeded. Resume at 10:05.)(现在是时候开始第27次殷斯翠姆博士测试。一如往常，珍坐着，眼睛闭着，头低着，左手放在脸上。她的速度刚开始比较慢，随着课的进行慢慢恢复正常。10:05重新开始。)
Now, give me a moment, please. (Pause.)现在，请等我们一下。(停顿)
These are my impressions. A series of small boxes, as in a post office, though I believe they are connected with the college.我的印象是这些。一系列的小箱子，像在邮局的那种，虽然我认为它们和大学有关。
They are rectangular, and fairly deep. (Pause.) He has been working there, I believe, on marking grades, or making out some sort of reports which are finding their way into these boxes. He sits now (at 10:09) at a table like a card table, I believe alone, with a game of some sort before him, or at least with a board such as a checkerboard. (Pause.)它们是长方形的，相当深。(停顿)我想他曾在那里整理评分，或把某些写好的报告放进箱子里。他现在坐在(10:09)一个像牌桌的桌子旁。我相信是他独自一人，有某种游戏在他前面，或至少是某种类似跳棋的棋盘。(停顿)
The object before him on the table does have checks upon it. Some are black, and the object is flat and of cardboard. He is in a robe, slippers and pajamas, with a door behind him. I believe to a clothes closet. (Pause.)放在他面前桌子上的物件确实有棋子。有些是黑色的，还有物件是扁平的，硬纸板似的。他穿着长袍、拖鞋，还有睡衣，有一扇门在他身后。我想是一个衣柜。(停顿)
I pick up once more a connection with boxes, but here in this room. And they are larger, perhaps shoe boxes or that type.我又再次收到和箱子有关联，但是在这个房间里。它们比较大，也许是鞋盒或类似的。
I also pick up a rather uncharacteristic connection with a pipe. Either he has been given one, or he has purchased one; but there is a connection with a pipe here.我也收到一个相当奇怪的，和烟斗的连结。或者有人送他、或者是他买了一个；但这里和烟斗有连结。
(Jane now took a long pause at 10:12.)(现在，珍在10:12分有一个长的停顿。)
A carpeted hall outside the door; and it seems an overnight guest, who has in his possession a leather like bag that is not a suitcase, but meant to hold papers. (Pause.) Light brown, fairly new in appearance, having I believe about its edges brass or gold colored bands of some sort. The initial C connected with the owner of the bag, and also perhaps a G, though I am not certain of this last letter.在门外是一个铺了地毯的大厅。似乎有一个过夜的客人，他有一个类似皮革的包，不是公文包，但里面可以装纸张。(停顿)浅咖啡色，外观看起来相当新，我想皮包边缘有类似黄铜或金色的装饰。缩写C或和皮包的主人有关，也可能是G，虽然最后这点我不很确定。
Now do you have a test for me, Joseph?现在，约瑟，你有测验要给我吗？
(“Yes. Here you are.”(“是的。在这里。”
(I handed Jane Lorraines sealed envelope. Jane reached out for it without opening her eyes at 10:16. As she has done a few times recently, she held the envelope flat against her forehead while speaking a few words, then lowered it to her lap. Her pace was again broken by pauses, none of them very long with one exception. This is the 24th envelope test.)(我拿洛琳封好的信封给珍。在10:16分，珍向前倾，把信接过去，没有睁开眼睛。就像她最近做了几次的那样，她说了几个字就把信封平贴在额头，然后放在她的大腿上。她的速度被很多次停顿给打断了，除了一次，其他都不长。这是第24次信封测验。)
Now please give us a moment.现在，请给我们一点时间。
A connection with a turbulent event, or unpleasantness. Four seven. The initial M, a connection with four people, and an afternoon. A location not in this city, that is a connection with a location not of this city.和一件混乱的事，或不愉快的事有关联。47。缩写M，和4个人，还有一个下午有关。一个不在这个城市的地点，和一个不在这个城市里的地点有关联。
A connection with a blue saucer, with an event of 1965, winter, and with an event I believe occurring approximately 1947.和一个蓝色的茶碟，一件1965年的事，冬天，和一件我想大约发生在1947年的事件有关。
A disturbance again, and a storm; whether or not this storm is physical I do not know.再次的，一场骚动和一个风暴；我不知道这个风暴是不是物质性的。
(Jane took a long pause at 10:20.)(珍在10:20长时间停顿。)
A miscellany of objects, designs that appear like numbers. A connection with a family record; as a page, for example, from a book.混杂在一起的物件，看起来像有数字的设计。和一件家庭记录有关。例如，一本书里的一页。
And a very distant connection with a child’s hair ribbon. A wide band sort; this applies to the child’s ribbon.和一个孩子的发带有遥远的连接。一个宽的发箍之类的；用在孩子身上的发带。
I pick up the number seven, and this could refer to the age, that is, of the child who wore the ribbon.我收到数字7，这可以指的是年龄，指戴发带的那个孩子。
We have here also the impression of a box once more, and I will tell you later why I have repeated this impression.在这里也有一个盒子的印象，我稍后会告诉你们为什么我会重复这个印象。
A connection also with four numbers, I believe in a row. I suggest your break.也和4个数字有关联，我想是排成一行。我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:25. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her pace had been slow.(10:25休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，速度比较慢。
(See the tracing on page 169. The test object is a visitor 's pass, produced by the Arnot-Ogden Hospital, where Lorraine is a secretary. This particular pass had been discarded; Lorraine picked it out of a wastebasket on the spur of the moment last August.(请见上图。测验物件是一张访客通行证，是属于亚纳奥登医院(Arnot-Ogden Hospital)，洛琳是那里的秘书。这张通行证被丢弃；是洛琳去年8月，一时冲动从废纸篓里捡回来的。
(Since the test object was picked by someone other than me, I had thought that some of Seth's connections might be difficult to trace, and it appears to be the case here. Since the part of the data we can judge is pretty much on the ball, we think it reasonable to assume that the rest of Seth's data may be equally good. Jane was pleased by the test.(因为测验物件并不是我选的，我想赛斯说的一些连结可能很难去追踪，看起来这正好就是一个例子。因为部分的资料我们觉得相当正确，所以我们合理的推论是，剩下的资料也应该很正确。珍很满意这次的测验。
(This is the first envelope test wherein the test object was picked by someone from outside.(这是第一次信封测验物件是由外面的人来选的。
(As stated before Jane was somewhat nervous this evening, resuming sessions and tests after the vacation. As soon as she gave the initial M, in the beginning of the data, she thought of Lorraines entity name, Marleno. Jane caught herself at once, she now said, in order to prevent possible distortions growing out of this thought. She said “To hell with it, ” to herself, relaxed, and kept on speaking for Seth. She completely cut off her own associations; this ability to discriminate, Seth has told us, is very important, and will grow steadily on Janes part.(之前说过的，珍今天晚上有点紧张，因为在假期过后重新开始课和测验。当一开始她给了缩写M的资料时，她想到了洛琳存有的名字，玛蕾诺。珍注意到了这点，她说，为了避免因为这个想法而产生的可能扭曲。她告诉自己“没关系”，放松，然后继续为赛斯说话。她成功的切断了自己的联想；赛斯告诉过我们，这个区分的能力十分重要，珍在这部分持续稳定的成长。
(It seems reasonable to describe a stay in the hospital as “a turbulent event, or unpleasantness, ” and as “A disturbance again, and a storm; whether or not this storm is physical I do not know. ” We of course realize there might be other connections in the private life of the patient, Miss Margaret M. Bunn. Lorraine does not know Miss Bunn. It is possible the hospital records contain more on Miss Bunn that would be revealing here, but I did not ask Lorraine to try to check.(描述住院是“一件混乱的事，或不愉快的事”应该很合理，还有“再次的，一场骚动或一个风暴；我不知道这个风暴是不是物质性的”。这里我们自然认为这可能和这个病人，玛格丽特·邦恩[Margaret M. Bunn]的私人生活有关联。洛琳并不认识邦恩小姐。医院可能有更多关于邦恩小姐的记录，但我没有要求洛琳试着去查。
(“The initial M" is a hit. We can offer no connection with “four people, and an afternoon.” “A location not in this city, that is a connection with a location not of this city, ” is a hit, Mansfield, PA, being the other location.(“缩写M”是对的。我们无法提供任何和“4个人，还有一个下午”有关的连结。“一个不在这个城市的地点，和一个不在这个城市里的地点有关联”，是正确的，宾州马斯柏[Mansfield,PA]这个地方。
("Blue saucer” rings no bells, or “winter, " or “an event I believe occurring approximately 1947.” “An event of1965 ” can apply, since Miss Bunn was admitted to the hospital on June 7,1965.(“蓝色的茶碟”，或“冬天”，或“一件大约发生在1947年的事件”并没有让我想到什么。“一件1965年的事”可用在邦恩小姐在1965年7月住院的事上。
(“A miscellany of objects, designs that appear like numbers, ” is we think a reference to the words and numbers on the pass. “A connection with a family record; as a page, for example, from a book, ” is a hit. The visitor's pass contains a number code referring to Miss Bunns hospital record, Lorraine tells us; and the pass is like a page from a book, in that such passes are kept in spiral books at the hospital.(“混杂在一起的物件，看起来像有数字的设计”，我们认为是通行证上面的数字和文字的符号。“和一份家庭记录有关。例如，一本书里的一页”是对的。洛琳告诉我们，访客通行证上有一个数字编码，指的是邦恩小姐的医疗记录；通行证就像是从一本书撕下来的一页，像这样的通行证是收在医院的环圈记录簿里。
(We probably will never check on the data referring to a child’s hair ribbon, the child’s age, etc.(我们可能永远无法核对有关小孩的发带和小孩的年纪等等资料。
(The numbers “Four seven’’ are on the pass, and also “four numbers, I believe in a row, ” if you want to isolate this many from longer groups. On the last line of the data on Miss Bunn some numbers are barely legible; we can see the impression of four numbers in a row here also.(数字“47”在通行证上，还有“4个孩子，我想是排成一行”，如果你想把这些从较久远的资料群里筛出来，在邦恩小姐资料的最后一行，有些数字已经不太清楚了；我们在这里也可以看到4个数字排成一行的痕迹。
(Jane had no idea as to why Seth referred to a box again. She told us she enjoyed the test involving a more impersonal object, in the sense that I did not choose it. However Jane was as much aware of the emotional charges surrounding this object; she felt that she was quite aware of the emotional disturbances involved in a hospital stay in this particular case.(珍不知道赛斯为什么又再次的提到盒子。她告诉我们，她享受一个更不具个人物件的测验，意思指不是我挑选的物件。不过珍一样觉察到围绕这个物件的情绪感染力；她感觉她觉察到关于这个特别的案例在住院期间的情感骚动。
(I would like to add a curious note. Note that Miss Bunn lives on Wellsboro St. in Mansfield, PA. Mansfield is a college town about seventy miles distant. I was born there. In addition, my father was born in Wellsboro PA., a small town perhaps twenty miles beyond Mansfield. As far as I know Lorraine Shafer doesn’t know of my family connections with Mansfield and Wellsboro. She also told us she merely picked the test object out of a group, without paying particular attention to it.(我想增加一个有趣的注记。邦恩小姐住在宾州马斯柏的韦斯波若街。马斯柏是一个70英里远的大学城。我在那里出生。另外，我爸爸是在宾州的韦斯波若出生，一个距离马斯柏大约20英里的小镇。就我所知，洛琳·雪佛并不知道我家和马斯柏以及韦斯波若的关联。她也告诉我，她只是从一堆东西里选了一个物件，并没有特别注意到它。
(Jane resumed in a quiet voice, her eyes closed, at 10:50.)(珍眼睛闭着，以一种轻柔的声音在10:50分重新开始。)
I am not going to keep you. I wanted however to mention one small point concerning the box image that was repeated in both tests.我并没有打算要耗着你们。不过我想要提一下，关于两次测验都重复提到的盒子印象。
This has to do with two separate principles. First of all there was a retention of image. Second of all, there was quite separately an association because of the size of the card given as test object.
