In the second case the association was Ruburt’s, for on his own he picked up a file-card image, but he translated this into the image of a box in which such file cards are often kept.这和两个分开的原理有关。第一个是印象的保留。第二个，这里对作为测验物件的卡的大小有一个单独的联想。第二个是鲁柏的联想，他自己收到了一个档案卡印象，但他把这个转成一个常用来放这种卡的盒子印象。
(Jane's eyes now opened. They were very dark. She lit a cigarette, and as she smoked and talked her eyes began to open frequently.)(珍的眼睛现在是睁开的，眼神很深邃。她点了一根烟，当她抽烟和说话时，眼睛频繁地睁开。)
Now while this association was his own, it was caused by the image retention carrying over from the first test. I want it clear that two rather than one causes existed for this second box image or impression.现在，这个联想是他自己的，是从第一个测验带来的留存印象而引起的。我想说得很清楚，是因为两个，而不是一个原因导致了这第二个盒子印象或影像的存在。
Actually it was fairly legitimate, but not carried far enough on Ruburt’s part. In this case he did very well in closing off his own associations.事实上它相当合理，但鲁柏做得不够。在这个例子，他做得非常好的是关闭了他自己的联想。
Now when he does so disconnect his own stream of consciousness in this manner, any correct associations on his part will automatically show themselves in the data through attraction. They will become incorporated with my data in a constructive fashion. This is fairly important, and we shall follow it up by examples when possible. For I will perceive certain types of information that are basic, and when Ruburts abilities, his own abilities as apart from mine, are fully developed, then he will be able to add certain specifics that have direct personal application.现在当他以这种方式关上自己意识流的时候，任何在他那里正确的联想会透过吸引力自动的在资料上显现出来。它们会以一种建设性的方式并入我的资料。这很重要，可能的话我们会加上一些例子。我可以感知到某类基本的讯息，当鲁柏的能力，有别于我的，而是他自己的能力充分发展后，他可以增加某些详细的、直接适用于这个人的讯息。
My information will indeed be specific enough, but there are certain human interrelationships that he will more precisely perceive, for they have no particular meaning for me.我的讯息的确够明确，但有某些人际的互动关系，他能更正确地感知到，因为它们对我没有特别的意义。
I will discuss this more thoroughly, perhaps at our next session so as not to keep you this evening, for I do not believe that I have quite made myself clear.我会更全面地讨论这一点，也许在下一节课里，这样就不用在今晚留你们太久，我想我并没有把它说得很清楚。
(I thought the information clear enough, and quite important. Not wanting Seth to continue in this fashion because of the hour, I picked another question. Sitting across the table from me, Jane appeared ready to continue beyond closing time.(我想讯息已经很清楚了，而且十分重要。因为时间的关系，我不希望赛斯以这种方式继续，我换了一个问题。珍坐在桌子的另一边，我的对面，看起来准备继续说下去。
(“What about the pair of eyes I saw so clearly last month, while I was in bed? Can you say a few words about this?"(“关于上个月，当我躺在床上看得很清楚的那只眼睛，你能对这件事说几句话吗？
(Jane, her eyes open, smiled at me quite deliberately.)(珍，她的眼睛闭着，不慌不忙地对着我微笑。)
I did not know that you would tempt me with such a question at the end of a session; and you have no one but yourself to blame, if the session continues longer than you would have it.我不知道你会在课的最后以这个问题引诱我；如果课延长了，那你只能怪你自己了。
(“Well, perhaps we’d better let it go then. ")(“那也许我们应该下次再说。”)
You were dealing, indeed, with a legitimate perception into a dimension outside of the ones with which you are familiar, and with a distortion of a sort on your part, as once again you attempted to translate inner data into a form that could be perceived by the physical senses.你以一种合理的感知在处理一个你不熟知的维度，在你的部分有某种扭曲，再次的，你试图转译内在资料到一个可以被肉体感官所感知的一种形式。
(Jane opened her eyes. Since Seth did not go into my latest vision this evening, I’ll save a description of it for next session. The last vision of mine that he discussed took place on August 30,1965, and is dealt with in the 183rd session. It was of the head of a man I had known centuries earlier in a previous life, according to Seth.)(珍睁开她的眼睛。因为赛斯今晚没有提到我最近的一个视像，我把描述留到下一节。最后一次他讨论到我的视像是在1965年8月30日，第183节。据赛斯说，那是一个在几世纪以前的前世，我认识的一个男人的头部。)
Now. I am in fine form. Ruburt is doing well. I realize that the hour has grown late in your time one, so I shall leave it to you as to whether or not I continue a most interesting discussion this evening. You may do as you think best.现在。我在一个很好的状态。鲁柏做得很好。我明白在你们的时间一里时间已经晚了，所以我应该让你们决定是否要我继续今晚最有趣的讨论。你们选择对你们最好的方式。
(“Will you continue this discussion in the next session?")(“你下一节会继续讨论这个吗？”)
Very well. You must admit that I gave you your moneys worth this evening.当然可以。你必须承认我今晚值回票价。
(“Yes. Thank you.”)(“是的。谢谢你。”)
My heartiest wishes to you both. And if our friend had been able to stay later we could have done rather well with her, for again our conditions were right.我对你们俩最衷心的祝福。如果我们的朋友能待得更晚，我们可以和她做得更好，再次的，我们的状况很好。
(Here Seth refers to Lorraine Shafer, who had to leave at last break. He also did well with Lorraine during the last session she witnessed, witnessed the 195th of October 4, 1965, delivering quite a bit of information on Lorraines past; she verified much of it. See Volume 4.)(这里赛斯指的是洛琳∙雪佛，她在上一次休息时离开了。在洛琳上一次参与的课，他也做得很好，那是在1965年10月4日，第195节，他口述了关于洛琳过去的一些资料；她确认了其中的很多面。见第四册。)
When we have time I have some remarks, or will have, concerning your Miss Callahan; and also some remarks concerning Ruburts business matters. For now however I wish you good evening.当我们有时间的时候，我们会针对卡拉汉小姐有一些评论，另外对鲁柏的事业也会有一些评论。不过，现在我祝你们晚安。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:09. Jane was very well dissociated, she said, even though her eyes had been open at times. She said Seth could have continued indefinitely; Seth had her in a “low ” state that seemed to require hardly any of her own energy, Jane said. She now felt very good. The dryness had left her throat; she thought it the result of nervousness at resuming the sessions.(11:09结束。珍说她的出离状态非常好，即使她的眼睛有时候是睁开的。她说赛斯可以无止尽的持续下去；珍说赛斯让她处在一个“低沉”的状态，那似乎不需要使用到任何她自己的能量。她现在感觉非常好。喉咙的干涩感已经没有了；她认为那是重新开始上课的紧张感所造成的。
(Miss Callahan is an elderly retired school teacher who lives in the front apartment. Her memory has been affected by a series of small strokes. Seth has considered her in earlier sessions, and she was also the subject of some of Jane's first recorded clairvoyant dreams. These took place at the beginning of Miss Callahan's illness. Seth discussed the progress of her troubles for a while in succeeding sessions, apparently accurately. Jane is still very solicitous for Miss Callahans welfare.(卡拉汉小姐住在前面的公寓里，是一位年长的退休老师。她的记忆被连续几次的小中风给影响了。赛斯在早期的课里有提过她，还有她也是珍第一次记录的几个预知梦里的主角。这些发生在卡拉汉小姐生病的初期。赛斯在随后的课里讨论了她问题的进展，而这显然相当正确。珍仍十分关心卡拉汉小姐的健康。
(In addition, Miss Callahan is the only person we have located who taught Frank Watts’ children in grade and high school; Frank Watts was the first personality Jane contacted in these sessions and was soon replaced by Seth. According to Seth Frank Watts had a high regard for Miss Callahan as a person and as a teacher. Miss Callahan however, cannot remember Frank Watts; only that she taught some “Watts children ”. See Volume I for Callahan and Watts material.)(另外，卡拉汉小姐是唯一一个我们知道高中有教过法兰克·沃兹孩子的老师，法兰克·沃兹是珍在这些课里第一个接触到的人格，后来很快被赛斯取代。据赛斯所说，法兰克·沃兹对卡拉汉小姐这个人、这个老师有很高的评价。不过卡拉汉小姐不记得法兰克·沃兹了，只记得她教过一些“姓是沃兹的孩子”。见第一册卡拉汉和沃兹的资料。)
(Tracings of the sales slips used in the 25th envelope test, in the 220th session, January 5,1966.)用在1966年1月5日第220节第25次信封测验的购物单素描

SESSION 220 第220节 罗的视像：另一层面的眼睛 信封25


JANUARY 5, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1966年1月5日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(For this evening's envelope test I used two sales slips stemming from Christmas shopping Jane and I did. They are on paper the weight of this page. I put them down between the usual two pieces of Bristol, and enclosed them in the usual sealed double envelope.(今晚的信封测验，我用的是珍和我圣诞节购物的两张购物单。它们是和这一页差不多重量的纸。我把它们放进两张厚纸板，封在普通的信封里。
(On page 177 of the last session Seth mentioned a recent vision of mine, and promised to discuss it further this evening. Since he does so I will now describe it in some detail. It took place in December, as I lay in bed suspended in that pleasant interlude between waking and sleeping; I’ve had other visions while in this state, incidentally.(在上一节，赛斯提到我最近的视像，而他答应将在今晚做更深入的讨论。因为他要这样做，所以现在我想先叙述一些细节。这发生在12月，当时我躺在床上，悬浮在一种愉快的半梦半醒间；顺道一提，当在这种状态时，我曾有过其他的视像。
(I realized on this particular evening that although my eyes were closed, I was staring into another pair of eyes that seemed to be within inches of my own, and had been doing so for some seconds. Conscious realization seemed to be suspended. These eyes were I would say masculine, and very beautiful, and could be human. They were a deep luminous golden brown; I realized I was so close to them that I could see their minutest details in vivid color, even upper lids that fell over the upper portion of the eyeball. At this stage of the phenomenon I encouraged this minute inspection, for I lay suspended below alarm.(在这个特别的晚上，我明白虽然我的眼睛闭着，却是盯着一双大约距离我的眼睛一英寸的另一只眼，而且持续了几秒钟。意识上的认知似乎停止了。我可以说这只眼是男性的、很漂亮，可能是属于人类的眼睛。它们是深邃、发亮的金棕色；我明白我离它们是那么的近，以至于我可以看到那清晰颜色的细微之处，甚至是盖过眼球上半部的上眼睑。在这种现象的状态下，我仔细的审视是因为我没什么警戒的躺着。
(I saw the reddish rims of these eyes, and their black lashes with the utmost clarity. The skin about them was a light brown. At the fringes of my field of vision I saw that the face containing these magnificent eyes was quite hairy, covered by long black shining hair almost as though I was visualizing a throwback to more primitive man. But there was no sense of primitiveness here; these limpid brown eyes regarded me impassively; there was no intrinsic threat. These eyes merely stared back at me from beneath heavy black brows.(我看见这只眼的虹膜，黑睫毛根根分明。皮肤是浅棕色。在我视线范围的边缘，我看见有着这只美丽眼睛的脸是多毛的，覆盖着黑亮的头发，就好像我回到过去，在看着一个比较原始时期的人。但这里并没有原始的感觉；这只清晰的棕色眼睛无表情地看着我；并不带威胁性。这只眼睛只是从一只黑色浓眉下盯着我看。
(As soon as I fully, consciously, realized what was taking place, I reacted violently in the manner described below by Seth. Within a very brief period after this unfortunate reaction, I began to regret it, for I knew I had terminated something much too soon. I thought my reaction was a normal one, yet was angry at myself for reacting so strongly. My outcry, my thrashing about in bed and waving my arms, of course startled Jane; I believe she had not yet fallen asleep. I blamed myself for not knowing enough to suspend any conscious judgment; I felt I had enough background knowledge to go along with this vision, to see what developed, yet I had reacted in what I thought a foolish way.(当我完全地、有意识地明白发生了什么之后，我以赛斯在下面描述的方式激烈的反应着。在这个令人遗憾的反应发生后的一小段时间，我开始后悔，因为我知道我太快结束某个东西，我认为我的反应是正常的，但我还是对我自己这么强烈的反应生气。我的叫喊和我挥着手臂打着床板的动作理所当然地吓到珍；我相信她还没有入睡。我怪自己不懂得暂缓任何意识上的判断；我觉得我应该对这个视像有足够的背景知识，可以看看发生了什么，但我却用我认为很愚蠢的方式去反应。
(Strange to say, I did not come fully awake as one does when arising in the morning for example. I achieved a state close to waking only, in spite of my momentary panic. Jane began to question me; she told me the next morning that I described the vision to her while speaking in a sleepy monotone. I was conscious of doing this, and that it took some little time, yet felt no urge to prod myself wide awake. I recall that I felt it urgent that I tell her what had taken place as soon as possible. I thought of getting up to make a drawing of what I had seen, but decided I would not forget. This is certainly true; this vision is as vivid and clear in memory today as it was a second after it ended. I do intend making a drawing, in color, for those who may be interested.(奇怪的是，我当时并没有像一般早上醒来那样完全的清醒。我只接近一个醒来的状态，尽管我有短暂的恐慌。珍开始问我，她隔天早上告诉我，我以一种有睡意的单音调描述了我的视像。我有意识到我这样做，而它只花了一点时间，我不觉得我需要完全的清醒。我记得我觉得这很急迫，所以一发生时我就告诉她了。我想到起来以后要画一张我所看到的景象，但后来并没有，因为我不会忘记。这绝对是真的；这个视像到今天还是一样逼真清楚的在我的记忆里，虽然只发生了一秒钟。我打算为对这有趣的人画一张图，彩色的。
(In addition, Seth has given enough information upon these visions so that I thought I had probably distorted quite valid and alien data into a form I could understand.(另外，赛斯对这些视像说了够多的讯息，因此我觉得我可能扭曲了十分有效和陌生的资料，以便它们能成为我所能了解的形式。
(I would add that when I realized I was receiving information for the first time, on a level below that of alarm, I encouraged this flow of data. I believe my perception then sharpened to some degree, and it was at this moment that I saw so clearly the minutest detail of the eyes, the shadow below the lids, the individual lashes, etc. I would say that at this moment of suspended judgment, before the ego exerted its authority, I was perfectly willing to receive this data and to examine it.(这里我要加注，当我了解到这是我第一次在不警醒的时候收到讯息，我鼓励着这种资料流。我相信我的感知某种程度变得比较敏锐了，所以当时我能看清楚那只眼睛的细微之处，眼下的阴影、每一根睫毛等等。我可以说，在那个判断暂缓的当下，在自我开始拿回主控权之前，我很愿意收到这样的资料并检视它。
(The last vision of mine that Seth discussed took place on August 30,1965, during waking hours, and was mentioned in the 183rd session of that evening.(上一次赛斯讨论我的视像是发生在1965年8月30日，那是发生在清醒的状态，在第183节那晚的课有提到。
(The session tonight was held in our large front room. Jane likes to use this room since it is larger than the back room we have used for the past few months, out of a fear of interruptions. She began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her pace was good, her voice average.)(今晚的课是在前面比较大的房间举行的。珍喜欢用这一间，因为它比我们过去几个月所用的后面那间要大，也不用害怕被打断。她开始坐着说话，眼睛闭着。她的速度很好，音量适中。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. Before I discuss your experience, the image that you saw, let me make a few preliminary remarks.现在。在讨论你的经验和你看到的影像之前，让我先做一些初步的评论。
First of all, you understand from our discussions concerning planes and fields in general, that these are more multitudinous than you can imagine. A proportion of these will be discussed along with the nature of time, since some of these are connected with probabilities that could have occurred within your physical system.首先，从我们的讨论里，你了解了基本的层面和场域，而这些比你想像的更为多样。有部分会在时间的本质时讨论，因为这里有一合法性和会发生在你物质系统里的可能性有关联。
(Seth referred to this bewildering multiplicity very early in the sessions, and dealt with it rather extensively in the 12th session of January 2,1964, in his first explanation of what he calls the fifth dimension. He has told us we could never cover even a portion of the numberless fields bordering even our own; some will be explained as they impinge upon our own in various ways; Seth also has mentioned his own ability to travel through a few other fields. See Volume 1.)(赛斯在课的很早期就提过这个令人困惑的多样性，当他在1964年1月2日第12节，第一次解释第五空间的时候就曾大量的提到它。他告诉我们，我们永远无法涵盖无数的场域疆界，即使是关于我们自己。当它们以不同的方式影响我们的时候，有些会被解释到。赛斯也提到他自己旅行过一些其他场域的能力。见第一册。)
In your particular state of consciousness on that particular evening, your attention strayed beyond your ordinary fields of perception. You perceived an inhabitant of another system. There was indeed a quite unusual point of contact reached; most unusual indeed in that you not only perceived this individual, but he also perceived you.在那个特别的夜晚，你意识特别的状态，你的注意力飘荡在你平常感知的场域之上。你感知到另一个系统的居民。这的确是一个十分不寻常的接触点；确实太不寻常，你不只感知到这个人，而且他也感知到了你。
(Jane's eyes opened. They were very dark. She stared at me and tapped upon the table for emphasis. Her eyes now opened frequently until break.)(珍的眼睛睁开着。它们非常深邃。她盯着我，为了强调而轻敲桌面。直到休息时，她的眼睛一直频繁的睁开。)
The point of such contact can indeed be mathematically shown, and in the future I shall do just that. Part of your own reaction, I believe, was due to the fact that you realized that this contact represented a personal encounter, that this bizarre apparition was aware of you as you were of him.这样的接触点确实可以用数学上的方式表现，未来我应该会这样做。我相信，有部分你的反应是因为，你了解这样的接触代表了一种个人的接触。这个古怪的幽灵知觉到你就好像你知觉到他一样。
(“What was his reaction to me?"(“那他对我的反应是什么？”
(Jane smiled.)(珍笑了。)
First you displayed, if I may say so, a rather unfortunate reaction. You were quite ready to strike out physically at what you could not understand. And this reaction broke the contact.首先，如果我可以这么说，你表露了一个相当不适当的反应。你准备去打那个你不知道的东西。而这个反应中断了这样的接触。
You did not break it purposely, but the other individual concerned was bewildered, and to some extent frightened, and he withdrew. You were indeed quite willing to strike out physically. It was this emotional reaction that was felt by the other individual, and the other individual had no idea what this emotion was.你不是有意打断它，但另一个人也很迷惑，到某种程度是害怕，而他退缩了。你几乎快在身体上打到他了。是这个情绪的反应被另一个人感觉到，而这另一个人完全不知道这种情绪是什么。
Now. The portion of the image that came closest to any semblance of reality was the region about the eyes, and the eyes themselves. There is much to be said here. For this was not imaginary, in that it did have a certain physical reality that existed within your field of reference.现在。最靠近实相外观的那部分影像就是眼睛这个地方，眼睛本身。这里有更多可以说的。这并不是想像的，它有某种存在你们参考场域的物质实相。
You must understand however that momentarily you had a reality in the reference field of that other individual. The contact was mutual. Now we know what the conditions were at your end. We know that you made no attempt to aim your attention in the particular direction that would allow you to perceive that definite system.不过你必须了解，你短暂的有了一个、另一个人参考场域的实相。接触是双方的。现在我们知道在你的部分状况是什么。我们知道你并没有意图朝一个特别的方向，瞄准你的注意力去感知那明确的系统。
You could just as well have tuned in, so to speak, on any one of the numberless other such systems. The individual within this particular other system, however, has a different sort of psychological makeup than your own. He is not as capable of intense concentration within as large a perspective as that possessed by your ego.可以这么说，你可以很好的把你自己调频到任何其他这样的系统。不过，这个在特定其他系统里的个人，有一个与你自己不同的心理组成。他无法强烈的关注在你的自我所拥有的广大观点上。
We have spoken, saying that the ego has a relatively small but intense focus. Your friend however has an even smaller specific field of attention, to your way of thinking. The concentration however and the focus is much more intense than that with which you are familiar.我们曾说过，自我有着一个相对小但强烈的聚焦。用你们的思考方式，你的朋友有一个更小、特定的注意力场域。不过，注意力和焦点比你们所熟悉的更强烈。
Its general field of awareness however is much larger than any with which you are familiar, and he has a greater control and focus within this larger generalized field than you possess in your comparable generalized field of perception. His dissociated states, for example, make up a much larger portion of his perception, and they are more vivid than mankinds generalized dissociated conditions.它觉察力的一般性场域比你们所熟知的要更广大，相对于你们所拥有类似的感官一般性场域，他对这个较大的一般性场域有着更大的控制力和专注力。例如，他的出离状态构成了他知觉力的一个更大部分，而他们比人类普遍的出离状态要更逼真。
Because his range was so large, your dissociated conditions simply met more easily than otherwise. However, once his attention was centered here, he turned his conscious attention to full focus upon what he perceived. Nor did he perceive your physical form as you know it. But he picked up fully your emotional recognition and fear, and these were translated or perceived by him in his own fashion, so that to him you appeared as a mass of varying colors, and as movement of severe intensity.因为他的范围是如此之大，你的出离状态单纯的比其他的更容易达到。不过，他的注意力曾一度围绕在这里，他把他有意识的注意力完全集中在他所感知到的东西上。他并没有如你所以为的，感知到你肉体的形式。但他完全接收到了你情绪上的认知和恐惧，而这些以他自己的方式被转译或感知，所以对他来说，你的显像是一团变化的颜色和非常强烈的动作。
The pulsations were caused by the action of your emotional state. And you, my dear Joseph, literally frightened him away. You on your part translated what was inner data into a form that you could, or hoped to, understand. The eyes were the first images that you saw.这个律动是被你情绪状态的动作所引起的。而你，我亲爱的约瑟，把他吓跑了。在你这里，你把内在的资料转译为你可以或你希望能了解的形式。这只眼睛是你看到的第一个形象。
I suggest a break and we shall continue.我建议休息，然后我们还会继续。
(Break at 9:25. Jane reported that she had been quite well dissociated for a first delivery—-far-out, as she puts it. Her eyes had been open more than closed, very dark as she stared at me. Her pace had been rather good, her voice average and quite amused at times, perhaps chiding in a gentle way.(9:25休息。珍说她在第一段口述的出离状态非常好——她的形容是，在太空远处。她的眼睛睁开来的时候比闭起来的时候多，非常深邃的凝视着我。她的速度很好，音量适中，有时候兴趣盎然，也许是以一种温和的方式责备着。
(She resumed in the same manner, quite emphatic at times, at 9:35.)(她以同样的方式，有时候十分亲切，9:35重新开始。)
Now. Despite my remarks, your reaction was perfectly understandable.现在。不用管我的评论，你的反应是完全可以了解的。
You should learn from it, for with your particular abilities it is possible that other such encounters will occur, though most improbable that the same system or field will be involved.你应该从中学习，以你独特的能力，其他类似的相遇还有可能再发生，虽然不太可能是这里所涉及的同一个系统或场域。
(I have hoped many times for another such contact, with the promise to myself that I would do better next time. I have also used suggestion, although not nightly, to the effect that more such experiences would occur. Nothing has developed to date.)(我有很多次希望能有另一次这样的接触，我承诺自己，下次会做得更好。虽然不是每晚，我也用了暗示，希望这样的经验能再发生。目前还没有什么进展。)
The individual was also bewildered however because he was able to perceive you in what you would call both your future and your past, as well as your present.这个个体也很迷惑，因为他能感知到你所谓的过去和未来，就像能感知到你的现在一样。
He perceived that a portion of you was bound, however, within your present time, and this was almost incomprehensible to him.不过，他感知到一部分的你是受限于你现在的时间，这对他而言是最不能理解的。
Such encounters do occur with what would appear to be startling frequency, when those in your system are sleeping; but they are very seldom remembered. What was however extremely unusual was that this contact was recognized as such by two inhabitants of completely different systems.这样的相遇发生在你们系统睡眠状态的机率，比看起来还要频繁得多。不过它们很少被记得。这样的接触被两个完全不同系统的居民给认出来了，这是很不寻常的。
Such encounters also occur during waking hours, but the ego is not aware of them. I will have some comments later in the session that may enable you to become more aware of other realities beside your own, and also some advice that will enable you to operate within your own system more effectively.这样的相遇也会发生在醒时，但自我无法觉知到它们。我在稍后的课里会有一些解释，可以让你们更觉知在你们自己系统之外的其他实相，也有一些建议能让你在自己的系统里更有效率地运作。
You translated, now, this data into other terms. The alien nature of the individual you translated into an animalistic appearance. This was not to emphasize any lower or base characteristics, but was your way of translating the individual’s exceptionally clear, pure and single-minded perception. For the intensity behind the perception reminded you of the unswerving attention often displayed in animals: a complete lack of trickery as it is understood by you.现在，你把这个资料转译成其他的词汇。你把这个个体的陌异本质转译成一种兽性的外表。这并不是强调任何较低或较底层的特质，但是对这个人你转译的方式是特别的清晰，纯净还有单一心智的感知。这个感知背后的强度让你想起了常出现在动物身上的、坚定不变的注意力：一种完全缺乏你们所理解的狡猾。
It will be most difficult to convince others of the reality of other systems beside their own, yet none of this must be taken upon my say-so alone. For once the knowledge is available, others will become aware of their own experiences, and you see here how the conscious self becomes educated and enriched; for the knowledge becomes part of consciousness. In the past the same experience would have remained only in the subconscious, and you have had other such experiences.最困难的是说服其他人，除了他们自己以外有其他系统的实相，但这些不必只凭借我说的话。一旦这些知识普遍了，其他人会变得觉知他们自己的经验，而你在这里会看到意识的自己是如何的变得可被教育以及丰富；这个知识会成为意识的一部分。在过去，同样的经验可能只能停留在潜意识，而你是有过其他这样经验的。
(Jane's eyes had now been opening often again.)(珍的眼睛再次地经常睁开。)
You are not alone in this however. You have had no other experiences where contact was recognized both by you and the other individual from the other system, however; and he takes what he learned as part of himself now.不过，在这件事上，你并不孤独。你并没有其他这种被你和其他系统的人所认出来的接触经验；而他现在把他学习到的当成他自己的一部分。
I do not know how it would serve you if I tried to describe the sort of plane which he inhabits. And since we are dealing in words some of the information simply would not make sense to you.我不知道如果我试着描述他所居住的那种层面能帮你什么。而因为我们是用文字来描述。有一些讯息对你来说单纯的就是没有意义。
(“Well, can you say a little about it then?”(“好的，但你能说一点点吗？”
(I was of course much interested, and knew that Jane was too. Jane now closed her eyes and sat quietly for a moment.)(我当然非常有兴趣，我知道珍也和我一样。珍现在闭起她的眼睛静静地坐了一会儿。)
It is a system that I cannot pinpoint for you in terms of physical location within your physical universe; though this location is far beyond your own solar system, it still does not exist as a physical mass however.它是一个我无法用你们物质宇宙里的物质所在地来指出的系统；虽然这个所在地比你们自己的太阳系还远，不过它不以一个物质团块的方式存在。
It exists within your physical universe but it is not of your physical universe, and it does not deal with physical matter at all. It is an old system, using your viewpoint. It has what I will call an inverted time system, which I will gladly discuss for you whenever you prefer.它存在你们的物质宇宙里，但不属于你们的物质宇宙，也不处理物质的问题。用你们的观点来说，它是一个旧的系统。我称它为倒置时间系统，不论何时，如果你们愿意的话，我会很乐于跟你们讨论。
There are brain formations, not materialized in physical form. Sensations are perceptions; emotions perceived in terms of color, and directly in terms of intensities. There is no direct relation here to your own system at all, except of course that all systems are ultimately connected. The inverted time system results in a different sequence of experience than that with which you are acquainted.那里有不是以物质形式显现的头脑形成。感觉是知觉；情感是以颜色的形式来感知的，而且直接用强度的形式。这里和你们自己的系统没有直接的关系，只除了最后所有的系统当然是相关联的。倒置时间系统导致了有别你们所熟知的，经验的不同排列。
It is difficult to explain to you in terms you can understand. I will make an analogy, which however will be imperfect. We will take reincarnation as a basis. Imagine that you have had ten reincarnations. These reincarnations all represent portions of your entity, living or experiencing sensation at various times within a physical time system.这很难用你们能了解的语汇来解释。我做一个比喻，不过可能不够完美。我们以转世作为一个基础。想像你有10个转世。这些转世全都代表了你存有的一部分，在一个物质时间系统里不同的时间活着，或经验感受着。
The entity has awareness of these ten portions of itself. Consciously however no one of the ten personalities is aware of the others, nor of the entity. Each of the ten egos travels along an egotistical time of successive moments. We understand that subconsciously much more knowledge is available, but not to the ego as a rule.这存有本身能觉知到自己的这10个部分。不过，意识上这10个人格中没有人能觉知到其他人或是存有。这10个自我的每一个，沿着一个自我的连续性片刻时间而旅行。我们了解潜意识里有更多的知识可以取得，但通常并不是对自我而言。
Now. In this inverted time system individual ten is aware of the experiences of individual two; and individual two is aware of the experiences of individual ten. All of these individuals have access to the experiences of the other. Individual ten may, so to speak, go back without confusion and enter into any experience undergone by any of the other individuals.现在。在这个倒置时间系统里，个体10是可以觉知到个体2的经验；而个体2也能觉知到个体10的经验。所有的这些个体能进入到其他个体的经验。可以这么说，个体10能进入其他个体所经历的经验而毫无困惑的回来。
(This sounds very much like the use of what Seth calls the third, fourth and fifth inner senses: Perception of past, present, and future; the conceptual sense; cognition of knowledgeable tissue. Material on these senses was presented in the 35. 38th sessions.)(这听起来很像赛斯称作第三、第四和第五内在感官的功能：过去、现在和未来的感知；观念的感官；认识见多识广的本质。这些感官的资料出现在第35至38节。)
There is no time boundary as you know it. This is obviously a gestalt. The experiences however of individual two, for example, are constantly being changed because of the intervention of the other personalities.这里并没有如你所知的时间界线。这很明显的是一个完形。例如，个体2的经验会因为其他人格的介入而持续的被改变。
We had better take our break, for our Dr. Instream material will begin shortly.我们最好休息一下，因为我们殷斯翠姆博士的资料很快就要开始了。
(Break at 10:05. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had been open much of the time, her pace good, her voice average. She said Seth could have continued in this vein, but stopped because the usual tests were due. Seth had the next thought or concept waiting, Jane said, and all she had to do was give voice to it.(10:05休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛大部分时间都是睁开的，她的音量适中，速度很好。她说赛斯能继续这个话题，但因为平常的测验要到了所以停止。珍说，赛斯的下一个想法或概念在等待，而她所做的就是为他发声。
(It was now time for the 28th Dr. Instream test. As usual Janes pace slowed considerably. She spoke with many pauses, sitting with her eyes closed, her head down, her left hand raised to her brow. Resume at 10:10.)(现在是第28次殷斯翠姆博士测试。像往常一样，珍的速度开始减慢。她坐着，眼睛闭着。她的头低着，左手举到她的眉毛上，说话时伴随着很多的停顿。10:10重新开始。)
Now. Give us a moment and we shall see what we can do.现在。等一下，我看看我们能做什么。
Today, a schedule of events, interrupted, a disturbance. (Pause.) Perhaps an illness, and someone in bed.今天，事件的日常安排，被打断，一场骚动。(停顿)也许是一场病，而某个人卧病在床。
A late walk, on Dr. Instreams part I believe this evening.晚上的散步，是殷斯翠姆博士，我相信是今晚。
A small meeting this afternoon, with one older and one younger man. Perhaps at five o’clock. (Pause.) A wish of Dr. Instreams that is fulfilled, having to do with a project.今天下午，和一个老人以及一个年轻人有场小小的会议。也许在5点。(停顿)殷斯翠姆博士的一个愿望会实现，和一项研究有关。
Some guests at his office earlier, in the nature of nuisances. A connection here with Ticonderoga. Perhaps one of the visitors was from there. I do not know, but this has application connected with his office today. (Pause.) I believe he lost a scarf, navy blue. In any case, whether it was lost or found, I see a navy blue scarf on the chair by his desk, in his office. Now; that is, in his office now.早些时候他的办公室有客人，是有点麻烦的性质。在这里和帝康德罗加(Ticonderoga)有关联。也许有一个访客是来自那里。我不知道，但这可能和今天他的办公室有关。(停顿)我相信他丢了一条领巾，海军蓝的。无论如何，不管它是丢了或是被找到，我看到一条海军蓝的领巾在他办公室书桌的椅子上。现在；现在在他的办公室里。
(Jane, her eyes still closed, gestured here as though to make this point clear.)(珍，她的眼睛仍闭着，在这里做着手势好像想把这点说得更清楚。)
A letter today from a man in the Midwest, or a letter about him. The man is on in years. He has two daughters, and is known for grumbling.今天有一封信来自中西部的一个男人，或一封有关于他的信。这个男人比较老。他有两个女儿，他以抱怨闻名。
Again, I see the image of a clock, with ornate pattern about it, oval rather than round. The impression that it is a lady’s watch rather than a man’s, or a mantel clock. The decorations are of gold color rather than silver, and the numbers are comparatively small, rather than large.再次的，我见到一个钟的形象，有着华丽的装饰，是椭圆形而不是圆形。印象它是个女表而不是男表，或是一个壁钟。装饰是金色的，而不是银色的，数字相对比较小。
The disturbance spoken of earlier may possibly have taken place during a class.之前提到的骚动可能是发生在课堂上。
Do you have a test for me, Joseph?约瑟，你有测试要给我吗？
(“Yes.”(“是的。”
(It was 10:23, and this was our 25th envelope test. As usual Jane took the test envelope from me without opening her eyes. She held it to her forehead for a sentence or two, then lowered it to her lap.)(现在是10:23，这是我们第25次信封测试。像往常一样，珍闭着眼睛从我手里接过信封。她把它放在前额，大概一两句话的时间，然后改放在大腿上。)
Now, a moment again please.现在，请等一下。
A connection with an arrival, as at the end of a tour of duty. A connection with a view of hills, and with four people. An engagement, as of an appointment or meeting.和一个抵达有关联，像是兵役的结束。和山的景色，还有4个人有关联。一个约定，像是约会或是会面。
A scramble. A connection with the month of June. The numbers three seven, and diagonal marks on the four corners of a rectangular piece of paper, connected perhaps with a photograph album.推挤。和6月这个月有关。数字37，一张长方形的纸，四角有对角线的折痕，也许和一本相簿有关。
A connection with dark hill shapes. A distant location, also connected here.和深色山的形状有关。一个遥远的所在地，也和这里有连结。
A dark or darkish brown coat, the color of some uniforms. Crowded. Many voices, dancing.一件深色或深棕色的外套，某种海军制服的颜色。拥挤。很多声音，跳舞。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:30. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed and her pace had been slow.(10:30休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，速度较慢。
(The test results this evening present a case where two separate events are combined in the results, as will be explained a bit later. At the moment I'll list the correct pieces of information that Jane and I can easily identify.(今晚的测验结果，出现了两件不同事件合并在结果里的例子，这晚一点会解释。此时我正列出珍和我都很容易辨认出的正确讯息。
(See the tracing of the two sales slips on page 179. The data contain references to both slips, although Seth or Jane did not identify them as such, or refer to the fact that there were two test objects, as I had hoped. Jane said that during the test she was not sure of the source of information, Seth or herself.(见上面两张购物单的素描。资料包含了两张单子的编号，虽然赛斯和珍并没有如我所希望的指出有两个测验物件。珍说在测验期间，她不确定资料的来源是赛斯，或是她自己。
(“An engagement, as of an appointment or meeting,” applies to the S.F. Iszard sales slip. On December 21 last, Jane and I went Christmas shopping; we parted to get each other gifts, after making an appointment to meet at a certain restaurant downtown when our shopping was over. “A scramble” can apply to either or both slips, since when we went shopping on December 18 and 21 we found the stores very crowded. Some aisles were difficult to get through, there was waiting necessary to get into dressing rooms, etc.(“一个约定，像是约会或是会面”这个用于伊萨百货的购物单。在去年12月21日，珍和我去做圣诞节的采购；我们分开去买对方的礼物，约定当我们购物结束后到市中心的某一家餐馆会面。“推挤”可以适用在任何一张购物单上，当我们在12月18日和21日去购物时，我们发现商店非常挤。有一些走道很难穿越，要去试衣间一定要等，等等。
("A dark or darkish brown coat, the color of some uniforms, ” is a reference to a sports coat of corduroy that Jane bought me for Christmas; this is indicated by the Penny's sales slip for December 18. The coat is a close approximation of the color of the winter topcoat for the everyday U.S. Marine uniform. The Marine connection here will be apparent shortly.(“一件深色或深棕色的外套，某种海军制服的颜色”，指的是珍圣诞节买给我的一件灯芯绒运动外套；这有标志在12月18日那张潘尼百货的购物单上。这件外套很接近美国海军制服里冬天大衣的颜色。在这里海军的连结很明显。
(“Crowded. Many voices, dancing, ” refers to the first time I wore the new coat. This was to a party given by Bill Macdonnel at his art gallery on Thursday, December 30. It was called a New Year’s Eve party, was very crowded, and there was dancing. I have yet to wear the coat out of the house again.(“拥挤，很多声音，跳舞”，指的是第一次我穿上这件新外套。那是12月30日星期四，比尔·麦唐纳在他的艺廊所开的派对上。那是除夕夜派对，非常拥挤，有人在跳舞。我还没穿着这件外套再出门过。
(The rest of the test data appears to be all of a piece, and can be connected with a young friend of ours with whom I used to work. Two years ago the friend enlisted in the Marines and was sent to Alaska. He returned to Elmira over the holidays on furlough. I met him twice but Jane did not see him at all. She did listen to me talk about him, of course.(其他的测验资料看起来像是同一件事，是和我过去一起工作的一个年轻朋友有关。两年前这个朋友入伍海军，被派到阿拉斯加州，他在休假时会回到埃尔迈拉。我遇见过他两次，但珍没有见过他。不过当然她有听过我提起他。
(Our friend wore his civilian clothes, so even had she met him Jane wouldn't have been able to observe his uniform colors. It chanced however that while we were waiting in line at the post office to mail packages, we saw a Marine in uniform. Jane noticed its color—this was not the dress blues uniform—and questioned me as to the soldier's branch of service, etc. Then when we went shopping we picked out my sport coat in a similar color, although I believe neither of us thought of any such connection at the time.(我们的朋友穿着一般人的衣服，所以珍遇到他的时候，她没能注意他制服的颜色。不过偶然，我们在邮局排队寄包裹的时候，看见一个穿着制服的海军军官。珍注意到它的颜色——这不是那件蓝色的制服——并问我这个士兵服役的单位等等。然后当我们去逛街时，我们选了一个类似颜色的运动外套，虽然我认为我们两个当时都没有想到这样的连结。
(Jane said that when she gave the data about “diagonal marks on the four corners of a rectangular piece of paper, "she saw such a piece of paper rather clearly within her mind's eye, without thinking of it particularly as a photograph.(珍说，当她给关于“一张长方形的纸，四角有对角线的折痕”这个资料时，她从她的心眼很清楚的看到了一张这样的纸，但并没有特别想到相簿。
(Jane also said that when the information “An engagement, ” etc., came through, it represented Seth's effort to put her on the right track. She had our Marine friend in mind during the test, and he was engaged to be married at the time he went into the service. He is now married and a father.(珍说当“一个约定”这个讯息过来的时候，它代表了赛斯努力的想把她导回正轨。在测验期间，她想到了我们的海军朋友，他入伍的时候正准备要结婚。他现在已经结婚并且成为父亲了。
(Jane resumed in the same rather fast manner, her eyes opening at times, at 10:40.)(珍的眼睛有时候会睁开，她以同样较快的方式在10:40重新开始。)
Now I will keep you but briefly.现在，我再短暂的留住你一下。
Long enough, however, to make a few comments. Ruburt was not particularly at his best this evening, simply because he was somewhat upset over your reaction, Joseph, to the car episode.只做一些评论。鲁柏今晚并没有在他最好的状态，单纯只因为他对约瑟你对于汽车事件的反应有些不安。
There is no reason however why tests should be limited to times when conditions are excellent, since we shall be dealing with many conditions. Some valid material did come through however, for I saw that, and the coat was meant to be an identifying piece of information.不过，测验不应该被限制在只有状况很好的时候才能做，因为我们会面对很多种情况。我的确看到有一些有效的资料透过来，而那件外套就是一个可识别的讯息。
Now we simply cannot discuss everything I had in mind, or the session would run too late.现在，我们无法讨论我心里所想的每一件事，否则课会上得太晚。
What Ruburt sensed however was somewhat legitimate. When you allow disturbances to upset you, then you become concentrated so deeply within ego time that you close off those very abilities that you need to help you.鲁柏所感受到的是有几分合理的。当你为这些混乱烦恼，你会太关注在自我时间，而关掉了那些你需要用来帮助你自己的能力。
There is no use pretending of course not to be annoyed. The point is simply to do your best, so that you gradually learn not to inhibit your reactions to them, but to change the nature of your habitual reactions to them.当然假装不烦恼是没有用的。重点是尽你的能力，因此你逐渐学习的不是阻止你对它们的反应，而是改变你对它们惯常反应的本质。
Otherwise you concentrate your creative energies, all of your energies, upon the disturbance itself, and interpret all other data in the light of that disturbance. In other words you put yourself into a position where you focus your attention upon very negative influences.否则你就是关注你的创造力能量，把所有你的能量都放在混乱本身，而以那个混乱的角度去解读所有其他的资料。换句话说，你把自己放在一个位置，这个位置就是你将注意力聚焦在十分负面的影响上。
Ruburt does this in his own way also. The one who is at any given time free of such difficulty should indeed help the other when such occasions arise. You actually put yourself in a trance state, and the suggestions take strong hold; and they are rarely constructive ones at such times.鲁柏也以自己的方式这么做。当这种情形发生的时候，那个当下没有陷入这种困难的人应该去帮助另一个人。事实上，你把自己放入一种出离状态，而暗示会强烈的接管；而在这种时刻，它们很少是建设性的。
What you need however is additional energy and resources to deal with such problems, and instead often you effectively cut yourself off from the resources within you.你所需要的是有额外的能量和资源去处理这样的问题，但相反地，你常常有效的切断了你自己内在的资源。
I am taking this incident as an example, but my remarks are to you both, for you both have much room for improvement in this respect. It is true that I am not concerned directly, so you may think that it is easy for me to speak to you both in this way. However it is because I am not directly concerned that I can see the problem and point out ways in which it can be solved. For there will always be such difficulties, and a habit of concentrating upon them could be most disadvantageous.我把这件事当成一个例子，但我的评论是对你们两人说的，在这方面你们两个都还有很多空间可以进步。这是真的，我并不担心，因此你们可能会认为我以这个方式对你们两个说话是很容易的。不过，那是因为我没有直接去担心我是有看到问题和指出它被解决的方法。总是有这类的困难，而一种关注在它们身上的习惯是最不利的。
Now, I will as you prefer give you a break or continue.现在，看你们要休息还是继续。
(“You might as well continue then.”(“你可以继续。”
(It was 10:55. I expected Jane to continue, but to my surprise I saw that she had left trance. Evidently there had been a misunderstanding on some level, or I hadn’t spoken clearly. Before we had time to discuss it she resumed, her eyes opened often, at 10:56.)(现在是10:55，我预期珍会继续，但我很惊讶地看到她离开了出离状态。显然这里有某种程度的误解，或是我没有说清楚。在我们还没有时间去讨论之前，她在10:56分重新开始，她的眼睛经常睁开。)
Now. When you react in such a manner, not only do you focus upon the present difficulty, but you project the difficulty and its imagined consequences into the future, turning expectation against you, and therefore bringing about the very conditions which you wish to avoid.现在。当你以这样的方式反应，你不只聚焦在现在的困难，而且还投射了这种困难和其想像的结果到未来，让你所想要的落空，而因此带来了你恰巧希望避免的那种情况。
Incidents of this nature may seem trivial. However patterns of behavior are extremely important, and such focus upon disturbances are directly opposed to all I have been trying to tell you. And I am speaking here only of one individual, but such reactions are also picked up by others on a subconscious basis, and the circle can be a vicious one.这种性质的事件可能看起来很琐碎。不过行为的模式是十分重要的，而这种聚焦在烦恼上，和所有我试着告诉你们的方式是恰恰相反的。而我在这里说的仅仅是一个人，但这样的反应也会被其他人在潜意识的基础给接收到，而这是一个恶性的循环。
You both know this I am sure, as a rule you both do fairly well in following a more healthy procedure. But the lessons must be put into practice or they are worthless.我很确定你们都知道这点，通常你们两个都做得很好，遵循着一个比较健康的过程。但这个课题应该拿来练习，否则它们就是没有价值的。
Again, we come to what is truly practical, as opposed to what the ego may think is practical at any given time.再次的，我们说到一个真正实用的东西，而这与自我可能认为实用的东西大相迳庭。
I have given you both sermon enough for this evening but I cannot emphasize too strongly the importance of what I have said. If you direct your inner self with confidence to steer you through your physical existence, it will do so. If you concentrate upon difficulties you will not allow it to do so. This method of giving yourself room will also help you to achieve a greater freedom in psychic matters. For any negative focus (and underline negative) within egotistical reality will automatically block you.我今晚对你们讲得太久了，但我说的实在是太重要了。如果你用信心指挥你的内我，在你的物质存在中引导你，那它就会这么做。如果你专注在困难中，你就不允许它这么做。给你自己一些空间的这个方法，也能帮助你在心灵事件中达到更大的自由。任何负面的聚焦(负面的划线)在自我实相上都会自动的阻碍你。
You will not feel free enough to allow yourself freedom for any psychic adventures. With confidence in your inner abilities however your practical problems will effectively be taken care of when you do not dwell upon them, and greater mobility will be achieved as far as other layers of the self are concerned.你不会觉得有足够的自由允许你去做心灵的冒险。当你不聚焦在它们身上，而带着对你内在能力的信心时，问题就会有效地被解决，而当其他层面的自己也关注时，就会达到更大的流动。
Obviously reason must be used. I am not speaking of indiscriminate Pollyanna hogwash, and yet even that is more practical in the long run than any habitual concentration upon disturbances.很明显的，理性要被使用。我现在说的并不是不加区辨、愚蠢的盲目乐观，但即使是那样，长期下来也会比习惯关注在烦恼上要实际多了。
I am not accusing either of you of such habitual activities, but because of our relationship I do feel bound to mention such issues as they arise. You should know, both of you by now, that I have your best interests always in mind.我并不是在谴责你们任何一个人有这样的习性，但因为我们的关系，当说到这样的议题时，我觉得我有义务要提及。你们两个现在应该知道，我总是把你们最大的利益放在心中。
And now may I wish you a hearty good evening. I would have discussed your friend’s inverted time system, Joseph, further, except for the lateness of the hour.而现在我衷心地祝你们晚安，约瑟，我会更深入讨论你朋友的倒置时间系统，但时间已经晚了。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:07. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had been open at times, her pace rather fast, her voice average.(11:07结束，珍出离如常。她的眼睛有时睁开，速度相当快，音量适中。
(A note added a week later: To my great relief, Seth dealt with my car episode in the 223rd Session.)(一周之后加了一个记录：我松了一口气，赛斯在第223节处理了我的汽车插曲。)
(Tracing of the drawing and verse used in the 26th envelope test, in the 221st session for January 10,1966.)用在1966年1月10日第221节第26次信封测验的插画以及散文的素描

SESSION 221 第221节 倒置时间系统 新兴的自己 信封26


JANUARY 10, 1966 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1966年1月10日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(On Saturday January 8 Jane and I received a letter from Dr. Instream, asking that Seth do his best to give data on but one object during tests. Dr. Instream also mentioned his difficulty in attempting to repeat an experiment with ESP cards, involving odds of a million-and-a-half to one. Jane and I mentioned that we would like Seth to say something on both points in tonight's session.(1月8日星期六，我和珍收到了一封殷斯翠姆博士的信，要求赛斯在课堂中尽力给一件物品的资料。殷斯翠姆博士也提到他重复ESP卡实验的困难，大约是150万分之一的机会。珍和我说到我们希望赛斯在今晚的课能对这两点说些什么。
(Over the weekend Bill and Peggy Gallagher agreed to try mutual concentration upon a single object in their home at session times. They would keep a record of the chosen objects for a month, without telling us what they were, then we would compare the list with Seth’s data after the experiment ended. We have thought of trying this before.(这个周末，比尔和蓓·加拉格同意要在上课时间共同专注在他们家的一件物品上。他们会记录选择的物品一个月，不告诉我们那是什么，然后在实验结束的时候，我们会和赛斯资料的清单做比较。我们以前就想试着这么做。
(We had some reservations however about trying it now, but decided to see what Seth would say. We didn’t want to give rise to a feeling of pressure on Jane during sessions, and wondered whether it was wise to try three regular tests. We want room for other material also. For this reason we had let the candle-flame tests go for the moment, even though they appear promising.(不过我们对现在尝试它也有一些疑虑，但决定看看赛斯会怎么说。我们不希望在课程中间对珍造成压力，也不确定去尝试3个固定的测验是否明智。我们也希望给其他资料一些空间。因为这个原因，我们决定把蜡烛火焰的测验先放到一边，即使它们看起来希望浓厚。
(See the tracing of the envelope test object on page 190. It is a humorous drawing made by Ann Diebler, who works in my office at Artistic Card Co.; Piggie, incidentally, refers to pigeon. I had mentioned the drawing to Jane several weeks ago, but not since, and of course she did not know I had brought it home. I put it between two pieces of Bristol and sealed it in the usual double envelope.(见上面信封测验物件的素描。它是安·黛伯乐[Ann Diebler]所画的幽默画，她在我的办公室，艺术卡公司工作；小鸽指的是鸽子。我几周前曾向珍提过这幅画，但后来就没再提了，她当然不知道我把它带回家。我把它夹在两张厚纸板中间，放进普通信封里。
(Ann Diebler has heard Seth speak twice during unscheduled sessions, and had read some of the early material. See the notes for the 206th and the 214th sessions.(安·黛伯乐曾有两次在临时课里听过赛斯说话，也读了一些早期的资料。见第206节和214节。
(The session was held in our large front room. Jane said she was somewhat sleepy before the session began. She began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed, but halfway to first break her eyes began to open occasionally. Her pace was good, her voice average.)(这节课在我们前面比较大的房间举行。珍说课开始前她有点想睡。她开始说话时坐着，眼睛闭着，但快到第一次休息时，她的眼睛开始偶尔睁开。她的速度很好，音量适中。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. First of all, I advise Ruburt along these lines: it is best if he not work at his own writing or records up until the last moment or so before a session.现在。首先，我建议鲁柏这些事：最好他不要到课前的最后一刻还在忙他的写作或记录。
He should relax, in any way he chooses, the hour preceding a session.他应该在课前的一小时，以他选择的任何方式放松。
Now. An inverted time system actually presents us with a system that more closely approximates the true nature of time. Time does indeed turn in upon itself, even as it explodes outward from itself. The expanding universe theory applies much more truly to time than it does to the physical universe. You think of a steady progression into the future. However, as you know there is no real progression, moment by successive moment, as you suppose.现在。事实上一个倒置时间系统呈现给我们的，是一个更接近时间真正本质的系统。时间确实是弯向它自己，即使是它向外扩张的时候。比起适用于物质宇宙，扩张宇宙的理论其实更适用于时间。你想像一个稳定直到未来的进展。不过就如同你所知道的，并没有一个如你所认为的，一个片刻接着一个片刻的真正进展。
(Seth dealt with the expanding universe theory in sessions 42-45, saying among other things that our physical universe is not expanding as is currently thought; he had much to say on the distortive data furnished us by our instruments.)(赛斯在第42至45节提过扩张宇宙理论，说过我们的物质并不是以目前所认为的方式扩张；他也说了很多我们的仪器提供给我们的扭曲资料。)
You think of the past as done with and completed, but on a subconscious basis you travel through the past. The past therefore becomes present. You know that precognition is a fact. The steady line of time does not exist. Inversion in terms of value interwound upon value, energy compressed, contained, working upon itself, contained but with momentum—this comes much closer to reality.你认为过去是已经完成而且结束了，但在潜意识的基础上，你旅行着这些过去。所以过去就变成了现在。你知道预知是一个事实。一条恒定的线性时间并不存在。就价值而言，时间倒置是一种价值，能量压缩，包容，在自身上作用的交织，被冲力所包容——这更接近实相。
However, the momentum works both ways. I am referring now to your own terms of reference. For if time speeds ahead, my dear friends, or if you say that times speed ahead, which is an entirely different thing, then you must say also that it speeds backwards. For this energy moves in all directions from its core, and the core at times becomes its outer surface.不过，冲力是双向运作的。我现在是用你们的参考角度引用的。如果时间往前加速，我亲爱的朋友，或假如你说时间往前加速，这是完全不同的东西，然后你也必须这样说，时间往后加速。这个能量从它的核心往所有方向移动，这个核心有时候会变成它外围的表象。
In an inverted time system the momentum is recognized and it is also taken advantage of, in that it is utilized by individual consciousness, so that your so-called present, past and future can be viewed as existing in a spacious now. Again, this sort of a system is very close to the true nature of time.在一个倒置的时间系统，冲力借由被个别的意识利用而被认出且被善用，所以你们所谓的现在、过去、未来可以被视为存在于一个广阔存在的现在(spacious now注：赛斯常用spacious present，此处例外)。再次的，这类系统非常接近时间的真实本质。
I mentioned that the inhabitant of the other system with whom you made contact perceived your existence in both the future and the past. He also was aware however of your own comparative imprisonment in a limited present. For the present as you know it is very limited indeed. He realized therefore, when the incident occurred, how it would end. He can relive the incident at his leisure, and experience it as present if he so chooses.我提到的那个和你接触的另一个系统的居民，能同时感知你未来和过去的存在。他也觉察到，你们自己在一个受限的现在相对的被禁锢着。你所知道的现在确实是非常受限的。因此他了解这个事件是何时发生，又是如何结束。因此在他闲暇的时候，他可以重温这个事件，还有如果他想要的话，他可以选择现在再经验一遍。
He can also remember it from any viewpoint in his future, if he chooses. He can give this information about this event to his own image as it existed in time before the contact was made. He can therefore make alterations in any aspect of time as it affects him.如果他选择的话，他也能从他未来里的任何观点来回忆这个事件。当这个接触发生在事件存在的时间之前，他可以给出关于这个事件的讯息到他自己的印象。因此他可以在如此影响到他的时间的任何层面做改变。
In essence you see the past can be changed. Present actions can change future events that would otherwise occur. But when this is admitted, then we must admit also that present events can alter the past, for there is no element in the past that has a different structure or composition or characteristic, that is not present in the future.本质上你明白过去可以被改变。现在的行动能改变要发生的未来事件。但是当这点被承认了，我们也必须承认现在的事件也可以改变过去，因为没有一个过去的元素有着和未来不同的结构、组成或特性。
(Seth has referred to the ability of suggestion to change experience which has already passed. See the 187th and 202nd sessions.)(赛斯指出暗示的能力可以改变已经过去了的经验。见第187节和202节。)
Time does not have certain characteristics when you view it as past, or when you view it as future, or when you view it as present. Any seeming difference between the past and the future is simply due to your own perception. Much of the material that I have given you concerning the nature of physical matter will be helpful when considered in connection with this material on time.时间并没有你所视为过去、或视为未来，或视为现在的某种特性。任何看起来似乎存在于过去和未来之间的不同，仅只因为你们自己的感知。当思考到关于时间这个资料时，我给你们很多关于物质事件本质的资料会有帮助。
(See the 60- 73rd sessions in Volume 2.(见第二册第60至73节。)
)我们在这里会试着给你一个例子。例如鲁柏度过童年的那间房子。现在如你所知，从来没有一个确定不改变的物件。这间房子是一个原子和分子的聚合物，一般被感知为一间房子，但每个看到的人明确感知到的是一间稍有不同的房子，被每个观察者从他自己的潜意识能量创造出一间房子的近似值，一间被感知为房子的大致形状，而被个人的看法进一步修饰。
We will try here to give you an example. Take for example then the house in which Ruburt spent his childhood. Now as you know, that was never one definite unchanging object. That house was a conglomeration of atoms and molecules, perceived generally as a house, but perceived specifically by everyone who saw it as a slightly different house. For each observer quite literally created from his own subconscious energy an approximation of a house, a general shape then perceived as a house, and further embellished by personal judgments. It was, say, in 1943 even then merely a portion of space perceived by all who saw it in their own light. It did not exist devoid or apart from those who viewed it.这是说，在1943年，那里也仅是一部分的空间被所有看到的人以他们自己的角度看见。它不是有别于那些看到的人们的存在物。
Time inversion would merely permit the recreation of a particular perception. The year for example 1943 was simply an artificial collection of events loosely agreed upon. The past exists to the same extent that the present or future exists, and it is only the perception that is limited.时间倒置仅仅允许了一个特别感知的再创造。例如1943年，这一年只是经过不精确同意的人造聚合事件。这个过去存在的程度，和现在或未来的存在是同一程度的，只是感知受限了。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:30. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes had opened frequently after the middle of the delivery, although her pace had begun to slow somewhat.(9:30休息。珍在第一段出离如常。她的眼睛在口述中段以后就频繁地睁开，虽然她的速度开始变得有些慢。
(She resumed at a slower pace, her eyes again opening often, at 9:37.)(她的眼睛再次的常常睁开，她以一种较缓慢的速度在9:37分重新开始。)
Now. Shortly we shall consider various psychological frameworks, for there are endless varieties; though we shall discuss only a few, the few with which I am familiar.现在。我们应该马上考虑到不同的心理架构，因为这里有无止尽的变化；尽管我们应该讨论的只有一些，这些是我所熟悉的。
These psychological structures obviously act as stabilizing platforms, so to speak, from which energy can view itself. The psychological frameworks simply are various organizational structures that are equipped to perceive reality discriminately.可以说，这些心理结构明显的作用是用来稳定平台，而从那里，能量能看见它们自己。这些心理架构单纯是不同的组织化结构，是配备去有区别的感知实相。
They are equipped to focus along particular directions. This material will be extremely interesting when we come to it. It is extremely difficult for a psychological structure to view itself, for in order to do so it must lift itself from the limitations and abilities of its own nature. In many realities such scrutiny is simply impossible, while the structure operates in a given fashion.它们被配备去专注在特别的方向。当我们提到这点，资料会变得非常有趣。让一个心理结构去看见它们自己是非常困难的，为了这么做，它必须从自己天性的限制和能力中移开。在很多的实相，当结构以特定的方式运作的时候，这样的审视简单来说是不可能的。
Gradually psychological structures are able to focus upon vaster areas, and in order to achieve proficiency in this manner you do indeed begin to build up layered selves that have been independent identities. These varying perceptive abilities organize so that their perceptive powers are pooled in a gestalt that eventually forms a new identity, a more complicated psychological structure that is capable of perceiving larger areas of reality.逐渐地，心理结构能够聚焦于更广阔的领域，并且为了以这种方式达到熟练，你必须开始建立有着独立身分层面的自己们。这些不同的知觉能力组织起来，因此他们的知觉力量以一种完形而集中，最后形成了一个新的身分，一个更复杂的、能感知实相更大领域的心理结构。
Even within a given system however all individuals are not at the same point. Now, in our sessions I am sure that by now you are at least to some extent aware of what would seem to be something quite strange: the emergence of a self that observes the self of which you have been ordinarily aware; a self with a slightly different time system, a slightly different viewpoint of reality, a self with greater control over the physical material that composes your physical image, a self with some quite effective control over your personal future.不过即使在一个特定的系统，所有的个人也不在同一个点上。现在，在我们的课里，我很确定你们至少某种程度觉察到某些相当奇怪的东西：一个自己的出现，观察着那个你们平常觉知着的自己；一个有着些微不同时间系统的、些微不同实相观点的自己，一个对组成你们物质形象的物质资料有着更大掌控的自己，一个更有效掌控着你们个人未来的自己。
I am speaking now of course of both of you. That is, each of you should by now be aware of such an emerging psychological unit. It is the result of your ability to step out of your own system to some small extent, for you cannot do this until you are ready. For the very attempt, or successful attempt, results in an extension of the self out of the system in which you were nurtured.我现在当然是对你们两个说的。你们两个此时都应该觉察到这样一个新兴的心理单位。这个是源于你的能力某种程度跃出了你自己的系统，除非你准备好，否则是做不到的。一个真正的尝试，或是成功地尝试，会导致一个延伸的自己跃出你们被养育的系统。
From the viewpoint of this emerging self you can view to some extent the system in which the earlier self was mainly imprisoned. Now I speak of imprisonment. I do not speak in terms of compulsory confinement however. Your perceptions simply kept you where you were. You could not clearly see even where you were, for the dimensions were not clear to you from the inside. You could not scale the wall, so to speak. You had to grow taller, if you will forgive me for using another analogy.从这个新兴自己的观点，你能某程度地看出那个先前的自己被主要禁锢的系统。现在我说的是禁锢，不过我说的不是强迫性的监禁。你的所在之处仅只受限于你的感知。你并不能清楚的看到你的所在，从里面你是看不清那个维度的。应该这么说，你无法越过那道墙。你必须变得更高。如果你容许我用另一个比喻来说的话。
I will have more to say along these lines, for we shall shortly be considering the psychological structures in terms of action, and in their relationship to time. We will first relate them to this emerging self that you can sense personally, and then we shall go further.就这个话题我还有更多要说的。我们应该先考虑就行动方面而言的心理结构，以及它们和时间的关系。我们先把它们和你们个人能感觉到的这个新兴自己联系起来，然后我们会再深入去谈。
Now, take your break.现在，休息吧。
(Break at 9:59. Jane was dissociated as usual, her eyes opening often. They had been very dark. Her pace had picked up considerably by break time.(9:59休息。珍出离如常，她的眼睛常睁开，它们十分深邃。她的速度在休息时间慢慢的跟了上来。
(It was now time for the 29th Dr. Instream test. As usual Jane sat quietly with her hands raised to her closed eyes. Her pace was quite slow, broken by many pauses that ran to 15-20 seconds. Resume at 10:09.)(现在是第29次殷斯翠姆博士测试。像往常一样，珍安静地坐着，她的手举起来放在她闭着的眼睛上。她的速度十分慢，中间被很多次的停顿中断，大约是15至20左右。10:09重新开始。)
Now. Give us a moment.现在。等我们一下。
I do have a few words for Dr. Instream. I believe I mentioned earlier that an object will work best if it has emotional significance for him.我的确有一些话想告诉殷斯翠姆博士。我相信我之前提过，一个能表现最好的物件是它对殷斯翠姆博士有着情感上的重点性。
Give us a moment. It may be a long one.等一下。可能会比较久。
(Jane took a pause of 40 seconds.)(珍停顿了40秒。)
You see, at this point we must flow through many legitimate impressions that we pick up in connection with Dr. Instream, before we get at the specific impression that he wants.你们知道，在我们得到他想要的特定印象之前，必须穿过很多人接收到的，和殷斯翠姆博士有关联的合理印象。
If it is an emotionally charged object this will make our task easier. Though he need not concentrate upon it then with too great an intensity, since the object itself will send out information of its own.如果它是一个充满情感的物件，那就会让我们的工作容易一点。他不需要以很强的强度专注在这个物件上，因为物件本身会发出它自己的讯息。
Ruburt has progressed very well, but is still learning to pinpoint in a specific manner.鲁柏目前进展得很好，但他仍在学习以明确的方式准确的指认出来。
Something round, in the nature of a pin cushion. Red in color, perhaps with green. Round with an apple shape, belonging to his wife.某个圆的东西，像针垫那样的东西。颜色是红色，也许带绿色。圆圆的像苹果的形状，
Now this will be considered as the object. (Pause at 10:17.)是属于他太太的。(10:17停顿)
I have some impressions concerning the ESP cards. A student with brown hair. I seem to get the initial E, though I do not know if this is a first, last or middle initial. Also the number six. Six of a group. (Another 40. second pause.) That is a particular group. A male student. (A one-minute pause.)我有一些印象是属于ESP卡。一个棕色头发的学生。我似乎收到缩写E，虽然我不知道这是第一个、最后一个或是中间的缩写。(一分钟的停顿)
There is no reason why the test results cannot be repeated, intrinsically. Dr. Instream however fears that they will not be repeated, and unless this feeling is changed on his part such will be the case. He wants a repeat, but he fears he will not get it, simply because he wants it so badly, and the student reacts to this subconscious inhibiting factor.并没有什么理由测验结果不能重复。不过殷斯翠姆博士害怕不能重复，除非这个感觉改变了。不然就会是那样。他想要重复的结果，又害怕他无法得到，因为他太想要了，所以学生会对这个潜意识的阻碍因素起反应。
I seem to pick up a similarity somewhere between Dr. Instream and the student involved—a similarity in name, I do not know. He believes and expects success in his hypnosis experiments, and that is why he attains success. We shall however achieve what we want.我似乎收到了殷斯翠姆博士和这个参与的学生之间有某些相似之处——名字的相似之处，我不知道。他相信并期待他的催眠实验会成功，而这也是为什么他成功了。无论如何我们总是达到我们想要的。
A stronger emotional contact between you, if it had been possible, would have led to somewhat quicker results. (Pause at 10:29.)如果有可能的话，在你们之间一个较强的情感接触，会引领你们得到比较快速的结果。(10:29停顿)
Now. I suggest that the experiments with our Jesuit and cat lover wait for a while yet, though the idea is a sound one, and we shall conduct our experiments later. You can tell them when you see them.现在。我建议和耶稣会信徒还有爱猫人士的实验可以等一等，虽然这个主意不错，但我们应该过段时间再安排这个实验。当你见到他们的时候可以告诉他们。
In the meantime, for this evening, we shall give the impression of a rock or stone that can be held in the hand, that has a connection with the water, that is speckled, and gray, with an indentation in it.同时，在今晚我们应该给一个可以握在手上的岩块或石头一些印象，那和水有连结，有斑点，灰色，有缺口在上面。
Do you have a test for me Joseph?约瑟，你有测验要给我吗？
(“Yes.”(“是的。”
(It was 10:31. I handed Jane the 26th double sealed test envelope, and as usual she took it without opening her eyes. She pressed it to her forehead and continued to hold it there, speaking with many pauses.)(现在是10:31。我递给珍第26次测验信封，如往常一样，她闭着眼睛接过信封。她把信压在她的前额，持续放在那里一会儿，说话时有很多的停顿。)
Give us a moment, please.请等我们一下。
The word nondescript as applying to the Gallagher object.毫无特征这个形容词可以适用于加拉格的物件上。
Now. We shall see what we can do.现在，我们应该看看我们能做什么。
Something to do with money. Ruburt thinks of a money order. This is his personal association, because of your recent activities.某个和钱有关的东西。鲁柏想到汇票。因为你们最近的活动，这是他个人的联想。
A schedule of events. A connection with several people, two male and one female in particular. The color blue, and a note or letter.事件的行程安排。和几个人，特别是两个男人和一个女人有关联。蓝色，还有一张短笺或信。
Your brother, pictures. An afternoon. Now a series of impressions having to do with the pictures taken by your brother Loren, of Ruburt.你的弟弟，相片。一个下午。现在有一系列的印象和你弟弟洛伦帮鲁柏拍的照片有关。
A connection however with a November event. Special lights. Ruburts white coat, and last Saturday evening.不过，有一个连结是和一件11月的事有关。特别的光。鲁柏的白色外套，和上个星期六的夜晚。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:40. Jane was dissociated as usual Her eyes had remained closed. When break arrived she discovered that she had left her glasses on while speaking, something she rarely does. Her pace had been slow.(10:40休息。珍出离如常，她的眼睛仍闭着。当休息的时候，她发现当她说话的时候，她把眼镜戴着，这是一件她很少做的事情。她的速度较慢。
(See the tracing of the test object on page 190. As can be seen practically none of the data applies to the test object, with the exception of the white coat; the connection here is tenuous, and will be explained. I thought “November" might be correct also.(见测验物件素描。看起来几乎没有一个资料是符合测验物件的，除了白色的外套以外；这里的这个连结有点薄弱，等下会解释。我想“11月”可能也是正确的。
(Jane said she had rather strong images visually of the data; twice she saw her white coat quite strongly. In the test she was unable to tell when she got off on the track of personal associations; somehow the fine discrimination was lacking. Jane said that by the time she approached break she knew the test had been a poor one. But she also knew the test was poor, something she wouldn't have been able to distinguish not too long ago. She could, she said, feel herself getting involved with what she knew were incorrect images.(珍说她对这个资料有相当强的视觉印象；她十分强烈的看见她的白色外套两次。在测验中，她无法分辨她何时脱轨至她个人的联想；有时候这样细微的区辨力是缺乏的。珍说当靠近休息的时候，她就已经知道这个测验没做好。她也知道测验结果不佳，某个不久之前她还无法分辨的东西。她说她可以感觉自己涉入了她明知道是不正确的印象。
(The white coat connection referred to the fact that Jane wore it last Saturday evening, when it was bitter cold. Now the test object contains a poem referring to shivering pigeons and snow—hence the connection. I thought the November reference might be legitimate, since the originator of the test object, Ann Diebler, could have visited our apartment during that month. A check showed this to be so—Ann witnessing the unscheduled session for November 5,1965.(白色外套的连结指的是珍上星期六晚上穿的衣服，那时很冷。现在，测验物件包含了一首诗，指的是颤抖的鸽子和雪——因此有关联。我认为11月可能是合理的，因为测验物件的创作者，安·黛伯乐好像在那个月拜访过我们的公寓。后来查核过，发现真是这样——安参与了1965年11月5日的临时课。
(Jane resumed at a moderate pace, with her eyes opening occasionally, at 10:45.)(珍以一种适中的速度在10:45重新开始，她的眼睛有时候会睁开。)
Now. I saw immediately what we were doing here.现在。我很快地看到了我们正在这里做什么。
However, only by making mistakes can Ruburt learn to distinguish the highly nebulous changes, subjectively speaking, that characterize legitimate hits from failures, and without the experience he would not learn. The coat was a legitimate connection, but I could not get through to him to make it correctly. He was working on the level of personal associations. There is a certain feel to the correct channel, and he will learn to distinguish it.无论如何，只有透过犯错，鲁柏才能学习分辨很模糊的变化，主观的来说，这记述了从错误中合理的命中，没有这个经验，他无法学习。外套是一个合理的连结，但我无法传递给他，而使它正确。他在个人联想的层次运作，有某种感觉是通往正确的管道，而他正学习分辨它。
The November event I believe had to do with an occasion when your Ann visited here, but it is hardly adequate.我相信11月的事件是和安拜访这里的事有关，但这还不够。
Now, I was prepared to go into some other material this evening. However since it is growing late perhaps we should save it for the next session.现在，我本来准备今晚进入一些其他的资料。不过因为现在已经晚了，也许我们应该留到下一节。
This is all a process of learning. Relaxation in the hour before sessions will help. We are trying to work on two levels here. We want success of course, but we also want to know how success is achieved, and so we shall.这都是一个学习的过程。在课前那一小时的放松会有帮助。我们在这里试着在两个层面运作。我们当然想要成功，但我们也想知道，成功是如何达到的，而我们也应该这么做。
Contrary to popular thought, while everyone has so-called psychic abilities, they must be trained in specific areas of accomplishment. This is what we are doing.和一般的想法相反，每个被称为有心灵能力的人，他们必须在特定的领域里完成训练。这是我们正在做的。
Now unless you have any particular questions we shall close the session.现在，除非你们有特别的问题，否则我们应该结束这节了。
(“I guess not then. ’’)(“我想没有。”)
My heartiest regards to you both.我对你们俩衷心地祝福。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:57. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes were closed for the most part. She said that in poor tests she is aware of a slight feeling of strain, mentally, that could be compared to the physical feeling of strain involved when she doesn’t do a Yoga exercise quite right, or goes a little too far without adequate preparation.)(10:57结束。珍出离如常。她的眼睛大部分时间是闭着的。她说，在结果不佳的测验里，她可以觉察到一丝紧张，心理上的，那可以对比于当她没有正确地做一个瑜珈练习，或没有适当的暖身就做得太过火时身体所感觉到的紧张。)
Jan.4, 1965缺翻译
Dear Bob and Jane:缺翻译
“Here are the two slides I took but an sorry to say neither one is any good as. I had to use too slow a shutter speed to hand-hold the camera, this caused the blur you can see. There was just not enough light to do this. The film is Kodachrome II with an ASA rating of 25, as compared to several that go to 160 and 200.缺翻译
With one of these films, I could have done it. After we got back home my flash unit arrived, again if I had had this there would have been no problem. I am still learning to use the telephoto lens and I'll be the first to admit I have a lot to learn.缺翻译
We are sorry that Dad, etc.缺翻译
(Note by RFB: The rest of this letter from my brother Loren is personal,, concerning family matters, and deals with a ’’disturbing event" that is referred to in the envelope test data. We will however be glad to make the balance of the letter available to anyone studying these results.)缺翻译
(Copy of the letter used in the 27th envelope test, in the 222nd session for January 12,1966.)缺翻译
(Tracings of the two Kodachrome transparencies of Jane that Loren enclosed with his letter. They were not used as test objects, but were referred to in the test data.)1966年1月12日第222节第27次信封测验所用的信件副本两张珍的柯达幻灯片素描，洛伦把它放在这里。它们没有用来当作测验物件却在测验资料里被指了出来

SESSION 222 第222节 汽车事件 信封27


JANUARY 12, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1966年1月12日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(This afternoon while doing Yoga exercises Jane gave herself suggestions to the effect that she would do better in the envelope test tonight, than she had done last session. As will be seen, she did do much better.(今天下午当珍在做瑜伽练习的时候，珍给自己暗示，今晚的信封测验她会做得比上一节课好。很快我们会看到，她真的做得比较好。
(See the copy on page 197. For the test object I used a letter from my brother Loren, who lives in Tunkhannock, PA. It is typewritten in black ink on paper the weight of this page, and white. It was folded once between two pieces of Bristol, then sealed in the usual double envelope. My brother inadvertently dated the letter 1965 instead of1966.(见上图。我用的测验物件是我弟弟洛伦寄的一封信，他住在宾州特和纳[Tunkhannock]。它是用黑墨水打字在这张纸差不多重量的一张纸上，纸是白色的。我把它夹进两张厚纸板里，然后放进普通信封里封好。我弟弟不小心把信的日期写成1965年，而不是1966年。
(The session again was held in our large front room, and was not interrupted. Jane began while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her eyes soon opened, however, and she displayed much amusement. Her pace was good, her voice average.)(这节课再次在我们前面较大的房间举行，中间没有被打扰。珍开始时坐着，她的眼睛闭着，很快又张开，然后，她显得很愉快。她的速度很好，音量适中。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. I have a few remarks to make. However you, Joseph, have been rushed with your notes, due to circumstances; and if you prefer we can then, after my few remarks, wait until ten o’clock for our Instream material. We are at all times flexible.现在。我想说几点。无论如何，约瑟，在这样的情况下，你太急着赶你的笔记了；如果你们愿意，我们可以在我一些论述后，等到10点再开始我们的殷斯翠姆博士测验。我们可以随时有弹性。
(“No, I'm all caught up now.”(“不用，我可以赶得上。”
(Jane now smiled. Her eyes, very dark, opened briefly. She stared at me from across the table.)(珍现在微笑。她的眼睛非常深邃，短暂的睁开一下。她从桌子对面盯着我看。)
Then I shall continue. First of all, may I congratulate you for doing something that you do not realize you have done. You did have some help, it is true, from Ruburt, but in the main you did this on your own. Do you have any idea of what I am speaking?那么我就继续了。首先，我想先恭喜你们，你们做了某件你们并没有意识到的事。这是真的，你们的确从鲁柏那里得到了一些帮助，但你们主要是靠自己完成的。你们知道我在说什么吗？
(Another smile from Jane as she stared at me. I didn’t know what Seth was referring to so I began to guess.(珍盯着我看，再次微笑。我不知道赛斯指的是什么，所以我开始猜。
(“My dream?”(“我的梦？”
(Last night I had had a very vivid dream in which I was levitating, my first of its kind since I began keeping records. Jane shook her head.)(昨晚我有一个非常逼真的梦，是我在漂浮着，这是我开始记梦以来第一个这样的梦。珍摇摇头。)
This is not what I am referring to.这不是我说的事。
(“The dentist?”(“牙医？”
(This afternoon I put myself in a light trance before going to the dentist, then used suggestion. I felt nothing in the chair.)(今天下午，我在去看牙医之前，我让我自己进入了轻微的出离状态，我运用了暗示。我坐在椅子上感觉不到什么。)
That indeed was very good, quite excellent—but it is not what I am referring to.那的确非常好，很棒——但那不是我说的事。
(“Well, the car, then?”(“好吧，那是车子？”
(Jane smiled broadly and nodded her head. She was much amused. She pointed at me, her eyes wide open.)(珍咧开嘴笑了，同时点点头。她很愉悦。她指着我，眼睛睁得很大。)
Now—now you are on the correct issue. It was an accomplishment because you started from scratch, so to speak. Consciously the whole affair annoyed you no end. You saw it as a grumpy old machine, with its best days finished. But you put to excellent use the advice which I gave you, concerning the importance of psychological reactions.现在——你现在说对了。这是一项成就，因为可以这样说，你从零开始。意识上，这整件事持续的困扰你。你把车看成一部坏脾气的老机器，它最好的岁月已经过了。但你考虑到心理反应的重要性，把我给你的建议用得极好。
On your part this did indeed represent an important level of achievement, simply because you have been in the past more easily given to pessimism.在你身上，这的确代表了一项重要层面的成就，因为在过去，你更容易倾向悲观。
(See pages 187-89 of the 220th session for the advice Seth refers to.)(见第220节赛斯给的建议。)
I want to explain precisely what you did, for you should find it most amusing.我想要仔细地解释你做了什么，你应该会觉得它很有趣。
When the trouble initially began, the most recent trouble, you were generally disgusted with the car, and your disgust led to the difficulties. Not in any nebulous symbolic manner, but in very literal terms.当麻烦刚开始的时候，最近的那次麻烦，你厌恶这台车，而你的厌恶造成了这些困难。这并不是以模糊象征性的方式来说，而是非常字面上的说法。
You forgot to buy the gasoline. You had previously not noticed the small red flash indicating that oil was needed, and if the trend had continued you would have continued to ignore this warning light. If your attitude had been strong enough to affect Ruburt, he would not have noticed it either. The general and overall condition of the car was on its way to deterioration.你忘了加油。你之前没有注意到，小红灯在闪显示需要加油，如果事情继续下去，你会持续忽略这个警告灯。如果你的态度强烈到影响了鲁柏，他也没注意到这件事，这辆车的整体状况就会恶化。
(A week or so ago I forgot to buy gasoline, and this led to a situation that could have been dangerous. When Jane and I were on our way to the home of the Gallaghers, who live on top of a steep and long hill outside Elmira, the car lost power, then stalled out on the hill. It was after dark, the road was slippery with snow; I had to back down the hill while Jane lighted the way with a flashlight, until I found a driveway. I did not realize I had run low on gas at the time, for the car started as we coasted down hill. We arrived home safely but the car would not start up again.(一周之前，我忘了加油，而这可能会导致很危险的情况。当珍和我去加拉格夫妇家的时候，他们住在埃尔迈拉郊外一个又长又陡的山坡上，车子失去了动力，在山坡上熄火了。当时已经是晚上，道路因为有雪而变得很滑；珍用手电筒照着路，我必须后退下山坡直到找到一条车道。我当时并不知道油快没了，当我们滑行下山的时候，车子启动了。我们安全地回到家，但是车子再也不能启动了。
(Jane and I walked to a nearby station for gasoline but the car still wouldn’t start; consequently the garage had to tow the car in for repairs. Seth's information on the oil warning light is also apparently correct, for when the garage checked the oil level it was quite low. I usually make a point of watching this closely, and it is interesting to speculate as to how I failed to see the warning light go on, since it is situated on the dash in front of me. I had the oil checked immediately after I became aware that the warning light was on. Nor had Jane noticed it on.(珍和我走到附近的加油站买油，但车子仍然无法启动，结果修车厂必须把车子拖去维修。赛斯说的油表警示灯也是正确的，当修车厂检查油表的时候，油量确实很低。我通常都会很仔细的看，但很有趣的是，我竟然没有看到警示灯在亮，它还是在我正前方的仪表板上。当我觉察到警示灯亮之后才马上去检查油量。珍也同样没有注意到。
(The car operated well the day after the garage repaired it, saying the trouble was moisture in the distributor. The next day the car once again would not start. This necessitated another tow to the garage. To our surprise the second tow and repair were free, the service manager telling us there was corrosion on the coil connections, and that the mechanic should have noticed this and corrected it the first time the car was in the garage.(在修车厂修过的那天，车子运作得很好，修车厂说问题出在配电盘的湿气。第二天，车子又再次不能发动。所以车子再次的被拖回修车厂。我们很惊讶的是第二次的拖车和修理是免费的，修车厂的经理告诉我们，管线的接触点已经腐蚀了，技工应该在第一次修车的时候就注意到这个问题并修好它。
(The 220th session, containing Seth’s advice, was held while the car was in the garage the first time. After the session I made a conscious effort to improve my attitude about the car. By then I had the idea that psychological attitudes could affect the car, and had recalled that once before Seth had dealt with the car and our attitudes while on our way to a Maine vacation in August 1964. See the 80. 81st sessions. According to Seth, Jane and I had succeeded in altering considerably the car's oil consumption; and as evidence we had before us the fact that the car had used much less oil on the trip than we had calculated. See Volume 2.)(第220节，那节涵盖了赛斯的建议，那是车子第一次在修车厂的时候举行的。在课后，我有意识的努力提升我对车子的态度，然后我有一个想法，心理的态度能影响车子，因而回想起我们1964年8月去缅因州度假时，赛斯曾提过车子和我们的态度。见第80和81节。据赛斯所说，珍和我相当成功的改善车子的油耗；而证据是，车子在这次旅行的耗油量比我们所预估的要少很多。见第二册。)
Now when your attitude began to change, it changed first on a subconscious level. Consciously you were not aware of the change. Now. You had already done some damage. The problem was to make it as minor as possible. It was therefore concentrated as corrosion on the coil, and this corrosion was not there when your garage man previously examined it.现在，当你们的态度开始改变，它首先会在潜意识的层面上改变。意识上你还没有觉察到这个改变。现在，你已经造成了一些损害。重点是要尽可能地缩小损害。问题是出在管线的腐蚀，而这个腐蚀在先前修车厂维修员检查的时候还没有发生。
The destructive elements were concentrated, given nice, neat tangible form, and therefore remedied in a physical fashion.破坏性的元素被集中，给予了很好、很整齐、很真实的形式，因此可以用一个物质的方式去解决。
Now you can do, that is any individual can do, and does, the same with the physical body. If his reactions cause a generalized overall poor condition, this is much more difficult to treat. But if this energy can be put into a specific form, one pimple, one pain, one ulcer, at least the problem is recognized, localized, and can be treated with somewhat less difficulty.现在你可以这么做，那也是每一个人都可以做的，就如同对物质的身体所做的一样。如果他的反应引起了笼统的、全面性的、很糟的情况，这更不容易处理。但如果这个能量可以转成一个具体的形式，粉刺、疼痛，或溃疡，至少问题被认明、被定位，那就没那么难被处理。
There was no need for your garageman to think, then, that the trouble had not been noticed, for when he examined the car last the overall condition was poor. But there was no specific physical or localized trouble. I thought that you would find this rather interesting.因此车厂维修员不需要觉得是他们疏忽了，当他们上次检查车子的时候，它整体的状况是很糟的。但那时并没有特定物质上的，或已经被定位的问题。我相信你们会觉得这个相当有趣。
(Jane smiled again. I did find it interesting, especially when I contemplated trying to explain it to our service manager at the garage, who is a personal friend of ours, but does not know about these sessions.)(珍再次微笑。我的确觉得很有趣，特别是当我考虑要向修车厂的服务经理解释时，他是我们的一个朋友，但并不知道这些课。)
I was pleased with the trance state that you achieved when you visited your dentist. And when you can do this under that stress, you see that you can also do it in other situations. With your parents for example you can use this knowledge, so that their actions will not upset you unduly. With them you simply need the suggestion that you will only react to constructive suggestions.我很高兴看到你去看牙医时所达到的出离状态。而当你可以在那样的压力下做到这点，你也可以在其他的情况下做到。比如，对待你们的父母时，你就可以用到这个知识，那样他们的行为就不会过度的让你们心烦。对待他们你只需要简单的暗示而已，你只对建设性的暗示起反应。
This still leaves you free from ordinary reactions with them, need not close you off from conversation, and yet gives you an immunity from their negative attitudes. In such a manner you can indeed help them while remaining free yourself.这会让你免除日常对他们的反应，不需要关闭和他们的对话，而又能让你对他们的负面态度免疫。以这样的方式，你能确实的帮到他们，也能令自己自在。
Both of you do this now in relation to your Miss Callahan, so you should understand the feel of it.当对着你们的卡拉汉小姐时，你们两个现在都会这么做，所以你们应该能了解这样的感觉。
You may take your break.你们可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:21. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes had opened frequently, and her pace had been fast as the session progressed. She resumed in the same manner at 9:26.)(9:21休息。珍在第一段出离如常。她的眼睛频繁的睁开，当课进行的时候，她的速度变得很快，她以同样的方式在9:26重新开始。)
Now. I have several things to say.现在。我有几件事情要说。
First of all, to give you a rest, Joseph, you may tape any sessions that you prefer, say, tape one weeks sessions during which Ruburt could then transcribe the notes to give you some extra time for yourself. He could follow your format and type them now and then for you.首先，约瑟，为了要让你能休息一下，你可以录下任何你想要的一节，比如说，录下一周的课，鲁柏可以帮着抄录这些笔记，好让你能有额外的时间休息。他可以照着你的格式，偶尔为你打字。
I have much more material on inverted time to give you, but there is a personal matter that I would like to discuss.我有更多关于倒置时间的资料要给你，而有一件个人的事我想和你讨论。
Your attitude toward your faithful old car is not based upon the reasons you ascribe it to. An automobile means one thing to you and one thing to Ruburt. Obviously your backgrounds have much to do with this, but I do not believe that you realize what I am about to tell you.你对于你那台忠实老爷车的态度，并不是基于你所认为的理由。一台汽车对你而言是一件事，但对鲁柏而言又是另一件事。很明显，你们的背景与这点有关，但我不认为你明白我即将要告诉你的。
Do you have any idea, now?现在，你知道我想说什么吗？
(“Maybe.”(“也许。”
(I thought Seth was going to say something about my attitudes influencing the actual physical behavior of the car.)(我认为赛斯将要说，某件有关于我的态度影响了车子实际功能的事。)
I am speaking of the relationship in your mind between your father and automobiles. Has this occurred to you?我要说的是在你心里，你父亲和汽车之间的关系。这有让你想起什么吗?
(“Only in a very general, symbolical way.”(“只有一个笼统、象征性的方向。”
(Jane smiled, her eyes wide and dark.)(珍微笑，她的眼睛很大很深邃。)
Well then, it is indeed time for these remarks.那么，现在就是说这些评论的时候了。
First of all, for Ruburt’s idea of an automobile. For his ideas are simpler and easier to explain. His mother could not leave the house. He always ran as a child to make sure that he could move at all. To him a car is an extension of that mobility.首先，关于鲁柏对汽车的想法。他的想法比较简单和容易解释。他的母亲无法离开房子，他总是像一个孩子般的奔跑，是为了确定他是可以移动的。对他而言，车子是这种移动性的延伸。
It does not matter whether the car is old or new, as long as he has one, and it is for this reason that he fights any of your suggestions that you do without one. The car is also to him a complementary image of his father, who was always on the move, more so than most men, while his mother could not move at all. A lack of a car also makes him fear a return to poverty, since in his neighborhood any car at all was a sign of luxury.不管车子是新或是旧，只要他有一台就够了，而也是因为这个原因，他反抗着任何你不想要有车的建议。车子对他而言，也是他父亲的一个补强形象，当他的母亲完全不能动的时候，他父亲总是比大部分男人更加动个不停。缺乏一台车总是让他恐惧会再次回到贫穷，因为在他的环境里，车子就是一种奢华的象征。
Now your situation is not only entirely different but contrary, for to you a car represents, because of your father, an image on one hand of perfection. Your father insisted, because of his work with batteries, upon perfection. An old car hardly represents this image.现在你的处境不只和鲁柏完全不同，甚至还完全相反，因为你的父亲，车子对你而言是一个完美的形象。你的父亲完美，因为他是做电瓶的工作。一台旧车很难代表这种形象。
(I am 46. As a young boy I used to watch my father make automobile batteries by hand. He had his own business in Sayre, PA, and took great pride in the excellence of his work. The business began to fail when batteries became mass produced, and the great depression finished it.)(我今年46岁。当我还是小男孩的时候，我曾看着父亲手作汽车的电瓶。他在宾州塞尔有他自己的公司，而且对他的工作非常自豪。后来因为电瓶开始大量生产，生意开始走下坡，最后他的公司因为经济大萧条而结束。)
Your father would like to kick at old cars, for he felt that they defied him since they worked improperly. More than this however, both of your parents still feel that a car is a symbol of social status, and you grew up with this. When your cars were new you felt at one with them. But an old car brings back the old struggles between your parents, and it is precisely here that subconsciously you and Ruburt do not agree. He gladly settles on an old car—anything that moves will do. But to you the old car has not meant freedom, but imperfection.你的父亲可能会踹那些旧车，因为它们功用不佳，他觉得这是对他的蔑视。不过，不只是这样，你们两个的父母都觉得车子是社会地位的象征，而你们是在这样的想法下成长的。当你们的车子是新的时候，你们的感觉是一致的。但一台旧车就会把你们带回你们父母之间的矛盾，这里就恰好是潜意识里，你和鲁柏不同的地方。他很高兴地安于一台旧车——只要能动就行。但是对你而言，旧车代表的不是自由，而是不完美。
I want to make this clear, for it should help you both to understand your reactions, and to change them accordingly. Some of your most basic feelings toward the automobile grew as a result of the early trip to California, when for days on end as a child you heard your parents bickering. They were uncertain of what they would find, pessimistic, and they blamed each other for having left at all.我想把这点说清楚，它应该会帮助你们两个了解你们自己的反应，而相应的去改变。有一些你最原始的、对于汽车的感觉，是在早期的加州之旅后逐渐地增强，当还是孩子的时候，你常听你的父母在争吵。他们悲观，不确定自己要寻找什么，而他们总是谴责对方的离开。
This is not the adventurous spirit they told you of, and you heard every word. On the other hand you do have a rather deeply felt feeling for mechanical objects. This has some connection with your position in the service. But the conscious reasons that you have for being annoyed with your automobile, these reasons are rationalizations to hide the deeper causes.这并不是他们告诉过你的冒险精神，而你听进了每一个字。另一方面，你的确对机械的物件有相当深的感觉。这可能和你在当兵时的职务有一些关联。但你被你的汽车所困扰的这个意识上的理由，是用来合理化的掩藏更深的原因。
(I was three years old when my parents made the month-long drive to California, and my brother Loren was two. I have a few vivid conscious memories of the trip. I grew up listening to my parents talk about the trip. When I was drafted during the second World War I was given aptitude tests; to my surprise I did well on mechanical subjects, and made up as an airplane mechanic and instrument specialist in the Air Transport Command.)(我3岁的时候，我的父母花了一个月的时间开车去加利福尼亚，而我的弟弟洛伦当时才两岁。我对那一次的旅行有一些清晰的记忆。我成长的岁月常听我父母谈起那次旅行。当我在第一次世界大战被分派的时候，我做了一个性向测验；我很惊讶地发现我在机械方面的分数很高，因此最后被指派到航空运输部队担任飞机机械工具的专门人员。)
There is also a lesser connection here with the garage in which your father spent so much of his time, for you picked up your mother’s anger that he was so often there. One small remark and you may take your break: Ruburt, for the reasons mentioned earlier, also liked anything with wheels that moved, roller skates for example. Anything that offered hope of mobility.这里还有一个次要的关联是，你父亲花了这么多的时间在修车厂，而你收到了你母亲对此事的愤怒。再一个小评论，你们就可以休息了：鲁柏，因为之前提过的理由，他也喜欢任何有轮子、可以动的东西，比如溜冰鞋。任何可以提供移动希望的东西。
