When the inverted time system is understood for what it is, then the individual is in contact simultaneously with the experience gained in the so-called past, and is also able to take advantage of events which have not yet occurred within your present. This does not mean that he will be consciously aware of future events, for if you remember these events can be changed by him at any time. He is constantly making his own experience. He is constantly forming the events of the past, even as he forms the events of the present and future.当一个人了解倒置时间系统是什么的时候，他就可以同时联系过去得到的经验，也能现在善用还未发生的事件。这并不意味着他会有意识的觉知到未来的事件，如果你记得，这些事件可以在任何时间被他所改变。他持续创造他自己的经验。他持续形成过去的事件，正如他形成现在和未来的事件一样。
In many respects the individual is not at the mercy of past events, for he changes them constantly. He is not therefore at the mercy of future events, for he changes these also, not only before but also after their occurrence. I regret that our friend Philip does not have the preliminary background to follow this discussion with clarity.在很多方面，个人不是任由过去事件的摆布，因为他也持续地改变着它们。因此，他也不是任由未来事件摆布，因为他也在改变着它们，不只是在事件发生之前，也在事件发生之后。我很遗憾，我们的朋友菲利普没有基础背景可以清楚地跟随着这个讨论。
Now. So-called hunches indeed are often caused by an inner recognition that a given event might occur. As you know, there is no cause and effect as you understand it. Nevertheless there are probabilities. Now basically it is not true to say that an individual's decisions must be based upon concrete events within his own past, nor that he is largely imprisoned by his past, nor that his future actions are predetermined by his past experience. For as you now understand the past is as real as the future, no more and no less. The past exists as far as the individual is concerned as a pattern of electromagnetic currents within the brain, and these connections constantly change.现在。所谓的预感，的确常常是由内在认出一个特定事件即将发生而引起的。如你所知，这里并没有你所了解的因与果。不过这里是有可能性的。现在，一个人的决定必须奠基在他自己过去具体的事件，或他很大程度是被他的过去所禁锢，或他未来的行动是由他过去的经验预告决定的，这些说法基本上并不是真的。就如你现在所了解的，过去和未来是同样的真实，不多也不少。就个人而言，过去是以大脑里电磁流的模式而存在，而这些连结是持续在改变的。
The individual can change past action within however the limitations earlier mentioned in our last session. Therefore his future actions are not dependent upon a concrete and unchanging past, for such a past never existed.不过，个人可以在我们上一节课提过的限制里改变过去的行动。因此他未来的行动并不依赖着一个具体和不变的过去，因为这样的过去是不存在的。
I would like these points made most clearly. Now. An event foreseen through precognition or clairvoyance, a future event, may or may not actually occur within time as you know it. For you are seeing into probabilities, and the probable event may or may not occur, within your time system.我希望把这些重点说得很清楚。现在。一个透过预知力或洞察力所预见的事件，一个未来的事件，可能会或可能不会在你们所知道的时间里真实的发生。因为你们看到的是可能性，而这个可能的事件，在你们的时间系统里，可能会或可能不会发生。
Such an event will however occur within another time system, for all probabilities become actual, although you may not perceive them. Our friend Dunne was quite correct here.不过这样的事件将会在另一个时间系统里发生，因为所有的可能性都会变成真实的，虽然你可能感知不到。在这里我们的朋友唐尼十分的正确。
I shall now let you take a break, and enjoy a brief social discussion.我现在应该让你们休息，享受一下短暂的社交讨论。
(Jane paused at 9:16, her eyes still closed. She then resumed briefly.)(珍在9:16停顿，她的眼睛仍闭着。然后她短暂地重新开始。)
For now, just write down 12th Street, and let it go at that. The 12th Street may have a significance to Philip.现在，只要写下第12街，然后忘了它。第12街对菲利普可能具有意义。
(Break at 9:17. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first break. Her eyes had remained closed, her pace had been fast, her voice stronger, deeper, and more emphatic than usual.(9:17休息。珍在第一段出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，速度变快，声音比平常大声，低沉和有力。
(John Bradley didn’t say anything about the 12th Street data, as I hoped he wouldn’t, and Jane didn't ask him about it. During break we discussed John's company, Searle Drug, which is in the throes of financial difficulties compounded by management problems; Seth has discussed this often when John has been present, and to date his statements have been accurate.(约翰·布莱德利没有说任何关于第12街的资料，我也希望他不要，而珍也没有问他。在休息的时候，我们讨论到约翰的公司，塞尔药厂，它正处于财务困难和问题的挣扎期；约翰在场的时候，赛斯常讨论这点，而到目前为止，他的说法都是正确的。
(Just before break ended the conversation concerned some of the new drug products Searle has coming on the market. Jane resumed in a most active and emphatic manner, her eyes still closed, at 9:29.)(休息正要结束之前，话题谈到塞尔药厂要上市的几种新药。珍以一种积极、有力的方式在9:29分重新开始。)
I do find the conversation quite amusing, and having no problems of that kind myself I will therefore avoid making any comments.我的确发现这个讨论十分有趣，而我也不逃避做任何的评论。
Now. These probabilities, these events that may or may not occur, are extremely interesting. Let us consider our self one and time one. As a rule our self two can indeed view what may happen in self one’s future. However, our self two views probabilities, and some of these probabilities will indeed occur to self one. Some will not, and this is where, again, our friends Priestley and Dunne fall short.现在。这些可能性, 这些可能会或可能不会发生的事件，真的非常有趣。让我们想想我们的自己一和时间。在多数情况下，我们的自己二确实能看到自己一的未来可能会发生什么。不过，我们的自己二看到的是可能性，而有一些这样的可能性将确实发生在自己一身上，但有一些不会。而再次的，这是我们的朋友普莱斯利和唐尼所缺乏的观点。
Priestley was right also to some extent here. These probabilities do occur somewhere, but they will occur to a self that Priestley nor Dunne ever imagined—a self who exists simultaneously with any given individual, and who is a part of him; but a self that he will never know while he is within your particular system.缺
Someday we shall explain this in mathematical terms. However for now we shall try plain English. Every thought is composed of its own energy, and it has an effect within energy. We are not speaking here now of your tired old cause and effect theory however. Every action changes every other action. Any probability is a reality whether or not it occurs within your own system, and I shall add to that early mention.有一天我们会以数学的术语来解释这个。不过现在我们应该先用纯英文试试。每一个想法是由它自己的能量所组成，而它在能量上会有一个效应。不过我们在这里说的，不是你们陈腔滥调的因果论。每一个行动改变另一个行动。任何可能性，不管它有没有发生在你们自己的系统，都是一个实相，而我应该把这个加进先前所提到的内容里。
Reality within some systems other than you own, is experienced not as a series of moments, but as experience into all the probabilities of action that exist within any given instant. A continuity therefore is in terms of the self rather than in terms of a series of moments. Instead there is a series of selves—某一些与你们自己不同的系统里，实相不是以一系列的片刻被经验的，而是以存在于任何特定片刻的行动之所有可能性被经验的。因此一个连续性是就自己而言，而不是一系列的片刻来说。取而代之的是一系列的自己们——。
(Jane's eyes now began to open wide for emphasis; they were very dark. Her voice was strong, her manner most emphatic and fast. She gestured frequently as she spoke.)(珍的眼睛现在开始为了强调而睁得很大；它们非常深邃。她的声音强烈，风格快而有力。她说话的时候常比手势。)
—with the inner ego operating consciously to give continuity.——随着内在自我有意识地运作来给予连续性。
In such a system therefore your ideas of present, past and future would not exist. Nor would your idea of one and only one event at a time be understood. Now this dimension exists in a reality which Priestley nor Dunne even began to examine.因此在这样一个系统，你对现在、过去和未来这样的想法并不存在。在一个时间点里有一个或只有一个的这种想法也不会被了解。现在存在于一个实相的这种维度是普莱斯利或唐尼未能开始审视的。
The whole psychological formation of the perceiver is entirely different, and there is no one event out of all probable events, but there is experience of all the mathematically probable events that could happen to any given individual, within any given amount of time as you know it.感知者的整个心理组成是完全不同的，没有一个事件是在所有可能的事件之外，但所有数学上可能事件的经验，能发生在任何你所知道的特定时间内任何特定的个人身上。
(Consider the whole of the next paragraph underlined, so strong and positive was Jane's delivery.)(考虑到珍传递的资讯如此强调、有力，下一段进行了下划线。)
The psychological composition of the perceiving participator is therefore entirely alien to your own. In such a system however, as in your own, the perceiver is also a participator and a creator, but he does not work with your conception of time, but with probabilities. In your terms then, he would seem to delve into each moment in all of its probabilities, so that in your time on the one hand many centuries would have passed, and on the other hand only an instant.因此，这个感知参与者的心理组成完全和你们的迥异。不过在这样的一个系统，就和你们自己的系统一样，感知者也是一个参与者和创造者，但他不以你们对时间的概念运作，而是以可能性运作。用你们的话来说，他好像是在探究每一个片刻里所有的可能性，因此在你的时间里，一方面有好几个世纪过去了，另一方面却只过了一瞬间。
The time system is entirely different here. The value fulfillment is quite as valid however within both systems, and in a very loose fashion this probability system could be compared to Dunnes time three.这里的时间系统是完全不同的。不过价值完成在两个系统里是同样的有效，而以一个很粗略的方式，这个可能性系统可以比作唐尼的时间三。
(Seth said a little on the above ideas when he began to give us the material on the electrical field and on moment points, several months ago. This was some time before Jane began reading Dunne and Priestley.)(赛斯曾在几个月前，给我们电子场域和片刻点的资料时，说过一些上面的概念。这是在珍开始阅读唐尼和普莱斯利之前。)
There would be many respects however where they would not agree, and I mention this similarity only to make my idea somewhat more clear to you.不过这里有很多细节他们并不会认同，我提到这个相似点，只是让你们更清楚我的概念。
We will have a break. I am anxious however to tie in this material on the system of probabilities with dreams, for at times there can be a connection; and something indeed that our friends Priestley and Dunne did not consider—for their self three can indeed wander outside of the dimensions which they assigned to him.我们休息一下。不过我急着要把这些可能性系统的资料和梦连结在一起，因为有时候，这里可能会有些关联；而有些东西我们的朋友普莱斯利和唐尼确实没有考虑过——因为他们的自己三确实能漫游在被分配给它的维度之外。
(Break at 9:48. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her voice and manner had been strong and emphatic, her pace fast.(9:48休息。珍出离如常。她的声音和态度强而有力，速度很快。
(Just before first break Seth had mentioned a 12th St. in connection with John Bradley. Jane now asked John about it, but John said he wouldn't tell her anything about such a statement yet. Jane said she received this bit of data quite strongly while giving Seth’s other material, and that at first she wasn’t going to give voice to it because she wasn’t sure if it was from Seth or herself . Then she decided to speak it out anyhow.(在第一次休息前，赛斯提到第12街和约翰·布莱德利有关联。珍现在问约翰这件事，但约翰说他还无法告诉她任何有关这段声音的事。珍说，当她在给赛斯其他资料的时候，她十分强烈的收到了这个资料，一开始她没有说出口，是因为她不确定这是从赛斯还是从她自己来的。然后她决定不管怎样都要说出来。
(Janes eyes had been open and very dark during much of the above delivery. Since it was now time for the 33rd Dr. Instream test however, her eyes closed and her pace slowed considerably. Her head was down, her hands raised to her face. Resume at 10:05.)(珍上面的口述大部分时间眼睛都是睁开的，而且眼神非常深邃。现在是时候开始我们第33次殷斯翠姆博士测验，她的眼睛闭着，速度相对的慢下来。她的头低着，手举到她的脸上。在10:05重新开始。)
Now, give us a moment for our Dr. Instream material.现在，为了殷斯翠姆博士的资料，请给我们一点时间。
I get the impression of glass. He is looking at a glass. The glass is the object. (Pause.)我有一个玻璃杯的印象。他看着一个玻璃杯。玻璃杯是物件。(停顿)
The glass is in front of him. I do not pick up any strong emotional attachment between him and the object.玻璃杯放在他面前。我在他和物件之间并没有收到任何强烈的情感连结。
Now for other impressions. Wisteria.现在其他的印象。紫藤。
(John Bradley shifted his position on the divan. Jane spoke to him without changing her position.)(约翰·布莱德利在沙发上改变他的位置。珍在同一个位置对他说话。)
Philip, during the test data please try to be as quiet as possible. Dr. Instreams hypnosis experiments now doing very well. Some slight difficulty in one particular area, caused by a motor malfunction. The malfunction the result of subconscious associations on the part of the subject. (Pause.)菲利普，在给测验资料期间，请尽可能地保持安静。殷斯翠姆博士的催眠实验现在进行得非常顺利。在一个特定的地方有一些小问题，是因为马达失灵引起的。失灵是源自于受试者的潜意识连结。(停顿)
The glass which I have given as the object has a connection with roses. A disturbance also. This disturbance is in connection with the owner of the glass.我说的物件玻璃杯和玫瑰有关联。也有一场骚动。这场骚动和玻璃杯的主人有关联。
1934, also in connection with the object.1934，也和这个物件有关联。
Dr. Instreams physical condition disturbs him more than usual. A pronounced limp. (Pause.) There is a connection with the glass and a note. (Pause.) The note from a woman.殷斯翠姆博士的身体状况比平常更困扰他。明显的跛脚。(停顿)这个玻璃杯和一张短笺有关联。(停顿)这张短笺来自一个女人。
Do you have a test for me, Joseph?你有测验要给我吗，约瑟？
(“No. ’’(“没有。”
(It was 10:14. Jane retained her position, sitting with her hands raised to her closed eyes, her head down, her voice slow.)(现在是10:14分。珍保持她的位置坐着，手举到她闭起的眼睛上，她的头低着，音量很小。)
I repeat the short data given earlier for Philip, in a town that is large and not in this location. I think also of a meeting and a fat man.我重复之前给菲利普的简短资料，在一个大的城镇但不在这个所在地。我也想到一个会议和一个胖男人。
The number 4, and 8 o’clock. At least I believe the number 8 refers to time. A stuffy place. Also an apartment. Three alternate plans. Two were not followed, and there is a question over the third.数字4，还有8点。至少我认为数字8指的是时间。一个闷热的地方。还有一间公寓。三个替代方案。两个没有跟着做，不确定第三个有没有做。
A corner bar and grill establishment in the same town, I believe, though I am not certain, as the 12th Street address. And in connection with this a tall thin man, and a discussion concerning money.我认为在相同的镇上有一家转角的酒吧和烧烤餐馆，虽然我不确定，像是第12街的地址。和这个有关联的是一个高瘦的男人，一场关于钱的讨论。
A hilltop address. Two women live together, this is a separate impression. One woman wears a string of beads, and Philip knows her. 1652.一个山顶的地址。两个女人住在一起，这是一个分别的印象。一个女人戴着一串珠子，而菲利普认识她。1652。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:18. Jane was dissociated as usual. She received no images, she said, while giving either the Dr. Instream or the John Bradley material.(10:18休息。珍出离如常。她说不管是给殷斯翠姆博士，或是给约翰·布莱德利资料的时候，她都没有收到印象。
(At first John said Seth's material meant little or nothing to him. This is just about a standard first reaction from witnesses for whom Seth has given such material; offhand Jane and I can think of no one who has reacted differently. It takes time for memory to begin to work. As usual I read Seth’s data back to John, and as he has in past sessions he then began to make connections. See the 135th, 166th, 190th, 199th, 200th, and 204th sessions for material re. John. A fair amount of the material is telepathic and/or clairvoyant, especially that of the 204th session. Seth expands on this last session in the 205th and 206th sessions, and deals with Johns experience in hearing Seth speak to him when he was alone.(首先，约翰说赛斯的资料对他而言没什么意义。这常是赛斯把资料给参与者时，他们标准的第一个反应；珍和我没见过有其他不一样反应的人。回忆是需要点时间的。如往常一样，我把赛斯的资料念给约翰听，然后像前几节那样，他开始做连结。见第135、166、190、199、200和204节关于约翰的资料。有相当数量的资料是心电感应和预知力，特别是第204节。赛斯延长这最后一节到第205和206节，处理当约翰独处时，他听到赛斯说话的那次经验。
(John attended a salesmens meeting, held by his employer, Searle Drug, in Cleveland OH on January 12¬-14,1966. He stayed at the Sheraton-Hilton Hotel. The president of the company and his top assistants also attended the meeting.(约翰参加了一个由他的公司，塞尔药厂，1966年1月12日至14日，在俄亥俄州克里夫兰所举办的销售员会议。他住在喜来登酒店。公司的负责人和首席助理也参加了这个会议。
(“12th Street. "John now told us that he took several meals in the Manger Hotel—pronounced with a hard G—and had some business engagements there also. This hotel is on either 12th or 13th St. in Cleveland; John was not positive, but felt the address would be 12th Street rather than 13th Street.(“第12街。”约翰现在告诉我们，他在曼爵饭店(Manger Hotel)吃了几次饭——重音在G——在那儿，也有几次商业聚餐。这家饭店在克里夫兰第12或第13街；约翰并不肯定，但他感觉地址应该在第12街而不是第13街。
(“in a town that is large and not in this location.” Cleveland is of course some distance from here. As stated Jane did not hear John mention Cleveland to me, although she knew he had been traveling. In any case Seth mentioned no city by name.(“在一个大的城镇，但不在这个所在地。”克利夫兰当然离这里有一段距离。如之前所述，珍并没有听到约翰向我提起克里夫兰，虽然她知道他去旅行。无论如何，赛斯没有提起任何城市的名字。
(“I think also of a meeting and a fat man. "At the Sheraton-Hilton John had several meetings with Searle's Washington, DC representative to the government, Mr. McKeown. This man engaged John in conversations designed to feel him out, John said, and did it so cleverly that the meeting in Cleveland was over before he fully realized what had taken place. John is aware that he is being considered for promotion however. Mr. McKeown, John told us, is quite overweight, but is not a truly obese person. John said his own idea of a “fat" man is one who is grossly overweight; this Mr. McKeown is not, even though on the heavy side.(“我也想到一个会议和一个胖男人”。在喜来登，约翰和塞尔在华盛顿首府的代表麦奇央先生有几次聚会。这个和约翰谈话的人原意是想多了解他，约翰说，他做得如此高明，以至于等到克里夫兰的聚会结束后他才完全明白发生了什么。约翰意识到，他在考虑他的晋升。约翰告诉我们，麦奇央先生有点过重，但不算是真的太胖。约翰说他自己对“胖”的想法是超重非常多的人；这位麦奇央先生不算，虽然他体重偏重。
(“The number 4, “John could offer no interpretation here.(“数字4”，约翰在这里无法提出任何说明。
(“8 o’clock. "John said this could refer to a time in the evening when he was supposed to make a telephone call, but he doesn’t consider it very relevant.(“8点。”约翰说这可能指晚上的一个时间，他应该在这个时间里打一通电话，但他并不觉得非常有关。
(“A stuffy place.” This is most interesting, John said, because of the fact that the Sheraton-Hilton was very stuff during the three nights he was there. Indeed, John said, it was so stuff at night particularly that he had trouble sleeping, and was out of bed several times.(“一个闷热的地方。”约翰说这是最有趣的，因为他待在那儿的3个晚上，喜来登都非常的闷热。约翰说，晚上确实特别的闷热，他甚至睡不着，起床了好几次。
(I might add another bit of information here, to the effect that on Jan. 8 Jane had a dream in which she saw a strange room, not a bedroom although there was a bed in it. The room, she knew in her dream, belonged to John Bradley, although she did not see him in the dream. In addition the bed had been slept in, and the bedclothes were tossed about as though John had been quite restless. The time was at night in the dream. We do not know if there is a connection here.(我想在这里加另一个讯息，大概是1月8日，珍做了一个梦，她看到一个奇怪的房间，不是卧室，虽然里面有一张床。在她的梦里，她知道这个房间是属于约翰·布莱德利的，虽然她在梦里并没有看到他。此外，床被睡过，床单凌乱，就好像约翰睡得十分不安似的。在梦里时间是晚上9点。我们不知道这里是否有关联。
(“Also an apartment. "John could offer nothing here at the moment, although there was a good connection, involving the Sheraton-Hilton and Mr. McKeown. It will be explained later in the session.(“还有一间公寓。”约翰此刻无法提供任何讯息，虽然在喜来登和麦奇央先生之间有一个相关性。等会在课里会有解释。
(“Three alternate plans. "John said he didn't see connections here, unless the reference was to his own personal plans. Recently he did have three plans in mind, which Jane and I also knew about, and which Seth had mentioned. These were to leave Searle and buy a restaurant in his hometown of Williamsport, PA; to stay with Searle and in Williamsport; or to demand a transfer of location from Searle, and a promotion. Mr. McKeown is involved with the last of these alternatives, so it is conceivable that “there is a question over the third.” as stated by Seth.(“3个替代方案。”约翰说在这里，他并没有看到连结，除非这里说的是他自己的计划。最近他在心里的确有三个计划，珍和我也知道，而赛斯也曾提过。这些分别是离开塞尔，在宾州威廉波特他的故乡买一家餐厅；待在塞尔和威廉波特；或要求从塞尔调职或晋升。麦奇央先生涉及了最后一个选项，所以赛斯叙述的“不确定第三个有没有做”是可信的。
(“A corner bar and grill establishment in the same town, I believe, though I am not certain, as the 12th Street address. "Seth is correct here, John said. The Hotel Manger is situated at a corner location, and the bar and grill in the hotel is on the comer. As stated, the hotel is on either 12th or 13th Street.(“我认为在相同的镇上有一家转角的酒吧和烧烤餐馆，虽然我不确定，像是第12街的地址。”约翰说，赛斯在这里是对的。曼爵饭店正位于转角处，而饭店里的酒吧和烧烤店也是在转角。之前说过，饭店不是在第12街就是在第13街。
(“And in connection with this a tall thin man, and a discussion concerning money. "John said he accompanied a tall thin man to the Hotel Manger's dining room, which is located next to the bar and grill. The tall thin man also has a position high up in the company, John said. John could look into the bar and grill of the Manger from where he sat while eating supper. He had a long talk with the company executive, but money was not the specific subject of the conversation.(“和这个有关联的是一个高瘦的男人，一场关于钱的讨论。”约翰说，他陪着一个高瘦的男人去曼爵饭店的餐厅，是位在酒吧和烧烤店的旁边。约翰说，这位高瘦的男子也是公司的高层。在他吃晚餐所坐的位置，约翰可以看见酒吧和烧烤餐厅。他和公司的主管有一场长谈，但钱并不是谈话中特定的主题。
("A hilltop address. Two women...” one of which John knows, and “1652.” meant nothing in particular to John, at the moment.(“一个山顶的住址。两个女人……”其中一个约翰认识，还有“1652”，在此时，这对约翰并没有特别的意义。
(We were discussing these last points when Seth came through again. Jane resumed at a fast pace, with her eyes closed, at 10:37.)(当赛斯再次透过来的时候，我们正在讨论最后一点。珍的眼睛闭着，以一种比较快的速度在10:37分重新开始。)
The two women referred—I am not sure so we shall go slowly—the two women live together and they had reference to one of the two gentlemen I have mentioned in connection with Philip.这两个女人指的是——我不太确定，所以我们应该进行得慢一点——这两个女人住在一起，她们和我刚提到和菲利普有连结的两个男士中其中一个有关联。
Here I also pick up 34. Now I am not certain whether this refers to the age of one of the women, or whether they live on a 34th Street in the same city. One has a connection with jewelry.这里我也收到了34。现在我不确定这指的是其中一个女人的年纪，或是她们住在同一个城市的第34街。有一个和珠宝有关联。
(“Not too fast.”)(“不要太快。”)
Perhaps she works in a jewelry shop. I also pick up the name Alfred—an atrocious name—and a Leo.也许她在珠宝店工作。我也收到一个名字艾尔菲——一个糟糕的名字——和一个名字里奥。
But I am going too far, for I am thinking now of the bartender, and this will not help us.但我说的太远了，因为我现在想到酒保，而这对我们没什么帮助。
An occasion at Philip’s home at about three o’clock in the afternoon, in connection with his family. A grievance also.大约下午3点的时候，在菲利普家有一个庆祝会，与他的家人有关。也有一件令人心生不满的事。
I will here end our session, with a gentle note to Ruburt, that I have asked him not to smoke when we are dealing with such material. Also a supper engagement, two men, and a paper is shown.我要在这里结束这一节了，我对鲁柏有一个温和的提醒，我告诉过他当我们处理这些资料的时候不要抽烟。也有一个晚餐的约定，两个男人，和一份秀出来的文件。
Now, my heartiest regards to you all. And as always I regret leaving, for you grow on me.现在，我对你们所有人最衷心的祝福。如往常一样，我很遗憾要离开了，我越来越喜欢你们了。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
([John:] “Good night, Seth.”([约翰：]“晚安，赛斯。”
(End, presumably, at 10:47. Jane's eyes had remained closed, and she had smoked during this last delivery.(大概在10:47结束。珍的眼睛仍闭着，她在最后一段口述时抽烟。
(John said he could offer little help, still, on the two women mentioned by Seth. He said that one of his friends sees a woman friend whenever he goes to Cleveland, and that perhaps this woman has a companion, or a roommate.(约翰说，关于赛斯提到的那两个女人，他可以提供一些协助。他说他的一个朋友每次去克里夫兰都会去见一个女性友人。这个女人好像有一个同伴，或是室友。
(During my efforts to get as much data written down as possible, I forgot to ask John whether “a supper engagement, two men, and a paper is shown.” meant anything to him.(在我努力想尽可能的写下资料时，我忘了问约翰“一个晚餐约定，两个男人，和秀出来的文件”对他有什么意义。)
(John was interested in whether Seth could add anything to the long range material he has given concerning Searle Drug over the past year and a half. This material is somewhat long and complicated, and is covered in the sessions John has witnessed: 37, 54, 63, 70, 95, 135, 166, 190, 204. Searle is going through a financial and management crisis, and this is reflected in the stock market; John is naturally concerned. See Volumes I through 5.(约翰对赛斯能否补充任何关于塞尔药厂这一年半以来的资料很感兴趣。这些资料有些长且复杂，它们涵盖在约翰曾出席的这几节里：37、54、63、70、95、135、166、190、204。塞尔正遭受财务和管理的危机，而这也反映在股市上；约翰自然很关心。见第一册至第五册。
(John said his barber in Williamsport, PA, is named Alfred, and that a friend of his who is active in a political organization that John belongs to, in Williamsport, is named Leo. But if these names refer to Cleveland, John could offer no confirmation.(约翰说，他在宾夕法尼亚州威廉波特的理发师名叫艾尔菲，而他的一个朋友，活跃在威廉波特、约翰所属的一个政治机构里，名叫里奥(Leo)，但约翰不敢确认这几个名字是否和克里夫兰有关。
(Nor could John pinpoint any three o'clock occasion in particular at his home, in connection with his family, or with a grievance.(约翰也无法说明三点钟在他家的一场特别庆祝会，和他家人有关，或是一件令人心生不满的事是什么。
(In reply to Johns queries about Searle, Seth came through once again. Jane resumed in a quieter voice, with her eyes closed, at 10:45.)(回应约翰对塞尔的询问，赛斯再一次地透过来，珍闭着眼睛，以一种比较安静的声音，在10:45重新开始。)
The connection should be rather apparent, and beginnings are already known. Events will take place, in the main, as I said that they would.这关联应该相当的明显，而且一开始就已经知道了。基本上，事情将会发生，就像我曾说过的。
I pick up in connection with this the initials A J, A G—I am not certain.我收到这和缩写A J有关联，或是A G——我不确定。
At another meeting some other aspects were made known to you, Philip, of which you may not be consciously aware. A vague but definite connection to Dayton, OH, here. A man with connections with Dayton, OH will be involved with a change in your company. We speak in terms of probabilities. Nevertheless no actions thus far have occurred to drastically change any of the predicted events, and unless actions are so initiated events will occur as given.在另一次会议上，你可能会知道某些讯息，菲利普，你可能并未有意识的觉察到，在这里和俄亥俄州丹顿，有一个模糊但明确的连结。一个和俄亥俄州丹顿有关联的男人将会涉及你们公司的改变。我们是就可能性来说的。不过目前没有发生什么行动去急剧改变任何预定的事件，而除非行动开始了，刚刚所说的事件才会发生。
There is a child, a female, who is seemingly not connected with any of these episodes, who will be important in a mans decision. Now see what you can make of all this.有一个小孩，女性，似乎和任何这些插曲都没有关系，但她对一个男人的决定有重要的影响。现在看看你能不能了解这个。
(Break at 10:49. Jane had been dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed.(10:49休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着。
(Seth’s predictions for Searle include the loss of power for the current vice president, who is the son of the company’s founder, although the son may retain a titular chair. There is to be a drastic reorganization, finally, after all else fails. John, according to Seth, would be wise to remain with the company, for eventually things will work out well Seth told John he could go as far as he desired in the company. John has been sounded out before by high officials, and was again at this Cleveland meeting.(赛斯对塞尔的预言包括，现任的副会长会失去权力，他是公司创立人的儿子，虽然这个儿子会保留名义上的位子。最后，在所有这些都失败后，会有一个急剧的重整。据赛斯所说，约翰最好是留在公司，因为最后事情的发展会很好。赛斯告诉约翰，他在公司可以升到他想要的位置。约翰在之前曾被高层试探，在这次克里夫兰的会议又再一次的被试探。
(As stated earlier, the sounding out was quite subtle as performed by Mr. McKeown and the other official, the tall thin man. They sought to learn John’s views while not committing themselves in any way, so as to save themselves the embarrassment of being refused. John has since written to Mr. McKeown for further information---this after he realized what was transpiring.(如之前所说，这个试探十分的隐蔽，是来自麦奇央先生和另一个高层，那个瘦高男子。他们询问约翰的看法，却没有任何的承诺，好像担心被拒绝会没面子。约翰有写给麦奇央先生询问进一步的消息——这是在他了解发生了什么之后。
(As John explained company politics to us now, he said he thought he saw a connection with Seth’s mention of an “apartment, "on page 235. It will be remembered that at first John could offer nothing for this data. Mr. McKeown, John said, had gone so far as to invite him up to his private room at the Sheraton-Hilton, for more secluded talks involving the company. At the time John was somewhat surprised that a high company official would pay particular attention to him. It was during such meetings as this, and those at the Manger, that the sounding-out process commenced.(当约翰解释公司的政策给我们听的时候，他说，他认为他看到了一个和赛斯在前面提到的“公寓”之间的连结。记得一开始时，约翰对这个资料完全无法提供任何讯息。约翰说，麦奇央先生在喜来登时，甚至邀请他到他的私人房间谈论更多和公司有关的问题。当时约翰有一点惊讶，一个公司高层会那么的注意他。自从这次的会面和那次在曼爵，这种试探的过程就开始发生。
(John could offer no help on the initials A J, or A G. Seth has given other initials in past data for John, with the same results, and Jane and I believe that this kind of information is probably distorted. Nor could John tell us anything about a female child, or a Dayton OH connection.(约翰无法提供有关缩写AJ，或AG的讯息。赛斯在过去也提供过其他缩写的资料，结果都是一样，珍和我认为这种讯息可能是扭曲的。约翰也无法告诉我们任何和小女孩，或和俄亥俄州丹顿有关的连结。
(In reference to the apartment data, Seth came through again at 11:00.)(关于公寓的资料，赛斯在11:00时透过来。)
This is what I referred to, and the room is what I was thinking of as an apartment, in that it was private. The information that was given to you and which you did not understand had to do with this man, and his impression of you had much to do with what I am saying, insofar as the company, and Philips connection to it, is concerned.这正是我所指的，我以为那个房间是一间公寓，因为它是私人的。给你们的讯息，还有你们所不了解的部分是和这个男人有关，还有他对你的印象很大程度和我所说的，关于公司和菲利普之间的连结。
He was sent with a purpose.他是带有目的的。
(End at 11:03. Jane had spoken quietly, her eyes closed. As stated, John has since written Mr. McKeown for more information, and any additional information related to Seths predictions in this session will be included in a future session.)(11:03结束。珍轻轻地说，她的眼睛闭着。如之前说过的，约翰有写信给麦奇央先生询问更多的消息，在这一节里任何和赛斯预言有关的额外消息涵盖在未来的课里。)

SESSION 227 第227节 ▲可能性事件


JANUARY 26, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1966年1月26日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(No envelope test was held during the session.(这一节没有信封测验。
(The session was held in our front room. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed; her eyes then began to open frequently after a few paragraphs of material. Her voice was about average, her pace somewhat slower than usual in the beginning. Her pace picked up considerably however as the delivery progressed, and acquired much emphasis. Jane began speaking at 8:58.)(这节课在我们前面的房间举行。珍开始说话时坐着，眼睛闭着；在几段资料后，她的眼睛开始频繁地睁开。她的音量适中，速度在刚开始时比平常慢。随着口述的进行，速度慢慢的恢复，加强了很多重点。珍在8:58分开始说话。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I was quite pleased with the amount of quite specific material that I managed to deliver concerning our friend Philip, at our last session.我很高兴在上一节课里，我试图传递了有关我们的朋友菲利普十分明确的资料。
(Jane paused and smiled. Philip is John Bradleys entity name.)(珍停下来，微笑着。菲利普是约翰∙布雷德利存有的名字。)
The confidence that Ruburt receives in such circumstances is of great help to us all. We shall have a relaxed session this evening. There are several points however that I would like to make. They have to do with our discussion of time in general.鲁柏在这种情况下所得到的自信心会对我们有很大的帮助。我们今晚的课会比较放松。不过我仍然想说一些重点。它们和我们讨论的时间有关。
A part of the whole self is quite aware of the probabilities. Now. This is a portion of the self that exists as a perceiving participator, in the dimension which we discussed in our last session. This is fairly difficult material, and so I am giving it to you carefully.全我的一部分相当觉知到可能性。现在，这是一个以感知参与者存在的自己，在一个我们上一节课里所讨论的维度。这是很难的资料，所以我会仔细地告诉你们。
The ego as you know it, the conscious self within your time system, this ego, let us say, arrives at and experiences event X.你们所知道的自我，你们时间系统里有意识的自己，比如说，这个自我达到且经验了事件X。
(“Wait a minute.”(“等一分钟。”
(Our cat, Willy, had jumped up into Jane's lap. As cats will, he began to knead her legs with his forefeet. Jane's eyes did not open up but her delivery became spasmodic. As I got up she lifted Willy herself and dropped him to the floor.(我们的猫，威立，跳上了珍的大腿。就像猫会做的事，它开始用它的前脚踩她的腿。珍的眼睛没有睁开，但她的口述变得断断续续。当我站起来的时候，她已经自己把威立举起来放到地板上。
(This is the first time in many sessions that Willy has paid any attention to Jane during a session. In the early sessions he exhibited some drastic behavior at Seth’s presence and/or arrival. At times he would attempt to entangle himself in Jane's legs as she paced about the room while speaking for Seth. At other times he seemed to exhibit plain panic, running to hide just before session time. Seth told us this was because the cat’s very acute senses detected his arrival on our plane. Willy, he said, would get used to his presence eventually and show no reaction; this has been the case now for well over a year.)(这是许多节以来的第一次，威立在上课时把注意力转到珍的身上。在早期的课里，每当赛斯出现，或刚到的时候，它会表现出一些极端的行为。有时当珍为赛斯说话，而在房间走来走去的时候，它会试图缠在珍的腿上。在其他时候，它似乎表现出完全的恐惧，在上课前就跑去躲起来。赛斯告诉我们，这是因为猫有非常敏锐的感官，可以侦测出他来到这个星球。他说，威立最后习惯了他的存在，所以没有反应了；现在这个样子大概超过一年了。)
Now this event X is only one of a literally numberless amount of probable events which the conscious self could experience. For its purposes however the conscious self chooses this particular event X. But again, this event X, until the conscious self experiences it, is only one of many other probable events, different in no basic manner from the others. It becomes real, actual and different from those other probable events, only when it is experienced by our conscious self, or by this conscious self.现在这个事件X，是无数可能性事件中唯一一个有意识的自己会经验到的。因为它的目的，这个有意识自己选择了这一个特定的事件X。但再次的，直到有意识的自己经验它之前，这个事件X是许多可能事件的其中一个，与其他的可能事件并没有基本样子上的不同。只有当它被我们有意识的自己或这个有意识的自己经验之后，它就变得真实，以及有别于其他的可能事件。
(Jane's manner had become faster and more emphatic, and her eyes began to open. They were very dark. She lit a cigarette.)(珍的方式变得更快更有力，她的眼睛开始睁开。变得非常深邃。她点燃一支烟。)
I am making this discussion as simple as possible, and using the conscious self simply because less difficulties are presented in explanation. It is obvious, for example, that some events are experienced by the subconscious also, that may or may not be experienced by the ego.我尽可能地把这个讨论弄得简单，而用这个有意识的自己，单纯是因为这会比较容易解释。例如，很明显的，有一些事件也被潜意识所经验，但可能会或可能不会被这个自我所经验。
This event X becomes real then, in your terms, only when it is experienced or perceived by our conscious self. What about all of these other probable events, however? The only difference between them and event X is that event X was perceived and experienced by our conscious individual. In other words, were it not for this perception of the event X, it would still be as valid, or as invalid, as real or as unreal, as all the other probable events that were not perceived.然后用你们的话来说，这个事件变成真的，只有当它被我们有意识的自己经验或感知到之后。不过，那所有这些其他的可能事件怎样了呢？在它们和事件X之间唯一的差别是，事件X被我们有意识的个体感知或经验到了。换句话说，如果没有对事件X的感知，它就像其他所有没有被感知到的可能事件一样，或是有效的，或无效的，或是真的，或不是真的。
This leads us then to an obvious conclusion: if event X were not perceived it would still be a probability only. By the same token, if our individual chose to perceive and experience, say, event Y, then event Y would be the reality, and event X would still be unreal.这引导我们到一个明显的结论：如果事件X没有被感知到，它就仍然只是一个可能性。同样的，如果我们选择去感知和经验，比如说，事件Y的话，那么事件Y就会是实相，而事件X就仍不是真的。
As I have explained the ego to you, within your system it can only perceive in terms of continuity, in a straight-line fashion so to speak, one event after the other. It can only choose to experience one event out of all the probable events at a time. The ego is however the only portion of the self that is, in the main, limited to follow experience along these lines.缺
Since your physical time operates as it does, the physical organism does not have time within its own framework to experience any more than one probable event. It cannot focus upon two events at once. It goes without saying, again, that we are simplifying matters considerably, since each physical event is actually a gestalt of many small events.因为你们的物质时间以这样的方式运作，物质有机体在自己的框架下没有时间去经验任何超过一个的可能性事件。它无法同时聚焦在两件事上。不用说，我们把事情相当程度的简单化了，因为每一个物质事件事实上是很多小事件的一个完形。
The package of experience that you can focus upon and make sense of, is indeed composed of many small packages, but the whole package of reality is actually much larger than this. There is however a portion of the self that can and does experience events in an entirely different fashion, and this portion of the self goes off on a different tangent. For when our individual perceives event X, this other portion of the self branches off, so to speak, into all the other probable events that could have been just as easily experienced by the ego.你能专注且理解的经验包裹确实是由许多小包裹所组成的，但实相的整个包裹事实上比这个要更广大。不过有一部分的自己可以，而且的确能以一种完全不一样的方式来经验着事件，而这部分的自己走向了一条不同的路。当我们个人感知了事件X，可以说这自己的另一部分转入了所有其他可能很容易被自我经验的可能事件。
The ego must choose one of all these because of its physical time limitations. But this other portion of the self can, and does, delve into what you could call event XI, X2, X3, et cetera. It can pursue and experience all of these alternate events, and it can do so in the same amount of physical time that it takes for the ego to experience event X alone.自我必须选择所有这些的其中一个，是因为它物质时间的限制，但其他部分的自己可以，而且也会去探究你可以称之为X1、X2、X3等等的事件。它能探讨和经验所有这些交替的事件，而且它能以自我单独经验事件X的等量物质时间来这么做。
This is not as far-fetched as it might seem, for again, you perceive now more than you realize; although you may not be consciously aware of this, it still falls within the framework of your associated experience. The mere shaking of a hand may be perceived by you as a simple action. You are not consciously aware of the million small actions which make up this seemingly insignificant act.这并没有如它看起来的那么难以置信，再次的，你现在感知到的远比你所了解到的要多；虽然你可能并未有意识的觉知到这点，它仍然落在了你相关经验的架构里。握手可能仅仅被你视为一个简单的动作。你并未有意识的觉知百万个组成这个微不足道动作的小动作。
These actions exist nevertheless. It does not take you time to perceive them one by one. You perceive them in their completed fashion. Now this other portion of the self experiences these probable events, consciously, with as much rapidity as you subconsciously perceive the million small actions that make up the handshake.尽管如此，这些动作是存在的。你没有花时间逐一的去感知它们。你以它们完成的方式去感知它们。现在这个自己的其他部分，有意识的，经验着这些可能性，以和你潜意识感知到组成握手的百万个小动作同样快的程度。
You may take your break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:29. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her pace had become fast but her voice had been rather quiet. Her eyes had opened often and been very dark. She had smoked.(9:29休息。珍在第一段出离如常。她的速度变得比较快，但是声音却相对的比较安静。她的眼睛常常睁开，而且十分深邃。她有抽烟。
(Jane said she was aware of Willy climbing up into her lap, and that the cat’s presence might have interfered with her delivery had he remained there.(珍说，她觉察到威立爬上了她的腿，猫的出现和它的在场可能干扰了她的口述。
(Jane resumed in about the same manner at 9:40.)(珍以相同的方式在9:40重新开始。)
Now. These various portions of the self of which I speak are just that—portions of the whole self that simply operate in different dimensions of reality, and within different fields of activity.现在。我说的这些不同部分的自己正是——全我单纯地以实相的不同维度和活动的不同场域来运作的那部分。
There are no ultimate boundaries that divide one from another. They simply seek their experience in separate dimensions. In this particular instance, compare the various portions of the self to the various members of a family.这里并没有根本的界线把一个和另一个分开。它们单纯的在不同维度寻找它们的经验。在这个特别的例子里，把自己的不同部分比作家庭的不同成员。
The man may work in a city. The woman may work in their home in the country. Of three children, all three may attend different schools. They are all still part of the same unit. They all operate out of the same house. There is no reason why any of the children could not spend his day at the office with the father of the family, basically speaking, but he would not be able to understand or perceive many of the events that occurred there.这个男人可能在市区工作。这个女人可能在他们郊区的家里工作。有三个孩子，所有的孩子都上不同的学校。他们所有人都是同一个单位的一部分。他们在同一间房子里运转。基本上来说，并没有什么理由孩子不能花一天在办公室里陪爸爸工作，但他可能不能或感知到很多在那里发生的事。
I am trying to make this analogy clearer. The child would fit into the man's office building, for example. There would be no boundary to keep him out while letting the father enter, physically speaking. The man could also enter the school. In the same manner there is no basic reason why one self, or rather one portion of the self, has its main experiences in one dimension, while other portions of the self experience reality within different fields.我试着把这个比喻说得更清楚一点。例如，这个孩子可能很适应待在这个男人的办公室大楼里。在物质上来说，当他爸爸进入这栋大楼时，并没有一个界限把孩子挡在外面。这个男人也可以进去学校。以同样的方式，并没有基本的理由为什么一个自己，或确切地说，自己的一部分，在一个维度里有它主要的经验，而自己的另外一部分不能在不同的领域经验实相。
There is within the family a general realization of the experiences of its members, but these are second-handed, except for those experiences which the family shares as a unit. This is an important point, for there is an unspecialized, extremely generalized and intuitional knowledge on the part of any portion of the self, as to the nature of experience as felt by the other portions of the self.在一个家庭里，对其中成员的经验是有一个广泛的了解，但这些是二手的，除了那些以家庭为单位所共享的经验外。这是重要的一点，因为就自己的任何部分而言，这里有一个非专门化的、非常一般和直觉的知识在自己的任何部分，是关于自己的其他部分所感受到的经验本质。
Some experiences or events will be perceived by all layers of the self, though in their own fashion, and experienced as a unit. There are few of these, but they are extremely vivid, and serve as the family’s joint experiences serve to reinforce the identity of the whole psychological structure.有一些经验或事件会被自己的所有层面所感知，虽然是以它们自己的方式，而以一个单位去经验着。这些经验有少数一些，它们非常的逼真，是用来作为家庭的共同经验来强化整个心灵结构的身分感。
The imagination can vaguely perceive, of course, some probabilities, but the physical organism can directly experience but one of these within physical time, and in terms of continuity. The probable events however are precisely as real as that one event which is chosen from them to be a physical experience. And these events therefore become “real”, in quotes, within other dimensions. As a sideline here, there are some interesting episodes, not at all understood, when a severe psychological shock, or even a deep sense of unendurable futility, will cause a short circuit, so to speak, so that one portion of the self becomes aware, and begins to experience reality as it exists for another portion of the self.当然，想像力能模糊地感知到一些可能性，但物质有机体就连续性来说，只能在物质时间里直接经验其中的一个。不过，可能性确实和它们之间其中一个被选为物质经验的那个事件是同样的真实。因此，这些事件在其他维度变得“真实”，引号。这里有一条副线，有一些有趣的插曲，不全然被了解，当一个严重的心理惊吓，或甚至一种很深的、难以忍受的无奈感发生时，会产生一个短路，可以这么说，因此自己的一部分变得觉知，并开始经验自己另一部分存在的实相。
I am thinking here in particular of some cases of amnesia, where the victim suddenly ends up in a different town, with a different name, sometimes even with a different occupation, and with no memory of his past.我这里说的特别是一些失忆的案例，当一个患病者突然出现在一个不同的城镇，用不同的名字，有时候甚至有一个不同的工作，而完全没有他过去的记忆。
In some such cases the individual is experiencing a probable event. But he must experience it, you see, within his own time system.在一些这样的例子当中，个人正经验着一个可能性的事件。但你知道，他必须在他自己的时间系统里经验它。
I suggest a break before our Instream material.在我们的殷斯翠姆博士资料前，我建议一次休息。
(Break at 10:00. Jane had been dissociated as usual. Her eyes had been open much of the time. Her delivery had been rather fast and emphatic, she had smiled often, used many gestures, and smoked a couple of cigarettes.(10:00休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛大部分时间都是睁开的。她的口述相当的快而且有力，她常常微笑，用很多手势，还有抽了几根烟。
(It was now time for the 34th Dr. Instream test. Jane sat quietly with her head down and her hands raised to her closed eyes. She spoke now with many rather short pauses. She was not smoking. Resume at 10:05.)(现在是时候开始第34次殷斯翠姆博士测验。珍静静地坐着，她的头低着，手举到闭着的眼睛上。她现在说话时有很多相当短暂的停顿。她没有抽烟。10:05分重新开始。)
Now. Give us a moment, please. The object has something to do with a desk top. A rather old-fashioned desk top. (Pause.) The attention seems focused here. A green blotter, a letter opener, the sort that is in the shape of a dagger, and a letter holder. (Pause.)现在。请等我们一会儿。这个物件和桌面有关。一个相当老式的桌面。(停顿)注意力似乎集中在这里。一个绿色的记事簿，一把拆信刀，像匕首那种形状的，还有一个信封架。(停顿)
A lamp on a still higher portion of the desk. This portion is like a ledge. The letter opener is a metal-type one, I believe of a silver color. Also a small round object on the desk, I believe of glass, the shape of a globe, and it is heavier than it looks. (Pause.)一盏灯在书桌比较高的部分。这部分像一个柜子。拆信刀是金属制的，我相信是银色。在桌上也有一个小的圆形物件，我认为是玻璃杯，是球状的，它比看起来要重。(停顿)
For Dr. Instream in general, visitors from out of town today. The initials I believe M W, or W M. The M is part of a name that is fairly long, with two R’s in it. (Pause.)殷斯翠姆博士今天从城外来了访客。我相信缩写是W M，或M W。这个M是一个相当长名字的一部分， 有两个R's在里面。(停顿)
An occasion that is rather grim. This is not necessarily connected however with the other impressions.一个相当阴森的地方。不过这不一定和其他的印象有关联。
A studio that he visits in the back of the building. (Pause, at 10:15.)一间他去拜访的工作室，位于大楼后面。(停顿10:15)
Do you have a test for me?你有测验要给我吗？
(“No.”)(“没有。”)
I ask out of a sense of courtesy, and also so that you understand that I welcome them, knowing the spirit in which they are given.我是出于礼貌问这个问题，因此你会知道我是欢迎它们的，知道它们被赋予的精神。
(Jane still sat with her hands raised to her face.)(珍仍坐着，她的手举到脸上。)
Now I told you that this would be a relaxed session, and I shall here bring it to a close, unless there are any matters in particular about which you have questions. We got through a bit of difficult material this evening very well.现在，我告诉过你们这会是比较放松的一节，我在这里应该要结束了，除非有任何你特别想问的问题。我们今晚很好地理解了一些比较难的资料。
(“I have no questions.”)(“我没有问题了。”)
Then my heartiest good wishes to you both, indeed as always.那么我对你们俩最衷心的祝福，如往常一样。
Ruburt will find incidentally that his book of poetry, the new and rather swiftly written one, will be published. He recognized the abundance of energy that was available to him as he wrote it.附带的，鲁柏会发现他的诗集，那些新的，还有很迅速写下的那几首会很快的出版。他了解到当他写诗时会有丰富的能量可以使用。
The spontaneity that allowed him to deviate from his usual schedule is largely responsible for the whole book, for his original intention was merely to write a few humorous verses for out cat lovers birthday. I will have a little more to say concerning this, perhaps, at our next session.让他偏离日常作息的自发性是他这本书能完成很大的原因，因为他原本的意图只是为我们爱猫人士的生日写几行幽默短诗。关于这点我还有一些要说的，也许在我们的下一节。
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth, and thank you.”(“晚安，赛斯，还有谢谢你。”
(End at 10:22 Jane was dissociated as usual. Her delivery picked up a little toward the end, and her eyes opened a few times. She said Seth was pleased when I said thank you.(10:22结束。珍出离如常。她的口述在要结束前回复到原来的速度，她的眼睛睁开好几次。她说当我说谢谢时，赛斯很高兴。
(It was very interesting to watch Jane produce the above-mentioned book of poetry. It grew out of earlier suggestions, and I would say the end result represented a fine example of spontaneous creative power at its best. The poems are of high quality indeed, and Jane felt certain from the start that they would be published. It is difficult to publish poetry in hard-cover.(看着珍完成上面提到的诗集是一件很有趣的事。它是由早先的暗示所产生的，我会说最后的结果代表了一个自发性创造力最佳发挥的好例子。这些诗集确实是高品质的，而珍一开始就很确定地感觉到它们会被出版。诗集是很难以精装本的形式被出版。
(Wednesday and Thursday nights, January 19 & 20, Jane gave herself suggestions that she would have a great abundance of energy. She usually uses suggestion each night, but this time she wanted a little something extra.(1月19日和20日，星期三和星期四晚上，珍给她自己暗示，她会有很充沛的能量。她通常每晚都会运用暗示，但这次她想要一些额外的。
(Jane said she had been working quite happily on the book dealing with the Seth material, and on one about dreams. When she got the burst of energy on the poetry book idea however, she took advantage of it, and felt certain the material would be published. Here is a schedule of events:(珍说，在写赛斯资料这本书和另一本有关梦的书期间，她工作得很快乐。不过当她在这本诗集的灵感上能量充沛的时候，她善用它，而且很确定的感觉这些资料会被出版。这里是事件的时间表：
(On Friday, January 21, she wrote 10 poems for Peggy’s birthday in the space of 2-1/2-3 hours. The poems were of a humorous, social commentary nature, and highly polished. These gave her the idea for the book, which she considered over the weekend.(在1月21日星期五，她为了蓓的生日写了10首诗，花了两个半到三个小时。这些诗是幽默的、社会评论本质的，还有非常精练的。这给了她出书的想法，她考虑了一周。
(On Monday, January 24, Jane wrote 20 poems in the space of 6 or 7 hours.(在1月24日星期一，珍花了6或7个小时写了20首诗。)
(On Tuesday, January 25, she wrote 15 poems in 5 or 6 hours.(在1月25日星期二，她在5或6小时之内写了15首诗。)
(On Wednesday, January 26, she wrote 7poems in 2-1/2 hours. This time span included doing some other work on the book also.(在1月26日星期三，她在两个半小时里写了7首诗。这个时间也包含了这本书的一些其他工作。
(The book was then finished, and Jane spent part of the next two days typing up the version for submission to publishers. In addition she recorded the 10 poems originally done for Peggy on Tuesday evening, January 25.)(然后这本书就完成了，珍花了接下来的两天把交给出版神的版本打字出来。此外，她也在1月25日星期二晚上，录了原先为蓓而做的10首诗。)

SESSION 228 第228节 物理风暴与情感风暴的相互关系


JANUARY 31, 1966 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1966年1月31日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(No envelope test was held during the session.(这节课没有信封测验。
(Watching the blizzard that hit Elmira this weekend in action, I thought it like a disembodied psychic storm. Jane agreed; as session time drew near tonight she said she thought Seth would discuss the storm, and our weather in general. Seth has had something to say about the weather in these sessions: 56, 84, 123 and 175, without going into any great detail. Check Volumes 2, 3, and 4.(看着这周末席卷埃尔迈拉的暴风雪，我认为它像一个未被看见的心理风暴。珍也同意；当今天接近上课时间的时候，她说她认为赛斯会讨论这个风暴，还有我们一般所言的天气。赛斯曾在这几节课里谈过天气：56、84、123和175，但并没有说得很详细。见第二、三和四册。
(The session was held in our front room. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed.)(这节课在我们前面的房间举行。珍开始说话时坐着，她的眼睛闭着。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. For a break from our material on probabilities and inverted time, I will indeed discuss a matter which is in your thoughts: the blizzard of the last few days.现在。让我们从可能性和倒置时间中休息一下，我的确会讨论你们心里所想的：过去几天的暴风雪。
(There came a knock on our door. It was a young neighbor from downstairs, concerned about transportation to work tomorrow. We work together at Artistic Card Co. but had not tried to get to the plant today. She does not know of these sessions.(门上传来了敲门声。是来自楼下的一个年轻邻居，她来关心明天去上班时该搭乘的交通运输工具。我们在艺术卡公司一起工作，但今天没有打算去公司。她不知道这些课。
(For a time we held sessions in the back of our apartment to avoid such interruptions, but Jane prefers them held in the large front room. The interruption tonight was not any kind of a shock to Jane; she left the trance state easily, although I noticed her eyes were very dark when they first opened. It was Jane who answered the door however. We then engaged in a half hour's conversation with our neighbor.(有一阵子，我们在我们后面那间房间举行这些课就是为了避免这样的打扰，但珍比较喜欢在前面大间的房间上课。珍看起来并不惊讶于今晚的中断；她轻易的就离开了出离状态，虽然我注意到她的眼睛第一次睁开的时候，眼神非常深邃。是珍去应门的。我们和我们的邻居聊了半个小时。
(When we were alone again Jane resumed as though the break had not occurred. Her voice was average, her pace average; her eyes were to open after a few paragraphs, and she was now smoking.)(当再次剩我们两个人的时候，珍重新开始就仿佛不曾中断过。她的音量适中，速度适中；她的眼睛在几个段落后睁开来，而她现正抽着烟。)
Now. This is a good time to discuss certain interactions that occur within your system, and we can take your winter storm as an excellent example.现在。这是一个讨论在你们系统里发生这种交互作用的好时机，而我们以你们这次的冬季风暴来作一个绝佳的例子。
There is a constant give and take between psychic and chemical components which actually cause your daily weather, your weather cycles, seasons, droughts and storms. This physical weather then in its turn affects and changes the psychic atmosphere of each individual. The force that causes your weather can be thought of as self-generating.在心灵和实际形成你们日常天气、天气循环、季节、干旱，和风暴之间的化学成分中有一个持续的施与受。然后物质天气转而影响每个个人的心灵氛围。引发你们天气的动力可以认为是自己生成的。
Ultimately it is not self-generating, but for the purposes of our discussion it may be termed so. The force originates within the psychic or nonphysical aspects of each living creature within your system. This force acts as a balancing mechanism for the psychic structures, and through use of it living forms create and maintain in a most basic manner their own physical environment.最终它不是自己生成的，但为了我们讨论的目的可以先这么讲。动力起缘于你们系统里每一个活着的生物心灵或非物质层面。这个动力在心灵结构中以一种平衡的机制作用着，而透过它，生命形式以最基本的方式创造和维持它们自己的物质环境。
This is not to be taken as a symbolic idea, for I am speaking in quite practical terms. Not only does the human system for example become influenced chemically, electronically and psychically by physical weather, but also the human system electronically, electromagnetically, chemically and psychically affects and creates the climate in which existence is possible.这并不是一个象征性的概念，我是就十分实际的一面来说的。例如，不只是人类系统会被物质的天气在化学、电子和心灵上所影响，人类系统也会在电子、电磁、化学和心灵上影响和创造其所存在的天气。
The chemical connections are the most easily discovered. The discovery however comes about, or is coming about, as a result of studies made concerning the effect of physical weather upon the individual, in chemical terms. It will take longer before it is at all realized that the individual also affects the weather.化学上的关联是最容易被发现的。不过这个发现以化学上来说，是来自，或产生自物质天气对个人影响的研究结果。要明白个人也会影响天气则需要比较长的时间。
Nevertheless some of this is, or should be, obvious. It is known that photosynthesis affects most vitally the makeup of your atmosphere, for example. The biological methods by which each individual utilizes oxygen are well known, but no assumptions have been drawn from this knowledge.不过，这里有一些是，或应该是明显的。例如，光合作用会至关重要的影响你们大气的组成，这是大家都知道的。每个个人利用氧气的生物学方式是众所周知的。但没有一个假设是从这个知识而来。
Now I have told you that dreams are caused in part—underline in part—by chemical excesses built up within the human system. Dreams also carry the weight of emotional excesses that cannot be adequately expressed within daily physical action.现在我告诉过你们, 梦有部分是由——部分划线——建立人类系统的化学剩余物所引起的，梦也涵带着无法在日常物质行动中充分表达的情绪剩余物的重量。
(Seth began talking about dreams by the 15th session, then began to give material on their chemical excesses soon after. See Volume 1.)(赛斯在第15节开始谈到梦，然后很快地开始说有关化学剩余物的资料。见第一册。)
Now I shall tell you that physical weather is also caused in part by psychic energy, rushing through the human system and through the systems of all living creatures, and also by an excess, a chemical excess, beyond that which the individual organism can handle.现在我应该告诉你们，物质天气有部分也是由心灵能量所引起，也是由超过个人有机体能处理的剩余物质，化学剩余物质，从人类系统还有所有活着的生物系统送出。
The word excess may be a poor one. Perhaps the word abundance of chemical energy would be more correct. The chemical energy is above that which is ordinarily needed by the individual physical organism, yet it must be used. The utilization comes about subconsciously.剩余物这个字眼可能是比较差的。也许化学能量的满益物这个字眼会更加正确。上面所说的化学能量是个人物质有机体平常所需，但它必须被使用。这个利用是来自潜意识。
This blizzard, and the last storm of last week, both of these are beneficial primarily. Now the physical organism simply cannot handle all of the energy that is available to it. It has abundant energy, not only to care for itself but to create a favorable physical environment. Without the outlet, the constructive outlet provided it in the formation of its own weather environments, the physical organism would have little balance or stability.这一场暴风雪，还有上周最后一次的暴风雨，两者主要都是有益处的。现在简单来说，物质有机体无法处理所有可用的能量。它有充裕的能量，不只是用来照顾它自己，还用来创造有利的物质环境。没有这个出口，如果在它自己的天气环境组成上没有提供一个建设性的出口，那物质有机体就很难有平衡和稳定。
As emotional storms may be the result of a lack of discipline or of knowledge, or of control of one or more portions of the self, bringing about a corresponding exaggeration or growth of other portions of the self, so also erratic physical storms come from the same causes on a collective basis, but with the energy directed outward and often turned to a constructive purpose. Though this is not always the case.就如情绪的风暴可能源自于缺乏自律或知识，或是自己的一个部分或更多部分缺乏控制，而带来自己其他部分相应的夸大或成长，因此在一个集体的基础上，不稳定的物质风暴也是源自相同的理由，但这个能量方向朝外且常常转向一个建设性的目的。虽然并不永远是这样。
A physical storm may, as you know, be far more disastrous than an emotional one. But a physical storm is a collective endeavor, and can be compared, if it is disastrous, only with disastrous collective emotional storms such as those that sweep across nations, when all minds seem seized by irrationality.如你所知的，一个物质的风暴可能比一个情绪性的风暴更具灾难性。但一个物质的风暴是一个集体的努力，如果它是灾难性的，可以比作是灾难性的情绪风暴，就如那些当所有的心智似乎被不理性所掳获扫过的国家。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:55. Jane had been dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her pace had become quite fast, and sometimes emphatic. Her eyes had opened often toward the end of the delivery.(9:55休息。珍在第一段出离如常。她的速度变得十分快，有时候是有力的。在口述快结束的时候，她的眼睛经常地张开。
(It was now time for the 35th Dr. Instream test. The blizzard howled outside. As usual Jane's pace slowed; she sat with her head down and her hands raised to her closed eyes. She spoke with many rather brief pauses. Resume at 10:02.)(现在是时候开始第35次殷斯翠姆博士测验。外面的暴风雪在呼啸着。就如往常，珍的速度较慢；她坐着，头低着，手举到她闭着的眼睛上。她说话时有很多相当短的停顿。10:02重新开始。)
Now, give us a moment before our Instream material.现在，在殷斯翠姆博士资料开始前请等我们一下。
First of all—this is not the object—I pick up the impression of a merge of some kind, in which our Doctor is involved.首先——这个不是物件——我收到某种合并的印象，其中有涉及我们的博士。
A connection now, separate from the merge, with a shoe, a mans shoe (pause), or a slipper. This is our object. The color of it is brown, but very dark, so that it appears almost to be black. (Pause.) It is his own (pause), and he concentrates upon it. I do not know if it is a slipper or a shoe, because while it has laces it appears somehow different from a shoe.现在，有别于这个合并，和一双鞋有关联，一双男人的鞋(停顿)，或一双拖鞋。这是我们的物件。它的颜色是棕色，但是非常深，所以看起来几乎是黑色的。(停顿)这是他自己的。(停顿)还有他集中注意力在它身上。我不知道它是拖鞋还是鞋子，因为它有蕾丝，看起来和一般鞋子不太一样。
A turn of events for him, in an opposite direction. The events having to do with a doctor of some sort.对他而言，事情转向一个相反的方向。这些事情和某个医生有关。
I pick up the initial D, but do not know unfortunately whether the D applies to doctor, or if the D is a name initial. (Pause.)我收到缩写D，但不幸的，并不知道D是适用于这个医生，或D是一个名字的缩写。(停顿)
The object is the left shoe or slipper, purchased in a shop on a side street, directly off from a main street. The street beginning with a C or G, and with the numbers 12 appearing somewhere in the address of the shop. (Pause.)这个物件是左边的鞋或拖鞋，在一条大马路旁的小街店铺买的。这条街以C或G开头，还有数字12出现在店铺的地址上。(停顿)
The shoes were purchased on a rainy day. I think of April but am not sure. He drove, or rather was driven, and did not walk there, and he had an appointment immediately after.这双鞋是在雨天买的。我想是4月，但并不能肯定。他开车，或是被载，并不是用走的到那儿，然后他紧接着有一个约会。
There was I believe a birthday about the same time, and the name Harvard somehow connected here. Harvard shoes or oxfords, I do not know. (Pause at 10:14.)我相信同时有一个生日，而这个名字哈佛和这里有一些关系。哈佛鞋或牛津鞋，我不知道。(10:14继续)
Do you have a test for me, Joseph?你有测验要给我吗，约瑟？
("No.”(“没有。”
(Pause.) The D mentioned earlier does apply to a name in the shoe.(停顿)早先提到的D确实适用于鞋子的一个名字。
(A point of confusion arose here. The Last word above, which I took to be shoe, was not clearly pronounced by Jane. I asked for a repetition of the word, whereupon Jane, her eyes still closed, pointed at me rather emphatically.)(这里有一点让我很困惑。上面最后一个字，我听到的是鞋子，但珍并没有很清楚的发音。我要求她重复这个字，然后珍，她的眼睛仍闭着，相当有力地指着我。)
Before the shoe data, with the material having to do with a doctor I think of, rather oddly, of a connection to a flamingo, which seems rather bizarre.在鞋子的资料之前，相当反常的，我想到和一个医生有关的，和火鹤有连结，这似乎相当古怪。
We shall, then, take a very brief break for Ruburt’s benefit, since I always give him one after this sort of material.为了鲁柏好，我们应该短暂地休息一下，我总是在这类资料后让她休息一下。
The initials D G may be the ones that I have been after here.缩写D G可能是这里我要寻找的。
(Break at 10:16. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed. Her pace had become good toward the end of the delivery. The wind had been hitting 40 MPH in gusts, and our apartment had been chilly all day. Janes slower and quiet manner had made me more aware of the storm and I had wondered whether it would bother her, but she said she had been aware of nothing while speaking.(10:16休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着。在口述快结束的时候，她的速度变得很适中。阵风突然达到40英里，我们的公寓整天都很冷。珍的安静和慢下来的方式让我更觉察到暴风雨，我很好奇这是否有打扰她，但她说，当她在说话的时候并没有觉察到任何不同。
(I explained the confusion over the shoe data to her during break, and asked Seth to clear it up. Jane resumed with her eyes again closed and her hands raised to them, at 10:26.)(在休息的时候，我解释那个有关鞋子资料的困惑给她听，希望赛斯能理清。珍在10:26重新开始时眼睛闭着，她的手举到眼睛上。)
Now first of all, the initials mentioned last do not apply to the shoes, but to the data given earlier, as specified.现在首先，最后提到的缩写并不是用在鞋子，而是在更早给的资料上。
I also see a wooden chair with some kind of scrolls on it, and some wicker, though the chair is not a wicker chair. This ends the Instream material.我也看到一把木制椅子，有某种纸卷在上面，还有一些柳枝，虽然这椅子不是柳枝制的椅子。殷斯翠姆博士资料结束。
There is much to be said concerning the interrelationships that exist between the human system and the weather system, and these shall be, these interrelationships, shall be discussed most completely at a later time. I do not want to interrupt our data concerning probabilities and time, however, to get involved in any long involvements on other matters. The question was in your minds however, and so we have taken a short while to give you some brief notes concerning it. At our next session we shall return to our previous subject matter.关于人类系统和天气系统之间所存在的相互影响，还有更多可以说的，而这些相互影响应该在之后更彻底的被讨论。不过我不想打断我们关于可能性和时间的资料，而涉入其他问题的冗长讨论。不过在你们的心里有疑问，所以我们会花一点时间给你们一些关于它的简短评论。在我们的下一节，应该回到我们之前讨论的主题。
I will now, according to your pleasure, continue the session for a while, or end it.现在随你们高兴，我可以继续这节课或结束它。
(“You might as well continue for a bit.”(“你可以再继续一会儿。”
(It was 10:25.)(现在是10:25。)(注：此时间与上面的时间矛盾，可能罗注记有误。)
Then I will speak briefly concerning Ruburts book of poetry, for this is an excellent example of how suggestion can be used to utilize energy for conscious purposes.然后我要简短地说一下关于鲁柏的诗集，因为这是一个绝佳的例子，关于暗示是如何为了意识的目的来运用能量。
The achievement, the book itself, is excellent. The book was written by other portions of the self than the ego, and it was not written at the egos wish alone.这个成果，这本书本身，是很棒的。这本书是由有别于自我、自己的其他部分所写成的，而它也不是单独以自我的意愿所写成的。
Ruburt’s ego now contains elements that did not at one time belong to it. It contains portions of the self that are—I hesitate, you see, to say superior, for he is not to get conceited—but portions of the self that contain more abilities than those usually held by the ego.鲁柏的自我现在包含了一度不属于它的要素。它包含了那部分自己是——你知道，我有点犹豫地说，是更好的，因为他不是自大——但自己的那部分包含了那些自我平常没拥有的更多能力。
His egotistical decisions therefore now more faithfully reflect the whole self, or the whole personality. There has been an integration. It is for this reason that his suggestions are taking hold so well, for they do not conflict with other layers of the self.因此，现在他自我的决定会更忠实地反映了这个全我，或这整个人格。这里有一个整合。也是因为这个原因，他的暗示发挥得这么好，因为它们和自己的其他层面并没有抵触。
The abundance of energy met no resistance therefore, and was immediately focused and disciplined according to the desire that he expressed. This is simply a fact. He is simply learning. And he has much more to learn.因此，充沛的能量没有遇到阻挡，而根据他表达的渴望，很快的专注和自律起来。这只不过是一个事实。他只不过在学习，而他还有更多要学的。
You are also learning. You are both beginning, barely beginning, to integrate your personalities in such a way that creativity can be put to positive use, free of negative inhibiting factors, which are always indications of conflicting inner doubts and desires. You will improve if you continue to progress as you have.你也在学习。你们两个都是刚开始，才刚刚开始，以这种创造力放在正向用途的方式去整合你们的人格，免于负面阻碍的因素，而这总是指向了内在怀疑和渴望的冲突。如果你持续的这样发展，你会进步的。
This is meant indeed to encourage you. It is not meant in any way to give Ruburt the idea that he is superior to anyone else. You both have the responsibility to use all of your abilities, and this is perhaps the one thing that is required of you.这确实是用来鼓励你们。这并不是要让鲁柏认为他比其他人优秀。你们两个都有责任去使用你们所有的能力，而也许这是一件你们的指定必修课。
I should be quite disappointed if you were not showing improvement. Your own psychic improvement, Joseph, is marked. Ruburt, with this book before him as an example, should know that he can now expect more of himself, and should not be satisfied with less. You are both becoming therefore more responsible as a result of your successes.如果你们没有显现出任何进步，我应该会十分失望。约瑟，你们自己心灵的进步是显著的。这本书会给鲁柏一个很好的模范，他应该知道，现在可以对他自己期待更多而不需要降低标准。因为你们成功的结果，你们两个会变得更负责。
Now, my friend, I am quite capable and agreeable. I will continue the session, or you may end it and instead take a break. It is up to you. I should suggest however a good night’s sleep, and I should suggest specifically that you give yourself the same sort of suggestion that Ruburt gave to himself before retiring.现在，我的朋友，我是十分有能力且讨人喜欢的。我可以继续这一节，或你想结束或者休息。那由你们决定。不过我应该建议一夜好眠，而我应该特别建议你，给你自己像鲁柏在休息前给自己的暗示。
You are on short time, and such suggestions will allow you to produce in a minimum of physical time excellent work.你们的时间很紧迫，而这样的暗示，能让你们在最短的物质时间内产生最好的工作结果。
(“That’s a good idea. ’)(“那是一个好主意。”)
Your energy will be focused where you want it. Ruburt’s book ordinarily would have taken him, at the very least, four months with ordinary efficiency. You notice that Ruburt did not specifically request that a book of poetry be produced, nor was a book even mentioned.你的能量将会聚焦在你想要的地方。一般而言，以鲁柏平常的效率，他的书至少要花4个月的时间。你注意到鲁柏并没有特别要求诗集的产生，甚至连一本书都没有提到。
The suggestion was given that he have an abundance of energy, and that he would focus and discipline the energy so that he could use it in his writing and in his psychic work. The hows and wherefores and the ultimate product were left to the inner self.这个暗示只是说他会有充沛的能量，而他能聚焦和训练这个能量，以便能运用这个能量在写作和心灵工作上。至于如何做到、怎么做到和最后的产品是留给内我来决定的。
I recommend most strongly that you use the same procedure; success would allow you to do ten times as well in the available time as is usual. You have Ruburt’s book before your eyes as proof.我强烈地建议你运用同样的步骤；同样的时间成果会高上10倍。你眼前有鲁柏的书作为证明。
My heartiest good wishes to you both, and unless you particularly wish me to continue I will end the session.我衷心的祝愿你们俩，除非你们特别希望我继续，否则我要结束这一节了。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:47. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her pace had been fast. Her eyes had opened often and a few times her voice had grown stronger for emphasis.(10:47结束。珍出离如常。她的速度很快，眼睛常常睁开。而有几次她为了强调，声音变得很大声。
(See page 241 of the last session, the 227th, for the data on the time schedule by which Jane produced the book of poetry. It will be noted that on the four days, January 21, 24, 25, 26, Jane wrote 52 poems in the course of from 16- 18 1/2 hours.(见第227节，珍写出这本诗集的时间表。在1月21、24、25和26日这4天里。珍在16至18又2分之1小时内写了52首诗。
(A recount since last session reveals that the total number of poems should be revised upward, to 63, produced in the same amount of time. In giving me the first set of figures Jane counted the pages in the book of poetry, forgetting that there were two poems on some pages.(从上一节课的详述，同样的时间里，上面显示的总数应该修正为63首。珍一开始数给我的是诗集的页数，她忘了在同一页里有时会有两首诗。(早在第6节课里，赛斯就告诉过珍和我，我们是在我们物质生命的最后一世，而我们两个都选择要成为存有。因为这一点，赛斯说，我们尽可能地在这一世里发展我们所有的能力是很有必要的。见第一册)。
(Tracing of the colored pieces of construction paper used in the 30th envelope test, in the 229th session for February 2,1966.)用在1966年2月2日第229节第36次信封测验的彩色西卡纸素描

SESSION 229 第229节 房东遇到麻烦 信封30


FEBRUARY 2, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1966年2月2日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(The 30th envelope test was held during the session. I cut out ten small pieces of colored construction paper, put them between the usual two pieces of Bristol board and sealed them in the usual double envelope. I was aware that there wouldn’t be much emotional charge connected with these, and Seth was too. As is the case also, Jane did not do well on the resumption of such experiments.(第30次信封测验在这一节课举行。我把彩色西卡纸裁成10小张，把它们放进普通的纸板中间，然后放进信封里封起来。我知道这些卡并没有很多情感能量或和赛斯有关。也许就是因为这样，珍在这个实验时进行得并不顺利。
(The session is quite unusual, in that all of it is devoted to experimental material of one kind or another. This includes the two usual tests plus the material delivered by Seth concerning our landlord. The landlord data arose out of one of those rather small incidents that keep accumulating emotional charges when most of the people involved turn stubborn.(这节课很不寻常，所有的时间都用在一种或另一种实验资料上。这包括两个平常的测验，再加上赛斯口述的，关于我们房东的资料。房东的资料源自于其中一个相当小的事件，但当涉及的大部分人都越来越固执的时候，情绪能量就一直的累积。
(Right after the first snowfall two weekends ago, our landlord appeared with his Jeep and snowplow attached, and cleaned out our long curving driveway and the garage area in back of the apartment house. About a foot of snow had fallen, but this rather small amount still made things difficult for automobiles, and the area involved would mean hours of shoveling by hand.(在两周前第一场积雪下完后，我们房东开着他的吉普车和车上拖着扫雪机出现了，然后他清理了我们又长又弯的车道，还有公寓后面的停车场区。那些天大约下了有一英尺高的雪，但这个相对少的雪量却仍让车子行进困难，而这个区域如果要用手来铲雪可能要花好几个小时。
(After the second foot of snow fell last weekend, the tenants of the house waited as usual for the landlord to appear with his plow. Drifts several feet deep had piled up in the driveway and against the garages. The landlord did not appear. Three days went by. It developed that he had thought we could shovel our own way out. By this time of course recriminations were beginning to fly back and forth by phone, although this did not involve Jane and me. Finally one of the tenants threatened to move, after feelings had been bruised all around. The situation was not without its comic aspects.(在上周末下了第二次一英尺的雪之后，这栋楼的房客就像平常一样等着房东带着他的扫雪机出现。车道的雪堆了几英尺高挡住了车库。房东还没有出现。3天过去了。原来是房东认为我们应该自己把雪铲出去。当然这时电话里来来去去的热战就开始了，虽然这并没有涉及珍和我。最后有一名房客因为感觉受伤所以威胁要搬走。这情况也是挺滑稽的。
(By the time the landlord realized we couldn’t shovel our own way out, he couldn't get his own plow into the driveway, nor could he hire help; everyone was busy. I was working overtime at my job also. I felt the brakes on our car needed adjusting so I wasn’t planning to drive personally regardless; this made it somewhat easier to be objective about the whole thing. I also decided that I wasn't going to get excited about it in any event. Then yesterday morning it developed that the thermostat on the furnace was not working; we got up to a cold house, and this led to more telephone messages, the calling of a specialist, etc.(后来房东了解到，我们无法自己铲出一条路，他也无法把他的扫雪机开进车道，也无法雇人帮忙；每个人都很忙。我也在加班。我觉得我们车子的刹车需要调整，所以我并不打算把车开出门；这让我比较容易客观地看待这整件事。我也决定，无论如何都不要对此事太过激动。到了昨天早上暖气的温度调节器坏了；整栋房子都很冷，而这导致电话的往来更多了，例如打电话给专门的维修人员等等。
(The specialist, actually the man who keeps the house in good running order for the landlord, is a personal friend of his. While talking to Jane he mentioned that our landlord’s books had been called in by the Internal Revenue Service.(这位总是帮房东维持房子正常运作的维修人员，是他的一个朋友。当和珍聊天的时候他提到，国税局曾要求回收我们房东的账簿。
(The session was held this evening with the chance that it might be interrupted. One of the tenants in the house had finally located a man with a plow, who was due to clear the area at 9 PM this evening. Everybody in the house was to chip in to pay him. We decided to go ahead with the session anyhow, on the chance the man with the snowplow did not show up, or was late.(今晚举行的课有可能会被打断。后来有一位房客联络了扫雪人员，他今晚9点要打扫这个区域。钱是由这栋楼的所有人一起出的。我们决定不管怎样先开始这节课，也许这个扫雪人员不会出现或迟到呢。
(The session was held again in our front room. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. They opened just once briefly when she put out a cigarette. Her voice was average, her pace quite slow by comparison. Neither of us had expected the kind of material that began to come through.)(这节课在我们前面的房间举行。珍开始说话时坐着，眼睛闭着。她的眼睛只有在把烟熄灭的时候短暂睁开过一次。她的音量适中，速度相对比较慢，我们两个都没有预期这样的资料会开始传过来。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Give me a moment, please.请等我们一会儿。
Now. There are difficulties arising, of a personal nature, concerning your landlord. He feels now that everyone is against him.现在，关于你们的房东，一个个人本质的困境出现了。他现在感觉每个人都在反对它。
He is indeed in the wrong, but over tax matters, certain falsifications. Also certain procedures on the borderline, concerning the house in which you live. He is worried that the illegal tax methods in connection with his business will be discovered.他的确是错的，确实是伪造文书，但不只是在税务方面。在关于你们住的房子，某些程序的模糊地带也是如此。他很担心他生意上的非法逃税方式被发现。
Nor, given his particular personality pattern, could he easily have avoided initiating these practices. He felt driven to them. He is aware of the compulsion with which he acts when finances are concerned. Since he realizes that he did not choose, consciously, to take these illegal steps, then he cannot understand why he should ever be penalized for them.由于他特殊的人格模式，他无法轻易地避免这些行为。他感觉被驱使着去这么做。他觉察到，当涉及账务时他就会有这么做的冲动，因为他了解在意识上，他并没有选择去采取这些非法的步骤，所以他不了解为何他得为此受罚。
Nevertheless the fear exaggerates his morbid concern with his heart. He is somewhat like a wounded buffalo, and to some extent at least the wound was not self-inflicted, although he himself has aggravated it.不过这个恐惧强化了他心脏的不正常。他某种程度就像一只受伤的水牛，而至少到某个程度，这个伤并非他自己招致的，虽然是他自己使之恶化。
There will be some legal difficulties for him, with a March 15 date connected here. There will also be an illness for him, unless he makes some inner adjustments. Some difficulties also for his oldest daughter. Papers in connection with the landlord himself now, kept secretly, in a place not often used, within or behind an old desk. Perhaps in a basement, I think having a concrete or stone like floor.他会遇到一些法律的困境，这里和3月15这个日期有关。他也会生一场病，除非他做一些内在的调适。他的大女儿也会遇到一些困难。现在和房东有关的秘密文件藏在一个不常使用的地方，在一个旧书桌的里面或后面。也许在一个地下室，我认为有一个混凝土或类似大头的地板。
(Our landlord, Jimmy Spaziani, is 50years old. His daughter mentioned here is a junior in high school. We like him and his family very much.)(我们的房东吉米·史帕日尼，已经50岁了。这里提到的他女儿是一个高中生。我们非常喜欢他和他的家人。)
Now. The figure 14,378. This refers to dollars, but interest will be added to it. This amount plus interest, I believe, will represent an initial amount due, but will not represent the full amount due.现在。数字14378。这指的是美金，但还会加上利息。我相信，这个金额加上利息代表了第一期到期的金额，但不代表全部到期的金额。
If he falls ill I believe it will be at a party-type gathering, at least with many people about. A fairly serious but not critical illness, possibly caused by circulation fluctuations. The difficulty showing up in a right leg, though the origin of the illness will not be in the leg. Something of the sort of a blood clot in the leg, that type of illness.如果他生病倒下，我想会是在宴会之类的聚会上，至少是在很多人的场合。一场相当严重但不是致命的疾病，可能是由于循环系统的波动所引起的。右脚会看得出来，虽然疾病的起因并不是在腿部。某种腿部血栓之类的疾病。
Some private papers hidden, mingled with old photographs in poor condition. Possibly he will have some kind of a visitation from his own father to warn him ahead of time.一些藏起来的私密文件和保存不佳的旧照片混在一起。他的父亲为了提前警告他，有可能会来看他。
I believe also a death of his wife’s father by next November.我想他妻子的父亲11月会去世。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:20. Jane was quite well dissociated for a first delivery, she said. Her eyes had opened briefly but once. Remember that the above material was delivered with many pauses interspersed. Most of the time Jane sat with her head down and her hands raised to her face, as during the Instream and envelope tests.(9:20休息。珍说她第一段的出离状态非常好。她的眼睛只有短暂的睁开过一次。上面的资料在传述的过程中有很多停顿。大部分时间，珍都低着头坐着，手举起来放在脸上，就像殷斯翠姆博士信封测验的时候一样。
(The material surprised us, and we had no thought of trying to relay it to anybody. We have no idea as to whether the tax matters referred to are true, and/or will develop. Our landlord is a complex and generous man who has lowered our rent and the rent of some of the other tenants over the last few years.(这个资料让我们很震惊，我们并不打算把它告诉任何人。我们不知道上面所指的税务事件或这样的发展是否真的。我们的房东是一个复杂且大方的人，他在过去几年降低了我们和其他一些房客的房租。
(Seth had dealt with Jimmy and his family in other sessions, notably the 100th and 101st. Our landlord operates a restaurant featuring a large party and catering service, so it is conceivable that a falling ill at a “party-type gathering” could refer to an illness occurring on those premises. See Volume 3.(赛斯曾在其他节谈过吉米和他的家人，特别在第100节和101节。我们的房东开了一家专门提供大型宴会和外带服务的餐厅，所以一个在“宴会之类的聚会”倒下的疾病，可能是指发生在那场合的病，这是可信的。见第三册。
(The visitation-from-his-father reference involves the material in the 100th and 101st sessions. Jimmy's father died in the summer of 1964. Following the father's death our landlord's wife had several vivid experiences involving the deceased father; Seth said these were legitimate experiences involving contact with the father, and not dreams. It appears that our landlord's wife is a good receiver, or relay station. Perhaps she would receive and pass on to her husband any visitations from the dead father.(来自他父亲的拜访牵涉了第100和101节的资料。吉米的父亲在1964年的夏天过世了。他父亲死后，我们房东的妻子曾有几次遇到这位过世父亲的逼真经验。赛斯说，这些和父亲接触的经验是合理的，并不是梦。我们房东的妻子似乎是一个很好的接收者，或转接站。也许她可以接收传递来自他死去父亲的拜访给她先生。
(Jane had not smoked since putting out her cigarette shortly after the session began, and when she resumed speaking again she refrained from smoking. As before her manner was quite slow. She sat with her head down and her hands raised to her closed eyes. She used many pauses. Resume at 9:31.)(自从这节课开始，珍熄了烟之后，她就没有再抽了，而当她再次重新开始后，她克制自己不要抽烟。像之前一样，她的方式相当慢。她低着头坐着，手举到闭起的眼睛上。她有很多停顿。9:31分重新开始。)
I am trying to see what else we can discover here.我试着看看这里我们还能发现什么。
Some connection with a long-term contract. Some irregularity in almost all property arrangements. Bonds, the private papers originally kept at the hill house, then moved.和一个长期契约的关联。几乎所有的房产协商都有一些不合常规的行为。契约，这些私密文件原本是藏在山上的房子，后来移走了。
(This is a reference to a 400. acre farm our landlord owns near Watkins Glen, NY. It is now empty. Various tenants have done much damage to the place.)(这是一个参考，我们房东在纽约州靠近华特金葛林[Watkins Glen]的地方，有一个400英亩的农场。它现在是空置的。不同的房客造成这地方很多的破坏。)
One legal irregularity existing for twelve years. Business, an irregularity going back to an early small restaurant. An interesting sideline here: his stinginess in small matters is not so much the result of greed as an emotional attempt to maintain the psychic warmth of childhood, a childhood which was marked by poverty.一个合法的不合常规行为存在了12年。一个生意上的不合常规行为回溯到早期小餐厅的时候。这里有个有趣的角度：他在小事情上的吝啬并不是出于贪婪，而是在情感上意图去维持童年心灵上的温暖，一个可以被称为贫穷的童年。
(Jimmy was one of perhaps a dozen children. As a child, one of his tasks was to pick coal along the railroad tracks in winter.)(吉米是12个孩子中的一个。在孩童时期，他其中一个工作是在冬天沿着铁路轨道捡煤。)
An uncle of his, on his side of the family, to die in the near future.他的一个叔叔，是他父亲这边的家人，最近会过世。
I am trying to give you some material that you can check. His wife is ignorant in the main of his financial manipulations, and she hides what suspicions she has from herself.我试着给你们一些可以核对的资料。他妻子基本上对他的账务操作是不了解的，而且她把她心里的猜疑都隐藏起来。
The eldest boy also has suspicions. In many ways he is a severe child.大儿子也有猜疑。他在很多方面是一个幼稚的孩子。
(The boy is a sophomore in high school.)(这男孩是高中二年级学生。)
There may be bonds of some type, belonging to him but under the names of different people. I am not sure. The people may be members of his family. There are some stocks held on a long-term basis, perhaps in his children’s name. I am on unfamiliar ground here. I think of AT& T.这里可能有某种契约，属于他但是在不同的人名下。我不确定。这些人可能是他的家庭成员。有一些长期持有的股票，也许在他孩子的名下。我对这些领域不熟。我想到AT＆T。
(Jane, still sitting with her hands raised to her closed eyes, took a long pause. Later I asked her if she knew what A T& T represented. After some thought she arrived at telephone and telegraph; guessing, she thought A might stand for Atlantic. But she did know the initials meant a stock.)(珍有一个长的停顿，她仍坐着，手举到闭着的眼睛上。后来我问她，她是否知道AT＆T代表什么。她想了一下，她的答案是电话和电报；她猜了一下，认为A可能是指大西洋。但她知道这个缩写意味着一支股票。)
I do not seem to see a courtroom situation however, but a settling up, or an agreement to settle up. An admission and settlement of some kind, through a lawyer. Perhaps a penalty paid, but with no confinement. A lawyer convinces him to settle, and avoid going to court, and through certain manipulations this part of it will be taken care of. (Another long pause.) Some money will be borrowed. The hill property will be sold, or used for collateral. Stocks will be sold. He will not lose his own house because of this.不过我似乎没有看到一个法庭的场景，但有一个协商，或是协商的协议。某种透过律师的认罪或协议。也许是易科罚金，但没有监禁。一个律师说服他协商，以避免上法庭，而透过某种斡旋，这部分会被处理好。(另一次长时间停顿)他会贷借一些钱。山上的房产会被卖掉，或用来抵押。股票会被卖掉。因为这样做他将不会失去他自己的房子。
There is some connection with Joe Cernohorskys wife, though not a direct one, in all of this.这里和乔·瑟诺候司基(Joe Cernohorskys)的妻子会有一些联结，虽然不是直接的那种。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:55. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed throughout the delivery. Much of the time she sat with her head down and her hands raised to her temples. Her pace had been very slow. She hadn’t smoked.(9:55休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛在口述期间自始至终都是闭着的。大部分时间她低着头坐着，而手放在太阳穴上。她的速度非常慢，没有抽烟。
(Joe Cernohorsky is the specialist mentioned on page 248, the man who keeps the apartment house we live in, in running order for the landlord. Joe and the landlord are of an age, 50, and have been friends for years. Jane and I have never met Joes wife, and have no idea what kind of connection Seth might be referring to.(乔·瑟诺候司基是前面提到的维修人员，他帮房东维持我们公寓的正常运作。乔和房东都是50岁，而且是多年的朋友了。珍和我从未遇见过乔的妻子，所以完全不知道赛斯指的某种连结可能是什么。
(It was time for the 36th Dr. Instream experiment. Jane's pace remained slow when she began speaking again, and as before she sat with her head down, her eyes closed, her hands raised, etc. Resume at 10:07.)(现在是时候开始第36次殷斯翠姆博士实验。当珍再次开始说话的时候，她的速度仍然很慢，像以前一样，她低着头坐着、眼睛闭着，手举起来等等。10:07分重新开始。)
Now. Our object is a small framework (pause), small as if made of match-sticks. It is light (pause), and miniature, and formed of squares. I do not believe it is solid all the way through, but with open spaces in it. Some of the square shapes may be open.现在。我们的物件是一个小的支架(停顿)，小的好像是用火柴做的。它很轻(停顿)，微型，由正方形组成。我不认为它是实心的，里面是空的。有一些正方形可能可以打开。
Ruburt thinks of a mobile, but that is not precisely it at all. Light in color (pause), mainly vertical in form; that is, taller than it is wide. It may have a connection with an L P. (Long pause at 10:12.)鲁柏想到一辆车，但那并不完全正确。颜色是浅色。(停顿)主要的形状是直立的；那意味着高比宽长。它可能与L P有连接(10:12长时间停顿)
There is something twisted on it. I also seem to pick up a connection with water and the object. The object was given to him rather than purchased by him. It may have a connection with a chain. (Pause.)上面有一些弯曲。我似乎收到一个和水，以及这个物件有关的连结。这物件是人家给他的，而不是他自己买的。它可能和链子有关联。(停顿)
I believe his mail is late because of the storm, and that he will receive a letter from the Midwest, later than he would have ordinarily. The letter not entirely unexpected. Duplicity, or a dual manner, in connection with a man who wrote the letter.我想他的信被暴风雨给耽误了，而他会收到一封来自中西部的信，比平常收到的时间要晚。这封信多少有点意料之中。欺骗，或一种双面的态度，和这个写信的人有关。
Now I pick up the word granger, but do not know to what it refers. (Pause.)现在我收到一个字“农夫”，但不知道它指的是什么。(停顿)
Do you have a test for me?你有测验要给我吗？
(“Yes.”(“是的。”
(It was 10:16. I handed Jane the envelope for our 30th envelope experiment, and as usual she took it without opening her eyes. She sat with the envelope held against her forehead.)(现在是10:16。我递给珍第30次实验的信封，而像平常一样她闭着眼睛接过去。她坐着，把信封抵在额头上。)
Give us a moment, please.请等我们一下。
Filling—-no, filing. Filing cabinet. These are impressions. From a filing cabinet.充满(Filling)——不对，是文件(filing)。文件柜。这些是印象。来自一个文件柜。
The number 12. Several people who do not seem to be related.数字12 ，几个似乎不相关的人。
Cloth connection.与衣服有连结。
A referral. L M, two one. Studious, someone studious. (Here now Ruburt thinks of your niece, and the letter announcing her marriage. You may put this reference in parenthesis.)一个转交。L M，21。用功的，某个人很用功。(现在这里鲁柏想到了你的侄女，还有一封宣告她要结婚的信。)你可以把这个参考放在括号里。
The connection with cloth is a good one. Evening. A connection with an endeavor that does not work. A short note. Several trees. This is a note, from someone in another place.和衣物的连结是很好的一个印象。夜晚。和一个新事业没有成功有关。一个短笺。几棵树。这是一封短笺，来自另一个地方的某个人。
A woman connection with a relative, as well as the earlier-mentioned connection with people who are not relatives.和一个亲戚有关联的女人，也和之前提到的，不是亲戚的人有关联。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:25. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed throughout both experiments, she had used many pauses, and had not smoked.(10:25休息。珍出离如常。在两个实验中间，她的眼睛闭着，她有很多时候停顿，而且没有抽烟。
(As stated earlier the results of the envelope experiment were not high. The first reference, to a filing cabinet, is a good one; the colored paper I used in the test is kept in my cabinet, and has been so for perhaps two years. But after this Jane kept veering toward the letter. I thought someone studious referred to myself, but again there was not sufficient elaboration.(如之前提过的，这个信封实验的结果并不好。第一个参考，文件柜，说的很好；我用在测验上的色纸大概放在柜子里有两年了。但在这之后，珍突然转向这封信。我认为某个用功的人指的是我自己，但再次的，这并不是充分的解释。
(From what Seth says after break, we saw the connection with cloth, evening, and an endeavor that does not work.
