Jane and I bought this colored paper to use in an experiment whereby, blindfolded, we tried to determine the various colors by touch alone. This after we had read an article in Time Magazine about a woman who had been able to do this. Our tests had been held in the evening, and our results reached chance level only.(在休息后，从赛斯所说的，我们看到和衣物、夜晚和一个新的事业没有成功有关的关联。珍和我买这些色纸用在实验上，是因为我们想试试看蒙着眼睛、光用触碰能不能分辨不同的颜色。这是我们读了《时代杂志》上的一篇文章说，有一个女人可以这么做。我们的测验是在晚上举行的。我们的结果只达到猜测的机率。
(Jane resumed while smoking, and with her eyes opening at times, at 10:29.)(珍在10:29分重新开始，她的眼睛有时候会睁开，而且她在抽烟。)
Now. After our star performance, I have a few words to say.现在。在我们精彩的表演后，我有一些话要说。
If you are interested in any kind of evidential material, it is good to hold tests fairly regularly. Now. When you want to give Ruburt a vacation from them, this is quite all right. But because of his peculiar makeup the first, or first few tests after resumption are apt to be poor now, at this time, because he is apt to try too hard. He is not used to the touch enough yet. He loses the touch of it, and falls back on other layers of the self which are not reliable for this sort of data.如果你们对任何一种可作为证明的资料感兴趣，最好是相当规律的举行测验。现在。当你想放鲁柏一个假，这是很好的。但首先，因为他奇怪的性格，或现在重新开始后的前几次测验都不太好，这一次，是因为他太努力了。他还不习惯这样的灵感，他失去了对它的感觉，而跌回了觉得那些资料不可靠的自己的那些层面。
One part of his whole personality is able to help me very much at times, but other portions simply cannot. I mentioned specifically Ruburts impression that the item had to do with a particular letter purposely, to tip him off, so to speak.他整个人格的某部分有时候能帮我很多，但其他部分则不是那样。我有意的特别提到鲁柏的印象：这个物品和一封特别的信有关，可以说是为了要透露消息给他。
A very few legitimate impressions came through. The cloth connection had to do with distinguishing the color of cloth, which was mentioned in an article that you read. The other legitimate impressions I believe you have already picked out.极少数合理的印象透过来。衣物的关联是和之前你读过那篇分辨衣物颜色的文章有关。其他合理的印象我想你们已经辩认出来了。
I like to keep our sessions fairly balanced. It is possible that sometime in the near future, perhaps late spring or summer, we can arrange for a few specific sessions, in which several envelopes are prepared ahead of time. The purpose of such possible sessions simply being the fortification of Ruburt’s shaky confidence.我想让我们的课保持平衡。有可能在不远的将来，也许晚春或夏天的时候，我们可以安排一些特定的课，在这些课里，信封能提前准备。这些可能的课的目的，单纯就是为了加强鲁柏动摇的信心。
Notice also that little emotional content was contained in the test item. I like something better to get my teeth into.也注意在测验项目里，多少包含一些少量的情感内容。我喜欢那些能更好地得到我注意力的东西。
This is indeed a training period, and at sometime in the future we will have greater opportunity for range. You see how well we do in a spontaneous manner, as with Philip.这确实是一个训练阶段，而未来，我们会有更多机会命中红心。你们知道的，就像和菲利普那时候一样，当以一种自发性的方式来做的时候，我们会做得多好。
(Philip is John Bradleys entity name. See the 204th and 226th sessions.)(菲利普是约翰•布雷德利存有的名字。见第204和226节。)
Now. You may end the session or continue it as you choose.现在。你可以选择结束这节课或继续下去。
(“I guess well end it then.”)(“我猜我们要结束了。”)
Then I bid you a most fond good evening.我祝你们有一个美好的夜晚。
(“Are we going to get any more snow?"(“还会下更多雪吗？”
(Jane smiled, her eyes closed.)(珍笑了，她的眼睛闭着。)
Do you want any more snow?你们想下更多雪吗？
(“No.’’)(“不想。”)
I am not a personal weather forecaster. However, you will get no appreciable amount of snow, I believe for ten days or so, though some perhaps this weekend, as Ruburt is fully aware since he heard that on the radio.我不是私人气象预报员。不过，我想在10天内，应该不会有太大量的雪，虽然这个周末可能会下一些，鲁柏相当清楚，因为他听了广播。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:44. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had opened occasionally. She said she had been looking forward to the envelope experiment tonight, hoping I would give her one; she had given herself suggestions concerning it this afternoon.(10:44结束。珍出离如常。她的眼睛偶尔会睁开。她说过她期待今晚的信封实验，希望我会给她一个信封；她今天下午有给她自己关于这信封的暗示。
(Jane was curious about the Instream object. I thought that perhaps it was a ship model. I then recalled that earlier in the week Bill Gallagher and I had been looking at some of my books on the ships of the 17th and 18th centuries. These books contained plans and photographs. Jane and Bill’s wife Peggy had been present but hadn’t paid much attention to our talk.(珍很好奇殷斯翠姆博士的物件是什么。我认为也许是一个船的模型。我后来想起来在这周稍早之前，比尔·加拉格和我在看一些我的藏书，写的是关于17和18世纪的船只。这些书有包含地图和照片。珍和比尔的妻子蓓也在场，但没有太注意我们的对话。
(We were discussing the material on our landlord when Seth came through again. Jane resumed with her eyes opening at 10:50.)(当赛斯再一次透过来的时候，我们正在谈论房东的资料。珍在10:50重新开始，她的眼睛是睁开的。)
One note: since much of this session has to do with personal material concerning your landlord, I did not mean earlier to point out to you your own reaction, Joseph, which has been excellent to the situation in general.一个注：因为这节课谈了很多关于你们房东的个人资料，我之前没有指出来，约瑟，你自己的反应对整个情况来说是很棒的。
Your improvement is noted here more strongly, for you have refused to become very much annoyed, and you have almost automatically adjusted your reaction. The situation is entirely different because of your reaction.你这里的进步是很明显的，你拒绝变得太恼怒，而你几乎是自动的调适了你的反应。这个情况因为你的反应而变得完全不同。
Your reaction has changed the situation for the better. Not only so far as you and Ruburt are concerned, but as far as those others involved. Because of your most sensible reaction, the whole situation is much less bothersome than it would be otherwise. Not only for you but for your neighbors.你的反应让情况变得更好 。不只单指你和鲁柏，也指其他涉及的人。因为你明智的反应，整个情形变得没原来的那么麻烦。不只对你们，也对你们的邻居。
In the past you would have allowed it to disrupt your inner life. I wanted you to realize that this was a tangible improvement.在过去，你会让它扰乱你内在的生活。我想让你知道，这是一个实质的进步。
(End at 10:55.)(10:55结束。)

SESSION 230 第230节 私人课 珍和罗的年龄预测


FEBRUARY 6, 1966 APPROXIMATELY 10:00 PM SUNDAY UNSCHEDULED1966年2月6日 星期天 大约晚上10:00 计划外
(A brief but potent unscheduled session was held Sunday night, with Bill and Peggy Gallagher as witnesses. This account is written the next evening from memory, since I took no notes at the time.(一个简短而有力的临时课在星期日晚上举行，比尔和蓓·加拉格也有参与。这篇记录是在隔天晚上照着记忆写下来的，因为我当时没有记笔记。
(No session was planned. The conversation among the four of us touched upon many things, including the news Jane received from her publisher that her ESP book is set for publication on May 16,1966. During the evening we played some tapes also, and among these was one of the recordings Jane made of G. K. Chesterton’s poem Lepanto; Jane was in a trance state while reading this, apparently in a close approximation of the voice of her now dead friend, Father Trainor. Lepanto was Father Trainor 's favorite poem. Jane has experienced this same phenomenon several times while reading this work, and it is dealt with in the 131st and 158th sessions.(本来并没有打算要上课。我们四个的对话涵盖了很多事，包括珍从她的出版商那收到的消息，她的ESP书准备在1966年5月16日出版。那天晚上我们也放了一些录音带，其中一卷录音是珍念了切斯特顿[G.K.Chesterton]的诗——《雷邦多》(Lepanto)，当念这首诗的时候，珍是在出离状态，以一种很像她死去的朋友，崔诺神父的声音念的。《雷邦多》是崔诺神父很喜欢的一首诗。每当念这首作品的时候，珍都经历过几次同样的现象，而这在第131和158节都有讨论。
(Bill Gallagher asked Seth about a possible operation for his ulcers, although he has been feeling well. Seth replied that he saw no operation for Bill, should present trends continue, and that Bill should surmount the ulcer problem eventually. Seth has told Bill this before.(比尔·加拉格问赛斯，他溃疡手术的可能性，虽然他已经觉得比较好了。赛斯回答说，沿着目前的发展，他没有看见比尔有动手术，而比尔的溃疡问题最后应该会解决。赛斯以前曾告诉比尔这件事。
(This led rather naturally into a discussion of ages. Seth then told Bill he saw him living until around 85, with Peggy equally old. Seth then told me I would live to be 87. This is the first time he has given me any specific age, although in several previous sessions, among them the 149th and the 217th, he has mentioned my living to an old age. In the 105th session, among others, he stated that Jane 's death was not “to occur for many years.” In our immediately past lives, spent mainly in Boston in pre-Civil War days, Jane lived to be 82 or 83 as a woman medium, and I lived to be 63 as an Episcopalian minister. We have received a limited amount of data on the Boston lives, and are not sure of our personal relationship, except that we were not man and wife. See Volume 4, for example.(这很自然的带到了有关年龄的讨论。然后赛斯告诉比尔，他看到他大概活到85岁，蓓也是差不多的年纪。赛斯告诉我，我应该会活到87岁[编注：罗去世时89岁，1919－200]。这是第一次他给我一个特定的年纪，虽然在前面几节，大概第149和第217节，他有提到我会活到老年。在第105节，他提到珍的死“好多年内不会发生”。在我们最近的前世，是在南北战争[pre-Civil War][编注：美国内战1861年]前，主要是住在波士顿，珍以一个女灵媒的身分活到了82或83岁，而我以一个圣公会牧师的身分活到了63岁。关于波士顿那次的人生，我们只收到很有限的讯息，而且并不确定我们私人的关系，除了我们不是夫妻关系以外。见第四册。
(Tonight, Jane then went on to foresee her own death at 67. This naturally surprised us. Seth prefaced this by saying something about “I see a breathing difficulty.” He went on to say that Ruburt was upset at this information, and that her relatively early death simply meant she had to work harder in this life. According to Seth this is the last physical life for Jane and me. Seth said he was having trouble getting this information through.(今晚，珍预知了她67岁会死。这当然吓到了我们。赛斯以“我看到了呼吸困难”作为开场白。他继续说鲁柏对这个讯息感到烦乱，而她的相对早逝意味着她在这一生必须更努力。据赛斯所说，这是珍和我的最后一世。赛斯说他在传述这个讯息时遇到了困难。
(The Gallaghers left shortly after this. Jane was upset, so upset that at first she couldn't let Seth through, even though she wanted to. I urged her to sit quietly, smoke a cigarette, and relax. In view of earlier material I remembered, I thought the 67th-year information was a distortion, and that such a distortion was natural enough when one talked about one's own passing. I also thought that all such predictions, whether favorable or not, depended upon probabilities, in line with the latest material we have been getting. I should add here that the 105th session dealt with the death of Jane’s mother, as well as Jane living to an advanced age. The mother's death has not yet occurred, Seth saying that the information was by way of allowing Jane to prepare herself for the shock of her mother's death. The subject had been brought up by several vivid dreams and psychological time experiences Jane had had concerning her mother. While giving this 105th session, Seth had also had trouble getting the information through, ascribing the difficulty to Janes ego. See Volume 3.(讨论到这里，加拉格夫妇很快就离开了。珍很烦乱，她第一次烦乱到即使她想让赛斯透过来，她也做不到。我劝她静静地坐着，抽一只烟，放松一下。由于我记得之前的资料，我认为67岁这个讯息是一个扭曲，而当一个人谈到自己的死亡时，这样的扭曲是很自然的。我也认为所有这样的预言，不管是不是好的，都是建立在可能性上，这才符合我们最新学到的资料。我应该在这里注明，在第105节里谈过珍母亲的死，还有珍会活到老年。她母亲的死还未发生，赛斯告诉她，这个讯息是为了让她有所准备，不至于对她母亲的死感到太过震惊。会提到这个话题是因为珍做了几个关于她母亲的，逼真的梦和心理时间经验。当在第105节，赛斯给这个资料时也遇到了困难，困难的原因应该是来自珍的自我。见第三册。
(Within perhaps fifteen minutes after the Gallaghers left, Seth did come through. He proceeded to explain that Jane had indeed distorted her personal information. Subconsciously, Seth said, Jane was aware that the death of her grandfather, whom she had loved, was early next month, March. The grandfather had died of tuberculosis, hence Jane producing a distorted reference to a “breathing difficulty. " The grandfather had also died at the age of 67. Jane did not know this offhand consciously, Seth said, but had the records to prove it, and subconsciously was well aware of it.(加拉格夫妇离开的15分钟后，赛斯过来了。他继续解释珍确实扭曲了她个人的讯息。赛斯说，潜意识里，珍觉察到她深爱的外公忌日是在下个月，也就是3月初。她的外公死于结核病，因此珍产生了一个扭曲的“呼吸困难”关联。她外公也死于67岁。赛斯说珍意识上不知道这个，但有记录可以证明，而潜意识里她早就知道了。
(Jane has in her files a family record book going back to the mid 1800s. Consulting this after the session we found that Seth was correct, that her grandfather had been 67 when he died March 12,1948. Jane was extremely attached to her grandfather; she grew up without a father since her parents separated when she was three years old, and her grandfather did his best to fill in the gap. Seth said the anniversary of his death has been on her mind. Seth dealt with the grandfather rather extensively in the 14th session. This material was the longest at the time, dealing with another personality in such a manner. See Volume 1.(珍的档案夹里有一个家族记录薄，可以追溯到19世纪中叶。在课后我们查看了这本薄子，发现赛斯是正确的，她的外公死于1948年3月12日，当时他67岁。珍和她外公非常亲近；她的成长期里没有父亲，因为她父母在她3岁时就分开了，她的外公尽力弥补这一点。赛斯说每年他的忌日她都放在心里。赛斯在第14节曾提过很多关于她外公的讯息。当时以这种方式提到另一个人格，那是最长的一次。见第一册。
(Seth also agreed with me concerning my memory of earlier sessions in which he stated she would live to old age. Since our index is not completed for all the sessions, I cannot find as many exact references here as I would like, other than to ask Seth for help in naming particular sessions, and do not know whether this is possible. We may try later.(赛斯也同意我所说的，关于我记得的，在早先的课里他曾说过她会活到老年。因为我们所有课的索引还没有完成，我没办法找到我想要的参考资料，只能要求赛斯帮忙指出特定的课，却不知道这样是否可能。我们可以稍后试试。
(Seth also agreed that all such predictions are indeed based on probabilities. By and large, he said, predictions will work out if no major drastic changes in personality and/or behavior occur.(赛斯也同意，所有这样的预测的确都是建立在可能性上。基本上，赛斯说，如果人格和发生的行为没有重大剧烈的改变，预言就会实现。
(Seth went on to give us some information that I for one found surprising. After saying that Jane would live into her eighties also, he said that we would be instrumental in offering conclusive evidence for the survival of the personality after physical death. Without naming names, he told me that the one of us dying first would succeed in communicating with the surviving partner in such a way that the results would give conclusive proof “to the masses.”(赛斯接着给我们一些我很惊讶的讯息。在说完珍也会活到80岁后，他说，在提供肉体死亡后人格还会继续存活的确凿证据上，我们会起一个重要的作用。没有说名字，他告诉我，我们其中一个人会先死，然后会继续以这样的方式和活着的另一半沟通，而这个结果会给“多数人”一个确凿的证据。
(I tried to question him closely about this and remember what I could. By masses, Seth said he meant the man in the street. I said I though much evidence had been collected already, and that more was certain to be gathered before our deaths forty or so years from now, granting his dates were correct. Seth agreed, but said the evidence might convince scientists and investigators long before it convinced the average man, who knows little about such things now.(我试着仔细地问他这一点，然后尽可能的记下来。大多数人，赛斯说他指的多数人是一般路人。我说我认为已经累积了很多证据，在40几年后我们死亡之日来临之前会有更多资料累积，那时就知道他说的是否正确。赛斯同意并且说，可能这些证据说服科学家和研究者的时间远比说服一般人的时间要早，一般人对这样的事所知甚少。
(Experiments would be set up in advance of the death of either Jane or I, Seth said, that would furnish this convincing proof once one of us died. I am nine years older than Jane. Seth went on to say that once this proof was made known and accepted, it would change the behavior of every man on earth, for man would have to live his physical life in the face of knowledge of an afterlife.(在珍或我死亡之前，实验就会开始设置，赛斯说，一旦我们其中一个过世，就会提供一个令人信服的证据。我比珍大9岁。赛斯接着说，一旦这个证据大家知道而且接受了，它就会改变地球上每个人的行为，因为人会开始带着有死后人生的这种知识而活着。
(This brought the session to a close, somewhere around 11:30 PM, I would estimate. Janes eyes had remained closed while the Gallaghers were present. After their departure and when Seth resumed, they began to open occasionally. Her voice remained at an average level, nor was her delivery out of the ordinary.(到这里课要结束了，我估计大约是晚上11:30分。当加拉格夫妇还在的时候，珍的眼睛一直闭着。在他们离开而赛斯重新开始时，它们开始有时候会睁开。她的音量维持适中，口述也和平常一样。
(Before the session, Bill G. told Jane he thought she possessed healing ability—to her surprise. During the session I believe Seth agreed.(在课开始前，比尔告诉珍他认为她有疗愈的能力——她很惊讶。上课时我相信赛斯也同意这一点。
(A note added 5-1/2 years later: In July 1971 Bill Gallagher did have an operation for his ulcers. It went very well, and he is free of pain.)(5年半后加上的笔记：在1971年7月，比尔·加拉格确实为了他的溃疡动了一个手术。手术非常顺利，他也不再痛了。)
(Reduced copy of the survival literature, font, used in the 31st envelope缺
experiment, in the 231st session for February 7,1966.)缺
(Reduced copy of the survival literature, font, used in the 31st envelope experiment, in the 231st session for February 7,1966.)用在1966年2月7日第231节，第31次信封测验的生存指南缩小版副本正反面

SESSION 231 第231节 思想、渴望、愿望都是事件 信封31


FEBRUARY 7, 1966 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1966年2月7日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(The 31st envelope experiment was held during the session. The test object is a leaflet concerning highway signs to be used in case of an atomic attack. Jane and I picked it up at our local Bureau of Motor Vehicles the second week in January, when we went there to inquire about the delay in receiving my new license plates. I had ordered them December 3,1965; as will be seen this date plays a part in the test results.(第31次信封测验在这节举行。测验物件是一本小册子，是有关如果发生原子弹攻击时，高速公路标志的使用方式。是珍和我在1月的第二周在地方汽车监理所拿到的，我们当时去那里询问，为什么没有收到我的新汽车牌照。我在1965年12月3日就申请了；等一下会看到这个日期出现在测验结果上。
(This leaflet had a good emotional connection to Jane, since a very few days before we went to the bureau she had a dream concerning an atomic attack, radiation, contamination, etc.; in the dream she saw a building and a floor plan that were very much similar to the actual layout of the local bureau. The data contained in the leaflet closely paralleled the dream; therefore Jane was quite pleased to discover stacks of these leaflets at the motor vehicle bureau. She had not been inside the bureau for at least a year.(这本小册子和珍有很密切的情感连结，因为我们去监理所的几天前，她做了一个关于原子弹爆炸的梦，有辐射、放射性污染等等；在梦里她看到一栋和地方监理所的布置很相像的大楼，还有它的建筑平面图。包含在这本小册子里的资料紧密的对应着这个梦；因此珍很高兴在汽车监理所发现了一叠这样的小册子。她至少有一年没去过监理所了。
(I folded the object once, placed it between the usual two pieces of Bristol and sealed it in the usual double envelope.(我把物件折起来，放在两个纸板中间，再放进信封里封好。
(The session was held in our front room and was not interrupted. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed, although they began to open after a few minutes. Her pace was good, her voice average.)(这节课在我们前面的房间举行，中间并没有被打扰。珍开始说话时坐着，眼睛闭着，虽然几分钟后它们睁开。她的速度很好，音量适中。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. I would like to give you some further data concerning probabilities and the inverted time system.现在。我想要给你们更多关于可能性和倒置时间系统的资料。
Now when I first spoke of the inverted time system, I spoke of it as if it were apart from your own time system, to enable you to see it with some objectivity. However as you know by now, this system operates within your own. It simply is not the time system recognized by the ego.现在。当我第一次提到倒置时间系统时，我是以仿佛它们是有别于你们自己时间系统的方式来说，这是为了让你们带着某种客观性去看待它。不过，就像你们现在知道的，这个系统是在你们自己的系统里运作，它只是不是自我能认出来的那种时间系统。
There are many implications here, and now perhaps you can understand why I gave you the information on the nature of action before I introduced you to the inverted time system. For action is action whether or not you perceive it, and probable events are events whether or not you perceive them as such.这里有很多含义。现在你们可能会了解为什么在我介绍倒置时间系统之前，我要先给你们有关行动本质的资料。因为不管你们有没有感知到它，行动就是行动，而可能性事件也是一样，不管你有没有感知到它，它就是事件。
Thoughts are indeed events therefore. Wishes and desires are events. As you know, wishes and desires also influence those actions which will be perceived by you as actual events in the physical universe. The human system responds fully as much to these events as it does to physical events. In the dream state often portions of these probable events are experienced in a semiconscious manner. This amounts to a bleed-through, and I use the term purposely, for your recorder can serve us here in an analogy.因此，思想的确是事件。愿望和渴望是事件。就如你所知，愿望和渴望也影响着那些行动，那些在物质宇宙里被你以真实事件感知的行动。人类系统全然地回应着这些事件，就好像它回应着物质事件一样。在梦的状态，这些可能事件的一部分常常会以半意识的方式经验着。这等同于渗漏，而我是有目的性的使用这个字眼，这里可以用你们的录音机来做一个比喻。
Imagine the whole self as composed of some master tape. Your recorder has four channels. We will give our master tape numberless channels.想象全我是由一些母带所组成。你的录音机有4个频道，而母带可以有无数的频道。
Each channel will represent a portion of the self, each one existing in a different dimension, and yet all part of the whole self, or the whole tape. You can see that it would be highly ridiculous to say that the material on your Mono One was any more or any less valid than your material on Mono Two. Mono One and Mono Two could be compared then to self one and two; self one and two here, however, in the context of the ego as self one and the subconscious as you know it as self two. We are not using Dunnes terms here, in other words.每一个频道代表自己的一部分，而每一个频道在不同的维度存在着，但所有部分都属于全我，或母带。如果你说现在单声道一的资料比出现在单声道二的资料更有效或更无效，这是很荒谬的。单声道一和单声道二可以比作自己一和自己二；不过这里的自己一和自己二，在这个背景下，自我可以比作自己一，而你们所知的潜意识可以比作自己二。换句话说，我们在这里用的不是唐尼的字眼。
We will imagine then these various one and two, Mono One and Mono Two, multiplied, literally, an endless amount of times. Now on your recorder I believe you have a setting for stereo. This enables you to unite and combine harmoniously the elements on the various channels simultaneously. I am taking my time here so that we get this clearly, for I do not often come through with the pure clarity of stereophonic.然后我们可以想像，这些不同的一和二，单声道一和单声道二，照字面上的，乘以无限次，现在我相信在你的录音机里有装置立体音量系统，这可以让你很和谐的同时合并和结合出现在不同频道的元素。我在这里会花一点时间让我们能把这个搞清楚，因为我并不常以这样的清晰度从立体音响系统透过来。
(Jane paused and smiled. Her pace had become quite slow.)(珍停顿而且微笑。她的速度变得十分慢。)
Now. Your stereophonic setting can be compared to what we have termed the inner ego. Now each of these selves experience time in their own manner, and as you should see by now this only means that they build their own realities according to the nature of their own perceptions. But the nature of their own perceptions is not chaotic. The portions of the self are so constructed, so to speak, that when the stereophonic channel is turned on the selves then know their unity. Their various realities merge in the overall perceptions of the whole self.现在。你们的立体音响系统可以比作我们所谓的内在自我。现在这些自己们的每一个都以他们自己的方式来经验时间，而你们现在应该知道这只是意味着，他们根据自己感知的本质来建立他们自己的实相。但他们自己感知的本质并不是混乱的。可以说，自己的这些部分是如此的结构化，而当立体音响的频道转到这些自己时，你就会知道它们的一致性。它们不同的实相融合进全我全面的感知里。
None of these portions of the self are the whole self, obviously, and until the whole self is able to perceive its own parts simultaneously, then these seemingly separate portions of the self appear to themselves isolated to a large degree, and alone.很明显的，直到全我能同时感知到它自己的这些部分之前，自己的这些部分都不是全我，然而自己这些看似分离的部分，到一个很大的程度显得是被隔离而且孤立的。
There is communication between them but they are not aware of it. The tape is the element common to all the channels. Now. The inner ego is the director as you know, but the whole self must know itself simultaneously. It is not enough that the inner ego knows what is going on. Ultimately therefore the inner ego must itself bring about comprehension on the parts of the various portions.在他们之间有沟通，但他们并不觉知到。这个录音带是所有频道共同的元素。现在。就如你所知道的，内在自我是一个指挥者，但全我必须同时知道它。光是内在自我知道发生了什么是不够的，因此最终内在自我必须带领这些不同的部分达到理解。
Each portion of the self must therefore become fully aware of all the other portions. We are not dealing however with anything as simple as a mechanical recorder, for our tapes, in analogy, are constantly changing.因此自己的每一个部分，必须变得完全觉知所有其他的部分。不过我们现在要处理的并不是像机械的录音机那样简单的东西，作为比喻来说，我们的录音带是持续地改变的。
I will suggest a break, and we shall continue this material. I also will have a few pertinent but brief remarks later in the session concerning last evening.我会建议休息，然后我们应该继续这个资料，我等一下也会在这节对昨晚的内容有一些相关但简短的评论。
(Break at 9:26. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her pace had been good and her eyes had opened frequently. Her pace had been quite slow in the middle of the delivery.(9:26休息。珍在第一段出离如常。她的速度很好，眼睛频繁的睁开。在口述中期，她的速度变得十分慢。
(When she resumed her pace was again slow, at 9:35.)(当她在9:35重新开始时，她的速度再次的变慢。)
Now. Take for example probable event X. This so-called probable event or action will be experienced by the various portions of the self in their own way. When it is experienced by the ego you call it an actual physical event. When the event is perceived or experienced by other layers of the self, the ego does not know of it.现在。以可能性事件X来做例子。这个所谓的可能性事件或行动，会被自己的不同部分以它们自己的方式来经验。当它被自我经验的时候，你可称它为一个真实的物质事件。当这个事件被自己的其他层面感知或经验时，自我是不知道的。
The event is actual all the same, and is experienced in variation. The whole self therefore perceives and is affected by probabilities, and experiences these as action, regardless of whether or not the ego has chosen to accept any given event as a physical occurrence.事件都是真实的，而以不同的方式被经验着。因此全我能且被可能性所影响，全我以行动来经验这些可能性，不管自我是否选择接受任何特定事件为物质上所发生的事件。
The time sequence varies also as you have seen. That is, events are experienced in different sequences. However past, present and future has reality only to the ego. Now there is some bleed-through. The ego is certainly aware to some extent of the subconscious. The subconscious is certainly aware of the ego. The portion of the self, or rather the portions of the self, that experience action in terms of what the ego would term probability, is further divorced from the ego, however, and this probability reality appears to the ego very rarely, and only very occasionally.时间顺序也和你所看到的不同。那意味着事件以不同的顺序被经验着。无论如何，过去、现在、未来只对自我有其实相。现在，总会有一些渗漏。自我当然能觉察到某程度的潜意识，潜意识也能觉察到自我。自己的这部分，或更确切的说自己的这些部分经验了自我称为可能性的行动，是更进一步脱离了自我，不过，这个可能性实相很少会对自我显现，只有非常偶然才会这样。
When this does happen it usually occurs as a bleed-through from the subconscious from the dream state, for the subconscious is somewhat acquainted with probabilities, and to some degree experiences these in a problem-solving manner. It views various probabilities with the purposes of the ego in mind, and therefore aids the ego in its decisions as to which probable events it should choose for its own experience.当这情形发生的时候，它通常是从潜意识里，从梦境渗漏出来，因为潜意识多少是熟悉可能性的，而到某种程度以问题解决的方式来经验这些可能性。它在心中以自我的目的来检视这些可能性，因此帮助自我来决定哪一个可能性事件应该被选为它自己的经验。
Now, the time in which the inner ego exists is, as you know, the spacious present. The spacious present is the basic time in which the whole self has its existence, but the various portions of that self have their experience in their own time systems, which are the results of their characteristic methods of perception.现在，就如你所知道的，内在自我存在的时间是广阔的现在。广阔的现在是全我存在的基本时间，但自己的不同部分经验着它们自己的时间系统，那是它们感知的独有方式的结果。
Now. It should be obvious that the psychological framework must be different when the time system of experience is different. You can see easily for yourself the individual psychological variations that exist simply between the ego and the subconscious, but these portions of the self are very close. Other portions of the self, that deal in what you would call probable realities, are very different in their psychological makeup.现在。这应该是很明显的，当经验的时间系统不同的时候，心理架构就必须不同。你能在你自己身上很轻易地看到，存在于自我和潜意识之间个别心理上的变化，但自己的这些部分是非常紧密的。自己的其他部分，处理你称为可能性实相的那部分，它们的心理组成是非常不同的。
There is a chameleon like characteristic, a continuity, not in terms of successive moments, but a continuity in terms of design. Events are perceived in what would seem a most alien manner to the ego. The probabilities are traveled through, so to speak. Identity or continuity of the self is retained and strengthened in a series of simultaneous events, with value fulfillment foremost insofar as purposeful action is concerned.有一种变色龙似的特质，一种持续性，不是就连续性片刻来说，而是就设计安排的连续性来说。事件是以对自我来说似乎最陌异的方式被感知着。可以说，种种的可能性被游历过。就有目的的行动而言，身分或自己的连续性被一系列同时性的事件保留并加强，且伴随着在其范围内最重要的价值完成。
The probable events are experienced in such a way that any given action or probable action is followed through in its various and almost infinite varieties.这些可能性事件以这样的方式被经验，任何一个特定的或可能性的行动伴随着各种各样、几乎是无止尽的变化。
I have been slow in giving you this data, since it is so divorced from your normal experience that it is difficult to put the concept into words. You do not have sufficient words to clearly explain what I mean. We will end up making this quite clear, however.我很缓慢地给你们这些资料，因为它和你们正常的经验是如此的不同，所以很难把概念转成文字。你们并不具有充足的字条让我可以很清楚地解释我的意思。不过我们终究会把它解释得很清楚。
(Jane now took a long pause. Her pace had again become very slow, although her eyes were opening rather often.)(珍现在有一个长的停顿。她的速度再次的变得非常慢。虽然她的眼睛相当频繁地睁开。)
The ego maintains much of its stability by looking backwards, so to speak, into its experience of its past, and finding something of itself there. Now the past may be an illusion, but it is not illusion to the ego. The portions of the self that deal in probabilities do not have such an experience with a past, to give them their feeling of identity or continuity.可以这么说，自我借由往回看进它过去的经验来保持它大部分的稳定性，在那里找到一些它自己。过去可能是一个幻相，但对自我来说，它并不是幻相。自己和可能性打交道的那部分并没有这样的经验，一个会让他们感觉到身分和连续性的过去的经验。
Permanence as the ego thinks of it would be an alien concept to these portions of the self, and to them a highly distasteful concept, adding up to rigidity. Flexibility is the key here, a voluntary changing or alteration of the self as it is allowed to change freely with each probability that is explored. Experience here therefore is of a plastic nature. Some thought concerning your own dream state may give you an intimate key to understand what I mean here.自我所思考的永恒性对自己的这些部分来说是很陌生的概念，而且对它们而言，这是个令人非常不愉快的经验，那加上了僵化。这里的关键是有弹性，自己的一种主动变化或改变，就如它被允许在每一个探索的可能性里都自由的改变。因此，在这里经验是一个可塑的本质。一些关于你们自己梦境的思考，可能会让你更容易理解我在这里所说的。
The identity, the basic identity, of these portions of the self, are carried by what you could compare to the subconscious that you know. This is difficult, but listen: in these portions of the self it is the subconscious that carries the burden of identity, and it is the ego whose experiences are of a dreamlike, plastic nature. I use these terms to make the point clear. Do not let them confuse you. These portions of the self would seem topsy-turvy to you for this reason.自己这些部分的身分，那基本的身分，是由可比喻为你所知道的潜意识所携带着的。这很困难，但仔细听：在这个自己的这些部分，是由潜意识携带着身分的重责，而它是自我经验到的一种似梦、可塑的本质。我用这些字眼让这个观点更清楚。别让它们混淆了你。因为这个原因，自己的这些部分对你们来说似乎是杂乱无章的。
You may take your break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 10:07. Jane had been dissociated as usual. Her eyes had opened often and been very dark. She had spoken slowly but with emphasis, and said she could almost feel Seth wanting her to get just the right words. Her manner had been intent, as though she worked much harder than usual for the material. She had not smoked.(10:07休息。珍出离如常，她的眼睛非常深邃而且常常睁开。她说得很慢但慎重，而且她说，她能感觉到赛斯想要她只用精准的字眼。她的态度很专注，仿佛为了这些资料，她比平常更努力。她没有抽烟。
(It was now time for the 37th Dr. Instream experiment. Janes pace remained broken by many rather short pauses. She sat with her head down, her hands raised to her closed eyes. She did not smoke. Resume at 10:12.)(现在是时间开始第37次殷斯翠姆博士实验。珍的速度仍然被许多相当短的停顿所打断。她低着头坐着，她的手举到闭起的眼睛上。她没有抽烟。在10:12重新开始。)
Now. Give us a moment, please. (Pause.) Something resembling a bench, but small and lighter in weight. Old-fashioned, it is old-fashioned. (Pause.) I have the impression of a miniature antique, of Victorian style, and it is scrolled. (Pause.) The legs, I believe, are scrolled. This is our object.现在。请等我们一下。(停顿)某个像长椅的东西，但比较小，而且重量比较轻。老式的，它是老式的风格。(停顿)我有一个小型古董，维多利亚风格的印象，而且它是弯曲的。(停顿)我认为，椅子的脚是弯曲的。这是我们的物件。
I believe it has a back on it, covered with a fabric, perhaps of satin.我认为它有一个后靠背，覆盖着一层布料，也许是丝。
Now, generally. (Pause.) Some kind of misrepresentation. Dr. Instream feels that something has been misrepresented to him professionally, I believe, on the part of the university or in connection with his work there. (Pause.)现在，大体上。(停顿)某种不实的报导。殷斯翠姆博士感觉他在专业方面被不实的报导，我想，是在大学里或他在那里的工作有关系。(停顿)
A scramble of communications is connected with this, and perhaps of letters crossed in the mail.杂乱的沟通和这件事有关，也许是往来的信件。
Near him now, a miscellany of objects, small ones, some of them white, that look like marble. Perhaps figurines, but they are not marble. (Pause.) A knock on the door. (Pause at 10:20.) This is at his home, and a caller, a male, younger than he, a fairly young male, perhaps a student. (Pause.)现在，在离他很近的地方有混杂的物件，小东西有一些是白色的，看起来像大理石。也许是小雕像，但它们不是大理石的。(停顿)一阵敲门声。(停顿10:20)这是在他的家，一个访客，男性，比他年轻，一个相当年轻的男性，也许是一个学生。(停顿)
Now, do you have a test for me? I will from here on in ask if you have an envelope instead.现在，你们有测验要给我吗？如果你们没有信封要给我，我现在要问问题。
("Yes.”(“有的。”
(It was 10:21. As usual Jane took the experimental envelope, the 31st, from me without opening her eyes. We had decided to call these studies envelope experiments instead of tests. Now Jane sat quietly for a moment; she held the envelope to her forehead as she spoke briefly, then lowered it to her lap.)(现在是10:21。如往常一样，珍闭着眼睛，从我手里接过第31次的实验信封。我们决定要称这个为研究信封实验，而不是测验。现在珍静静地坐了一会儿；当她很简短的说这个的时候，她举着信封抵着前额，然后往下放到她的大腿上。)
There are impressions.有这些印象。
Some connection with a magistrate of some sort.与某种地方执行官有关联。
The numbers three and twelve, and an occurrence that was not repeated.数字3和12，和一件没有重复发生的事。
An afternoon. Many colors. Two men, one taller than the other. Both of them here at one time or another.一个下午。很多颜色。两个男人，一个比另一个高。他们俩个曾一度在这里。
Connection with a note, and money. A sweeping out. The color gray. Strong uprights. Other designs, and numbers in some sort of pattern.和一封短笺还有钱有关联。清扫干净。颜色灰色。坚固的直立物。其他图案，某种数字的图案。
You may take a break.你可以休息。
(Break at 10:28. Jane was dissociated as usual during both experiments. Her eyes had remained closed. She said she wasn’t worried about the results of the experiments, and that nothing she said about them had any personal meaning to her at all.(10:28休息。珍在两个测验期间都出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着。她说她不担心实验的结果，她说的东西没有任何一个对她有个人意义。
(See the tracings of the object on page 258. 59, and the notes on page 260. Most of the data was at once clear to us.(见前面的物件和笔记。大部分资料我们立刻就了解了。
(“Some connection with a magistrate of some sort.” When Jane and I went to the Elmira Bureau of Motor Vehicles to inquire as to why I hadn’t received the license plates I had ordered several weeks prior to mid-January, we found the office very crowded. We stood in line for perhaps fifteen minutes. Then a man I thought to be a policeman entered. I succeeded in talking to him, and saw by his shoulder patch that he was a sheriff.(“和某种地方执行官有关联。”当珍和我到埃尔迈拉汽车监理所去询问，为什么我还没有收到我在一月中旬之前就订的车牌时，我们发现办事处非常拥挤。我们排了大概15分钟的队。然后我认为有一个像是警察的人走了进来。我成功的和他说上了话，而从他肩上的徽章认出他是警长。
(“The numbers three and twelve.” I had ordered my 1966 license plates by mail, on December (twelve) 3rd (three), and had the money order stub with me in case it was necessary to show a record of payment.(“数字3和12。”我用信件在12月3日订了我的车牌号码1966，然后留着汇票存根，以防万一出示付款记录。
(“and an occurrence that was not repeated.” The sheriff told us the bureau was flooded by mail requests for plates and was very much behind; indeed they had just begun filling mail orders a day or so before our visit. The sheriff advised us to return a few days later if we did not receive our plates. Although we didn't receive the plates by the day he mentioned, we did not return to the bureau as he said to do, but chose to wait a little longer; the plates arrived the next week.(“和一件没有重复发生的事。”警长告诉我们，监理所里申请车牌的信件排山倒海而来，所以进度严重落后；他们在我们去的前一两天才开始兑汇票。警长建议我们回去等几天，没有收到车牌再来。虽然等到他说的那天我们还没有收到车牌，我们也没有像他告诉我们的再回去监理所，我们选择再等久一点；下个星期车牌就到了。
(“An afternoon. "Jane and I made our visit to the motor vehicle bureau in the afternoon.(“一个下午。”珍和我是在下午去汽车监理所的。
(“Many colors.” We can think of connections here but do not have enough data. I neglected to ask Seth to elaborate when he resumed.(“很多颜色。”我们在这里可以想到一些连结，但没有足够的资料。当赛斯重新开始的时候，我忘了要求他详细描述一下。
(“Two men, one taller than the other. Both of them at one time or another.” This I felt to be a rather far-removed connection involving myself and the service manager of the Ford garage in town that keeps our car running. He is a friend; visiting us over the Christmas holidays, he urged Jane and me not to wait too long before making personal inquiries at the bureau, to check and see if they had received my application. I am the taller of the two referred to.(“两个男人，一个比另一个高。他们俩个曾一度在这里。”这里我感觉是一个相当遥远的连结，是关于我自己和镇上维修我们车辆的福特修车厂经理。他是一个朋友；他在圣诞节期间来拜访我们，在我们去监理所询问之前，他劝珍和我不要等太久，去确认一下，看看他们有没有收到我的申请书。我是两个中间比较高的那个。
(“Connection with a note, and money. "As stated I ordered the plates by mail, enclosing a money order in payment, on December 3,1965. Since they had not arrived as the holidays approached, I wrote a short letter of inquiry just before Christmas to the bureau. I asked them to answer the letter only if they had not received my application. To help the bureau check I enclosed the number from the money order stub, mentioned the amount of the money order, etc.(“和一封短笺还有钱有关联。”之前说过，我在1965年12月3日用邮件去订了车牌，包含了付款的汇票。因为假期快到了，我还没有收到车牌，在圣诞节去监理所之前，我写了一封询问的短信。我请他们如果没有收到我的申请书，回信给我。为了帮助监理所核对，我附上了汇票存根的号码，提到汇票的金额等等。
(“A sweeping out.” Again, we can think of connections but feel the data too general. I did not ask Seth to elaborate.(“清扫干净。”再次的，我们可以想到一些连结，但觉得这个资料太笼统了。我没有要求赛斯详细说明。
(“The color gray. "As can be seen from the tracings on page 258. 59, the envelope object is half gray on the front, and over two-thirds gray on the back.(“颜色灰色。”可以由前面的素描看到，信封物件的正面有一半是灰色，而背面超过三分之二是灰色。
(“Strong uprights. Other designs.” The leaflet is designed effectively in a simple bold upright or vertical format. The lines of type indicated in a pen line on the tracing are actually printed in a heavier, boldface block lettering. We suppose other designs is a reference to the various signs shown on the leaflet; in the past Seth has referred to lettering or type as designs, also.(“坚固的直立物。其他图案。”这个小册子实际上是以一种简单、大字的直立格式设计的。在纸上的字是以深色、粗体的方形字母印的。我们认为其他图案指的是小册子上显示的高速公路标志；在过去赛斯有说字型或打字算是图案。
(“and numbers in some sort of pattern.” In the lower right hand corner of the back of the leaflet is a series of numbers, code numbers referring to date of printing, etc.(“某种数字的图案。”在小册子背面的右下角有一连串的数字，数字的编码指的是印刷日期等等。
(Jane was pleased with the test results. As stated, the envelope object had good emotional connections for both of us, with the added connection of the dream material mentioned on page 260. The dream material was not specifically mentioned by Seth, however. It will be noted that his data moved between the fact of our being strongly concerned about the license plates, and the experimental object itself, which was picked up as the focal point of our concern.(珍对测验结果很满意。之前提过，这个信封物件跟我们两个有很强的情感连结，和前面提到的梦资料有连结。不过，梦的资料并不是赛斯特别提起的。值得注意的是，他的资料改变了，在我们非常关注的车牌和作为关注焦点拿起的实验物件本身之间。
(Janes eyes began to open when she resumed, while smoking, at a faster pace at 10:32.)(珍在10:32分以较快的速度重新开始时，她在抽烟而且眼睛开始睁开。)
I will close the session for your convenience.缺
You may give Ruburt a pat on the back, for all in all he deserves it.你可以鼓励鲁柏一下，这是他应得的。
Now I will continue with the session if you request me to do so, or I will close it to give you a rest.现在如果你们要求我继续这节课，我会继续，否则我要结束让你们休息了。
(“You might as well continue then. ")(“你可以继续。”)
Since we covered some of our own material quite well this evening, I will add a few comments here on other matters.因为我们今晚涵盖了一些非常棒的资料，我要在这里对其他问题加一些评论。
(Seth now refers to the unscheduled230th session of February 6, in which Jane gave the predictions for the ages of death for herself, the Gallaghers, and me.)(赛斯现在指的是2月6日第230节的临时课，在这些课里，珍预测了她自己、加拉格夫妇和我的死亡年纪。)
Now, Ruburts subconscious simply got in our way at last evening’s session. Now and then it is to be expected, but I regret the particular circumstances deeply. He was subconsciously but never consciously aware that next month marked the time of his grandfather's death, and subconsciously he knew his grandfathers age at death.现在，在昨晚的课里，单纯是鲁柏的潜意识阻碍了我们。有时候这是意料中的，但我对这个特殊的情况感到很后悔。他潜意识，但不是意识上觉知到下个月是他外公的忌日，而潜意识里他知道他外公的年纪。
When I gave my material it was meant to be reassuring. This was my intent. But when I tried to give information regarding Ruburt, the subconscious activity interrupted. We had his identification with his grandfather momentarily, and the subsequent distortion.当我给这个资料的时候，我的用意是希望他安心。这是我的意图。但当我试着给关于鲁柏的讯息时，被潜意识的活动给打断了。我们马上有了他对他外公的认同，和接下来的扭曲。
(Janes grandfather died at the age of 67. During last night's session she gave this age for her own life span, and said I would live to be 87. The Gallaghers are also to live into their eighties. Later Seth corrected the distorted data, telling us Jane too would live that long.)(珍的外公死于67岁。在昨晚课里，她说她会活到67岁，我会活到87岁。加拉格夫妇也会活到80几岁。后来赛斯更正这个扭曲的资料，告诉我们，珍也会活到那么久。)
All the particular information given was indeed based upon probability. However, unless drastic changes occur in all of your characteristic ways of handling stress, then the relatively old ages mentioned should stand up well.所有这些特定讯息确实都是建立在可能性上的。不过，除非你们因为应付历力的独特方式有剧烈的改变，否则上面提到的年纪是经得住考验的。
I would apologize to Ruburt, but the distortion was not my own. I do deeply regret it however. I also think that you will find his attitude from now on an improvement over his past attitude, as far as our experiments are concerned, and this will be of benefit to all of us.我对鲁柏道歉，但这并不是我自己的扭曲。不过我对此深深的感到后悔。就我们的实验而言，我认为你也发现了，他现在的态度和过去的态度相比是有进步的，而这对我们所有人都是有利的。
It will also mean that the experimental results will be of like quality, to some degree. That is, after a vacation from experiments he will not be nervous and distort data.这也代表了实验的结果到某种程度是大同小异的。在休息了几次没有做实验之后，他也没那么紧张和扭曲资料了。
The yoga discipline is helping him more than he realizes. He need not try to force himself into any sort of strained spirituality. He is intuitively aware of more than he knows.瑜伽的自律性帮助他比他以为的更多。他不需要强迫自己进入任何勉强的灵性，他直觉上了解的比他知道的更多。
Do you have any questions for me?你们还有任何问题要问我吗？
(“Will you explain the references to the two men, in the envelope experiment tonight?")(“你能解释一下今晚这信封实验里，那两个男人的关联吗?”)
That was indeed our weak point, and since we were doing well I did not press it. You were the taller man, and your garage man was the short one. I let this go since we were doing well enough without pressing Ruburt.这的确是我们的弱项，而因为我们做得不错，我不会再给你压力。你是比较高的男性，而修车人员是比较矮的那个。因为我们做得够好，我不想给鲁柏压力，就让它过去。
This has been an excellent session in many respects. My heartiest good wishes to you both.在很多方面这都是一节很棒的课。我对你们俩衷心的祝福。
Ruburt should trust and rely upon his intuitional nature, for it is sturdier and more reliable than he knows.鲁柏应该相信且依赖他直觉的本质，它比他所知的更为坚定可信。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:47. Jane was dissociated as usual. The last line of the session sums up pretty well . Jane 's new attitude concerning the sessions, experiments, etc. Actually the attitude is not new; both of us have been aware of the point made for a long time. The recent difference seems to be that Jane is evidently able to put the realization into effect more efficiently now.)(10:47结束。珍出离如常。这一节的最后一行把珍对课、实验等等的新态度总结得很好。事实上，这个态度并不是新的；我们都觉知到这一点很久了。最近的不同似乎是珍现在明显地把这种理解更有效的应用在结果上。)
(Tracings of the black & white Polaroid, photo of myself used in the 32nd envelope experiment, in the 232nd session for February 9,1966.)用在1966年2月9日第232节第32次信封实验，我的黑白照

SESSION 232 第232节 可能性系统 可能性事件 信封32


FEBRUARY 9, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1966年2月9日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(The 32nd envelope experiment was held during the session. The object was a black and white Polaroid photo, taken of myself by a coworker in September 1960, at my desk at the Artistic Card Co. in Elmira. The older individual in the left background of the photo, Ezra Havens, figures in the envelope data, also. The friend who took the photo caught me by surprise during a lunch hour; hence my position in the act of stretching, and the startled expression.(第32次信封实验在今晚的课举行。物件是一张黑白的拍立得照片，是1960年9月，一个同事在埃尔迈拉艺术街卡公司，我的书桌前帮我拍的。照片背景的左边那位比较年长的人，伊若•海文[Ezra Havens]也在信封资料里。照相的朋友在午餐时抓住我惊讶的瞬间；因此我的姿势是在伸懒腰，而表情很惊吓。
(I placed the photo between the usual two pieces of Bristol and then sealed it in the usual double envelope. This photo had laid in my files for several years. Jane had seen it a long time ago, I knew, but certainly not recently. Since it was a photo of me I felt it would have an emotional attraction for her.(我把照片放进两张纸板中间，然后放进普通信封里封好。这张照片在我的档案夹里好多年了。我知道珍很久以前曾看过，但绝对不是最近。因为这是一张我的照片，所以我觉得对她应该会有一种情感上的吸引力。
(For the record: In the 227th and 228th sessions Seth discussed the book of poetry Jane produced so quickly by using suggestions for abundant energy, and told us the book would be published. Jane had also finished the first third of her book on the Seth material itself and felt it ready to send out.(记录：在第227和228节，赛斯讨论到鲁柏运用暗示来使用充沛的能量，很快地完成了诗集，而且告诉我们书要出版了。珍也完成了三分之一赛斯书，而且觉得可以寄出去了。
(On Tuesday, February 8, she telephoned her publisher, Frederick Fell, in New York City. She read a few of the poems from the book to Mr. Fell over the phone and outlined her ideas for its humorous format, etc.; to her surprise he requested that she send him the manuscript for consideration. Jane had not been aware that he would consider poetry. Mr. Fell also asked to see the manuscript on the Seth material, and told Jane some of the plans he had for publicizing her ESP book, due to be published this May. The publicity may include adds in the New York Times Book Review; surveys taken by the publisher show the book should have a good reception and sale. Mr. Fell also told Jane she may appear on some radio and/or TV shows; this has been Janes idea also. Summing up, the publisher told Jane that once the ESP book is on the market and her name begins to be known through publicity, it will help the sales of future books considerably—namely the Seth material.(在2月8日星期二，她打电话在纽约市的出版商佛德瑞克•费尔。她在电话中念了一小段书里的诗给费尔听，而且概述了一下她对它幽默的想法等等；出乎意料的，费尔先生要求她寄手稿让他考虑一下。珍不知道他会考虑诗集。费尔先生也要求看赛斯资料的手稿，并且告诉珍，他对于她将在5月出版的ESP书的宣传计划。宣传可能包括把书加进《纽约时报》的新书评论里；出版社的意见调查显示，这本书应该会被接受而且卖得不错。费尔先生也告诉珍，她可能会出现在一些广播或电视秀里；这也是珍的主意。总结，出版商告诉珍一旦ESP书上市了，她的名字就会透过宣传开始为人所知，这会对以后书的销量帮助很大——也就是赛斯书。
(Mr. Fell asked Jane to make a tape of her poems to send along with the manuscript, since he enjoyed her telephone reading. This was done this afternoon. The tape, the poetry book, and the Seth material will be mailed Thursday. Jane will be waiting to hear.(费尔先生要求珍把她的诗录成一卷录音带，和手稿一并寄过去，因为他很享受她的电话朗读。这件事在今天下午已经办好了。录音带，诗集和赛斯资料星期四会寄到。珍会等着回音。
(Last Friday Jane received a letter from Fate Magazine, to the effect that they would like to see, on speculation, an article dealing with Seth and the envelope experiments.(上周五珍收到一封来自《命运杂志》的信，估计他们是想看到一篇有关于赛斯和信封实验的文章。
(The session was held in our front room. Jane began speaking rather slowly, with pauses. Her hands were raised to her closed eyes and she was not smoking.)(这节课在我们前面的房间举行。珍一开始说话时很慢，伴随着停顿。她的手举到她闭着的眼睛上，没有抽烟。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now, I wanted to make a few remarks concerning the unscheduled session which occurred.现在我想要对刚上完的临时课做一些评论。
(This would be last Sundays unscheduled 230th session, during which Jane gave data on our life spans and those of Bill and Peggy Gallagher. It developed that some of this material was distorted.)(这说的是上星期日第230节的临时课，珍在这节课里给了有关我们，比尔和蓓·加拉格会活到几岁的资料。后来的发展是，有些资料是扭曲的。)
There is a fine discrimination used in our sessions. There is indeed a tuning into, a reception of frequencies. Now it is extremely difficult to lock in here. There is a pulsation always occurring. It is difficult for Ruburt to maintain steadily that particular reception of frequency, and within certain limits there is sometimes a slipping in and out, so that now and then Ruburts personal subconscious is allowed to intrude. This is what happened the other evening.在我们课里有一个运作上的细微差别。的确有一个对接收频率的调频。要把频率锁定在这里是非常困难的。总是有律动会发生。对鲁柏来说，要稳定地保持特定频率的接受是很困难的，在某个范围里，有时候会有岔进和岔出，因此有时候鲁柏的个人潜意识会侵入。这正是那一晚所发生的。
I am going to ask you to wait a moment while the kitchen window is closed, as the traffic is disturbing Ruburt.我要求你们等厨房窗户关上后再开始，因为外面的交通噪音干扰了鲁柏。
(Break at 9:06. Janes eyes opened and she was out of trance. I too had been aware of the traffic noise, although I had pulled our kitchen window closed, I thought, before the session. I now latched it tightly, which helped, and pulled the curtains over it to further deaden the sounds.(9:06休息，珍的眼睛睁开，且离开了出离状态。我也注意到了交通噪音，虽然在课前我已经把厨房的窗户关上了。我现在把窗户紧紧锁上，这有帮助，然后为了进一步杜绝噪音，我把窗帘拉起来。
(Seth began talking about pulsations in the very early sessions, the 12th among others. He added more material on such frequencies along with the data on the inner senses, by the 50th session; then elaborated further in the material on the electrical universe, given in the sessions from 122 on. See Volumes I through 3.(赛斯开始提到律动是在很早的课里，大概第12节左右。他在第50节加了很多关于这种内在感官频率的资料；然后从第122节更进一步的开始详述了电子宇宙的资料。见第一至第三册。
(Jane now resumed, still with pauses, at 9:07.)(现在珍停顿着，在9:07重新开始。)
The information which you have been receiving, and which you will continue to receive, will be of great benefit, not only to yourselves but to others. Ruburts present book on the subject, on our Seth material, will indeed be published, and meet with success.你们到目前为止所接受的讯息，还有你们继续会接受到的讯息，不止对你们，而且对其他人都有很大的帮助。鲁柏现在有关这个主题的书，我们的赛斯资料，确实会出版，而且会很成功。
He is obviously drawing upon knowledge that is beyond his own conscious abilities. Now much of it would, and is, theoretically available to each human being; but practically of course things simply do not work that way. He is reaching beyond his own personal subconscious, for while the personal subconscious does have definite knowledge unknown to the conscious mind, it also has definite limits.他很明显的吸引到超过他自己意识能力以外的知识。大部分这些知识，理论上来说是每个人都可以得到的；但当然实际上事情没有这么简单。他所触及的超过了他自己的个人潜意识，个人潜意识会有明确的知识是不为有意识的心智所知的，因为它也有明确的界线。
Information received must however be sifted through the subconscious. We are managing now in such a way that our material survives without undue coloration from the subconscious. The whole process is a complicated one, but the very act of holding the sessions is of great benefit to the organism as a whole. For the vibrations and frequencies which are received in order to make our communications possible, are also most beneficial in themselves to the human and psychic system.不过接受到的讯息必须从潜意识里筛过。我们现在努力完成的，就是让我们的资料存活下来而不会被潜意识过度着色。这整个过程是很复杂的，但持续这些课的这种行为对整个有机体来说有很大的助益。因为，为了让我们的沟通成为可能而接受到的震动和频率，它们本身对人类和心灵系统也是最有益的。
They are quite literally healing. I mention this in particular to explain to Ruburt the reason for our Jesuit’s comments the other evening. I had intended however to make the point clear earlier in any case.它们实际上是非常疗愈的。我特别提到这一点，是为了解释给鲁柏听那一晚耶稣会信徒为什么会有这个评语。无论如何，我打算早一点把这点说清楚。
(Before the unscheduled 230th session of last Sunday, Bill Gallagher had surprised Jane by telling her he thought she possessed healing ability. Seth discussed this ability in the 185th session, and he referred to it briefly in a few others.)(在上星期日第230节临时课之前，珍很惊讶地听到比尔·加拉格说，他认为她具有疗愈能力。赛斯在第185节讨论过这个能力，他也在其他节里短暂的提过。)
The book of poetry which Ruburt has just completed can also be taken as tangible proof that he is in the process of learning how to use energy in such a way that it can be most beneficially used psychically, but also with very practical results. He will find that this ability will grow.鲁柏刚完成的诗集也可以作为一个真实的证明，他正在这个学习过程里，学习如何以这种方式使用能量，而能量可以被心灵最有益的运用且得到非常实际的效果。他将会发现这个能力会继续成长。
It will also be developed on your part as you let it develop, Joseph, and in your own work. Spontaneity must be allowed for in this respect. You should give yourself the suggestions that I mentioned earlier, consistently. Do you recall the suggestions?约瑟，在你的部分，和你自己的工作上，如果你让它成长，它也会成长。在这个方面，你必须允许自发性运作。你要持续的给你自己我之前提过的暗示。你记得这个暗示吗？
(“Yes. I’ve already started using them.”(“是的，我已经开始使用它们了。”)
(See the 228th session.)(见第228节。)
They are potent. They will help you, not only to do the excellent painting that you desire, but to do so in such a way that others will be benefited, and you be financially rewarded.它们是强而有力的。它们会帮助你，不只是画出你想要的优秀作品，而且以这种方式这么做，其他人也会受益，而你会在财务上得到回报。
In his previous poetry, as a rule. Ruburt was not reaching deeply enough.在他过去的诗集里，通常，鲁柏触及的不够深。
I wanted to make these comments, and do suggest that at least a portion of a session a month be concerned with the state of your psychic and physical circumstances, for there are possibilities here from which you are not yet fully benefiting.我想要评论一下，而且我真的要建议你们一个月至少一次，把一节课的部分时间用来关注你心灵和物质的境况，因为这里还有你未能完全得益的可能性。
(“How about the first session following the first of each month?”)(“每个月第一周的第一节怎么样？”)
That will be fine.那样很好。
Now. Some of the information that I gave you in our last session, concerning the portions of the self, seem rather alien, I am sure. Do not forget however that you are not even aware of many portions of the self that you know intellectually do exist. So it is not so strange to imagine other portions of the self with which you are not at all familiar in any conscious way.现在。上一节课里我给你们一些有关自己那部分的讯息，我想这似乎对你们相当的陌生。不过不要忘了，你甚至还不觉知到自己的很多部分，那是你理智上已经知道存在的。所以去想像以任何知觉方式都不熟悉的那些自己的其他部分，也就没有那么奇怪了。
The workings of any cell within your physical body would strike you as quite alien. Its ways of perception are different. Each cell is an intimate part of your reality, and yet consciously you are not as familiar with it as you are with the rug upon your floor.你物质身体里的任何细胞可能会像个陌生人般的攻击你。它感知的方式是不同的。每一个细胞都是你实相的一个密切部分。但意识上你熟悉它们的程度，还远不及你家地板上的一块小毯子。
The self enclosed within the physical system is indeed only a small portion of the whole self. The portion that deals with probabilities is as much a part of you as any cell within your physical body. It simply deals with different kinds of reality, and so does the cell.被包围在物质系统里的自己确实只是全我的一小部分。处理可能性的这部分和你物质身体里的任何细胞，都同样是你自己的一部分。它只是处理不同种类的实相，而细胞也是这样。
I will suggest a brief break and we will continue.我建议一个短暂的休息，然后我们继续。
(Break at 9:30. Jane had been dissociated as usual. The traffic noise had not bothered her any more. Her pace had picked up; her eyes had opened briefly, quite often, and had been very dark. She had smoked a cigarette after the interruption.(9:30休息。珍出离如常。交通噪音已经不再干扰她了。她的速度慢慢恢复；她的眼睛常常短暂地睁开，而且眼神非常深邃。在被打断之后，她抽了一支烟。
(She resumed in the same manner at 9:41.)(她以同样的方式在9:41重新开始。)
Now. This system of probabilities is quite as real and actual as the system with which you are familiar, and you exist in it whether or not you realize it.现在。可能性的系统和你所熟悉的这个系统是同样的真实和实际，而不管你有没有意识到，你都活在其中。
You simply are not focused within it, or your attention is not focused within it. You sometimes become aware of it when you are in the dream state. Now I have told you that these images have a reality, beside an imaginative reality.你只是没有聚焦在它上面，或者说，你的注意力没有聚焦在它上面。当你在做梦时，有时候你会觉知到它。我曾告诉过你们，这些印象除了是一个想像的实相，它们也都有一个实相。
(This discussion began in the 41st session. See Volume 1.)(这个讨论从第41节开始，见第一册。)
Now, probabilities exist in the same manner. They simply are not concrete for you, as dreams are not concrete for you. You may dream for example of holding an apple, then wake up and the apple is gone. This does not mean that the apple did not exist. It simply means that in the waking state you are not aware of its reality. You do not experience it, or perceive it. In the same manner you do not perceive or experience physically the actuality of probable events.现在，可能性以同样的方式存在。它们对你来说不是具体的，就像梦对你来说也不是具体的。例如，你可能梦见握着一个苹果，然后醒来苹果就不见了。这并不代表这个苹果不存在。它只是代表了在醒时的状态，你没有觉知到它的实相。你没有经验它，或感知它。以同样的方式，你没有物质上的感知或经验到可能事件的真实。
Now a portion of you may be quite involved in these probable events. Another portion of yourself therefore is concerned here, and a portion with which you are not ordinarily familiar.现在你的一部分可能相当涉入这些可能性的事件。因此你自己的另一部分也在这里关切着，但那是你平常不熟悉的一部分。
The system of probabilities is not as easily perceived even as those events that exist within the dream state, for with these you are familiar, while you are in the dream state. Often the ego is even made aware of dream events. Now the self that is the I of your dreams can quite legitimately be compared to the self that experiences probable events.可能性的系统并不如那些存在于梦境中的事件那么容易被感知到，因为当你在梦的状态，这是你比较熟悉的。通常自我更觉知到梦的事件。现在那个自己，你们梦里的那个我，可以十分合理的相比于那个经验着可能性事件的自己。
(Janes pace had become much slower by now. She used many pauses, some of them quite long as she sat quietly with her eyes closed.)(珍的速度现在变得非常慢。她有很多停顿，有一些十分长，而她会眼睛闭着，静静地坐着。)
For that matter, some intuitive understanding of the inverted time system can be achieved through a study of time as it appears to the dreamer.就此而言，一些直觉性的、对倒置时间系统的了解，可以透过一个做梦者对时间的研究来达到。
Let us consider the following. The individual within your system—and this is quite simplified—an individual finds himself with a choice of three actions. He chooses one of these and experiences it within the physical field. The other two actions are experienced however, but not within the physical system. The results of the other two actions are perceived by the inner ego.让我们思考一下下面的内容。在你们系统里的一个人——这是非常简化的说法——这个人发现他有三种行动的选择。他选择其中的一种，并且在物质的场域里经验它。不过其他两种行动也被经验了，但不是在物质的系统。其他两种行动的结果被内在自我所感知。
The results are then checked by the inner ego against the action that was chosen for actuality within the physical system. These results are then sent to certain portions of the subconscious, where through this information knowledge is gained as to whether or not the ego and the subconscious made the best decision under the circumstances.这个结果被内在自我所审核，然后参照那在物质系统选择成为事实的行动。这些结果被送到潜意识的某个部分，透过这部分而得到讯息知识，不管自我和潜意识在这个情况下是否做出最好的决定。
The results are retained, to be checked against future decisions, and to be used by the physical self as an aid in making future decisions. The probable actions were definitely perceived and experienced however, and these experiences make up the existence of this other portion of the self, as indeed dream actions make up the experience and existence of the dream self, or of the I as it exists within the dream state.这些结果被保留，以便和未来的决定做核对，而且在物质自己做未来的决定时能当成一种辅助。无论如何，这些可能性的行动确实被感知且经验了，而这些经验组成了这个自己其他部分的存在，就如同梦的行动的确组成了这个梦自己的经验和存在，或那个存在于梦的状态的我。
Now through hypnosis it has been ascertained that this dreaming I has memory of its past existence, which is made up of past dreams. You may call this the dreaming personality if you prefer, but it amounts to another self. Now the I who experiences probable events, not chosen for experience in the physical universe, has the same kind of identity and memory as this dream self. There is a constant subconscious interchange of information between these portions of the self.现在通过催眠它可以被探知，这个做梦的我有着它过去存在的记忆，是由过去的梦所组成的。如果你喜欢的话，你可以称这个是梦中人格，但它等同于另一个自己。现在，没有选择在物质宇宙里经验的，这个经验着可能性事件的我，有着和这个梦的自己同样的身分和记忆。在自己的这些部分之间，有着持续的潜意识讯息的交换。
If you must think in layers to make this clearer, then this probable self would exist on the other side of the subconscious from the ego.如果你必须以层面来想才能搞清楚的话，这个可能性的自己存在于自我潜意识的另一面。
Now I suggest your break.现在，我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:00. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her pace had picked up once more, her eyes had begun to open, and she had smoked a cigarette. The traffic noise hadn’t bothered her.(10:00点休息。珍出离如常。她的速度再度恢复，眼睛开始睁开，而她抽了一支烟。交通噪音不再干扰她。
(It was now time for the 38th Dr. Instream experiment. Once more Jane sat with her hands raised to her temples; her eyes were closed. She spoke with many short pauses, but her pace was not too slow in actuality. Resume at 10:05.)(是时候开始第38次殷斯翠姆博士测验。再次的，珍坐着，她的手举到太阳穴；眼睛闭着。她说话时有很多短暂的停顿，但速度事实上并不慢。10:05重新开始。)
Now. Give us a moment, please.现在。请等我们一下。
A chest of drawers (pause), it seems of grandiose design, and of dark wood. (Pause.) Full size, with a frilly shaded lamp on top. The shade may be pink and fairly transparent.抽屉里的箱子(停顿)，似乎很夸张的设计，深色的木头做的。(停顿)完整的尺寸，有镶边灯罩的灯在上面。灯罩可能是粉红或相当透明的颜色。
An oval rug in front of it, not smooth in texture. A dark-colored wooden bed with high posts. A desk, and a chair by it, at which Dr. Instream sits. (Pause.)它前面有一张椭圆形的地毯，并不是平滑的材质。深色木制的床有着高高的柱子。一张桌子，有一张椅子在旁边，是殷斯翠姆博士坐的。(停顿)
A letter by his hand. The letter is either from somewhere in Nebraska, or has some connection with Nebraska in the contents. (Pause.) It is from a man but there is also a connection with a woman. There is an April date, I believe April 11, in connection with the letter. (Pause.) Having to do with a meeting of many men, and concern over what could be an upsetting element (pause), to upset the meeting.他手边有一封信。这封信或者来自内布拉斯加州(Nebraska)的某处，或是内容与内布拉斯加州有关联。(停顿)信来自一个男人，但也和一个女人有关联。有一个日期是4月，我想是4月11日，与这封信有关。(停顿)和许多人的一次会议有关，而关注的可能是一个令人困扰的因素(停顿)，会议的话题令人困扰。
Some child known to Dr. Instream has measles. Dr. Instream’s throat has been sore. Do you have an envelope for me?殷斯翠姆博士认识的几个孩子得了麻疹。殷斯翠姆博士的喉咙有点疼。你有信封要给我吗？
("Yes. ’’(“是的。”
(It was 10:15. I handed Jane the envelope for our 32nd experiment. As usual she took it from me without opening her eyes, and held it against her forehead throughout. She spoke with many short pauses.)(现在是10:15。我递给珍第32次信封实验的信封。像往常一样，她闭着眼睛，从我手里接过信封，然后自始至终都抵在她的前额上。她说话时有很多短暂的停顿。)
Give us a moment, please. These are impressions.请等我们一下。印象是这些。
A connection with four people, and with February. And with something circular. And here also with an unknown element.和4个人，还有二月有关联。和某种圆形的东西有关。这里也有一个未知因素。
I do not know to what this refers, but a twist, or something twisted. A four. A five six.我不知道这指的是什么，一个扭动，或某个扭动的东西。一个4。一个5 6。
A lifting up. Something rising.一个举起来的。某个升起的东西。
(Ruburt’s impression is of a table next, and you may put this in parenthesis. Also Ruburt’s impression, rounded objects and colored.)(鲁柏接下来的印象是一张桌子，你可以插入这句话。也是鲁柏的印象，圆的物件和彩色的。)
A mine. Two people coming upstairs. Perhaps your stairs.一个矿坑。两个人往上走来。也许是你的楼梯。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:20. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her pace not too slow. While she was giving the envelope data some snow broke loose from a steep third floor roof of the house, and came crashing down on a porch roof not far from our living room; the house shook. Jane heard this, she said, but was not bothered by it. But she now said the earlier interruption caused by the traffic had disturbed her, and she felt she hadn’t been at her best afterwards.(10:20休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，速度并不慢。当她在给信封资料的时候，一些在房子三楼斜屋顶上的雪松动了，砸在了离我们客厅不远的阳台屋顶上；房子震动了一下。珍说她听到了，但没有被它打扰。但现在她说，早先因为交通噪音而中断的事有困扰着她，因此后来她觉得没有在最好的状态。
(See the tracings of the envelope object on page 267, and the notes on page 268. Jane and I could make connections with the object and Seth’s data, and these are noted below as usual. Seth later adds to our interpretations.(见上面信封物件的素描和注记。珍和我可以把赛斯的资料和这个物件做一些连结。这些会和往常一样记录在下面。赛斯后来又增加了一些注释。
(“A connection with four people, ” I felt to be a vague reference to others I worked with at Artistic Card Co., when the photo was taken in 1960. Not specific enough.(“与4个人有关联”，我感觉这模糊的关联指的是和我在艺术卡公司工作的其他人，照片是在1960年拍的。不够具体。
(“February." I thought another vague reference, to the fact that I had just found the envelope object in my files on this day in February 1966.(“2月。”我认为是另一个模糊的关联。我在我的文件夹里发现信封物件的那天，是1966年2月。
(“And with something circular.” to me represented the round bottle of ink showing in the photo on the table beside my drawing board, and to the standard color mixing tray on the drawing board itself; this contains four circular wells.(“与某种圆形的东西有关。”对我而言，这指的是照片里，在桌子上，我的画板旁的圆形墨水瓶，而画板上有一个普通的调色盘；盘里有4个圆形的凹槽。
(“And here also with an unknown element.” referred, in my opinion, to the death of Ezra Havens, shown in the background of the photo. Ezra died of a heart attack in September 1964. Jane of course knew of Ezra 's death although she had never met him; she agreed with me that “an unknown element.” could be a reference to death.(“这里有一个未知因素。”我的想法是，这指的是伊若·海文的死，他有出现在照片里。伊若在1964年9月死于心脏病。珍当然知道伊若的死，虽然她从没见过他；她同意我说的这个“未知因素”可能指的是死亡。
("I do not know to what this refers, but a twist, or something twisted.” referred I thought to myself, caught in the act of stretching in the envelope photo.(“我不知道这指的是什么，一个扭动，或某种扭动的东西。”这里我认为说的是我自己，我在信封的照片里正在伸懒腰。
(“A four. "Jane said this was a reference to the 4 in 42, on the back of the photo in the upper left corner.(“一个4。” 珍说这和42里的4有关联，在照片背面的左上角。
(“A five six.” Note that Jane, or Seth, pronounced these numbers as five six, rather than fifty-six. Nevertheless I felt five six referred to the age of Ezra Havens when the photo was taken in 1960. As stated, Ezra died in 1964. Inquiring at the plant the day after this session, I learned that he had been 60 when he died; this of course made him 56 in 1960. Ezra had a history of heart trouble and his death from this was not unexpected.(“一个5 6。”注明这点，珍或赛斯发音这几个数字时是说5 6，而不是五十六。不过我觉得56指的是1960年拍照时伊若·海文的年纪。之前提过，伊若死于1964年。在这节课过后第二天的询问之下，我知道他死的时候是60岁；所以1960年时他是56岁。伊若有心脏问题的病史，因此他的死并不是意料之外的。
(“A lifting up. Something rising. " Both of us thought this a clear reference to the action of my stretching arms in the envelope photo.(“一个举起来的，某个升起的东西。”我们两个都认为这很明显是指我在信封照片里举起手臂的动作。
(“Ruburts impression of a table...and rounded objects and colored. " In the photo I am sitting at a drawing table. Rounded objects and colored I thought another reference to “something circular .” listed above. The table data brings up another instance of the fine discrimination necessary to Jane in giving such experimental data. She said she had an impression of a table while speaking for Seth; not only this, but of a white table. In the envelope photo it can be clearly seen that my drawing table is covered with white paper, for cleanliness while working. This is still my habit.(“鲁柏的印象是一张桌子……圆形的物件和彩色的。”在照片里，我坐在一张画桌旁边。圆形的物件和彩色的，我认为另一个“某种圆形的东西”已经列在上面了。桌子的资料提供了另一个例子，关于珍给这些实验资料时，细微区辨力的必要性。她说当她为赛斯说话的时候，她有一张桌子的印象；不只这样，那是一张白色的桌子。在信封里可以很清楚的看到，我的画桌上覆盖着一层白布，是为了工作时的干净。这仍然是我的习惯。
(However, we also have a small coffee table in our apartment, and it is painted white. Jane said she thought of this table while speaking for Seth, yet knew it wasn't the right table. To avoid confusion in speaking the data she omitted the adjective white.(不过，在我们的公寓里也有一张小咖啡桌，是漆成白色的。珍说当她为赛斯说话的时候，她想到的是这张桌子，但知道它不是正确的桌子。为了避免说资料时的混淆，她省略了形容词“白色的”。
(“A mine.” This is interesting also. Speaking this word, Jane said, she had an impression of being underground, while not being specifically in a location such as a coal mine for instance. She was aware of sides of rocky earth, with the rocks visible . The sides were rather close together. Consciously of course Jane knows Ezra Havens is dead and buried. But while giving the data she had no impressions of Ezra. Looking back, she thinks she might have been trying to get at the impression of a grave while skirting around it. She remembers that she was going to elaborate on the mine impression by using the word underground; but instead of doing so she went on to the next impression.(“一个矿坑。”这也很有趣。珍说，她说这个字的时候，她有一个在地下的印象，但并不特定指煤矿这样的地方。她觉察到岩石洞穴的壁面，看得到石块。壁面相当的靠近。意识上，珍当然知道伊若·海文已经死了、埋葬了。不过当她给这资料的时候，并没有收到伊若的印象。往回看，她认为她可能试着得到墓地周围的印象。她记得她当时想用“地下”这个字来描述这矿坑的印象；但她没有这么做，继续说下一个印象。
(“Two people coming upstairs. Perhaps your stairs. "No one came up the stairs of our apartment house while this data was being given. The art room at Artistic, where the envelope photo was taken, is located on the second floor. Since the photo was taken at noon it is possible people were using the stairs at the end of the hall. But the impression is too vague.(“两个人往上走来，也许是你的楼梯。”在说这个资料的时候，并没有人走楼梯上我们的公寓。在信封照片拍摄的地方，艺术卡的画室，是位于二楼。因为照片是在中午拍的，所以有可能有人走楼梯。但这个印象太笼统了。
(Jane now said she puts herself “in the hands of whoever or whatever possesses these abilities” during such experiments, and tries to stay out of the way of what will happen.(珍现在说，她在这些实验期间，她把自己交到“不管是谁，不论拥有这些能力的是什么”的手上，试着不要挡路，看看会发生什么。
(She was now smoking, and her eyes began to open at brief intervals, when she resumed at 10:37.)(她现在抽着烟，她的眼睛开始短暂的睁开，在10:37重新开始。)
Now we will shortly end our session.现在我们很快要结束这一节了。
Ruburt was correct. He was not at his best this evening. However he did very well for me. In the past when he was not at his best, we simply could not get this much legitimate information through. He is operating in a more efficient manner, and his attitude of late is of great benefit to us.鲁柏是对的。他今晚不在最佳状态。不过他仍然为我做得非常好。过去当他不在最佳状态时，我们是无法得到这么多合理讯息的。他以更有效率的方式运作，而且他最近的态度对我们是绝大的帮助。
The mine was a case where he was not quick enough. I gave him the underground impression, but he did not translate this into grave, simply because he does not like graves.矿坑是一个例子，这里他还不够快。我给他地下的这个印象，但他没有把这转译为墓穴，很简单，因为他不喜欢墓穴。
(Jane's eyes opened and she smiled.)(珍的眼睛睁开而她微笑。)
The fifty-six did refer to the man’s age.56的确是指这个男人的年龄。
Ruburts explanation of the table was correct. I did give him the white table, but he confused it with the white table in your room, knew that this was not the table to which I referred, made the correct distinction, but thought that the white indication did not belong.鲁柏对桌子的解释是正确的。我的确给他的是白色的桌子，但他把它和你们家那张白色的桌子搞混了，他知道那不是我指的桌子，做了一个正确的区辨，但以为白色的形容是错的。
My heartiest wishes to you both, and I hope, Joseph, that you make a habit of giving yourself the suggestion which I advised. If you do this regularly you will be amazed, as Ruburt was, at the results.我衷心地祝福你们俩，而约瑟，我希望你能按照我的建议，开始培养一个对自己暗示的习惯，如果你们定期的开始这么做，你和鲁柏会很惊讶那个结果。
Your fortunes are taking a turn for the better, as I told you that they would. The turn however is a result of development on your parts, and the development will accelerate now that it has reached a certain level, with of course continued application on your parts.你的运气会变得更好，就如我所告诉你的那样。不过这个转向是你自己发展的结果。这个发展现在会加速，当它达到了某种程度，当然就能继续应用在你自己身上。
And now good evening. You are making your lives much more pleasant for yourselves.而现在晚安。你们把你们的生活变好了。
("Yes. Good night, Seth.”(“是的。晚安，赛斯。”，
(End, presumably, at 10:45. As we sat talking I told Jane that Seth had discussed some of the points mentioned in the envelope data, but that since he said good night I didn’t press for more information. Yet I had the feeling Seth would continue, if Jane were willing. She said she was, and resumed at 10:46.)(大概10:45结束。当我们坐着说话的时候，我告诉珍，赛斯讨论了一些信封资料提到的重点，但因为他说了晚安，我就没有再问更多讯息了。我有一种感觉如果珍愿意的话，赛斯会继续。她说她可以，而在10:46重新开始。)
Very well then, we shall. The twisting was distortive, having to do with the motion of the body. Ruburt translated this into a dancing motion, you see.非常好，我们应该这么做。这个扭动是一个扭曲，和身体的那个动作有关。鲁柏把这转译成一个跳舞的动作。
The February was simply insufficient data, for it did refer to your coming across the item, and that was all. Ruburts new attitude here will allow much clearer perception.2月仅仅是一个不充分的资料，它的确指的是你找到这东西的日子，就只是这样。这里鲁柏新的态度会允许更多更清晰的感知。
(“What about the connection with four people?”)(“4个人的关联是什么？”)
There were, shortly before, four people in the room.这只是指以前有4个人在那个房间里。
(“Just before the picture was taken?”(“在拍照之前吗？”
(Remember, the envelope photo was taken in I960.)(记得吗，这信封照片是在1960年拍的。)
Indeed. And two others, who had been in the room, were on the stairway.未知因素的确指的是这个人迫近的死亡，当然当时是不为人知的。
(This is a reference to the last bit of envelope data.缺
(“What about the reference to an unknown element?”)缺
The unknown element did refer to the man’s imminent death, that was not known of course at that time.缺
(Note that Seth’s idea of our time is quite different from our own at times. The photo was taken in 1960, and Ezra died in 1964; we do not call a four-year wait imminent. At various times Seth has told us his idea of time may not coincide with ours. Without going into details I recall a prediction of his that was to materialize “soon.” It did materialize, but six months later.(注意到，赛斯对我们时间的概念有时候和我们自己的不一样。这张照片是在1960年拍的，而伊若是在1964年死的；我们不会称4年的时间是迫近。有很多次赛斯告诉我们，他对时间的概念可能和我们是不一致的。不说细节，但我记得他曾说过一个预言会“很快”的实现。它的确实现了，但是在6个月以后。
(“What did you mean by the something circular reference?”)(“你指的某个圆形的东西是什么？”
That was explained later in the data. Later on we made that clear.这晚一点会解释，晚一点我们会说得更清楚。
(This involved my ink bottle, the mixing tray for color on my desk in the photo, etc.(这和我的墨水瓶、在照片里我桌上的调色盘有关等等。)
(“That takes care of that then, Seth.”(“那就是了，赛斯。”
(Jane now took a long pause at 10:51. Her eyes were closed.)(珍在10:51有一个长的停顿。她的眼睛闭着。)
I would add here, once more, that during our sessions your physical organism is automatically allowed greater healing abilities. It is easier for the physical organism to utilize energy in order to make any desirable adjustments.我要在这里再说一遍，在我们上课期间，你们的物质有机体会自动地允许更大的疗愈能力。它会让物质有机体更容易地利用能量去做最好的调适。
(“Why do I sometimes feel sleepy during sessions?")(“为什么在上课期间我有时候会很想睡觉？”)
For several reasons. For one thing, obviously your attention is detached to some degree from other activities.有几个原因。一个明显的原因是你的注意力会某程度脱离了其他活动。
There is even in your case some lowering of blood pressure, for example.例如，甚至在你的状况，你的血压会有些降低。
(“I've often wondered if I go into a light trance myself？”)(“我常常怀疑我自己是不是进入了一种轻度的出离状态。”)
Also. You make certain automatic adjustments in order to perceive what little of my presence that you do perceive. And I also have a calming effect on you, which is most beneficial to you.还有。你做了某种自动的调适，是为了去感知你的确感知到我淡淡的存在。然后我对你也有一个镇定的效果，这是对你最有益的。
(“Does this effect apply to anyone witnessing sessions?”)(“这个效果也适用于其他参与课的人吗？”)
Under most circumstances, and according to their attitude. The benefits would always be there, whether or not they were taken advantage of. To some extent this effect lingers, and is part of your psychic framework, or rather environment.在大部分状态是这样，但会根据他们的态度而有所不同。助益永远是在那儿，不管它们有没有被利用到。到某种程度，这个效果会继续保存着，而成为你心灵架构甚至是你环境的一部分。
Now I shall close the session or continue as your prefer.现在我要结束了，或者你想要继续。
(“I guess were ready to close.”)(“我想我们准备好要结束了。”)
Once again then my heartiest wishes to you both.再次的，我对你们俩衷心的祝福。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:58. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed. Her pace had been average.)(10:58结束。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，速度适中。)
(Tracing of the wedding announcement used in the 33rd envelope用在1966年2月14日第233节第33次信封实验的结婚喜帖素描
experiment, in the 233rd session for February 14,1966.)第233节 可能的自己 信封33

SESSION 233 FEBRUARY 14, 1966 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED 1966年2月14日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课


(The 33rd envelope experiment was held during the session. I trimmed down the front page of the wedding announcement of my niece, placed it between two pieces of Bristol and sealed it in the usual double envelope. It is printed in black and the reverse side is blank. It has a blind embossed border as indicated.(第33次信封实验在这节课举行。我剪下我侄女结婚喜帖的封面，把它放进两张纸板中间，然后放进普通信封里封好。它是黑字印刷，背面是空白的。如上面的素描，它有一个隐藏的凸起来的边。
(On the evening of February 2, during the 229th session, Seth said: “You will get no appreciable amount of snow, I believe for ten days or so... ’’See page 254. Seth was correct. Indeed, we began to receive our first appreciable snow within three hours after the ten days were up. This was a very heavy wet snow that began shortly before 1AM Sunday, February 13; it continued until dawn, accumulating about an inch, then turned into a very heavy soaking rain that lasted all day Sunday and on into the night. Jane and I were quite conscious of the prediction Sunday because we had to be traveling. I had been keeping track of it in the meantime, however, and noted that we received a few very light dustings of snow during the ten day interim. Actually, the weather has been so warm that most of the heavy snow received two weeks ago has melted.(在2月2日晚上，第229节课时，赛斯说：“我想在10天内，应该不会有太大量的雪……”。见前面。赛斯是正确的。实事上在第10天过后的3个小时内，下了第一场明显的雪。这一场大雪是在2月13日星期天，快接近凌晨1点时开始下的；雪持续下到黎明，大约累积了一英寸，然后转成超大暴雨，持续了星期天整天，直到晚上。珍和我注意到星期天的预报是因为我们要出远门。我在这期间注意天气，在10天期间，下了薄薄的一层雪。事实上，天气变得非常温暖，把两周以来累积的雪都融化了。
(Saturday night, February 12, Jane had a vivid dream that she believes to be significant, and hoped Seth would discuss it this evening. It is included later in the session.(在2月12日星期六晚上，珍做了一个很逼真的梦，她认为这个梦应该很重要，所以希望赛斯今晚能讨论它。这等下会记录在课里。
(The session was held in our front room. All windows were shut tightly, and the traffic noise was not a problem, although it was audible to some degree. Jane began speaking while sitting down, at 9:01. Her eyes were almost immediately open. Today was Valentine's Day. Jane had been in a good mood, and so was Seth. Jane smiled broadly as she opened the session.)(这节课在我们前面的房间举行。所有窗户都关得紧紧的，所以交通噪音不是问题，虽然还是听得到一些声音。珍坐着，在9:01开始说话。她的眼睛几乎立刻就睁开了。今天是情人节。珍心情很好，赛斯也是。当她开始这节课时，她笑得很灿烂。)
Now good evening, my Valentines.现在，晚安，我的情人们。
(“Good evening, Seth.")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
You did get it in the record that I called you my Valentines, did you not?你们有确实记录下来我称你们是情人的这句话吗？
(“Yes.”)(“有。”)
It will be evidence that I am a sympathetic sort occasionally, and that I can show high humor.这证明了我有时候是很讨人喜欢，而且非常幽默的。
(Jane's eyes now closed. She sobered, and began to speak at a slower pace.)(珍的眼睛现在闭着。她严肃了起来，开始以一种比较慢的速度说话。)
Now. We shall indeed discuss Ruburts dream in good time, when he is not expecting it. For now, I would like to add somewhat to our discussion concerning inverted time and probable events.现在。我们确实应该在鲁柏不预期的情况下，及时讨论他的梦。现在我想要把一些关于倒置时间和可能性事件的内容加进我们的讨论里。
If you recall, we mentioned the fact that the dreaming self has its own memories. It has memories of all of its dream experiences. To you this might mean that it has memory of its past, and indeed to you memory itself is dependent upon the existence of a past, or it is meaningless.如果你记得，我们之前提过，这个梦的自己有它自己的记忆。它有它所有梦经验的记忆。对你来说，这可能意味着它有过去的记忆，而你的记忆本身确实仰赖于过去的存在，否则它是没有意义的。
To the dreaming self however, past, present and future as such do not exist, and yet it has what you term memory. How can this be?不过对梦的自己来说，这种过去、现在和未来是不存在的，可它有着你们所谓的记忆。这是怎么回事呢？
All experience as I have told you is basically simultaneous, and the dreaming self is simply aware of its experiences in their entirety.所有我告诉你们的经验基本上都是同时存在的，而这个梦的自己只是单纯觉知到它整体的经验。
(Seth began to talk about the simultaneity of basic reality in the 41st session, which dealt with the spacious present, see Volume 1.)(赛斯在第41节提到广阔的现在时，有说到基本实相的同步性。见第一册。)
You are not aware of your experiences in their entirety, for you experience events in a consecutive manner. You are therefore aware of your dreams only in a consecutive manner. You are hardly familiar with all of the dream experiences of your dreaming self, and barely familiar with any of their implications. The dreaming self is to some considerable degree conscious of the self which we shall here term the probable self. The probable self is somewhat like a twin self to the dreaming personality, for neither the experiences of the dreaming self nor the probable self occur within the complete radius of physical reality.你们没有觉知到你们整体的经验，因为你们是以一种连续性的方式来经验事件。所以你们只能以一种连续性的方式来了解你们的梦。你们很不熟悉你们梦的自己所有梦的经验，也几乎不了解它们的含义。梦的自己到一个很大的程度，是意识到那个我们称之为可能性的自己。这个可能性的自己有点像这个梦的人格的双胞胎自己，因为不管是这个梦的自己的经验，或是可能性自己的经验，都没有发生在物质实相的整体范围里。
(Jane's voice now began to grow somewhat heavier.)(珍的声音开始有点严肃。)
There is a constant give and take between the probable self and the dreaming self, for much data is received, particularly by the dreaming personality from the probable self, or the self that experiences what the ego would term probable events.可能性的自己和梦的自己之间有一个持续的施与受，这个梦的人格特别从可能性的自己那里收到很多讯息，或这个自己经验了自我称为可能性的事件。
This data is often wound by the dreaming self into a dream drama, which informs the subconscious of dangers, or of the probable success, of any given event which is being considered by the subconscious as suitable for physical actuality.资料常常在梦的自己进入梦的戏剧时就折损了，那些资料包括了通知潜意识危险，或被潜意识考虑适合作为物质的任何真实特定事件可能的成功。
In other words the ego is not familiar with the probable self, but certain portions of the subconscious are. For the subconscious, like the probable self, is aware of its existence in the inverted time system. The subconscious is aware of many realities which are not accepted by the ego as actual physical events, and it reacts to many stimuli of which the ego is completely unaware.换句话说，自我不熟悉可能性的自己，但潜意识的某个部分是熟悉的。潜意识，就像可能性的自己，是知道倒置时间系统的存在的。潜意识知道很多不被自我视为真实物质事件的实相，而它对很多自我完全不知道的刺激起反应。
Again past, present and future are definite realities only to the ego. Memory to the ego presupposes the existence of a past that no longer exists within physical reality. When I say that the dreaming self has memory, therefore, of its dream experiences, I mean that it scans its present existence. It is a simultaneous self.再次的，过去现在和未来只对自我是明确的实相。自我的记忆先假设了过去是不再存在于物质实相中的。因此当我说梦的自己有对它梦经验的记忆时，我指的是它审视了它当下的存在。它是一个同时性的自己。
The same can be said for the probable self. Were it not for the experience of this probable self and for the information which it gives, via the dreaming self to the subconscious, then it would be most difficult for the ego to come to any kind of a decision within the physical universe.这同样也可以适用于可能性的自己。如果不是这个可能性自己的经验和它经由潜意识梦的自己所给的讯息，那么自我将会很困难在物质宇宙里做任何的决定。
The ego does not realize the data that is constantly feeding into it. It cannot afford to, generally, since all its focused energy must be used in the maintenance and manipulation of physical actuality.自我不了解这些持续喂养给它的资料。概括地说，它负担不起，因为它所有专注的能量都必须用来维持和操纵物质的现实。
It will take us many years before all of this information on this particular subject is clear. You must take it for granted also, you see, that this probable self has operated in each incarnation, in each materialization of the whole personality, and has therefore at its command literally millions of probable situations and conditions upon which to make value judgments.把这个特定主题的所有讯息讲清楚会花我们很多年的时间。你知道，这是理所当然的，这个可能性的自己在每一次的转世，在全人格每一次的物质化里运作，因此在它全然的指挥下，在数百万种处境或情况需要下做出价值判断。
(For an idea of the complexity implied here, in Volume 3 see the 88th session, in which Seth goes into the structure of the subconscious to some degree.)(关于这里暗含的复杂概念，见第三册第88节，赛斯在这一节有讨论到一些潜意识的结构。)
Of itself however it does not make these judgments in those terms. The decision as to whether or not a particular probable event should be perceived as a physical one depends, of course, upon the nature of the ego which would then experience it. The probable self does not make the decision, but merely passes on the data which it has received through its own experience with the event.以这样的说法它本身并不做这些判断。至于决定一个可能的事件是否被感知为一个物质的事件，当然是依赖着随后经验它的自我本质。可能性的自己不做这个决定，而只是把透过它对这个事情的经验资料传过去。
The information is sifted often through the dreaming self to the subconscious, which has intimate knowledge of the ego with which it is closely connected. The subconscious makes its own value judgments here, and passes these on to the ego. But then the ego must come to its own decision.这些讯息通常会经过梦自己的筛选而进入潜意识，它有着和它紧密连结的自我的熟悉知识。潜意识在这里会做它自己的价值判断，然后把这些传给自我。然后自我必须做它自己的决定。
In some cases the decision is made by the subconscious. However, for various reasons often the ego will simply refuse to make the decision. Occasionally when a decision has been made by the ego, the subconscious will change it, because the decision is obviously such an unwise one.有些情景是由潜意识来下决定的。不过有不同的原因，通常是自我单纯地拒绝做决定。偶尔，当自我做了决定后，潜意识会改变它，因为这明显的不是一个明智的决定。
The self is far from a simple psychological structure, and your psychologists are barely beginning to have any understanding of what it is.这个自己远远不是一个简单的心理结构，而你们的心理学家对它是什么几乎是毫不了解的。
