I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 9:29. Jane was well dissociated for a first break, she said. Her voice was heavier than usual, and her pace had finally become very fast. After the humorous opening her eyes had remained closed. She had not smoked.(9:29休息。珍说她在第一段出离如常。她的声音比平常低沉，速度最后变得非常快。在幽默的开场后，她的眼睛一直闭着。她没有抽烟。
(Ordinarily, Jane said, she would have had a cigarette during the delivery; but this time she “got the message" that she was not to smoke. It came on a parallel level while she was speaking other words aloud. She felt no force preventing her hand from reaching for a smoke, yet she didn’t feel free to reach for one.(珍说通常她在口述时会抽一支烟；但这次她“收到一个讯息”要她别抽。当她大声说其他事的时候，这个讯息来自一个平行的层面。她并不感觉有力量阻止她去拿烟，但她也不感觉可以自由地去这么做。
(In the 222nd session Seth asked Jane not to smoke during tests. Sometimes seriously but more often humorously, he has gone into the reasons behind Jane's smoking in these sessions: 31, 32, 147, 148, 149, 150, 151, 222.(在第222节赛斯要求，珍不要在测验期间抽烟。有时候是很严肃地说，但大部分时候口气都是幽默的，他在这几节里有提过珍抽烟背后的理由：31、32、147、148、149、150、151、222。
(Jane was smoking when she began speaking again. Now her eyes began to open frequently; they were very dark. Her pace was slower, her voice average. Resume at 9:39.)(当珍再次说话的时候，她正在抽烟。现在她的眼睛开始频繁地睁开；她的眼神深邃，速度慢下来，音量适中。在9:39继续重新开始。)
Now. This probable self can be reached through hypnosis, but only with excellent subjects and an excellent operator.现在。这个可能性的自己可以透过催眠触碰到，但只有在最好的受试者和最好的操作者之下才能办到。
It will often not be recognized for what it is, however, for there will be no evidence in the physical universe to back up its statements. There will not be much of a problem however, since it will not be reached often. It lies, so to speak, on the other side of the subconscious.它们是什么常常无法被承认，因为在物质宇宙里并没有证据去证明它的说法。不过这不是什么大问题，因为它并不常被触碰到。可以这么说，它位于潜意识的另一面。
Its data will agree when taken within its own framework, but this will be the only clue visible at first sight. The probable self, as far as I know, has not yet been reached in any hypnotic experiments. It has been glimpsed however, but not recognized as a separate part of the self, in dream recordings given in analytic sessions.当在它自己的架构被得到时，它的资料会被认可，但这是最初唯一可见的线索。可能性的自己，就我所知，还没有在任何的催眠实验里被触碰到。不过，它曾被瞥见，但它从未在分析课程里以梦的记录被记下来，而以自己的一个分开部分被认出来。
It must be recognized also that these portions of the self exist in each incarnation. In the materialization of personality through various incarnations, only the ego and the layers of the personal subconscious adopt new characteristics. The other layers of the self retain their past experiences, identity and knowledge.也必须了解到的是，自己的这些部分存在于每一次的转世中。在人格透过不同的转世物质化的时候，只有自我和个人潜意识的这层面采用了新的物质。自己的其他层面则保留了它们过去的经验、身分和知识。
The ego receives, in fact, much of its stability because of this subconscious retention. Were it not for past experiences in other lives on the part of deeper layers of the self, the ego would find it almost impossible to relate to other individuals, and the cohesiveness of society would not exist.事实上，自我大部分的稳定性来自于这种潜意识的保留。如果没有其他世的过去经验在自己更深层面的话，自我几乎不可能和其他个体有连结，而社会的凝结力不会存在。
Learning to some extent is indeed passed on through the genes, biochemically, but this is a physical materialization of inner knowledge achieved and retained from past lives. Human beings learn mainly through experience, and the experience is derived from past experience in other existences.到某种程度上，学习的确会透过生物上的基因传递，但这是从过去世达成和保留的内在知识的一种物质显现。人类学习主要是透过经验，而这个经验是由其他世存在的过去经验而来的。
The human organism does not spring full blown, erupt into existence at birth, and laboriously then begin its first attempt to gain experience. If this were the case you would still be back in the stone ages.人类这个有机体并不是透过出生而被突然送入存在，然后费力地开始他第一次的经验累积。如果是这样的话，你们现在还仍然会在石器时代。
Now there are indeed waves of energy, and waves of reincarnational patterns, for there have been many stone ages on your planet, where new identities began their first experience with physical existence, and changed the face of the earth as they progressed.现在这里的确有能量的波和转世模式的波，因为在你们星球上有很多的石器时代，在那里，新的身分开始他们物质存在的第一次经验，而改变了地球进展的样貌。
They changed it in their own individual ways, and not in your ways. But this will be discussed at a much later time. Yet all of this occurs, basically, within the blinking of an eyelid, so to speak, yet all with purpose and with meaning, and based upon achievement and responsibility. Each portion of the self, while independent to some considerable degree, is nevertheless responsible to every other portion of the self, and each whole self, or individuality, is responsible to all others while it is still largely independent as to activity and decision.他们以他们自己个人的方式改变，而不是以你们的方式。但这可以过后再讨论。可以这么说，所有的这些。基本上都在眨眼之间发生，但所有的这些，都带着目的和意义，而奠基在成就和责任上。自己的每一个部分，虽然相当大程度上是独立的，仍然要对自己的其他部分负责，而每一个全我，或个体，要对所有其他的负责，虽然在行动和决定上他们大部分是独立的。
For as many layers of the self compose the whole self, so many selves form a gestalt of which you know relatively little, and of which I am not yet prepared to tell you.因为自己的很多层面组成了全我，所以很多的自己形成了一个你们所知甚少的完形，这我还没准备要告诉你们。
You may take your break.你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:55. Jane was quite well dissociated, she said. She wasn't aware of much except the voice. Her pace had on the whole been good, her voice average. Her eyes had opened occasionally, and she had smoked.(9:55休息。珍说她在很好的出离状态。除了声音以外她没有觉察到别的。她的速度全程都很好，音量适中。她的眼睛偶尔会睁开，而她在抽烟。
(Seth has mentioned psychic gestalts before, and has given bits and pieces of information on them, along with data on the general heading of the God concept, in these sessions: 31, 66, 81, 95, 96, 97, 146, 147, 149, 135, 151, etc.(赛斯曾提过心灵完形，且给过一点关于它们的讯息，是在提到上帝概念的这个广泛标题的资料里，在这几节里：31、66、81、95、96、97、146、147 、149、135、151等等。
(It was now time for the 39th Dr. Instream experiment. As usual Jane sat with her eyes closed, her right hand raised to them. Her voice was quiet, with many short pauses. Resume at 10:08.)(现在是第39次殷斯翠姆博士实验。如往常一样，珍闭着眼睛，坐着，她的右手举到眼睛上。她的声音低沉，有很多短暂的停顿。10:08重新开始。)
Now give us a moment please for our Instream material.现在请给我们一点时间开始我们的殷斯翠姆博士测验。
A chandelier, with four large bulbs, and small bulbs between them. Now. A green object. Rectangular in shape, as a book shape. The fourth book on a shelf, having to do with mediums. Page 98. And a description of a particular seance attended by Lodge and two others. (Pause.)一个枝形吊灯架，有4个大灯泡，中间有很多小灯泡。现在，一个绿色的物件。长方形的形状，像是一本书的形状。书架上的第四本书和灵媒有关。第98页。还有一段关于一个特别的降神会描述，洛基和另外两个人都有参加。(停顿)
The seance given by a woman, as described in the book, with dark hair, parted in the middle. Some connection here also with Dr. Instreams book on spiritism; that is, his own book.这个降神会是由一个女人主持的，如书上所描述，有深色的头发，中分。这里也有和殷斯翠姆博士关于降神术书的一些关联；那是，他自己的书。
He has recently corresponded with a colleague, or the man has written him. Or Dr. Instream has been strongly thinking of the colleague.他最近与一位同事通信，或这个人写信给他。或殷斯翠姆博士曾很强烈的想到这个同事。
A disagreement here somewhere, in connection with two men. This is not the disagreement that Dr. Instream spoke of to you and Ruburt when you met. (Pause at 10:15. See Session 169 in Volume 4.)这里有某些意见不合，和两个男人有关。这不是指当你们见面时，殷斯翠姆博士和你跟鲁柏之间的意见不合。(10:15分停顿。见第四册第169节。)
A spectacular-enough result in certain tests conducted by Dr. Instream since his last letter to you.自从他上次写给你们那封信之后，殷斯翠姆博士操作的某个测验有令人惊叹的结果。
If he did not conduct them, the tests, himself, then he is strongly aware of them. They are not trivial, the results.如果他自己没有亲自操作这些测验，那他就是十分熟知它们。这结果可不是微不足道的。
A March 2 date in his mind for a planned event.他心中有一个3月2日的日期，为了某个计划中的事件。
The substance of a letter, colon: “I will meet with you on March 2, if there is no change in plan.” The meeting to be in Oswego. The letter from a man to Dr. Instream concerning a series, now, of tests. The hypnosis experiments I believe.一封信的要点，冒号：“如果计划没变的话，我和你约在3月2日见面。”会面地点是在奥斯威戈，这封给殷斯翠姆博士的信来自于一个男人，有关一系列的测验。我相信是催眠实验。
Now. Do you have a test for me, Joseph?现在。你有测验要给我吗，约瑟？
(“Yes.”(“是的。”
(It was 10:17. I handed Jane the envelope for our 33rd experiment; as usual she took it without opening her eyes. She sat with it pressed to her forehead for a few sentences, then lowered it to her lap.)(现在是10:17。我递给珍我们第33次实验的信封；如往常一样，她闭着眼睛接过了信封。她坐着，前几个句子，她把信压在前额，然后放在大腿上。)
Give us a moment, please. It takes me a moment to change focus.请等我们一下。我要花一点时间来改变焦点。
These are impressions. Strips of color. A connection with a photograph, and some sort of grand affair, such as a ball.以下是印象。色带。和一张照片，以及某种重要事件有关联，像是一场舞会。
An entrance, and a schedule. A connection with three people, and a fourth who is not present. An initiation, and a bringing together of fragments. Four, the number four. A connection with an older man.一个入场，和一个日常行程表。和3个人有关联，第4个人不在场。一个开始，把片段集中起来。4，数字4。和一个老人有关联。
A disturbance that was not unexpected, and a result that was expected and hoped for.一个不预期的混乱，和一个预料之中且被期待的结果。
These are still impressions: two houses separated by grass. The numbers three, four, five, six. Six being significant. Too many too soon. November six three, and a letter that did not meet your approval. A connection with something twice, and five in a circle.这些仍然是印象：两间房子被玻璃隔开。数字3、4、5、6。6是重要的。太多太快。11月，63，和一封未受你们赞同的信。和某个东西有两次的关联，一个循环中的5。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:25. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed throughout both experiments. She said she had tried to block out all personal associations in connection with the envelope data.(10:25休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛在两个实验期间都闭着。她说，她试图屏蔽掉所有和信封资料有关的个人联想。
(I read the data to her before she opened the envelope. Jane pointed out three instances in it where she had personal associations with Seth's data, and as it turned out all three would have been in error had she voiced them.(我在她打开信封之前念这些资料给她听。珍指出三件她对赛斯资料有个人联想的例子，而最后她说的这三个都是错误的。
(See the tracing of the envelope object on page 278. As stated, the object is the front page of the announcement of the marriage of my brother Lorens daughter, Linda, to Dennis Murray of Brooklyn, NY. Once again Seth goes over the data with us, so immediately below is listed, first, the connections Jane and I made ourselves.(见上面信封物件的素描，之前提过，物件是我弟弟洛伦的女儿琳达的喜帖正面，她要嫁给住在纽约布鲁克林区的丹尼斯·莫瑞。再次的，赛斯和我们一起浏览过这些资料，首先列举在下面的是珍和我所做的连结。
(“Strips of color. " This meant nothing in particular to us.(“色带。”这对我们没有特别的意义。
(“A connection with a photograph", referred we thought to the fact that my brother took color pictures of the wedding. We visited him last Sunday at my parents home, in Sayre, PA, and he had expected to have the color prints with him; however they had not arrived from the processor yet, to our disappointment and his.(“和一张照片的关联”，我们认为这是指我弟弟洛伦拍摄的彩色照片。我们上周日在我父母宾州塞尔的家遇到他，本来预期他应该带着照片；不过相片还没洗好，我们和他都很失望。
(“and some sort of a grand affair, such as a ball. "A reference to the wedding, but hardly to a ball.(“某种重要事件有关联，像是一场舞会。”指的是婚礼，不是舞会。
(“An entrance, "Linda, a Protestant, married a Catholic in a Brooklyn church. Jane said she felt the reference to an entrance concerned the recent decision by the Ecumenical Council in Rome, to the effect that Protestants could now be allowed to enter the altar enclosure to be married. My brother Loren told us Sunday that this decision is so recent that his daughter was the first to be married in such a fashion in this church.(“一个入场”，琳达，一个新教徒在布鲁克林教堂嫁给一个天主教徒。珍说，她感觉这个入场指的是罗马天主教会议最近所做的决定，新教徒现在被允许进入神坛结婚。我弟弟洛伦星期天告诉我们这是刚做的决定，所以他的女儿是第一个以这种方式在这间教堂结婚的。
(“and a schedule. " My brother and his wife traveled to Brooklyn by bus to attend the marriage. They were so pressed for time on this particular weekend that the day of the wedding was changed from Sunday, January 23, to Saturday, January 22, so that they could return to their home in time for work Monday, January 21. Fortunate that this was so, for they narrowly missed being stranded in the first heavy snowstorm of the winter. The announcement is a schedule of events.(“和一个日常行程表。”我弟弟和他的妻子搭公车到布鲁克林参加婚礼。这个周末他们的时间很紧迫，因为婚礼从1月23日改到1月22日星期六，这样他们就可以在1月24日赶回去工作。幸运的是，他们刚好避过了这个冬天的第一场大风雪。喜帖是一个事件的行程表。
(“A connection with three people, and a fourth who is not present.” We thought this a too-vague reference to my brother and his wife, and their daughter, and the groom.(“和3个人有关联，第4个不在场。”我们认为这太笼统，可能指的是我弟弟和他妻子，还有他们的女儿和新郎。
(“An initiation, and a bringing together of fragments. " We thought this of course a reference to Linda's marriage. The use of the word fragments here, by Seth, led us to think that reincarnational motives might be involved in the marriage; but I did not think to quiz Seth about this when he resumed. In the very early sessions Seth began to use fragment as a reference to each physical personality manifested by the entity.(“一个开始，把片段集中起来。”我们认为这一定是指琳达的婚姻。这里赛斯用的字眼，片段，让我们想到这个婚姻里可能涉及的转世动机；但当赛斯重新开始时，我没有想到要问他这个。在很早期的课里，赛斯开始用片段来指存有显现的每一个物质人格。
(“Four, the number four. A connection with an older man.” This was perhaps a vague reference to the father of the groom; he is quite a bit older than my brother, who is Linda 's father. Later, Jane told me that this was a reference to brother Loren, Linda 's father.(“4，数字4。和一个老人有关联。”这可能指的是新郎的父亲；他比我弟弟，琳达的父亲老很多。后来珍告诉我，这指的是我弟弟洛伦，琳达的父亲。
(“A disturbance that was not unexpected”, we thought a reference to the disapproval with which Linda's maternal grandmother greeted the news of the marriage. She definitely was not in favor of it, as everybody knew.(“一个不预期的混乱。”我们想到的是，琳达的外婆听到结婚消息时她的反对。每个人都知道，她明显的不支持。
(“and a result that was expected and hoped-for. "Linda did want to get married, of course.(“和一个预料之中且被期待的结果。”琳达当然是想结婚的。
(“two houses separated by grass.” This was too general.(“两间房子被玻璃隔开。”这太笼统了。
(“The numbers three, four, five, six. Six being significant.” We did not make anything out of this particularly.(“数字3，4，5，6。6是重要的。”我们没有特别想到什么。
(“Too many too soon. November six three”, are very accurate references to Linda, but are here not explained because of personal reasons on her part. The data are available however to anyone making a study of these experiments. The numbers refer to November 1963; during this month Linda was involved in a strong emotional experience that was unique for her.(“太多太快。11月，6 3”，一个和琳达非常正确的关联，但因为她个人的理由，这里不能解释。这个资料开放给任何想研究这些实验的人。这数字指的是1963年11月；在这个月琳达涉入了一件对她而言很独特的强烈情感经验。
(“and a letter that did not meet your approval.” This is a reference to the letter written to Jane and me by Linda's mother, on January 24, telling us about Linda's marriage on January 22.(“一封未受你们赞同的信。”这指的是琳达的母亲在1月24日写给珍和我的信，告诉我们琳达的婚礼在1月22日。
(“A connection with something twice" is another quite accurate reference by Seth to personal matters involving Linda, and data on this are withheld here for the same reason announced above. The three pieces of data that are not explained in this experiment are the best, incidentally, that Seth gave in connection with the object.(“和某种东西有两次的关联。”是另一个赛斯对琳达私人的事正确的描述，而不解释这个资料也是基于上面同样的理由。顺便一提，在这个资料里有三个不能解释的讯息是最棒的，赛斯给了和一个物件的连结。
(“and five in a circle.” meant nothing to Jane and me.(“一个循环的5。”对珍和我没有意义。
(We were discussing the data when Seth resumed. The first couple of sentences of his discussion concerned the three items noted above. He seemed in the mood to continue for a while, and to discuss the envelope data, so I began to ask questions. Jane resumed with her glasses on, and with her eyes opening occasionally, at 10:40.)(当赛斯重新开始的时候，我们正在讨论这个资料，讨论的前几句和上面提到的三个项目有关。她似乎还想继续讨论信封资料一会儿，所以我开始问问题。珍在10:40重新开始时戴着眼镜，她的眼睛偶尔会睁开。)
...The six, which was significant. This was simply not given clearly. I merely meant that two sixes did appear, as 66.……这个6，很重要。这里给的不清楚。我的意思是，有两个6出现，像66。
(1966 appears on the wedding announcement.(1966年有出现在喜帖上。
(“Did we correctly interpret the data about a letter?”)(“我们有正确解读信的资料吗？”)
The letter referred to the original note of the girl’s marriage, which Joseph didn’t meet, with your approval, incidentally; nor for that matter with Ruburts.这封信指的是这女孩的喜帖，约瑟不赞同，而鲁柏也是。
(Here now Seth elaborated further on the three points not explained: Too many too soon; November six three; and A connection with something twice. (“What about the 'five in a circle data?”)(在这里，赛斯深入的描述了不能解释的那三点：太多太快；11月 ，63；和某个东西有两次的关联。(“一个循环的5”指的是什么？)
I beg your pardon?请再说一次？
(I repeated my question.)(我重复了我的问题。)
These were simply distortions, or rather material from Ruburts own subconscious.这些单纯是扭曲，或是从鲁柏自己的潜意识而来的资料。
The “strips of color” represented however, I believe you call it, confetti. This was in many colors and in small strips.不过这个“色带”指的是你们所谓的五彩碎纸。很多颜色在小纸片上。
This was not our best. However, on the average we are doing much better. Ruburt is loosening up some.这不是我们最好的表现。不过，平均说来，我们做得好多了。鲁柏有比较放松一些了。
(“Were we correct concerning our interpretation of the photograph data?")(“关于我们对照片资料的解释是正确的吗？”)
You were indeed.你们的确是的。
(“And concerning your reference to an entrance?”)(“而关于你指的入场呢？”)
Indeed. This referred to the altar arrangement. The “initiation” referred to the marriage of course, but also to the beginning of a new tradition in the particular church where for the first time a Protestant was allowed into the altar section.的确。这指的是神坛的安排。这个“开始”指的当然是婚姻，但也是一个特殊教堂新传统的开始，第一次新教徒被允许进入神坛区。
The “something twice” also referred to the sixty-six, or sixes twice. I picked this up quite literally, I’m afraid.这个“某个东西两次”指的也是66，或两次的6。我恐怕是非常字面的接收到这个。
(“What about your reference to an older man?”)(“你指的老人是什么？”)
The older man represented the groom’s father, simply because of the discussion concerning him Sunday. (But see Jane's comment on page 285.老人指的是新郎的父亲，单纯只因为星期天的讨论提到他。(见上面珍的评论。
(“And the number four?”)(“那数字4呢？”)
The four people. The parents of the girl and the groom, mentioned in the announcement.4个人。喜帖里提到的新郎新娘的父母亲。
(“Were we right about the ‘disturbance?’”)(“我们说“混乱”的解释正确吗？”)
You were.是的。
The “grand affair” and the “ballroom” implication, you see—the connection somewhat distorted here was the formality of the wedding—clothes, the wedding clothes, which did lead Ruburt to think of a ball.这个“重要事件”和“舞会”的含意，你知道——和婚礼仪式的连结在这里有些扭曲——衣服，婚纱，这让鲁柏想到一场舞会。
(“Were we correct about ‘two houses separated by grass?’”)(“对于“两间房子被玻璃隔开”我们是正确的吗？”)
You were.是的。
(I did not write it down earlier, but we thought Seth had referred to the home of my parents and the house next door. The connection is far-out: My brother, father of the Protestant bride who married a Catholic, was at my parents' home Sunday; the people who live next door are Catholic.(我之前没有写下来，但我们以为赛斯指的是我父母的家和隔壁的邻居家。这个连结很遥远：我弟弟，身为一个要嫁给天主教徒新郎的新教徒新娘父亲，这星期天他正好在我父母的家；隔壁住的是天主教徒。
(“What about the numbers, three, four, five?”)(“数字3、4、5指的是什么？”)
This was simply to lead me up, or to lead Ruburt up, to the number six. I saw the number six twice, which led me to think it was significant. With numbers I use this device, and have in the past, counting aloud to the number that I want.这单纯的让我或让鲁柏想到数字6。我看到数字6两次，这使我认为它很重要。对数字我会用这个方法，我以前用过，大声地把我想要的数字数出来。
(“You did that once with John Bradley.”(“你有一次对约翰·布莱德利这么做。”
(See the 204th session, page 39. In this case Seth used the method to pinpoint a raise John received from his company.)(见第204节。赛斯用这个方法准确地指出约翰会被他的公司升职。)
I did indeed. It is of a help to Ruburt, but soon we shall not need it.我的确是。它会对鲁柏有帮助，但很快我们就不需要它了。
Now. The Fate article will be sold, providing Ruburt follows the way which has been set out for him.现在。《命运》杂志社的那篇文章会卖出，鲁柏将会沿着这条铺好的路发展。
(As mentioned in the notes for the 232nd session, page 269, Fate Magazine wrote Jane concerning an article on the envelope experiments. She has now written the first draft for the article. We suppose Seth’s rather cryptic note above means the article will sell if Jane sticks to the way she has planned.(在第232节，提到《命运》杂志向珍邀请，请她写有关信封实验的一篇文章。她现在写了初稿。我们认为上面赛斯相当神秘的注解，意味着如果珍坚持她计划的方式，这篇文章会卖出。
(There follows a copy of Jane's dream of Saturday, February 12, as taken from her dream notebook. Jane believes the dream to be a significant one, and had hoped Seth would discuss it this evening:(以下是珍在2月12日星期六所做的梦，从她梦笔记本中摘录的。珍相信这个梦很重要，所以她希望赛斯今晚能讨论它：
(“I dreamed I was on a bed, Rob on one side of me and another man also. No pain, movement in pelvis and I delivered a baby. Someone, a doctor, holds up two babies, twins, and I thought, somewhat humorously: 'Oh no, twins! Really, this is too much.' By this I meant, after having no babies all these years, now to have two at once! Then, though I'm not sure, I think that the doctor reassured me, that only one baby was involved. The hospital, or whatever it was, was near Lizzy Roohans old house, in my childhood neighborhood in Saratoga Springs, NY. I was pleased that the delivery was so easy and painless for me.”)(“我梦见我在一张床上，罗在我旁边，还有另一个男人。没有痛苦，在骨盆腔的推动后，我生了一个婴儿。某个人，一个医生，抱着两个婴儿，双胞胎，然后我有点幽默地想“哇，不会吧，双胞胎！这真的太多了。”我的意思是，这么多年不生孩子，现在一次有两个！然后，虽然我不确定，我想这个医生在安慰我，是只有一个孩子的。这个医院，或不管它是什么，位于我童年邻居丽兹·如翰[Lizzy Roohans]的老家，在纽约州撒拉托加斯宾。我很高兴这个生产是这么容易而且是无痛的。)
His dream represented several layers of information; on a superficial layer it represented his knowledge that fear of physical childbirth is not a deterrent to him. On another level it represented a knowledge that a future endeavor would at first appear to be two separate endeavors, two separate accomplishments not connected to each other; but on later examination it will be seen that they are unified.他的梦意味着几层的讯息；在比较浅的层面，它意味着对生产的害怕不足以吓阻他。在另一个层面，它意味着一个知识，一个未来的尝试可能一开始会看起来像两种不同的尝试，两个彼此不相关的成就；但在后来的检视中会看到它们是一体的。
These have not yet come to pass, and they represent a rebirth, or a new birth, from the subconscious. This spring will be the time.这些还尚未实现，而它们代表了从潜意识的一个重生，或一个新生。那个时间点就在今年春天。
I am one of those represented in the dream, and you are another. The affair will be most beneficial from many viewpoints, and represents a creative endeavor.在梦里，我代表其中一个，而你是另一个。这件事从很多观点来说都是最有益的，而且代表了一个创造性的努力。
He will think that two endeavors are involved, and will realize that one united product has been achieved instead. He saw a female child because the product will be intuitive, and psychic, rather than born from logic.他认为这涉及了两种努力，并了解那将会达成一个结合的产物。他看到一个小女孩是因为，这个产品是出自直觉、心灵而不是出自逻辑。
He will be reborn about the time of his own birth date. This is another reason why the birth symbolism was used.他会在自己的生日那天重生。这是另一个理由为什么会用这个生产的象征。
(“How do you mean, reborn?"(“你指的重生是什么？”
(The term made me wonder if Seth referred to another physical life for Jane; in the past he has reiterated that our present physical lives are the last for both of us.(这个字眼让我想弄清楚，赛斯指的是否珍另一次的物质生命；过去他曾反复地说过，我们现在的物质生命是我们俩的最后一世。
(We are not sure whether Seth refers to the publication of Janes ESP book, or perhaps the start of another in some fashion. The ESP book is due May 16; Janes birthday is May 8. Also, Seth and I are mentioned often in the book. Jane was speaking rather rapidly now, and I did not think to interrupt and ask Seth to clear up this point. She is 38. I am 47.)(我们不确定赛斯指的是否珍ESP书的出版，或也许是另一本书某种方式的开始。ESP书5月16日截稿；珍的生日是5月8日。还有，书中常提到赛斯和我。珍现在说得很快，而我不想打断赛斯要求他说清楚。她今年38岁，而我47岁。)
The product will not come from pain, and so he felt none in the dream. It will come from psychic motion. This simply represents another creative project which he shall deliver, with our help.这个产物不是从痛苦中得来的，因此他在梦中也感觉不到痛苦。它来自心灵的律动。这仅意味着在我们的帮助之下，另一个他催生的创造性计划。
Now. My fondest regards to you both from your own Valentine.现在。我在情人节对你们俩最深的祝福。
(“The same to you.”)(“你也是。”)
And if we are not all hearts and flowers, let it be said that hearts and flowers as a steady diet could become quite boring.生命并不总是充斥着爱心和花朵，这么说吧，千篇一律的爱心和花朵也可能变得十分无聊。
(“Yes. Good night, Seth.”(“是的。晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:01. Jane was well dissociated, she said. Her eyes had opened often, and halfway through the delivery she had opened her glasses, as if to put them on. Her pace had been good but her voice had sounded tired. Now she said she did feel tired at the end of the session.)(11:01结束。珍说她在很好的出离状态。她的眼睛经常睁开，而口述中途她打开眼镜戴上。她的速度适中，但声音听起来有点累。现在，在这节课的尾声她说她真的感觉累了。)
(Tracing of the envelope front used in the 34th envelope experiment, in the 234th session for February 16,1966.)用在1966年2月16日第234节第34次信封实验信封正面素描

SESSION 234 第234节 可能的场域由思想图像组成 信封34


FEBRUARY 16, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1966年2月16日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(The 34th envelope experiment was held during the session. The object was the front of a recent letter to Jane from her publisher's secretary. I folded it once, put it between two pieces of board and sealed it in the usual double envelope. Jane did not know I had saved it. I thought this object simple enough, while containing some good emotional charges, but as will be seen Seth picked up many connections. The experience turned out to be a complicated one. There were unexpected hits, and one not used.(第34次信封实验在这节课举行。物件是一封信的正面，这是最近出版社的秘书写给珍的。我把它折起来放进两张纸板中间，再放进信封里封好。珍不知道我保留它。我想这个物件够简单，而且包含了一些很好的情绪能量，等会将会看到，赛斯收到了很多的连结。这个经验后来变得复杂。说中了一些没有预期的地方，而有一个没用上。
(Jane was visited by the wife of our landlord after supper this evening. Marian Spaziani is a good friend. It will be remembered that Seth dealt with her husband’s financial activities in some detail in the 229th session. Seth has also called Marian an excellent telepathic receiver, and has dealt with some of her experiences, concerning the death of her husband’s father, in past sessions. See the notes on page 248; and the 100th and 101st sessions in Volume 3, for example.(我们的房东太太在今天晚餐过后来拜访珍。玛丽安·史帕日尼是一个好朋友。记得赛斯曾在第229节提过她先生财务活动的一些细节。赛斯也曾说过玛丽安是一个很棒的心电感应接收者，而且在过去几节提过一些她的经验，是有关她公公的死。见前面相关页面的注记；还有第三册的100节和101节。
(Marian had an interesting experience to tell Jane. Recently Marians daughter wrote what Marian considered to be an excellent composition on the poet Donne; the quality was exceptional, according to Marian, and she typed up the paper for her daughter to take to school. To their surprise the English teacher marked the paper with a D minus.(玛丽安有一个有趣的经验要告诉珍。最近玛丽安的女儿写了一篇关于诗人多恩的论文，玛丽安觉得她写得很棒；据玛丽安所说，那是一篇很优秀的文章，她帮女儿打了报告带到学校。他们却很意外地发现英文老师给了一个极差评。
(Marian and her husband went to school to see the teacher, a middle-aged woman. The teacher was much embarrassed, appeared to be very upset, and finally said she thought the daughter had copied the paper from other sources. She did not change the mark she had given however, so Marian and her husband went to the school principal; this individual said he was powerless in such cases.(玛丽安和她的先生到学校见这个老师，她是一个中年女人。这个老师十分困窘，看起来很不安，最后她说，她认为她女儿的这篇文章是从别的地方抄来的。她没有更改她的评分，因此玛丽安和她先生去见校长；校长说他在这件事上无能为力。
(A few days later, before a class which contained Marians daughter, the same teacher burst into tears without apparent cause, and fled the room. The daughter told Marian. Shortly afterward, while working at home, Marian felt what she called a compulsive urge to telephone this teacher and make peace with her; Marian found herself picking up the telephone before she realized what she was doing. She talked with the teacher for half an hour, and the two women made their peace. Marian had felt she had hurt the teacher unduly, and had no wish to do this. She felt much better for making the call. Four days after this, the teacher dropped dead.(几天后，在上玛丽安女儿的课之前，这个老师突然没有来由的哭出来，然后冲出教室。女儿告诉了玛丽安这件事。后来当玛丽安在家时，她感觉有一股冲动，想打电话给这个老师和她和解；在玛丽安还没明白她在做什么时，她已经拿起了电话。她和这个老师谈了半个小时，最后两个女人和解了。玛丽安感觉她过度伤害了这个老师，她本来不希望这么做的。她觉得打完电话后感觉好多了。4天后，这个老师突然暴毙。
(Marian now wondered if she had been subconsciously aware of the womans impending death, etc., and had tried to offer solace. Marian knows of the sessions but has not witnessed any; she has read some of the early material.(玛丽安现在想知道，是否她的潜意识觉知到了这个老师迫近的死亡，所以试着提供一点慰藉。玛丽安知道我们的课，但从没有参与过；她有读过一些早期的资料。
(The session was held in our front room. Jane began speaking while sitting down, and her eyes opened briefly almost at once Her pace was fast; she sipped wine occasionally and was smoking.) Now, good evening.(这节课是在我们前面的房间举行的。珍坐着开始说话，她的眼睛几乎立刻睁开。她的速度很快；她抽烟而且偶尔喝口酒。)现在，晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth. ")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
It did Ruburt good to talk with his friend, for he has been concentrating with too much vigor of late.和朋友说说话对鲁柏是好的，他最近耗费了太多精力。
It is not the time he spends working, necessarily. He should understand this by now, but the effort, energy and concentration that is expended. Now, it is to be expected that he expend energy and that he concentrate with some thoroughness, but at times he becomes emotionally weary as a result of expending huge amounts of energy within a small amount of time, comparatively speaking.这并不必然指的是他工作的时间。他现在应该了解，这指的是他花的努力、精力和专注力。现在，他花精力和专注力在一些事上是可预期的，但相对上来说，有时候在短时间之内花了巨大的能量，在情绪上他会变得疲惫。
When he does so he forgets to draw from subconscious energy and uses nervous energy, and is therefore somewhat depleted. This time however we mention it when the trend only begins, and so nip it in the bud. The social interlude was therefore most beneficial.当他这么做的时候，他忘了从潜意识汲取能量，而使用了焦虑的能量，因此能量多少耗竭了，不过这一次我们在这个倾向刚开始时就提起了，因此能防范于未然。所以这个社交插曲是最有益的。
I have mentioned this before, and do not intend to hammer you both over the head with it. Nevertheless an evening a week spent out of your own quarters, a social evening, reaps many benefits which you may not as yet understand, and is, all in all, quite necessary for overall well-being on your parts.我之前提过这个，而我不想一直念你们。无论如何一周花一个晚上在你们自己的团体，有一个社交活动的夜晚，会有很多你们还未能理解的收获，而从各方面来说，对于你们整体的健康是非常必要的。
Proper balance is not maintained otherwise. For one thing the change of environment is necessary—and I am speaking for you, Joseph, as well as for Ruburt; and here we shall let the matter rest.否则适当的平衡无法被维持。环境的改变是必要的——而我说的是你，约瑟，还有鲁柏；而现在，这个话题就不用再说了。
As far as the experience recently encountered by Ruburts friend, it was quite legitimate. Subconsciously the teacher realized that she was about to die, and communicated this realization to Ruburts friend, who is indeed, as I have said before, an excellent receiver.就鲁柏的朋友最近所遭遇的经验来说，它是十分合理的。潜意识里这个老师知道她要死了，而就此和鲁柏的朋友沟通，她就像我之前说过的，是一个很棒的接收者。
Now. Back to our probabilities.现在。回到我们的可能性。
The field of probable events exists as a reality. From it the self chooses those actions which shall become a part of physical reality. Here indeed free will enters into the matter. This is a pun. I would be disappointed if it were missed. It is a good one.可能性事件的场域是以一个实相存在的。自己从中选择那些应该会变成一部分物质实相的行动。这里的确关乎自由意志(或：这里自由意志的确进入物质)。这是一个双关语。如果它被遗漏了，我会很失望的。它是很好的一句双关语。
(Jane, her eyes wide open, stared at me, smiling broadly.(珍的眼睛睁得很大的盯着我，笑得很灿烂。
(“Yes.")(“是的。”)
Now. Often clairvoyant information will appear to be wrong. In some cases this is because a different probable event has been chosen by a self for physical materialization. I have access to the field of probabilities and you do not—egotistically, you do not. I have access to your so-called past. I can view your present. To me your past, present and future merge into one.现在。预知的讯息常常看起来是错的。在一些例子里，这是因为自己选择了一个不同的可能性事件物质化。我可以进入可能性的场域而你们不行——自我上，你们不行。我可以进入你们所谓的过去。我能看到你们的现在。对我来说，你们的过去、现在和未来合并成同一个。
(This reminds me that on page 58 of the 206th session, Seth briefly described what he usually “sees” of us, or any witnesses, during a session. Unless he narrows his focus and concentration to concentrate upon the present individual during a session, Seth told us he sees a composite image, an energy reality that is composed of past personalities, and in many cases also of future personalities that will be adopted by the inner self.)(这让我想起在第206节，赛斯简短地描述在一节课里，他通常“看到”我们或参与者的是什么。除非在课程中他缩小他的焦点，专注在现在的这个个体，否则赛斯告诉我们，他看到的是一个复合的形象，一个由过去人格们组成的能量实相，而在很多例子里，未来的人格们也会被内我所采用。)
On the other hand as I have told you, your past continually changes. It does not appear to change to you, for you change with it. You are not aware of the changes that have come about. The question of clairvoyance however is not at issue with information given concerning your past. Your future changes as your past changes. But clairvoyant information deals with the future, that is, precognitive clairvoyant information, and it is here that the issue shows itself.另一方面，就如我所告诉你的，你的过去持续地在改变。对你来说过去看起来并没有改变，是因为你跟着它改变。你不觉知到正在发生的改变。不过问题是预知力不是给关于你过去讯息的线索。你的未来在改变就像你的过去在改变一样。但预知的讯息处理的是未来，那是预知的讯息，而在这里议题显现了出来。
We shall consider an example. Suppose that in the past you sat behind a John X in grade four. At the time you sat behind him, you liked him very much. He was then an agreeable fellow, and you considered him as such.我们思考一个例子。假设过去你四年级的时候，坐在一个约翰X的后面。那时候你坐在他的后面，你非常喜欢他。那时的他是一个讨人喜欢的家伙，而你也认为如此。
In grade six, let us suppose that you had a severe disagreement with this same John X, and then you disliked him thoroughly. He was a disagreeable fellow in your perceptions.让我们假设，在六年级的时候，你和这同一个约翰X起了一个严重的冲突，然后你完全不喜欢他了。你觉得他是一个讨厌的家伙。
In twelfth grade you become fast friends. He is once again an agreeable fellow. You know him for several following years. Someone who is supposed to have psychic abilities looks into your past, and tells you that you sat behind a most disagreeable child. Most unlikeable in the earliest grade, and mentions the name John X.在十二年级的时候，你们又变回了朋友。他又再次的成为一个讨人喜欢的家伙。你接下来的几年都和他很熟。某个有心灵能力的人看你的过去，告诉你你坐在一个讨人厌的孩子后面，在低年级时最讨厌的人，并提到他的名字是约翰X。
You think that the information is wrong, for John X, you are convinced, is a friend of yours, has always been a friend of yours, and consciously you are convinced that you have always found him agreeable. Consciously you have forgotten the past, and you have remade it.你会认为，关于约翰X的这个讯息是错的，你相信他是你的朋友，他一直是你的朋友，而意识上你相信了你一直觉得他是讨人喜欢的。意识上你忘了过去，而且你重塑了它。
In most cases however it is the future in which you are interested. The future changes. You change it, in the same manner that you have changed the past. In such cases it is necessary that the correct channel of probable events be perceived, correct meaning the channel which shall ultimately be chosen. And the choice is dependent upon your choices in both past and present.不过在大部分的例子，你们所感兴趣的是未来。未来也在改变。你以改变过去的方式同样改变着未来。在这样的例子，可能性事件那个正确路线的被感知是必要的，正确意味着最终被选择的路线。而这个选择是同时凭借着你过去和现在的选择。
These choices however are based upon your changing perceptions of past and present. Because I have a larger scope of perception than you, I can with much greater facility predict what may happen. But this is dependent upon my prediction as to which choice you will make, and the choice is still your own.无论如何这些选择是基于你对过去和现在改变中的感知。因为我有着比你们更大范围的感知，我来预测可能发生的事要容易得多。而我的预测是凭借着你们将要做的选择，而选择仍然是你自己的。
Predictions, per se, do not contradict the theory of free will, though free will is dependent upon much more than any freedom of the ego alone. If the ego were allowed to make all the choices, with no veto power from other layers of the self, you would all be in a sad position indeed.预言本身不能抵触自由意志这个原则，虽然自由意志凭借着远比单独的自我更多的自由。如果让自我去做所有的选择，而其他层面的自己都没有否决权的话，你们真的会在一个很悲惨的情况里。
You may take your break.你们可以休息了。
(Break at 9:29. Jane said she was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her pace had been generally fast, slowing a bit in the middle. Her eyes had opened often, her delivery had been emphatic.(9:29休息。珍说她在第一段出离如常。他的速度一般来说算快，中间的时候有慢一点。她的眼睛频繁地睁开，口述有力。
(Seth has spoken on free will at various times. Much of this has been incorporated in discussions on the God concept and psychic gestalts. See the following sessions among others: 3, 4, 31, 35, 49, 66, 81, 95. 97, 135, 146. 49, 151. Volumes 1 to 4.(赛斯在不同的时间点有说过自由意志。大部分涵盖在对上帝的概念和心灵完形的讨论里。见以下几节：3、4、31、35、49、66、81、95-97、135、146-149、151。第一册至第四册。
(Jane was again smoking when she resumed in the same manner at 9:42.)(当珍在9:42分以同样方式重新开始的时候，她再次地抽烟。)
I can therefore perceive far more than you can of your own future.因此对于你们的未来，我能感知的比你们多得多。
I am hardly omnipotent, however. Nor, strictly speaking, is such omnipotence possible. Now. Ruburt, generally speaking, has been doing very well in utilizing the energy available to him from other portions of the self, and in so doing he has indeed picked up clairvoyant information of which he is not aware on a conscious level.不过我并不是全能的。严格来说，这样的全能也是不可能的。现在。一般来说，鲁柏在使用从自己其他部分而来的能力这方面做得很好，而当他这么做的时候，的确接收到了意识层面没有觉知到的预知讯息。
He does now and then need a rest from such matters however, and the release of purely physical stimuli and enjoyments. He needs to throw himself occasionally into other activities. When he does not do so he tries too hard, and the very attempt throws him back on his own nervous energy.不过他有时会需要从这些事情抽离，借由单纯的物质刺激和享乐来释放。他偶尔需要把自己丢进其他的活动。当他不这么做的时候，他会太过努力，而正是这种努力会把他丢回本身的焦虑能量。
I will endeavor to warn him of the beginning of such episodes, as of now, so that they will never become extended. Such depletions minimize the ability of the inner self to draw upon all the available information from other layers of the self, concerning the field of probabilities.我努力在这类插曲开始前就警告他，就如现在一样，这样这类事情就不会拖太久。这类损耗会降低内我从自己的其他层面，有关可能性的领域，获得可用讯息的能力。
The available events are not fully perceived on a subconscious level, and therefore choice is limited. When he is operating at his best he remembers his dreams very easily, and this can be a guide point for you both.可得的事件并没有在潜意识的层面被完全地感知，因此选择是受限的。当他以最佳状态运作的时候，会很轻易地记得他的梦，而这对你们俩来说会是一个引导。
(True, Jane has had trouble remembering her dreams lately, and for that matter so have I. She had also been quite tired at the end of sessions, as noted; whereas she usually feels better than at the beginning.)(这是真的，珍最近很难记起她的梦，而我也是。她也像之前注记的，在课结束的时候变得非常累；以前通常结束时，她会觉得比课刚开始时还有精神。)
Once more, the field of probabilities does not consist of imaginative fancy, nor of nebulous activity. It is quite as real as the physical universe. The experiences that are encountered there by other portions of the self are used by the whole self, and the knowledge thus gains is invaluable. Not only in terms of overall experience, but also as a means of training the ego, and the subconscious, to choose between various activities.再一次，可能性的领域并不是由富有想像力的想像或模糊的活动所组成的。它和物质宇宙是同样的真实。由自己其他部分所遭遇的经验会被全我所使用，而从中获得的知识是极其宝贵的。不只是就整体的经验来说，也是作为自我和潜意识从不同的活动之间选择一种训练方法。
All of this data is instantly available to layers of the self, and only the ego is not aware of this field. It would be snowed under completely. Now, this field of probabilities has existed in your past, and formed your present.所有这些资料都立即可以被自己的层面所取用，只有自我不觉知这个领域。它完全被矇住了。现在，这个可能性的领域存在于你们的过去，而形成了你们的现在。
It constantly expands, as does your own universe. It is never static. From it you choose those patterns of thought which you will weave into the physical matter of your universe. The dreaming self sees both fields, and operates in each. It should be realized that the probable self also has its dreams.就像你们自己的宇宙一样，它持续的扩展。它永不静止。从中你选择那些你会织进你们宇宙物质事件的思想模式。梦的自己能看见两个领域，而在其中任何一个运作。要了解可能性的自己也有它的梦。
This probable field seeds many other systems beside the one physical system with which you are familiar. The probable field is strongly composed of thought images, not physically materialized, but extremely vivid and actual storehouses of energy. Here is the material from which all pasts and presents and futures are made.这个可能性的领域，在除了你所熟悉的那个物质系统外播种了很多其他的系统。可能性的领域是由思想印象强而有力地组成的，它没有物质化，但有极逼真和真实的能量储藏。这里的资料是由所有过去、现在和未来所组成的。
It is far from a closed system in any way. Not only does it feed the physical universe, but in it many aspects of your own dreams become actual. Do you dream of an apple? Do you dream of a child, who has no existence in physical reality? Often these exist in the field of probability.就任何方面来说，它都远不是一个封闭的系统。它不只喂养了物质宇宙，而且在其中，你们自己的梦的很多方面都变得真实。你梦过一个苹果吗？你梦过一个不存在于物质实相中的孩子吗？通常这些存在于可能性的领域。
You may take your break.你们可以休息一下。
(It was now time for the 40th Dr. Instream experiment. Jane sat with her right hand raised to her closed eyes. She used many short pauses but her pace was average in between. She was not smoking. Resume at 10:09.)(现在是时候开始第40次殷斯翠姆博士实验。珍坐着，她的右手举到闭着的眼睛上。她有很多短暂的停顿，但速度适中。她没有抽烟。在10:09分重新开始。)
Now. Give us a moment please.现在。请等我们一下。
I have the impression of a group of miscellaneous objects, bearing no particular relationship to each other: a stone, a pencil, a grape, something that looks like a twig. Another, a banana shape. All of these in a circular arrangement. (Pause.)我有一堆杂物的印象，相互没有特别的关联：一块石头，一支铅笔，一串葡萄，某个东西看起来像小树枝。另一个，一个香蕉的形状。所有这些排成一个圆形。(停顿)
A paper clip also, and a small grain, g-r-a-i-n, something small and granular.还有一个回形针，和一个小颗粒，g-r-a-i-n，某个很小又像颗粒状的东西。
The items have been kept in a box. Also the impression of a small ceramic sculpture, of two people, and colored. The figures upright, with some gadget on top. This is only an example now, but a gadget like a handle, for example.物品被放在盒子里，还有一个印象是小的陶瓷雕像，是两个人和彩色的。雕像是直立的，顶部有一个精巧的装置。现在，比如，一个像手把的精巧装置。
The above is to be taken as my impressions concerning an object, or objects.上面是我对一个物件或一堆物件的印象。
Now. In connection with Dr. Instream himself, a splendid occasion of some kind, occurring recently. (Pause at 10:15.) Something movable and round. These are separate impressions, you understand; the movable and round docs not necessarily refer to the splendid occasion.现在。和殷斯翠姆博士自己有关，最近发生的，是一个壮观的场合。(10:15停顿)某种能动的和圆形的。你知道，这是分开来的印象；能动和圆形的并不必然指的是壮观的场合。
(Here Jane made a gesture, her eyes still closed, as if she could somehow distinguish between the above impressions.)(这里珍做了一个手势，她的眼睛仍闭着，好像她能多少分辨上面的印象。)
A willingness to make a journey despite other considerations. A store where he was recently overcharged two dollars and fifty cents on a purchase. (Long pause at 10:17.)不管其他的考量，他有意安排一个旅行。他最近在一家商店买东西贵了两元五十分。(长时间停顿10:17)
Twelve people in a group, listening to him. A special group in which he is highly interested. A letter from an F W. Findings that are surprising to him, involving somehow X's and Y’s. Perhaps on the third, thirteenth or twenty-third of this month. I am sure of the three but not of the other figures.有12个人在团体里听他说话。是一个他非常感兴趣的特别团体。一封来自FW的信。某个让他惊讶的发现，牵涉了X's和Y's。也许在这个月的3，13和23日。我很确定3，但不确定其他数字。
Do you have an envelope for me, Joseph?你有测验要给我吗，约瑟？
("Yes."(“是的。”
(It was 10:20. I handed Jane the sealed double envelope; as usual she took it without opening her eyes, then resumed her former position, with her right hand raised to her eyes.)(现在是10:20。我递给珍一个封好的信封；她如往常一样闭着眼睛接过了信，然后继续她之前的姿势，把右手举到眼睛上。)
Give us a moment.等我们一下。
A connection with twine. With the numbers four three, and an automotive establishment.和麻绳有关联。伴随着数字43，还有一个跟汽车有关的建筑。
A connection with a grand view. A package. (Jane gestures.) Ruburt’s association is with something that did not arrive on time, but let that one pass.和一个壮丽的景色有关。一个包裹。(手势)鲁柏的联想是和某个没有准时到达的东西有关，但先跳过这一个。
An achievement and a scarcity. Three people in particular.一项成就和一个稀有的。特别是3个人。
A note—there is some confusion here—that was not sent, or did not arrive. This leads Ruburt to think of a note he wrote but did not send, to Father Martin. I mention this for your information.一封短笺——这里有一点困惑——没有寄出去，或没有抵达。这让鲁柏想到一封他写给马丁祖父但没有寄出去的短笺。我提这个是让你知道。
The impression of cleverness, several children, and a dismissal. A long passage of time, and then a meeting.印象是聪明的，几个孩子，和解散。一段长时间，然后是一个会面。
A willingness to achieve. Paws, and netlike shapes, and triangles.有意去达成。手掌，网状的，和三角形。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:28. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed. She had spoken at a fair pace broken by many short pauses.(10:28休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着。她以一个适中的速度说话，被很多短暂的停顿中断。
(Jane said she felt that she was trying too hard during the experiment; she wanted Seth to name the object exactly, and when she realized this she tried to relax. She now went on to explain that when I handed her the envelope she had “shifted gears ” in order to give herself suggestions that she do very well on the experiment.(珍说，她感觉自己在这个实验中尝试得太用力了；她想要赛斯说出物件正确的名称，当她明白这点，她试着放松。她现在继续解释当我递给她信封的时候，她会“换档”以便给自己暗示在这个实验会表现得非常好。
(Jane said she felt her awareness "rising" as she did this; she believes she came part of the way out of her trance state, then sank back into it when she made her effort to relax. In retrospect she does not believe such tactics to be good ones, and will not repeat them.(珍说，当她这么做的时候，感觉觉察力“提升”了；她认为她部分脱离了出离状态，而当她努力放松的时候，又沉回去了。经过反省，她不认为这样的策略是好的，所以并没有重复它。
(See the tracing of the envelope object on page 289. I had used this for the object on the spur of the moment, more or less, without being concerned with whether Jane might know, or have on file, the letter the envelope had contained. Some of the data we could connect with the object, some we could not. When Jane began to go through her file of correspondence with her publisher, F. Fell, we began to see what complications could evolve from what seemed to be a simple envelope object.(见上面物件的素描。我心血来潮把这个当成物件，多少没有考虑到珍是否有可能知道信封里的信。有一些资料我们能和物件连结，有一些我们不能。当珍开始浏览她和她的出版商费尔先生往来的书信档案时，我们开始看到看似简单的信封物件是如何演变为复杂的东西。
(In order to understand the data it was necessary to write out a schedule of events; most of this was done after the session. As it was we spent about half an hour during break in an effort to begin to sort out the impressions. It developed that four letters were involved with the envelope object, and that one of these was enclosed in the experimental object. The common denominator here is that the date, January is somehow involved with all four letters. Seth uses this as a springboard for his impressions.(为了要了解这些资料，我有必要写下事件的日程表；这些大部分是在课后完成的。我们在休息的时候花了大约半小时整理这些印象。后来的发展是，有四封信可能和信封有关，而其中一封是包含在实验物件里。这里的共同点是日期，1966年1月25日，这四封信多少涉及了这个。赛斯用这点作为他的印象起点。
(First, a brief description of the four letters, including the dates written:(首先，对这四封信一个短暂的描述，包含了写下的日期：
(Letter #1: Written January 20. Jane wrote Frederick Fell giving approval of the title given to her ESP book. She also offered her help in writing copy for mail order ads, and offered her small collection of ads for various ESP books which she has collected, as a guide. She told F. Fell copy for the ESP field is hard to write without experience in the field.(第一封信: 写于1月20日。珍给佛德瑞克·费尔写的信，她同意用在ESP书的书名。她也帮忙写了邮购广告的文案，也提供了她收集的各种ESP书上的广告做为指南。她告诉费尔没有ESP领域的经验很难写这领域的文案。
(Letter #2: Written January 25. This acknowledged Janes letter of January 20, and was written by F. Fell’s secretary, Rhoda Monks. She informed Jane that F. Fell was out of town for two weeks, and that he would be back in town—NYC—on February 7. F. Fell was out of town from Monday January 24, to Monday February 7. It developed that he was in Florida on a selling trip and vacation.(第二封信：写于1月25日。这封信回复了1月20日珍的信，是由费尔的秘书柔达·蒙克[Rhod.a Monks]写的。她通知珍，费尔会出城两周，他会在2月7日回到纽约市。费尔出城的日子是从1月24日星期一到2月7日星期一。他在佛罗里达州工作兼度假。
(Letter # 3: Written January 25. This too was from the offices of F. Fell, written the same day as letter # 2, and was a simple note from an Emma Hesse, of the bookkeeping department, requesting that Jane send in her social security number for tax purposes. Actually the letter was a form letter and Jane was addressed as “Gentlemen:”.(第三封信：写于1月25日。这封信也是来自费尔的办公室，与第二封来信是同一天，是从会计部门艾玛·汉斯[Emma Hesse]写来的一封短信，要求珍寄给她社会安全号码以作为税务用途。事实上这是一封制式信，珍被署名为“先生”。
(Letter # 4: Written January 25 by Jane, before the receipt of the two letters from F. Fell on the same day. Our mail arrives Late in the day. In this Letter Jane discussed the 200pages she has finished on her first book on the Seth material itself. She also discussed the title for the ESP book, again offered her help on publicity ideas re this book, and told F. Fell that she was ready to help in any way she could.(第四封信：珍写于1月25日，是在同一天收到从费尔那里寄来的两封信之前。我们的信那天到得比较晚。在这封信里，珍讨论了她第一本已经完成了200页的赛斯书。她也讨论了ESP书的书名，再次帮忙提供了关于这本书的宣传想法，而且告诉费尔她准备倾尽所能的提供帮助。
(Both letters of January 25 from F. Fell to Jane, although on different-sized paper, bore fold marks that revealed either one could have been enclosed in the experimental object, which is an envelope front from F. Fell, postmarked January 25. Since the data obtained from the experiment this evening refers to both letters, as will be shown, we have no way of knowing which letter was actually mailed in the experimental object. I did not realize until after the session that it would have helped to ask Seth this.(两封信都是费尔在1月25日写给珍的，虽然是不同大小的纸，折痕显示了任何一个都有可能被放在信封物件中，这是来自费尔的信的信封正面，邮戳是1月25日。因为从今晚的实验所得的资料指向这两封信，我们等一下会展示，我们无从知道信封物件是哪一封寄来的信。直到上完课后我询问赛斯才明白。
(It should be noted here that Jane spent most of the day working on the article for Fate Magazine, dealing with Seth and the envelope experiments. In the 233rd session, Seth said the article would be sold. In order to do the article. Jane spent much time going over past envelope experiment results. It was tiring work in its own way, and Seth gives this activity as one of the reasons the envelope experiment results were not better. He has also said in the past that this kind of work on Jane's part can lower the level of her results.(这里应该注记，珍今天大部分时间都花在写《命运杂志》的那篇文章上，有关于赛斯和信封实验。在第233节，赛斯曾说这篇文章会卖出。为了写这篇文章，珍花了很多时间浏览过去信封实验的结果。这是一个很累人的工作，而赛斯说这是其中一个导致了今天的信封实验结果不太好的原因。赛斯在过去也说过珍做这类工作会降低结果的水平。
(During the half hour that break lasted we made what connections we could, but most of our time was spent puzzling out the four letters, etc. Seth discusses the experimental results to some extent. On some points we did not see or get explanations.(在休息的半个小时，我们尽可能地找出连结，但大部分时间我们都花在搞清楚这四封信上。赛斯讨论了一些实验结果。有一些地方我们并没有看到或得到解释。
(“A connection with twine.” We thought this general, since Jane's book manuscripts are usually bound with twine.(“和麻绳有关联。”我们认为这太笼统了，虽然珍的书稿通常是用麻绳绑的。
(“With the numbers four three", was also general. Jane speculated that it could refer to the age of either the publicity director of F. Fell, or to Rhoda Monks, the author of letter # 2. Jane telephoned Frederick Fell on February 8th, and in so doing spoke first to Rhoda Monks; to Jane she sounded as though she could be about that age.(“伴随着数字43。”也很笼统。珍想了一下，觉得这可能指的是出版社负责人费尔，或柔达·蒙克，写第二封信的人，他们两人的年纪。珍2月8日打给费尔，也是第一次和柔达·蒙克讲话；珍说她听起来像是这个年纪。
(“an automotive establishment.” elicited no response from us.(“一个跟汽车有关的建筑。”我们想不出来这是什么。
(“A connection with a grand view. ’’Again this was too general.(“和一个壮丽的景色有关。”再次的，这也是太笼统了。
(“A package. "A package was mailed to F. Fell on February 10. It contained the manuscript for the book on the Seth material, plus that of the poetry book. See page 269 of the 232nd session for Frederick Fell’s request to see the book plus the tape recording Jane made of some of the poems. The connection here with the envelope data is the January 25 postmark on the experimental object; Jane discusses the book on the Seth material in letter #4, written on January 25. Also, the tape was mailed to F. Fell on February 10 in a separate package.(“一个包裹。”一个在2月10日寄给费尔的包裹。它包含了赛斯书的手稿，再加上诗集。见第232节费尔要求看这本书，还有珍朗读她诗集里几首诗的录音带。这里和信封资料的连结是实验物件上1月25日的邮戳；珍在1月25日写的第四封信里讨论了赛斯书的资料。同时录音带是在2月10日寄给费尔的，是分开寄的。
(“Ruburt’s association is with something that did not arrive on time, but let that one pass. ’’After break Seth tells us he hoped to make this clearer, but could not. Jane and I thought this was a reference to the fact that F. Fell left for Florida on January 24, Monday, before reading Jane's letter #1, of January 20, the previous Thursday. Letter #1 would not have arrived at his office by the next morning, Friday. Thus letter #1 was acknowledged in letter #2, written by F. Fell’s secretary, Rhoda Monks, on Tuesday, January 25.(“鲁柏的联想是和某个没有准时到的东西有关，但先跳过这一个。”在休息过后赛斯告诉我们，他希望把这点说得更清楚，但无法做到。珍和我认为这指的是费尔在1月24日星期一到佛罗里达，而他应该还没看到上星期四1月20日珍写的第一封信。第一封信不会在隔天星期五早上就寄到他的办公室。因此第一封信才会在1月25日星期二由费尔的秘书柔达·蒙克回复，也就是第二封信。
(We think also that Seth’s statement above might refer to letter #4, written by Jane on January 25. At the time she wrote this letter Jane had yet to receive letter #2, and thus did not know F. Fell would be out of NYC until February 7. Actually Jane's letter #4 was never answered by mail. It was discussed in the telephone call between Jane and F. Fell on February 8. This is the call discussed in the notes on page 269 of the 232nd session. And again, the connection here with the envelope object is the January 25 date on which Jane wrote letter # 4, and the January 25 postmark on the object.(我们认为赛斯上面的声明，也可能指的是珍在1月25日写的第四封信。当她写这封信的时候，珍还没有收到第二封信，所以不知道费尔会离开纽约市直到2月7日才回来。事实上珍的第四封信从来没有以邮件的方式被回复。是在2月8日珍和费尔通的电话里讨论的。这是那通在第232节被讨论的电话。再次的，这里和信封物件的连结是珍写的第四封信上面的日期1月25日，物件上有1月25日的邮戳。
(“An achievement and a scarcity. ’’ We think this a reference to letter # 1, written by Jane on January 20. Achievement being a general reference to her ESP book, and scarcity being a more specific connection in that Jane offers her own small collection of ESP ads to F. Fell’s office for use as a guide in writing copy. The connection with the envelope object being that this letter #1 was answered on January 25, by letter #2, and that it is quite possible this is the letter contained in the object used in this evening's experiment.(“一项成就和一个稀有的。”我们认为这指的是珍在1月20日写的第一封信。成就可能泛指她的ESP书，而稀有的可能是一个更特定的连结，指的是珍提供给费尔办公室做文案指南的ESP广告小收藏。和信封物件的连结是，第一封信是由1月25日的第二封信回复的，而这封信很有可能是今晚实验所用的物件。
("Three people in particular.” Three people wrote the four letters involved. Jane wrote letters #1 and #4, Rhoda Monks wrote letter #2, Emma Hesse was responsible for letter #3. But I did not ask Seth for clarification and so we are not certain.(“特别是3个人”。3个人写了上述的四封信。珍写了第一封和第四封，柔达·蒙克写了第二封，艾玛·汉斯写了第三封，但我没有要求赛斯详细说明，所以我们不确定。
(“A note—there is some confusion here— that was not sent, or did not arrive. This lead Ruburt to think of a note hg wrote but did not send, to Father Martin. I mention this for your information.” There is an interesting example of association at work here. Jane saw it before I did. Father Martin is a monk in a nearby monastery close to Elmira, and the author of letter #2, possibly enclosed by the envelope object, is Rhoda Monks.(“一封短笺——这里有一点困惑——没有寄出去，或没有抵达。这让鲁柏想到一封他写给马丁祖父但没有寄出去的短笺。”这是一个很有趣的，有关工作上联想的例子。珍在我之前先发现这点。马丁神父是邻近埃尔迈拉修道院的修道士，而有可能包含在信封物件里的第二封信的作者，是柔达·蒙克。[译注：蒙克和修道士同音]
(Jane did write Father Martin a letter on December 2,1965 that she never mailed. In the 212th session for November 29,1965 Seth discussed various measurements that could be taken from Jane just before, during, and after sessions by a doctor. Father Martin was a doctor before entering the religious Life; he knows of the sessions but has not witnessed any or read the material. We considered asking his help in the matter of getting some data on Janes physiological states, but did not go through with the idea because of lack of time.(珍的确在1965年12月2日写给马丁神父一封信，但从未寄出。在1965年11月29日第212节，赛斯讨论了几种测量珍的方法，这可以由一个医生在课前、课中和课后这么做。马丁神父在进入教会生涯之前是一个医生；他知道这些课，但他没有参与或读过这些资料。我们想过找他帮忙测量珍的身体状态，但因为缺乏时间所以就没有进行。
(“The impression of cleverness", meant little in particular, other than that Jane received the impression that F. Fell is the shrewd businessman type, through her telephone talks with him.(“印象是聪明的。”并没有特别意味着什么，除了珍通过电话得到一个印象，费尔是一个精明的商人。
(“several children, and a dismissal.” rang no bells with us.(“几个孩子，和解散。”我们想不到什么。
(“A long passage of time, and then a meeting.” This is a connection growing out of letter #4, written by Jane on January 25, which is the postmark date on the experimental object. As stated, F. Fell did not answer letter #4 by mail. The letter was answered by telephone in the call of February 8, between Jane and F. Fell. Jane said the passage-of-time reference grows out of Mr. Fell's questions as to when she was coming to New York, and her reply that she saw no use in it until the ESP book was out; then, in May, she wanted to be in NYC to help with publicity. Thus a year or so is involved from the time F. Fell agreed to publish the book and Jane began her final draft of it. The “meeting" grows out of Mr. Fell’s reference that in this telephone call of February 8, he felt he was getting acquainted with Jane as a person, meeting her personally; also that he looked forward to their meeting in May.(“一段长时间，然后是一个会面。”这是一个出自于第四封信的连结，珍在1月25日写的那封信，也是实验物件上的邮戳日期。之前提过，费尔并没有用邮件来回复第四封信。而是透过2月8日和珍通的电话来回复的。珍说有一小段时间是来自于费尔的询问，询问她何时到纽约，她的回答是，在ESP书出版前并没有必要去；然后，在5月，她想到纽约市帮忙宣传。从费尔同意要出版这本书到珍的最后完稿大概一年左右。这个“会面”是来自于2月8日和费尔所通的电话，他觉得比较熟悉珍了，想私下和她见一面；他也期待他们5月的会面。
(“A willingness to achieve.” In both letters #1 and #4, Jane expresses her willingness to do all she can to help with publicity re the ESP book—write copy, appear on radio or TV shows, etc. In the February 8 phone call, F. Fell told Jane he would try to get her on some shows to publicize the book.(“有意愿去达成。”在第一封和第四封信里，珍表达了她的意愿，她愿意尽所能的帮忙宣传ESP书——写文章、出现在广播或电视秀等等。在2月8日的电话上，费尔告诉珍，他会试着让她上一些秀去宣传这本书。
(“Paws, and netlike shapes, and triangles.” These are very good references to letter #3, and take the form of doodles executed by Jane. She remembers making these on February 8, just before her telephone call to F. Fell. Letter 4#, again, was written January 25, and the date connects this letter with the January 25 postmark on the envelope experimental object. Either letter #2 or letter #3 was enclosed in the experimental object.(“手掌，网状的，和三角形。”这些是第三封信很好的参考，珍画了一些涂鸦。她记得是在2月8日打给费尔之前画的。第三封信，再次的，是1月25日写的，而这个日期和信封实验物件那封信上的邮戳是有关联的。实验物件所含的不是第二封就是第三封信。
(Jane has the habit of making such doodles, but as it happens letter #3 is the only one of the four letters involved that has doodles on it. Nor, for the record, does Jane's unmailed letter of December 2,1965 to Father Martin contain any doodles. The doodles from letter #3 are reproduced below as tracings from the originals, and are not in the same position as on the original, standard-size 8'L x 11 inch typing paper; the doodles are scattered over the page.(珍有画这些涂鸦的习惯，但第三封信是四封信里唯一一封有涂鸦的。在1965年12月2日，珍那封从未寄给马丁神父的信里也没有任何涂鸦。第三封信的涂鸦以素描的方式重现于下，和原始在八又二分之一乘以11英寸的纸上不一样的位置；涂鸦四散在纸中间。
(I interpreted the portion indicated of the one doodle as bearing a resemblance to the imprint of a paw, although Jane intended this design as flowers. The netlike shapes and triangles are obvious.(我认为其中一个涂鸦有部分像手掌印，虽然珍原本打算画的是花。网状的和三角形则很明显。
(The “10 times” is the only other doodle appearing on the letter.(这个“10次”是出现在信上的另一个涂鸦。
(We now come to an impression that Jane had while giving the experimental data this evening, but to which she did not give voice. Naturally, she was considerably vexed to learn that it was a legitimate one, and pertained directly to the object. See the tracing of the experimental object on page 289. Note that the word “bread” is written upon it as part of a grocery list. As soon as she opened the sealed double envelope and saw the object, Jane realized she had had an impression of bread. She did not have an image of a loaf of bread, for instance, but the words “a loaf of bread, ” rather quickly. She does not know why she didn’t give voice to them, other than that the next impression came along quickly. This has happened before, she said. Then succeeding impressions crowd out memory of what has been left unsaid, until later. In this instance, Jane could not recall very accurately what part of the data she was giving voice to when she had the bread impression, except that she was sure it wasn’t toward the end.(我们现在有了珍对今晚实验资料的印象，但对此她没有发言。很自然的，她相当不高兴的学到这是合理的，而且是直接属于这个物件。见上面物件的素描。注意到写在购物单上方的“面包”这个字。当她打开封起来的信封看到这个物件时，珍想到她有一个印象是面包。她没有一条面包的影像，但很快闪过了“一条面包”这几个字。她不知道为什么她没有说出来，而下一个印象很快就到了。她说这之前有发生过。接连不断的印象使得有的记忆没有当场被说出来。在这个例子上，珍无法正确记忆这个面包的印象是夹在哪一段资料里，除了很确定不是在快结束的时候。
(Jane resumed with her eyes closed, but opening occasionally, at 11:01.)(珍在11:01分重新开始时，眼睛闭着，但偶尔睁开。)
Now. We have various circumstances operating here, merely because of the several letters connected with the same date. The fact, also, that Ruburt was indeed overextended.现在。我们有不同的情况在这里运作，只是因为这几封信和同一个日期有关联。事实上，鲁柏的确是过度延伸了。
With good circumstances it would have been quite an achievement to separate all the impressions connected with these letters.好的方面是，去区别和这几封信相关的所有印象的确是一项成就。
The four three refers to the age, either of Rhoda Monks, or the man who sent the request for the social security number. They are both approximately of the same age.这个43指的是年龄，是柔达·蒙克，或者是那个要求寄社会安全号码的男人年纪。他们大概是同年。
(Seth slipped up here, we believe. Rhoda Monks did author letter #2, but letter #3 was written by a woman, also; it is this letter that concerns Jane's social security number.(我们相信赛斯在这里弄错了。柔达·蒙克写了第二封信，但第三封信也是一个女人写的；这是一封有关珍社会安全号码的信。
(Seth’s next comment refers to a remark I made during break.)(赛斯下一个评论指的是我在休息期间说的言论。)
While it is true that any conceivable item can be used, it is indeed simpler at present if an item without so many associated impressions is used.这是真的，任何你想得到的物品都可以使用，现在如果使用一个没有这么多联想印象的物品的确会比较容易。
The three letters of the same date brought about the difficulty, though the difficulty would have been far less had our circumstances this evening been better. There is no need to go into the meanings for other impressions which were not clear.这三封同一个日期的信的确带来了困难，虽然我们今晚的困难相对比较多，情况也比较好，不需要去讨论其他那些不甚清楚的印象的意义。
Most of them are legitimate enough, but far from specific enough. Ruburt's concentrated work on our test data today simply resulted in his strained efforts on my behalf. This is all right, and sometimes to be expected.大部分印象都够合理，但还不够明确。鲁柏今晚努力专注在我们的测验资料上，而这造成了他的紧张，但没关系，这有时候是意料中的。
Now, unless you have any questions for me, we shall close our session with my heartiest regards to you both.现在，除非你们还有任何的问题，我们应该结束我们的课了，我对你们俩衷心的祝福。
(“Just one then. Are we right about the connections between Father Martin and Rhoda Monks?”)(“只有一个。关于马丁神父和柔达•蒙克之间的关联，我们说的对吗？”)
The impressions which you caught were indeed legitimate. I asked you to let the one impression pass because I hoped to make it clearer, but was unable to. Even when conditions are not the most beneficial, we are not too far off, you see.你们捕捉到的印象的确是合理的。我要求你们跳过这一个印象，是因为我希望说得更清楚，但无法做到。即使状况不是最有利的，我们做得也不差。
The twine was nearest I could get Ruburt to come. I was seeing however the January 25 letter Ruburt wrote, and was trying to get across the idea of a book to be mailed out. There was some small discussion, if you recall, when it was mailed, as to whether or not twine should be used.麻绳是最接近我从鲁柏那里收到的。我看到1月25日鲁柏写的信，而试着让你了解一本书被寄出的这个想法。如果你记得，这里曾有一些小讨论，当书被寄出去的时候，应不应该使用麻绳。
(Seth is correct, and after he mentioned the twine connection Jane and I remembered it. This took place not on January 25, however, but on February 10, when the manuscript on the Seth material and the poetry book were mailed together. But Jane wrote letter #4, concerning the Seth material, on January 25. We did not use twine on the package, incidentally, but did use it on the package containing the tape recording Jane made of some of the poems in the poetry book. This was also mailed February 10. See page 269 of Session 232.)(赛斯是对的，在他提到麻绳的连结之后，珍和我都想起来了。不过这不是发生在1月25日，而是在2月10日赛斯资料的手稿和诗集一起寄出的那天。但珍是在1月25日写关于赛斯资料的第四封信。顺带一提，我们没有在包裹上用麻绳，但在寄珍朗诵诗集录音带的那个包裹上却有使用。这也是在2月10日寄的。见第232节。)
The “grand view”, I am afraid, was not nearly specific enough, and referred to Mr. Fell’s view of the ocean in Florida.这个“壮丽的景色”，我恐怕这里不够具体，但指的是费尔先生在佛罗里达州看到的海景。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:14. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her pace had been average, her eyes had opened occasionally. Once again she said she was tired after the session.)(11:14结束。珍出离如常。速度适中，眼睛偶尔睁开。再次的在课结束之后她说她很累。)
(Tracing of the coaster used as the object in the 35th envelope experiment, in the 235th session for February 23,1966.)用在1966年2月23日第235节第35次信封实验的杯垫素描

SESSION 235 第235节 自觉意识自己 信封35


FEBRUARY 23, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1966年2月23日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(The regularly scheduled session for Monday, February 21, was not held. Jane and I felt the need to rest and vary our routine. As a result we felt much refreshed for tonight’s session. We wanted to make up for the Dr. Instream experiment we missed on Monday, however, so before tonight’s session we mentioned aloud that we hoped Seth would deal with this.(2月21日星期一的定期课没有举行。珍和我都觉得需要休息，还有改变我们的惯例。结果我们感觉今晚的课特别有精神。我们想要补足星期一错过的殷斯翠姆博士实验，因此在今晚的课之后，我们大声地提起希望赛斯能谈谈这点。
(The envelope object for tonight’s 35th experiment was a beer coaster that I picked up from our table last Saturday evening, at our favorite dining and dancing establishment here in Elmira. It was the one I had used. Jane and I met two young couples there by prearrangement, and we had much fun dancing. The coaster is made of heavy absorbent cardboard, so I peeled the top layer of paper from it. This contained the design, printed in red, without any unusual thickness to furnish Jane unwitting clues. It was sealed in the usual double envelope between two pieces of Bristol.(今晚第35次实验的信封物件是一个啤酒杯垫，是我上星期六晚上在埃尔迈拉，我们最喜欢吃饭和跳舞的店里的桌上拿的。这是我用的那一个。珍和我在那里意外的遇到两对年轻夫妻，我们跳舞跳得很开心。这个杯垫是由很重的吸水纸板制成的，所以我撕下了上面的那一层纸。上面的图案印成红色的，这样才不会有特别的厚度而提供珍额外的线索。它被夹在两个纸板中，封进普通信封里。
(The two young couples, Marilyn and Don Wilbur, and Ann Diebler and Paul Sinderman, witnessed the unscheduled session of November 5,1965. See the notes for the 206th session. The Wilburs and Ann Diebler also witnessed the unscheduled session for December 3,1965; see the notes for the 214th session.(有两对年轻夫妇，玛丽莲和唐·韦伯，还有安·黛伯乐和保罗·席德曼参与了我们1965年11月5日临时课。见第206节的笔记。韦伯夫妇和安·黛伯乐也参与了1965年12月3日的临时课；见第214节的笔记。
(The session was held again in our front room, and was not interrupted. The windows were closed to dampen traffic noise. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed, but they soon began to open for brief intervals. Her pace was rather slow, and she was smoking as the session began.)(再次的，这节课是在我们前面的房间举行的，中间没有被打断。窗户关得很紧以杜绝交通噪音。珍坐着开始说话，她的眼睛闭着，但中间有短暂的睁开。她的速度相当慢，课一开始时她正在抽烟。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
And welcome after your vacation. Certainly I have nothing against your taking some time off occasionally. You have been most faithful. Then, so have I.欢迎你们度假归来。我绝不反对你们偶尔休息。你们是最忠实的。当然，我也是。
(Jane smiled.(珍笑了。
("Yes.”)(“是的。”)
Ruburt did well to relax the last few days, and he will now find that he applies himself to his various endeavors with renewed energy. I am glad that he put his dream book aside for a while, merely because he will have much more data for it within a short time. He can be working out his ideas however in the meantime, as this will be most beneficial. Even though some of his ideas will change, he will still need these present ideas as a basis.鲁柏过去几天休息的很好，他现在会发现，有更新的能量可用在他不同领域的尝试上。我很高兴他把梦的笔记本放到一边，因为他在短时间内将会有更多关于它的资料。他在这个期间可以发展他的想法，这是最有益的。即使他的一些想法会改变，他仍需要这些当下的想法作为基础。
Now. If you would have some idea of what the probable universe system is like, then examine your own dreams, looking for those events which do not have any strong (underline) resemblance to physical events in your own conscious existence. Look for dream individuals with whom you are not acquainted in your waking life. Look for landscapes that appear bizarre or alien, for all of these exist somewhere.现在。如果你们想了解可能性宇宙系统是什么，那么就要检视你们自己的梦，寻找那些在你们自己的意识存在里没有那么强烈(划线)像物质事件的事件。寻找梦里那些你在醒时生活并不认识的人。寻找那些显得古怪或是陌异的景色，因为所有这些都存在于某个地方。
You have perceived them. They do not exist in the space which you know, but neither are they nonexistent, merely imaginative toys of the dreaming mind, without substance.你感知到它们。它们不存在于你熟知的空间，但它们也不是不存在，而仅仅是没有实质的、梦的心智的想像玩具。
You may not be able to make sense from what appears to be a chaotic jumble of disconnected images and actions. The main reason for your confusion is your inability as an egotistical identity to perceive an order that is not based upon continuity of moments.你可能无法从看起来是一堆混乱不连结的影像和行动中找到意义。你困惑的主要原因是，你不能以自我的身分去感知到一个不奠基在片刻连续性上的顺序。
The order within the probable system is based upon something that could be compared to subjective associations, or intuitive flashes of insight, that can combine elements that would appear to the ego as quite disconnected, into whole and integrated patterns of action.可能性系统里的顺序是奠基在某种可以比作是主观的联想，或洞察力的直觉闪现上，这能结合那些对自我来说十分不连贯的元素，成为完整统一的行动模式。
Now. In reality the possible system does t achieve its order through subjective association, but the term, subjective association, is the nearest that I can come in approximating the basic causes for this order.现在。在可能性系统的实相里，它的顺序并不是透过主观的联想来达到的，但这个措词，主观的联想，是最接近我所讨论的这个顺序的基本肇因。
The word subjective, to you, implies immediately that which is not objective. However the events and actions of the probable system are indeed objective and concrete within their own field of reality. Your own physical system, you should remember, is only real and concrete within its own field. It is for this reason mainly that the physical system is so little perceived by you when you sleep.对你来说，这个字眼主观，立刻暗含了不客观的意思。不过，可能性系统的事件和行动，在它们自己实相的领域的确是客观和具体的。你应该记得，你自己的物质系统在它自己的领域里是唯一真实且具体的。这是一个当你在睡觉时很少感知到物质系统的主要原因。
You withdraw yourself to a large extent from the physical field of actuality, but you do not only withdraw from the physical system. You enter other fields of actuality. Sleep is far from a negative state. In the sleep state there are as you know several stages. Some of these you call dream states, because the ego is aware upon awakening that some kind of Mental activity has occurred.你很大程度地从真实的物质领域里撤离，但你不是只从物质系统里撤离。你进入了其他真实的领域。睡眠远远不是一个消极的状态。你知道在睡眠状态有几个阶段。有一些你称作梦的状态，因为在醒时，自我了解到某种心智活动在发生。
But there are other states which the ego does not recall, states of activity that are presently beyond the reach of current scientific endeavors, and these states we shall discuss rather thoroughly.但也有其他的状态自我无法想起，当下活动的状态是超过目前科学的努力可以触及的，我们应该相当彻底的讨论这些状态。
You may however take a break, and we shall deal with these, and also with Dr. Instream for Monday, and for this evening.你可以休息一下，我们会讨论这些，而也会讨论星期一和今晚的殷斯翠姆博士实验。
(Break at 9:23. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes had opened and her pace had finally become rather good. She was not smoking when she resumed in an even more emphatic manner, at 9:36.)(9:23休息。珍在第一段出离如常。她的眼睛睁开，速度最后变得相当好。她在9:36分以一种更有力的方式重新开始，她没有抽烟。)
Now. First of all, some of these states of activity take place so far beneath the ego or the subconscious that you simply do not know of them.现在。首先，到目前为止，某些这类活动的状态是发生在你不知道的自我和潜意识之下。
Some of these states take place above the ego or the subconscious, although I am using the terms above or below simply for your convenience. You think of the ego as the center of the self, therefore I am forced to use these terms. You think the other portions of the personality revolve about the ego.有的这些状态发生在自我或潜意识之上，虽然我用这个措词之上或之下是为了你们的方便。你认为自我是自己的中心点，所以我被迫要用这些措词。你认为人格的其他部分是环绕着自我转动的。
(Janes eyes now began to open widely. They were very dark. Her delivery was most emphatic, and she used many gestures, speaking rapidly.)(珍的眼睛现在开始睁得很大。它们非常深邃。她的口述非常有力，而她说得很快，用了很多手势。)
The ego is only one layer of the self that has self-consciousness. Being self-conscious, the ego attempts to be conscious only of itself. Self-consciousness results in an intense, but necessarily limited focus. It necessitates boundaries. It depends upon some sort of inner psychological decision as to what will be considered self, and therefore accepted by consciousness, and that which will be considered notself, and not accepted by consciousness.自我只是自己当中其中一层有自己意识的。作为自己意识，自我试图只对它自己有意识。自己意识造成一个强烈，但必要的局限性聚焦。它使界线成了必要。它依赖着某种内在心理上的决定，这导致了被意识接受的就被认为是自己，而没有被意识接受的就被认为是非自己。
Now, my dear friends, your self-consciousness is the self-consciousness of the ego which you know, and which you consider . But where this self -conscious self ends, another self-conscious self begins. The two selves, being self-conscious selves, cannot be aware of any reality but their own.They cannot be consciously aware of each other.现在，我亲爱的朋友，你的自己意识是你所知道的自我的自己意识，而这是你认为的你自己。但这个自己意识的自己结束的地方，就是另一个自己意识的自己开始的地方。这两个自己，身为自己意识的自己们，无法意识到除了它们自己以外的任何实相。
Now the ego interprets all it perceives mainly in terms of its self. Other portions of the self, also self-conscious, interpret what they perceive in terms of themselves.它们无法有意识地觉察到彼此。现在自我解读所有它感知到的，主要是就它自己而言。自己的其他部分，也是自己意识的，就它们自己来解读它们所感知到的。
Each layer, or each area of the whole self, imagines that it is the center of awareness, and that the whole self revolves about it. So far you have had little experience with these other “centers”—you may put that in quotation marks—but before too long we shall give you some ideas so that you may become at least slightly acquainted. Initially this will be done through suggestion on a subconscious level.全我的每一层，或每一个部分，都想像它是意识的中心，而这个全我绕着它旋转。目前为止，你对这些其他的“中心”有着很少的经验——你可以把它放在括号里——但很快地我们会给你一些概念，而让你至少对此变得有点熟悉。一开始这可以借由潜意识层面的暗示而做到。
Now. You have become somewhat aware of the subconscious. This means that your ego has enlarged its conception of the self, of itself, to include certain activities of which it is now aware. Progress in the development of personality in the long run will be determined by the ability of the whole self to recognize and become aware of all of its self-conscious portions.现在。你变得多少意识到了潜意识。这意味着你的自我扩大了这个自己，它自己，在这个概念，去涵盖了某些它现在意识到的活动。长期人格发展的进展，将会由全我认出和变得意识到所有它自己意识部分的这个能力所决定。
The subconscious is a self-conscious portion of the whole self. It is called subconscious because the ego as a rule is not conscious of it.潜意识是这个全我的一个自己意识部分。它被称作潜意识，是因为自我通常没有意识到它。
The subconscious, so-called, is aware to some extent of the ego, regarding it as an extension of itself, over which it does not have as much control as it would like. This is precisely however the way the ego views the subconscious, as a rule. These two self-conscious portions of the self simply happen to coincide or to coexist with some proximity, psychologically speaking.这个所谓的潜意识，意识到某些程度的自我，认为它是它自己的延伸，对此它并没有它所希望的对它有那么多的控制。不过，通常这正是自我看待潜意识的方式。心理上来说，自己的这两个自己意识部分，仅仅在某些邻近点上恰好是一致的，或共存的。
There are other self-conscious portions of the self however, with which the ego is not at all familiar, but of which the subconscious has intuitive knowledge. These self-conscious portions of the self exist in different reality systems. Before we go into our Dr. Instream material, let me remind you however that there is a whole self, composed of these various self-conscious selves, and that a portion of the self is indeed aware of the unity that exists to form the whole psychological gestalt.不过，这个自己有其他自己意识的部分，这些是自我一点都不熟悉的，但对此潜意识有着直觉的知识。这个自己的这些自己意识部分存在于不同的实相系统。在我们开始殷斯翠姆博士资料之前，让我提醒你，无论如何，这里有一个全我，由这些不同自己意识的自己们所组成，因此自己的一部分的确意识到那个存在着去形成整个心理完形的整体。
Now, a very brief break and we shall continue.现在，短暂的休息后，我们将会继续。
(Break at 9:58. Jane said she was dissociated more than usual. Her pace had slowed somewhat but been very emphatic, and her eyes opened many times. She had smoked, and sipped wine occasionally.(9:58休息。珍说她的出离状态比平常要好。她的速度慢了一点，但非常有力，而她的眼睛睁开很多次。她有抽烟，偶尔啜一口酒。
(It was now time for what we thought would be the 4lst and 42nd Dr. Instream experiments. As usual Jane sat with her hands raised to her closed eyes. She was not smoking. On the whole her pace was not slow, although broken by many short pauses. Resume at 10:05.)(现在，是时候开始第41和42次殷斯翠姆博士实验。如往常一样，珍坐着，手举到她闭着的眼睛上。她没有抽烟。整体来说她的速度不慢，虽然被很多短暂的停顿打断。10:05重新开始。)
Now, give us a moment, please—some moments—for this.现在，等我们一下，请——多等一会儿——为此。
These are impressions. Something that resembles a shield in shape, with inscriptions on it. Made I believe of metal, an insignia. Either the inscription or the insignia is of red color. The object itself of a metal color.印象是这些。某个像盾牌形状的东西，上面的刻印。我相信是铁制的，一个徽章。不管是刻字还是徽章，都是红色的。物件本身是金属色。
Fairly heavy in weight for its size. The edges of the object would ordinarily be sharp, it seems, but they are somewhat blunted. I get the numbers one eight eight eight, in connection with this.以它的大小来说，它的重量很重。物件的边缘原本应该很锋利的，但它似乎变得有些钝。我收到数字1888，和这个有关联。
Also a connection with flowers. Either they are represented somewhere on the object, or somehow connected with it, and small leaves. The flowers could be violets. The object is not full size. That is, it is not a soldiers shield of full size, but a representation. And a connection with jewelry.也和花有关联。或者物件某处有花，或某种和花的连结，还有小叶子。这花可能是紫罗兰。这物件并不是全尺寸的。意思是它不是士兵用的全尺寸的盾，而是一个象征。还有和珠宝有关联。
Give us another moment, please.请再等我们一下。
First, a connection with a scroll for the above object. The object which we have dealt with is Monday’s object. (For February 21.)首先，上面的物件和一个卷轴有关联。我们说的这个物件是星期一的物件。(2月21日)
(Jane paused at 10:12, took a sip of wine without appearing to open her eyes, then gave voice to the last sentence above. She resumed her previous position. I have seen her reach out for objects often without seeming to look at them. She appears to have no memory of opening her eyes on such occasions; if she does slit them open I cannot tell, even from my position across a narrow table from her.(珍在10:12分停顿了一下，闭着眼睛，啜了一口酒，然后说完上面最后一段。她重新开始时保持了之前的姿势。我看见她伸手去拿物件的时候，似乎常常是闭着眼睛的。在这种情形下她不记得她睁开了眼睛；如果她有睁开一点，我也看不出来，虽然我的位子和她的只隔了一张很窄的桌子。
(Jane spotted it at break at 10:28 before I did: part of the above data seems to pertain to this evenings envelope object. This was interesting to me especially. I prepared tonight's envelope sometime after supper, then forgot about it in the press of other business. When the time for the envelope experiment arrived, I then had the idea the envelope contained another object, one I had thought of earlier in the day. So my surprise was considerable, consciously, when Jane opened the envelope and revealed the coaster.)(珍在10:28的休息时间比我先看到它：上面一部分的资料似乎也适用于今晚的信封物件。这对我来说特别有趣。我在今天晚餐后才准备今晚的信封，然后因为忙其他的事情就忘了它。当信封实验的时间到的时候，我还以为信封是包含了另一个物件，一个今天稍早时我想到的物件。所以当珍打开信封露出杯垫的时候，意识上，我很惊讶。)
Now. Something round for this evenings object.现在。今晚的物件是某种圆的东西。
It has a connection with a clock, but is not a clock. It has hands but it does not tell time. The numbers four, three, six are connected here, and also a school-house. and a bell, such as one that is rung to some children to school.它和时钟有关联，但它不是时钟。它有指针，但不是指明时间。这里和数字4、3、6，也和一个校舍，还有一口钟，类似发出钟声要小孩去上学的那种钟有关。
A vest. (Pause at 10:16.) The object is smooth, with moving parts. Twice, something on it twice, or two times.一件背心。(10:16停顿)物件是平滑的，有可以动的部分。两次，某种东西在上面两次，或两遍。
Did I tell you this is this evenings object?我有告诉过你这是今晚的物件吗？
("Yes. ’’)(“是的。”)
Now, a turnabout for Dr. Instream of some sort, I believe professionally, or in his professional life. Ten students in particular. Tuesday at eight. An acclimation, acclaim.现在，殷斯翠姆博士的某种转变，我相信是专业上的，或他的专业生涯。特别是10个学生。星期二8点。对新环境的适应，喝彩。
A mission that worked out differently than he expected.一个工作发展得和他预期的不同。
Do you have a test for me, Joseph?你有测验要给我吗，约瑟？
("Yes.”(“是的。”
(At 10:20 I handed. Jane the 35th double envelope and she took it without opening her eyes. She held it against her forehead with her right hand.)(10:20。我递给珍第35次的信封，而她闭着眼睛接了过去。她用右手握着它放在前额上。)
Please give us a moment.请等我们一会儿。
Four, the number four, having to do with several of a kind. An enclosure. A specific event, which is anticipated. These connected with the item.4，数字4，和几个同样的东西有关，一个圈用地。一个具体的事件，在预料之中的。这些和这个物件有关。
Writing. A rectangular shape, with an indentation that could suggest a border. A paper item. Connected with the initials J R.字迹，一个长方形，有一个凹陷处可以是边。一个纸的物件。和缩写J R. 有关。
Terwilliger. This is not correct, but take it down, the Terwilliger.提维格(Terwilliger)。这并不正确，但写下来，提维格。
(Jane rather blurted out the word Terwilliger, as though somewhat surprised herself, then gestured impatiently, her eyes still closed.)(珍脱口说出了这个字提维格，好像连她自己也吓了一跳，然后急着比手势，她的眼睛仍闭着。)
A connection with grassy land, and strings, such as apron strings. Four, five, no, six, the number six. February. Someone runs away. A connection with round colored objects, and a person who was not familiar to you personally.和一片草地有关联，还有带子，像围裙的带子。4、5，不对，6，数字6。2月。某个人跑掉了。和一个圆的，彩色的物件有关，还有一个你私下并不熟悉的人。
Also a grading. Ten, September. Perhaps six three.也是一个整地。10，9月。也许是63。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:28. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed except for the possible instant noted during her pause at 10:12. In spite of the many brief pauses her pace had been good. On the average it is now much faster during these experiments than it used to be.(10:28休息。珍出离如常。她的眼睛仍闭着，除了上面说的10:12分停顿的一瞬间。虽然有很多短暂的停顿，她的速度仍然很好。平均来说，在这些实验期间，她现在速度比以前快。
(See the tracing of the envelope object on page 301. As stated, Jane was the first to notice that some of the data given for the Instream object of Monday, February 21, appeared to apply to our own envelope object for this evening, February 23.(见上面信封物件的描图。之前说过，珍是第一个注意到，2月21日星期一给的某些殷斯翠姆博士物件的资料，似乎可适用于今晚2月13日我们自己的信封物件上。
(How much of this data on page 305 might pertain to the Instream object we do not know, but Jane had intuitive feelings that a bleed-through had occurred involving the envelope object. I go along with her in that such feelings are legitimate, since the basis of these experiments, as Seth has told us many times, is emotional.(我们并不知道前面说的有多少资料是关于殷斯翠姆博士物件的，但珍有个直觉，她感觉信封物件可能发生了渗漏。我和她意见相同，这样的感觉是合理的，因为正如赛斯告诉我们很多次的，这些实验的基础是情感性的。
(Jane felt that the following impressions on page 305 could very well apply to the envelope object:(珍觉得前面的一些印象很适用在信封物件上：
(“Something that resembles a shield in shape, with inscriptions upon it.” We suppose that since shields are of many shapes, this can apply to the shape of the envelope object. The printed copy on the coaster can be inscriptions. Our dictionary does not distinguish as to whether inscriptions need be lettering or designs, such as the three glasses on the coaster, or can be both.(“某个像盾牌形状的东西，上面有刻印。”因为盾牌有很多种形状，我们假设这项可以适用在信封物件的形状上。杯垫上的图文可以说是刻印。我们的字典并没有区分的很清楚刻印必须是字，还是图，像杯垫上的三个杯子，或两者皆可。
(I was interested to note that our dictionary lists the word inscroll also, following inscriptive, and that the last line of the data for the Instream object for Monday contains this reference: “a connection with a scroll for the above object.”(有一件很有趣，我想要注明的是，我们的字典把卷轴这个字也列在刻印之后，而星期一殷斯翠姆博士物件最后一行的资料上包含了这项参考：“上面的物件和一个卷轴有关联”。
(“Either the inscription or the insignia is of red color.” Our envelope object, the coaster, is printed in a bright red. The color of the porous paper or board is a typical light beige or tan, not resembling metal, and certainly not heavy in weight for its size.
