Seth also mentioned these last two points in connection with the Instream data for Monday.(“不管是刻字还是徽章，都是红色的。”我们的信封物件，杯垫，是用鲜红色印的。透气纸或透气板的颜色是典型的浅褐色或棕褐色，并不像金属，当然它的重量也不重。赛斯也提到，这最后两点和星期一的殷斯翠姆博士资料有关。
(“The edges of the object would ordinarily be sharp, it seems, but they are somewhat blunted. ’’Jane was perhaps more definite concerning this impression, than any of the others. She feels the sharp edges is a reference to the beer glasses depicted on the coaster: one can think of glass ordinarily as sharp-edged, but to be useful as a drinking vessel the material would have its edges smoothed, or blunted.(“物件的边缘原本应该很锋利的，但它似乎变得有些钝。”也许珍对这个印象说得比其他的要具体。她感觉这个锋利的边缘指的是杯垫上描写的啤酒杯：玻璃通常是有锋利的边，但要用来作杯子，这个材料就要把边磨平，或是磨钝。
(“I get the numbers one eight eight eight, in connection with this. "My own idea here is that Seth/Jane picked up the three-ring design shown on each of the three glasses depicted on the coaster, and translated or converted this data into the number 8, three times. There is a graphic resemblance here. The numeral I appears in the code number, in small type, next to the bottom border.(“我收到数字1 8 8 8，和这个有关联。”我自己在这里的想法是，赛斯/珍收到三个玻璃杯上面三个圈的图案而转译或转换成数字8，三次。这里有一个图案上的相似。数字1出现在编码上，小字，靠近底部的边缘。
(Seth goes over the envelope results with us to some extent this evening, and answers a few questions pertaining to such experiments. First however there follows the connections Jane and I made with the envelope object, and Seth’s data on page 306.(赛斯今晚和我们一起浏览过测验结果，也回答了关于这些实验的一些问题。不过首先，以下是珍和我对这个信封物件和赛斯在前面资料所做的连结。
(“Four, the number four, having to do with several of a kind.” There is a connection here but we did not see it at the time. Seth reminds us of it later in the session.(“4，数字4，和几个同样的东西有关”，这里有一个连结，但我们当时没有看到。赛斯在后来的课里提醒我们。
(“An enclosure. " We thought this a reference to the dining and dancing establishment we visited last Saturday evening, February 19, where I picked up the envelope object. Not to the establishment itself, but to the particular table we sat at with the other two couples. Its location, in one corner of the place, is unique; it sits on a raised platform perhaps two feet higher than the other tables; the dance band is on the left, the fireplace on the right, with an excellent view of the dance floor in between. The table itself is round, and backed up by a wide circular leather-covered divan-type of seat. In short, it's the best seat in the house.(“一个圈用地。”我们认为这指的是上星期六，2月19日，我们去的那家吃饭和跳舞的餐厅，在那里我拿了信封物件。不是指餐厅，而是我们和其他两对夫妻坐的那个特殊的桌子。它的位置很特殊，是在那地方的一个角落；它位于一个比其他桌子高两尺的台子上；舞厅的乐队在左边，壁炉在右边，那里对中间的跳舞区有着良好的视野。桌子本身是圆的，后面有宽敞的、圆形的皮制厚垫椅子。简单地说，是整个房间里最好的位子。
(“A specific event, which is anticipated. These connected with the item.” This is a reference to the Saturday evening of dancing, which was planned in advance by us with the other two couples, Marilyn and Don Wilbur, and Ann Diebler and Paul Sinderman. Certainly it was anticipated with pleasure.(“一个具体的事件，在预料之中的。这些和这个物件有关。”这指的是周六晚上的跳舞，这是我们和另外两对夫妻玛丽莲和唐·韦伯，还有安·黛伯乐和保罗·席德曼预先计划好的。当然也如预料中开心。
(Note above that Seth first gives data connected with the object; next he tries to become more specific about the object itself. Later in the session he has something to say about this method.(注意到上面，赛斯先给关于这个物件的资料；接下来他试着对这个物件本身说得更具体。后来在这节课中他对这个方法做了说明。
(“Writing.” The object bears printed copy.(“字迹。”这物件上有印制的字体。
(“A rectangular shape", does not obviously apply, in that the coaster measures square within 1/12 inches.(“一个长方形。”并不明显的适用，这杯垫量起来是三十二分之一英寸的正方形。
(“with an indentation that could suggest a border.” The object has a border, as can be seen in the tracing. In actuality the border is indented, or debossed, into the porous paper or cardboard material of the coaster, to the extent that it can be easily felt with the ball of the finger. This is a common effect obtained easily enough by the printer, through control of the pressure the printing plate applies to the object, and one which I work with often on my job. Jane however is not familiar with the term, debossed.(“有一个凹陷处可能是边。”这个物件有一个边，可以在素描里看到。事实上，这个杯垫的透气纸或纸板的边是凹陷的凹卡印刷，某种程度上很容易以手指感觉出来。这是一个印刷上很常见的效果，是透过印刷板模压在物件上的力道所控制的，而这个在我的工作上很常见。不过珍并不熟悉这个词汇，凹卡印刷。
(“A paper item.” The envelope object is a paper item. As stated, it originally was quite thick, so I peeled the top layer from it, containing the design printed in red, to insert into the double envelopes. This reduced it to the thickness of rather heavy writing paper. When this thin layer was enclosed between the regular two pieces of Bristol, then sealed in the usual double envelope, it was not possible to judge by feel, or weight, that it was in any way somewhat different from the usual envelope object.(“一个纸制的物品。”信封物件是一个纸制的物品。之前说过，它本来很厚，所以我撕下上面那一层有红色图案的，把它放进信封里。这样就减轻了厚度和重量。这薄薄的一层纸被放进两个厚纸板中间，然后放进信封封好后，就不可能由感觉或重量来判断它是什么，但无论如何，它都和普通的信封物件有些不同。
(“Connected with the initials J R.” Jane said she felt this was a reference to the entity names Seth has assigned to us, Joseph and Ruburt. Of course this kind of data could apply to many envelope objects.(“和缩写J R.有关”，珍说，她感觉这个指的是，赛斯说的约瑟和鲁柏的存有名字。当然这种资料可以适用在很多信封物件上。
(“Terwilliger.”, etc. This meant nothing to us, although Seth explains it later. At the moment Jane could only say that she had also found herself writing the word down in her daily predictions a few times lately, without knowing why.(“提维格”等，这对我们来说没有代表任何意义，虽然赛斯后来有解释。当时珍只说，她发现自己最近在每日预测里总共写下这个字好几次，不知道为什么。
(“A connection with grassy land’’, led Jane to say a connection could be seen with the envelope object after all. When she gave this impression, she had the mental impression of grain; thus her voicing the word grassy came from the mental grain. Jane had the idea, now, that the envelope object advertised beer, made from grain.(“和一片草地有关联”，这最后引导珍说了一个和信封物件有关的连结。当她给这个印象的时候，她有一个稻谷的心里印象；她说出的这个字“草地”，是来自于心里面稻谷的印象。珍现在有个想法，信封物件广告了啤酒，而啤酒是由稻谷制成的。
(This interpretation is not correct, as will be seen. Instead Seth leads us to recall the rather hilarious incident Saturday evening that did give rise to this impression.(这个解读不正确，等下会看到。相反的，赛斯引导我们回想星期六晚上一个引发这个印象的有趣事件。
(“and strings, such as apron strings.” We did not see any connection right away.(“还有带子，像围裙的带子。”我们没有立即看到有什么连结。
(“Four, five, no, six, the number six.” Here again Seth leads Jane by his method of counting. There were six of us in our gathering last Saturday evening, when I obtained the envelope object.(“4，5，不对，6，数字6。”这里再次的，赛斯用他计数的方式引导珍。上星期六晚上，当我拿到信封物件时，我们有6个人。
(“February.” I picked up the object on February 19, but this is too general.(“2月。”我拿到这个物件是在2月19日，但这个太笼统了。
(“Someone runs away.” I thought this a reference to the fact that Don Wilbur and his wife Marilyn left the dancing establishment somewhat earlier than the rest of us did, because he was very tired after putting many hours of overtime work for the county, in connection with the snow we have been getting this month. This was not correct.(“某个人跑掉了。”我想这是指唐·韦伯和他的妻子玛丽莲比我们其他人提早离开跳舞的地方，因为在为郡政府超时工作了好几个小时之后，他已经很累了。加班和我们这个月下了很多雪的这件事有关。这并不正确。
(“A connection with round colored objects, I thought this might be a vague reference to the fact that Marilyn found in her handbag, Saturday night at the establishment, a group of miniature plastic castings of animals that she had made for her two-year old son. They were translucent, of different colors, tiny horses that were not round as a marble is round, but with rounded simple Lines. We toyed with them throughout the evening.(“和一个圆的彩色物件有关。”我认为这可能是一个模糊的参考，指的是玛丽莲在她手袋里找到的东西，一组小的动物塑胶模型，是她为两岁儿子制作的。它们是半透明的，有各种颜色，小马不像弹珠这么圆，但是有着简单的圆弧线。我们整个晚上都把玩着它们。
(I did not think to query Seth about this impression later, so do not know if my interpretation is correct.(我后来忘了问赛斯这个印象，所以不知道我的解读是不是对的。
(“and a person who was not familiar to you personally.” The connection here is tied in with the “grassy lands” data, but Jane and I did not see it during break.(“还有一个私下和你并不熟悉的人。”这里的连结是和“草地”的资料连在一起的，但珍和我在休息的时候没有发现。
(“Also a grading.” We did not see anything here.(“也有一个整地”，我们不知道这指的是什么？。
(“Ten, September. Perhaps six three.” If this referred to the date, September 10, 1963, we were unable to make any immediate connection. Nor did any other interpretation occur to us.(“10，9月，也许是63。” 如果这指的是日期，1963年9月10日，我们无法立即做任何连结。我们也没想到其他的解释。
(Jane's eyes began to open at times when she resumed, at an average pace, at 10:50.)(当珍以一个适中的速度在10:50分重新开始的时候，她的眼睛开始有时候会睁开。)
Now. We shall shortly end our session.现在。我们很快就要结束这一节了。
The date is pertinent, but I will let you figure this one out for yourself.日期是有关的，但我会让你们自己发现。
(I can offer a connection, but cannot verify it with Seth until next session. After this session I remembered that the Wilburs are reading what we call Book One of the Seth material. This consists of the first 26 sessions. The first formal session was held December 2,1963. My introductory notes contain a reference to Jane and me borrowing a Ouija board from our landlord “in the fall of1963, ” which compares with the date given by Seth this evening, of September 10,1963. The notes refer to our attempts to use the board early in November 1963 also, without success.)(可以提供一个连结，但直到下一节课才能向赛斯确认。这一节课结束后，我想起来韦伯正在阅读赛斯资料的第一册。这包含了前26节。第一节正式的课是在1963年12月2日举行的。我的介绍里说明了珍和我在“1963年秋天”向我们的房东借了一个灵应盘，这可以对比于赛斯今晚给的资料，1963年9月10日。这个注记也包括了我们试图在1963年11月初用这个盘，但没有成功。)
The initials J R were to refer to you both.缩写J R指的是你们俩个人。
By the person not familiar to you, I meant to refer to someone not a friend—this being your obnoxiously pleasant Rice—and this was the grain. Now, you see.那个不熟悉的人，我本来指的是某个不是朋友的人——这是指你们讨厌的瑞斯——也就是那个稻谷(译注：瑞斯Rice和稻谷同音)。现在你明白了吧。
(Jane paused and smiled broadly. See the reference to “A connection with grassy land, ” and “and a person who was not familiar to you personally.” in the envelope data. At once I recalled an incident that took place at the dancing establishment last Saturday evening; the six in our party had watched it with much amusement.(珍停顿，笑得很灿烂。见信封资料的“和一片草地有关联”和“一个私下和你并不熟悉的人”。我马上想起一件发生在上星期六晚上舞厅的事；当时我们6个人很有兴趣的看着这件事。
(It involved a man I see very occasionally at my job. He works in another department, and is named Hack Rice. Jane and I see him more often when out dancing that I do on the job. He is always accompanied by his wife. Early Saturday evening, we saw Hack Rice and his wife dancing, and said hello as we usually do. At this time Hack was quiet and smiling.(这和一个我在工作上很少会看到的男人有关。他在另一个部门工作，他的名字是汉克·瑞斯[Hack Rice]。珍和我在出去跳舞的时候看到他的次数还比工作时要多。他总是和他妻子一起。在星期六晚上稍早时，我们看到汉克·瑞斯和他的妻子正在跳舞，就像平常一样，我们向他打了招呼。这一次汉克安静的微笑。
(For a while the couple then disappeared from view and we forgot about them. Much later, around midnight, when the floor was crowded, Jane and I saw Hack again. Now he was obviously feeling good, and dancing with another woman. Hack is what they call a slow and smooth dancer. To the amusement of most people, Hack and the woman, whom we did not know, put on quite an exhibition of exaggerated, sinuous, close-contact dancing.(过了一会儿，这对夫妇就消失在我们的视线里，我们也忘了他们。后来，凌晨左右，当舞池挤满了人时，珍和我又看到了汉克。他现在的心情明显很好，而且和另一个女人在跳舞。汉克是一个动作缓慢流畅的舞者。我们很有趣地发现，汉克和这个我们不认识的女人，当时正表演着非常夸张、复杂、贴身的舞步。
(So Jane, while voicing the impression of “grassy land”, had the mental impression of grain, which referred to a man named Rice, who was present in the place where I obtained the envelope object. The connections are as far out as Hack Rice's funny behavior.)(所以珍说“草地”这个印象时，有着稻谷的心理印象，这也指的是这个名叫瑞斯的人，他出现在我拿到信封物件的地方。这个连结和汉克·瑞斯有趣的举止同样的奇怪。)
The apron strings referred to your Marilyn, who holds her son on her apron strings.围裙带子指的是你们的玛丽莲，她在围裙的带子上系着儿子。
(This reminded Jane and me that during Saturday evening, Marilyn had described to us how her young son had discovered what fun there was to the universal game of hanging by his mother's apron strings, as she tried to go about her duties in the trailer home in nearby Wellsburg, NY.(这提醒了珍和我，在星期六晚上。玛丽莲描述给我们听，她的小男孩发现吊在妈妈的围裙上是多么有趣的游戏，当时她在靠近纽约威斯伯格的拖车式房子里做个尽责的妈妈。)
(“What about your reference to the number four?”)(“你说的数字4指的是什么？”)
The four in the beginning was merely my effort to lead Ruburt further, in counting as I did do later on, ending up with our correct six. The number, as a beginning number, was chosen because it does appear, though minutely, on the item itself. Also, there were four, initially, and then six. I came in. so to speak, when there were four.一开始的4只是我努力把鲁柏引导得更深，在我后来计数的过程中，最后到达了正确的6。作为一个开始的数字，这个数字被选择是因为它就这么出现了，虽然在物件上很微弱。还有，一开始是4，然后到6。这样说，还在4的时候，我进来了。
(The number 4 does appear in the small code number printed on the envelope object, inside the bottom border. We missed noting this during break. We had also forgotten that we met Marilyn and Don Wilbur first at the dancing establishment, and had time for our first drink before Ann Diebler and her escort, Paul Sinderman, arrived.(数字4的确出现在信封物件底部靠边的编码上。我们休息的时候忘了写下这一点。我们也忘了在舞厅，我们是先遇到玛丽莲和唐·韦伯的，然后在安·黛伯乐和她的男伴保罗·席德曼抵达前，我们还喝了第一杯酒。
(“Do you want to say something about the Terwilliger reference?”)(“你想说一下关于提维格吗？”)
This had no connection. The Gallaghers were at a party that evening. They were somewhat on Ruburts mind, and the name Terwilliger is a subconscious designation he uses for them. A distortion of the words Tim and Gallagher, simply because Tim has a particularly Gaelic connotation for him. More so than Bill, which is our Jesuit’s first name.这里没有关联。加拉格夫妇那晚也在一个派对。鲁柏把他们放在心上，这个名字提维格是鲁柏的潜意识用来称呼他们的名字。是提姆和加拉格的扭曲，只因为提姆有一个盖尔语的含义。这关系比比尔的强，那是耶稣会信徒的姓。
A distant connection here, you see, with Dickens, and little Tim of the Christmas Carol, and other connections hardly worth mentioning here.你知道这里有一个狄更生，还有圣诞歌里面的小提姆遥远的连结，而其他的连结在这里不值得一提。(译注：圣诞颂歌是狄更生的作品，小提姆是书里的角色。)。
Do you have any other questions?你还有任何其他的问题吗？
("How about clearing up the reference to grading? ”(“你能说一下整地吗？”
(Jane smiled. Her eyes were opening now, and she lit a cigarette.)(珍微笑。她的眼睛现在睁开了，而且点了一支烟。)
The grading was, I am afraid, a poor reference to the parking lot, which was paved recently.我恐怕，整地可能是有关停车格的一个薄弱的连结，停车格是最近铺的。
(True. The large parking lot at the dancing establishment, once consisting of the usual rather loose gravel, had been paved with amacite late last fall.(这是真的，舞厅的大型停车格一度是以相当松散的砂石组成的，是去年秋天才铺好的。
(“What do you think of me asking you a question once in a while during an experiment?“(“你觉得如果偶尔我在实验中问你问题怎么样？”)
(I had been wondering lately if an occasional question might not produce more specific results. At times I’d had the distinct feeling that such questions would provide enough of a nudge to bring forth more data, but had hesitated because I didn't want the questions to be considered leading.)(我最近有点好奇，如果偶尔问问题会不会带出更明确的结果。有时候我很清楚的感觉，这样的问题可能会带出更多资料，但迟疑着没有做，是因为我不希望这些问题被认为是引导性的。
It would be better if you asked me a question at the immediate ending of a test, rather than interrupt the data. Simply say, I have a question for you, or I will have a question for you.如果你要问我问题，在测验一结束时问会比中间打断资料问要好。只要简单地说，我有一个问题要问你，或我会有一个问题要问你。
A simple one-word question would probably not be harmful, but it is best for now to wait until the end.一个简单的问题应该是无伤大雅的，但现在来说最好是等到结束的时候。
Now. On those occasions where there is some bleeding through, I attempt to make some specific points in any case, that are identifying.现在。在其他时候会有一些渗漏，无论如何我试图提出一些具体的证明，那是可被认出来的。
(“Did that happen tonight?”)(“这在今晚有发生吗？”)
To some degree. This merely involves my efforts to teach Ruburt to focus more specifically. It is a learning process.某种程度。这涉及了我努力教鲁柏聚焦得更具体。它是一个学习的过程。
(Now see my notes on page 305, concerning my consciously forgetting the contents of the double envelope used in this evenings experiment. I was sure that subconsciously however I knew the contents well.(现在见我前面的笔记，关于我意识上忘记了今晚实验的信封内容。但无论如何我很确定我潜意识对这内容却很清楚。
(“Well, it seems the data on the Instream object for last Monday became entangled with tonight 's envelope object data. Did you pick this up from me, telepathically, or clairvoyantly from the envelope object itself”)(“看起来上星期一殷斯翠姆博士物件的资料，似乎和今晚信封物件的资料缠在一起。你是心电感应式的从我这里收到资料，或从信封物件本身来的预知？” )
No, this was a clairvoyant activity.不，这是一个预知的活动。
(“From the envelope object itself, some time before we got to the envelope experiment.”(“从信封物件本身？在我们开始信封实验之前吗？”
(In the 180th session, after the second envelope experiment, Seth told us he worked well clairvoyantly with objects, although at times telepathy could enter into such experiments.)(在第180节，在第二次信封实验后，赛斯告诉我们，他在预言这个物件的时候做得很好，有时候这类实验会发生心电感应。)
Yes. From the color red, which has strong connotations. The strongest elements are perceived more easily, as emotional elements are always perceived more easily. Initially with objects, I pick up shapes, and emotional connections, and then try to get Ruburt to let me narrow these down more specifically.是的，从红色开始说，它有强烈的含义。最强烈的元素最容易被感知到，就像情感性的元素总是比较容易被感知到。一开始对于物件，我收到形状，还有情感性的连结，然后试着让鲁柏帮我更明确的缩小范围。
Ruburt, you see, does not perceive shapes as I do. Also he does not deal with details, as far as his overall perceptive patterns are concerned, and I am teaching him to do so psychically in these tests.你知道，鲁柏并没有像我一样感知到形状，就他整体感知的模式而言，他也没有处理细节。在这些测验里我在心灵上教他这么做。
(“Then did your 'Someone runs away.' envelope data have a strong emotional color?"(“那你的“某个人跑掉了”这个信封资料里，有强烈的情感色彩吗？”
(See page 306.)(见上面的笔记。)
This had to do with the quick and too-speedy journey of one of the young men. I perceived a fast journey.这和一个年轻人高速的旅程有关。我收到一个高速的旅程。
(This referred to Ann Diebler's escort, Paul Sinderman. Paul holds a job in Norfolk, VA. He makes the 1200. mile round trip to Wellsburg, a small town just outside Elmira, to see Ann every other weekend. We were discussing the amount of driving this involved, during our evening at the dancing establishment last Saturday. Paul has been in at least one auto accident that we know of.(这和安·黛伯乐的男伴保罗·席德曼有关。保罗在维吉尼亚州诺福克工作。他每两个星期开1200英里的路到威斯伯格，一个埃尔迈拉附近的小镇去看安。我们上星期六在舞厅的那晚，讨论了他到底开了多少路。就我们就知，保罗至少出了一次车祸。
(“Did you make any of that journey, to or from Norfolk?")(“你有收到去或回诺福克的旅程吗？”)
No I did not. Our progress will be clear to those who read our records. There will be fluctuations. As larger areas are perceived more training is needed on Ruburt’s part, to give us specifics. But we shall get a hold of these specifics.不，我没有。我们的进展对那些有读我们记录的人会很清楚。这里会有起伏。当要感知到更广大的领域，鲁柏需要更多的测验才能告诉我们更具体的。但我们应该掌握这些更具体的。
(“Is there any training involved here for you also?”)(“你在这里有涉及任何训练吗？”)
No. There is effort involved, as I learn, indeed, the best ways of giving Ruburt data, and try to guide him in discriminating between, or rather among, the many personal associations that any one legitimate impression may bring to his mind.没有。这里确实有涉及努力，就我学到的，给鲁柏资料最好的方式，并试着引导他从很多个人联想里，分辨可能来到他心中任何一个合理的印象。
On occasion he is in somewhat deeper a trance state, and our results are better, but this does not teach him what I want him to learn. The light trance state is ideal for my purposes. For with this training he will be able to give specific information, but he will also have some knowledge of how this comes about. Do you have any more questions?有时候他会在比较深的出离状态，那我们的结果就会比较好，但这并没有教给他我想要他学的。轻度出离状态最适合我的目的，在这些训练中，他必须能给出更具体的讯息，但他也会有一些知识了解这是如何发生的。你有任何其他的问题吗?
(“No, not for tonight. ")(“没有了，至少今晚没有了。”)
I will then close our session.那么我要结束了。
("It's been very good. ")(“它很棒。”)
Ruburt will find, and you will find, that his latest endeavors have born fruit, and not lemons.鲁柏会发现，而你也会发现，他最近的努力有了成果，那并不是徒劳无功的。
(“Good. I'm sure he’s interested. Good night, Seth.”(“很好。我确信他会很感兴趣。晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:15. Jane was dissociated as usual, her eyes open often. She ended the session with a smile. Presumably Seth refers to the writings she has sent out recently. Her publisher, F. Fell, has written expressing interest in her book on the Seth material and on the poetry book described in the 232nd session, page 269. Jane has also received a letter concerning some of these poems from Playboy Magazine, regarding their consideration for publication as a book. All of this is tentative. In addition Jane mailed her article to Fate Magazine recently. See page 287 in Session 233. Seth said the article would sell.(11:15结束，珍出离如常，她的眼睛常常睁开。她以一个微笑结束了这节课。可能赛斯提到了她最近寄出的文章。她的出版商，费尔，写信表达了他对赛斯资料和第232节里描述的诗集感兴趣。珍也收到了一封信，是有关于她登在《花花公子杂志》上的一些诗，他们打算出版成一本书。所有这些都是不确定的。此外珍最近寄出了写给《命运杂志》的那篇文章。见第233节。赛斯说过这篇文章会卖出去。
(Tracing of the pencil drawing on white paper, used as the object in the 36th envelope experiment, in the 236th session for February 28,1966. Drawing executed by my boss, Harry Gottesman, at the Artistic Card Company in Elmira, NY.)用在1966年2月28日第236节第36次信封实验的物件，是一张白纸上用铅笔画的素描。是由我的老板，亨利·盖特曼在纽约州埃尔迈拉的艺术卡公司所画的
(Reduced tracing of my pencil sketch on transparent tracing paper. There are pencil rubbings on the back, so the sketch can be traced. The object is folded, and enters into the envelope data.)在透明素描纸上我铅笔素描的缩图。后面有铅笔的拓本，所以素描可以用描的。这个物件是折起来放进信封资料

SESSION 236 第236节 ESP书出版 信封36


FEBRUARY 28, 1966 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1966年2月28日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(A short unscheduled session took place last night, Sunday, February 27, after our guests, the Gallaghers, had left. It was held in our living room and lasted from II PM to about 11:35 PM. I took no notes; this account is written from memory the following day.(昨晚，2月27日星期天，在我们的客人加拉格夫妇离开后，有一节短暂的临时课。这节课在我们的客厅里举行，从晚上11点到11:35分。我没有做笔记；这篇记录是我第二天根据记忆写的。
(The evenings conversation had largely concerned matters other than Seth, but his name had been mentioned. After the Gallaghers left Jane said she could feel Seth “buzzing around.” Shortly after this she began speaking as Seth, in an average voice; she was smoking; she gestured often, and eventually her eyes began to open. She spoke without a break until the session ended. It was a question and answer affair for the most part. I will summarize the main points covered. I did not ask Seth the type of question I would prefer being answered in writing.(今晚的讨论大部分围绕着赛斯以外的话题，但他的名字有被提到。在加拉格夫妇离开后，珍说她可以感觉赛斯“在附近低声说话”。很快，她开始以一个适中的音量为赛斯说话；她抽烟；她常常比手势，最后她的眼睛开始睁开。直到这节课完结，她都没有间断。大部分是问与答的形式。我会摘录主要的重点。我没有问赛斯那些我希望用写下来的方式回答的问题。
(Seth began by discussing a very emotional dream I had on the night of Thursday, February 24, involving what seemed to be the death of my father. I had not asked him to go into the dream yet, but had considered it, as Jane knew. Seth explained how the dream was built around my subconscious fears concerning my father. His interpretation of the dream was detailed, and in the manner of those he dissected in the 216th and 217th sessions. The conclusions were somewhat similar, and contained Seth’s assertions that the death of my father is not imminent, although 的he is 75. Seth went into one of the basic problems behind the dream, the lack of an easy communication between my father and myself. He said this particular problem is more my father’s fault than mine, and went into some methods concerning how I could begin to bridge this gap.(赛斯一开始就讨论了我在2月24日星期四晚上做的一个非常情感性的梦，似乎涉及了我父亲的死。我还没请他讨论这个梦，但如珍所知的，我有这么想过。赛斯解释这个梦是怎样的建立在我潜意识对父亲的恐惧上。他以他在第216和217节那种剖析的方式，仔细地解读了这个梦。结论有点相似，赛斯说了，我父亲的死并不是马上会发生，虽然他已经75岁了。赛斯讨论了这个梦背后的一个基本问题，我父亲和我之间缺乏一个简单的沟通。他说这个特定的问题比较是我父亲的错，还讨论了一些我可以如何开始建立桥梁的方法。
(Seth reiterated that Janes book on the Seth material would be published, and that the poetry book would be published. He did not say who would publish them, and I did not ask. See page 269 of the 232nd session for background material and other references. Janes publisher F. Fell, has written asking for photographs pertaining to the Seth book; in connection with this and in answer to my question, Seth said he would be amused to see a reproduction of my painting, purporting to be Seth, in the book. I’d done my oil of Seth in May/June of1965.(赛斯重申了，珍写的赛斯资料会出版，而诗集也会出版。他没有说是由谁出版，而我也没有问。见第232节的背景资料和其他参考。珍的出版商费尔写信询问有关赛斯书的照片；和这件事有关也同时回答了我的问题，赛斯说他会很高兴地看到那张复制的、我声称是赛斯的画放在书里。我在1965年5/6月用油画画的。
(I discussed with Seth the surprise with which Jane and I have watched young people take to his ideas on time, dreams, clairvoyance, telepathy, etc.; with this I speculated as to the reaction of Jane or myself had we been introduced to such ideas at the age of20 or so. Seth said there was no cause for surprise here, that young people are intuitively aware of much more than one gives them credit for, and that when Jane and I meet young people who express interest we should help them by recommending books, giving our own ideas, etc.(我很惊讶地和赛斯讨论了珍和我所看到的，年轻人接受他对时间、梦、预知力、心电感应等等的概念、因为这个，我思考着，如果我们20岁左右就接触了这样的观念，我们自己会有的反应。赛斯说不需要惊讶，年轻人其实更直觉地了解到这些，而当珍和我遇见对此有兴趣的年轻人时，我们应该借由介绍书、分享我们自己的概念等等方式帮助他们。
(Seth also said we have helped the Gallaghers, and that they have helped us. He said I have been particularly benefited, since they have the ability to open me up, whereas I had always thought Jane benefited most, because of her very warm relationship with Peggy. Jane is more outgoing than I am.(赛斯也说我们帮助了加拉格夫妇，而他们也帮助了我们。他说我特别的受益，因为他们有让我开放的能力，因为珍和蓓很亲近，我总是认为是珍受益最多。珍比我外向。
(Seth had some interesting things to say about using suggestion. The kernel of thought here is that it is important to use whatever suggestions we want to, daily; he stressed the importance of not missing a day. He explained that in a given period of say, thirty days, the suggestions on perhaps but three or four days within that period would be really effective, and that as of now we have no way of knowing the best days. So if we miss a day, we run a chance of missing out on a particularly effective day for suggestion. Seth said that on occasion suggestion will reach all levels of the personality, that our voice will be heard throughout the personality, and that effective action will follow. There was more here but the above is the main point made.(关于运用暗示，赛斯有一些有趣的事情要说。这里的核心思想是，去用我想要的暗示，不管是什么，每天去做；他强调重点是，不要错过任何一天。他以一个特定的时段，30天来说，在这段时间里面，暗示可能只有3或4天是真正有效的，但现在，我们无法知道最有效的是哪些天。因此如果我们错过了一天，我们可能就错过了那个暗示特别有效的日子。赛斯说，暗示偶尔会达到人格的所有层面，那我们的声音就会遍及整个人格的被听见，而有效的行动就会随之而来。这里还有更多，但上面所提的是最主要的重点。
(I asked no questions about other major topics, such as the envelope experiments, Dr. Instream, etc., preferring to have such answers in writing. Our exchange was leisurely and quiet, and Jane was dissociated as usual.(我没有再问其他的主题，比如说信封实验、殷斯翠姆博士实验等等，我比较喜欢这些答案用写下来的。我们的交流是悠闲宁静的，而珍出离如常。
(Two additional notes to add to the above account: Seth told me we might have witnesses to the session scheduled for Wednesday, March 2, but he did not say how many and I did not ask. He also said Jane should use suggestion to teach herself to sleep without a pillow. This would benefit her as an individual greatly, he said, and promised to go into the reasons later. When I remarked that I often woke up to notice that Jane was sleeping without a pillow, having pushed it aside in her sleep, Seth said this was an indication that her subconscious knew what it was doing. I sleep with a heavier pillow than Jane uses, and sometimes use two; Seth said my reasons were different than Jane's and that in this case the pillows were not a hindrance.(对上述的描述要加注两点：赛斯告诉我，我们可以在3月2日星期三那天邀请参与者，但他没说多少人，而我也没有问。他也说珍应该运用暗示教她自己不用枕头而睡觉。他说，以个人来说，这会对她大大地有益，他也答应以后会说明原因。当我说起我常常醒来时注意到珍没有用枕头睡觉，她在睡梦中把它推到一旁。赛斯说，这显示了她的潜意识知道要怎么做。我用的枕头比珍用的要高，有时候会用到两个；赛斯说我的理由和珍不同，在这个例子上，枕头并不是妨碍。
(Seth used Janes pillow data to go on to explain that she had a habit of sleeping with her hands tensed, or sometimes clenched, and that this allowed tension to move up her arms, across her shoulders and into the upper back and neck. Sometimes upon arising Jane will notice a stiffness in her upper back and neck, which wears away as she becomes active. Suggestion re the hands would help, according to Seth.(赛斯用珍枕头的资料继续解释，她有一个睡觉的习惯是手会绷紧，或有时候攥紧，而这会让紧绷往上延伸到手臂，穿过肩膀，到达上背和头部。有时候早上起来时，珍会发现她的上背和头部很僵硬，而这会耗损了她的活动性。据赛斯说，针对手而去运用暗示会有帮助。
(The 36th envelope experiment was held tonight. See the tracings on pages 313. 14. The drawing on 313 is the actual envelope object. The drawing on 314 is executed by myself, after my boss's drawing and instructions, and enters into the envelope data in the manner in which the four letters became involved with the envelope object in the 234th session. The relationship tonight is simpler, however.(今晚举行第36次信封实验。见上面的素描。第一幅是真实的信封物件。第二幅是我自己画的，是在我老板的指示和他的画作之后画的，结果就像第234节那四封信都涉及了信封物件的方式一样，不过今晚的关系比较简单。
(Today Jane received the galley proofs of her ESP book, along with the original manuscript, from her publisher by special delivery. We noted that most of the typed pages of her script bore handwritten comments in the margins and on the back. They were made evidently either by a psychologist or parapsychologist, probably at the invitation of the publisher before he accepted the book. We had considered this possibility, although the publisher had not mentioned it to us.(今晚，珍从她的出版社那里收到了限时专送的ESP书的校样和原始手稿。我们注意到，大部分她稿件页数的空白处和背后都带有手写的评论。明显是由心理学家或超心理学家写的，可能是在出版社接受这本书之前邀请他们写的。我们思考了这个可能性，虽然出版社没有跟我们提过。
(Someone had then laboriously used a magic marker to try to cross out the notes so they couldn’t be read; we were much amused to read them rather easily by holding the pages up to a light. The comments run the gamut from scorn to approval, and tell us as much about their author as they do about Janes book. Jane plans to ask her publisher, F. Fell, for the name of the author of the notes, and for a copy of the covering letter he refers to. We have initials. Seth also comments on the events, although we did not ask him to.(有人费力的用奇异笔试着删掉这些注记以便让人无法辨认；我们怀着有趣的心情把纸放在灯下阅读。评论从嗤之以鼻到赞同全部都有，而那告诉了我们很多有关写信者的讯息。珍打算问她的出版商费尔，这些注记的作者名字，还有他的封面短签的副本，我们有缩写。虽然我们没有问，但赛斯也评论了这一件事。
(Jane was pleased at the choice of type for the book, and the manner in which Seth's quotes have been distinguished from her own copy. The arrival of the galleys had excited her, but she felt the excitement stemmed from not from this alone, but from the manner in which they arrived from New York City. She apparently had the situation covered in her daily predictions for the two previous days.(珍对这本书所选择的形态很满意，方式是，赛斯的引述和她自己的分开。收到校稿让她很兴奋，但她感觉她的兴奋不单只源自于这个校稿，而也是它们从纽约市送达的方式。她在两天前的每日预测里就清楚预测了这个情况。
(Without going into details her predictions involved a lost package and other pertinent forecasts having to do with delays. The post office fouled up here, misplacing the special delivery notice, then failing to make delivery, etc. Finally when Jane went to the post office just before closing time today to claim the package, it proved to be lost again, this time on the premises. It was found after a lengthy search.(她的预测并没有包含细节，但涉及了一个遗失的包裹及其他关于延迟的预测。在这里邮局出了一点问题，把限时专送的通知单乱放，所以没办法送达等等。所以当珍今天在邮局快关门前去领包裹时，发现找不到包裹，花了很长时间寻找才找到。
(Previous to obtaining the package, Jane spent several hours in a strong state of worry and anticipation, and feels this state was a clairvoyant/telepathic attempt to give her conscious self information concerning the package. She believes her tension prevented her understanding what she was trying to tell herself. Her publisher had not advised her the galleys were on the way, incidentally.(在拿到包裹之前，珍有几个小时既担心又期待，而且她感觉在这个状态下，心电感应试图要给她有意识的自己关于这个包裹的讯息。她相信她的紧张妨碍了她试图告诉自己的讯息。顺带一提，出版商并没有通知她校稿送出了。
(Tonight's session was held in our large front room. Jane felt good as session time arrived, and perhaps for this reason Seth spoke at a somewhat slower pace than usual. There were many very brief pauses. Jane's eyes opened almost at once, briefly, closed, then began their usual fluctuation. Her voice was average. She lit a cigarette soon after she began.)(今晚的课是在我们前面大房间举行的。上课时间到的时候珍的感觉很好，也许是这个原因，赛斯以一种比平常还要慢的速度说话。有很多非常短暂的停顿。珍的眼睛几乎马上睁开，短暂的，又闭上，然后开始了平常的眼皮起伏。她的音量适中。在她开始后，点了一支烟。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
May I join the party?我可以参加这个派对吗？
(“Yes.”(“当然。”
(Jane smiled.)(珍笑着。)
Now, we shall say what we shall say in our own good time. The ESP book will be very widely read, and well noticed. There will be some controversy, and Ruburt will simply learn to relax, and not to upset himself.现在，在我们自己最佳的时间，我们会说我们应该说的。这本ESP书会被非常广泛地阅读而且会被注意到。它将会有一些争议，但鲁柏应该单纯地学会放松，而且不要让自己烦恼。
The book will be, in its field, the most controversial of the year. This is quite all right, and to be expected.这本书，在它的领域里，会是今年最受争议的。这没什么，也是意料之中的。
By the time we are finished, we will have some excellent evidential material. By the time critics’ voices become noisy we will be ready to show what we can do. We will have progressed enough for that.在我们完成的时候，我们将会有一些非常好的证明资料，当批评的声音变大的时候，我们会准备好秀出我们所能做的。关于这个，我们将会有足够的进展。
The less complicated portions of my material have been used in the ESP book, but there is enough there to give serious question to many learned gentlemen, and they will look forward to the Seth book, for the further developments that will be given.我的资料里比较不复杂的部分会放在这本ESP书里，但这足以让很多知识份子去问一些比较严肃的问题，而他们会期待接下来的赛斯书带给他们更进一步的发展。
(Jane now took a pause that lasted a full minute, sitting quietly with her eyes closed.)(珍现在眼睛闭着，静静地坐着，停顿了大约足足一分钟。)
The inverted time system should be at least briefly explained in the Seth book. I do not want to dictate to Ruburt, or tell him how to write this book. It occurs to me however that it would be advantageous to include in the middle section my ideas concerning the construction of physical matter, the inverted time system, moment points, a discussion concerning the dream universe, and the system of probability. All of this in direct quotes from the material itself. The last section of the book could then deal with what evidential material we have, and you shall have more. I am certain that Ruburt could so organize the center portion of the book so that stress could still be given to the personal story line.在赛斯书里至少应该简单的解释倒置时间系统。我不想命令鲁柏，或告诉他该如何写这本书。不过我突然想到，如果书的中间部分包含了我对于物质事件的结构，倒置时间系统，片刻点的想法，关于梦的宇宙，还有可能性系统的讨论，那会是有利的。所有这些从资料本身直接引述。书的最后一部分可以提到我们拥有的证据资料，而你们会有更多的资料。我很确定鲁柏会把书的中心部分组织得很好，所以重点应该放在个人故事那一条线。
In this manner a tantalizing sample of the material in several aspects would be given. Questions would be raised in the minds of the readers, and in other books the various ideas could be expanded from the material, and these questions answered. In this way you would be presenting an overall picture that would later be filled in.以这种方式这些资料在几个面向上的诱人实例可以被给予。读者心中会升起问题，而在其他的书里，这些资料的不同想法可以被扩展，而这些问题会被解答。以这种方式你会呈现一个尔后会被填满的全盘性画面。
(Jane took another long pause. We had just about decided to finish the book in the above manner. Jane has been thinking over what material to include in the center section so as to maintain reader interest, and some time ago decided to finish the book with what evidential material we have so far. The first section is now in the hands of her publisher.)(珍有另一个长的停顿。我们刚刚决定了以上面的方式完成这本书。珍有思考过，在中间部分应该包含什么样的资料而让读者保持兴趣，而不久前决定了以我们目前有的证据资料来完成这本书。第一个部分目前在出版社手上。)
The first section would then remain as it is, basically, except for any changes Ruburt wishes to make in small matters. I would like, you see, the overall picture presented as much as possible. The overall picture will capture the imagination, and the specifics will follow.基本上，第一个部分应该保留它原来的样子，除了鲁柏在一些小地方想要做的改变。你知道，我希望尽可能地呈现全盘性的画面。全盘性的画面会捕获想像力，而那些具体的会随之而来。
(Another long pause. Jane sat with her head down as she leaned forward, hands clasped, eyes closed.)(另一个长的停顿。珍低着头坐着，身体往前倾，双手握紧，眼睛闭着。)
The material on reincarnation will appear consistent and logical only within the whole framework. The objections of many will be offset only when the reincarnational data is seen in the light of a full understanding of the spacious present and the inverted time system.转世的资料只会持续且合理的出现在整个架构里。只有当转世的资料以一种充分理解广阔的现在和倒置时间系统的角度来看待时，很多反对才会消弭。
的I believe you will hear from Dr. Instream himself shortly.我相信你很快会从殷斯翠姆博士本人那听到消息。
Now, I have a few comments concerning your own activities.现在，关于你们自己的活动我有一些评论。
You did indeed tune in on your dancing establishment, and hear the music. It is of course no coincidence that you were between waking and sleeping when this occurred.你的确调频到你们跳舞的那间餐厅而听到音乐。这当然不是巧合，那是发生在你半睡半醒之间。
Ruburts experience in psychological time today represented a legitimate attempt to dissociate his awareness from physical matter, and was a sign that he is embarking upon another fruitful period of activity.鲁柏今天在心理时间上的经验代表了一个合理的意图，去把他的觉知从物质事件中分离开来，而这也是他开始另一个活动的丰收期征兆。
There are certain self-regulating devices at work here, psychologically speaking, that insure necessary periods of passivity and rest. In any well-balanced personality these operate automatically, as in Ruburts case.这里在工作上确实有自我管理的方法，心理上来说，那确保了不活动和休息的心要阶段。在任何良好平衡的人格里， 这些都是自动运作着，就像鲁柏的例子。
Now I suggest a brief break.现在，我建议一个简短的休息。
(Break at 9:30. Jane was dissociated as usual. “Seth, "she said, “is being tricky tonight.” Because of her excitement in the day's events, she felt Seth was using a more deliberate manner than usual in order to “lull" her psychologically. Jane said she was fully aware of Seth’s tactics. She announced also that she was cooperating in case Seth wanted to say anything about the notes on her ESP manuscript.(9:30休息。珍出离如常。“赛斯”，她说，“今天很妙”。因为她对白天的事件感到很兴奋，她感觉到赛斯用一种比平常更从容的方式试图在心理上“缓和”她的心情。珍说她完全知道赛斯的策略。她也声明，假如赛斯想说任何关于她ESP手稿上的注记，她会配合。
(There follows the account from my notebook describing my adventure in hearing music while almost asleep: “February 27, Sunday night, actually 12:30 AM: As I lay in bed half asleep I heard very clearly music in chords, played by an electric guitar. The sound was very harmonious, neither too fast or slow, and quite beautiful, almost with an echoing quality. I realized I had been listening to it for some little time, perhaps a minute, before I consciously realized what was happening. I then came awake and described the effect to Jane, who had not yet fallen asleep.”(以下是从我的笔记本所摘录的报告，描述的是我在几乎睡着时听到音乐的这个奇遇：“2月27日，星期日晚上，大概12点半左右：当我半睡着地躺在床上时，非常清晰地听到了和音，是电吉它演奏的。声音听起来非常和谐，不快也不慢，很美，几乎带着一种回音的特质。我发现在我有意识地了解发生什么之前，我听了这声音一会儿，也许1分种。然后我醒了过来，把这个结果描述给珍听，她当时还没睡着。”
(“A little later, while in the same state, I heard the music again to a reduced degree, for a few seconds. I then fell asleep. It is interesting that the evening before this experience, Saturday, February 26, Jane and I had an excellent time dancing to a new band at our favorite dancing establishment in town. I believe the guitar music I heard in bed was very much like one of the guitars in the band. I had watched this particular musician often during the evening, admiring his playing. The band plays until 1 AM each evening, when the establishment closes. Since I had my experience at 12:30 AM, when presumably the band would still be playing, did I perhaps tune in on it there?"(“过了一会儿，在同样的状态，我又再次地听到了音乐几秒钟，这次声音比较小。后来我睡着了。很有趣的是，在这个经验发生的前一天晚上，2月26日，星期六，珍和我在镇上我们最喜欢的舞厅，和新的乐队度过了一段非常棒的跳舞时光。我认为我在床上听到的吉他声音非常像这个乐队里的一个吉他声。我那天晚上常常望着这个特别的音乐演奏者，欣赏他的弹奏。乐队每晚会演奏到凌晨一点舞厅打烊的时候。因为这个经验是发生在凌晨12点半，是这个乐队有可能还在演奏的时间，难道我调频到那里去了吗？”
(I have had several other suggestive experiences recently, and keep a list of these in my dream notebook. One involved voices; another and more striking one involved my naming the exact item of clothing Jane purchased for me, unknown to me while I was at my job.(我最近有其他几个引起联想的经验，我在梦的笔记本里把这些列了一张清单。一个涉及了声音，另一个更令人印象深刻的，是我精确地说出了珍帮我买的衣服，那是在我工作、我并不知道的情况下买的。
(Jane said there is little to say about her psychological time experiences, other than that she felt she was making a guarded attempt to lift out of her physical body.(珍说，她的心理时间经验没什么好说的，除了她感觉她小心地试图从她的身体升起。
(Break proved to be a little longer than usual. Jane began speaking in the same rather slow manner, and for the most part her eyes remained closed. Resume at 9:45.)(休息的时间比平常要长一点。珍以同样慢的方式开始说话，大部分时间她的眼睛都是闭着的。9:45重新开始。)
Now. A few general remarks before our Instream material.现在。在我们开始殷斯翠姆博士资料前，先来一点概括的评论。
You will both meet the gentleman to whom you refer. The man whose writing appears on Ruburts original manuscript.你们俩个会见到你们提到的那位先生。这个人的笔迹曾出现在鲁柏的原始手稿里。
(Jane now took a one-minute pause. She sat with her hands raised to her closed eyes.)(珍现在停顿了一分钟。她坐着，手举起来放在闭着的眼睛上。)
These are impressions concerning that gentleman.这些是关于这位先生的印象。
A connection with Harvard about the year 1934. He lived for a long time near water, but I believe inland water. If it was near the ocean, it was where the ocean was quiet, for example a bay location.在大约1934年和哈佛大学有连结。他住在靠近水的地方已经很长一段时间了，但我相信是岛边的水岸。如果是靠近海，会是平静的海域，例如一个海湾的位置。
The initials M’s connected with him. A stomach disorder. A mole, fairly noticeable, on the face, perhaps in the region of the nose. He is cautious about money, but prides himself upon an open mind. He holds on to his ideas however, as he holds on to money.缩写MS和他有关联。一个腹部的疾病。一个痣，相当明显，在脸上，也许在鼻子的部位。他对钱很谨慎，但对他自己有一个开放的心胸很自豪。不过，他紧抓住他的想法就像是他紧抓住钱一样。
A connection with a cottage on the water, perhaps not on a year-round basis. A connection with a large organization. Now a young man. Sometimes given to wearing checkered vests, or jackets. I believe vests.和水上的一间小屋有关联，也许不是年租的。和一个大型的机构有关联。现在一个年轻人。有时候穿着格子的背心或夹克。我想是背心。
A connection with cold. I am not sure to what this refers. Perhaps somehow the sounds of his name suggest ice, or the letters. We shall see.和冷有关联。我不确定这指的是什么。也许他的名字听起来像冰，或拼音里有冰的字母。我们再看看。
A downtown location, in which he sometimes works. For a scientist he is himself rather long-winded, and can hardly afford to take me to task on that particular point.一个市中心的所在地，是他有时候工作的地方。对一个科学家来说，他讲话很冗长，在那特定的一点上，他没有能力挑战我。
I shall give you a very brief break at this time, and then for the Instream material. There is a connection here in the above impressions with Priestley, yes.现在我建议你们短暂的休息一下，然后开始殷斯翠姆博士的资料。是的，这里有一个连结是和上面普莱斯利的印象有关。
(Break at 9:59. Jane was dissociated as usual. Earlier in the evening we had noted a similarity in some of the comments on her manuscript with J.B. Priestley’s ideas on time. Jane had the idea that Priestley and our unknown commentator were contemporaries. Priestley we believe to be 70. Jane said she had the personal association of Norway when she heard herself giving the data on ice, regarding the name.(9:59休息。珍出离如常。在今晚稍早，我们注意到她手稿上的一些评论和普莱斯利对于时间的是非相似之处。珍有一种想法，普莱斯利和我们那位不知名的评注者是同年的。我们相信普莱斯利已经70岁了。珍说当她听到她在给有关名字是冰的资料时，她个人联想到挪威。
(Janes pace had been slow for the most part all evening. It was now time for the 43rd Dr. Instream experiment, and once again her pace was broken by pauses. As usual she sat with her head down, her hands raised to her closed eyes. Her pace picked up a little as the data proceeded. Resume at 10:05 )(今晚大部分时间珍的速度都比较慢。现在是时候开始第43次殷斯翠姆博士实验，而再次的，她的速度被很多停顿打断。和往常一样，她低着头坐着，手举到闭着的眼睛上。当资料进行时，她的速度恢复了一点。10:05分重新开始。)
Now. Give us a moment, please.现在。请等我们一下。
A page, I presume from a book, that somehow deals with history. I do not know if it is a history book, but it deals either with events in the past, or with ideas of the past.我认为书上有一页，多少和历史有关。我不知道它是否是史书，但它讨论的如果不是过去的事件，就是过去的想法。
Some allusions to Rome, about 30 AD. Some to the Middle Ages, and some to the previous century—that is, to the century before this one.有一些罗马的典故，大约在公元30年。有些是中世纪，有些是上一个世纪——那是，这个世纪之前。
A brown or red binding. Perhaps leather. That is, the cover is rather heavy or thick. Something to do with Descartes also, in the copy. A medieval scene depicted, with romantic overtones. Romantic not necessarily in terms of love interest, but in terms of imaginative fancy.棕色或红色的书皮。也许是皮的。封面相当厚重。在这本书里有些东西也和笛卡儿有关。以一种浪漫的含意，描绘中世纪的场景。浪漫不一定是就爱情方面，也有可能是就奇幻的想像力而言。
A book marker. The number three two eight. A philosophical exchange in terms of a classic dialogue.一张书签。数字3 2 8。就一经典的对话方面有一个哲学上的交流。
Something ground up or tattered. I do not know to what this refers. A woman in old-fashioned clothing, a representation rather than a person. The color red, large flowery first letters, open sentences or paragraphs.某个绞碎的或破烂的。我不知道这指的是什么。一个女人穿着老式的衣服，一种代表而不是一个人，颜色是红色，第一个字母像是很大的花，开放的句子或段落。
A mention of a much-maligned historical figure, also I believe from the past. A title of four words I believe.提到一个非常凶恶的历史人物，我相信也是来自于过去。我相信标题是4个字。
Do you have a test for me, Joseph?你有测验要给我吗，约瑟?
(“Yes.”(“是的。”
(At 10:16 I handed Jane the 36th double envelope; as usual she took it from me without opening her eyes, then sat holding it to her forehead with her right hand. Her eyes were still closed.)(10:16，我递给珍第36次的信封；和往常一样，她闭着眼睛接过去，然后坐着，用右手举起信封贴着额头。她的眼睛仍闭着。)
Give us a moment, please. These are impressions.请等我们一下。以下是印象。
An establishment, or something established. Something turned up.一个店面，或某个被创立的生意。某个东西被找到。
A connection with a marvelous occasion, though the word marvelous may be too strong.和一个极佳的场合有关联，虽然极佳这个字眼可能太强烈了。
I get a connection with a missionary, or religion, and the number 8, and something rising. But as a geyser rises, rather than something simply lifting up. An explosive type of motion.我收到和一个传教士，或宗教，和数字8，还有某种上升东西的关联。但是以一种间歇泉水喷发出的形式，而不是某种单纯浮起来的东西。一种爆炸类的动作。
A small round object, with some inscriptions resembling a postmark. A connection with something unclaimed, with the number 12, perhaps also with six three, and with ribbon like shapes. That is, long lines that are straight, perhaps two of these, and of dark color I believe, or dark red. Black on red. Horizontal rather than vertical, in the position in which I hold this.一个小的、圆形的物件，某种看起来像邮政的刻印。和某个无人认领，有数字12，也许也有63，和像带子形状的东西有关。那是，长线，是直的，也许有两条，我想是深色的，或深红色。红里带黑。以我握着这封信的姿势，比较是水平而不是垂直的。
(Without opening her eyes, Jane held the envelope before her in a horizontal position, and moved it from side to side to show horizontal movement. She then rested her elbow on the arm of her rocker and kept holding the envelope up as she continued.)(没有睁开她的眼睛，珍以一种水平的姿势，把信封握在她前面然后左右晃动，显示是水平的移动。然后她把手肘放在摇椅的扶手上，当她继续的时候仍高握着信封。)
A connection with a machine, and locomotion, and some people you do not know, and some you do know.和一台机器，和移动力，以及某些你认识的和不认识的人有关联。
December. A connection with a willingness to go somewhere. Star shapes. The color white background, and a paper item, folded like a card, the center being a rectangular shape.12月。和有意愿去某个地方有关联。星形。白颜色的背景，还有一个纸制的物品，折起来像一张卡，中心是一个长方形的形状。
Somehow cluttered, or full, and empty toward the outsides. Dark and shadowy in the center, with suggestions of motion, and late afternoon.某种挤满的，或满出来了，而往外是空的。中间是深色和有阴影的，有着动作的暗示，还有傍晚。
A connection with a house and a white border.和一座房子，以及白色的边界有关联。
You may take a break. Also a hat.你们可以休息。还有一顶帽子。
(Break at 10:27. Jane was dissociated as usual Her eyes had remained closed, her pace had been slow, she hadn't smoked, etc.(10:27休息。珍出离如常，她的眼睛仍闭着，速度慢，没有抽烟，等等。
(See the tracing of the envelope object, and its accompanying drawing, on pages 313. 14. We did not ask Seth to clear up each point in the data, so give below our own interpretations. As stated, the key drawing made by my boss was the actual envelope object. This is on thin white paper. The drawing on tracing paper was made by me, from instructions given to me by my boss, and is a schematic drawing to be traced onto Bristol board for final artwork.(见上面信封物件及附带的素描。我们没有要求赛斯理清资料上的每一点，所以下面给的是我们自己的解释。之前说明过的，真正的信封物件是那张我老板画的画。这是在一张很薄的、白色的纸上。而那张素描纸上的画是我画的，是根据我老板的指示画的，是一个描绘最后成品的草图。
(My drawing was actually a recreation of artwork that had been lost at Artistic Card Co. As often happens the original art was later found after I had duplicated it. The drawing was for a gummed sticker to be applied to a line of packaged cards of various kinds—religious, Christmas, Valentine's Day, etc., and was for a large old department store in Philadelphia, PA, that goes under the cavalier name of John's Bargain Store. As the copy of my tracing shows these stickers are applied to the appropriate merchandise at various times of the year.(我的画上是根据我们艺术卡公司遗失的一张画作的再创作。就像常发生的，原始的画作在我复制了以后又找到了。这张画作是用来当一种贴纸，用来贴在一排不同种类的卡片袋上——宗教的、圣诞节的、情人节的等等，而这是为了宾州费城的一家老牌百货店，约翰折扣中心所画的。就像我素描的复本，这些贴纸适用于一年不同时间的合适商品里。
(“establishment, or something established. "My thought was that both drawings were produced at an establishment, namely my place of employment. But this could also refer to the customer in Philadelphia.(“一个店面，或某个被创立的生意”。我的想法是，这两张图都是在一个店面，也就是我工作的地方完成的。但这也有可能指的是费城的顾客。
(“Something turned up.” As stated, the lost artwork was found after I had spent time duplicating it.(“某个东西被找到”，如之前说过的，在我花时间复制了以后。这个遗失的画作就被找到了。
(“A connection with a marvelous occasion, though the word marvelous my be too strong.” The word marvelous is too strong, we suppose, but the stickers are made for special occasions through the year, as explained above.(“和一个极佳的场合有关联，虽然极佳这个字眼可能太强烈了。”我们假设极佳这个字眼太强烈了，但上面有解释过，这些贴纸是用在一年里的特殊场合中。
(As can be seen, much of the envelope data given by Seth was transposed from the actual object to my own tracing-paper drawing. It might be noted that during the session, while Jane held the envelope in her hand, my tracing-paper drawing was in the same room with us, although I was unaware of this until after the session. It reposed in my jacket pocket in our front room closet; I had brought it home several days ago, then forgot about it, not having worn the jacket since. Both drawings were made about two weeks ago. Jane hadn't known they even existed.(由上述可见，大部分赛斯给的信封资料，是从实际的物件转到了我自己的素描画上。有一点要注意的是，在课程进行中，当珍手上握着信封时，我的素描画是和我们在同一个房间里，虽然直到课后我才发现。它放在我们前面房间的衣柜，在我夹克的口袋里；我几天前把它带回家，然后就忘了，也没再穿过那件夹克。两张画都是在两个星期前制作的。珍甚至不知道它们的存在。
(“I get a connection with a missionary, or religion ", is a reference to the fact that the stickers were to be used on boxes of religious cards, as well as other categories. While I was making the drawing the four or five boxes of different cards were laid out before me so that I could refer to them, and the religious box was among them.(“我收到和一个传教士，或和宗教有关联。”是一个参考，指的是贴纸被用在宗教卡的盒子上，就像被用在其他种类上一样。当我画这个图的时候，四、五个不同盒子的卡就放在我前面，所以我可以参考它们，而宗教卡的盒子就在其中。
(“and the number 8 ”, offers no connections that we can see.(“还有数字8”。我们看不到有什么连结。
(“and something rising. But as a geyser rises, rather than something simply lifting up. An explosive type of motion.” This is an associative bit of data on Jane's part and will be explained later.(“但是以一种间歇泉水喷发出的形式，而不是某种单纯浮起来的东西。一种爆炸类的动作。”这是在珍那边的联想资料，等一下会解释。
(“A small round object, with some inscriptions resembling a postmark. "Jane said she saw within a small round object, with horizontal lines running across it; she thought of a postmark on an envelope, with the cancellation lines, but knew this wasn't it. When she looked at my tracing-paper drawing, she said this was evidently what she was trying to arrive at subjectively; my drawing is of a round object, although much larger. Jane said the straight-across lettering. Key Value, is in the position of the horizontal lines she saw within. There are also ruled-in horizontal lines on the drawing.(“一个小的、圆形的物件，某种看起来像邮戳的刻印。”珍说她看到一个小的圆形物件，有水平的线条穿过它；上面有横线，但又知道这并不是在说它。当它看到我素描纸的画时，她说这就是她想要说的；我的画是一个圆形的物件，虽然大得多。珍说直线穿过的字眼，关键价值[Key Value]，是在她看到的水平线里面。画上面也有水平线。
(“A connection with something unclaimed, with the number 12, perhaps also with six three", brought no connections to mind. Then later Jane thought of the lost artwork at Artistic—“something unclaimed”?(“和某个无人认领，有数字12，也许也有63的东西有关。”我们想不到什么连结。后来珍想到了在艺术卡公司遗失的画作——“某个无人认领的”？
(“and with ribbon like shapes. That is, long lines that are straight, perhaps two of these, and of dark color, I believe, or dark red. Black or red. Horizontal rather than vertical, in the position in which I hold this. "As stated on page 321, Jane held the rectangular double envelope up with its long edge parallel to the floor, and moved it back and forth to indicate most definitely her insistence upon the horizontal attribute. This is most interesting, for the envelope object itself contains neither vertical or horizontal lines or masses. Once again her actions and data seem to be an attempt to get at my tracing-paper drawing, which bears a close connection to the envelope object.(“和像带子的形状。长直线，也许有两条，我想是深色的，或深红色。红里带黑。我握着它的姿势，比较是水平而不是垂直的。”前面有说明，珍握着长方形的信封，长边和地板平行，来回移动非常明确的指出平行的性质。这里最有趣的是，信封物件本身并没有包含垂直或平行线。再次的，她的动作和资料是似乎试图去收到我的素描画，而这和信封物件有紧密的连结。
(My drawing contains lines that are horizontal and straight. There are two sets of these horizontal lines, across the top and the bottom of the words Key Value, and when one turns the drawing over on the back—not shown here—is seen the dark smudges of my pencil as I prepared the drawing for tracing onto paper. Jane said these lines and the dark smudges beneath them are what she believes she was referring to, more so than the other two horizontal sets of lines below the end of the key.(我的画里包含了水平线和垂直线，有两组水平线横过“关键价值”这个字眼的上下，而当翻过这幅画的背面——没有显示在这里——可以看到当我准备素描在纸上时，深色钢笔的污迹。珍说她认为这些线和深色的污迹正是她所指的，另外两组水平线是在“钥匙”这个字的底部。
(When she saw the smudges on the back of the tracing-paper drawing, Jane said this was what gave her the idea of “ribbon like shapes.” The “dark color” and “dark red” references were her attempts to further refine this data.(当她看到素描画后面的污迹时，珍说这就是她说“像带子的形状”的想法来源。“深色”和“深红色”是她试图修正这个资料。
(“A connection with a machine ", could refer to the fact that I did some of the work on my tracing-paper drawing on a darkroom machine that is called a Lacey-Luci. This is a bulky contraption containing floodlights, a ground glass, and a magnifying-reducing lens for fast juggling of copy or artwork to proper size. A machine of this type is a standard in most art departments.(“和一个机器的关联。”，这可能指的是，我有部分的素描画是用一台叫雷西露西[Lacey-Luci]的暗房机器制作的。这是一台很庞大的奇特装置，包含了强光灯、底面玻璃，还有一个扩大-缩小的镜片，用来很快的调整副本或画作到适宜的大小。对大部分艺术部门来说，这台机器是基本配备。
(“and locomotion”, is to me a personal association of Jane’s derived from the machine data above.(“和移动力”，对我来说，这是从上面机器资料来的珍的个人联想。
(“and some people you do not know, and some you do know.” Too general. I do not know the people who operate John's Bargain Store, but neither do I know many other of Artistic's clients. Obviously there were people around the art room whom I do know.(“以及某些你不认识和认识的人。”太笼统了。我不认识营运翰折扣中心的人，也不认识很多艺术卡公司的客人。很明显地，在艺术工作室附近的确有我认识的人。
(“December. A connection with a willingness to go somewhere.” We saw no connections here.(“12月。和有意愿去某个地方有关联。”我们不知道这里的连结是什么。
(“Star shapes.” This is related to the geyser data on page 321, and out of it grows a personal association of Janes. Note that my tracing-paper drawing bears a formalized six-pointed star. Jane said she had an image of a star of sorts, and that this gave her the idea of fireworks shooting into the sky—thus the idea of a geyser, and something rising and explosive, etc.(“星形。”这和上面间歇泉水的资料有关，而珍有一个个人的联想源自于这个资料。注意我的素描画里有一个正六角星。珍说她有星星之类的印象，而这给她烟火射向天空的想法——因此才有了喷泉的想法，和某种升起来和爆炸的东西等等。
(“The color white background”, might be taken as a reference to the white paper the envelope object was drawn on, but Jane said that once again this referred to the tracing-paper drawing I made. Tracing-paper is a pale translucent gray or off-white color, but not really white as this typing paper is white.(“白色的背景”，可能指信封物件是画在白色的纸上，但再次的，珍说这是指我画的素描画。素描纸是一种透明的浅灰白色，那种白不是打字纸那种真正的白。
(“and a paper item, folded like a card”, also referred, Jane said, to my drawing rather than the envelope object. Jane said she had a vague image of a small round object upon a rectangular folded object that was like a card, yet the circle was not placed as neatly in the center of the rectangle as my drawing is. It was more offset toward the upper right corner, hence her postmark reference on page 321 also. On page 314 note that my tracing-paper drawing is folded roughly like a card.(“还有一个纸制的物品，折起来像一张卡”，珍说，这指的也是我的画而不是信封物件。珍说她有一个模糊的印象，一个小的，圆形的物件，在一张折起来长方形像一张卡的物件上，但这个圆不像我的画是整齐地放在长方形的正中心。它比较在右上角，因此像是她在前面说的邮戳。在前面说明过我的画折起来乍看像一张卡。
(“the center bring a rectangular shape. "Jane said this is another reference to the rectangular area taken up across my drawing by the words Key Value.(“中心是一个长方形的形状。”珍说，这指的是我的画里“关键价值”这几个字圈出来的长方形区块。
(“Somehow cluttered, or full, and empty toward the outsides.” On the original tracing-paper drawing my pencil smudging on the back shows through easily, and gives the drawing a cluttered or crowded look in the center. By contrast it looks bare toward the edge of the circle. This is an effect I noticed at work while making the tracing, but the illusion disappeared on the finished art.(“某种挤满的，或满出来了，而往外是空的。”在原本的素描画里，背面铅笔的污迹很容易透过来，而给画的中心部分一种满出来的感觉。对比之下，圆圈的边看起来是空的。当在画画的时候，我有注意到这个效果，但成品完成后就没有这个错觉了。
(“Dark and shadowy in the center", Jane said, is another reference to my smudges on the back of the drawing, and refer back to the ribbon like shapes on page 321. She had a fairly good image of this darkened area, and its horizontal disposition.(“中间是深色和有阴影的”，珍说这指的也是我的画背面的污迹，而在前面有说，背面是像带子形状的。她对这个深色的区域和它水平的位置有着相当好的影像。
(“with suggestions of motion", again refers to my drawing rather than the actual envelope object; the motion, Jane said, of my pencil smudges across the back of the drawing, and to the slant of the words. This Week’s above the key and star.(“有动作的暗示”，再一次，这指的也是我的画而不是真正的信封物件；这个动作，珍说，是我铅笔的污迹划过画的背面，而到钥匙和星星上面的“这星期”这几个斜字上。
(“and late afternoon.” Jane said this is another impression taken from the smudges on the back of my drawing. Note that this pencil smudging on the back of the tracing affected Jane probably more than anything else. This late afternoon impression stemmed from the feeling of dusk or evening falling, as suggested by the dark smudges. Jane was quite aware of this feeling subjectively.(“还有傍晚。”珍说，这是另一个来自我画背面污迹的印象。注意这个素描背后的污迹可能影响珍比其他东西都多。这个傍晚的印象来自一种灰尘或夜幕落下的感觉，就像深色污迹所暗示的。珍主观上十分明白这种感觉。
(“A connection with a house and a white border.” This is interesting, in that Jane said she had an image of a card shape with a house and foliage on it. It was not very clear, yet she knew that much about it. The boxes of cards for which the sticker was made are large, large enough to contain reproductions of four cards, arranged in a rectangular pattern on the box top, and on a printed gold background. Each card design is surrounded by a rectangular white border, perhaps an eighth of an inch wide. Some of the boxes laid out before me, as I made my drawing for the sticker, contained reproductions of cards bearing houses, trees, flowers, etc.; the standard kind of subject material for greeting cards.(“和一个房子还有白色的边界有关联。”这很有趣，珍说她有一张卡的形状的影像，是一间房子还有枝叶在上面。这不是非常清楚，但她知道的就这么多。这些有贴纸在上面的，放卡片的盒子很大，大到可以放下四种不同的卡，在盒子上面排成了长方形，还有一个金色印花的背景。每张卡的设计都有长方形白色的边围绕着，大概有八分之一英寸宽。当我在为贴纸画图的时候，有些盒子就在我面前。包含了房子、树、花等等图案；这些是祝贺卡片的标准主题。
(“Also a hat.” I saw no connection here.(“还有一顶帽子。”我在这里没有看到连结。
(Jane said that out of all the connections we made, practically all of them referred to my tracing-paper drawing rather than to the actual envelope object itself. My boss made the envelope object. Jane knows him of course, and likes him; yet the fact that I made the tracing-paper drawing evidently exerted a stronger pull emotionally. Perhaps this diverted Seth/Jane's focus from the envelope object to a closely related object. As stated, Jane didn’t know the two drawings existed.(珍说，几乎我们所做的所有连结，都指向我的素描画，而不是真正的信封物件。我的老板画了这张信封物件。珍当然认识他，而且也喜欢他；但事实上，我的素描画显然发挥了比较强的情感拉力。也许这也是让赛斯-珍的焦点从信封物件转向了另一个紧密的物件。之前说明过，珍并不知道这两张画的存在。
(Jane resumed, still at a somewhat slow pace, at 10:45.)(珍在10:45分重新开始，依然是以比较慢的速度。)
Now we will end the session very shortly. You have had a busy day.现在，我们很快要结束这一节了。你们过了忙碌的一天。
Ruburt is just coming out of what can be called a rest period. It is true that five months earlier it would not have been possible to get this much valid information through during such a period.鲁柏刚刚从一个所谓的休假时期回来。在5个月之前，我们是不可能透过这样一段时间得到这么多有效的讯息的。
(The first envelope experiment was held on August 18,1965, almost 8 months ago.)(第一次信封实验，是在1965年8月18日举行，大概是8个月之前。)
The interpretations he gave when you discussed the impressions were correct. All of them.当你们讨论这些印象时，他给的解释是正确的。所有的都是。
You may ask me questions at the end of my delivery of impressions, and before the break.在我口述这些印象的最后和休息之前，你们可以问我问题。
(Seth had mentioned this in the last session; and again tonight we had talked about it during break.(赛斯在上节课里有提到这一点；而再次的，在今晚休息的时候我们有讨论到它。
(“Well, I think it natural that I want to ask questions during these experiments, but I don’t want to lead Ruburt on. ")(“我想在这些实验期间，我想问问题是很自然的，但我不想去引导鲁柏。”)
They may indeed. It will help you clarify some data perhaps, before Ruburt sees it, and this will be to our advantage.它们的确有可能会。在鲁柏看到物件之前，我也许可以帮你们理清一些资料，而这对我们有好处。
(I believed Seth’s answer showed a mild misunderstanding between us.(我相信赛斯的回答显示出我们之间一些轻微的误解。
(“What I mean is, will I be accused of giving him clues if I ask questions about the envelope data? Suppose I ask him to be more specific about a certain point, say a shape? Won't he take the question as a sign that the point needs to be clarified?’)(“我的意思是，如果我问了关于信封资料的问题，我会不会被指控是给了他暗示？假设我要求它在某一点更明确，比如一个形状？他会不会把这个问题当成一个信号，这一点需要被理清？)
You will have to be careful, but we are learning also.你必须小心，但我们也需要学习。
(Now Jane lowered her head. She raised her hands to her closed eyes once more.)(现在珍低着她的头，再次的把手举到她闭着的眼睛上。)
Now wait a moment.现在等一会儿。
Some distant connection with the name Margo. This concerns our impressions of the man who made notations on the manuscript. Two other females also. Younger than he.有一些遥远的连结和玛戈(Margo)这个名字有关。这有关于我们对那个在手稿上注释的那个人的印象。还有另外两个女性。比他年轻。
My heartiest regards to you both, and good evening. Unless you have any questions.我对你们俩最衷心的祝福，还有晚安。除非你还有任何的问题。
(“Just one. Will we have any witnesses to Wednesdays session?"(“只有一个。我们星期三的课会有任何参与者吗？”
(Seth had mentioned this possibility during the unscheduled session of last Sunday, February 27. Jane smiled.)(赛斯上个星期天，2月27日的临时课里提过这个可能性。珍微笑。)
You may.你们可能会有。
(“Why the smile?")(“为什么这么笑？”)
You may have two sets of witnesses.你们可能会有两组参与者。
(“How many people?”)(“有多少人？”)
The possibilities exist for four, perhaps even five.可能性有4个，也许到5个。
(“It sounds like a busy time, then... Good night, Seth.”(“那听起来会很忙，那么……晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:55. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed since break, her pace rather slow. She said she felt sure about the impressions concerning my tracing-paper drawing. She was aware, she repeated, of the circular shape upon the rectangular shape formed by the folded tracing paper; she felt it was folded when Seth said so.)(10:55结束。珍出离如常。她的眼睛自从休息之后就一直闭着，速度相当慢。她说对于我素描画的印象，她的感觉是确定的。她也知道，她重复了那段，折起来的素描纸形成的长方形和在上面的圆形；她感觉当赛斯这么说的时候它被折了起来。)
(Reduced copy of the print of my right palm, used as the envelope object in the 37th envelope experiment, in the 237th session缺翻译
for March 2, 1966. Made on February 27,1966.)第237节 倒置时间是千里眼的主要原因　信封37

SESSION 237 1966年3月2日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课


MARCH 2, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED我的右手掌影印的缩小版，用在1966年3月2日第237节第37次信封实验的物件。是在1966年2月27日制成的
(The 37th envelope experiment was held during the session. See the tracing of the envelope object on page 327. It is a print of my right hand, made with black stamping ink on paper. I made it on February 27,1966. Jane had picked up a book on hands at the library recently, and this got us interested in making such prints.(第37次信封实验在这节课举行。见上图信封物件的素描。它是我右手掌的打印，是用黑色印泥印在纸上。这是我在1966年2月27日制作的。珍最近在图书馆借了一本有关手掌的书，而这让我对这种打印有了兴趣。
(The print is on the whole darker than my pencil indication on the preceding page, and of much better quality. The lines in the palm, indicated by black lines, are in actuality in white on the original print, so that the effect is the interesting one of a hand in reverse, or perhaps a map or plan printed in reverse. The fingerprints show with fair clarity also. This is but one of many prints I made that evening; I discovered it is not easy to obtain a full print that has good overall detail.(这个打印整体比我前一页用铅笔标示的颜色更深，品质更好。手掌的掌纹，之前是用黑线标示的，在原始的打印上实际是白色的，所以很有趣的是，效果是反向的，或也许印出来的地图或镂面图也是倒反的。指纹也显示得非常清楚。我那天晚上制作很多张，这是其中的一张；我发现要得到一张完整的、有着很好整体细节的打印是很不容易的。
(Jane of course saw this particular print, along with perhaps twenty others I made at the same time. There is nothing about this one to distinguish it from many of the others. Following the instructions in the book, I traced the outline of my hand in pencil while pressing the inked surface against the white paper. The print was sealed in the usual double envelope between the usual two pieces of Bristol.(珍当然有看过这张特别的打印，我大概同时印了其他20张。这一张和其他几张并没有什么区别。照着书上的指示，当手上沾了印泥压在白纸上的时候，我用铅笔描绘手的轮廓。这张打印夹在两张纸板中间，然后放进普通信封里封好。
(In the last session Seth said the possibility existed that we would have four or five witnesses for the session tonight. He had also mentioned such a possibility during Sunday's unscheduled session of February 27. However no witnesses appeared.(在上一节课，赛斯说我们今晚的课有个可能性是会有4或5个参与者。他在2月27日星期日的临时课里也提过这个可能性。不过并没有参与者出现。
(Prior to the session Jane and I had a discussion as to the exact profession of the person who had written the many notes on the manuscript of her ESP book. See pages 319-20 for notes on this, in the 236th session, and Seth 's comments. Neither of us thought the person in question a psychologist. I favored a parapsychologist, Jane a psychiatrist. In his comments he referred rather often to his own theory of spherical time. Neither of us have heard of this, nor can we find a reference to it in our books.(在这节课之前，珍和我有一个讨论，是关于那个在她ESP手稿上写了很多注释的人，他的专业是什么。见第236节的注记和赛斯的评论。我们两个都不认为这个人是心理学家，我比较倾向他是超心理学家，珍认为是精神科医师。在他的评论中，常常提到他自己的球状时间理论。我们两个都没有听过这个说法，在我们的书里也找不到参考资料。
(The session was held in our front room. Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed, and once again her pace was slow; at times during this first delivery it was as slow as I can remember during any session. Jane was not smoking. She sat for some time with her head down, her hands raised to her temples. Begin at 9:02.)(这节课是在我们前面的房间举行的。珍说话时坐着，眼睛闭着，而再次的，她的速度较慢；在第一段口述时几乎是有史以来的最慢。珍没有抽烟。她头低着坐了一会儿，手举到太阳穴上。在9:02开始。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I enjoyed your little discussion.我享受你们的小讨论。
Our friend of the manuscript thinks of himself as a liberal-minded man, but he will not take any giant steps away from the lines of academic like safety.我们手稿上的朋友认为他自己是一个有开明心胸的人，但他并没有迈开大步离开学术式的安全感。
He takes prissy tiptoeing steps, always looking backward with worried caution. He does not carry his precious spherical time idea far enough to begin with. His spherical time is like the surface of a sphere only.他谨慎地踮着脚走，总是小心翼翼地往回看。他并没有带着他珍贵的球状时间想法走得够远去开始。他的球状时间就只像是球体的表面。
The spacious present and the inverted time system deal with the insides of the sphere.广阔的现在和倒置时间系统处理的球体的里面。
(Jane now took a long pause. The above material had been broken by many pauses.)(珍现在有一个长的停顿。上面的资料被很多停顿打断。)
There are a few points I would like to make. They will take us a bit away from our main lines of discussion, and they have to do with communication between essence personalities and those still within the physical system.有几点我想说的。它们会让我们离题一下子，而它们和元素人格以及那些仍然在物质系统的人格之间的沟通有关。
(Seth enjoys calling himself an energy personality essence.)(赛斯喜欢称他自己为能量人格元素。)
Now. When the communicator is still strongly tied emotionally to your own system, and when he is still acclimating himself to his new conditions, then his communications will be extremely garbled, as a rule.现在。当沟通者仍情绪强烈的和你们自己的系统绑住，而当他仍在适应他的新情况时，那么通常他的沟通就会变得非常混乱。
His control over the nervous system of the person through whom he communicates will be faulty and erratic. His interests will largely be those he had during physical existence. This is generally true.他所控制的这个透过他来沟通的人的神经系统，就会变得错误和不稳定。他的兴趣主要会在，那些当肉体存在着时他所拥有的东西上面。这通常是真实的。
He will be mainly concerned in an effort to prove his survival. His messages will be full of trivial but significant data that will make his survival plain to those he has left behind.他主要关注的焦点是努力证明他的存活。他的讯息将会充满了琐碎但有某种意义的资料，只为让他的存活给其他人知晓。
Our communications are not of this type. As an overall personality, I have always been concerned with ideas. I am not emotionally in strong connection with any personalities known to Frank Watts, for example. He is a part of, or a fragment of, my whole self, and an independent one.我们的沟通不是这一种。以一个全面的人格，我所关心的总是和概念有关。我在情绪上没有和任何人格有强烈的连结，例如，法兰克•沃兹。他是我全我的一部分或一个片段体，而也是独立的一个。
(These sessions began when we contacted the Frank Watts personality through the Ouija board, in December 1963. The Frank Watts personality was replaced in the 4th session by Seth. Seth has dealt with Frank Watts to some degree in the following sessions: 4, 8, 11, 14, 15, 16, 21, 25, 29, 31, 51, 85, 88, 173, 184, 189, 224. See Volumes I through 5.)(这些课是因为1963年12月，我们透过灵应盘和法兰克·沃兹这个人格有了接触才开始的。 赛斯在第四节取代了法兰克·沃兹的人格。赛斯在下面几节某种程度的提过法兰克·沃兹：4、8、11、14、15、16、21、25、29、31、51、85、88、173、184、189、224。见第一册至第五册。)
My field of reality is not the same as it is for those who have recently left your system. It is not necessary for Ruburt to adopt the deep trance state for our sessions, since I am able to speak through him without shutting out most aspects of his consciousness.我实相的领域和那些刚离开你们系统的人并不一样。鲁柏不需要为了我们的课而采用深度出离状态，因为我可以不必关闭他大部分意识而透过他说话。
Of course I get help from him. One of my main purposes is to instruct, and to do so with all the available equipment operating at least to some degree. The light trance state is ideal for this.当然他有帮助我。我其中一个主要的目的是教导，而为了这么做，我必须某程度的运作所有可使用的装备。要这么做，轻度出离状态是最理想的。
(Jane's pace was now very slow, as slow as it has ever been, I believe. Some of her pauses lasted well over a minute. Yet at times her eyes opened briefly.)(现在珍的速度非常慢，好像从未那么慢过。有一些她的停顿持续超过了一分钟。有的时候她的眼睛会短暂睁开。)
Now. Emotional intensities are still our guidelines however, and they have meaning and significance within all systems. It is by their light that you see.现在。无论如何情绪的强度仍然是我们的准则，它们在所有的系统都有意义和重要性。借着它们的光你们才能看见。
(See the sessions on the electrical universe in Volume 3.) One of the reasons, incidentally, for Ruburt’s good performance for me is precisely his ability to use words well. We are building up a foundation here, in which words are important, and for which incidentally subconscious shorthand symbols would be of little use.(见第三册电子宇宙的那几节课。)附带一提，对我来说，鲁柏其中一个表现良好的理由是他用字精准的能力。我们要在这里建立一个基础，字汇是很重要的，而附带一提，潜意识的简略象征没什么用处。
You may take a short break.你们可以短暂休息一下。
(Break at 9:32. Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. She knew Seth was being deliberate, she said, but was not aware that half an hour had passed. Her pace had been very slow, and she did not have too good an idea of what she had said.(9:32休息。珍在第一段口述时出离如常。她说她知道赛斯很谨慎，但没有觉察到半小时已经过了。她的速度一直非常慢，而她对她说了什么不太清楚。
(Jane said she thought Seth might have gone into the survival material because of some of the marginal notes made on her ESP manuscript by our unknown friend, particularly on the chapters dealing with reincarnation.(珍说，她认为赛斯提到生存的资料，是因为我们那位不知名的朋友在她ESP手稿边上写下一些注释的缘故，特别是提到转世的那几章。
(She thought the last paragraph came about because our same friend had made some notes about authentic survival messages being given in “shorthand, ” the letter “U" for the word you, etc.(她认为最后一段是有关我们那位朋友在做一些关于真正幸存讯息的一些注释时，表达的方式很简略，比如字母“U”代替“你”这个字等等。
(Jane still used pauses, but her pace was much faster when she resumed. She was not smoking. Her eyes remained closed. She sat quite still for at least a minute after closing them, before resuming at 9:44.)(珍仍然有停顿，但当她重新开始时，速度快多了。她没有抽烟，眼睛仍然闭着。在9:44分重新开始前，她闭着眼睛，静静地坐着至少一分钟。)
Now, back to our main discussion.现在，回到我们的主要讨论。
When the inverted time system is understood clearly, then the inadequacy of the cause and effect theory will be clear. If your psychologists and scientists would begin a study of their own dreams, they would learn much through personal experience.当倒置时间系统被清晰了解了，那么因果论的不足之处也会很清楚。如果你们的心理学家和科学家可以开始研究他们自己的梦，他们会从个人经验里学习到更多。
They would tackle realities that cannot be measured with physical instruments. Since psychologists deal with psychological activity, it is all the more amazing that they have not concentrated upon psychological activity, observing it first hand as it exists in their own various stages of consciousness.他们可以处理那无法用物质工具测量的实相。既然心理学家处理的是心理上的活动，很令人惊讶的是，他们并没有专注在心理活动上，第一手的观察存在于他自己意识的不同状态。
If such a study is conducted however with preconceived ideas, then each experimenter will find only what he has been looking for, for all else will appear meaningless to him.不过，如果这样的研究是以预先形成的想法来执行的，那么每一个实验者只能发现他所寻找的东西，因为所有其他的会显得对他毫无意义。
But the dreaming state presents any experimenter with original and varied material, and the opportunities involved are tremendous. The inverted time system will appear plainly, if any examination is made as to the relationship between time and the dream state.但这种梦的状态对所有实验者展现了原始和不同的资料，而涉及的机会是巨大的。如果去检验时间和梦境之间的关系，那么倒置时间系统就会清楚地出现。
This may not be the time to make this remark, but quite literally, tomorrows dream can change yesterday. All of the experiments that you are conducting are in themselves beneficial simply because of the training involved, and the expansion of consciousness.现在也许不是做这些评论的时机，但很实际的，明天的梦能改变昨天。所有你安排的实验本身会单纯的对你有益，因为所涉及的训练，和意识的扩展。
I am not de-emphasizing consciousness. I am trying to teach you to focus your consciousness in many directions, even to carry a portion of egotistical consciousness into the dream state.我并不是不强调意识。我试着教导你把你意识聚集到很多的方向，即使是带着一部分的自我意识到梦境。
Clues as to the existence of inverted time appear also in the waking condition however, and soon I shall have much to say on this matter. It is the existence of inverted time that is mainly responsible for clairvoyance.不过对于倒置时间存在的线索也同样出现在醒时状态，而很快的，我会对这个议题说得更多。预知力主要是由倒置时间的存在负责的。
Now, give us a moment please, before the Instream data.现在，在殷斯翠姆博士资料之前，请等我们一下。
(Jane paused at 9:56. Seth dispensed with the usual break before our experimental material. When break finally did arrive Jane said Seth was going to give a break at this time but decided to go ahead because she was in a good state. Usually, Jane said, she reaches a better state as time passes.(珍9:56停顿。在实验资料之前赛斯通常会让我们休息。这次当休息时间到的时候，珍说赛斯本来要让我们休息，后来因为她的状态很好所以决定继续下去。珍说，通常随着时间的流逝，她会达到比较好的状态。
(Now, her head down, her hands raised to her closed eyes as usual, she began the material on the 44th Dr. Instream experiment.)(现在，她的头低着，手像往常一样举到闭着的眼睛上，开始第44次殷斯翠姆博士实验的资料。)
He is in a building several stories high, and he is not on the first floor. The building is modern. He has matches in his hand, and lights one. He stares at the matches, a small packet of ordinary matches.他在一栋几层楼高的大楼里，他不是在一楼。这栋是现代的建筑物。他手上有火柴，而且点燃了一根。他盯着火柴，一小包普通的火柴。
(Jane took a longish pause at 10:00. Her pace was broken by many short pauses, but was still good.)(珍在10点有一个长的停顿。她的速度被很多短暂的停顿打断了，但依然很稳定。)
The cover has a representation of a building on it. Howard Johnson. Two other men in particular, standing up as if to leave. One taller than the other, and both seem hatless.封面有一栋代表建筑物。哈沃强森饭店。特别有两个人站起来好像要离开的样子。一个人比另一个人高，而两个人似乎都没有戴帽子。
There is a coffee urn, or a silver-colored urn. A button loose—that is, a button is loose. (Jane gestured, her eyes still closed.) The color orange used as a decoration. Glass doors, and many voices from the other side.有一个咖啡壶，或一个银色的壶。一个松了的扣子——即，一个扣子松掉了。(珍做着手势，眼睛仍然闭着。)颜色橙色用来做装饰。玻璃门，很多声音从另一边传出来。
One of the other men mentioned has a mustache, a dark one, though he is not necessarily a young man, and pointed features. The chin small but pointed. (Jane touched her own chin.)提到的其中一个人留着胡子，深色的，虽然他不一定是年轻人，还有脸形很尖。下巴小但很尖。(珍摸了摸她自己的下巴。)
One of the men carries a brown cardboard large envelope, or folder, with strings on it, and records inside.其中一个男人拿着一个棕色的大信封或文件夹，上面有绳子，还有记录在里面。
Some connection with the initials C S. Also a connection with a young boy—that is, young man. I believe, but not an adult male.和缩写C S有一些关联。也和一个年轻的男孩有关联——我想，那是一个年轻的男人，但不是成年的男性。
Some talk of money for a project, or the lack of it, and an immediate plan considered. A framework, or something framed. (Jane shook her head.) The matches are the object.谈到一笔研究计划的钱，或缺乏经费，还有思考一个立即的计划。一个框架，或某个框起来的东西。(珍摇摇头)火柴是物件。
Do you have a test for me, Joseph?你有测验要给我吗，约瑟？
("Yes.”(“是的。”
(Jane paused at 10:09. I handed her the envelope for our 37th experiment, and as usual she took it from me without opening her eyes. Then she sat with it held against her head. She gave the material on the envelope with many short pauses.)(珍10:09停顿。我递给她第37次实验的信封，而如往常一样，她闭着眼睛接过去。然后她坐着，握着信封抵着头。当她给信封资料的时候有很多短暂的停顿。)
Now give us a moment, please.现在。请等我们一下。
Five. Something for a consideration. A floor plan, or diagram. I have the impression of a steeple shape, or upside-down V shape, that is rather prominent.5。某个让你思考的东西。一个楼层的平面图，或图表。
A connection with many people, and with something like a basement—low, that is. This leads Ruburt to think of your Myhalyks, his impression.我有一个尖塔的形状，或倒V形状的印象，那相当的明显。和很多人，还有某个像地下室的东西有关联——那是低的。这让鲁柏想到你们的麦亥，他的印象。
Something low and something high, in contrast, to do with an understanding reached. I pick up five again, and a connection with a man who wears glasses. Not you, Joseph. And with walls, and an interior.某个低的和某个高的东西，对比，和达到某种了解有关。我再次的收到5，和一个戴眼镜的男人有关联。不是你，约瑟。还有墙，和一个室内。
That will be all before we take our break, unless you have any questions.除非你有任何问题，否则在我们休息之前这就是全部了。
(Jane paused at 10:14. Her eyes were still closed and she still held the envelope to her forehead. This was my first opportunity to ask a question during such experiments; I picked what I thought was a safe one, meaning that I didn’t think it would give Jane any clues.(珍10:14停顿。她的眼睛仍闭着，而她仍握着信封抵在前额。这是我在这样的实验中第一次有机会问问题；我选了一个我认为是安全的问题，这意味着我不认为它会给珍任何的线索。
(“Well, do you want to say something about colors involved with the object, if any?”)(“好，你想要说说和这个物件有关的颜色吗，如果有的话？”)
Give us a moment.请等我们一下。
A violet. Red, and a grading to yellow. Plus white, and very dark.紫色。红色，还有黄色的渐层。加上白色，还有非常深的颜色。
The darks horizontal, the verticals bright. Also let me add initials, or symbols.深色的水平线，垂直线是亮色。也让我加上缩写，或象征。
(Break at 10:16. Jane was dissociated as usual, she said, and her eyes had remained closed. My question had not upset her. It will be recalled that this asking of questions during experimental material, or immediately afterward, has been led up to gradually in very recent sessions. As will be seen, the question bore fruit.(10:16休息。珍说她出离如常，她的眼睛仍闭着。我的问题并没有困扰她。我记得在最近的课里有讨论过，问问题要在实验资料立即结束后。等下会看见，问题带来了成果。
(See the tracing of the envelope object on page 327. Jane and I made most of the connections between the envelope object and the data easily enough, and did not ask Seth to clear up any points. The connections tonight were predominantly related with the envelope object itself and not displaced onto another as they had been in the last session, and in the 234th, which involved the episode of the four letters.(见上面的物件描图。珍和我轻易的在信封物件和资料之间找到很多连结，因此没有要求赛斯理清任何一点。今晚的连结主要是和信封物件本身有关，没有像上一节，或第234节，涉及四个信封那一节一样转移成另一个物件。
(“Five.” My handprint of course shows five fingers.(“5。”我的手印当然显现出五只手指。
(“Something for a consideration.” The print was made to be read, or considered, after the manner outlined in the book on hands.(“某个让你思考的东西。”这个打印是在阅读，或思考过那本关于手掌的书当中所列出来的方法后制成的。
(“A floor plan, or diagram.” Note here how Jane narrowed the meaning down to a diagram. The original print used as the object, with the white lines apparent, is a diagram. See the detailed description on page 328.(“一个楼层的平面图，或图表。”注意到珍是如何把选择缩小到一张图表。原来用作物件的打印，有着白色明显的线，是一个图表。详细的描述见前面。
(“I have the impression of a steeple shape, or upside-down V shape, that is rather prominent.” To Jane the shapes of my fingers as outlined in pencil on the print, were steeple shapes. There are several V shapes on the print, and a prominent one between the thumb and forefinger. We are not sure why the upside-down reference to a V shape however. During the experiment I noticed that Jane held the rectangular test envelope to her forehead with its long axis roughly parallel to the floor; perhaps the folded object inside gave rise to the upside-down impression.(“我有一个尖塔形状，或倒V形状的印象，那相当地明显。”对珍来说用铅笔勾勒的，我手指的形状是尖塔状。打印上有几个V的形状，主要的那个是在大拇指和食指之间。不过，我们不确定为什么是一个倒V形。在实验期间我注意到珍握着长方形的信封在前额，信的长边大概和地板平行；也许里面折起来的物件引起了上下倒置的印象。
(Personal association also operated with this impression. It wasn’t until after the session ended that Jane realized that the “steeple shape, "and the "many people" data to follow, had reminded her of a childhood poem she hadn't thought of in years. After the session she recited the little poem to me; it is done with hand gestures accompanying, the fingers of both hands interlocking in various positions. This is the poem: “Here is the church, here is the steeple. Open up the doors, and see all the people.”(这个印象里也有个人联想在运作。一直到课结束之后，珍才明白“尖塔形状”和“很多人”的资料，让她回想起一首她很多年没有想到的、童年时的诗。在课结束后她朗诵这首小诗给我听；伴随着手势，双手的手指以不同的姿势扣紧。这首诗是：“这儿有教学，这儿有尖塔。打开这些门，看到所有人。”
(“A connection with many people, and with something like a basement—low, that is. This leads Ruburt to think of your Myhalyk's, his impression. "Jane believes her impression here is correct. Myhalyk's is our favorite dancing establishment in Elmira. On Saturday, February 19, Jane and I met Marilyn and Don Wilbur and some others at Myhalyk’s for an evening of dancing. This was shortly after we had obtained the book on hands, and during the evening Jane asked the Wilburs if they would cooperate in having handprints made. The Wilburs, who have witnessed several unscheduled sessions, consented. Arrangements were made to obtain their prints on Friday, February 25, but were not carried out because of the difficulty in getting good prints. My print, made on February 27, was an experiment in an effort to learn just how to make a good print.(“和很多人，还有某个像地下室的东西有关联——那是低的。这让鲁柏想到你们的麦亥，他的印象。”珍相信她这里的印象是正确的，麦亥是一家我们很喜欢的跳舞场所，位于埃尔迈拉。在2月19日星期六晚晚，珍和我在麦亥跳舞的时候遇到了玛丽莲和唐•韦伯，还有一些其他人，这是在我们刚拿到那本有关手掌的书之后，而那个晚上，珍问韦伯他们是否愿意一起制作手印。韦伯夫妇同意了，他们参与过几节临时课。本来是要在2月25日星期五那天拿到他们的打印，但后来没有，是因为好的打印很难制作。我在2月27日制成的打印是一个实验，实验如何制作一张好的打印。
(“Something low and something high, in contrast, to do with an understanding reached.
