" We think this is a reference to part of the technique in reading a hand; as described in the book it is not only necessary to consider the lines, but the “mounts", which are the high points of flesh at the base of the fingers, the thumb, the heel of the hand, etc. Also the low spots or depressions are considered significant.(“某个低的和某个高的东西，对比，和达成某种了解有关。”我们认为这指的是阅读手掌的部分技巧；书里有描述不只需要考虑手上的线，还有手掌的“隆起之处”、手指大拇指根高起来的地方、手掌根部等等。还有比较低凹的地方也是重要的考量。
(“I pick up five again ", If this is not a reference to the handprint, we do not see the connection, unless it is tied in with the next data.(“我再一次地收到5。”如果不是有关手印，我们看不到相关处，除非和下一个资料有关。
(“and a connection with a man who wears glasses. Not you, Joseph. " Don Wilbur wears glasses. I do also. So does Bill Gallagher. Peggy Gallagher was visiting Jane on the evening I made the print used as the envelope object, on Sunday, February 27. After I was through with my efforts Bill arrived. As we recall he was not wearing his glasses on that particular evening. Don Wilbur wears his all the time, as I do.(“和一个戴眼镜的男人有关联。不是你，约瑟。”唐·韦伯戴眼镜。我也是。比尔·加拉格也是。蓓·加拉格在我制作信封物件打印的那晚，2月27日星期日来拜访珍。在我努力完成之后比尔也到了。我们记得那一晚他没有戴眼镜。唐·韦伯随时都戴眼镜，我也一样。
(“And with walls, and an interior. "Although this is too general Jane thinks it is another reference to the aforementioned evening at Myhalyk's, where references to handprints were made.(“还有墙，和一个室内。”虽然这太笼统了，珍认为这指的也是前面提过的麦亥夜晚，那晚提到手印的制作。
(“A violet. Red, and a grading to yellow.” This is very interesting to me personally; Jane also recalls these details. After spending a couple of hours trying to make a good handprint, I gave up and began cleaning the ink from my hand. This proved to be a job. As I applied scouring powder I was surprised to see the black ink on the palm turn what might be termed a red with violet undertones. This effect at once reminded me of reading that the quality of a black ink can be judged by its behavior when diluted: If a red color develops it means the ink is of inferior quality. The ink I had used was stamp-pad ink purchased at a 5. and-10 downtown.(“紫色。红色，还有黄色的渐层。”这对我个人来说很有趣；珍也想起来这些细节。在花了好几个小时试图制作一张好的手印后，我放弃了，然后开始清理我手上的墨。这是一个大工程。当我把清洁粉放到手上的时候，我很惊讶的发现，手掌上黑色的墨水转变成可以称之为红色和紫色的底色。这个效果一度提醒了我曾读过的，黑墨水的品质可以由稀释后的表现来判断；如果出现红色，代表墨水是比较差的品质。我用的墨是印章用的印泥，是在市中心一家五和十商店买的。
(The ink might have been of poor quality but it was difficult to remove. The red color was pronounced and I called Jane’s attention to it. She too had had the experience, since she had tried prints of her own a few days earlier. A lot of scrubbing reduced the red stain to a yellowish cast finally, but here I had to let it wear off. This took several days. Thus we have a progression here from black to violet to red to yellow.(这墨水可能品质不好，它很难卸掉。红色很明显，而且珍注意到了。她也有同样的经验，因为她几天前也试过打自己的手印。多次的刷洗让红色的污迹最后褪成黄色，我得让它自己褪掉。这得花几天的时间。因此我们这里有一个进程，后黑到紫到红到黄。
(Bear in mind that Jane had this experience as well as I. Perhaps her own experience reinforced whatever data she had picked up from my involvement with the actual envelope object. Jane said she cannot distinguish between the two, if this took place.(记住，珍和我有同样的经验。或许她自己的经验强化了她从真正的信封物件中收到的资料。珍说如果这发生了，她也无法从中分辨。
(“Plus white, and very dark.” I made the handprint on white paper identical with this page, and the print itself is very dark.(“加上白色，还有非常深的颜色。”我在和这一页同样白的纸上打手印，而印泥本身的颜色非常深。
(“The darks horizontal, ”Note the fold marks on the copy of the envelope object on page 327. When the object was folded and then held in a roughly horizontal position in the rectangular double envelope, the dark patterns of the fingers would be horizontal within the envelopes.(“深色的水平线。”注意前面信封物件副本上的指痕。当这个物件被折起来，而这个长方形的信封以一个大概水平的方位被握着的时候。信封里手指的黑色图案是水平线的。
(“the verticals bright.” If this is a reference to the white spaces between the fingers of the print, then these would be horizontal also. We do not know why the vertical designation then.(“垂直线是亮色。”如果这指的是手印里手指之间的白色空隙的话，那么这些也是水平的。我们不知道所谓的垂直线是什么。
(“Also let me add initials, or symbols. "As indicated on the copy on page 327, my initials, right hand designation, and the date were noted by me when I made the print. This was in black pen.(“也让我加上缩写，或者象征。”如上面副本显示的，我的缩写，右手的名称，还有我制作这张打印的日期都标注在上面。这是用黑笔写的。
(When she began speaking Jane used short pauses often. Her eyes remained closed. Much of the time she cradled her cheek on her crossed arms, supported by the table. She was not smoking. Resume at 10:32.)(当珍开始说话的时候，她常常有一些短的停顿。她的眼睛仍闭着。大部分时间她的手抵住桌子撑住脸颊。在10:32分重新开始。)
Now. We shortly end our session.现在。我们很快要结束这一节了。
Ruburt has been intellectually involved in a strong manner with our whole relationship and experience, as he studied the galleys for his book. This is not particularly conducive to his intuitional activities, so I did not give him a break before our tests, but let the trance state continue. This worked to our advantage. This period just passing, of comparative rest on his part, from psychic activities, makes one point at least plain: our results, all in all during this period, have been good.当鲁柏读着他书的校样时，他一直以一种强烈的方式理智地涉入我们整个的关系和经验。这对他的直觉活动并不特别有益，所以在我们的测验之前我没有让他休息，而是让出离状态继续。这对我们比较好。这一段鲁柏没有做心灵活动的休息时间让这一点变得很清楚；最后，我们的测验结果很好。
It was in a similar period in the past that the test data were very poor. The improvement will show itself more clearly as he becomes psychically more active again. My best regards to you both. If you have no questions I will end the session.在过去类似的时期，测试资料会很不好。当他心灵上再次变得更活跃，这个进步会就很清楚的显现了。我对你们俩最衷心地祝福。如果你们没有任何问题，我要结束这一节了。
(“What happened to the witnesses we were supposed to have?"(“我们本来应该要有的参与者呢？”)
(Jane raised her head, eyes still closed, and smiled.)(珍抬起头，眼睛仍闭着，微笑。)
I was being cagey. I merely said their attendance was possible. My time elements were simply off here, unfortunately.我不能泄漏秘密。我只说他们可能会来。遗憾的是，我的时间元素有时并不受限在此刻。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:40. Jane was dissociated as usual. See page 326for the data on the expected witnesses for this evenings session.)(10:40结束。珍出离如常。见前面资料关于今晚课的可能参与者。)

SESSION 238 第238节 私人课：加拉格夫妇 唐·韦伯夫妇


MARCH 4, 1966 11:45 PM UNSCHEDULED FRIDAY EVE1966年3月4日 星期五 晚上11:45 临时课
(An unscheduled session was held this evening. It was witnessed by four people, and interrupted by a fifth. This account is written the following morning after a review of the main points with Jane. No notes were taken at the time of the session.(今晚举行了一节临时课。有4个人参与，后来又因为第5个人加入而中断了一下。这篇文稿是在隔天早上和珍一起检视过主要的重点之后写下的。在这节课中间我没有记笔记。
(It will be remembered that during the unscheduled session on last Sunday, February 27, and during Mondays regular session for February 28, Seth had mentioned the possibility of witnesses for last Wednesday’s session, March 2. Moreover he mentioned the possibility existed for two sets of witnesses, and for four people, perhaps even five. When no witnesses appeared for Wednesday's session Seth said in answer to my question: “I was being cagey. I merely said their attendance was possible. My time elements were simply off here, unfortunately. "Jane had smiled broadly while giving this answer.(记得在上星期日，2月17日的临时课和2月28日星期一的定期课里，赛斯提到了3月2日星期三晚上的课有可能会出现参与者。甚至他提到了可能会有两组参与者，有4个人，或甚至5个人。当星期三的课没有出现参与者的时候，赛斯是这么回答我的问题：“我不能泄漏秘密。我只说他们可能会来。遗憾的是，我的时间元素有时并不受限在此刻。”当给这个答案的时候，珍笑得很灿烂。
(Two sets of witnesses did attend tonight 's unplanned session, the Gallaghers and Marilyn and Don Wilbur. Jane began speaking as Seth at 11:45 PM, continued until about 12:15 AM, took a break during which the Gallaghers left, then resumed briefly, from about 12:30 to 12:45 AM with the Wilburs present. The session might have continued but was interrupted by the visit of a friend who does not know of them. We do not often get visitors after midnight; this friend has visited us perhaps three times in the last year, so we can say his arrival was unexpected.(的确有两组参与者出席了今晚的临时课，加拉格夫妇以及玛丽莲和唐·韦伯夫妇。珍在晚上11:45分以赛斯的身分开始说话，一直持续到凌晨12:15分，当加拉格夫妇离去的时候休息了一下，然后很快的重新开始，从晚上12:30分到12:45分，那时韦伯夫妇在场。课程本来是要继续的，但被一个不认识他们的朋友的拜访给打断了。我们很少在凌晨12点后还有访客前来；这个拜访我们的朋友去年大概来了3次，所以我们可以说他的拜访是意料之外的。
(It can be said that since the Gallaghers and the Wilburs both know of the sessions, and that they visit us regularly, an unscheduled session is hardly unusual with these two sets of witnesses. It can also be said however that we do not easily hold unscheduled sessions, although from the record it might seem they are held rather often. Jane and I usually go out of our way to avoid them because of the extra work involved, etc. Hence the late starting hour for this one.(因为加拉格和韦伯夫妇都知道这些课，而他们会定期来拜访我们，一节临时课有这两组参与者并不算太不寻常。不过可以这么说，我们并不常举行临时课，虽然从记录上看起来可能以为我们常常举行。珍和我通常会想尽办法避免临时课的举行，因为会有额外的工作要做等等。因此这节课这么晚才开始。
(Seth made some interesting points which I will attempt to summarize. Earlier in the evening Bill Gallagher spent perhaps three-quarters of an hour contemplating the oil painting of an elderly man which I executed in July 1965. Seth on various occasions has claimed this painting, along with one other, to be likenesses of him. I did these two without models. This evening Bill commented often that the painting in question had a peculiar alive quality for him. I told him the lighting was flattering, but Bill insisted there was a different quality in the work, and that he did not believe it was due solely to suggestion.(我试图总结赛斯提到的一些有趣的重点。今晚稍早时比尔•加拉格花了大概45分钟，思考我在1965年7月画的一张年长的油画。赛斯提过很多次，这张画和另一张都很像他。我画这两张画的时候没有用模特。今晚比尔一直提到，我们在讨论的这张画对他来说有一种不寻常的鲜活特质。我告诉他是因为光影，但比尔坚持这个作品有一种不同的特质，而他不相信这只是因为光影的原因。
(Since the conversation revolved around matters psychic and no psychic, the stage was set rather effortlessly for Seth’s appearance, although as stated neither Jane nor I actively encouraged the session. Everyone was in an excellent mood however. Soon after she began speaking for Seth, in a quite low and pleased voice, Jane launched into the reasons for Bill’s response to the painting. It marked Bill’s emotional perception, according to Seth, of Seth’s presence in the painting, earlier in the evening. Hence Bill’s feeling of an extra quality of life in the work. This event thus meant that for the first time Bill felt an emotional rapport with Seth, although previously he had been intrigued intellectually by the material.(因为讨论围绕着心灵和非心灵的问题，于是这种情况不费吹灰之力地迎来了赛斯的出现，虽然之前提过，珍和我并没有主动鼓励这节课的发生。不过，每个人的心情都非常好。当珍以一种十分缓慢愉悦的声音为赛斯说话之后，她说起了比尔对这幅画反应的原因。据赛斯所说，因为今晚稍早，比尔情感性地感知到在这幅画里赛斯的存在，因此比尔感觉到这幅画里有一种额外的蓬勃生气。这件事也意味着，比尔第一次感觉到和赛斯有一种情感性的和谐关系，虽然之前他在理智上就对这些资料很感兴趣。
(Seth went on to explain that with the exception of me everyone else in the room, including Jane, still had doubts as to what he was, that I accepted his explanation of his personality, and that this was a help in the sessions. This led to an exchange concerning secondary personalities. Seth said that in the future we would have many exchanges with psychologists and other scientists. Seth told us he knew how “their minds worked, ” and that when they thought they had him pinned down as a secondary, he would have a surprise for them, a demonstration. He did not go into detail here and I did not press for particulars because I was not making notes. I believe such events lay quite well ahead of us however.(赛斯继续解释，在场除了我之外的所有人，包括珍，仍对他是什么有所怀疑，而我接受他对他人格的解释，这在这些课里是一个帮助。这导致了关于第二人格的交流。赛斯说，我们在未来会与心理学家和其他科学家有很多交流。赛斯告诉我们，他知道“他们的心智是如何运作的”。而当他们认为且确定他是第二人格的时候，他会给他们一个惊喜，一个示范表演。他在这里没有提到细节，而我因为没有记笔记，也没有继续追问下去。不过我相信这样的事件终究会发生。
(The surprise, Seth went on, would embarrass scientific personnel, but would also lead to clearer understanding of the Seth phenomenon. None of this information was given in a superior, or smug or sarcastic manner. It was a warm evening and our living room windows were open. Traffic noise even at this hour was audible; when I told Seth he was in danger of being drowned out by the traffic noise, the voice immediately rose in strong volume, humorously, for a few sentences: “I will never be drowned out by traffic... ’’etc.(赛斯继续说下去，这个惊喜会让那些科学人很困窘，但也会引导他们更清楚地了解这个赛斯现象。这个讯息不会以一种优越、自满或讽刺的方式给予。这是一个温暖的夜晚，我们客厅的窗户是打开的。即使在这个时间仍然听得到交通噪音；当我告诉赛斯他有可能会被交通噪音给淹没时，强烈的声音立即升起，幽默地，说了几句话：“我永远不会被交通噪音淹没……”等等。
(Earlier in the evening our conversation had turned on the subject of death and related topics in a rather humorous way, and Seth pointed out that he had listened in on us at this time. He was not disapproving, but neither did he approve.(今晚稍早，我们的讨论以一种相当幽默的方式转到了死亡和相关的议题，赛斯指出，他当时有听我们的说话。他没有不赞同，也没有赞同。
(Peggy Gallagher has been bothered in recent weeks by what she calls bursitis in her left shoulder. In the last few days the discomfort has moved down into her left arm; periodically she said the arm tingles, in a sensation similar to that felt when a limb has gone to sleep. The feeling is not that drastic though. Seth, without being asked, told Peggy that she had a disturbance in the area of the third to fifth vertebrae, and that this, basically, was the cause of her back and arm disturbances. Peggy had thought circulation was at the seat of the trouble. Seth said the circulation was healthy, but interfered with somewhat by tension.(蓓·加拉格最近几周常被她左肩的滑囊炎所困扰。过去几天不舒服的感觉往下移到了左手臂；她说手臂不时的有刺痛感，感觉手好像要失去知觉了。不过这种感觉不算剧烈。虽然蓓没有问，赛斯还是告诉她，在她第三节到第五节的脊椎之间有一种失调，而这基本上是引发她背和手臂失调的原因。蓓一直认为血液循环才是主要的原因。赛斯说血液循环正常，但因为紧张，所以多少有一点被干扰到。
(Seth proceeded to suggest several things Peggy might do; if she followed the suggestions the trouble should disappear. She should give herself suggestions before sleep that she not sleep on her left side, but her right side instead. This would remove the pressure on the afflicted side of the body. Peggy said she didn't think she slept on her left side; Seth said she did after going to sleep, and that suggestion would prevent this. Seth told Peggy not to lean on her left elbow during the day, especially at work. Even as he spoke, we saw Peggy leaning on her left elbow. Peggy said she may have the habit of leaning on her desk at the newspaper office with her left arm or elbow; she will check.(赛斯继续建议几件蓓可以做的事；如果她遵从着这些建议，问题应该会消失。她睡觉前应该给自己暗示说她不会左侧睡，而会右侧睡。这会移除身体不舒服那边的压力。蓓说她不认为她是左侧睡；赛斯说她睡着的时候确实是这样，而暗示会预防这件事的发生。赛斯告诉蓓，平时不要压靠着左手肘，特别是在工作的时候，而当他这么说的时候，我们看到蓓正压靠着她的左手肘。蓓说她在办公室可能有一个习惯，是用左手臂或左手肘压靠着桌子；她会注意。
(Seth told Peggy to stand up and stretch her arms over her head frequently during the day. He told her to use suggestion that her circulation in the afflicted areas be more than adequate until the condition subsided; she should do this frequently during the day. He went into some detail here, explaining that the tension caused a slowing of the blood flow in the shoulder and arm making the blood’s normally easy flow much more difficult. He told Peggy there was nothing wrong with her circulation.(赛斯告诉蓓，一天之中要常常站起来把她的手臂伸举过头。他告诉她去暗示自己痛的地方血液循环会比平常快，直到状况减轻为止；她应该在一天之中常常这么做。他在这里提了一些细节，解释了紧张引发了肩膀和手臂血流的减缓，让血通常很容易流过的地方变得困难。他告诉蓓，她的血液循环没有问题。
(In connection with the above, Seth told Peggy not to take aspirin. The aspirin, he said, aggravates the problems caused by tension in this particular instance. A congestion builds up in the back and arm. Seth then told Peggy to drink two cups of coffee at breakfast. Peggy drinks one as a habit. Seth said the extra caffeine in her case would stimulate circulation, whereas the aspirin would hinder it. He was definite on this.(和上面有关的是，赛斯告诉蓓不要吃阿司匹林。他说在这个例子上，阿司匹林会让这个紧张引发的问题急化，在背和手臂的部分会淤血。然后赛斯告诉蓓早餐时喝两杯咖啡。蓓通常的习惯是喝一杯。赛斯说在她的情况，额外的咖啡因会刺激血液循环，而阿司匹林反而会妨碍它。在这一点上他很明确。
(We now come to a surprising development. Seth proceeded to tell Peggy that she was doing her yogic neck rolls much too fast in the morning. This is an exercise, Peggy told us at break, that she does each morning. Like Jane, she works out with yoga each day, but rushes the exercises in the morning while dressing for work. Jane did not know this, and Peggy said she had never mentioned it. Seth was right here, according to Peggy, for lately she felt she had been hurrying the exercises too much. Seth told Peggy the rapid neck rolls, which are an exercise supposed to be done slowly, were actually being detrimental to her. In addition, Peggy should be careful at the end of this exercise, when she drops her head forward, supposedly in a relaxed manner. Seth said the sudden dropping put a strain on the third to fifth vertebrae. Peggy agreed that she ended the exercise in this manner; and again, she had not thought to mention this to Jane previously.(我们现在有一个惊人的发展。赛斯继续告诉蓓，她在早上做脖子转动的瑜珈动作时动作太快了。在休息的时候，蓓告诉我们，这是一个她每天早上会做的运动。和珍一样，蓓每天早上都做瑜珈，但在早上会急着做完运动，然后穿衣出门上班。珍不知道这件事，蓓说她从未提过。据蓓所说，赛斯这里说的是正确的，最近她的确感觉太急着做完这些运动。赛斯告诉蓓，脖子转动的这个动作应该是要慢慢做，做得太快事实上反而会对她不利。此外，蓓应该在这个运动结束的时候特别注意，当她低头往前的时候，应该是用一种放松的方式。赛斯说突然的低头会拉伤第三至第五节脊椎。蓓同意她是以这个方式结束运动的；再一次，她不认为她以前有和珍提过这个。
(Seth told Peggy the yoga exercises were basically excellent for her if done at the proper tempo, and to keep them up. He said Peggy should surmount the problem setting up the tension in her back, which was leading in turn to the other physical symptoms, for if she did not there was a danger that any habits of rigidity would grow worse in the future. Seth did not go into any emotional causes this evening, and was not asked to. Peggy agreed to try the routine suggested, and will report on results.(赛斯告诉蓓，如果以适当的节奏，瑜珈这个运动基本上对她是很好的，要继续下去。他告诉蓓应该解决这个后背绷紧的问题，这会引发其他身体上的症状，如果她没有这么做，这个僵直的习惯会在未来越来越严重。赛斯在今晚没有提到任何情绪上的原因，而蓓也没有问。蓓同意试试他所建议的方法，然后会后续报告结果。
(Seth took a break at 12:15 AM, during which the Gallaghers left. He resumed at about 12:30, until interrupted at 12:45. The interruption marked the end of the session.(赛斯在凌晨12:15加拉格夫妇离开的时候让我们休息。他在12:30重新开始，直到12:45被中断。这个中断结束了这节课。
(The Wilburs have witnessed a few unscheduled sessions. Their first experience is mentioned in the notes for the 206th session, of November 8,1965. Their next is mentioned in the notes for the 214th session, of December 6,1965. The unscheduled session was held on November 5,1965; see page 57.(韦伯夫妇曾经参与了一些临时课。他们的第一次经验在1965年11月8日第206节的笔记上。下一次是1965年12月6日第214节的笔记上。临时课是在1965年11月5日举行的。
(During that session Seth gave Don Wilbur a little information concerning a job change he was contemplating. I made no notes during the evening, but Don took down the data pertaining to him. It amounted to perhaps a medium-long paragraph, and included a description of a building he would visit, its offices, and a man to whom he would apply for employment. Dons wife 你你carried the notes in her handbag for some weeks. Don never did see about the job he was thinking of, in December, because his present employment kept him too busy during the winter months. He and his wife lost track of the notes, and Jane and I had forgotten them long ago.(在那节课里，赛斯给了唐·韦伯一些有关于他打算换工作的讯息。我那节没有做笔记，但唐有写下关于他的资料。那一段大约有中等长度，包括了描述他会在拜访的那栋建筑物、办公室，还有应征他的人。唐的妻子把这张纸条放在包里几个星期。唐12月并没有去应征他想要的工作，因为在冬天的这几个月，他的工作很忙。他和他的妻子都忘了这张纸条，而珍和我早就忘了这件事。
(Last week, the first week in March 1966, Don Wilbur began making the rounds in Elmira in his quest for a better job. Answering an ad in the local paper, he drove to the location given for a construction firm. He had forgotten consciously about Seth’s data, but as he drove into the firm's property he was immediately struck by the similarity there with Seth’s predictions. He had not been to the location before. The description of the building matched, as well as the description Seth had given of the man Don would talk to about work. Marilyn, Dons wife, believes she still has Seth 's notes at home and will look for them.(上星期，1966年3月的第一周，唐·韦伯开始在埃尔迈拉附近寻找更好的工作。他回应地方报纸上的一个广告，开到上面登的一家建筑公司。他意识上根本忘了赛斯的资料，但当他一开进这家公司的地域，他立刻想起了这里和赛斯预言的地方很相似。他以前从未到过这个地方。赛斯对这栋建筑，还有唐在应征时会遇见的人的描述都很吻合。唐的妻子，玛丽莲相信她还留着赛斯的那张纸条在家里，她会去找找看。
(Don Wilbur's parents are against his changing jobs. The Wilburs did not ask Seth for advice, nor did Jane and I. Seth volunteered that it was better for Don to make his own decisions. He did say that Don would leave his present job because it offered no opportunities for advancement, and that he would try three other positions before he settled into one he really liked. But Seth did not say when. Don himself has not decided what to do. The place he visited that matched Seth's description has made him an offer of employment.(唐·韦伯的父母反对他换工作。韦伯夫妇也没有问赛斯的意见，珍和我也没有。赛斯主动地说，最好是由唐自己做决定。他的确说了唐会离开他现在的工作，因为它已经无法提供他晋升的机会，而在他找到他真正喜欢的工作稳定下来之前，他会试过其他三个工作。但赛斯没有说何时，唐自己也还没有决定要怎么做。那个符合赛斯描述的、他所拜访的地方愿意雇佣他。
(Seth was going into the relationship between predictions and probabilities when the session came to an end because of the mentioned interruption. As stated, two sets of witnesses had been present. A fifth person had also appeared, causing the end of the session after one set of witnesses had left. See page 326.(当课被上面提到的事中断结束时，赛斯正说到预言和可能性之间的关系。之前说过，有两组参与者会出席。在第一组人离开后，第5个人也出现了，因此结束了这节课。
(Jane's eyes had been wide open much of the time, and very dark. Her voice for the most part had been very quiet, her pace average. Her delivery at times had been humorous.)(珍的眼睛大部分时间都睁得很大，而且非常深邃。她的声音大部分时间都很轻柔，速度适中。她的口述有时候很幽默。)
(Front and back tracing of the insurance slip used as the envelope object in the 38th experiment, in the 239th session for March 7,1966.)(第38次信封实验在这节课举行。密封在信封里的物件，是珍在1966年2月10日寄给她出版商两份手稿的保险单据。这些是诗集还有她的书，赛斯资料的第一部分。这些资料和其他部分在第234节讨论过了。

SESSION 239 第239节 约翰私人课 信封38


MARCH 7, 1966 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1966年3月7日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(The 38th envelope experiment was held during the session. The object, sealed in the usual double envelope, was the insurance slip for the two manuscripts Jane mailed to her publisher on February 10,1966. These were the poetry book and the first section of her book on the Seth material. This material is discussed in the 234th session, among others.用在1966年3月7日第239节第38次实验的信封物件，保险单据正面和背面的素描
(Jane was not feeling at her best, and did not do as well as she wanted to on the experiment. I had suggested earlier in the day that she skip the session but she declined. She also wanted to have the envelope experiment. John Bradley, our salesman friend from Williamsport, PA, was a witness, and I believe this contributed to the envelope results, in some way I cannot define. Previously Jane has done well with envelopes before witnesses.(珍感觉她今天的状态不算最好，所以她在实验上的表现没有她希望的那么好。我之前建议她跳过今天的课，但她拒绝了。她也想要做信封实验。我们的朋友，约翰•布莱德利，来自宾州威廉斯波特的销售业务是参与者，以某种我无法解释的方式，我相信这帮助了实验结果。之前在参与者面前，珍做的信封实验结果都很好。
(John's entity name is Philip. He has witnessed a number of sessions, the last being the 226th. Johns presence usually calls forth some telepathic and/or clairvoyant material from Seth, and so it developed this evening. The form of the material is a little different however this time, and involves John and his wife for the most part.(约翰存有名是菲利普。他之前参与了几节课，最后一次是第226节。约翰的在场常常会从赛斯那里唤起一些心电感应和预知的资料，而今晚的发展也是这样。不过这一次资料的形式有点不同，大部分都和约翰以及他的妻子有关。
(The session was held in our font room. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. She was smoking, and opened her eyes but the one time to put out her cigarette. Her pace was average, her voice a little more active than usual.)(这节课在我们前面的房间举行，珍坐着开始说话，闭着眼睛，她在抽烟，只有一次在熄灭香烟时睁开了眼睛，她的速度适中，声音比平常更活跃。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
([John:] “Good evening, Seth.”)([约翰：]“晚安，赛斯”)
Welcome to our friend Philip. We shall have some remarks later that will pertain to him.欢迎我们的朋友菲利普。我们等一会儿有一些关于他的评论。
There are some additions, Joseph, that I would like to make concerning our inverted time system. An understanding of this system will serve to explain to the psychologists certain things that are not now plain to them.约瑟，关于我们的倒置时间系统，这里我们有一些要补充的。了解这个系统会有助于向这些心理学家解释某些他们还不清楚的东西。
For one thing, association is not clearly understood by any means. It cannot be clearly understood simply because at present psychologists believe that association works only in connection with past events.有一点，联想无法以任何方式被清楚地了解。它无法被清楚了解的原因是，现在心理学家相信联想只会发生在和过去有关的事情上。
They also underestimate dream events, for many associations in your present are the result of events which have occurred in the dream state. The mind is hardly shut off when you dream. It continues to use its associative processes. Therefore any given personal association may originate from a dream event as well as from a past waking event.他们也低估了梦的事件，你们现在有很多的联想是源自于发生在梦境里的事件。当你做梦时心智也不是关闭的，它持续运用它联想的过程。因此任何特定的个人联想可能源自于一个梦的事件，就像它可能源自于一个过去醒时的事件一样。
Psychologists, generally speaking, have not accepted the latest theories of your own physicists, however. They continue to consider time as a series of moments, one following the other.一般说来，心理学家并不接受你们自己物理学家最新的理论。他们持续地把时间考虑成一连串的片刻，一个接着一个。
The inverted time system recognizes the actual nature of time, however. There is room in this system for a rather complete explanation of the mind’s associative processes.不过，这个倒置时间系统认出了时间真正的本质。在这个系统里面有充裕对心智的联想过程作比较完整的解释。
Now. The mind as opposed to the brain, perceives time in terms of the spacious present. It is true that the mind works on associative principles. Therefore these associations are drawn not only from the past, but also from the future.现在。对比于大脑，心智以一种广阔的现在来感知时间。这是真的，心智是以联想原则来运行。因此这些不只是从过去，也会从未来而来。
Take an example here. Frederick Y. becomes ill whenever he smells a certain perfume. He does not know the reason. A psychologist would explain this reaction by presuming some kind of unpleasant event occurred in the past. An event that was connected with his sensual perception of this particular perfume.这里举一个例子。每当佛德瑞克闻到一种特定的香水时，他就觉得恶心。他不知道原因，一个心理学家要解释这个可能假设，过去曾发生过某种不开心的事件。一个和他对这个特定香水的感官知觉有关联的事件。
The explanation is a good possible one. However, it is the only one that your psychologists would consider, and at least two other possible explanations exist. Frederick may be reacting to an unpleasant event experienced within the dream state, where in the dream the upsetting situation was accompanied by the odor of a particular perfume.这个解释是很好的可能性。不过，它也是唯一一个你们的心理学家能想到的解释，而至少还有两种其他的解释存在。佛德瑞克可能是反应一件在梦境中经验过的不愉快事件，在梦里这个令人不快的情况，可能是伴随着这个特定香水的气味。
Frederick however could also be reacting to the same sort of event that has not yet occurred, however, to his perception—that is, to an event in the future. For the mind does not divide time into a series of moments. This is done by the physical brain and the physical senses.不过，佛德瑞克也可能是反应某类还未发生的事件，他的感知——是对着未来的一个。因为心智并不会把时间划分为一连串的片刻，只有肉体的头脑和肉体的感官才会这么做。
The ego is not as a rule aware of this broader time experience. The subconscious however is so aware, and the associative processes of the mind can, and do, react to a future event, while the ego is closed off to it. Therefore it is possible for Frederick, this year, to become ill at the smell of a particular perfume because subconsciously he knows that in 1980 his mother will be wearing that perfume when she dies.自我通常无法感知这个较广阔的时间经验。不过潜意识是如此的明白，而当自我是关闭的时候，心智的联想过程能够，而且会对一件未来的事件起反应。因此佛德瑞克有可能今年对某种特定的香水感到恶心，是因为潜意识里他知道，在1980年他母亲死的时候是擦这种香水的。
The associative processes work both backwards and forwards. An understanding of this will help in a study of the associative processes in general.这个联想的过程可以向前和向后运行。对这点的了解通常会帮助联想过程的研究。
You may take a brief break and I shall continue.你可以短暂休息一下，然后我会继续。
(Break at 9:20. Jane was dissociated as usual, she said, for a first delivery. Her delivery had become rather active and fast.(9:20休息。珍说她第一段出离如常。她的口述变得相当生动和快速。
(A long break now ensued. It was brought about because John began talking about his family relationships; the subject came up when we discussed some of the sessions John has witnessed, and the data Seth has given in them pertaining to John, his family, his job, etc. Some of the predictions are long-range. See 166th, 190th, 204th, 226th, for example; in Volumes 4 and 5.(现在接着是一个长的休息。因为约翰开始谈他的家庭关系；当约翰在场的那几节，这个话题曾出现过，而赛斯有给约翰关于他、他的家庭，和他的工作等等的资料。有一些预测是长期的。例如见第166、190、204和206节；在第四册和第五册。
(John said it was all right for the personal material to be included in this record, and it is a good example of the way Seth handles such data. Jane and I, incidentally, have never met Johns wife. Most of the family material is self-explanatory. During break John gave us some information; briefly, it has to do with his restlessness in his job, his wife’s reactions, his wife’s parents, his own strong need to assert his independence, etc. John is also active politically in Pennsylvania, as a conservative. He is an excellent medical representative for Searle Drug, but feels he is not being extended enough in his work; he wants more challenge. Seth has advised patience here; John said this is difficult for him but that he is carefully considering the advice. Searle itself is going through a difficult time managerially and financially.(约翰说，他的个人资料写进这个记录里没关系，这是赛斯处理这类资料的一个好例子。顺便一提，珍和我从未见过约翰的妻子。大部分家庭资料是一看就了解的。在休息的时候，约翰给我们一些讯息；简而言之，这和他不眠不休的工作有关、他妻子的反应、他妻子的父母、他自己的强烈需要去确立他的独立，等等。约翰也以一个保守党员的身分在宾州的政治场上很活跃，他是塞尔药厂绝佳的药品销售代表，但他感觉他在工作上扩展得不够；他想要更多的挑战。赛斯这里建议他要有耐心；约翰说这对他而言很困难，但他会考虑这个建议。塞尔药厂本身正在经历一个管理和财务上的困难时期。
(Jane finally resumed, her eyes closed even though she was smoking, at 9:48.)(珍最后在9:48分重新开始，即使她在抽烟，眼睛也是闭着的。)
Now. I did not resume the session for rather obvious reasons.现在。我没有继续这节有相当明显的原因。
We will however shortly begin our Instream material, and then we will be involved with our own envelope, if you have one for me, Joseph.不过，我们很快会开始殷斯翠姆博士资料，然后是我们自己的信封实验，约瑟，如果你有信封要给我的话。
However I will discuss this later in the session, and make a few comments now. Give us a moment however.我在这节课晚一点的时候会讨论这个，和做一些评论。请等我们一下。
(Jane now paused. As when giving experimental material, she sat with her head down, a hand raised to her closed eyes.)(珍现在停顿。当在给实验资料的时候，她低着头坐着，一只手举起来放在她闭起来的眼睛上。)
Ruburt is not particularly pleased with what he knows I am about to say, but I am not held by the same social rules that hold him in this particular matter, and I know Philip perhaps better than he does.鲁柏知道他对我将要说的话可能并不高兴，但在这件事上，我不像他会因为同样的社交礼貌而保留不说，而且我也许比他还了解菲利普。
This discussion will be begun now but ended later this evening.这个讨论会从现在开始，而在今晚稍晚时结束。
Now. We have fear and rage on the part of the girl, for despite the children she is yet a girl, and a very nice one. However the relationship between her own parents has been destructive. The father has wanted domination, and to some extent has forced his wife into a position of dominance which she strongly resents. Because of this she lashes out at her husband. I am speaking now, you understand, of the parents of Philips wife.现在。在这个女孩的部分有着害怕和愤怒，尽管有了孩子，但她还是个小女孩，而且她是一个很好的孩子。不过她父母之间的关系是很具破坏性的。这个父亲想要掌控，而某种程度上他强迫他的妻子进入这个她强烈痛恨的掌控位置。因为如此，她猛烈地抨击她的先生。你知道，我现在说的是菲利普妻子的父母。
(John and his mother-in-law do not get along.)(约翰和他的岳母处得并不好。)
Now, the girl respects Philip because he will not be dominated. On the other hand the woman image that she understands, because of her mother, is a dominating woman image. To her she fails as a female if she cannot hold him in line. At the same time her personality is far different than her mothers, and less focused.现在，这个女孩尊敬菲利普，因为他不被掌控。另一方面，因为她的母亲，她了解的女性形象是一个掌控的女性形象。对她而言，如果她不能控制他，那么作为女性，她是失败的。同时她的人格又和她的母亲非常不同，是较不聚集的。
Also she loves Philip, and would not consciously want to dominate him if she could. He senses this subconscious need of hers however to hold him, and resents it vigorously. She attempts to dominate him in her own way, and on a subconscious basis, and it is indeed by appealing to him through helplessness. At the same time she does not want him to give in to her.还有她爱菲利普，如果她可以，她在意识上并不想掌控他。不过他感受到她潜意识里想控制他的需要，而强烈的怨恨着。她企图用她自己的方式来掌控他，在一个潜意识的基础，她的确透过一种无助感来吸引他，而同时她也不希望他对她让步。
She tries to dominate in more feminine ways. Her mothers domination had more masculine aspects. We will have more to say concerning this, and I hope some helpful comments after our other material.她试图以更女性的方式来掌控。她母亲的掌控有更多男性的部分。关于这一点，我们还有更多可以说的，我希望在我们给其他的资料后能有一些有助益的讨论。
Now, please give us a moment for the Instream data.现在，给我们一点时间开始殷斯翠姆博士的资料。
(Jane paused at 10:01. She sat with her head down, her hands raised to her closed eyes. She began speaking with many short pauses, but overall her pace could not be called slow. This is the 45th Instream experiment.)(珍10:01停顿。她低着头坐着，手举到她闭着的眼睛上。她开始说话时有很多短暂的停顿，但整体来说她的速度不算慢。这是第45次殷斯翠姆博士实验。)
A dark corner of a room, with wooden paneling. It is a right corner. He stands facing it. In front of him there is a large and very bulky chair.房间里的一个阴暗角落，有木制的镶板。是在右边的角落。他站着面对着它。在他面前有一张很大、很笨重的椅子。
It is covered with leather or plastic, rather than cloth. A table with a lamp sits beside it. The initials R H connected here. Perhaps the initials of the man who lives here.它是皮制，或者是塑胶包裹着的，不是布料。一张桌子边上有一盏灯。这里和缩写RH有连结。也许有这个缩写的男人住在这里。
Two other people in the room, I believe a woman and a man, and another man has been present but is now out of the room. There is also another wall adjacent to this one, with a long window now covered by a closed cloth drapery. The drapery is short, that is, it does not reach all the way to the floor.有其他两个人在房间里，我想是一个男人和一个女人，还有另一个男人本来也在，现在走出了房间。邻近这一个还有另一个墙面，有一个长窗户现在被一个布的厚帘子盖着。这个帘子比较短，它的长度没有到达地面。
A desk beneath this window, of dark wood. The floor covered with a light-colored, textured rug. In the light it looks green. Two doorways to the room. There is an office close by in the same dwelling place, that also belongs to the owner, the man who Dr. Instream visits.这个窗户下有一个深木色的桌子。地板上覆盖着一个浅色、质地粗糙的毯子，在光线下看起来像绿色。这个房间有两个入口。在同样的地点旁边有另一间办公室，也属于这个屋主，那是殷斯翠姆博士拜访的人。
This room, the office, has a large light-colored wooden desk, set out from a window—that is, not in the center of the floor—the chair between the window and the desk.这个房间，这间办公室，有一个大的、浅色的木桌靠近窗户——那是，不在房间中间——椅子在窗户和桌子中间。
This window also covered by a short closed drapery. A photograph on the desk, taken in 1936, of a woman. An earlier party this evening for Dr. Instream. This dwelling I believe is on another level but the first level of a building. The street faces north and south, runs north and south. The numbers 312 connected here.这个窗户也装了一个短的厚帘子。桌上有一张照片，是在1936年照的，是一个女人。殷斯翠姆博士在今晚稍早有一个派对。我想这个地方是在另一层，这栋楼的一楼。这条街面朝南北，是南北向。数字312和这里有关。
Now. Do you have an envelope for me?现在。你有信封要给我吗？
("Yes.”(“是的。”
(As usual Jane took the double envelope from me without opening her eyes. On impulse I almost told Seth there was to be no envelope, but decided to go ahead in the presence of a witness. Jane appeared to feel all right, also. She held the envelope against her forehead.)(和往常一样，珍闭着眼睛，从我手里接过信封。有一个冲动，我几乎想告诉赛斯本来是没有信封的，但有一个参与者在场，所以我决定继续下去。珍看起来也还好。她握着信封抵着前额。)
Please, give us a moment. These are impressions.请等我们一下。这些是印象。
The numbers 4, 6. An unknown element. A connection with a man and a woman. A paper item.数字4、6。一个不知名的元素。和一个男人以及一个女人有关联。一个纸制的物品。
Black and white, a border, I believe of white. A light strip on this item. Perhaps wider at one end, and in the lower portion.黑色和白色，一个边，我想是白色的。这个物品上有一个浅色的带子。也许尾端比较宽，在比较下面的部位。
Again the impression of lights. A 4 and 9. A connection with a shovel, or something dug up. Something that you wish to know.再一次，光的印象。一个4和9。和一个铲子，或某种挖掘的东西有关联。某个你希望知道的东西。
The paper item having to do with a gathering. Now. Ruburts connection here with your acquaintances, the Smiths. Handwriting, or writing, lettering, on it.这个纸制的东西和一个聚会有关联。现在。鲁柏在这里和你们的熟人，史密斯有关。手写的，或印的，有字母在上面。
I pick up also some connection with flag shapes and colors, and with a connection with Wisconsin.我也收到和旗子的形状，还有颜色有一些关联，和威斯康辛州有连结。
Do you have any questions, Joseph?你有任何的问题吗，约瑟？
(Jane paused at 10:17, without opening her eyes. She now held the envelope in her lap. This was the second time Seth had given me the chance to ask a question after an experiment. I could not be sure, without checking with Seth in detail, but I thought Jane had been wandering about on the above data. Because we had a witness I didn’t t think we would spend too much time checking details. Earlier in the day I had wondered what would happen if I asked Seth/Jane to go over all of the data again; I supposed Jane would take this as a sign that the first data wasn’t much good, and at break Jane said this was her thought at the time.(珍在10:17分停顿，没有睁开眼睛。她现在握着在她大腿上的信封。这是第二次赛斯给我机会在实验之后问问题。我没有和赛斯确认细节，所以不能确定，但我认为珍漫游在上面的资料里。因为我们有一个参与者，我不认为我们应该要花太多时间审核细节。今天稍早我很好奇，如果我要求赛斯-珍再次的浏览过所有的资料会怎么样；我假设珍会认为，这代表第一次的资料不够好，而在休息的时候，珍说，这的确是她当时的想法。
(“Do you want to try again?")(“你想要再试一次吗？”)
We can. 4. A square. 3, diagonal, 2, 1. A connection with a rush, or hurry. An engagement. A framework and a variety of incidents leading up to an important development.我们可以这么做。4。一个正方形。3，斜线，2，1。和赶、或快有关联一个约定。一个架构和事件的变化导致一个重要的发展。
Purple, the color. A connection with a ring, and with a time schedule. Four separate blocks, or divisions of color. Connection with a missionary and a turnstile.紫色，是颜色。和一个戒指，还有一个时间表有关联。4个不同的框，以颜色来区分。和一个传教士，还有一个旋转栅门有关联。
More numbers, and I suggest your break.更多数字，而我建议你们休息。
(Break at 10:25. Jane said that toward the end of the delivery she was more dissociated as usual. When I asked her to try again she took it as a sign that the first attempt with the envelope wasn’t good.(10:25休息。珍说口述接近尾声的时候，她比平常更深的进入出离状态。当我要求她再试一次的时候，她认为这表示第一次信封实验的结果并不好。
(See the tracing of the object on page 339. The object is the insurance slip for the manuscripts of Janes poetry book, and the first section of the Seth material, mailed to her publisher on February 10,1966. This material is discussed to some extent in the 234th session, among others.(见上面物件的素描。这是珍在1966年2月10日寄给出版商的诗集以及赛斯资料第一部分手稿的保险单据。这个资料连同其他的已经在第234节某程度的讨论过了。
(Seth offered to go over the test material but we went on with more material for John Bradley, the witness. Jane and I made a few connections, which will be noted. In the first group of impressions Jane said the data “A light strip on this item. Perhaps wider at one end, and in the lower portion, "pertained to a mental image she had at the time. She saw a wedge-shaped light strip, horizontally, but could tell no more than this.(赛斯答应会解释这个测验，但我们继续了更多有关于参与者约翰·布莱德利的资料。珍和我做了一些连结，会写在后面。在第一组的印象里，珍说了“这个物品上有一个浅色的带子。也许尾端比较宽。在下面的部位。”这个资料和她当时的一个心象有关。她看到一个楔形的浅色带子，水平的，但说不出更多了。
(Since most envelope objects are paper items, we usually discount such data. The numbers 4, 6 and 9 however do appear on the object, as mentioned in the first data.(因为大部分信封物件都是纸制的物品，我们会忽视这样的资料。不过数字4、6和9真的出现在物件上，像第一段资料上提到的。
(My question proved to have some value, for in some manner it spurred Seth, or Jane, to a better effort. Listed below are the connections we could make without asking Seth.(我的问题后来证明是有一点价值的，因为以某种方式，它刺激了赛斯或珍，让他们更努力。以下列出的是没有问赛斯的情况下，我们所做的连结。
(“4.” The number 4 appears on the receipt. There could be other connections.(“4。”数字4出现在单据上。可能有其他的连结。
(“A square. "Jane said this probably referred to the tape recording that was mailed along with the manuscripts. The tape was one Jane made reading some of the poems for her publisher. It was wrapped in a thin box that was square in area.(“一个正方形。”珍说，这指的可能是与手稿一起寄出的录音带。录音带录的是珍朗诵给出版商听的几首诗。它是用一个四方形的薄盒子包起来的。
(“A connection with a rush, or hurry. An engagement. A framework and a variety of incidents leading up to an important development. "Jane felt emotionally good about this data, she said. It involved her efforts in getting the tape made, and the two manuscripts in question, ready for the mail. All of it was done in quite a hurry, at the request of her publisher. Jane called her publisher on February 8, as noted in the envelope material in the 234th session, then hurried to get the scripts and tape ready for the mail on February 10. A variety of incidents were involved while Jane made the tape recording of the poems, etc.(“和赶，或快有关联。一个约定。一个架构和事件的变化导致一个重要的发展。”珍说，她在情感上觉得这个资料很好。这有关于她很努力的录好了录音带，还有准备好前面提到的两份手稿寄出去。所有这些都是在出版商的要求下很快完成的。就像在第234节信封资料时提过的，珍在2月8日打给她的出版商，然后赶着把手稿和录音带准备好，在2月10日寄过去。当珍在制作这些录音带时有不同的事件发生等等。
(The important development for Jane was making the tape, and sending in the script on the Seth material. We are not sure of the reference to a framework however.(重要的发展是指珍制作了录音带，寄出赛斯资料的手稿。不过我们不确定架构指的是什么。
(“Purple, the color. A connection with a ring, and with a time schedule.” As stated, the hand stamp applied to the insurance receipt is in purple or violet, and is in the shape of a ring. The time element is also apparent in the above material.(“紫色，是颜色。和一个戒指，还有一个时间表有关联。”之前提过，保险单据上的戳章是紫色或蓝紫色的，而且是一个戒指的形状。在上面的资料里时间元素也很明显。
(“More numbers.” There are several sets of numbers on the front of the receipt, and a string of them along the bottom on the back.(“更多数字。”单据的正面有几组数字，而背面底部也有一连串的数字。
(Thus there are four pieces of data we made no connections for: 3, diagonal, 2, 1; A framework; Four separate blocks, or divisions of color; Connection with a missionary and a turnstile.(不过有四段资料，我们找不到连结：3，斜线，2、1。一个架构；4个不同的框，以颜色来区分；和一个传教士，还有一个旋转栅门关联。
(John Bradley said that as far as he knew Seth was correct in his analysis of his wife's parents, and correct concerning the relationship between John and his wife.(约翰·布莱德利说，据他所知，赛斯对他岳父母，还有他和妻子之间关系的分析是正确的。
(Break had again been fairly long. Jane resumed at a comfortable pace; her eyes were closed and she was smoking. After she had been speaking for a while her eyes, very dark, began to open occasionally. Resume at 10:45.)(休息再次变得相当长。珍以一个舒适的速度重新开始；她的眼睛闭着，而且在抽烟。在她说了一阵子话之后，她的眼睛很深邃，开始偶尔睁开。10:45重新开始。)
Now. The test results were fairly poor.现在。测验结果相当不好。
We have gone into the reasons for such results in the past. I would prefer to make some remarks to Philip now, rather than discuss the tests in the time available. I will discuss them if you wish.我们过去有讨论过这类结果的原因。我现在比较想对菲利普做一些评论，而不是讨论这个测验。如果你们想要，我会讨论它们。
(“No, that’s all right."(“不用，没关系。”
(Once again Jane bowed her head and raised her hand to her closed eyes.)(再一次，珍低着头，把手举到闭着的眼睛上。)
Give us a moment.等我们一下。
With the girl’s background it is natural enough that an independent male would both frighten and fascinate her. It was this way from the beginning of their relationship.因为这个女孩的背景，很自然的，一个独立的男性会同时让她感到害怕并且着迷，也是这样而开始了他们的关系。
(Jane pointed at John, her eyes still closed.)(珍指着约翰，她的眼睛仍闭着。)
What he does not understand is the rage that she is containing. There is considerable strength to it, and he should recognize this. She does not want to dominate him through feminine wiles, and yet subconsciously she feels driven to do so.他不了解的是，她里面暗含的愤怒。这里有不少力量，他应该可以辨认出来。她并不想透过女性的花招来掌控他，但潜意识里，她感觉被驱策着这么做。
She feels threatened by serious conversation, Philip, for she fears the unknown. She feels like a child when a parent says “Now, we must discuss this seriously.” Such a discussion threatens the status quo.菲利普，严肃的沟通会让她感觉被威胁，因为她害怕未知。当父母说“现在，我们应该严肃地来讨论一下。”她会感觉像一个孩子。这样的一个讨论威胁了现状。
The trivial conversations which you were all discussing would be helpful here, as reassurance. Your own ideas concerning various issues could be profitably inserted when you are not emotionally upset over them.你们谈论时那种琐碎的对话在这里会有帮助，像是一种保险。当你不那么情绪烦躁时，关于种种事件你自己的想法才可以有益的植入她。
Your anger is interpreted simply as violence, and she fears it. Ideas expressed at such occasions will be strenuously fought by her. You must make an emotional bridge, for she will not understand an intellectual one. But the emotional bridge must not be of a violent nature.你的怒气单纯的被解释为暴力，而她害怕它。在这样的时刻表达的想法会被她顽强地反抗。你必须建立起一座情绪的桥梁，因为她不理解一个理智化的表达。但情绪的桥梁必须不是一种暴力的本质。
This is all you have achieved so far in that regard.这部分是你目前所能做的。
She fears, for one thing, that you could run the house more efficiently than she can, and basically that you do not need her. She is not certain of her own merit, and achieves her self-approval through your auspices.她害怕一件事，就是你能比她更有效的管理这个家，而基本上你不需要她。她不确定她自己的价值，而她透过你的支持来达到她的自我认可。
She is not a partner and you are indeed in difficulties. She can become a partner however, but anger will only minimize her importance in her own eyes, and therefore in yours.她目前不是一个伴侣，而你们的确遇到了困难。不过她可以变成一个伴侣，但愤怒只会贬低她在她自己眼中，还有在你眼中的重要性。
One of the children is suffering to some extent psychologically because of the dilemma, and you are too much the autocrat with this child, a female.因为这个困境，其中一个孩子已经在心理上某种程度的受苦了，你们对这个孩子太专制了，是一个女孩。
This is merely a question of relationships, where any thought of blame is meaningless. The situation can be salvaged.这只是一个关系的问题，任何责怪的想法都是无意识的。这个情况是可以被拯救的。
Now, give us a moment again.现在，再等我们一下。
(Jane now took a pause lasting over a minute. Her eyes had been opening occasionally but they were now closed. Her hands were once again raised to her face.)(珍现在停顿了超过一分钟。她的眼睛有时候会睁开，但它们现在是闭着的。她的手再次的举到脸上。)
Her father has been more destructive to her psychological health in some respects than her mother, for he gave her the image of males as weak.在某些方面，她爸爸对她心理健康上的破坏比她妈妈要多，因为他给了她男性是软弱的这个印象。
The strong male is therefore a threat, while he also represents security. There seems to be some situation arising particularly on Wednesdays, that is important emotionally to her. I am not certain as to what this refers.因此，坚强的男性是一个威胁，但他也代表了安全感。星期三那天似乎有某种特别的，对她情绪很重要的情况发生。我不确定这是指什么。
She does not realize basically, subconsciously, her importance to you. If you can make her see this you will be able to maintain that sense of independence that is important to you. If you cannot she will be driven to snatch it away.基本上，潜意识里她并不了解她对你的重要性。如果你能让她看到这点，你就可以保持那对你来说很重要的独立感。如果你不能那么做，她就会驱使自己把你的独立感夺走。
If you cannot communicate important ideas, then you must communicate trivial ones. The big conversation, in which you attempt to communicate your ideas, only frightens her. The idea should be communicated when you are not emotionally upset, and you should not adopt the tone of a parent speaking to a child.如果你们不能沟通重要的想法，那你们必须沟通琐碎的事情。那种你试图沟通你想法的，重大的讨论，只会让她害怕。这种想法应该在你不那么情绪愤怒的时候表达，而且你不应该用一种父母对小孩说话的口气。
I suggest a brief break. We cannot have Joseph’s hands falling off at every session.我建议一个短暂的休息。我们不应该让约瑟的手每一节都那么累。
(Break at 11:13. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her pace had been good; my hand was feeling some fatigue. Her eyes had remained closed except when she put out her cigarette and took a sip of wine.(11:13休息。珍出离如常。她的速度很好；我的手觉得有点累。她的眼睛仍闭着，除了她把烟熄灭和喝一口酒的时候。
(John said he agreed with Seth’s material. He verified that a situation does arise on Wednesdays in his home. Every other week a cleaning woman works at his home on Wednesdays, helping his wife with heavier chores. John's wife is named Mary-Ellen, the cleaning woman is Lots. Lois, John said, is around 40years old, and she has her own personal problems. Mary-Ellen is not the type to talk with others about personal affairs, John said, but he has had the thought that she may get satisfaction listening to others talk about their troubles. Lois is a talker.(约翰说他认同赛斯的资料。他确认过，星期三在他家的确发生了一件事。每两周的星期三，会有一个清洁女人到他家工作，帮他妻子做一些粗重的家事。约翰的太太叫玛莉·艾伦，这名清洁女人叫路易丝。约翰说路易丝大概40岁左右，而她有她个人的问题。约翰说，玛莉·艾伦不是那种会跟别人说自己私事的人，但他认为她可能是透过其他人讲他们的困难来得到满足。路易丝是一个爱说话的人。
(Again the break was rather long. Jane resumed while smoking, in a faster manner, and her eyes began to open more often, at 11:34.)(再次的，这个休息相当长。珍在11:34分重新开始时正抽着烟，以一种较快的方式说话，她的眼睛开始常常睁开。)
Now. I am rather an old man to be speaking in such terms.现在。就这方面来说，我够老资格去说这些话。
However, in the main you are doing two things wrong. You are treating her primarily as a woman rather than an individual person; but you are not treating her as a desirable woman rather than an individual person.不过，基本上你做错了两件事。你主要以一个女人而不是以一个个人来对待她；但以一个女人来说，你也不是以一种她是一个值得被喜欢的女人来对待她。
If you treat her as a desirable woman, you will find a difference in your home atmosphere. If you cannot do this, then you must treat her primarily as an individual person. But if you treat her as a woman primarily, it must be as a desirable woman, or she will find no content as a woman or as an individual.如果你以一种她是一个值得被喜欢的女人的方式来对待她，你会发现你们家的氛围会不同。如果你不能这么做，那么你必须主要以一种对待一个个人的方式来对待她。如果你主要以一个女人来对待她，那必须以她是一个值得被喜欢的女人的方式来对待她，否则她会发现她既不是一个女人也不是一个个人。
And if you treat her as a desirable woman, she will become one. You are treating her as a wife and mother, primarily. With this particular individual this is not adequate. She wants to be regarded as a desirable woman who happens to be your wife and a mother.而如果你能以她是一个值得被喜欢的女人的方式来对待她，她就会变成这样的一个人。你主要是以一种妻子和母亲的身分来对待她。对她这个人而言，这是不够的。她希望被当作一个值得被喜欢的女人，而这个妇人正好是你的妻子和一个母亲。
She will be much more content and pliable to reason if you can manage, regardless of your intellectual tendencies, to approach her in that light. She needs drama, within the framework of the home, and she wants this from you. It will take some effort on your part, but if she feels that you spend time with her simply because you want to be with her, this will go a long way in solving your difficulties.不管你理智的倾向，如果你能以这种方式靠近她，她会更愿意、更顺柔地听你说道理。在家的这个架构，她需要戏剧性，而她希望这是来自于你。你需要花一些努力，如果她感觉你花时间跟她在一起只因为你想要和她在一起，这会对解决你的困境大有裨益。
And if you cannot do this honestly, then your difficulties are more serious than you realize. The effort will be more than worth your while, but the effort must be an honest one, or she will sense the hypocrisy.而如果你无法诚实的这么做，那么你的困难会比你所认为的要严重许多。那是值得你花这些努力的，但努力必须是真诚的，如果是虚伪的，她会感觉得到。
Do you have any questions, Philip?你还有任何问题吗, 菲利普？
([John:] “No, not specifically.”)([约翰：]“没有，没有特别的了。”)
I realize that you feel as if you are in a vicious circle. In many cases however you do not ask, but have a tendency to command her. Not in words so much as in attitude. She does not feel truly desirable. You can do much to change this.我明白你感觉在一个恶性循环里。不过在许多的例子，你没有要求，但你有一种命令她的倾向。不光是言语，还有你的态度。她并不觉得自己真的被喜欢。在改变这一点上你有很多可以做的。
If your relationship is as important to you as I believe it is, then you will make the effort. The simple fact is that you do need her, and you have not communicated this. Obviously there are reasons for her behavior, and changes also that she can and should make, but I am speaking to you and not to her.如果你们的关系像我所认为的对你有那么重要，那么你就应该努力。事实很简单，你需要她，而你没有表达这一点。很明显的，她的行为也有原因，而她应该，也需要做改变，但我现在是在对你说而不是对她说。
There seems to be someone, three houses away, a woman with whom your wife could make friendly and profitable contact. Either the woman is younger, or seems so.似乎有一个人，住在离你们三栋房子远的地方，一个你的妻子可以和她做朋友的女人，和她接触会有助益。这个女人可能比较年轻，或看起来比较年轻。
The adjustments necessary are not all on your part, but your adjustments can initiate hers. You are concerned, and have made efforts, but you are better equipped, simply because of your personality structure, to make these efforts. She is at this point like a child in the woods, but the potentialities are there for an excellent relationship. We will take a break or end the session, as you prefer.这个调整并不必然全部在你身上，但你的调整可以开始带动她。你很关心，也做了努力，因为你性格结构的关系，你是比较准备充足的。她现在就像一个孩子迷失在树林里，但一个更美好关系的潜力是存在的。我们休息结束，随你们喜欢。
(“Well take a short break then.”(“那我们短暂休息一下。”
(11:59. I thought John wanted more information, but we were tired by now, and this proved to be the end of the session. Jane had been dissociated as usual. Her rapid pace had been broken by some rather long pauses, and her eyes had remained closed.(11:59休息。我以为约翰会想要更多的讯息，但我们累了，而这证明已经是课的结尾了。珍出离如常。她的快速度被一些相当长的停顿给打断了，而她的眼睛仍闭着。
(John again agreed with Seth. He also verified Seth again, in that he remembers a younger girl living three houses away. This girl is perhaps five years younger than John and his wife; they know her only to say hello to. John said a younger woman lives but two houses away, also. Jane knew nothing of these two women, just as she knew nothing of the Wednesday incidents.)(约翰再次同意赛斯所说的。他也会再和赛斯确认，他记得有一个年轻女孩住在离他三栋房子远的地方。这女孩也许比约翰和他的妻子年轻5岁；他们对她认识的程度就只有打招呼而已。约翰也有一个年轻女人住在离他家两栋房子远的地方。珍完全不知道这两个女人，就像她不知道星期三发生了什么事情一样。)
